## Initiative: System Foundation & Policy Integration

### Epic: Claim Common Business Processes & Workflows

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to initiate and manage claim intake events, so that claims are properly registered and routed through the standardized workflow.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: initiate and manage the complete claims lifecycle from intake through payment issuance using standardized workflows and automated business rules
- **Value**: claims are properly registered, adjudicated, and paid according to policy terms while maintaining audit trails and handling exceptions systematically

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **initiate and manage the complete claims lifecycle from intake through payment issuance using standardized workflows and automated business rules**,
> So that **claims are properly registered, adjudicated, and paid according to policy terms while maintaining audit trails and handling exceptions systematically**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User is able to initiate claim intake via event case creation and apply applicability rules to validate claim eligibility
> 2. Upon policy retrieval, user is able to establish coverage details and create financial accumulators for tracking
>     2.1 When coverage is not automatically added, user manually adds coverage details
>     2.2 System validates coverage correctness before proceeding
> 3. User is able to execute adjudication process applying coverage rules and generating coverage determinations
> 4. User is able to schedule payments based on adjudication results and apply deductions, additions, taxes, and offsets sequentially
> 5. Upon payment approval validation, user is able to initiate batch payment generation and issuance to Payment Hub
> 6. When critical issues are detected at any stage, system creates tasks for manual review and resolution


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** event case is created, **when** applicability rules execute, **then** system validates claim eligibility and routes to appropriate workflow
> 2. **Given** policy details are retrieved, **when** coverage details change, **then** system returns to coverage setup for revalidation
> 3. **Given** adjudication completes, **when** claim details have not changed, **then** system proceeds to payment scheduling without reprocessing
> 4. **Given** payment scheduling completes, **when** deductions/additions/taxes are applicable, **then** system applies them sequentially before approval
> 5. **Given** critical issues are detected, **when** validation fails, **then** system prevents progression and creates tasks for resolution
> 6. **Given** payment generation succeeds, **when** batch issuance executes, **then** system creates Payment Hub transaction and issues payment


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=749180054"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to set and manage claim parties and beneficiaries, so that claim ownership and payment recipients are correctly established.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: establish and manage claim parties and beneficiaries to ensure accurate claim ownership and payment recipient designation
- **Value**: claims are properly attributed to responsible parties and payments are directed to the correct recipients, ensuring compliance and reducing payment errors

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **establish and manage claim parties and beneficiaries to ensure accurate claim ownership and payment recipient designation**,
> So that **claims are properly attributed to responsible parties and payments are directed to the correct recipients, ensuring compliance and reducing payment errors**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Upon claim creation during intake phase, system retrieves policy details and determines applicable parties based on policy configuration
> 2. User is able to configure claim parties to establish claim ownership and responsibility
>     2.1 System supports automated party assignment from policy data
>     2.2 User can manually override or add parties when automated assignment is insufficient
> 3. User is able to designate beneficiaries for payment distribution when required by claim type or coverage
> 4. System validates party and beneficiary relationships against policy rules and business constraints before persisting
> 5. Upon party or beneficiary changes, system triggers recalculation of payment schedules and financial allocations
> 6. System maintains complete audit trail of all party and beneficiary modifications throughout claim lifecycle


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** claim is in intake or setup phase, **When** user accesses party configuration, **Then** system retrieves policy parties and displays them for assignment or modification
> 2. **Given** user modifies claim parties, **When** changes are submitted, **Then** system validates party relationships against policy rules and prevents invalid configurations
> 3. **Given** coverage requires beneficiary designation, **When** user attempts to proceed without assigning beneficiaries, **Then** system prevents progression until beneficiaries are properly configured
> 4. **Given** parties or beneficiaries are updated, **When** changes are saved, **Then** system recalculates payment allocations and schedules accordingly
> 5. **Given** payment process has begun, **When** user attempts to modify beneficiaries, **Then** system enforces appropriate restrictions based on payment status
> 6. **Given** party or beneficiary modifications occur, **When** changes are committed, **Then** system records complete audit trail including user, timestamp, and modification details

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manage and add coverages to a claim, so that all applicable policy coverages are included in the adjudication process.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: manage and add coverages to a claim
- **Value**: all applicable policy coverages are included in the adjudication process

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **manage and add coverages to a claim**,
> So that **all applicable policy coverages are included in the adjudication process**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System automatically applies coverages based on policy applicability rules and event case details.
> 2. User reviews system-generated coverage list and validates alignment with policy terms.
> 3. When coverage is not automatically added or is incorrect, user manually adds or overrides coverage information.
>     3.1 User applies claim overrides to correct coverage details.
>     3.2 System creates accumulators for tracking coverage limits and usage.
> 4. System validates updated claim and coverage details before proceeding to adjudication.
> 5. Upon validation completion, coverage information becomes available for adjudication rule processing.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** policy details are retrieved, **When** applicability rules execute, **Then** system automatically determines and applies eligible coverages to the claim.
> 2. **Given** automatic coverage determination is incomplete, **When** user adds coverage manually, **Then** system accepts and validates the coverage against policy terms.
> 3. **Given** coverage details are incorrect, **When** user applies overrides, **Then** system updates coverage information and recalculates accumulators.
> 4. **Given** coverage modifications are completed, **When** user proceeds, **Then** system prevents adjudication if required coverage information is missing.
> 5. **Given** all coverages are finalized, **When** system validates, **Then** complete coverage list is available for adjudication processing.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to apply and review claim adjudication rules and results, so that coverage eligibility and benefit amounts are accurately determined.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: apply and review adjudication rules to determine coverage eligibility and calculate benefit amounts through automated and manual validation workflows
- **Value**: accurate coverage determinations, compliant benefit calculations, and reduced claim processing errors are achieved through systematic rule-based adjudication

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **apply and review adjudication rules to determine coverage eligibility and calculate benefit amounts through automated and manual validation workflows**,
> So that **accurate coverage determinations, compliant benefit calculations, and reduced claim processing errors are achieved through systematic rule-based adjudication**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System retrieves policy details and automatically applies applicability rules to determine initial coverage eligibility
> 2. Adjuster prepares adjudication input and system applies coverage adjudication rules to generate coverage results
>     2.1 Upon claim or coverage detail changes, system loops back to re-prepare adjudication input
> 3. Adjuster is able to apply financial adjustments including deductions, additions, taxes based on applicability determinations
> 4. System creates financial accumulators and validates coverage detail correctness throughout adjudication
> 5. Adjuster reviews generated coverage results and benefit amounts for accuracy
> 6. System detects changes during adjudication process and triggers re-validation workflows when modifications occur


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** policy details are retrieved, **When** applicability rules execute, **Then** system determines coverage eligibility and generates initial coverage list
> 2. **Given** adjudication input is prepared, **When** coverage adjudication rules apply, **Then** system produces accurate benefit amounts and coverage results
> 3. **Given** claim or coverage details change during adjudication, **When** change is detected, **Then** system re-executes adjudication workflow with updated information
> 4. **Given** deductions, additions, or taxes are applicable, **When** adjuster updates financial tabs, **Then** system recalculates benefit amounts accordingly
> 5. **Given** coverage details are incorrect, **When** validation fails, **Then** system prevents progression until corrections are made
> 6. **Given** adjudication completes, **When** critical issues exist, **Then** system blocks payment scheduling and creates review task

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to process deductions, taxes, and additions to claim payments, so that all financial adjustments are properly applied and recalculated.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: process financial adjustments including deductions, taxes, and additions to ensure accurate payment recalculation
- **Value**: claim payments reflect all required financial modifications and comply with policy terms and regulatory requirements

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **process financial adjustments including deductions, taxes, and additions to ensure accurate payment recalculation**,
> So that **claim payments reflect all required financial modifications and comply with policy terms and regulatory requirements**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System evaluates claim financial requirements and determines applicable adjustment categories following payment scheduling validation
> 2. User reviews and applies deductions based on policy provisions and business rules
>     2.1 System recalculates net payment amount upon deduction confirmation
> 3. User processes additions for supplementary payment components as required by policy terms
>     3.1 System updates total payable amount reflecting approved additions
> 4. User applies tax calculations according to jurisdictional requirements and policy specifications
> 5. System validates financial adjustments for critical issues and triggers payment recalculation automatically
> 6. Upon completion, system updates payment records and balance overview with adjusted financial components


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** payment scheduling is completed, **When** financial adjustments are required, **Then** system presents applicable adjustment categories for processing
> 2. **Given** user applies deductions, **When** deduction values are confirmed, **Then** system automatically recalculates payment amounts and updates balance overview
> 3. **Given** additions are processed, **When** user confirms addition amounts, **Then** system updates total payable reflecting approved supplementary components
> 4. **Given** tax calculations are applied, **When** jurisdictional rules are executed, **Then** system computes correct tax amounts and adjusts net payment
> 5. **Given** multiple adjustments are applied, **When** any adjustment is modified, **Then** system triggers complete payment recalculation reflecting all current financial components
> 6. **Given** critical validation issues are detected, **When** financial processing completes, **Then** system prevents payment generation and creates review tasks

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to schedule and manage claim payments, so that payment timing and amounts are optimized according to business rules.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: schedule, adjust, and manage claim payment processing according to automated business rules and manual overrides
- **Value**: payment timing and amounts are optimized to ensure accurate disbursement, regulatory compliance, and efficient financial resolution

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **schedule, adjust, and manage claim payment processing according to automated business rules and manual overrides**,
> So that **payment timing and amounts are optimized to ensure accurate disbursement, regulatory compliance, and efficient financial resolution**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System retrieves adjudication outcomes and applies payment scheduling rules to generate initial payment schedules with automated validation.
> 2. Upon detecting existing payments or data changes, system recalculates payment amounts based on updated coverage and financial accumulators.
> 3. User adjusts payment elements including deductions, additions, and taxes; system automatically recalculates affected payment schedules.
> 4. User designates beneficiaries and configures offset applications before finalizing payment instructions.
> 5. System validates payment schedule for critical issues and routes to approval workflow; if approved, payments queue for batch generation.
> 6. When critical issues arise during validation or issuing, system creates review tasks and blocks payment processing until manual resolution.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** adjudication completes successfully, **When** no prior payments exist, **Then** system schedules initial payments applying business rules without manual intervention.
> 2. **Given** claim or coverage data changes post-adjudication, **When** payment recalculation triggers, **Then** system updates payment amounts reflecting current financial state.
> 3. **Given** user applies deductions or additions, **When** adjustments are saved, **Then** system recalculates payment schedule and validates updated amounts.
> 4. **Given** payment validation detects critical issues, **When** approval fails, **Then** system prevents generation and creates manual review task.
> 5. **Given** payments pass validation and approval, **When** batch generation executes, **Then** system creates payment records and queues for issuing.
> 6. **Given** issued payments exist, **When** user attempts modification, **Then** system blocks changes and enforces exception handling workflow.

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=749180054"

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to create and review payments with offset and override capabilities, so that claim payments can be customized and exceptions handled appropriately.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: create, review, and customize claim payments with offset and override capabilities to handle standard and exceptional payment scenarios
- **Value**: claim payments are accurately calculated, exceptions are appropriately managed, and financial adjustments are systematically applied before issuance

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **create, review, and customize claim payments with offset and override capabilities to handle standard and exceptional payment scenarios**,
> So that **claim payments are accurately calculated, exceptions are appropriately managed, and financial adjustments are systematically applied before issuance**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User retrieves financial data and applies payment scheduling rules to determine initial payment amounts and schedules
> 2. Upon critical issues detection, system creates review tasks requiring manual adjuster intervention
> 3. User evaluates and processes conditional financial adjustments including deductions, additions, taxes, and offsets based on claim circumstances
>     3.1 System recalculates payment amounts automatically after each adjustment category is applied
> 4. User applies claim-level or coverage-level overrides to customize payments for exceptional scenarios
> 5. User reviews recalculated payments and resolves approval failures through manual task workflows
> 6. Upon successful validation, system generates final payment records and initiates issuance to Payment Hub


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** financial data is retrieved, **When** payment scheduling rules execute, **Then** system generates initial payment schedule with calculated amounts
> 2. **Given** critical issues are detected during scheduling, **When** validation fails, **Then** system creates review task and prevents payment progression
> 3. **Given** deductions, additions, taxes, or offsets are applicable, **When** each category is processed, **Then** system automatically recalculates affected payment amounts
> 4. **Given** adjuster applies overrides, **When** custom values are submitted, **Then** system accepts overrides and recalculates payments accordingly
> 5. **Given** payment approval fails, **When** failure is detected, **Then** system creates manual review task and halts issuance
> 6. **Given** all validations pass, **When** payment generation completes, **Then** system creates payment records and transmits transactions to Payment Hub successfully

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want to generate and issue payments through the Payment Hub, so that claim payments are processed and distributed efficiently.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: generate and issue payments through the Payment Hub
- **Value**: claim payments are processed, validated, and distributed efficiently while ensuring financial accuracy and compliance

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **generate and issue payments through the Payment Hub**,
> So that **claim payments are processed, validated, and distributed efficiently while ensuring financial accuracy and compliance**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System retrieves adjudication results and validates coverage applicability with policy details and accumulators
> 2. User applies financial adjustments including deductions, additions, taxes, and offsets with automatic recalculation
> 3. System schedules payments by retrieving financial data, applying scheduling rules, and validating for critical issues
>     3.1 Upon existing payments detected, system recalculates instead of creating duplicates
>     3.2 When approval required, system validates authorization status before proceeding
> 4. System generates payments through batch processing applying generation rules
> 5. System issues payments by creating outbound transactions to Payment Hub
>     5.1 If critical issues detected, system halts issuance and creates resolution task


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** adjudication completed, **When** financial adjustments applied, **Then** system recalculates payment amounts reflecting all deductions, additions, and taxes
> 2. **Given** payment scheduling initiated, **When** payments already exist, **Then** system recalculates existing payments instead of creating duplicates
> 3. **Given** payment requires approval, **When** approval status fails validation, **Then** system creates review task and prevents payment generation
> 4. **Given** payment generation triggered, **When** batch job executes, **Then** system applies generation rules and creates valid payment records
> 5. **Given** payment ready for issuance, **When** critical issues detected, **Then** system halts disbursement and creates cancellation task
> 6. **Given** payment validated, **When** issued to Payment Hub, **Then** system creates outbound transaction and confirms disbursement

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to identify and manage critical issues and payment approval failures, so that exceptions are escalated and resolved promptly.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: identify and manage critical issues and payment approval failures
- **Value**: exceptions are escalated and resolved promptly

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** identify and manage critical issues and payment approval failures,
> **so that** exceptions are escalated and resolved promptly.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. During payment schedule validation, the system automatically detects critical issues that would prevent payment processing.
>    1.1 If critical issues are identified, the system blocks progression to payment listing and creates a task assigned to the Claims Adjuster for payment review.
>    1.2 Payment schedule remains in pending status until all critical issues are resolved by the adjuster.
> 2. The system checks payment approval status as part of the payment scheduling workflow.
>    2.1 If payment approval is denied, the system creates a task for the Claims Adjuster to review and address the denial reasons.
>    2.2 Payment processing is blocked until approval denial is resolved and re-approval is obtained.
> 3. During payment issuance to the Payment Hub, the system validates outbound transactions for blocking issues.
>    3.1 If blocking issues are detected during Payment Hub transaction validation, the system creates a task for canceled payments assigned to the Claims Adjuster.
>    3.2 The system prevents creation of the outbound Payment Hub transaction until issues are resolved.
> 4. The Claims Adjuster accesses exception tasks through the Side Menu Navigation under Process Tasks.
> 5. For each exception task, the adjuster reviews relevant context including payment schedule details, approval status, validation errors, and blocking issue descriptions.
> 6. The adjuster takes corrective action based on the exception type, which may include updating payment details, modifying deductions or additions, adjusting beneficiaries, or escalating to underwriting or management.
> 7. Once corrective actions are completed, the adjuster resolves the task, triggering the system to re-validate and resume payment processing.
> 8. The system maintains an audit trail of all exception tasks, resolutions, and corrective actions in the Activities Timeline and History components.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the payment schedule validation process is running **when** a critical issue is detected **then** the system creates a task assigned to the Claims Adjuster within 5 seconds and blocks payment listing generation.
> 2. **Given** a payment approval check is performed **when** the approval status returns as denied **then** the system immediately creates a review task and prevents payment scheduling from progressing to the next stage.
> 3. **Given** a Payment Hub transaction validation is in progress **when** blocking issues are identified **then** the system creates a canceled payment task and does not transmit the transaction to the external Payment Hub.
> 4. **Given** a Claims Adjuster accesses the Process Tasks menu **when** exception tasks exist **then** all pending critical issue tasks and payment approval failure tasks are displayed with priority indicators and creation timestamps.
> 5. **Given** an exception task is opened by the adjuster **when** reviewing task details **then** the system displays complete context including payment amounts, blocking issue descriptions, approval denial reasons, and related claim and policy information.
> 6. **Given** a Claims Adjuster has resolved the underlying issue **when** the task is marked as complete **then** the system automatically re-triggers validation and resumes payment processing without manual intervention.
> 7. **Given** multiple critical issues exist for the same payment **when** the adjuster resolves only some issues **then** the payment remains blocked and the task remains open until all issues are resolved.
> 8. **Given** a Payment Hub transaction was previously blocked **when** the adjuster resolves all blocking issues and closes the task **then** the system successfully creates and transmits the outbound Payment Hub transaction within 10 seconds.
> 9. **Given** an exception task has been resolved **when** viewing the Activities Timeline or History **then** the complete audit trail including issue detection timestamp, task creation, adjuster actions, and resolution timestamp is visible.
> 10. **Given** no critical issues or approval failures exist **when** payment validation completes successfully **then** no exception tasks are created and payment processing continues automatically to the payment generation stage.


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=749180054"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view claim history, activities timeline, and balance overview, so that I have complete visibility into the claim lifecycle and financial status.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: access comprehensive claim history, activity timeline, and financial balance overview throughout the claim lifecycle
- **Value**: I have complete transparency into claim progression, financial status, and audit trail to support informed adjudication decisions and regulatory compliance

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **access comprehensive claim history, activity timeline, and financial balance overview throughout the claim lifecycle**,
> So that **I have complete transparency into claim progression, financial status, and audit trail to support informed adjudication decisions and regulatory compliance**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Upon claim creation, user is able to view consolidated claim overview displaying event case status and involved parties
> 2. User is able to access chronological activities timeline tracking all claim milestones from intake through adjudication to payment issuance
> 3. User is able to review historical audit trail capturing all modifications to coverage, financial adjustments, and policy changes
> 4. User is able to monitor financial balance overview including accumulators, scheduled payments, deductions, additions, taxes, and offsets
> 5. When coverage or payment details change, user is able to identify triggering events and recalculation impacts through activity logs
> 6. User is able to track outstanding tasks and critical issues blocking payment processing through integrated task visibility


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim exists in any lifecycle stage, **When** user accesses claim overview, **Then** system displays current status, parties, coverage, and financial summary without navigation delays
> 2. **Given** claim activities have occurred, **When** user views activities timeline, **Then** system presents chronological sequence of intake, adjudication, scheduling, generation, and issuance events
> 3. **Given** claim modifications exist, **When** user reviews history, **Then** system displays audit trail of all coverage changes, financial adjustments, and policy updates with timestamps
> 4. **Given** financial transactions are processed, **When** user checks balance overview, **Then** system calculates and displays accurate accumulator balances, scheduled amounts, and applied adjustments
> 5. **Given** payments are recalculated, **When** user investigates changes, **Then** system identifies triggering modifications and resulting financial impacts
> 6. **Given** critical issues block processing, **When** user views outstanding tasks, **Then** system highlights unresolved validation failures requiring intervention

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=749180054"

### Epic: Operational Workflow & Task Management

#### Feature: As a System Administrator, I want to define and configure task definitions with unique identifiers and entity types, so that tasks can be created for specific claim entities with consistent naming and routing.
- **Role**: Claim Manager
- **Action**: define and configure reusable task templates with unique identifiers, entity constraints, and routing rules
- **Value**: tasks can be consistently created across claim entities with standardized naming, assignment queues, and priority levels

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Manager**,
> I want to **define and configure reusable task templates with unique identifiers, entity constraints, and routing rules**,
> So that **tasks can be consistently created across claim entities with standardized naming, assignment queues, and priority levels**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Configure task template with unique identifier, entity type constraints, and temporal validity parameters
> 2. Define default assignment rules including preferred queue routing and read-only priority settings
> 3. Establish optional date calculation mechanisms for warning and due date automation
> 4. Activate task template upon effective date for operational use
> 5. Create task instances by selecting date handling strategies
>     5.1 Apply interval-based periods for dynamic scheduling
>     5.2 Specify explicit dates for fixed deadlines
> 6. Assign tasks automatically to configured queues with preset priorities


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** task template configuration is submitted **When** required identifiers and entity type are provided **Then** system activates template on effective date with routing rules
> 2. **Given** task template exists **When** user creates task instance **Then** system enforces entity type constraints and applies queue assignments
> 3. **Given** date type is unspecified **When** task is created **Then** system defaults to template-defined date calculation rules
> 4. **Given** priority is defined in template **When** task instance is generated **Then** system locks priority as read-only
> 5. **Given** incomplete date parameters **When** submission occurs **Then** system prevents task creation until required dates are provided


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=610898533"
> ]

#### Feature: As a System Administrator, I want to set effective and expiration dates for task definitions, so that task creation rules are only active during the appropriate business periods.
- **Role**: Claim Manager
- **Action**: configure temporal validity periods for task definitions to control when task creation rules are active
- **Value**: task workflows align with current business periods and prevent creation of outdated or premature task types

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Manager**,
> I want to **configure temporal validity periods for task definitions to control when task creation rules are active**,
> So that **task workflows align with current business periods and prevent creation of outdated or premature task types**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User is able to establish task definition templates with unique identifiers and metadata for specific case types
> 2. User is able to assign effective dates to control when task definitions become available for task creation
> 3. User is able to set expiration dates to automatically deactivate task definitions after business period ends
>     3.1 Upon expiration, system prevents new task creation using expired definitions
> 4. User is able to configure default assignment queues, priorities, and descriptions within temporal boundaries
> 5. System validates temporal status before permitting task instantiation from definitions


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a task definition with future effective date, **When** user attempts task creation before that date, **Then** system prevents task instantiation
> 2. **Given** an active task definition within validity period, **When** user creates task, **Then** system applies configured defaults and permits submission
> 3. **Given** a task definition past expiration date, **When** user attempts task creation, **Then** system blocks creation and notifies of inactive status
> 4. **Given** overlapping temporal periods for similar definitions, **When** system evaluates applicability, **Then** most specific active definition governs
> 5. **Given** no expiration date configured, **When** effective date passes, **Then** definition remains perpetually active


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=610898533"
> ]

- **Role**: Claim Manager
- **Action**: configure task definitions with preferred queue assignments and default priority levels
- **Value**: tasks are automatically routed to appropriate teams with correct prioritization, ensuring efficient workload distribution and timely claim processing

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Manager**,
> I want to **configure task definitions with preferred queue assignments and default priority levels**,
> So that **tasks are automatically routed to appropriate teams with correct prioritization, ensuring efficient workload distribution and timely claim processing**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User is able to establish task definition with unique identifier and entity restrictions for specific business processes
> 2. User configures preferred queue assignment to direct tasks to designated teams automatically
> 3. User sets default priority level to ensure critical tasks receive appropriate attention
> 4. User defines effective dates to control when task definitions become operational
>     4.1 Upon reaching effective date, system activates task definition for routing

> 4. **Given** priority level is configured, **When** task instance is created, **Then** priority value is applied and protected from modification
> 5. **Given** entity restrictions are specified, **When** task is associated with different entity type, **Then** system prevents invalid assignment

- **Action**: configure default task definitions with standardized metadata, deadline types, and warning parameters

> 4. **Given** definition contains metadata, **When** user views task, **Then** system displays configured description and naming conventions
> 5. **Given** extension parameters are specified, **When** task requires specialized rules, **Then** system applies external configuration logic
> 6. **Given** definition exists, **When** duplicate identifier is submitted, **Then** system prevents creation to maintain uniqueness

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to create tasks from predefined task definitions with configurable warning and due dates, so that I can efficiently manage claim follow-up activities with clear deadlines.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: create and manage follow-up tasks from predefined task definitions with configurable warning and due dates
- **Value**: I can efficiently track claim activities with clear deadlines and proactive reminders, ensuring timely claim resolution

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **create and manage follow-up tasks from predefined task definitions with configurable warning and due dates**,
> So that **I can efficiently track claim activities with clear deadlines and proactive reminders, ensuring timely claim resolution**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System administrator establishes task definitions with entity scope, assignment queues, and default priority settings
> 2. User initiates task creation by selecting a predefined task definition applicable to the claim event case
> 3. User configures task deadline parameters by specifying due date and optional warning date for proactive alerts
> 4. System validates date configurations and assigns task to designated queue with defined priority
> 5. User manages active tasks with visibility to warning and due date milestones for timely completion
> 6. Upon deadline approach, system triggers proactive notifications based on configured warning date settings


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a valid task definition exists, **When** user creates a task instance, **Then** system requires due date selection and allows optional warning date configuration
> 2. **Given** task is created, **When** assigned to queue, **Then** system applies default priority and restricts assignment to designated queue only
> 3. **Given** warning date is configured, **When** warning threshold is reached, **Then** system triggers proactive notification to assigned user
> 4. **Given** incomplete date configuration, **When** user attempts submission, **Then** system prevents task creation until due date is provided
> 5. **Given** task definition effective date, **When** before effective date, **Then** system prevents task creation using that definition
> 6. **Given** multiple task types exist, **When** user selects definition, **Then** system displays only definitions applicable to current entity type

#### Feature: As a System Administrator, I want to define task definitions with period-based or delay-based due dates, so that task deadlines can be automatically calculated relative to claim events.
- **Role**: System Administrator
- **Action**: configure task definitions with flexible due date calculation methods (period-based, date-based, or default) relative to claim events
- **Value**: task deadlines are automatically calculated and enforced consistently across all claim workflows, reducing manual scheduling and ensuring timely claim processing

**Description:**

> As a **System Administrator**,
> I want to **configure task definitions with flexible due date calculation methods (period-based, date-based, or default) relative to claim events**,
> So that **task deadlines are automatically calculated and enforced consistently across all claim workflows, reducing manual scheduling and ensuring timely claim processing**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Administrator establishes task definition with unique identifier, entity restrictions, effective dates, queue assignment, and priority level
> 2. Administrator configures warning date parameters selecting calculation method: period-based (relative timeframe), date-based (absolute date), or system default
> 3. Administrator configures due date parameters selecting calculation method: period-based (relative timeframe), date-based (absolute date), or system default
> 4. System validates definition uniqueness and entity type constraints before activation
>     4.1 Upon duplicate identifier detection, system prevents definition creation
>     4.2 Upon invalid entity type assignment, system rejects configuration
> 5. System activates task definition on specified effective date for automated task instance creation
> 6. System calculates warning and due dates dynamically when task instances are created based on configured calculation rules


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a task definition with period-based due date (e.g., P3D), **When** a task instance is created, **Then** system calculates due date as three days from triggering event
> 2. **Given** a task definition with date-based warning date, **When** task instance is created, **Then** system applies absolute date as configured
> 3. **Given** duplicate definition identifier submission, **When** administrator attempts creation, **Then** system prevents creation and alerts to uniqueness constraint
> 4. **Given** task definition restricted to specific entity type, **When** task creation attempts different entity, **Then** system rejects creation
> 5. **Given** task definition with effective date in future, **When** current date precedes effective date, **Then** system prevents task instance creation until activation
> 6. **Given** task definition without expiration date, **When** activated, **Then** system permits indefinite task creation until explicitly expired

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want to manage task definition lifecycle through effective and expiration dates, so that outdated task creation rules are automatically deactivated and compliance with policy changes is maintained.
- **Role**: Claims Operations Manager
- **Action**: manage task definition lifecycle through effective and expiration dates
- **Value**: outdated task creation rules are automatically deactivated and compliance with policy changes is maintained

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Operations Manager,
> **I want to** manage task definition lifecycle through effective and expiration dates,
> **so that** outdated task creation rules are automatically deactivated and compliance with policy changes is maintained.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Define task definitions with temporal controls including unique definition ID, name, entity type restrictions, and lifecycle dates.
> 2. Configure effective date to control when a task definition becomes active and eligible for creating new task instances.
> 3. Configure expiration date to automatically deactivate task definitions and prevent creation of new tasks based on outdated rules.
> 4. Manage task definition attributes including target queue assignment, default priority, description, and extension parameters.
> 5. Configure warning and due date specifications for tasks created from the definition.
>    5.1 Set warning date configuration using type options (PERIOD for relative timing, DATE for specific date, or DEFAULT for system default) with corresponding value specification.
>    5.2 Set due date configuration using type options (PERIOD for relative timing, DATE for specific date, or DEFAULT for system default) with corresponding value specification.
> 6. Create task instances from active task definitions for specified entity types with automatic queue assignment and priority application.
> 7. System enforces entity type restrictions ensuring tasks are only created for authorized entity types as defined in the task definition.
> 8. Task definitions maintain system-wide uniqueness of definition identifiers to prevent conflicts.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a task definition with effectiveDate set to a future date, **When** the current system date is before the effectiveDate, **Then** the task definition cannot be used to create new task instances and is marked as inactive.
> 2. **Given** a task definition with effectiveDate set to a past or current date, **When** the current system date is on or after the effectiveDate, **Then** the task definition becomes available for creating new task instances.
> 3. **Given** a task definition with expirationDate configured, **When** the current system date reaches the expirationDate, **Then** the system automatically deactivates the definition and prevents creation of new tasks using this definition.
> 4. **Given** an expired task definition, **When** an attempt is made to create a task using the expired definition ID, **Then** the system rejects the request and returns an appropriate error message indicating the definition has expired.
> 5. **Given** a task definition with both effectiveDate and expirationDate configured, **When** the definition is queried, **Then** the system displays the complete lifecycle status including dates and current active/inactive state.
> 6. **Given** a task definition with entityType restriction set to CapLoss, **When** attempting to create a task for a non-CapLoss entity, **Then** the system prevents task creation and returns an entity type mismatch error.
> 7. **Given** a task definition with preferredQueueCd set to claim_management and priority set to 2, **When** a task is created from this definition, **Then** the task is automatically assigned to the claim_management queue with priority 2.
> 8. **Given** a task creation request with warningDateType set to PERIOD and warningDateTime set to P2D, **When** the task is created, **Then** the warning date is calculated as 2 days from the task creation date.
> 9. **Given** a task creation request with dueDateType set to DATE and dueDateTime set to a specific date value, **When** the task is created, **Then** the due date is set to the specified absolute date value.
> 10. **Given** a task definition with definitionId CAP-002.CapEventTask, **When** attempting to create another definition with the same definitionId, **Then** the system rejects the creation due to duplicate identifier violation.
> 11. **Given** multiple active task definitions with overlapping effective periods, **When** creating tasks during the overlap period, **Then** the system allows task creation from any active definition based on the specified definitionId in the creation request.
> 12. **Given** a task definition without expirationDate configured, **When** the definition passes its effectiveDate, **Then** the definition remains active indefinitely until an expirationDate is set through definition update.

#### Feature: As a System Administrator, I want to configure extension parameters for task definitions, so that domain-specific business logic and custom attributes can be applied to task creation workflows.
- **Role**: System Administrator
- **Action**: configure extension parameters for task definitions
- **Value**: domain-specific business logic and custom attributes can be applied to task creation workflows

**Description:**

> **As a** System Administrator,
> **I want to** configure extension parameters for task definitions,
> **so that** domain-specific business logic and custom attributes can be applied to task creation workflows.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Administrator defines a new task definition with required core identifiers including unique definition ID, task name, and associated entity type.
> 2. Administrator configures task validity period by specifying effective date and optional expiration date to control when the task definition is active.
> 3. Administrator sets default operational parameters including preferred queue assignment, priority level with read-only restrictions, and descriptive text.
> 4. Administrator configures extension parameters through OpenL rules that define custom attributes and their data types for domain-specific requirements.
> 5. Administrator establishes flexible date configuration options for task instances:
>    5.1 When warning date delay is not predefined at definition level, task creators can specify warning date using DATE type with optional user-selected date/time.
>    5.2 When due date delay is not predefined at definition level, task creators must specify due date using DATE type with required user-selected date/time.
>    5.3 Alternative date type configurations support PERIOD (duration-based calculations), DATE (absolute date/time selection), or DEFAULT (inheritance from definition defaults).
> 6. Task definition is published and becomes available for task instance creation through REST API once effective date is reached.
> 7. Users create task instances based on configured definitions by providing entity association, selecting required due date/time, and optionally specifying warning date/time according to configured extension parameters.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an administrator is creating a task definition, **When** they specify a definition ID, **Then** the system validates uniqueness across all task definitions and prevents duplicate IDs.
> 2. **Given** a task definition is configured with effectiveDate of 2021-11-17 and no expirationDate, **When** the current date is on or after 2021-11-17, **Then** the task definition is available for task instance creation indefinitely.
> 3. **Given** a task definition specifies priority value of 3 as read-only, **When** a user creates a task instance from this definition, **Then** the priority value cannot be modified during task creation or after task is created.
> 4. **Given** a task definition has extensionType configured with OpenL rules, **When** a task instance is created, **Then** all extension parameters defined in OpenL are available and validated according to their specified data types.
> 5. **Given** a task definition has warningDateDelay unset and warningDateType configured as DATE, **When** a user creates a task instance, **Then** the system allows optional selection of warningDateTime without requiring a value.
> 6. **Given** a task definition has dueDateDelay unset and dueDateType configured as DATE, **When** a user creates a task instance, **Then** the system requires mandatory selection of dueDateTime and blocks task creation if not provided.
> 7. **Given** a task definition supports three date type options (PERIOD, DATE, DEFAULT), **When** a user creates a task instance, **Then** the system correctly processes date/time values according to the selected type:
>    7.1 PERIOD calculates dates based on duration from reference point.
>    7.2 DATE uses the exact date/time value specified by user.
>    7.3 DEFAULT inherits date configuration from the task definition.
> 8. **Given** a task definition specifies entityType as CapEventCase and preferredQueueCd as claim_management, **When** a task instance is created via REST API, **Then** the task is associated with the specified event case entity and automatically assigned to the claim_management queue.
> 9. **Given** multiple task definitions exist in the system, **When** an administrator attempts to create a new definition with a duplicate definitionId, **Then** the system rejects the creation with a clear error message indicating ID conflict.
> 10. **Given** a task definition is configured with all required core attributes and extension parameters, **When** a user creates a task instance without providing mandatory fields (e.g., dueDateTime when required), **Then** the system blocks task creation and displays validation errors for missing required fields.

### Epic: User Experience & Claim Workspace

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view claim overview header components including claim status, assignment, and key identifiers, so that I can quickly understand the claim's current state and ownership.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view claim overview header components including claim status, assignment, and key identifiers, and assign claims to appropriate personnel
- **Value**: I can quickly understand the claim's current state and ownership, and efficiently manage claim assignments

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view claim overview header components including claim status, assignment, and key identifiers, and assign claims to appropriate personnel,
> **so that** I can quickly understand the claim's current state and ownership, and efficiently manage claim assignments.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User accesses the Claim Overview page to view and manage claim information.
> 2. System displays claim header components containing essential claim information including claim status, current assignment, and key identifiers.
> 3. User reviews displayed header information to understand the claim's current state and ownership.
> 4. User interacts with standardized common UI components consistent with Life and Annuities BLOB interface patterns.
> 5. When claim assignment is required:
>    5.1 User initiates the Assign Claim process from the Claim Overview screen.
>    5.2 System presents the Assign Claim interface components.
>    5.3 User selects and assigns a claim manager to the claim.
>    5.4 System updates the claim assignment and reflects the change in the header display.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster with appropriate access permissions accesses a valid claim record, **When** the Claim Overview page loads, **Then** the system displays the claim header components with all essential claim information including status, assignment, and key identifiers.
> 2. **Given** the Claim Overview page is displayed, **When** the user views the header components, **Then** the interface follows the standardized patterns defined in Common UI Components for LA Life, ensuring consistent user experience.
> 3. **Given** a claim requires assignment, **When** the user initiates the Assign Claim process from the Claim Overview screen, **Then** the system presents the Assign Claim interface components allowing claim manager selection.
> 4. **Given** the user has selected a claim manager in the assignment interface, **When** the user completes the assignment action, **Then** the system successfully assigns the claim to the designated claim manager and updates the header display accordingly.
> 5. **Given** a user without appropriate access permissions attempts to access the Claim Overview page, **When** the page is requested, **Then** the system denies access and prevents display of claim header information.
> 6. **Given** the user is on the Claim Overview page, **When** the user interacts with any common UI components, **Then** the components behave consistently with the standardized Life and Annuities BLOB interface patterns.
> 7. **Given** a claim assignment has been successfully completed, **When** the Claim Overview page refreshes or is accessed subsequently, **Then** the updated claim manager assignment is reflected in the claim header components.
> 8. **Given** a claim record does not exist in the system, **When** a user attempts to access the Claim Overview for that record, **Then** the system prevents page load and provides appropriate error messaging.

> 2. System displays Definition of Disability Details section showing disability definition parameters sourced from Master Policy  Plan  Disability Provisions.
>    2.1 For Short-Term Disability claims: Display STD-specific fields including Definition of Disability Formula, Minimum Partial Disability Earnings (%), Maximum Partial Disability Earnings (%), Partial Disability status, Test Definition, and Earning Test (%).
>    2.2 For Long-Term Disability claims: Display LTD-specific fields including Definition of Disability Formula, Minimum Partial Disability Earnings (%), Maximum Partial Disability Earnings (%), Partial Disability status, Test Definition, Own Occupation Earning Test (%), and Any Occupation Earning Test (%).
> 3. For Long-Term Disability claims, system additionally displays Indexing Details section showing adjustment configuration.
>    3.1 When Master Policy Plan has Indexing of Monthly Earnings = Yes: Display all indexing fields including Adjustment Percentage (e.g., CPI), CPI Type, Maximum Adjustment Percentage (%), Number of Adjustments (Unlimited/5/10), Waiting Period (Months), 1st Indexing Date (calculated), and Next Indexing Date (estimated).
>    3.2 When Master Policy Plan has Indexing of Monthly Earnings = No: Display 'N/A' in the Indexing Details section.
>    3.3 When claim closes or maximum adjustments reached: Display 'N/A' for Next Indexing Date field.
> 4. For Long-Term Disability claims with active indexing, system displays Indexing History table showing all historical adjustments sorted with most recent entries first.
>    4.1 Each history entry includes: Indexing Date (actual anniversary date), Adjustment Number (sequential count), Actual Index Percentage applied, Indexed Pre-Disability Monthly Earnings (calculated amount), and Maximum Partial Disability Earnings (calculated from indexed earnings).
>    4.2 When indexing anniversary date occurs: System automatically calculates and records new entry with current adjustment details and adds to top of history table.
> 5. System automatically manages indexing lifecycle based on claim status.
>    5.1 When claim closes or maximum adjustments reached: Stop recording new indexing history entries and mark Next Indexing Date as 'N/A'.
>    5.2 When claim reopens and maximum adjustments not yet reached: Resume indexing calculations, recalculate Next Indexing Date, and continue recording new history entries on anniversary dates.
> 6. All calculations and date determinations follow documented business rules for indexing anniversaries, adjustment percentages, and AGBA calculations.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster accesses a Short-Term Disability claim, **When** viewing the Definition of Disability tab, **Then** the system displays Definition of Disability Details section with STD-specific fields only (Definition of Disability Formula, Minimum Partial Disability Earnings %, Maximum Partial Disability Earnings %, Partial Disability, Test Definition, Earning Test %) and does not display Indexing Details or Indexing History sections.
> 2. **Given** a Claims Adjuster accesses a Long-Term Disability claim, **When** viewing the Definition of Disability tab, **Then** the system displays Definition of Disability Details section with LTD-specific fields (Definition of Disability Formula, Minimum Partial Disability Earnings %, Maximum Partial Disability Earnings %, Partial Disability, Test Definition, Own Occupation Earning Test %, Any Occupation Earning Test %) and additionally displays Indexing Details and Indexing History sections.
> 3. **Given** an LTD claim where Master Policy Plan has Indexing of Monthly Earnings = Yes, **When** viewing the Indexing Details section, **Then** the system displays all indexing configuration fields with populated values including Adjustment Percentage, CPI Type, Maximum Adjustment Percentage, Number of Adjustments, Waiting Period, 1st Indexing Date (calculated), and Next Indexing Date (estimated).
> 4. **Given** an LTD claim where Master Policy Plan has Indexing of Monthly Earnings = No, **When** viewing the Indexing Details section, **Then** the system displays 'N/A' instead of showing indexing field values.
> 5. **Given** an LTD claim with active indexing, **When** viewing the Indexing History table, **Then** the system displays all historical adjustment entries sorted with most recent entries first, each containing Indexing Date, Adjustment Number, Actual Index Percentage, Indexed Pre-Disability Monthly Earnings, and Maximum Partial Disability Earnings.
> 6. **Given** an LTD claim reaches its indexing anniversary date, **When** the system processes the anniversary, **Then** a new entry is automatically added to the top of the Indexing History table with calculated values for that adjustment period.
> 7. **Given** an LTD claim closes or reaches maximum adjustment count, **When** viewing the Indexing Details section, **Then** the Next Indexing Date field displays 'N/A' and no new entries are added to Indexing History table.
> 8. **Given** a previously closed LTD claim reopens and has not reached maximum adjustments, **When** the claim status changes to active, **Then** the system recalculates and displays the Next Indexing Date and resumes recording new indexing history entries on subsequent anniversary dates.
> 9. **Given** a Claims Adjuster views any Definition of Disability tab, **When** the page loads, **Then** all displayed data is sourced from Master Policy  Plan  Disability Provisions and Indexing configurations and follows documented business rules for all calculations.
> 10. **Given** an LTD claim has no indexing history yet, **When** viewing the Indexing History section, **Then** the table is displayed empty with appropriate column headers visible and ready to display entries once anniversaries occur.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to add, edit, and remove ancillary activities such as vocational rehabilitation programs with date ranges and claim linkage, so that I can track rehabilitation and support services provided to the claimant.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: manage ancillary activities such as vocational rehabilitation programs with date ranges and claim associations
- **Value**: I can track and document rehabilitation and support services provided to claimants, ensuring comprehensive claim management and compliance with service delivery requirements

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **manage ancillary activities such as vocational rehabilitation programs with date ranges and claim associations**,
> So that **I can track and document rehabilitation and support services provided to claimants, ensuring comprehensive claim management and compliance with service delivery requirements**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates the addition of an ancillary activity and selects the activity type from available options
> 2. User specifies the service period by defining start and end dates for the activity
> 3. User associates the ancillary activity with one or more relevant claims
>     3.1 Upon selecting vocational rehabilitation programs, system enables full functionality
>     3.2 When selecting other activity types, system indicates limited operational status
> 4. User submits the activity for validation and system verifies date range logic and non-overlapping periods for identical programs on the same claim
> 5. User modifies existing ancillary activities by updating type, dates, or claim associations
> 6. User removes ancillary activities with system confirmation, updating the claim records accordingly


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim exists, **When** the adjuster adds an ancillary activity with valid date ranges and claim linkage, **Then** the system records the activity and displays it in the activity list
> 2. **Given** an ancillary activity exists, **When** the adjuster modifies the service period or claim association, **Then** the system validates and updates the activity without creating duplicates
> 3. **Given** date validation requirements, **When** the start date equals or exceeds the end date, **Then** the system prevents submission and requires correction
> 4. **Given** existing vocational rehabilitation programs, **When** adding a new program with overlapping dates for the same claim, **Then** the system prevents submission and alerts the adjuster
> 5. **Given** an ancillary activity is selected for removal, **When** the adjuster confirms deletion, **Then** the system removes the activity and updates the claim
> 6. **Given** insufficient permissions, **When** attempting activity management, **Then** the system restricts access to the functionality

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to add, edit, and remove deductions from a claim with details including type, amount, date range, and pre-tax status, so that I can accurately manage financial adjustments and withholdings.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: manage deductions throughout the claim lifecycle to ensure accurate financial adjustments and withholdings
- **Value**: financial accuracy is maintained and withholdings are properly documented for claim settlement

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **manage deductions throughout the claim lifecycle to ensure accurate financial adjustments and withholdings**,
> So that **financial accuracy is maintained and withholdings are properly documented for claim settlement**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User is able to access the deduction registry within the claim workspace to review existing financial adjustments
> 2. User is able to initiate deduction creation by providing deduction classification, monetary value, effective period, and pre-tax designation
> 3. User is able to modify deduction attributes when business conditions or financial requirements change
> 4. User is able to remove deductions when withholdings are no longer applicable
> 5. System validates deduction data completeness before persisting records
> 6. System maintains deduction audit trail for financial reconciliation and compliance purposes


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 3. **Given** incomplete deduction information, **When** submission is attempted, **Then** the system prevents persistence until data requirements are satisfied
> 4. **Given** a deduction is no longer applicable, **When** the adjuster initiates removal, **Then** the system archives the record and adjusts claim calculations
> 5. **Given** multiple deductions exist, **When** the adjuster accesses the registry, **Then** all deductions display with current attributes and effective status

### Epic: Domain-Specific Capabilities & Logic

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to retrieve policy summary information at event case intake, so that I can verify coverage details and assist with coverage investigation
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: retrieve and integrate policy summary information, coverage details, eligibility criteria, and benefit structures at event case intake and throughout the claims lifecycle
- **Value**: I can verify coverage details, validate claim eligibility, support coverage investigation, and accurately calculate settlement amounts based on policy terms and conditions

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** retrieve and integrate policy summary information, coverage details, eligibility criteria, and benefit structures at event case intake and throughout the claims lifecycle,
> **so that** I can verify coverage details, validate claim eligibility, support coverage investigation, and accurately calculate settlement amounts based on policy terms and conditions.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. **Event Case Level - Policy Search and Population:**",
>   "   1.1 Upon event case creation (triggered by 'createCase' command), system automatically searches indexed policies by indicated date and registry IDs.",
>   "   1.2 System transforms and maps policy summary information into the Event Case using policy indexing and projection processes.",
>   "   1.3 Policy general summary information is made available to claims adjuster to support initial coverage verification at intake.",
>   "2. **Loss Level - Comprehensive Policy Integration:**",
>   "   2.1 Upon loss creation (triggered by 'createLoss' command), system resolves full policy image using stored policy ID.",
>   "   2.2 System maps comprehensive policy data including summary information, coverage details, eligibility criteria, age reduction rules, and benefit structures into ClaimWrapper entity.",
>   "   2.3 Claims adjuster can access detailed coverage list for selection and validation during loss event processing.",
>   "   2.4 System applies applicability rules to validate claim eligibility against policy terms and conditions.",
>   "   2.5 **Alternate Flow - Unverified Policy at Loss Level:** When processing unverified policies, system maps limited subset of data including only summary information and basic coverage data (no eligibility or age reduction details).",
>   "3. **Settlement Level - Benefit Calculation and Adjudication:**",
>   "   3.1 Upon settlement adjudication (triggered by 'adjudicateSettlement' command), system resolves full policy image using stored policy ID.",
>   "   3.2 System maps policy benefit information including coverage codes, benefit amounts, time periods, maximum benefit numbers, and lifetime maximums into Settlement entity.",
>   "   3.3 Claims adjuster can calculate gross and payable settlement amounts based on integrated policy conditions, benefit structures, and coverage terms.",
>   "   3.4 **Alternate Flow - Unverified Policy at Settlement Level:** When processing unverified policies, system maps only summary information and basic benefit information without detailed benefit structure attributes.",
>   "4. **Cross-Stage Data Consistency:**",
>   "   4.1 Policy integration attributes are stored centrally in ClaimWrapper entity to ensure consistency across all claim processing stages.",
>   "   4.2 System maintains policy version control and tracks policy status, effective dates, and product codes throughout the claim lifecycle.",
>   "   4.3 Claims adjuster can view related master policy and certificate policy information for group insurance scenarios.",
>   "5. **Product Line Extension Support:**",
>   "   5.1 **Alternate Flow - Term Life Processing:** For term life applications, system follows same three-stage integration pattern with term life specific configurations.",
>   "   5.2 **Alternate Flow - Other Product Lines:** Integration capability extends to Group Term Life and Hospital Indemnity through product-specific configuration and transformation mappings."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Scenario 1: Event Case Creation with Policy Search**",
>   "Given a claims adjuster initiates event case creation with valid loss date and insured registry IDs,",
>   "When the 'createCase' command is triggered,",
>   "Then the system searches indexed policies matching the indicated date and registry IDs,",
>   "And the system populates Event Case with policy summary information including policy number, product code, policy status, effective date, and risk state,",
>   "And the policy summary is displayed to the claims adjuster within the event case intake screen.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 2: Loss Creation with Full Policy Integration**",
>   "Given an event case exists with associated policy ID,",
>   "When the claims adjuster creates a loss via 'createLoss' command,",
>   "Then the system resolves the full policy image using the stored policy ID,",
>   "And the system maps comprehensive policy data including coverage details, eligibility criteria, age reduction rules, and benefit structures into ClaimWrapper entity,",
>   "And the claims adjuster can view and select from available coverages based on policy benefit configurations,",
>   "And the system validates claim eligibility against policy waiting periods and eligibility requirements.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 3: Settlement Adjudication with Benefit Calculation**",
>   "Given a loss exists with integrated policy coverage information,",
>   "When the claims adjuster initiates settlement adjudication via 'adjudicateSettlement' command,",
>   "Then the system resolves the full policy image and maps benefit information into Settlement entity,",
>   "And the system calculates gross and payable amounts based on policy benefit amounts, time periods, maximum benefit numbers, and lifetime maximums,",
>   "And the claims adjuster can view calculated settlement amounts with policy-based justification.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 4: Unverified Policy Processing at Loss Level**",
>   "Given an event case is associated with an unverified policy,",
>   "When the claims adjuster creates a loss,",
>   "Then the system uses unverified policy transformation mapping,",
>   "And the system populates only summary information and basic coverage data without eligibility or age reduction details,",
>   "And the claims adjuster is notified that policy verification is required for complete coverage validation.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 5: Unverified Policy Processing at Settlement Level**",
>   "Given a loss is associated with an unverified policy,",
>   "When the claims adjuster initiates settlement adjudication,",
>   "Then the system uses unverified policy transformation mapping,",
>   "And the system populates only summary information and basic benefit information,",
>   "And detailed benefit structure attributes are not available for calculation,",
>   "And the claims adjuster must manually verify benefit amounts before finalizing settlement.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 6: Master and Certificate Policy Relationship**",
>   "Given a claim involves a certificate policy under a master group policy,",
>   "When the claims adjuster views policy information at any stage,",
>   "Then the system displays both master policy ID/number and certificate policy ID/number,",
>   "And the system shows master policy product code, package code, plan code, and organization customer number,",
>   "And the claims adjuster can navigate between master and certificate policy details.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 7: Coverage Configuration Validation**",
>   "Given policy benefits are configured in OpenL CI Coverage List sheet,",
>   "When the claims adjuster accesses available coverages during loss processing,",
>   "Then only benefits matching the relationship to participant, package/plan codes, and policy coverage codes are displayed,",
>   "And each coverage displays the configured claim coverage label and applicable loss types,",
>   "And benefit availability indicators (e.g., isAmbulanceAirApplied, coveredConditionsDetails) are evaluated from policy data.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 8: Benefit Mapping and Calculation**",
>   "Given policy benefit structures include benefit amounts, increment amounts, min/max amounts, and salary multiples,",
>   "When the claims adjuster proceeds to settlement adjudication,",
>   "Then the system maps benefit level parameters from policy coverage configuration,",
>   "And the system applies rounding methods, annual earnings calculations, and employee/individual percentages as configured,",
>   "And calculated benefit amounts respect policy-defined minimum, maximum, and approved amount constraints.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 9: Age Reduction Application**",
>   "Given a policy includes age reduction rules,",
>   "When the system integrates policy data at loss level,",
>   "Then age reduction details including age code and reduced-to code are mapped into ClaimWrapper coverage information,",
>   "And the isAgeReductionApplied indicator is set based on insured age and policy effective date,",
>   "And benefit amounts are adjusted according to age reduction schedule during settlement calculation.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 10: Policy Data Consistency Across Stages**",
>   "Given policy integration attributes are stored in ClaimWrapper entity,",
>   "When the claims adjuster accesses policy information at loss level and later at settlement level,",
>   "Then the same policy version, status, effective date, and product code are consistently displayed,",
>   "And any changes to policy data require re-resolution of policy image,",
>   "And policy data inconsistencies trigger validation warnings to the claims adjuster.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 11: Missing or Invalid Policy ID**",
>   "Given an event case is created without valid policy search results,",
>   "When the claims adjuster attempts to create a loss,",
>   "Then the system prevents loss creation due to missing policy ID,",
>   "And an error message indicates that policy information must be verified before proceeding,",
>   "And the claims adjuster is directed to manually search and associate a valid policy."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to select applicable coverages from a filtered list based on the current loss event, so that I only process coverages relevant to the claim
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: select applicable coverages from a filtered list based on the current loss event
- **Value**: only relevant coverages are processed, reducing errors and improving adjudication efficiency

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **select applicable coverages from a filtered list based on the current loss event**,
> So that **only relevant coverages are processed, reducing errors and improving adjudication efficiency**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System retrieves policy summary and coverage data upon event case intake
> 2. System filters coverage selection list based on loss event type (e.g., death, accelerated, dismemberment, premium waiver)
>     2.1 Upon accelerated loss, only accelerated coverages display
>     2.2 Upon death loss, only death-related coverages display
> 3. User selects applicable coverage from the filtered list for adjudication
> 4. System validates coverage eligibility against policy rules and effective dates
> 5. System maps selected coverage to claim wrapper, inheriting policy limits and benefit structures
> 6. System calculates gross and payable amounts based on integrated policy terms


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a loss event is created, **When** coverage selection is initiated, **Then** system displays only coverages matching the loss event type
> 2. **Given** policy integration succeeds, **When** coverage list loads, **Then** unrelated coverages are excluded from selection options
> 3. **Given** coverage is selected, **When** validation executes, **Then** system prevents processing if coverage is ineligible per policy rules
> 4. **Given** valid coverage selection, **When** adjudication proceeds, **Then** system inherits benefit amounts and limits from policy
> 5. **Given** unverified policy scenario, **When** coverage retrieval occurs, **Then** system integrates available summary and coverage data without benefit details
