#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want the system to calculate gross and payable amounts based on policy conditions and terms, so that benefit amounts are accurate and compliant with policy provisions
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: retrieve and integrate policy-level information (coverages, limits, insureds, beneficiaries, benefit structures) across the claim lifecycle and calculate gross and payable amounts based on policy terms and conditions
- **Value**: benefit amounts are accurate, compliant with policy provisions, and coverage investigation is supported with complete policy context

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** retrieve and integrate policy-level information (coverages, limits, insureds, beneficiaries, benefit structures) across the claim lifecycle and calculate gross and payable amounts based on policy terms and conditions,
> **so that** benefit amounts are accurate, compliant with policy provisions, and coverage investigation is supported with complete policy context.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. During Event Case creation, the system retrieves policy summary information by searching indexed policies using loss date and registry identifiers, then populates policy summary data into the Event Case entity.",
>   "2. During Loss creation within the ClaimWrapper domain, the system resolves the full policy image and integrates comprehensive policy data including:",
>   "   2.1 Policy summary attributes (master policy ID, policy number, product code, package code, plan code, risk state, policy status, effective date, term).",
>   "   2.2 Coverage and benefit structure details (available coverages, benefit levels, benefit amounts, coverage limits).",
>   "   2.3 Eligibility criteria and parameters.",
>   "   2.4 Age reduction schedules and details.",
>   "   2.5 Insured information and beneficiary data.",
>   "3. The system stores all integrated policy data in the ClaimWrapper entity (not individual Loss entities) to support claim-policy relationship throughout the claim lifecycle.",
>   "4. During Settlement adjudication, the system resolves policy data again and maps policy summary, coverage, and benefit information into the Settlement entity for benefit calculation purposes.",
>   "5. The system calculates gross and potential payable amounts based on policy terms, conditions, benefit structures, coverage limits, and age reduction schedules retrieved from the policy integration.",
>   "6. For unverified policies, the system follows an alternate integration path:",
>   "   6.1 At Loss level: integrates only policy summary and coverage information without detailed benefit structures.",
>   "   6.2 At Settlement level: integrates policy summary and benefit information through specialized unverified policy transformations.",
>   "7. The system applies configurable applicability rules to validate losses against policy terms and finalize loss determinations.",
>   "8. The system enables claim handlers to select applicable coverages from the list of policy benefits defined for critical illness master and individual policies.",
>   "9. The system maps detailed benefit attributes from policy benefit structures to settlement benefit information based on configured benefit level mappings.",
>   "10. The system validates integrated policy data post-mapping to ensure data integrity and completeness before proceeding with claim processing."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** an Event Case is being created with a valid loss date and insured registry ID, **When** the createCase command is triggered, **Then** the system retrieves indexed policy summary information and populates policy data into the Event Case entity within 3 seconds.",
>   "2. **Given** a Loss is being created in the ClaimWrapper domain, **When** the createLoss command is triggered with a valid policy ID, **Then** the system resolves the full policy image and maps all policy data (summary, coverage, eligibility, age reduction, benefit structure) into the ClaimWrapper policy entity.",
>   "3. **Given** policy integration occurs at Loss creation, **When** the policy data is mapped, **Then** all required policy attributes are stored in CapClaimWrapperEntity including: masterPolicyId, policyNumber, productCd, policyPackageCd, policyPlanCd, riskStateCd, policyStatus, txEffectiveDate, term, and isVerified flag.",
>   "4. **Given** a Settlement is being adjudicated, **When** the adjudicateSettlement command is triggered, **Then** the system resolves policy data and maps policy summary, coverage, and benefit information into the Settlement policy entity for benefit calculation.",
>   "5. **Given** policy data is available in the Settlement entity, **When** benefit calculation is performed, **Then** the system calculates gross and payable amounts based on policy face value, benefit structures, coverage limits, and age reduction schedules with 100% accuracy to policy terms.",
>   "6. **Given** an unverified policy is being integrated at Loss level, **When** the alternate unverified policy flow is triggered, **Then** the system integrates only summary and coverage information without detailed benefit structures using the CapLifeUnverifiedPolicyToClaimWrapper transformation.",
>   "7. **Given** an unverified policy is being integrated at Settlement level, **When** the alternate unverified policy flow is triggered, **Then** the system integrates summary and benefit information using the CapLifeUnverifiedPolicyToCISettlement transformation.",
>   "8. **Given** policy search indexing is configured, **When** a policy search is initiated during Event Case creation, **Then** the system uses index/version transformations (IndToPolicyVersion, MasterToPolicyVersion, UPToPolicyVersion) and search projection transformations (MasterPolicySearchHeader, IndPolicySearchHeader, LifeIndividualPolicySearchHeader, UPSearchHeader) to retrieve policy data.",
>   "9. **Given** benefit configuration is defined in OpenL _api_life_coverage_based.xls, **When** coverages are being populated, **Then** the system uses the 'CI Coverage List' sheet to determine which policy benefits are available for claim based on the Path of Available Indicator column.",
>   "10. **Given** benefit attribute mapping is configured in OpenL, **When** settlement benefit information is being populated, **Then** the system uses the 'CI Coverage Config' sheet to map detailed attributes from policy benefits to settlement capBenefitInfo based on Benefit Level Mapping column.",
>   "11. **Given** a policy cannot be resolved during Loss or Settlement creation, **When** the policy resolution fails, **Then** the system displays an error message indicating policy integration failure and prevents further claim processing until policy data is available.",
>   "12. **Given** policy validation rules are configured in OpenL _api_claim_wrapper_eligibility.xlsx, **When** policy data mapping is completed, **Then** the system validates all integrated policy data and flags any data integrity issues before allowing claim processing to continue.",
>   "13. **Given** multiple policy types (CIMaster, CIIndividual) are supported, **When** policy integration is performed, **Then** the system correctly routes to the appropriate transformation based on policy type and applies type-specific mapping logic.",
>   "14. **Given** MS application configuration is properly set in policy-api-config-override.properties, **When** policy API calls are made, **Then** the system successfully connects to the configured policy service URLs and endpoints for CIMaster and CIIndividual policy types.",
>   "15. **Given** policy-support-override.properties is configured with supported models, **When** a claim of type ClaimWrapper, CILoss, or CISettlement is created, **Then** the system correctly identifies the supported policy models (CIMaster, CIIndividual) and executes the appropriate policy integration flow."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view policy and coverage information on the claim UI, so that I have visibility into policy details during claim adjudication
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view policy and coverage information on the claim UI during the claim lifecycle
- **Value**: I have comprehensive visibility into policy details, coverage limits, beneficiaries, and benefit structures necessary for accurate claim adjudication and coverage investigation

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view policy and coverage information on the claim UI during the claim lifecycle,
> **so that** I have comprehensive visibility into policy details, coverage limits, beneficiaries, and benefit structures necessary for accurate claim adjudication and coverage investigation.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. **Event Case Level Policy Integration**: Upon event case creation, the system searches indexed policies and maps summary data to the Event Case, providing initial policy context at the earliest stage of claim intake.",
>   "2. **Claim Loss Level Policy Integration**: During loss creation, the system resolves the full policy image and maps detailed policy data including:",
>   "  2.1. Policy summary information (master policy ID, policy number, package code, plan code, product code, policy type, term, status)",
>   "  2.2. Coverage lists filtered by loss event type (accelerated loss events show only accelerated coverage; death events show only death coverage; accidental dismemberment events show only accidental dismemberment coverage; premium waiver events show only premium waiver coverage)",
>   "  2.3. Policy-claim coverage mapper creation to link policy coverages with claim coverages",
>   "  2.4. Calculated face value displayed on the UI for adjuster review",
>   "  2.5. Default values for Benefit Period and Elimination Period of Premium Waiver",
>   "  2.6. Benefit structures, age reduction details, eligibility information, and insured/beneficiary data",
>   "3. **Settlement Level Policy Integration**: During settlement adjudication for Death, Accelerated, Accidental Dismemberment, and Premium Waiver settlements, the system resolves policy image and maps data to calculate gross and payable settlement amounts based on policy terms and benefit configurations.",
>   "4. **Unverified Policy Handling**: When processing unverified policies, the system applies specialized transformation logic at both ClaimWrapper and Settlement levels, marking data with unverified indicators while still enabling claim processing to continue.",
>   "5. **Coverage Selection and Filtering**: The system enforces business rules that restrict available coverages based on loss event type, ensuring adjusters only see relevant coverage options for the specific claim scenario.",
>   "6. **Policy Data Indexing and Search**: The system maintains indexed policy data for master policies, individual certificates, and unverified policies, enabling rapid retrieval during claim processing through policy search APIs.",
>   "7. **Extensible Product Line Support**: The integration framework supports extension to additional product lines through configuration updates, new transformation mappings, and OpenL rule configurations without core system changes."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** an Event Case is being created for a term life claim, **When** the system searches for applicable policies, **Then** policy summary data (master policy ID, policy number, product code, status) is mapped to the Event Case within 3 seconds.",
>   "2. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is creating a loss for an accelerated benefits event, **When** the ClaimWrapper is created, **Then** only accelerated coverages are displayed in the coverage selection list, excluding death, accidental dismemberment, and premium waiver coverages.",
>   "3. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is creating a loss for a death event, **When** the ClaimWrapper is created, **Then** only death coverages are displayed in the coverage selection list, excluding accelerated, accidental dismemberment, and premium waiver coverages.",
>   "4. **Given** a ClaimWrapper is being created for a verified policy, **When** the system retrieves policy data, **Then** comprehensive policy information including benefit structures, age reduction details, eligibility, insureds, and beneficiaries is mapped to CapClaimWrapperPolicyInfoEntity and displayed on the claim UI.",
>   "5. **Given** a ClaimWrapper is being created for a term life policy, **When** the system calculates face value, **Then** the calculated face value is displayed on the claim UI for adjuster review without manual calculation required.",
>   "6. **Given** a Premium Waiver loss is being processed, **When** the system maps policy data, **Then** default values for Benefit Period and Elimination Period are populated from the policy and displayed on the UI.",
>   "7. **Given** a settlement is being adjudicated (Death, Accelerated, Accidental Dismemberment, or Premium Waiver), **When** the settlement calculation is triggered, **Then** the system resolves the current policy image and applies policy terms to calculate gross and payable amounts within 5 seconds.",
>   "8. **Given** an unverified policy is associated with a claim, **When** the ClaimWrapper or Settlement is processed, **Then** the system applies unverified policy transformation logic, marks the policy data with @UnverifiedPolicy indicator, and allows claim processing to continue.",
>   "9. **Given** a Claims Adjuster views the claim UI, **When** policy and coverage information has been integrated, **Then** all policy attributes (masterPolicyId, masterPolicyNumber, policyPackageCd, policyPlanCd, coverageCd, benefitStructures) are visible without requiring navigation to external policy systems.",
>   "10. **Given** a policy search is executed during claim processing, **When** the search includes term life policy models (GTLMaster, TLIndividual, CapLifeUnverifiedPolicy), **Then** relevant policies are returned within 2 seconds using indexed search projections.",
>   "11. **Given** policy-api-config-override.properties is configured with GTLMaster and TLIndividual application URLs and API endpoints, **When** the system attempts policy integration, **Then** policy data is successfully retrieved from configured policy applications without connection errors.",
>   "12. **Given** policy-support-override.properties maps term life policy products to supported loss and settlement models, **When** a claim is created for a mapped product, **Then** the system enables policy integration for all supported loss types (DeathLoss, AcceleratedLoss, AccidentalDismembermentLoss, PremiumWaiverLoss) and settlement types.",
>   "13. **Given** OpenL configuration '_api_life_coverage_based.xls' defines coverage availability indicators, **When** a Claims Adjuster selects coverages for a specific loss event, **Then** only coverages marked as available for that event type are selectable in the UI.",
>   "14. **Given** a policy has no active coverages for the loss event type, **When** the Claims Adjuster attempts to create a loss, **Then** the system displays an appropriate message indicating no applicable coverages are available.",
>   "15. **Given** policy data has been mapped to CapClaimWrapperPolicyInfoEntity, **When** the Claims Adjuster saves and exits the claim, **Then** all mapped policy data persists and is retrievable when the claim is reopened."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want the system to apply age reduction rules and benefit structures from policy, so that benefit calculations reflect applicable policy modifications
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: retrieve and apply age reduction rules and benefit structures from verified or unverified Hospital Indemnity policies to claim settlements
- **Value**: benefit calculations accurately reflect applicable policy modifications and coverage terms, ensuring correct claim adjudication and payment amounts

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** retrieve and apply age reduction rules and benefit structures from verified or unverified Hospital Indemnity policies to claim settlements,
> **so that** benefit calculations accurately reflect applicable policy modifications and coverage terms, ensuring correct claim adjudication and payment amounts.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. The system retrieves policy summary information during event case creation by searching indexed policies using indicated date and registryIds, then transforms and maps policy data into CapEventCase.CapPolicyInfoEntity.
> 2. During loss creation (createLoss command), the system resolves the full policy image using stored policyId and maps comprehensive policy data including summary, coverage, and eligibility information into ClaimWrapper.CapClaimWrapperPolicyInfoEntity.
>    2.1 For unverified policies during loss creation, the system integrates summary and coverage information only, excluding benefit details, using entities marked with @UnverifiedPolicy annotation.
> 3. During settlement adjudication (adjudicateSettlement command), the system resolves the full policy image and maps policy data including summary, coverage, and benefit information into HISettlement.CapHISettlementPolicyInfoEntity.
>    3.1 For unverified policies during settlement adjudication, the system integrates summary and benefit information through specialized transformation mappings.
> 4. The system applies age reduction rules retrieved from policy coverage information, including age codes and reduction percentages, to calculate adjusted benefit amounts.
> 5. The system utilizes benefit structure configurations from policies, including benefit type codes, increment amounts, maximum/minimum benefit amounts, approved amounts, and rounding methods for settlement calculations.
> 6. The system maps policy eligibility parameters including waiting period amounts, waiting period mode codes, eligibility type codes, and waiting period definitions to validate claim coverage.
> 7. The system provides claim handlers with policy coverage lists derived from master and individual policy benefits, enabling appropriate coverage selection for loss events.
> 8. The system calculates gross and potential payable amounts based on policy face values, benefit structures, age reduction rules, and other policy terms integrated during the adjudication phase.
> 9. The system supports extension to additional product lines (e.g., Group Term Life) through configuration of applicability rules, lookups, and development of product-specific transformation mappings.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an event case is being created for a Hospital Indemnity claim, **When** the createCase command is executed with indicated date and registryIds, **Then** the system searches indexed policies and populates CapEventCase.CapPolicyInfoEntity with policy summary information including masterPolicyId, policyNumber, productCd, policyStatus, and riskStateCd within 5 seconds.
> 2. **Given** a ClaimWrapper loss is being created with a valid policyId, **When** the createLoss command executes, **Then** the system resolves the full policy image and maps policy summary, coverage, and eligibility data into CapClaimWrapperPolicyInfoEntity including capCoverageInfo with isAgeReductionApplied flag, benefitStructures, ageReductionDetails, and eligibility parameters.
>    2.1 **Given** the policy is unverified during loss creation, **When** the mapping occurs, **Then** the system includes only summary and coverage information, excludes benefit details, and marks entities with @UnverifiedPolicy annotation.
> 3. **Given** an HISettlement is being adjudicated with a valid policyId, **When** the adjudicateSettlement command executes, **Then** the system resolves the full policy image and maps policy summary, coverage, and benefit information into HISettlement.CapHISettlementPolicyInfoEntity.
>    3.1 **Given** the policy is unverified during settlement adjudication, **When** the mapping occurs, **Then** the system includes summary and benefit information using CapLifeUnverifiedPolicyToHISettlement transformation.
> 4. **Given** a policy has age reduction rules defined with specific age codes and reduction percentages, **When** settlement adjudication calculates benefits, **Then** the system applies the age reduction rules from CapAgeReductionDetailsEntity (ageCd, reducedToCd) and correctly adjusts benefit amounts accordingly.
> 5. **Given** a policy benefit structure includes incrementAmount, maxBenefitAmount, minBenefitAmount, benefitAmount, and roundingMethod, **When** the system calculates settlement amounts, **Then** the gross and potential payable amounts reflect all benefit structure parameters from CapCoverageBenefitStructuresEntity.
> 6. **Given** a policy has eligibility parameters including waitingPeriodAmount and waitingPeriodModeCd, **When** a claim is processed, **Then** the system validates claim coverage against CapEligibilityEntity parameters and blocks adjudication if eligibility conditions are not met.
> 7. **Given** OpenL configuration file _api_life_coverage_based.xls contains HI Coverage List with policy benefit mappings, **When** a claim handler views available coverages, **Then** the system displays only those policy benefits marked as available for the specific package code, plan code, and policy benefit code combination.
> 8. **Given** policy-support-override.properties maps HIMaster and HIIndividual products to ClaimWrapper, HILoss, and HISettlement models, **When** the system processes a claim for these products, **Then** policy integration executes across all three phases (event case, loss creation, settlement adjudication) without configuration errors.
> 9. **Given** policy-api-config-override.properties contains invalid or unreachable policy application URLs, **When** the system attempts policy integration during any phase, **Then** the system logs a clear error message indicating the failed policy endpoint and prevents incomplete data mapping.
> 10. **Given** a Hospital Indemnity policy has multiple insureds with isMain flags, **When** policy data is mapped to ClaimWrapper, **Then** the system correctly populates insureds collection in CapInsuredInfo with accurate registryTypeId and isMain indicator for each insured.
> 11. **Given** the system is being extended to support Group Term Life products, **When** configuration is added to life-policy-support-override.properties and CapLifeUnverifiedPolicy settings are included, **Then** the system processes Group Term Life claims using appropriate transformation mappings without impacting Hospital Indemnity claim processing.

#### Feature: As a System Administrator, I want to configure policy application URLs and API endpoints for each product line, so that the claim system can retrieve policy data from the correct policy microservices
- **Role**: System Administrator
- **Action**: configure policy application URLs and API endpoints for each product line
- **Value**: the claim system can retrieve policy data from the correct policy microservices and support multi-stage claim processing across different insurance products

**Description:**

> **As a** System Administrator,
> **I want to** configure policy application URLs and API endpoints for each product line,
> **so that** the claim system can retrieve policy data from the correct policy microservices and support multi-stage claim processing across different insurance products.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. Administrator configures policy application URLs for each product line model in policy-api-config-override.properties, mapping product identifiers (e.g., CIMaster, CIIndividual) to their respective microservice endpoints.",
>   "2. Administrator configures API endpoint links for policy entity retrieval, specifying the REST API paths for accessing policy data from each product line application.",
>   "3. Administrator configures the CAP (cross-domain) policy search API link to enable unified policy search across all product lines.",
>   "4. Administrator specifies which claim entities (ClaimWrapper, Loss types, Settlement types) should integrate with each policy product model through policy-support-override.properties configuration.",
>   "5. System establishes three-stage policy integration workflow:",
>   "  5.1. Event Case Creation: System searches indexed policies by date and registry IDs, retrieves policy summary information, and maps it into Event Case policy attributes.",
>   "  5.2. Loss Creation: System resolves full policy image using stored policy ID and maps comprehensive policy data (summary, coverage, eligibility, age reduction, benefit structure) into ClaimWrapper-level policy attributes.",
>   "  5.3. Settlement Adjudication: System resolves full policy image and maps policy data (summary, coverage, benefit) into Settlement-level policy attributes to calculate gross and payable amounts based on policy terms.",
>   "6. System handles alternate policy scenarios:",
>   "  6.1. Unverified Policies: System uses alternate transformation files that integrate limited policy information (summary and coverage only at ClaimWrapper level; summary and benefit at Settlement level) with separate configuration entries.",
>   "  6.2. Master vs Certificate Policies: System applies different transformation files based on policy type (Master or Individual/Certificate) to map appropriate policy attributes.",
>   "  6.3. Multiple Product Lines: Administrator can extend configuration to additional product lines (e.g., Life, Term Life) through product-specific configuration files (life-policy-support-override.properties).",
>   "7. Administrator configures policy search indexing and projection to include product-specific policy models, ensuring proper policy discovery during Event Case creation.",
>   "8. For local development environments, administrator configures docker environment files with policy application and deployer image information to enable testing with mocked policy data.",
>   "9. Administrator maintains OpenL configuration spreadsheets to define which policy benefits are available for claim processing and how policy benefit attributes map to settlement calculations for coverage-based functionality.",
>   "10. System validates policy integration configuration during ClaimWrapper creation through eligibility rules and runs applicability rules to initiate and finalize losses based on retrieved policy information."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** an administrator configures policy application URLs in policy-api-config-override.properties, **when** the claim system attempts to retrieve policy data, **then** the system successfully connects to the correct microservice endpoint for each configured product line.",
>   "2. **Given** multiple product lines are configured (e.g., CIMaster and CIIndividual), **when** an Event Case is created with a policy from a specific product line, **then** the system uses the correct API endpoint to retrieve that policy's information.",
>   "3. **Given** a policy-support-override configuration maps a product model to specific claim entities, **when** a Loss or Settlement is created, **then** the system retrieves and maps policy data only for the configured entity types (ClaimWrapper, Loss, Settlement).",
>   "4. **Given** an Event Case is created, **when** policy search executes, **then** the system retrieves and maps policy summary information into CapEventCase policy attributes within expected response time.",
>   "5. **Given** a Loss creation command is executed, **when** the system resolves the full policy image, **then** comprehensive policy data including coverage, eligibility, age reduction, and benefit structure are mapped into ClaimWrapper-level policy attributes.",
>   "6. **Given** a Settlement adjudication command is executed, **when** the system resolves the full policy image, **then** policy data including summary, coverage, and benefit information are mapped into Settlement-level policy attributes and used for benefit calculation.",
>   "7. **Given** an unverified policy scenario, **when** the administrator configures the unverified policy model in policy-support-override.properties, **then** the system uses alternate transformation files that integrate limited policy information (summary and coverage only).",
>   "8. **Given** both Master and Certificate policies exist, **when** policy integration occurs, **then** the system applies the correct transformation files based on policy type (Master vs Individual/Certificate).",
>   "9. **Given** policy search indexing is configured for a product line, **when** policies are indexed, **then** the policy models are correctly projected and searchable during Event Case creation.",
>   "10. **Given** OpenL coverage configuration is maintained, **when** a Settlement is adjudicated, **then** the system correctly maps policy benefit attributes to settlement calculations according to the configured coverage mappings.",
>   "11. **Given** an invalid or unreachable policy application URL is configured, **when** the system attempts policy retrieval, **then** the system returns appropriate error messages indicating connectivity failure without system crash.",
>   "12. **Given** a new product line needs to be added, **when** the administrator adds the product configuration to policy-api-config-override.properties and policy-support-override.properties, **then** the claim system can retrieve policy data from the new product line without code changes.",
>   "13. **Given** local development environment is configured with docker policy.yml, **when** the CAP mock application is deployed, **then** mocked policy data can be created and retrieved through the 'write' endpoint for testing purposes.",
>   "14. **Given** eligibility validation rules are configured in OpenL, **when** ClaimWrapper is created post-policy mapping, **then** the system validates the integrated policy data according to configured eligibility rules.",
>   "15. **Given** a product line requires a product-specific configuration file (e.g., life-policy-support-override.properties), **when** the configuration is applied, **then** the system correctly applies product-specific settings without affecting other product line configurations."
> ]

#### Feature: As a System Administrator, I want to configure supported loss and settlement models for each product in policy support configuration, so that policy validation correctly identifies applicable claim models
- **Role**: System Administrator
- **Action**: configure supported loss and settlement models for each product in policy support configuration
- **Value**: policy validation correctly identifies applicable claim models and enables seamless policy-to-claim integration across event case creation, loss processing, and settlement adjudication

**Description:**

> **As a** System Administrator,
> **I want to** configure supported loss and settlement models for each product in policy support configuration,
> **so that** policy validation correctly identifies applicable claim models and enables seamless policy-to-claim integration across event case creation, loss processing, and settlement adjudication.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System administrator configures policy support mappings that establish relationships between policy products and supported claim models.
>    1.1 For verified policies, administrator maps policy products (e.g., GTLMaster, TLIndividual) to supported loss models (DeathLoss, AcceleratedLoss, AccidentalDismembermentLoss, PremiumWaiverLoss) and settlement models (DeathSettlement, AcceleratedSettlement, AccidentalDismembermentSettlement, PremiumWaiverSettlement).
>    1.2 For unverified policies, administrator ensures CapLifeUnverifiedPolicy includes same model values as verified policy mappings to maintain processing consistency.
>    1.3 Administrator configures policy application URLs and API entity links to enable policy data retrieval during claim processing.
> 2. During Event Case Creation phase, system leverages configuration to search indexed policies and populate policy summary information into the event case.
>    2.1 System executes policy search by indicated date and registry identifiers based on configured policy models.
>    2.2 System transforms and maps policy summary information using configured transformation mappings.
> 3. During Loss Creation phase, system utilizes configuration to resolve full policy image and map policy data into claim wrapper attributes.
>    3.1 System maps policy data including summary information, coverage, eligibility, age reduction, and benefit structure based on configured transformations.
>    3.2 For unverified policies, system applies alternate transformation logic that excludes benefit details at loss level.
>    3.3 System restricts coverage selection options to current loss events based on configured loss-to-coverage relationships.
> 4. During Settlement Adjudication phase, system applies configuration to map policy data into settlement-specific entities.
>    4.1 System resolves policy data and maps summary information and benefit details to corresponding settlement types based on configured settlement model mappings.
>    4.2 Each settlement type (Death, Accelerated, Accidental Dismemberment, Premium Waiver) uses distinct transformation configurations.
>    4.3 For unverified policies, system includes benefit details during settlement adjudication using alternate transformation mappings.
> 5. System enables coverage-based processing capabilities through configuration.
>    5.1 Administrator configures which policy benefits are available for claim processing and validation through OpenL coverage list settings.
>    5.2 Administrator defines detailed attribute mapping from policy benefits to settlement benefit information through OpenL coverage configuration.
>    5.3 System executes applicability rules, calculates gross amounts and potential payable amounts based on configured policy-to-claim mappings.
> 6. Configuration supports extensibility to additional product lines through modification of applicability rules, transformation mappings, and coverage-based lookup tables.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a system administrator configures policy-support-override.properties with GTLMaster mapped to DeathLoss, ClaimWrapper, and DeathSettlement models, **When** an event case is created for a GTLMaster policy, **Then** the system successfully searches and retrieves the policy, populates policy summary information into the event case, and enables creation of DeathLoss with appropriate settlement options.
> 2. **Given** policy application URLs and API links are configured in policy-api-config-override.properties, **When** loss creation is initiated, **Then** the system resolves the full policy image within 5 seconds and maps coverage, eligibility, and benefit structure data into ClaimWrapper policy BE attributes without manual intervention.
> 3. **Given** CapLifeUnverifiedPolicy is configured with the same model mappings as verified GTLMaster and TLIndividual policies, **When** a claim is processed against an unverified policy, **Then** the system maps summary and coverage information at loss level (excluding benefit details) and includes benefit details during settlement adjudication using the alternate unverified transformation logic.
> 4. **Given** OpenL TL Coverage List sheet is configured with specific policy benefits marked as available, **When** a user creates a loss for an Accelerated event, **Then** the system restricts coverage selection to only accelerated coverage options and prevents selection of death coverage or unrelated benefits.
> 5. **Given** OpenL TL Coverage Config sheet defines benefit-level mapping from policy to settlement, **When** settlement adjudication is executed, **Then** the system correctly calculates gross amount and potential payable amount based on configured policy face value, age reduction factors, and benefit structure rules.
> 6. **Given** separate settlement transformations are configured for DeathSettlement, AcceleratedSettlement, AccidentalDismembermentSettlement, and PremiumWaiverSettlement, **When** adjudicateSettlement command is invoked for each settlement type, **Then** the system applies the correct transformation mapping and populates settlement-specific policy information entities without data leakage between settlement types.
> 7. **Given** policy search indexing and projection include required term life policy models (IndToPolicyVersion, MasterToPolicyVersion, UPToPolicyVersion), **When** event case creation triggers policy search, **Then** the system returns matching policies within 3 seconds based on indicated date and registry identifiers.
> 8. **Given** ClaimWrapper eligibility validation rules are configured in OpenL '_api_claim_wrapper_eligibility.xlsx', **When** loss creation occurs after policy data mapping, **Then** the system validates integrated policy data and blocks loss creation with inline error messages if eligibility criteria are not met.
> 9. **Given** a policy product is NOT included in policy-support-override.properties model mappings, **When** an attempt is made to create a claim for that policy product, **Then** the system prevents claim creation and displays an error message indicating the product is not supported for claims processing.
> 10. **Given** an administrator modifies policy-support-override.properties to add a new product line (e.g., Critical Illness) with corresponding loss and settlement models, **When** the configuration is deployed and a claim is created for the new product, **Then** the system successfully executes the complete integration flow across event case, loss creation, and settlement adjudication phases using the newly configured mappings.
> 11. **Given** local development environment requires policy mock data, **When** administrator configures /docker/dev/policy.yml with policy app images and invokes CAP mock app 'write' endpoint, **Then** the system creates mocked policies accessible for testing claim-policy integration without dependency on external policy systems.
> 12. **Given** transformation files (CapEventCasePolicyInfo.gtransformation, ClaimWrapperInfo.gtransformation, DeathSettlementInfo.gtransformation, etc.) are properly configured, **When** each integration phase executes, **Then** policy data is accurately transformed and stored in the appropriate entity attributes (CapEventCase.CapPolicyInfoEntity, ClaimWrapper.CapClaimWrapperPolicyInfoEntity, Settlement.CapXXXSettlementPolicyInfoEntity) with data integrity maintained across all phases.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to map policy benefits to settlement benefit information through coverage-based configuration, so that claim adjudication uses correct benefit parameters from policy
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: map policy benefits to settlement benefit information through coverage-based configuration
- **Value**: claim adjudication uses correct benefit parameters from policy

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** map policy benefits to settlement benefit information through coverage-based configuration,
> **so that** claim adjudication uses correct benefit parameters from policy.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. System retrieves and maps policy information through a three-phase progressive integration process aligned to claim lifecycle stages (Event Case, Loss, Settlement).",
>   "2. During Event Case creation phase:",
>   "2.1. System executes applicability rules to validate loss event initiation.",
>   "2.2. System searches indexed policies by indicated date and registryIds to identify applicable policies.",
>   "2.3. System transforms and maps policy summary information into Event Case entity.",
>   "2.4. System populates policyId reference into loss entity for subsequent retrieval.",
>   "2.5. If applicability validation fails, system prevents loss initiation and halts progression to Loss Level Integration.",
>   "3. During ClaimWrapper Loss creation phase:",
>   "3.1. System validates loss event through applicability rules.",
>   "3.2. System resolves full policy image using stored policyId.",
>   "3.3. System retrieves and presents policy coverage lists available for selection and adjudication per loss event.",
>   "3.4. System maps comprehensive policy data (summary information, coverage details, eligibility parameters) into ClaimWrapper policy entity.",
>   "3.5. System consumes policy-inherited validation parameters for claim processing integrity checks.",
>   "3.6. If validation parameters fail (validated via eligibility rules), system prevents loss finalization and halts progression to Settlement Level Integration.",
>   "3.7. For unverified policy scenarios, system applies limited mapping transformation integrating summary and coverage information only.",
>   "4. During Settlement adjudication phase:",
>   "4.1. System finalizes loss when all validation passes.",
>   "4.2. System resolves full policy image by stored policyId.",
>   "4.3. System maps detailed policy data (summary information, coverage details, benefit structures) into Settlement policy entity.",
>   "4.4. System calculates gross amount and potential payable amount based on policy conditions, terms, and benefit parameters.",
>   "4.5. For unverified policy scenarios, system applies alternate transformation integrating summary and benefit information with limited data set.",
>   "5. System maintains configuration-driven benefit mapping through coverage-based OpenL tables that define:",
>   "5.1. Available policy benefits from master/individual policies mapped to claim coverage labels with availability indicators.",
>   "5.2. Attribute-level mapping from policy benefit structures to settlement benefit information entities.",
>   "6. System supports both verified and unverified policy workflows with distinct transformation logic and data mapping rules at Loss and Settlement levels.",
>   "7. System enables extension and customization through defined extension points including policy search logic, gtransformation mappings, coverage configuration tables, and validation rule sets."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. Event Case Level Integration:",
>   "1.1. **Given** a claim handler initiates Event Case creation with valid loss date and insured registryIds, **when** the system executes applicability rules and finds matching indexed policies, **then** the system retrieves policy summary information and populates policyId into the loss entity within 3 seconds.",
>   "1.2. **Given** applicability rules fail during Event Case creation, **when** validation errors are detected, **then** the system prevents loss initiation and displays specific validation failure reasons without creating the Event Case.",
>   "1.3. **Given** multiple policies match the search criteria, **when** policy transformation is triggered, **then** the system maps all applicable policy summary information into CapEventCase.CapPolicyInfoEntity following configured gtransformation rules (CapEventCasePolicyInfo, HIMasterToPolicyInfo, HIIndividualToPolicyInfo).",
>   "2. ClaimWrapper Loss Level Integration:",
>   "2.1. **Given** a loss entity with populated policyId exists, **when** 'createLoss' command is executed, **then** the system resolves full policy image and maps comprehensive policy data (summary, coverage, eligibility) into ClaimWrapper.CapClaimWrapperPolicyInfoEntity within 5 seconds.",
>   "2.2. **Given** policy benefits are configured in 'HI Coverage List' sheet, **when** system retrieves coverage lists, **then** all configured benefits from master/individual policies are presented as available claim coverages with correct availability indicators and mapped labels.",
>   "2.3. **Given** policy-inherited validation parameters are mapped, **when** system executes eligibility validation rules (_api_claim_wrapper_eligibility.xlsx), **then** the system validates all required parameters and only allows loss progression when all validations pass.",
>   "2.4. **Given** validation parameters fail at Loss Level, **when** validation errors are detected, **then** the system prevents loss finalization, displays specific validation failure messages, and does not proceed to Settlement Level Integration.",
>   "2.5. **Given** an unverified policy scenario, **when** 'createLoss' command is executed, **then** the system applies CapLifeUnverifiedPolicyToClaimWrapper.gtransformation and maps only summary and coverage information (limited data set) into ClaimWrapper entity.",
>   "3. Settlement Level Integration:",
>   "3.1. **Given** a validated loss entity exists, **when** 'adjudicateSettlement' command is executed, **then** the system resolves full policy image and maps detailed policy data (summary, coverage, benefit structures) into HISettlement.CapHISettlementPolicyInfoEntity within 5 seconds.",
>   "3.2. **Given** policy benefit structures are mapped from 'HI Coverage Config' sheet, **when** system performs adjudication calculations, **then** gross amount and potential payable amount are calculated accurately based on policy conditions, terms, and mapped benefit parameters with results matching expected calculation formulas.",
>   "3.3. **Given** an unverified policy scenario at Settlement Level, **when** 'adjudicateSettlement' command is executed, **then** the system applies CapLifeUnverifiedPolicyToHISettlement.gtransformation and maps summary and benefit information (limited data set) into Settlement entity.",
>   "3.4. **Given** benefit attribute mapping is configured in 'HI Coverage Config', **when** policy benefits are transformed to settlement capBenefitInfo, **then** all configured attribute mappings are applied correctly and all benefit-level data is populated in settlement entity.",
>   "4. Configuration and Data Model:",
>   "4.1. **Given** MS Application Configuration files are properly configured, **when** system initializes, **then** all policy application URLs (HIMaster, HIIndividual), API link endpoints, and model mappings (ClaimWrapper, HILoss, HISettlement to HIMaster/HIIndividual) are loaded and accessible for policy integration.",
>   "4.2. **Given** OpenL configuration tables (_api_life_coverage_based.xls) are modified, **when** system processes policy integration, **then** updated benefit mappings and coverage configurations are applied immediately without requiring application restart.",
>   "4.3. **Given** policy integration completes at any level, **when** data is persisted, **then** all policy attributes are stored in CapClaimWrapperEntity (not individual Loss entities) following the defined data model structure with proper entity relationships (CapClaimWrapperPolicyInfoEntity, CapInsuredInfo, CapClaimWrapperCoverageInfoEntity, etc.).",
>   "5. Extension and Customization:",
>   "5.1. **Given** additional policy attributes need to be mapped, **when** gtransformation files (HIMasterToClaimWrapper, HIIndividualToClaimWrapper, HIMasterToHISettlement, HIIndividualToHISettlement) are modified, **then** new attributes are successfully mapped to ClaimWrapper and HISettlement policy BE attributes and available in claim processing.",
>   "5.2. **Given** new benefits are added to OpenL 'HI Coverage List' sheet, **when** loss creation is executed, **then** newly configured benefits appear in coverage selection lists with correct availability indicators and mappings.",
>   "5.3. **Given** custom validation rules are added to _api_claim_wrapper_eligibility.xlsx, **when** Loss Level Integration processes policy data, **then** custom validation rules are executed post-mapping and enforce defined business constraints.",
>   "6. Negative Scenarios:",
>   "6.1. **Given** policyId cannot be resolved at Loss or Settlement Level, **when** system attempts to retrieve full policy image, **then** system displays error message indicating policy retrieval failure and prevents progression to next phase.",
>   "6.2. **Given** required policy benefit information is missing in policy system, **when** benefit mapping is attempted, **then** system logs mapping errors and applies default/null handling logic without system crash.",
>   "6.3. **Given** policy search indexing is incomplete or corrupted, **when** Event Case creation attempts policy search, **then** system displays appropriate error message indicating indexing issue and prevents incorrect policy association."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to verify policy eligibility criteria including waiting periods and eligibility types, so that I can determine if a claim meets policy requirements
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: verify policy eligibility criteria including waiting periods and eligibility types, and integrate policy information across event case, loss, and settlement processes
- **Value**: I can determine if a claim meets policy requirements and accurately adjudicate critical illness claims based on complete policy terms, coverages, and benefit structures

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** verify policy eligibility criteria including waiting periods and eligibility types, and integrate policy information across event case, loss, and settlement processes,
> **so that** I can determine if a claim meets policy requirements and accurately adjudicate critical illness claims based on complete policy terms, coverages, and benefit structures.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. **Event Case Creation - Initial Policy Discovery**: System searches and retrieves matching policies by indicated date and registry IDs when event case is created, then maps policy summary information into the event case entity through policy transformation logic.
>
> 2. **Loss Creation - Comprehensive Policy Integration**: Upon loss creation, system resolves the full policy image and maps extensive policy data into ClaimWrapper including:
>    - Policy summary information (policy numbers, IDs, product codes, status, term)
>    - Coverage details with age reduction rules and benefit structures
>    - Eligibility rules (waiting period amount, waiting period mode, eligibility type, waiting period definition)
>    - Benefit structure (benefit types, amounts, multiples, rounding methods)
>    - Insured and beneficiary information
>    2.1. **Alternate Flow - Unverified Policy at Loss**: When unverified policy is used, system applies modified transformation that integrates summary and coverage information only, excluding detailed benefit data.
>    2.2. System applies additional validation rules after policy mapping completes to ensure integrated policy data meets business requirements.
>
> 3. **Coverage Availability Determination**: System evaluates which policy benefits are available for claim based on configured conditions including relationship to participant, package code, plan code, policy coverage code, policy benefit code, and covered condition indicators.
>
> 4. **Settlement Adjudication - Benefit Calculation**: Upon settlement adjudication, system resolves policy image again and maps policy data including detailed benefit parameters (benefit amounts, time period codes, maximum benefit numbers, lifetime maximum benefit amount percentages) to enable calculation of gross amount and potential payable amount.
>    4.1. **Alternate Flow - Unverified Policy at Settlement**: When unverified policy is used during settlement, system applies alternate transformation integrating summary and benefit information only.
>
> 5. **Policy Verification Status Handling**: System distinguishes between verified and unverified policies throughout the claim lifecycle, applying appropriate data mapping and validation rules based on verification status.
>
> 6. **Eligibility Criteria Validation**: System verifies waiting periods, eligibility types, and waiting period definitions against policy terms to determine claim eligibility and coverage applicability.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an event case is created with valid indicated date and registry IDs, **When** the system invokes policy search, **Then** matching master or individual policies are retrieved and policy summary information is populated into the event case entity within the expected timeframe.
>
> 2. **Given** a loss is created for a critical illness claim with verified policy, **When** the system performs policy integration, **Then** ClaimWrapper entity contains complete policy information including:
>    - Policy identification (master policy ID, policy numbers, policy type)
>    - Coverage details with age reduction flags and details
>    - Eligibility rules (waiting period amount, mode code, eligibility type code, definition code)
>    - Benefit structures with amounts, multiples, and rounding methods
>    - Insured collection with main insured indicator and registry type IDs
>
> 3. **Given** a loss is created with unverified policy, **When** the system performs policy integration, **Then** ClaimWrapper contains summary and coverage information only, without detailed benefit data, and is marked with unverified status.
>
> 4. **Given** policy data is mapped into ClaimWrapper, **When** additional validation rules are executed, **Then** all eligibility criteria including waiting periods and eligibility types are validated against configured business rules, and validation failures produce specific error messages.
>
> 5. **Given** a settlement requires adjudication, **When** the system resolves policy information, **Then** settlement entity contains policy summary, coverage details, and benefit details including benefit amount, time period code, maximum benefit number, and lifetime maximum benefit amount percentage.
>
> 6. **Given** coverage availability logic is configured in OpenL table, **When** the system evaluates benefit applicability, **Then** only benefits meeting configured conditions (relationship to participant, package code, plan code, policy coverage code, policy benefit code) are marked as available for the claim.
>
> 7. **Given** benefit attribute mapping is configured in OpenL table, **When** the system maps policy benefits to settlement, **Then** benefit level parameters are accurately transferred to settlement benefit info fields including benefit amounts, time periods, and maximum benefit numbers.
>
> 8. **Given** a settlement is adjudicated with complete policy integration, **When** the system calculates payable amounts, **Then** gross amount and potential payable amount are computed based on integrated policy conditions, benefit structures, and age reduction rules.
>
> 9. **Given** policy application URLs and API links are configured, **When** the system attempts to retrieve policy data during any integration point, **Then** the system successfully connects to the configured CI Master or CI Individual application endpoints.
>
> 10. **Negative Scenario - Given** policy cannot be found during event case creation, **When** the system completes policy search, **Then** event case is created without policy information and appropriate indicators are set for manual policy association.
>
> 11. **Negative Scenario - Given** waiting period has not been satisfied, **When** eligibility validation is performed at loss creation, **Then** system flags the eligibility violation and prevents automatic claim initiation or presents validation warnings to the adjuster.
>
> 12. **Negative Scenario - Given** eligibility type code does not match policy requirements, **When** eligibility validation is executed, **Then** system produces validation error identifying the specific eligibility type mismatch and required criteria.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to identify main insureds and other insureds from policy information, so that I can correctly determine coverage applicability for each party
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: integrate comprehensive policy information (including main insureds, other insureds, coverages, benefits, and eligibility details) from master and certificate policies throughout the claims lifecycle
- **Value**: I can correctly determine coverage applicability for each party, perform accurate adjudication, and make informed settlement decisions based on validated policy terms and conditions

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** integrate comprehensive policy information (including main insureds, other insureds, coverages, benefits, and eligibility details) from master and certificate policies throughout the claims lifecycle,
> **so that** I can correctly determine coverage applicability for each party, perform accurate adjudication, and make informed settlement decisions based on validated policy terms and conditions.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. During Event Case Intake, the system searches for applicable policies using the indicated date and registry IDs, then transforms and maps policy summary information into the Event Case entity.
> 2. Upon Loss Creation within the ClaimWrapper domain, the system resolves the full policy image and maps comprehensive policy data including policy summary, coverage, eligibility, age reduction, and benefit structure into ClaimWrapper policy attributes (not individual loss entities).
> 3. During Coverage Selection, the system retrieves and displays available coverage options restricted to the current loss event, ensuring accelerated losses can only add accelerated coverage and death losses can only add death coverage.
> 4. Throughout Settlement Adjudication for all settlement types (Death, Accelerated, Accidental Dismemberment, Premium Waiver), the system resolves full policy images and maps relevant policy data into settlement-specific policy information entities.
> 5. The system performs automated Face Value calculations based on integrated policy data and displays results on the UI for adjuster review.
> 6. The system calculates gross amounts and potential payable amounts based on policy conditions, terms, benefit structures, and configured business rules.
> 7. The system defaults values for Benefit Period and Elimination Period for Premium Waiver settlements based on policy terms.
> 8. The system enables adjuster viewing of comprehensive policy and coverage information directly within the Claim UI without requiring navigation to separate policy systems.
> 9. The system validates loss events against integrated term life policy data during ClaimWrapper creation phase to ensure eligibility and compliance.
> 10. The system applies applicability rules to initiate and finalize losses after validation, inheriting validation parameters from policy data.
>   10.1 For Unverified Policy scenarios, the system uses alternative transformation logic to integrate summary and coverage information at the Loss level and settlement level, ensuring claims processing can proceed even when policy verification is pending.
>   10.2 When custom policy search requirements exist, the system supports modification of search behavior to accommodate alternate search criteria while maintaining data integrity.
>   10.3 When additional policy attributes require integration beyond standard configuration, the system supports extension through modified transformation files and OpenL table configurations.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an Event Case is being created **when** the createCase command is executed **then** the system searches indexed policies by indicated date and registryIds within 3 seconds and populates policy summary information into CapEventCase.CapPolicyInfoEntity.
> 2. **Given** a ClaimWrapper Loss is being created **when** the createLoss command is executed **then** the system resolves the full policy image by stored policyId and maps comprehensive policy data (summary, coverage, eligibility, ageReduction, benefitStructure) into ClaimWrapper.CapClaimWrapperPolicyInfoEntity.
> 3. **Given** a Coverage Selection is initiated **when** the adjuster views available coverages **then** the system displays only coverages applicable to the current loss event type (accelerated coverage for accelerated loss, death coverage for death loss).
>   3.1 **Given** configuration exists in OpenL '_api_life_coverage_based.xls' TL Coverage List sheet **when** the system evaluates available benefits **then** only benefits with valid Available Indicator path are displayed as selectable options.
> 4. **Given** a Settlement Adjudication is initiated for any settlement type **when** the adjudicateSettlement command is executed **then** the system resolves full policy image and maps policy data into the corresponding Settlement.CapXXXSettlementPolicyInfoEntity within 2 seconds.
> 5. **Given** policy data has been integrated into ClaimWrapper **when** Face Value calculation is triggered **then** the system calculates and displays the default Face Value on the UI based on policy benefit structure, increment amount, and approved amount.
> 6. **Given** settlement calculation is performed **when** gross amount and potential payable amount are computed **then** the system applies policy conditions including age reduction details, benefit structures, salary multiples, rounding methods, and annual earnings amount.
> 7. **Given** a Premium Waiver settlement is created **when** default values are populated **then** the system automatically defaults Benefit Period and Elimination Period values from integrated policy terms.
> 8. **Given** an adjuster is reviewing a claim **when** they access the Claim UI **then** comprehensive policy and coverage information (policy number, package code, plan code, product code, insureds, coverage details, benefit structures) is visible without requiring external policy system access.
> 9. **Given** loss event validation is required **when** ClaimWrapper creation occurs after policy mapping **then** the system validates the loss event against integrated term life policy data using OpenL '_api_claim_wrapper_eligibility.xlsx' rules.
>   9.1 **Given** validation fails due to eligibility criteria **when** the validation result is returned **then** the system prevents loss creation and displays specific eligibility failure reasons to the adjuster.
> 10. **Given** a policy is marked as unverified **when** ClaimWrapper or Settlement integration occurs **then** the system uses CapLifeUnverifiedPolicyToClaimWrapper.gtransformation and corresponding CapLifeUnverifiedPolicyToXXXSettlement.gtransformation files to integrate summary and coverage/benefit information.
> 11. **Given** a policy search is executed **when** multiple policies match the search criteria **then** the system returns all matching GTLMaster and TLIndividual policies indexed and projected according to configured transformation files.
> 12. **Given** applicability rules are configured **when** a loss is created **then** the system runs applicability rules to initiate the loss and inherits validation parameters from the integrated policy data.
> 13. **Given** additional policy attributes are required beyond standard configuration **when** transformation files and OpenL tables are modified per technical implementation guidelines **then** the system successfully maps and displays the additional attributes in ClaimWrapper and Settlement entities.
> 14. **Given** an Accelerated Loss is being created **when** the adjuster attempts to add coverage **then** the system restricts coverage selection to accelerated coverage only and prevents selection of death or other coverage types.
> 15. **Given** benefit attribute mapping is configured in OpenL '_api_life_coverage_based.xls' TL Coverage Config sheet column 'N' **when** settlement is created **then** the system maps detailed attributes from policy Benefits to settlement capBenefitInfo according to the configuration.

### Epic: Policy System Foundation & Rules Engine

#### Feature: As a System Administrator, I want to configure policy data model attributes for each product line (Life, Disability, Dental, Accident, Pet), so that claim systems can correctly map and retrieve policy information during case creation and claim adjudication.
- **Role**: System Administrator
- **Action**: configure policy data model attributes for each product line (Life, Disability, Dental, Accident, Pet) and establish integration mappings with external policy systems
- **Value**: claim systems can correctly retrieve, map, and transform policy information during case creation, claim adjudication, and settlement processing across all supported product lines

**Description:**

> **As a** System Administrator,
> **I want to** configure policy data model attributes for each product line (Life, Disability, Dental, Accident, Pet) and establish integration mappings with external policy systems,
> **so that** claim systems can correctly retrieve, map, and transform policy information during case creation, claim adjudication, and settlement processing across all supported product lines.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Administrator configures policy data model attributes for each supported product line, including Life policies (ACCIndividual, ACCMaster, CIIndividual, CIMaster, GTLMaster, TLIndividual, GPLUIndividual, HIIndividual, HIMaster), Disability policies (LeaveIndividual, LeaveMaster, STDIndividual, STDMaster with LTD/STD packages, SMPMaster), and Unverified Policies.
> 2. System establishes integration with external policy systems following a standardized pattern: command execution triggers policy data requirement check, missing data invokes policy populator, populator searches applicable policies using context-specific criteria, retrieved data is transformed using model-specific transformation files, and transformed data is stored in target entity.
> 3. For Event Case creation context, system automatically populates policy data when createCase command executes:
>    3.1 System detects policy holder entity lacks policy data during case creation.
>    3.2 System invokes EventCase policy populator using Event Date as the search date parameter.
>    3.3 System routes transformation through CapEventCasePolicyInfo based on Policy Product/Model Name.
>    3.4 Transformation files follow naming convention: &lt;Policy._modelName&gt;ToPolicyInfo (STD policies use &lt;Policy.packageCd&gt;&lt;Policy._modelName&gt;ToPolicyInfo) located in /cap-case-hna-domain/modeling/policy_transformations.
> 4. For Claim/Loss creation context, system populates policy data when createLoss command executes:
>    4.1 For Disability Claims: System invokes CapDisabilityPolicyPopulator using lossDetail.lastWorkDate as search date, resolves policy by capPolicyVersionId if versioned or by capPolicyId with date range validation if unversioned (sorted by policySystemRevisionNo DESC), and routes to disability-specific transformations (CapStdDisabilityPolicyInfo, CapLtdDisabilityPolicyInfo, CapSmpDisabilityPolicyInfo, CapLeaveDisabilityPolicyInfo) following naming convention &lt;Policy._modelName&gt;ToLoss located in /cap-loss-disability-domain/modeling/policy_transformations.
>    4.2 For Life Claims: System invokes CapClaimWrapperPolicyPopulator using lossDetail.claimLossDate as search date, applies same version/date resolution logic as Disability claims, and routes through CapClaimWrapperPolicyInfo.gtransformation following naming convention &lt;Policy._modelName&gt;ToClaimWrapper located in /cap-loss-term-life-domain/modeling/policy_transformation.
> 5. For Settlement adjudication context, system integrates policy data when adjudicateSettlement command executes:
>    5.1 For Disability Settlements: System triggers settlement-specific transformations for CapStdSettlement, CapLtdSettlement, CapSmpSettlement, and CapLeaveSettlement using naming convention &lt;Policy._modelName&gt;To&lt;Settlement._modelName&gt; located in /cap-adjudication-disability-domain/modeling/&lt;SettlementModel&gt;/policy_transformations.
>    5.2 For Life Settlements: System triggers transformations for AcceleratedSettlement, DeathSettlement, CISettlement, HISettlement, AccidentalDismembermentSettlement, and PremiumWaiverSettlement using naming convention &lt;Policy._modelName&gt;To&lt;Settlement._modelName&gt; located in /cap-adjudication-term-life-domain/modeling/&lt;SettlementModel&gt;/policy_transformations.
> 6. Administrator configures policy resolution rules applying consistent date range logic (effTxEffectiveDate  searchDate AND effTxExpirationDate  searchDate) combined with revision number sorting for unversioned policies.
> 7. System maintains segregated transformation file locations by domain (case-hna, loss-disability, loss-term-life, adjudication-disability, adjudication-term-life) to support modular configuration and maintenance.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an administrator configures policy model attributes for Life product line (e.g., GTLMaster), **when** a createCase command executes for a policy holder without policy data, **then** the system invokes CapEventCasePolicyPopulator using Event Date as search parameter and successfully retrieves and transforms policy data within 3 seconds.
> 2. **Given** a policy exists in versioned state with capPolicyVersionId, **when** a createLoss command executes for a Disability claim, **then** the system matches policy by capPolicyVersionId and applies STDMasterToLoss transformation located in /cap-loss-disability-domain/modeling/policy_transformations.
> 3. **Given** a policy exists in unversioned state without capPolicyVersionId, **when** system searches for applicable policy during Life claim creation, **then** the system matches by capPolicyId where effTxEffectiveDate  claimLossDate AND effTxExpirationDate  claimLossDate, sorted by policySystemRevisionNo in descending order, and returns the most recent valid policy version.
> 4. **Given** multiple policy models are configured (STDIndividual with STD package, LeaveMaster, ACCIndividual), **when** createLoss commands execute for corresponding claim types, **then** system routes each to correct transformation file following naming convention: STDSTDIndividualToLoss for STD claims, LeaveMasterToLoss for Leave claims, and ACCIndividualToClaimWrapper for Accident claims.
> 5. **Given** a Disability Settlement requires adjudication, **when** adjudicateSettlement command executes, **then** system triggers CommandListener('Execute', 'adjudicateSettlement') and applies transformation &lt;Policy._modelName&gt;ToCapStdSettlement located in /cap-adjudication-disability-domain/modeling/CapStdSettlement/policy_transformations.
> 6. **Given** an Unverified Policy exists in the system, **when** policy population is triggered in any context (EventCase, Claim, or Settlement), **then** system successfully retrieves and transforms unverified policy data following the same transformation rules as verified policies.
> 7. **Given** transformation files are organized by domain and settlement model, **when** administrator updates a Life Settlement transformation for DeathSettlement, **then** the file is correctly located in /cap-adjudication-term-life-domain/modeling/DeathSettlement/policy_transformations and changes apply only to Death Settlement adjudications without affecting other settlement types.
> 8. **Given** policy data is missing during EventCase creation, **when** policyPopulator.populate() is invoked, **then** system completes policy search, transformation via CapEventCasePolicyInfo.gtransformation, and data storage before createCase command completes execution.
> 9. **Given** a policy model naming convention is defined as &lt;Policy._modelName&gt;To&lt;Settlement._modelName&gt;, **when** system processes settlements for multiple Life products (GTLMaster, TLIndividual, CIMaster), **then** each policy model routes to correctly named transformation file (GTLMasterToDeathSettlement, TLIndividualToDeathSettlement, CIMasterToCISettlement).
> 10. **Given** search date logic varies by context, **when** system processes EventCase (uses Event Date), Disability Claim (uses lastWorkDate), and Life Claim (uses claimLossDate) in sequence, **then** each context applies its designated search date parameter correctly and retrieves appropriate policy versions without cross-contamination of date criteria.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to retrieve applicable policy versions based on loss date and relationship to insured, so that I can adjudicate coverages and benefits accurately for the correct policy period.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: retrieve applicable policy versions based on loss date and relationship to insured
- **Value**: I can adjudicate coverages and benefits accurately for the correct policy period

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** retrieve applicable policy versions based on loss date and relationship to insured,
> **so that** I can adjudicate coverages and benefits accurately for the correct policy period.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. System retrieves policy image for all applicable policies based on the Event Date provided during case creation or other claim lifecycle events.",
>   "1.1. Archived policy versions are automatically excluded from the policy image response.",
>   "2. System locates the applicable policy version using the Date of Loss (DOL) according to claim type-specific business rules.",
>   "2.1. For Cap Absence claims, system applies business rules defined in BR>CapAbsence>Locate Policy Version to determine the applicable policy version.",
>   "2.2. For Cap Non-Absence claims, system applies business rules defined in BR>CapNonAbsence>Locate Policy Version to determine the applicable policy version.",
>   "3. System determines the Relationship to Insured based on claim structure to support coverage adjudication.",
>   "3.1. For CWCP (Claim with Covered Person) scenarios, system derives Relationship to Insured using the Insured Role in Covered Person (CP), which may be Primary Insured, Spouse, or Child.",
>   "3.2. For CWMP (Claim with Member Policy) scenarios, system derives Relationship to Insured from CEM (Customer Entity Management) relationship data.",
>   "4. System performs auto-adjudication or re-adjudication of applicable coverages and benefits based on the located policy version, loss information, and relationship to insured.",
>   "5. Policy integration occurs multiple times throughout the claim lifecycle to ensure current and accurate policy data is available for adjudication decisions."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Scenario 1: Policy Image Retrieval**",
>   "1. Given a claim case is created with a valid Event Date, When the system retrieves the policy image, Then all policies applicable to the Event Date are returned within 3 seconds.",
>   "2. Given policies with archived versions exist, When the system retrieves the policy image, Then archived policy versions are excluded from the response.",
>   "**Scenario 2: Policy Version Location for Cap Absence Claims**",
>   "3. Given a Cap Absence claim with a Date of Loss, When the system locates the applicable policy version, Then the business rules defined in BR>CapAbsence>Locate Policy Version are applied and the correct policy version is identified.",
>   "4. Given a Cap Absence claim with a Date of Loss that falls outside any active policy period, When the system attempts to locate the policy version, Then the system returns a validation error indicating no applicable policy version exists.",
>   "**Scenario 3: Policy Version Location for Cap Non-Absence Claims**",
>   "5. Given a Cap Non-Absence claim with a Date of Loss, When the system locates the applicable policy version, Then the business rules defined in BR>CapNonAbsence>Locate Policy Version are applied and the correct policy version is identified.",
>   "**Scenario 4: Relationship to Insured Determination**",
>   "6. Given a CWCP (Claim with Covered Person) claim, When the system determines Relationship to Insured, Then the Insured Role from the Covered Person (Primary Insured, Spouse, or Child) is used.",
>   "7. Given a CWMP (Claim with Member Policy) claim, When the system determines Relationship to Insured, Then the Relationship data from CEM (Customer Entity Management) is used.",
>   "8. Given the Relationship to Insured cannot be determined from the expected data source, When the system attempts adjudication, Then the system prevents adjudication and displays an error message indicating missing relationship information.",
>   "**Scenario 5: Coverage and Benefit Adjudication**",
>   "9. Given the applicable policy version and Relationship to Insured are successfully determined, When the system performs auto-adjudication, Then coverages and benefits are adjudicated based on the policy terms, loss information, and relationship to insured.",
>   "10. Given policy data changes during the claim lifecycle, When the system re-adjudicates the claim, Then the system retrieves the latest policy information and updates coverage determinations accordingly."
> ]
