#### Feature: As a Claims Examiner, I want to locate the correct policy version based on date of loss and event date, so that claims are created against the appropriate policy version in effect at the time of loss.
- **Role**: Claims Examiner
- **Action**: locate the correct policy version based on date of loss and event date
- **Value**: claims are created against the appropriate policy version in effect at the time of loss

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Examiner,
> **I want to** locate the correct policy version based on date of loss and event date,
> **so that** claims are created against the appropriate policy version in effect at the time of loss.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. System initiates a two-stage policy version location process upon Event Case submission.",
>   "2. **Stage I - Policy Retrieval (triggered by Event Case submission):**",
>   "   2.1. System uses Event Date as initial Date of Loss reference.",
>   "   2.2. System searches for all policies where the Policy's Customer registry ID matches either the Event Case Employer or Event Case Member registry ID, and Event Date is on or after the Policy's Effective Date.",
>   "   2.3. System retrieves all matching policies regardless of policy state.",
>   "   2.4. System groups policy versions by policy number and retrieves only the latest version of each policy.",
>   "   2.5. System filters out policies where Event Date exceeds Policy Term Expiration Date or Cancellation transaction effective date.",
>   "   2.6. **Alternate Flow - Event Date Precedes Policy Effective Date:** If Event Date is before the Policy's Effective Date, system excludes the policy from processing and does not generate a claim under the Event Case.",
>   "3. **Stage II - Policy Version Location (triggered after applicability rule validation passes during claim creation):**",
>   "   3.1. System determines the LOB-specific Date of Loss based on claim type:",
>   "      - Life (TL): Earliest date among Date of Death, Date of Diagnosis, Date of Prescription, or other relevant dates",
>   "      - Critical Illness (CI): Diagnosis Date",
>   "      - Health Insurance (HI): Service Date if available; otherwise Date Range start date. For multiple service items, uses the earliest Service Date or Date Range start date",
>   "      - Accident (ACC): Date of Accident",
>   "   3.2. System searches for the policy version where the effective transaction date is on or before the LOB-specific Date of Loss.",
>   "   3.3. System retrieves the specific policy version applicable for the determined Date of Loss.",
>   "   3.4. **Alternate Flow - Date Mismatch with Policy Effective Date:** If the Claim's Date of Loss is before the Policy's Effective Date (which is before the Event Date), or if the Date of Loss falls within an 'Archived' policy version, system creates the claim but assigns it 'Incomplete' status to flag data inconsistency for manual review.",
>   "   3.5. **Alternate Flow - Multiple Events/Losses in Claim:** If multiple events or losses exist within a single claim:",
>   "      - System uses the earliest Date of Loss among all events to search for the policy version",
>   "      - System validates each individual Date of Loss separately for eligibility determination",
>   "      - Special case: When both Death and Accident events coexist, system applies Accident's waiting period for member effectiveness validation (note: only one TL claim is created despite multiple events)"
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Scenario 1: Standard Policy Version Location**",
>   "1. Given an Event Case is submitted with Event Date of 2024-03-15 and Member registry ID 12345,",
>   "   When the system searches for applicable policies,",
>   "   Then the system retrieves all policies where Customer registry ID matches 12345 or the Employer registry ID, and Policy Effective Date is on or before 2024-03-15, excluding policies with expiration or cancellation dates before 2024-03-15.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 2: LOB-Specific Date of Loss Application**",
>   "2. Given a Health Insurance claim with multiple service items dated 2024-02-10, 2024-02-15, and 2024-02-20,",
>   "   When the system determines the Date of Loss for policy version location,",
>   "   Then the system uses 2024-02-10 (earliest service date) to locate the applicable policy version.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 3: Policy Version Temporal Matching**",
>   "3. Given a Critical Illness claim with Diagnosis Date of 2024-01-20,",
>   "   When the system searches for the policy version,",
>   "   Then the system retrieves the policy version where effTxEffectiveDate is on or before 2024-01-20.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 4: Event Date Precedes Policy Effective Date (Exclusion)**",
>   "4. Given an Event Date of 2024-01-10 and a Policy Effective Date of 2024-01-15,",
>   "   When the system performs Stage I policy retrieval,",
>   "   Then the system excludes this policy from processing and does not generate any claim under the Event Case.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 5: Date of Loss Precedes Policy Effective Date (Incomplete Status)**",
>   "5. Given an Event Date of 2024-02-01, Policy Effective Date of 2024-01-15, and Claim Date of Loss of 2024-01-10,",
>   "   When the system creates the claim,",
>   "   Then the system assigns 'Incomplete' status to the claim to flag the data inconsistency for manual review.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 6: Latest Policy Version Retrieval**",
>   "6. Given multiple versions exist for policy number POL-001 with effective dates 2023-01-01, 2023-06-01, and 2024-01-01,",
>   "   When Stage I policy retrieval is executed with Event Date 2024-03-01,",
>   "   Then the system retrieves only the policy version with effective date 2024-01-01 (latest version).",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 7: Cancellation Date Exclusion**",
>   "7. Given a policy with Cancellation transaction effective date of 2024-02-15 and Event Date of 2024-02-20,",
>   "   When the system performs Stage I filtering,",
>   "   Then the system excludes this policy as Event Date exceeds the Cancellation effective date.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 8: Multiple Events with Earliest Date Logic**",
>   "8. Given a Life claim with Date of Death 2024-03-10 and Date of Diagnosis 2024-02-15,",
>   "   When the system determines the Date of Loss for policy version location,",
>   "   Then the system uses 2024-02-15 (earliest date) to search for the applicable policy version.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 9: Death and Accident Event Coexistence**",
>   "9. Given a claim with both Death event (Date: 2024-03-10) and Accident event (Date: 2024-03-05),",
>   "   When the system validates member effectiveness,",
>   "   Then the system applies the Accident waiting period and creates only one TL claim despite multiple events.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 10: Applicability Rule Prerequisite**",
>   "10. Given Stage I policy retrieval has completed successfully,",
>   "    When applicability rule validation fails,",
>   "    Then the system does not proceed to Stage II policy version location."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Examiner, I want to add special handling attributes (such as Catastrophe) to a claim during intake, so that the claim is flagged for appropriate priority and handling procedures.

#### Feature: As a Claims Examiner, I want to add and manage additional parties (with roles and contact information) to an event case during intake, so that all relevant parties are documented for claim processing.
- **Role**: Claims Examiner
- **Action**: add and manage additional parties (with roles and contact information) to an event case during intake
- **Value**: all relevant parties are documented for claim processing

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Examiner,
> **I want to** add and manage additional parties (with roles and contact information) to an event case during intake,
> **so that** all relevant parties are documented for claim processing.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Claims Examiner accesses the Additional Parties section as part of the multi-step Case Intake wizard (Step 3: Additional Parties).
> 2. Examiner adds parties to the event case by capturing key identifying information including party type, role, name, and contact details (phone, email, address).
> 3. System allows assignment of specific party roles relevant to the event type (e.g., claimant, beneficiary, witness, healthcare provider, employer representative).
> 4. Examiner can add multiple parties with different roles to a single event case as needed for comprehensive documentation.
> 5. System validates that required party information is complete before allowing progression or submission.
> 6. Examiner can edit or remove party information while the case remains in draft or incomplete status.
> 7. Upon case submission via 'Complete Intake', all party information is saved and becomes part of the permanent event case record.
> 8. Party information is made available for downstream claim processing, correspondence generation, and workflow routing.
>
>    8.1 **Alternate Flow - Event Type ADA Work Accommodation**: If the selected event type is ADA - Work Accommodation, the system skips additional information collection requirements and allows progression without mandatory party-specific data entry beyond basic case parties.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the Claims Examiner is on Step 3 (Additional Parties) of the Case Intake wizard, **When** they add a new party, **Then** the system requires at minimum: party role and contact name before allowing save.
> 2. **Given** an event case is in draft status, **When** the Examiner adds multiple parties with different roles, **Then** all parties are saved and displayed in the party list with their assigned roles clearly indicated.
> 3. **Given** the Examiner has entered party information, **When** they click 'Save & Exit', **Then** all party data is persisted and retrievable when the case is reopened within 30 days.
> 4. **Given** required party information is incomplete, **When** the Examiner attempts to click 'Complete Intake', **Then** the system blocks submission and displays inline error messages identifying missing required fields.
> 5. **Given** the event type is ADA - Work Accommodation, **When** the Examiner reaches the additional information step, **Then** the system skips mandatory additional party collection and allows progression to case completion.
> 6. **Given** the Examiner is viewing the Additional Parties section, **When** they edit an existing party's information, **Then** the system saves the updated information and reflects changes immediately in the party list.
> 7. **Given** a party has been added to the case, **When** the Examiner removes the party before case submission, **Then** the system removes the party from the case record without affecting other saved information.
> 8. **Given** the Examiner completes intake with all required party information, **When** the case is submitted, **Then** all party data is available on the Event Case Overview screen and accessible for downstream claim processing workflows.

#### Feature: As a Claims Examiner, I want to upload supporting documents during claim intake and have them automatically organized in the case file, so that all claim evidence is captured and accessible for processing.

- **Action**: upload supporting documents during dental claim intake and have them automatically organized in the case file
- **Value**: all claim evidence is captured and accessible for processing

> [
>   "1. User accesses the Upload Documents screen after completing claim details, services, and optional additional information sections.",

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want the system to automatically assign newly created claims to appropriate claim managers based on authority levels and workload, so that claims are distributed efficiently and consistently.
- **Role**: Claims Operations Manager
- **Action**: configure the system to automatically assign newly created claims to appropriate claim managers based on authority levels, availability, and current workload
- **Value**: claims are distributed efficiently and consistently across the claim management team, preventing bottlenecks and ensuring equitable workload distribution

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Operations Manager,
> **I want to** configure the system to automatically assign newly created claims to appropriate claim managers based on authority levels, availability, and current workload,
> **so that** claims are distributed efficiently and consistently across the claim management team, preventing bottlenecks and ensuring equitable workload distribution.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. System triggers automated claim assignment process immediately upon completion of the claims intake workflow.",
>   "2. System identifies eligible claim managers by evaluating authority qualifications:",
>   "2.1 Validates claim authority type matches the claim being processed.",
>   "2.2 Applies authority level-based assignment rules to filter appropriate managers.",
>   "2.3 Executes OpenL business rules to determine authority-based eligibility.",
>   "3. System filters eligible claim managers based on availability criteria:",
>   "3.1 Verifies user status is 'Active' in the system.",
>   "3.2 Confirms current system date does not fall within any configured unavailability periods for the user.",
>   "4. When no eligible claim managers remain after filtering:",
>   "4.1 System terminates auto-assignment process.",
>   "4.2 Claim is assigned to the 'Claim Management' queue as a fallback for manual distribution.",
>   "5. When exactly one eligible claim manager remains after filtering:",
>   "5.1 System skips workload evaluation step.",
>   "5.2 Claim is assigned directly to both the identified user and the 'Claim Management' queue.",
>   "6. When multiple eligible claim managers remain after filtering:",
>   "6.1 System counts the number of active claims currently assigned to each eligible manager (active status in CMMN across all claim types).",
>   "6.2 System applies load balancing logic by assigning the new claim to the manager with the lowest active claim count.",
>   "6.3 In case of tied claim counts, system assigns to the first user appearing in the filtered list.",
>   "7. Upon successful claim manager identification, system updates all relevant claim records:",
>   "7.1 Updates CMMN claim manager field.",
>   "7.2 Updates Claim Header claim manager field.",
>   "7.3 Assigns the 'New Claim' task to the designated claim manager.",
>   "7.4 Maintains 'claim_management' queue association for both the claim and related tasks.",
>   "8. For claims requiring reassignment after initial creation, system requires manual reassignment action by the current claim manager (auto-assignment logic does not apply)."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Scenario 1: Successful Auto-Assignment with Multiple Eligible Managers**",
>   "1. Given multiple claim managers exist with proper authority for the claim type,",
>   "   And all managers have 'Active' status,",
>   "   And the current date is not within any manager's unavailability period,",
>   "   When the intake process is completed and claim creation is triggered,",
>   "   Then the system assigns the claim to the manager with the fewest active claims,",
>   "   And the CMMN claim manager, Claim Header claim manager, and New Claim task assignee are all updated with the selected manager,",
>   "   And the claim remains associated with the 'claim_management' queue.",
>   "**Scenario 2: Auto-Assignment with Single Eligible Manager**",
>   "2. Given only one claim manager exists with proper authority and availability,",
>   "   When the intake process is completed,",
>   "   Then the system skips the workload evaluation step,",
>   "   And assigns the claim directly to that manager and the 'claim_management' queue,",
>   "   And all claim manager fields are updated within 5 seconds of claim creation.",
>   "**Scenario 3: Tie-Breaking in Workload Distribution**",
>   "3. Given three eligible claim managers each have exactly 15 active claims,",
>   "   When auto-assignment is triggered,",
>   "   Then the system assigns the claim to the first manager in the filtered list,",
>   "   And all claim assignment fields reflect this manager as the assignee.",
>   "**Scenario 4: No Eligible Managers - Queue Fallback**",
>   "4. Given no claim managers have the required authority level for the claim,",
>   "   Or all qualified managers have 'Inactive' status,",
>   "   Or all qualified active managers are within their unavailability periods,",
>   "   When auto-assignment is triggered,",
>   "   Then the system terminates the auto-assignment process,",
>   "   And assigns the claim to the 'Claim Management' queue only,",
>   "   And no individual claim manager is assigned to the CMMN or Claim Header fields,",
>   "   And the New Claim task is assigned to the queue for manual distribution.",
>   "**Scenario 5: Authority Level Filtering**",
>   "5. Given a high-complexity claim requires Level 3 authority,",
>   "   And three managers exist with Level 1, Level 2, and Level 3 authority respectively,",
>   "   When auto-assignment evaluates eligibility,",
>   "   Then only the Level 3 authority manager is included in the eligible list,",
>   "   And managers with insufficient authority are excluded from assignment consideration.",
>   "**Scenario 6: Unavailability Period Exclusion**",
>   "6. Given a claim manager has an unavailability period configured from 01-Jan-2025 to 15-Jan-2025,",
>   "   And the system date is 10-Jan-2025,",
>   "   When auto-assignment filters eligible managers,",
>   "   Then this manager is excluded from the eligible list,",
>   "   And the claim is assigned to another eligible manager or the queue.",
>   "**Scenario 7: Active Claim Count Accuracy**",
>   "7. Given a claim manager has 5 claims with 'active' CMMN status and 3 claims with 'closed' CMMN status,",
>   "   When the system counts active claims for workload balancing,",
>   "   Then only the 5 active claims are counted,",
>   "   And the count includes claims across all claim types assigned to that manager.",
>   "**Scenario 8: Post-Creation Reassignment (Out of Scope for Auto-Assignment)**",
>   "8. Given a claim has already been created and assigned to Manager A,",
>   "   When Manager A needs to reassign the claim to Manager B,",
>   "   Then the auto-assignment logic does not trigger,",
>   "   And Manager A must manually reassign using the claim reassignment workflow,",
>   "   And the system does not automatically apply workload balancing rules for this reassignment.",
>   "**Scenario 9: OpenL Rules Application**",
>   "9. Given custom OpenL business rules are configured for authority-based assignment,",
>   "   When auto-assignment evaluates claim manager eligibility,",
>   "   Then the system executes all applicable OpenL rules,",
>   "   And only managers who pass both standard authority checks and OpenL rule evaluations are eligible for assignment.",
>   "**Scenario 10: Queue Assignment Persistence**",
>   "10. Given a claim is successfully auto-assigned to a claim manager,",
>   "    When the assignment is completed,",
>   "    Then the 'claim_management' queue association is maintained,",
>   "    And both the claim manager and the queue are reflected in the Claim Overview UI,",
>   "    And the New Claim task shows both the assigned manager and the queue."
> ]


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=731650430"
> ]

### Epic: Case Management & Overview

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to create and manage event cases with unified case visibility, so that I can view and process all related claims together
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: create and manage event cases with unified case visibility to view and process all related claims together
- **Value**: I can view and process all related claims together, reducing duplicate effort and ensuring consistent handling of multi-claim insurance events

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** create and manage event cases with unified case visibility to view and process all related claims together,
> **so that** I can view and process all related claims together, reducing duplicate effort and ensuring consistent handling of multi-claim insurance events.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. The system creates an Event Case as a container that groups multiple claims related to the same insurance event.",
>   "2. Claims Adjuster can view all related claims collectively within a single Event Case interface.",
>   "3. Claims Adjuster can manage related claims as a coordinated group rather than as isolated individual claims.",
>   "4. Claims Adjuster can process related claims together, maintaining visibility of their relationships and interdependencies.",
>   "5. The system maintains the relationship linkage between claims within the Event Case throughout their lifecycle.",
>   "6. Claims Adjuster can access comprehensive case visibility showing all claims stemming from a single insurance event in one unified view."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** multiple claims are related to the same insurance event, **When** the Claims Adjuster accesses the Event Case, **Then** all related claims are displayed collectively in a unified interface.",
>   "2. **Given** an Event Case has been created, **When** the Claims Adjuster views the case, **Then** the system displays all claims grouped within that Event Case container.",
>   "3. **Given** multiple claims exist within an Event Case, **When** the Claims Adjuster performs management actions, **Then** the system allows coordinated processing of related claims as a group.",
>   "4. **Given** claims are grouped in an Event Case, **When** the Claims Adjuster processes one claim, **Then** the system maintains visibility of all other related claims in the same event.",
>   "5. **Given** an insurance event has generated multiple claims across different policies, **When** the Event Case is created, **Then** all claims maintain their relationship linkage throughout their lifecycle.",
>   "6. **Given** an Event Case exists, **When** the Claims Adjuster accesses case management functions, **Then** the system provides centralized management capabilities for all related claims within that event.",
>   "7. **Given** a Claims Adjuster needs to process event-related claims, **When** viewing the Event Case, **Then** the system presents a complete view of all claims stemming from the single insurance event.",
>   "8. **Negative Scenario - Given** claims are not related to the same insurance event, **When** attempting to group them in an Event Case, **Then** the system prevents inappropriate claim grouping or displays a validation error."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to search for and select members during case intake, so that I can quickly associate the correct insured with a new claim
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: search for and select members during case intake, including work detail and address information
- **Value**: I can quickly associate the correct insured with a new claim and ensure accurate member and employment data is captured

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** search for and select members during case intake, including work detail and address information,
> **so that** I can quickly associate the correct insured with a new claim and ensure accurate member and employment data is captured.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates member detail entry as the first step of case creation.
> 2. User searches for existing members by entering search criteria in the member search bar.
>    2.1 System triggers auto-suggestion search after more than 3 characters are entered.
>    2.2 System displays matching members in dropdown showing first name, last name, and date of birth.
>    2.3 If no matching members are found, system displays 'No data is found' message and allows user to retry search.
>    2.4 User may choose to add a new member instead by pressing 'Add New Member' button, which opens the Add New Member form.
> 3. User selects a member from search results by clicking on the name.
> 4. System displays work detail component with employer search capability.
>    4.1 If selected member has existing employment data in CEM, system pre-fills employer, work state, occupation, date of hire, and class fields.
>    4.2 User searches and selects employer from the employer search bar.
>    4.3 User reviews and edits work detail attributes as needed: Work State, Occupation, Date of Hire, and Class.
> 5. System displays address detail component with member's address information pre-filled from CEM (non-editable).
> 6. When initiated from Individual Customer context in Customer Portfolio:
>    6.1 System automatically pre-fills member's name from CEM data in the search bar.
>    6.2 System pre-fills all work detail attributes from CEM data.
> 7. When initiated from Organization Customer context in Customer Portfolio:
>    7.1 System displays member search bar without default values.
>    7.2 System pre-fills employer search bar with Organization Customer as default (disabled for editing).
>    7.3 System auto-populates class dropdown with all available class values from the Organization Customer.
>    7.4 System auto-fills all address detail fields (disabled for editing).
>    7.5 User searches and selects member using standard search process.
> 8. User completes member addition to proceed with case creation workflow.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** user has PRIV>CAP>Initiate Loss privilege and initiates member detail entry, **when** user enters fewer than 3 characters in member search bar, **then** system does not trigger auto-suggestion search.
> 2. **Given** user enters more than 3 characters in member search bar, **when** system finds matching members, **then** system displays auto-suggestions within 2 seconds showing member first name, last name, and date of birth.
> 3. **Given** user enters search criteria, **when** no members match the criteria, **then** system displays 'No data is found' message and allows user to continue searching or add new member.
> 4. **Given** user clicks 'Add New Member' button during search, **when** button is pressed, **then** system opens Add New Member form.
> 5. **Given** user selects a member from search results, **when** member is clicked, **then** system displays selected member's name in search bar and shows Work Detail component with employer search bar.
> 6. **Given** selected member has existing employment data in CEM, **when** member is selected, **then** system pre-fills Work Detail component with employer, work state, occupation, date of hire, and class from CEM data.
> 7. **Given** Work Detail component is displayed, **when** user views the fields, **then** work state, occupation, date of hire, and class fields are editable by user.
> 8. **Given** member is selected, **when** system displays Address Detail component, **then** all address fields (Address Line 1, Address Line 2, Address Line 3, City, State/Province, Zip code/Postal, Country) are pre-filled from CEM and disabled for editing.
> 9. **Given** process is initiated from Customer Portfolio with Individual Customer context, **when** member detail form opens, **then** system pre-fills member's name and work detail attributes from CEM data automatically.
> 10. **Given** process is initiated from Customer Portfolio with Organization Customer context, **when** member detail form opens, **then** system displays Organization Customer as default employer (disabled), auto-populates class dropdown with organization's class values, and auto-fills address details (disabled).
> 11. **Given** user is in Organization Customer context, **when** employer search bar is displayed, **then** employer field is disabled with Organization Customer set as default value.
> 12. **Given** user does not have PRIV>CAP>Initiate Loss privilege, **when** user attempts to access member addition functionality, **then** system prevents access to the feature.
> 13. **Given** user has selected and configured member details, **when** all required fields are completed, **then** user can proceed to next step of case creation workflow.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to capture case details including reporting method, event date, and loss type during intake, so that all essential claim information is recorded accurately
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: capture case details including reporting method, event date, and loss type during intake
- **Value**: all essential claim information is recorded accurately

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** capture case details including reporting method, event date, and loss type during intake,
> **so that** all essential claim information is recorded accurately.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Adjuster captures core case details including reporting method (via dropdown), date reported (date picker with past/current date validation), event date (required, validated against earliest event loss date), and optional event description (up to 1000 characters).
>    1.1 If reporting method is 'Self-service portal', the Date Reported field is automatically disabled.
>    1.2 If Event Date is later than the earliest event loss date, the system displays a warning but allows the adjuster to continue.
> 2. Adjuster selects the claim subject from eligible parties including the member and active dependents (Wife, Husband, Domestic Partner, Daughter, Son) retrieved from CEM data.
>    2.1 If the required party is not listed, adjuster selects 'Other' and is navigated to 'Add New Individual Party' slide-out panel to enter party details and relationship to member; upon saving, the subject section refreshes and the newly added party is auto-selected.
> 3. Adjuster classifies the case by selecting Accident, Sickness, or Other using radio button options.
> 4. Adjuster selects applicable loss types from multi-select options: Death, Accident, Serious Illness, Absence, Accelerated Death, Hospital Service, ADA - Work Accommodation, and Wellness.
>    4.1 If the selected subject is not the employee, the 'Absence' loss type checkbox is automatically disabled.
> 5. Adjuster optionally manages ICD codes by adding, editing, or deleting entries with code, description, primary indicator (checkbox), and date fields.
>    5.1 If the adjuster attempts to mark multiple ICD Codes as primary, a validation error is triggered (only one primary allowed).
>    5.2 If the adjuster attempts to delete an ICD Code entry, a confirmation modal is displayed to prevent accidental removal.
> 6. Adjuster navigates through the intake workflow using Next (to Step 3: Additional Parties), Previous (back to Step 1: Member), Save & Exit (persist data and exit), or Cancel (terminate without saving changes).


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the adjuster is on Step 2 of the intake process, **when** they select a reporting method and enter a date reported, **then** the date reported must be validated as current or past date.
> 2. **Given** the reporting method is 'Self-service portal', **when** the page loads, **then** the Date Reported field is automatically disabled and cannot be manually edited.
> 3. **Given** the adjuster enters an event date, **when** the date is later than the earliest event loss date, **then** the system displays a warning message but allows continuation to the next step.
> 4. **Given** the adjuster is selecting a claim subject, **when** they choose 'Other', **then** they are navigated to the 'Add New Individual Party' slide-out panel, and upon saving, the newly added party is auto-selected as the claim subject.
> 5. **Given** the adjuster has selected a subject who is not the employee, **when** the loss types are displayed, **then** the 'Absence' checkbox is automatically disabled.
> 6. **Given** the adjuster is managing ICD codes, **when** they attempt to mark more than one ICD Code as primary, **then** a validation error is triggered and the action is blocked.
> 7. **Given** the adjuster attempts to delete an ICD Code, **when** they click the delete action, **then** a confirmation modal is displayed before the deletion is executed.
> 8. **Given** the adjuster has entered all required fields (reporting method, event date, and accident/sickness classification), **when** they click 'Next', **then** they are navigated to Step 3: Additional Parties.
> 9. **Given** the adjuster clicks 'Previous', **when** the action is triggered, **then** they are navigated back to Step 1: Member without losing entered data.
> 10. **Given** the adjuster clicks 'Save & Exit', **when** the action is executed, **then** all entered data is persisted and the adjuster exits the intake workflow.
> 11. **Given** the adjuster enters an event description, **when** the description exceeds 1000 characters, **then** the system displays a validation error and prevents submission.
> 12. **Given** the adjuster is viewing the subject selection section, **when** the system retrieves eligible parties, **then** only member and active dependents with relationships Wife, Husband, Domestic Partner, Daughter, or Son are displayed (filtered by customer state = customer/qualified AND membership status = Active).
> 13. **Given** the adjuster has completed all required fields, **when** they submit the case detail step, **then** the data is mapped to CapEventCaseDetailEntity and CapClaimEventEntity as per the specification.
> 14. **Given** the date picker is displayed, **when** the adjuster's locale is en_GB, **then** the date format is displayed as DD/MM/YYYY.

>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=540791893"

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to add and manage parties (claimants, beneficiaries, vendors) to a case, so that all stakeholders are properly documented and linked to the claim
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: add and manage parties (claimants, beneficiaries, vendors) to a case and assign specific claim roles and relationships
- **Value**: all stakeholders are properly documented, linked to the claim, and their roles and contact information are accurately maintained throughout the case lifecycle

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** add and manage parties (claimants, beneficiaries, vendors) to a case and assign specific claim roles and relationships,
> **so that** all stakeholders are properly documented, linked to the claim, and their roles and contact information are accurately maintained throughout the case lifecycle.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System displays the Additional Party Information table showing all parties currently associated with the case.
> 2. Adjuster initiates party addition by searching for existing parties in the system.
>    2.1 Search auto-triggers when more than 3 characters are entered, displaying matching results with party names.
>    2.2 Adjuster can apply advanced filters to refine search results.
>    2.3 Adjuster can view detailed party information from search results before making a selection.
>    2.4 If no matching party is found, adjuster can manually create a new party record with required information.
> 3. Adjuster selects a party from search results and assigns claim-specific roles and relationship to participant.
> 4. System adds the party to the case and displays the updated party record in the Additional Party Information table.
> 5. Adjuster edits contact information for added parties including addresses and communication details.
>    5.1 System updates contact information in the backend and reflects changes in the party table.
> 6. Adjuster edits party information including roles, relationships to insured, and payment methods.
>    6.1 For parties with protected roles (Employer, Primary Beneficiary, Contingent Beneficiary, Payee, Guardian), system restricts role modification to maintain data integrity.
>    6.2 Guardian roles cannot be selected from the role dropdown when editing existing party records.
>    6.3 System updates party information and refreshes the display with current data.
> 7. System requires confirmation when adjuster attempts to cancel party addition or edit operations to prevent accidental data loss.
> 8. Adjuster can remove or reassign parties as case requirements change, subject to role-based restrictions.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the adjuster is on the Additional Parties screen,
>    **When** they click 'Add Party',
>    **Then** the system opens the Add Party interface with search functionality enabled.
>
> 2. **Given** the adjuster is entering search criteria,
>    **When** they type more than 3 characters,
>    **Then** the system automatically displays auto-suggest results showing party first and last names within 2 seconds.
>
> 3. **Given** the adjuster has selected a party from search results,
>    **When** they assign roles and relationship to participant and save,
>    **Then** the system creates a new record in the Additional Party Information table and displays edit options.
>
> 4. **Given** no matching party is found in search results,
>    **When** the adjuster chooses to add a new party manually,
>    **Then** the system opens the Add New Party form, allows data entry, and creates the party record upon submission.
>
> 5. **Given** an existing party record is displayed in the party table,
>    **When** the adjuster clicks 'Edit Contact Information',
>    **Then** the system opens a slide-out window with current contact and address information editable and saveable.
>
> 6. **Given** an existing party record is displayed,
>    **When** the adjuster clicks 'Edit Party Information',
>    **Then** the system opens a slide-out window allowing updates to roles, relationships, and payment methods.
>    6.1 **Given** the party has a protected role (Employer, Primary Beneficiary, Contingent Beneficiary, Payee, Guardian),
>        **When** the adjuster opens the Edit Party form,
>        **Then** these role values are disabled and cannot be removed, and these roles do not appear in the Roles dropdown for selection.
>
> 7. **Given** the adjuster has a party with Guardian of Beneficiary role,
>    **When** they click 'Edit' on this party record,
>    **Then** the system displays the Guardian role as disabled and does not allow it to be found in the Roles dropdown.
>
> 8. **Given** the adjuster is in the process of adding or editing a party,
>    **When** they click 'Cancel',
>    **Then** the system displays a confirmation dialog before closing the form.
>    8.1 **Given** the confirmation dialog is displayed,
>        **When** the adjuster confirms cancellation,
>        **Then** the system closes the form without saving changes.
>    8.2 **Given** the confirmation dialog is displayed,
>        **When** the adjuster does not confirm,
>        **Then** the system closes the dialog and returns to the form for continued editing.
>
> 9. **Given** the adjuster is viewing search results,
>    **When** they click on a party name to view details,
>    **Then** the system opens the Party Information UI in read-only mode and closes without confirmation when dismissed.
>
> 10. **Given** the adjuster applies search filters,
>     **When** they execute the filtered search,
>     **Then** the system displays only results matching all applied filter criteria.
>
> 11. **Given** the adjuster saves contact or party information updates,
>     **When** the save operation completes,
>     **Then** the system updates the backend, closes the edit window, and refreshes the Additional Party Information table to show updated data.
>
> 12. **Given** required fields are missing during party addition,
>     **When** the adjuster attempts to save,
>     **Then** the system prevents submission and displays inline validation errors.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to create new claims from an event case using the 'I want to' menu, so that I can quickly initiate claims for different claim types (STD, SMP, LTD, Other)
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: create new claims from an event case using the 'I want to' menu
- **Value**: I can quickly initiate claims for different claim types (STD, SMP, LTD, Other) and ensure proper routing based on claim event and case status

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** create new claims from an event case using the 'I want to' menu,
> **so that** I can quickly initiate claims for different claim types (STD, SMP, LTD, Other) and ensure proper routing based on claim event and case status.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User views the Event Case Overview screen displaying the unique case number and current Event Case status.
> 2. User accesses the hierarchical 'I want to' menu system to initiate claim creation.
>   2.1 User clicks the 'I want to' button to display the 1st level menu.
>   2.2 User selects 'Create New Claim' from the 1st level menu to reveal the 2nd level menu.
> 3. System presents available claim type options in the 2nd level menu (Other Claim, STD Claim, SMP Claim, LTD Claim).
> 4. User selects a claim type and system navigates to the appropriate claim creation page.
>   4.1 For 'Other Claim' selection: System navigates to the Add New Claim page with no additional restrictions.
>   4.2 For 'STD Claim' selection: System validates Event Case contains Claim Event 'Absence' and status is 'Open', then navigates to the STD Claim page.
>   4.3 For 'SMP Claim' selection: System validates Event Case contains Claim Event 'Absence' and status is 'Open', then navigates to the SMP Claim page.
>   4.4 For 'LTD Claim' selection: System validates Event Case contains Claim Event 'Absence' and status is 'Open', then navigates to the LTD Claim page.
> 5. For absence-related claim types (STD, SMP, LTD), if business rule validation fails:
>   5.1 System disables the corresponding claim type button.
>   5.2 System displays contextual error message on hover explaining the restriction (either missing Claim Event 'Absence' or Event Case not in 'Open' status).


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is authenticated with privilege 'PRIV>CAP>Initiate Loss' and viewing an Event Case Overview with status 'Open',
>    **When** the user clicks the 'I want to' button,
>    **Then** the system displays the 1st level menu within 1 second.
>
> 2. **Given** the 1st level menu is displayed,
>    **When** the user clicks 'Create New Claim',
>    **Then** the system displays the 2nd level menu showing all four claim type options (Other Claim, STD Claim, SMP Claim, LTD Claim).
>
> 3. **Given** the Event Case has status 'Open' and no specific claim event restriction,
>    **When** the user selects 'Other Claim',
>    **Then** the system navigates to the Add New Claim page for Other Claim type without validation errors.
>
> 4. **Given** the Event Case contains Claim Event 'Absence' and status is 'Open',
>    **When** the user selects 'STD Claim', 'SMP Claim', or 'LTD Claim',
>    **Then** the system navigates to the respective claim creation page (STD, SMP, or LTD).
>
> 5. **Given** the Event Case does NOT contain Claim Event 'Absence',
>    **When** the user views the claim type menu,
>    **Then** the system disables the STD Claim, SMP Claim, and LTD Claim buttons,
>    **And** hovering over each disabled button displays the message: '[Claim Type] can be created only when Claim Event 'Absence' is selected for the Event Case.'
>
> 6. **Given** the Event Case status is NOT 'Open' (e.g., 'Closed', 'Incomplete'),
>    **When** the user views the claim type menu,
>    **Then** the system disables the STD Claim, SMP Claim, and LTD Claim buttons,
>    **And** hovering over each disabled button displays the message: '[Claim Type] can be created only when Event Case is in status 'Open'.'
>
> 7. **Given** the user does NOT have privilege 'PRIV>CAP>Initiate Loss',
>    **When** the user attempts to access the Event Case Overview,
>    **Then** the 'I want to' menu functionality for claim creation is not available or disabled.
>
> 8. **Given** the Event Case does not contain Claim Event 'Absence' AND the status is NOT 'Open',
>    **When** the user hovers over a disabled absence-related claim button,
>    **Then** the system displays an appropriate error message indicating the primary blocking condition.
>
> 9. **Given** the user successfully selects a valid claim type,
>    **When** the system navigates to the claim creation page,
>    **Then** the Event Case number and relevant case details are automatically pre-populated in the new claim form.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to validate claim creation against policy effective periods and detect duplicate claims, so that invalid or duplicate claims are prevented from being created
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: create a new claim linked to an existing case and policy with automatic validation of policy effective periods and duplicate claim detection
- **Value**: invalid claims outside policy coverage periods and duplicate claims are prevented or flagged before creation, reducing processing errors and operational costs

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** create a new claim linked to an existing case and policy with automatic validation of policy effective periods and duplicate claim detection,
> **so that** invalid claims outside policy coverage periods and duplicate claims are prevented or flagged before creation, reducing processing errors and operational costs.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User navigates to Case Overview and initiates the add new claim process for cases that have existing loss events.",
>   "2. User selects the type of claim from available insurance lines (Life, Critical Illness, Hospital Indemnity, Short-Term Disability, Semi-Monthly Disability, Long-Term Disability).",
>   "3. System dynamically filters available claim events and policies based on the selected claim type and product mappings.",
>   "4. User selects one or more existing claim events (Death, Accelerated Death, Accidental Dismemberment, Serious Illness, Absence, Hospital Service) associated with the case.",
>   "5. User selects a policy from the filtered list displaying policy number, line of business, effective date, and termination date.",
>   "6. System validates that the date of loss falls within the selected policy's effective period.",
>   "6.1. If date of loss is outside policy effective period, system prevents claim creation and alerts user to select a different policy or create claim without policy association.",
>   "6.2. If master policy is selected when individual policy exists, system prevents claim creation and prompts user to select appropriate individual policy.",
>   "7. System performs duplicate claim detection by searching for existing claims under the selected policy across all claim statuses.",
>   "7.1. If duplicate claim is detected, system displays warning modal identifying the existing claim and allows user to proceed or cancel.",
>   "7.2. If user confirms to proceed despite duplicate warning, system allows claim creation.",
>   "8. User optionally creates claim without policy association by enabling the 'Create Claim Without Policy' option, which bypasses policy validation.",
>   "9. User submits the claim creation request, triggering backend claim initiation and creation processes.",
>   "10. System confirms successful claim creation and displays the new claim on the Claim Overview page."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Positive Scenarios:**",
>   "1. Given a case with existing loss events, when the user accesses Case Overview, then the 'Add New Claim' button is enabled.",
>   "2. Given the user selects a claim type, when the selection is made, then the system filters claim events and policies to show only those applicable to the selected claim type within 2 seconds.",
>   "3. Given the user selects claim type 'Life', when viewing available claim events, then only Death, Accelerated Death, and Accidental Dismemberment events are displayed.",
>   "4. Given the user selects a claim event and policy, when the date of loss falls within the policy effective period, then the system allows the user to proceed to claim creation.",
>   "5. Given the user completes all mandatory fields with valid data, when the user clicks 'Create Claim', then the system creates the claim and displays success message 'Claim successfully created' on Claim Overview page within 5 seconds.",
>   "6. Given the user enables 'Create Claim Without Policy', when the user proceeds with claim creation, then the system bypasses policy validation and creates the claim without policy association.",
>   "7. Given multiple policies exist for the customer, when the policy list is displayed, then only the latest version of each policy is shown regardless of policy status.",
>   "8. Given policies are filtered based on employee/customer relationship, when group policies exist, then individual policies are shown for individual claims and group policies for group claims.",
>   "**Negative Scenarios:**",
>   "9. Given a case without existing loss events, when the user accesses Case Overview, then the 'Add New Claim' button is disabled.",
>   "10. Given the user selects a policy with effective period from 2023-01-01 to 2023-12-31, when the date of loss is 2024-02-15, then the system displays error: 'Date of Loss of the selected event is not within the chosen Policy's effective Period. Please select another policy or create claim without a policy' and prevents claim creation.",
>   "11. Given a claim already exists for the selected policy and loss event, when the user attempts to create a new claim, then the system displays warning modal: 'Claim already exists. This claim might be a duplicate of Claim #[number] under the same policy #[number]. Do you wish to proceed?' with Yes/No options.",
>   "12. Given the duplicate claim warning is displayed, when the user selects 'No', then the claim creation is cancelled and the user returns to the claim form without saving.",
>   "13. Given the user selects a master policy, when an individual policy exists for the same coverage, then the system displays error preventing claim creation and prompts user to select the individual policy.",
>   "14. Given the user is on the Add New Claim form, when the user clicks 'Cancel', then the system returns to Case Overview page without saving any entered data.",
>   "15. Given mandatory fields (Type of Claim, Select Existing Claim Event, Select Policy) are incomplete, when the user attempts to submit, then the system prevents claim creation and displays inline validation errors."
> ]

>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=565746874"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view case duplication warnings and override duplication results when appropriate, so that I can proceed with legitimate duplicate claims while maintaining audit trails
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view case duplication warnings, review matched duplicate cases with detailed scoring, and override duplication results when appropriate with documented justification
- **Value**: I can proceed with legitimate duplicate claims while maintaining audit trails and preventing false duplicate rejections that could delay valid claim processing

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view case duplication warnings, review matched duplicate cases with detailed scoring, and override duplication results when appropriate with documented justification,
> **so that** I can proceed with legitimate duplicate claims while maintaining audit trails and preventing false duplicate rejections that could delay valid claim processing.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System automatically performs case duplication validation during case processing based on configured business rules (BR>Duplicate Case/Claim Validation).
> 2. When potential duplicates are identified that meet or exceed the duplication threshold score, the system displays a Warning Alert on the case overview page notifying the user that the case is possibly duplicated with other claim cases.
> 3. User accesses detailed duplication information by clicking the 'View Duplication Details' hyperlink on the warning alert, which opens a Duplication Details Drawer.
> 4. User reviews all matched cases presented in the drawer, which displays for each match:
>    4.1 Subject of claim name (hyperlinked to customer portfolio for detailed customer review)
>    4.2 Member ID for identification
>    4.3 Score components showing only non-zero values for focused review
> 5. User examines individual duplicate cases through expandable/collapsible Duplicate Case Cards (defaulting to collapsed state), which provide:
>    5.1 Case number with 'View Case' hyperlink that opens the potentially duplicate case in a new browser window for side-by-side comparison
>    5.2 Total score comparison against the configured threshold
>    5.3 Score breakdown table with matching criteria messages and individual component scores
> 6. User scrolls through duplication details when content exceeds screen length to review all matched cases.
> 7. **Alternate Flow - Override Duplication Result (Authorized Users Only)**:
>    7.1 If user possesses PRIV>CAP>Override Case Duplication Result privilege and determines the duplication warning is incorrect, user clicks 'Override Duplication Result' button in the Duplication Details Drawer
>    7.2 Override Confirmation Popup appears requiring mandatory override reason input and displaying warning that the duplicate alert will be permanently hidden after override
>    7.3 User enters override justification reason and confirms the override action
>    7.4 System processes the override, closes the popup and drawer, refreshes the page, displays success notification, and permanently removes the warning alert from the case overview
> 8. User acknowledges duplication information and proceeds with appropriate case processing based on review findings.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the system performs case duplication validation during case processing, **when** potential duplicate cases are identified with scores meeting or exceeding the configured threshold, **then** a Warning Alert is displayed on the case overview page with the message 'This case is possibly duplicated with other claim cases, please review the duplication details' and a 'View Duplication Details' hyperlink.
> 2. **Given** a duplication warning alert is displayed on the case overview page, **when** the user clicks the 'View Duplication Details' hyperlink, **then** the Duplication Details Drawer opens and displays all matched cases with subject of claim name (hyperlinked), Member ID, and only non-zero score components.
> 3. **Given** the Duplication Details Drawer is open with multiple matched cases, **when** the drawer content exceeds screen length, **then** the content becomes scrollable to allow viewing of all matched cases.
> 4. **Given** duplicate cases are displayed in the Duplication Details Drawer, **when** the drawer initially loads, **then** all Duplicate Case Cards are displayed in collapsed state by default.
> 5. **Given** a Duplicate Case Card is displayed, **when** the user expands the card, **then** the system displays the case number with 'View Case' hyperlink, total score vs threshold comparison, and score breakdown table with matching criteria messages and individual scores.
> 6. **Given** a Duplicate Case Card displays a case number, **when** the user clicks the 'View Case' hyperlink, **then** the potentially duplicate case opens in a new browser window for side-by-side comparison.
> 7. **Given** the Duplication Details Drawer displays subject of claim names, **when** the user clicks a subject of claim name hyperlink, **then** the system navigates to the corresponding customer portfolio page.
> 8. **Given** the user has PRIV>CAP>Override Case Duplication Result privilege, **when** the Duplication Details Drawer is open, **then** the 'Override Duplication Result' button is visible and enabled.
> 9. **Given** the user does NOT have PRIV>CAP>Override Case Duplication Result privilege, **when** the Duplication Details Drawer is open, **then** the 'Override Duplication Result' button is NOT visible or accessible.
> 10. **Given** an authorized user clicks 'Override Duplication Result' button, **when** the Override Confirmation Popup appears, **then** the system displays a mandatory override reason input field and warning message indicating the duplicate alert will be permanently hidden after override.
> 11. **Given** the Override Confirmation Popup is displayed, **when** the user attempts to confirm without entering an override reason, **then** the system prevents submission and displays a validation error requiring reason input.
> 12. **Given** the user enters a valid override reason and confirms, **when** the system processes the override successfully, **then** the popup closes, drawer closes, page refreshes, success notification displays, and the warning alert is permanently removed from the case overview.
> 13. **Given** a duplication warning has been overridden, **when** the user returns to the case overview page, **then** the duplication warning alert is no longer visible and cannot be restored.
> 14. **Given** duplication validation is based on configurable business rules, **when** cases are evaluated, **then** the system applies the current BR>Duplicate Case/Claim Validation rules and threshold scores to determine duplication status.
> 15. **Given** the override action is permanent and includes user justification, **when** an override is recorded, **then** the system maintains an audit trail capturing the user identity, timestamp, override reason, and original duplication score for compliance and review purposes.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manage ICD codes and diagnosis information on claims, so that medical conditions are properly documented and validated
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: manage ICD codes and diagnosis information on claims
- **Value**: medical conditions are properly documented and validated

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** manage ICD codes and diagnosis information on claims,
> **so that** medical conditions are properly documented and validated.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User views existing ICD codes in the Diagnosis Section on the Claim Overview page, displaying ICD code, description, primary indicator, date, and available actions.
> 2. User adds a new ICD code by initiating the add action, searching for and selecting a diagnosis code from a suggestion list, marking it as primary if applicable, specifying the diagnosis date, and saving the record.
> 3. User edits an existing ICD code by selecting the edit action, modifying the diagnosis code, primary designation, or date, and saving the changes.
>    3.1 If the user cancels during add or edit operations, the form closes without saving and returns to the list view.
>    3.2 If validation fails during save, the system displays validation errors and keeps the user in the edit form for correction.
> 4. User deletes a non-primary ICD code by selecting the delete action and confirming the deletion.
>    4.1 If the primary ICD code is the only remaining record, the user can delete it after confirmation.
>    4.2 If other non-primary ICD codes exist, the primary ICD code cannot be deleted and the delete action is unavailable.
> 5. User views the Accident vs. Sickness classification for the claim, which indicates whether the diagnosis is accident-related or sickness-related.
> 6. User can collapse or expand the Diagnosis Section to manage screen real estate, with the section expanded by default.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the user is viewing the Claim Overview page, **when** the Diagnosis Section is displayed, **then** all existing ICD codes are shown in a table with columns for ICD Code (required), Description, Primary indicator, Date (formatted per user locale), and Actions (Edit/Delete icons).
> 2. **Given** the user clicks '+ Add ICD Code', **when** the ICD Code Edit Form opens, **then** the form displays an ICD Code Search Box with auto-suggestions, a Primary Checkbox, a Date Picker with locale-based format, and Save/Cancel buttons.
> 3. **Given** the user enters a valid ICD code, marks it as primary, selects a date, and clicks Save, **when** validation passes, **then** the new ICD code is saved and appears in the ICD Code List Table, and the form closes returning to the list view.
> 4. **Given** the user clicks the Edit icon for an existing ICD code, **when** the ICD Code Edit Form opens, **then** all fields are pre-filled with existing values from the selected record.
> 5. **Given** the user modifies an existing ICD code and clicks Save, **when** validation passes, **then** the changes are saved and reflected in the ICD Code List Table.
> 6. **Given** the user attempts to save ICD code data with invalid or missing required fields, **when** validation fails, **then** the system displays inline validation errors and the user remains in the edit form to correct issues.
> 7. **Given** the user clicks Cancel in the ICD Code Edit Form, **when** the cancel action is triggered, **then** the form closes without saving any changes and returns to the ICD Code list view.
> 8. **Given** the user wants to delete a non-primary ICD code, **when** the user clicks the Delete icon and confirms the deletion, **then** the record is removed from the ICD Code List Table.
> 9. **Given** the primary ICD code is the only remaining record, **when** the user views the Actions column, **then** the Delete icon is visible for the primary record.
> 10. **Given** other non-primary ICD codes exist, **when** the user views the Actions column for the primary ICD code, **then** the Delete icon is hidden and deletion is not allowed.
> 11. **Given** the user attempts to delete the primary ICD code when it is the only record and confirms deletion, **when** the deletion is processed, **then** the primary ICD code record is removed from the list.
> 12. **Given** the Diagnosis Section is visible, **when** the user views the section, **then** the Accident vs. Sickness classification is displayed indicating whether the diagnosis is accident-related or sickness-related.
> 13. **Given** the user is on the Claim Overview page, **when** the page initially loads, **then** the Diagnosis Section is expanded by default.
> 14. **Given** the user clicks the arrow toggle button, **when** the toggle action is triggered, **then** the Diagnosis Section collapses or expands accordingly.
> 15. **Given** the user's locale is set to en_GB, **when** date fields are displayed, **then** dates are formatted as DD/MM/YYYY per the user's locale settings.
> 16. **Given** the user searches for an ICD code, **when** typing in the ICD Code Search Box, **then** the system displays relevant suggestions such as 'M79.7 Fibromyalgia'.
> 17. **Given** all data validation and defaulting rules are defined in BR>Claim ICD Code Defaulting and Validation Rules (LA Life), **when** any ICD code data is saved, **then** the system applies all applicable business rules and validation logic.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manage beneficiaries and designate coverage allocations on life claims, so that benefit payments are properly distributed according to policy terms
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: manage beneficiaries and designate coverage allocations on life claims
- **Value**: benefit payments are properly distributed according to policy terms

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** manage beneficiaries and designate coverage allocations on life claims,
> **so that** benefit payments are properly distributed according to policy terms.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. View and manage beneficiaries through a structured interface displaying beneficiary list with key information including name, guardian status, date of birth, assigned coverages, beneficiary type (Primary/Contingent), allocation percentage, benefit amount, and coverage eligibility status.
> 2. Add new beneficiaries to the claim by:
>    2.1. Selecting beneficiaries from existing case parties (Additional Parties excluding Subject of Claim), or searching for other individuals/organizations in the system, or creating new party records with automatic 'Beneficiary' role assignment.
>    2.2. Optionally assigning a guardian for beneficiaries (automatically designated as payee), with guardian relationship synchronized to CEM and listed in Case Overview Party Information.
>    2.3. Specifying payment details including payment method (Check or saved EFT/ARCH methods) and check address when applicable.
>    2.4. Entering beneficiary details including date of birth (pre-filled from CEM when available), beneficiary type (Primary/Contingent with support for multiple types), proof of loss received date, retained asset approval status, qualification to receive benefit, and willingness to receive benefit.
>    2.5. Designating coverage allocations by selecting eligible coverages (excluding Premium Waiver), assigning percentage of benefit designation (1-100% with 2 decimal precision), with benefit amount automatically calculated as coverage gross amount multiplied by percentage.
> 3. Edit existing beneficiaries to update guardian assignments, payment information, beneficiary details, or modify coverage designations.
>    3.1. If coverage has related payment schedule or payment, coverage field and percentage field become disabled preventing changes.
>    3.2. If guardian or minor beneficiary has payment schedule or payment, guardian selection becomes disabled preventing reassignment.
> 4. Remove beneficiaries or coverage designations through delete actions with confirmation prompts.
>    4.1. If beneficiary/guardian has existing payment schedule or payment (including coverage allocation, Ex Gratia, and Expense payments), remove button is hidden and deletion is prevented.
> 5. System automatically defaults member as beneficiary with 100% primary designation when subject of claim is dependent of decedent and no policy beneficiary exists.
> 6. System validates data integrity by:
>    6.1. Preventing duplicate beneficiaries with same coverage and party combination.
>    6.2. Displaying soft warning when beneficiary is under 18 years old (non-blocking).
>    6.3. Blocking submission when beneficiary is same party as guardian.
>    6.4. Blocking submission when guardian is under 18 years old (skipped if DOB is null).
>    6.5. Preventing total coverage designation percentages from exceeding 100% across all beneficiaries for that coverage.
>    6.6. Preventing total coverage designation amounts from exceeding Gross Benefit Amount (GBA) of coverage across all beneficiaries.
>    6.7. Preventing duplicate coverage records for the same beneficiary.
>    6.8. Blocking Check payment method save when customer has no address in CEM.
>    6.9. Displaying warning (non-blocking) when guardian relationship already exists in CEM.
>    6.10. Validating against duplicate party across beneficiary types during save operation.
> 7. System retains added beneficiaries in section even when selected coverage changes from eligible to non-eligible status.
> 8. System supports beneficiary population triggered during event case automatic creation/update, manual claim creation, or claim update workflows.
> 9. Cancel and close actions prompt confirmation modal before clearing entered information to prevent accidental data loss.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster accesses the Beneficiaries section on a life claim, **when** the page loads, **then** the system displays the beneficiaries list with columns for Name, Guardian, DOB, Coverage, Primary vs. Contingent, Percentage, Amount, and Actions, along with an 'Add Beneficiaries' button.
>
> 2. **Given** the adjuster clicks 'Add Beneficiaries', **when** the drawer opens, **then** the system presents mandatory 'Select Beneficiary' dropdown with options including Additional Parties (excluding Subject of Claim), 'Other - Individual', and 'Other - Organization'.
>
> 3. **Given** the adjuster selects 'Other - Individual' or 'Other - Organization', **when** the selection is made, **then** the system displays a search field targeting parties with customer states: customer, qualified, unqualified, inQualification.
>
> 4. **Given** the adjuster adds a new party as beneficiary, **when** the party creation form opens, **then** the Roles field is auto-disabled with 'Beneficiary' as default value.
>
> 5. **Given** the adjuster assigns a guardian to a beneficiary, **when** the guardian is selected, **then** the system:
>    - Refreshes Payment Detail section with guardian's payment information
>    - Saves guardian relationship to CEM
>    - Lists guardian in Case Overview > Party Information
>    - Displays information text stating 'The guardian will be designated as the payee of the coverage in payment if guardian is selected'
>
> 6. **Given** the adjuster selects Check as payment method, **when** attempting to save, **then** the system verifies customer has address in CEM and blocks save if address is unavailable.
>
> 7. **Given** the adjuster enters Date of Birth, **when** DOB is retrievable from CEM, **then** the field is pre-filled and disabled; otherwise it remains editable and mandatory.
>
> 8. **Given** the adjuster adds coverage designation, **when** entering percentage, **then** the system auto-calculates Amount as coverage grossAmount  Percentage and displays with 2 decimal places.
>
> 9. **Given** the adjuster attempts to add beneficiary, **when** total designation percentage for a coverage exceeds 100% across all beneficiaries, **then** the system displays error message and prevents save.
>
> 10. **Given** the adjuster attempts to add beneficiary, **when** total designation amount for a coverage exceeds Gross Benefit Amount (GBA) across all beneficiaries, **then** the system displays error message and prevents save.
>
> 11. **Given** the adjuster attempts to add beneficiary, **when** a duplicate party with same coverage already exists, **then** the system displays error message and prevents save.
>
> 12. **Given** the adjuster enters a beneficiary under 18 years old, **when** saving, **then** the system displays soft warning message but does not block submission.
>
> 13. **Given** the adjuster selects same party as both beneficiary and guardian, **when** attempting to save, **then** the system displays error message and blocks submission.
>
> 14. **Given** the adjuster assigns a guardian under 18 years old, **when** attempting to save, **then** the system displays error message and blocks submission (validation skipped if DOB is null).
>
> 15. **Given** a beneficiary or guardian has existing payment schedule or payment (including coverage allocation, Ex Gratia, and Expense payments), **when** the adjuster views the record, **then** the Remove button is hidden and deletion is prevented.
>
> 16. **Given** a coverage has related payment schedule or payment, **when** the adjuster edits the beneficiary, **then** the Coverage field and Percentage field are disabled preventing changes.
>
> 17. **Given** a guardian or minor beneficiary has payment schedule or payment, **when** the adjuster attempts to edit, **then** the guardian selection field becomes disabled.
>
> 18. **Given** the adjuster attempts to assign duplicate coverage to same beneficiary, **when** saving, **then** the system displays error message preventing duplicate coverage assignments.
>
> 19. **Given** the Coverage dropdown loads, **when** displaying available coverages, **then** the system filters out Premium Waiver coverage and shows 'No Data' if no coverages are available.
>
> 20. **Given** the Payment Method dropdown loads, **when** displaying options, **then** the system shows only 'Active' methods with payment type icons, masked card numbers (last 4 digits for saved methods), and '(Preferred)' label for methods marked as preferred in CEM.
>
> 21. **Given** subject of claim is dependent of decedent and no policy beneficiary exists, **when** the claim is processed, **then** the system automatically defaults member as beneficiary with 100% primary designation.
>
> 22. **Given** a coverage changes from eligible to non-eligible status, **when** the adjuster views beneficiaries, **then** the system retains added beneficiaries in section without automatic removal.
>
> 23. **Given** the adjuster clicks close (X) or Cancel button with unsaved changes, **when** confirming action, **then** the system prompts confirmation modal 'Are you sure you want to clear the entered information?' before clearing form.
>
> 24. **Given** the adjuster successfully adds or edits beneficiary with valid data, **when** clicking Add Beneficiary/Save, **then** the system validates for duplicate party across beneficiary types, saves record, and navigates to Beneficiaries Information List.
>
> 25. **Given** a guardian relationship already exists in CEM, **when** the adjuster saves the beneficiary, **then** the system displays warning message but does not block save operation.
>
> 26. **Given** the adjuster views beneficiary list, **when** clicking Name or Guardian hyperlinks, **then** the system navigates to Party Information form for the respective party.
>
> 27. **Given** the adjuster views beneficiary sub-rows, **when** expanded, **then** the system displays individual coverage details with eligibility status (Eligible/Non-Eligible) and individual coverage amounts, with main row showing total across all coverages.
>
> 28. **Given** a beneficiary has no coverage assigned, **when** viewing the beneficiaries list, **then** the system displays warning message indicating missing coverage assignment.
>
> 29. **Given** the adjuster selects organization as beneficiary, **when** the form loads, **then** the DOB field is hidden and Guardian dropdown is disabled.
>
> 30. **Given** duplicate party is detected across beneficiary types during save, **when** validation runs, **then** the system displays error message at drawer bottom and prevents save operation.
