#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manage payment methods for parties and beneficiaries, so that claim payments are directed to the correct recipients through their preferred payment channels
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: manage payment methods for parties and beneficiaries associated with cases and claims
- **Value**: claim payments are directed to the correct recipients through their preferred payment channels

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** manage payment methods for parties and beneficiaries associated with cases and claims,
> **so that** claim payments are directed to the correct recipients through their preferred payment channels.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User views a consolidated table of all parties associated with a case or claim, displaying party name, role, association level (case or claim), and relationship to participant.",
>   "2. System automatically pre-populates parties including case/claim-related parties (sponsors, employers), vendors from Provider Management Studio, and beneficiaries and guardians for display purposes.",
>   "3. User adds new parties to a case or claim by:",
>   "   3.1. Selecting party type (Individual or Organization).",
>   "   3.2. Searching for existing parties by name with results showing date of birth, phone, and role.",
>   "   3.3. Either selecting an existing party from search results or creating a new party record.",
>   "   3.4. Specifying the association level (Case or Claim), assigning roles, defining relationship to participant, and configuring payment method.",
>   "4. User edits party information for parties with Personal RelationshipType, modifying:",
>   "   4.1. Association level and roles.",
>   "   4.2. Contact information including phone, email, and contact preference.",
>   "   4.3. Address details (address lines, country, city, state/province, zip code).",
>   "   4.4. Payment method preferences (not available for beneficiaries).",
>   "5. User manages vendor parties through dedicated context menu actions:",
>   "   5.1. Viewing vendor details and services.",
>   "   5.2. Editing vendor services.",
>   "   5.3. Navigating to full vendor record in Provider Management Studio.",
>   "   5.4. Deleting vendor association with confirmation.",
>   "6. System enforces different party visibility based on payment management configuration:",
>   "   6.1. At case-level payment management: displays all beneficiaries and guardians from all claims under the case in Event Case Overview.",
>   "   6.2. At claim-level payment management: displays only beneficiaries and guardians from the current claim in Claim Overview, with changes affecting all claims within the case.",
>   "7. System restricts editing and deletion for parties with non-Personal RelationshipType (e.g., Sponsor) to maintain system data integrity.",
>   "8. System manages beneficiary payment methods separately through a dedicated Beneficiary drawer, not through the standard party edit interface."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** a user accesses the Party Information component on Case or Claim Overview, **When** the page loads, **Then** the system displays a table sorted first by Party Name, then by Associated with field (Case entries before Claim entries).",
>   "2. **Given** a case or claim exists, **When** the Party Information component loads, **Then** the system automatically pre-populates case/claim-related parties (e.g., Sponsor, Employer), vendors from Provider Management Studio, and all relevant beneficiaries and guardians.",
>   "3. **Given** a user wants to add a new party, **When** the user searches by name in the Add Party modal, **Then** the system displays existing party results showing DOB, Phone, and Role, and allows selection of existing party or creation of new party.",
>   "4. **Given** a user adds a new party, **When** the user completes all required fields (Type, Name, Associated With, Roles, Relationship to Participant), **Then** the system adds the party to the Party Information table and saves the record.",
>   "5. **Given** a party has Personal RelationshipType, **When** the user selects Edit Party, **Then** the system displays an editable form with fields for Associated With, Roles, Relationship, Contact Information, Address, and Payment Method.",
>   "6. **Given** a party has non-Personal RelationshipType (e.g., Sponsor), **When** the user views the party context menu, **Then** the Edit and Delete options are not available.",
>   "7. **Given** a user edits a beneficiary party, **When** the Edit Party form opens, **Then** the Payment Method field is not available, requiring payment method management through the Beneficiary drawer.",
>   "8. **Given** a user manages a vendor party, **When** the user accesses the Manage Vendor context menu, **Then** the system provides options to View Detail, Edit Services, View Vendor Record (navigating to Provider Management Studio), and Delete with confirmation.",
>   "9. **Given** payment management is configured at case-level, **When** the user views the Event Case Overview, **Then** the Party Information component displays beneficiaries and guardians from all claims under the case.",
>   "10. **Given** payment management is configured at claim-level, **When** the user views the Claim Overview, **Then** the Party Information component displays only beneficiaries and guardians from the current claim, and changes affect all claims within the case.",
>   "11. **Given** a user attempts to delete a vendor party, **When** the user selects Delete from the context menu, **Then** the system displays a confirmation dialog before executing the deletion.",
>   "12. **Given** a user saves changes to party information, **When** the save operation completes, **Then** the system immediately reflects the updated information in the Party Information table without requiring page refresh.",
>   "13. **Given** multiple parties exist with the same name, **When** the table is displayed, **Then** the system applies secondary sorting by Associated with field (Case before Claim) to maintain consistent ordering."
> ]

### Epic: Product-Specific Claim Intake & Case Creation

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to collect product-specific claim information during intake for all product lines (Life, Accident & Health, Dental, Pet, Motor/Auto, Disability, SMP), so that claims are properly initialized with complete and validated data.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: collect and validate product-specific claim information during intake for all product lines (Life, Accident & Health, Dental, Pet, Motor/Auto, Disability, SMP)
- **Value**: claims are properly initialized with complete, validated, and product-appropriate data that supports accurate processing and adjudication across all lines of business

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** collect and validate product-specific claim information during intake for all product lines (Life, Accident & Health, Dental, Pet, Motor/Auto, Disability, SMP),
> **so that** claims are properly initialized with complete, validated, and product-appropriate data that supports accurate processing and adjudication across all lines of business.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. System presents a product-specific claim intake section tailored to the identified line of business (Dental, Life, A&H, Pet, Motor/Auto, Disability, SMP).",
>   "2. User captures claim intake attributes through structured input controls designed for the specific product line requirements.",
>   "3. System validates claim intake data according to product-specific business rules during data entry.",
>   "4. User submits the claim intake information to initialize the claim record with complete product-appropriate attributes.",
>   "5. System persists the claim intake data and integrates it with the broader claim case creation workflow.",
>   "6. User can review and modify claim intake attributes as needed before final submission within the dental claim intake workflow."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Positive Scenarios:**",
>   "1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is processing a dental claim intake, **When** the claim intake section is displayed, **Then** all product-specific attributes for dental claims are available for data entry with appropriate input controls.",
>   "2. **Given** required claim intake attributes are populated with valid data, **When** the user submits the claim intake section, **Then** the system successfully validates and persists the claim information without errors.",
>   "3. **Given** a claim intake section for any supported product line (Life, A&H, Pet, Motor/Auto, Disability, SMP), **When** the user accesses the intake form, **Then** only the attributes relevant to that specific product line are presented.",
>   "4. **Given** claim intake data has been entered, **When** the user navigates within the claim intake workflow, **Then** previously entered data is retained and displayed accurately.",
>   "5. **Given** all mandatory claim intake attributes are completed, **When** the claim is submitted, **Then** the claim record is properly initialized and available for downstream processing.",
>   "**Negative Scenarios:**",
>   "6. **Given** mandatory claim intake attributes are missing, **When** the user attempts to submit the claim intake section, **Then** the system displays validation errors identifying the missing required fields.",
>   "7. **Given** invalid data is entered in claim intake attributes, **When** the user attempts to proceed, **Then** the system prevents submission and displays specific validation error messages.",
>   "8. **Given** product-specific business rules are violated, **When** the user submits the claim intake information, **Then** the system blocks the submission and provides actionable error guidance."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to validate claim intake data against product-specific business rules before submission, so that invalid or incomplete claims are caught early and data quality is maintained.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: complete a four-step dental claim intake process with product-specific validations at key submission points
- **Value**: invalid or incomplete claims are caught early and data quality is maintained before final submission

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** complete a four-step dental claim intake process with product-specific validations at key submission points,
> **so that** invalid or incomplete claims are caught early and data quality is maintained before final submission.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User initiates dental claim creation through a four-step wizard: Policy and Patient  Claim Info  Upload Documents  Review Claim Info.",
>   "2. **Step 1: Policy and Patient Selection**",
>   "   2.1. User searches and selects a Policy and Patient to initiate the claim.",
>   "   2.2. Upon successful selection, user creates the claim which triggers system initialization of the loss record.",
>   "   2.3. System marks the claim as initiated and enables navigation and draft-saving capabilities.",
>   "   2.4. **Alternate Flow - Withdraw After Initiation**: If user chooses to withdraw at any point after claim initiation, system prompts for confirmation, then closes the claim with reason 'Abandoned' and exits the intake process.",
>   "3. **Step 2: Claim Info**",
>   "   3.1. User enters claim details and navigates forward to the next step.",
>   "   3.2. System validates entered data using 'UIClaimInfoValidation' product-specific business rules before allowing progression.",
>   "   3.3. System saves claim data as draft and marks the step as visited.",
>   "   3.4. **Alternate Flow - Save Draft**: User can save incomplete claim data and exit the intake process; system saves the draft even if validation rules are not fully satisfied.",
>   "   3.5. **Alternate Flow - Close Claim**: User can close the claim during data entry; system prompts for confirmation, then closes the claim with reason 'Canceled' and exits the intake process.",
>   "   3.6. **Alternate Flow - Navigate Backwards**: User can return to Step 1 to modify policy or patient selection; system saves current data as draft before navigating.",
>   "4. **Step 3: Upload Documents**",
>   "   4.1. User uploads supporting documentation related to the dental claim.",
>   "   4.2. User navigates forward to the review step; system saves uploaded documents as draft.",
>   "   4.3. All alternate flows from Step 2 (Save & Exit, Close, Withdraw) remain available.",
>   "5. **Step 4: Review Claim**",
>   "   5.1. User reviews all entered claim information and supporting documents.",
>   "   5.2. User submits the claim for processing.",
>   "   5.3. System validates the complete claim using 'ClaimUpdateValidation' business rules to ensure all product-specific requirements are met.",
>   "   5.4. System locates the appropriate policy version using product-specific business rules, creates the final claim record, and navigates to the submission result page.",
>   "   5.5. **Alternate Flow - Navigate Backwards**: User can return to Step 3 to modify documents or prior steps to adjust claim information.",
>   "   5.6. All alternate flows from Step 2 (Save & Exit, Close, Withdraw) remain available until final submission.",
>   "6. Throughout the process, system enforces navigation rules: progression to next step requires passing step-specific validations, while regression to previous steps and draft-saving are always permitted.",
>   "7. System maintains claim state across user sessions, allowing retrieval and continuation of saved drafts."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Scenario 1: Successful Claim Initiation**",
>   "   - Given the user is on Step 1 (Policy and Patient)",
>   "   - When the user selects a valid policy and patient and clicks 'Create Claim and Continue'",
>   "   - Then the system calls 'initLoss' command, enables the 'Save & Exit' button, replaces 'Create Claim and Continue' with 'Next' button, replaces 'Cancel' with 'Withdraw' button, and navigates to Step 2 (Claim Info) within 3 seconds.",
>   "**Scenario 2: Validation Enforcement During Forward Navigation**",
>   "   - Given the user has entered claim information on Step 2 (Claim Info)",
>   "   - When the user clicks 'Next' button",
>   "   - Then the system validates the data using 'UIClaimInfoValidation' rules, calls 'updateLossDraft' command, and only navigates to Step 3 if validation passes.",
>   "**Scenario 3: Validation Failure Blocking Progression**",
>   "   - Given the user has entered incomplete or invalid claim information on Step 2",
>   "   - When the user clicks 'Next' button",
>   "   - Then the system displays inline error messages for fields failing 'UIClaimInfoValidation' rules and prevents navigation to Step 3.",
>   "**Scenario 4: Draft Saving Without Full Validation**",
>   "   - Given the user has entered partial claim information on any step from Step 2 onwards",
>   "   - When the user clicks 'Save & Exit' button and confirms the action",
>   "   - Then the system saves the claim as draft without enforcing full validation rules, closes the intake UI, and allows the user to retrieve the draft later.",
>   "**Scenario 5: Claim Withdrawal After Initiation**",
>   "   - Given the user has initiated a claim (completed Step 1) and is on any subsequent step",
>   "   - When the user clicks 'Withdraw' button and confirms the action",
>   "   - Then the system closes the claim with reason 'Abandoned', exits the intake UI, and does not allow claim retrieval.",
>   "**Scenario 6: Claim Cancellation During Data Entry**",
>   "   - Given the user is on Step 2 or later",
>   "   - When the user clicks 'Close' button and confirms the action",
>   "   - Then the system closes the claim with reason 'Canceled', exits the intake UI, and does not allow claim retrieval.",
>   "**Scenario 7: Final Submission Validation**",
>   "   - Given the user has completed all steps and is on Step 4 (Review Claim)",
>   "   - When the user clicks 'Submit Claim' button",
>   "   - Then the system validates the complete claim using 'ClaimUpdateValidation' rules, locates the policy version using 'BR>CapDental>Locate Policy Version', creates the claim record, and navigates to the submission result page within 5 seconds.",
>   "**Scenario 8: Final Submission Validation Failure**",
>   "   - Given the user is on Step 4 (Review Claim) with incomplete or invalid data",
>   "   - When the user clicks 'Submit Claim' button",
>   "   - Then the system displays validation errors and blocks claim submission until all 'ClaimUpdateValidation' rules are satisfied.",
>   "**Scenario 9: Backward Navigation Preserves Data**",
>   "   - Given the user is on Step 3 or Step 4",
>   "   - When the user clicks 'Previous' button",
>   "   - Then the system calls 'updateLossDraft' command, saves current data, and navigates to the previous step with all previously entered data intact.",
>   "**Scenario 10: Initial State Control Enforcement**",
>   "   - Given the user opens the New Claim creation workspace",
>   "   - When Step 1 (Policy and Patient) is displayed",
>   "   - Then the 'Create Claim and Continue' button and 'Save & Exit' button are disabled until a valid policy and patient are selected."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Examiner, I want to manage multi-step claim intake workflows (Policy selection, Claim Details, Document Upload, Review) with the ability to save progress and navigate between steps, so that complex claims can be processed incrementally without losing data.
- **Role**: Claims Examiner
- **Action**: manage multi-step claim intake workflows (Policy selection, Claim Details, Document Upload, Review) with the ability to save progress and navigate between steps
- **Value**: complex claims can be processed incrementally without losing data

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Examiner,
> **I want to** manage multi-step claim intake workflows (Policy selection, Claim Details, Document Upload, Review) with the ability to save progress and navigate between steps,
> **so that** complex claims can be processed incrementally without losing data.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates pet claim intake from either Home Page or Customer Portfolio after verifying PRIV>CAP>Create Loss access privilege.
> 2. User selects policy and pet through search functionality, enabling claim initialization.
> 3. Upon clicking Create Claim and Continue, system generates unique Claim Number and saves initial data in Incomplete status.
>   3.1 Prior to claim initialization, user can cancel the process and return to originating screen without creating a claim record.
> 4. After claim initialization, user navigates through five sequential steps: Policy and Pet selection, Claim Info entry, Document Upload, Payment Details, and Review.
>   4.1 At any point after initialization, user can save incomplete data and exit the workflow, preserving all entered information regardless of validation status.
>   4.2 At any point after initialization, user can withdraw the claim, which closes it with status Closed and reason Abandoned.
> 5. User moves forward and backward between steps using Next and Previous navigation controls, with system retaining all entered data.
> 6. Upon reaching the Review step, user verifies all collected information across policy, pet, claim details, documents, and payment data.
> 7. User submits the completed claim for processing.
>   7.1 Successful submission changes claim status to Open or Pending based on auto-adjudication evaluation and displays Claim Overview screen.
>   7.2 Failed submission retains Incomplete status and displays error page, allowing user to correct and resubmit.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a user with PRIV>CAP>Create Loss privilege accesses the intake workflow, **when** they reach Step 1, **then** the system displays the Policy search dropdown with Cancel button enabled, Save and Exit button disabled, and Create Claim and Continue button.
> 2. **Given** user is on Step 1 before claim initialization, **when** they select a valid policy and pet, **then** the Create Claim and Continue button becomes enabled.
> 3. **Given** user clicks Create Claim and Continue, **when** claim is initialized, **then** the system generates a unique Claim Number, sets status to Incomplete, enables Save and Exit button, replaces Cancel with Withdraw button, and displays Next button.
> 4. **Given** user is on Step 1 before clicking Create Claim and Continue, **when** they click Cancel and confirm with Yes, **then** the system does not create a claim record and navigates back to the originating screen (Home Page or Customer Portfolio).
> 5. **Given** claim has been initialized, **when** user clicks Save and Exit and confirms with Yes, **then** the system saves all entered data including incomplete or invalid data, maintains Incomplete status, and exits the intake UI.
> 6. **Given** claim has been initialized, **when** user clicks Withdraw and confirms with Yes, **then** the system sets claim status to Closed with reason Abandoned and exits the intake UI.
> 7. **Given** user is navigating through Steps 2-4, **when** they click Next after entering data, **then** the system saves the step data and advances to the next step in sequence (Claim Info  Upload Documents  Payment Details  Review Claim Info).
> 8. **Given** user is on Steps 2-5, **when** they click Previous, **then** the system navigates backward while preserving all entered data.
> 9. **Given** user reaches Step 5 Review, **when** the page loads, **then** the system displays Policy Card and Pet Card without trash icons and all previously entered information for verification.
> 10. **Given** user is on Step 5 Review with complete data, **when** they click Submit Claim, **then** the system validates all required fields and either proceeds to submission or displays inline validation errors.
> 11. **Given** claim submission is successful, **when** processing completes, **then** the system sets claim status to Open or Pending based on auto-adjudication rules, displays success page, and provides View Claim button to access Claim Overview screen.
> 12. **Given** claim submission fails due to system error, **when** the failure occurs, **then** the system retains claim status as Incomplete and displays submit claim failed page.
> 13. **Given** user clicks View Claim from success page, **when** navigation occurs, **then** the system displays the newly created claim on the Claim Overview screen with the generated Claim Number visible.
> 14. **Given** claim has been saved and exited, **when** user returns to resume the claim, **then** all previously entered data across all steps is retrieved and displayed accurately.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to collect product-specific additional information (accident details, absence reasons, death information, serious illness data) during case intake, so that all relevant context for claim adjudication is captured.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: collect product-specific accident details during case intake including accident dates, location, work-related status, and loss items
- **Value**: all relevant context for claim adjudication is captured at the point of loss reporting

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** collect product-specific accident details during case intake including accident dates, location, work-related status, and loss items,
> **so that** all relevant context for claim adjudication is captured at the point of loss reporting.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System presents an 'Additional Information' section with an 'Accident' subsection when 'Accident' is selected as the loss type during event intake.
> 2. Adjuster captures core accident temporal information including the date of accident and date of first treatment, with system enforcing logical date sequencing.
> 3. Adjuster selects the accident location from a standardized lookup list, with the ability to provide free-text description for non-standard locations.
>    3.1 When 'Other' is selected as the accident location, system displays an additional field for the adjuster to provide a descriptive explanation of the location.
> 4. Adjuster indicates whether the accident is work-related through a binary selection to support workers' compensation determination.
> 5. Adjuster identifies all loss items involved in the accident through multi-selection capability.
> 6. For child claimants, adjuster captures whether the accident occurred during organized sporting events to support coverage determination.
>    6.1 When the claim subject is identified as a child, system displays and requires input for organized sport participation status.
> 7. System validates all captured accident information against business rules and stores data in the Event Case Domain Model.
> 8. All accident information is persisted with the event case and available for downstream claim processing workflows.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the adjuster has selected 'Accident' as the loss type during event intake, **When** the case detail step is displayed, **Then** the system presents an 'Additional Information' section with an expandable 'Accident' subsection containing all required fields.
> 2. **Given** the adjuster is entering accident date information, **When** the Date of Accident is entered, **Then** the system validates that the date is consistent with the overall Event Date and displays an error if validation fails.
> 3. **Given** the adjuster has entered a Date of Accident, **When** the Date of First Treatment is entered, **Then** the system validates that the treatment date is equal to or later than the accident date and prevents progression if earlier.
> 4. **Given** the adjuster is selecting an accident location, **When** 'Other' is selected from the Accident Location dropdown, **Then** the system displays a mandatory text input field 'Description of Accident Location' that must be completed before submission.
> 5. **Given** the claim subject has been identified as a child, **When** the accident information section is displayed, **Then** the system presents a mandatory 'Child Organized Sport' radio button field (Yes/No) that must be answered.
> 6. **Given** the claim subject is not a child, **When** the accident information section is displayed, **Then** the 'Child Organized Sport' field is not visible or required.
> 7. **Given** the adjuster is completing the accident information section, **When** the Work Related field is not answered, **Then** the system prevents case progression and displays an inline validation message indicating this mandatory field is required.
> 8. **Given** the adjuster has entered all required accident information, **When** the case intake is submitted, **Then** all accident details are persisted to the CapAccidentDetailEntity within the Event Case Domain Model.
> 9. **Given** date fields are displayed, **When** the system locale is set to en_GB, **Then** date pickers display and accept dates in DD/MM/YYYY format according to locale-specific configuration.
> 10. **Given** the adjuster has not completed all mandatory accident fields, **When** attempting to proceed to the next step or complete intake, **Then** the system blocks progression and displays inline error messages next to each incomplete required field.
> 11. **Given** multiple loss items are applicable to the accident, **When** the adjuster uses the Loss Item field, **Then** the system allows selection of multiple items from the LossItems lookup dropdown.
> 12. **Given** the accident information section is initially displayed, **When** the adjuster clicks the fold/unfold button, **Then** the section collapses or expands to show or hide detailed accident fields while maintaining entered data.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manage multiple absence reasons for a single absence case with product-specific details (Pregnancy, Bonding, Care for Family Member, Military, Own Medical Condition, Other), so that complex absence scenarios with multiple concurrent reasons are properly documented.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: add, edit, view, and remove multiple absence reasons (Pregnancy, Bonding, Care for Family Member, Military, Own Medical Condition, Other) for a single absence case during absence intake
- **Value**: complex absence scenarios with multiple concurrent reasons are properly documented and tracked

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** add, edit, view, and remove multiple absence reasons (Pregnancy, Bonding, Care for Family Member, Military, Own Medical Condition, Other) for a single absence case during absence intake,
> **so that** complex absence scenarios with multiple concurrent reasons are properly documented and tracked.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User views the Absence Reasons Section displaying all currently added absence reasons with their sequential numbers and names for the absence case.
> 2. User adds a new absence reason by selecting from available unassigned reason types (Pregnancy, Bonding, Care for Family Member, Military, Own Medical Condition, Other) through a slide-out form.
> 3. User saves the new absence reason, which is validated for uniqueness, persisted to the case, and displayed in the updated Absence Reasons Section.
> 4. User expands or collapses individual absence reason details to view or hide product-specific information associated with each reason.
> 5. User edits existing absence reasons by modifying product-specific details while the reason type remains fixed.
> 6. User removes absence reasons from the case when multiple reasons exist, with automatic renumbering of remaining reasons.
>    6.1. If only one absence reason exists, removal is disabled to enforce minimum requirement.
> 7. User navigates away from unsaved forms with confirmation to prevent accidental data loss.
>    7.1. If user attempts to close the Add/Edit form with unsaved changes, system prompts for confirmation before discarding changes.
> 8. User manages 'Other' reason type as a special category that can be added multiple times when different secondary reasons exist.
>    8.1. For 'Other' reason type, the expandable details view is hidden and the reason remains available in the dropdown until all secondary reasons are assigned.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> **Positive Scenarios:**
> 1. Given an absence case is open during intake, When the user views the Absence Reasons Section, Then the system displays all added absence reasons with sequential numbering and reason names mapped to CapAbsenceReasonEntity.absenceReasons.
> 2. Given the user clicks the 'Add' button in the Absence Reasons Section, When the Add Absence Reason pop-up opens, Then the dropdown displays only absence reason types that have not been assigned to the current case (except 'Other' which may appear multiple times).
> 3. Given the user selects a valid absence reason and clicks 'Save', When the system validates uniqueness, Then the reason is persisted, the pop-up closes, and the Absence Reasons Section updates to display the new reason.
> 4. Given multiple absence reasons exist in the case, When the user clicks the edit icon next to a reason, Then the slide-out form opens with all fields populated and the reason dropdown is disabled showing the current reason type.
> 5. Given multiple absence reasons exist in the case, When the user clicks the remove icon and confirms the removal, Then the system removes the reason, automatically renumbers remaining reasons sequentially, and updates the display.
> 6. Given the user selects 'Other' as an absence reason, When the reason is saved, Then the system allows 'Other' to be added again if different secondary reasons exist, and hides the expandable details icon for the 'Other' reason type.
> 7. Given the user clicks an expandable icon next to a reason (except 'Other'), When the icon is clicked, Then the system toggles the display of product-specific details for that absence reason.
> 8. Given the user has made changes in the Add/Edit form, When the user clicks the Close (X) icon or Cancel button, Then the system displays a confirmation modal 'Are you sure you want to close this form?' with Yes/No options, and closes without saving only if Yes is selected.
>
> **Negative Scenarios:**
> 1. Given the user attempts to add an absence reason that already exists in the case (except 'Other'), When the user selects the duplicate reason and clicks 'Save', Then the system prevents saving and displays an error message indicating the reason already exists.
> 2. Given only one absence reason exists in the case, When the user views the Absence Reasons Section, Then the remove icon is hidden for that single reason to enforce the minimum requirement of at least one reason per case.
> 3. Given the user opens the edit form for an existing reason, When the form loads, Then the reason type dropdown is disabled and cannot be changed, ensuring reason type immutability after creation.
> 4. Given the user clicks the remove icon and the confirmation modal appears, When the user selects 'No', Then the removal action is cancelled and the reason remains in the case without any changes.
> 5. Given 'Other' reason type has been added for all possible secondary reasons, When the user opens the Add Absence Reason dropdown, Then 'Other' is no longer available as an option until a secondary reason is freed.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to upload and manage supporting documents (invoices, receipts, medication labels, incident reports) during claim intake with file type and size validation, so that all required documentation is collected and stored in the eFolder.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: upload and manage supporting documents (invoices, receipts, medication labels, incident reports) during claim intake with file type and size validation
- **Value**: all required documentation is collected and stored in the eFolder

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** upload and manage supporting documents (invoices, receipts, medication labels, incident reports) during claim intake with file type and size validation,
> **so that** all required documentation is collected and stored in the eFolder.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. Adjuster navigates to the document upload step (Step 3) within the Pet Claim Intake workflow.",
>   "2. System presents upload instructions specifying required document content by category:",
>   "   2.1. Services documents: itemized invoice containing pet name, policy holder name, service dates, service description, diagnosis, and charges.",
>   "   2.2. Supplies documents: itemized receipt containing item description, purchase date, purchase location, and charges.",
>   "   2.3. Prescription medications: medication label copy containing pet name, policyholder name, and prescriber information.",
>   "3. Adjuster uploads documents using drag-and-drop or file selection interface, with support for multiple simultaneous file uploads.",
>   "4. System performs real-time file validation:",
>   "   4.1. File type validation against LU>FileType lookup configuration.",
>   "   4.2. File size validation ensuring files are greater than 0 Bytes and do not exceed 20MB or LU>FileType.maxSizeInBytes limit for the specific extension.",
>   "   4.3. If validation fails due to unsupported file type, system blocks upload action.",
>   "   4.4. If validation fails due to size limit exceeded, system displays dismissible error message: 'File size is greater than allowable maximum of 20MB'.",
>   "5. Successfully uploaded files appear in the Uploaded Files List displaying file name, extension, and delete function (X icon).",
>   "6. Adjuster can remove uploaded files by clicking the delete icon, which removes the file from the upload queue.",
>   "7. Adjuster can proceed with claim submission without uploading documents, as document upload is optional and does not block submission.",
>   "8. Adjuster navigates through workflow using Previous/Next buttons and can save progress using 'Save and Exit' or withdraw the claim using 'Withdraw' option.",
>   "9. Upon final 'Submit Claim' action, all uploaded files are automatically transferred to the eFolder:",
>   "   9.1. Files are stored in the '1-Intake' folder within the eFolder hierarchical structure.",
>   "   9.2. File Purpose is automatically set to 'Supporting Documents'.",
>   "   9.3. Default file names are retained.",
>   "10. eFolder displays in sidebar with complete folder structure: 1-Intake, 2-Financials, 3-Appeals, 4-General, 5-Inbound (with subfolders: 1-Member, 2-Provider, 3-Other), 6-Outbound (with subfolders: 1-Member, 2-Provider, 3-Other)."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Positive Scenarios:**",
>   "1. **Given** the adjuster is on Step 3 of Pet Claim Intake, **when** they access the document upload section, **then** the system displays upload instructions specifying required document content for Services, Supplies, and Prescription medications.",
>   "2. **Given** the adjuster has valid files (supported type, size >0 Bytes and 20MB), **when** they drag-and-drop or select multiple files, **then** all files are uploaded simultaneously and appear in the Uploaded Files List with file name and extension displayed.",
>   "3. **Given** files are successfully uploaded, **when** the adjuster clicks the delete icon (X) next to a file, **then** the system removes that file from the Uploaded Files List.",
>   "4. **Given** the adjuster has completed intake steps, **when** they click 'Submit Claim' with uploaded documents, **then** all files are transferred to eFolder's '1-Intake' folder with Purpose set to 'Supporting Documents' and original file names retained.",
>   "5. **Given** the adjuster is on Step 3, **when** they proceed without uploading any documents, **then** the system allows claim submission and navigation continues without validation errors.",
>   "6. **Given** files are uploaded to eFolder, **when** the adjuster views the eFolder sidebar, **then** the complete folder structure is displayed with numbered folders (1-Intake through 6-Outbound with applicable subfolders).",
>   "",
>   "**Negative Scenarios:**",
>   "7. **Given** the adjuster attempts to upload a file with unsupported extension (not in LU>FileType lookup), **when** they select or drag the file, **then** the system blocks the upload action and the file is not added to the Uploaded Files List.",
>   "8. **Given** the adjuster attempts to upload a file exceeding 20MB or LU>FileType.maxSizeInBytes for its extension, **when** the file is selected, **then** the system displays error message 'File size is greater than allowable maximum of 20MB' with dismissible X icon and prevents upload.",
>   "9. **Given** the adjuster attempts to upload a file with 0 Bytes size, **when** the file is selected, **then** the system blocks the upload due to minimum size validation failure.",
>   "10. **Given** pre-upload validation fails, **when** the adjuster dismisses the error message, **then** the system removes the error message and allows the adjuster to attempt another upload with a valid file.",
>   "",
>   "**Navigation & Workflow:**",
>   "11. **Given** the adjuster is on Step 3 with uploaded files, **when** they click 'Save and Exit', **then** the system saves the current state and exits the workflow.",
>   "12. **Given** the adjuster is on Step 3, **when** they click 'Previous' or 'Next' buttons, **then** the system navigates to the respective workflow step while preserving uploaded file data.",
>   "13. **Given** the adjuster decides not to proceed, **when** they click 'Withdraw', **then** the system initiates the claim withdrawal process."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to select policy, patient/pet, and provider information during claim intake with search and validation capabilities, so that claims are correctly linked to the appropriate policy and service provider.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: select policy, patient/pet, and provider information during claim intake with search and validation capabilities
- **Value**: claims are correctly linked to the appropriate policy and service provider

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** select policy, patient/pet, and provider information during claim intake with search and validation capabilities,
> **so that** claims are correctly linked to the appropriate policy and service provider.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Claims Adjuster initiates the dental claim intake process and accesses the policy and patient selection interface.
> 2. User searches for and selects the applicable insurance policy from available policies associated with the insured member or group.
> 3. User identifies and selects the patient who received dental services from the list of covered individuals under the selected policy.
> 4. System validates the selected policy and patient combination to ensure eligibility and active coverage status.
> 5. User selects or searches for the dental service provider associated with the claim, including provider credentials and network participation status.
> 6. Upon successful selection and validation of policy, patient, and provider information, the system enables progression to subsequent claim detail entry steps.
> 7. System retains the selected policy, patient, and provider information throughout the claim intake workflow to ensure consistency and data integrity.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the Claims Adjuster has initiated dental claim intake,
>    **When** the policy and patient selection screen is displayed,
>    **Then** the interface presents search and selection controls for policy identification and patient selection.
>
> 2. **Given** a valid policy number or member identifier is entered,
>    **When** the user performs a policy search,
>    **Then** the system retrieves and displays matching policies with relevant coverage details within 2 seconds.
>
> 3. **Given** a policy has been selected,
>    **When** the user accesses patient selection,
>    **Then** the system displays all covered patients/dependents associated with the selected policy.
>
> 4. **Given** a patient is selected,
>    **When** the system validates eligibility,
>    **Then** only patients with active coverage status for the date of service are selectable, and inactive patients are flagged or excluded.
>
> 5. **Given** policy and patient have been successfully selected,
>    **When** the user proceeds to provider selection,
>    **Then** the system enables search functionality for dental service providers by name, NPI, tax ID, or other identifiers.
>
> 6. **Given** a provider is selected,
>    **When** the system validates provider credentials,
>    **Then** the provider's network participation status and eligibility to render services under the selected policy are confirmed.
>
> 7. **Given** an invalid or inactive policy is entered,
>    **When** the user attempts to select the policy,
>    **Then** the system displays an inline error message indicating the policy cannot be used for claim intake and prevents progression.
>
> 8. **Given** no matching policy or patient is found,
>    **When** the search is executed,
>    **Then** the system displays a 'No results found' message and allows the user to refine search criteria.
>
> 9. **Given** all required selections (policy, patient, provider) are complete and validated,
>    **When** the user advances to the next step,
>    **Then** the system persists the selected information and enables entry of detailed claim service and billing information.
>
> 10. **Given** the user navigates away from the selection screen before completing selections,
>     **When** the user returns to the claim intake workflow,
>     **Then** the system retains previously selected policy, patient, and provider information if saved as draft.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to capture claim-specific details (claim type, transaction type, treatment facility, other insurance information, additional claim information) during intake, so that all relevant claim context is recorded for adjudication.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: capture claim-specific details (claim type, transaction type, treatment facility, provider information, and claim type-specific attributes) during intake
- **Value**: all relevant claim context is recorded for adjudication and each claim component can be independently evaluated

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** capture claim-specific details (claim type, transaction type, treatment facility, provider information, and claim type-specific attributes) during intake,
> **so that** all relevant claim context is recorded for adjudication and each claim component can be independently evaluated.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User searches for and selects a provider by name or NPI (Individual providers only), and the system displays provider information (name, license number, address, phone) in a removable provider card.",
>   "2. User selects transaction type (Precertification or Actual Service), which determines form behavior and validation rules for the entire claim intake process.",
>   "  2.1. When Precertification is selected, the system restricts claim type selection to a single type and limits data entry to one service record.",
>   "  2.2. When Actual Service is selected (default), the system allows multiple claim types and multiple service records, and requires Claim Received Date (defaulting to system date).",
>   "  2.3. If user switches transaction type after entering data, the system clears all previously entered claim details and the user must re-enter information according to the new transaction type rules.",
>   "3. User enters basic claim information including Treatment Facility Name and Address (required), Claim Received Date (required for Actual Service), and whether the claim is covered by other insurance.",
>   "4. User selects one or more claim types (Preventive Care, Injury, Illness, Medical Supplies) via checkboxes, which dynamically displays corresponding detail entry sections for each selected type.",
>   "5. For Preventive Care claims, user enters wellness type, date of service, telemedicine indicator, and charges in an Add/Edit drawer interface.",
>   "6. For Injury claims, user enters injury type, injury date and location, description of injury event, type of care received (multi-select), date of service, charges, and indicators for telemedicine, hospital stay, prescribed medication, and prescribed physiotherapy.",
>   "  6.1. If the injury was caused by another pet or person, the system displays a Responsible Party Information section for capturing details about the responsible party.",
>   "  6.2. If user selects surgeries along with other service types in Type of Care Received, the system prevents the combination through validation, requiring separate records or modified selection.",
>   "7. For Illness claims, user enters type of condition, first date of diagnosis, type of care received (multi-select), date of service, charges, and indicators for telemedicine, hospital stay, prescribed medication, and prescribed physiotherapy.",
>   "  7.1. The system applies the same validation rule preventing surgeries from being mixed with other service types in Type of Care Received.",
>   "8. For Medical Supplies claims, user selects supply type(s) from multi-select dropdown (Prescription Medication, Over the Counter Medication, Durable Medical Equipment, Other) and enters type-specific details including item identification, purchase/fill dates, vendor details, charges, and whether the supply is related to a covered injury or illness.",
>   "  8.1. The system saves each selected medical supply type as a separate record to enable independent adjudication of each supply.",
>   "  8.2. For Prescription Medication, user enters medication name/strength, dates filled/purchased, pharmacy details, and charges.",
>   "  8.3. For Over the Counter Medication, user enters medication name/strength, date purchased, store details, and charges.",
>   "  8.4. For Durable Medical Equipment, user enters equipment description, date purchased, store details, and charges.",
>   "  8.5. For Other supplies, user enters description, date purchased, store details, and charges.",
>   "9. When user selects 'Other' in any dropdown field, the system displays an additional required description field, and when saved, displays the entry in table format as 'Other-&lt;Description&gt;'.",
>   "10. The system saves each claim type detail entry as a separate record displayed in data tables with auto-generated sequential line numbers (01, 02, etc.) and provides edit/delete functionality for each record.",
>   "11. The system calculates and displays total accumulated charges from all saved service records in a read-only Total Charges field at the bottom of the form.",
>   "12. User can save entries as drafts and continue adding multiple service records within the same intake session until all claim details are captured."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Scenario 1: Provider Search and Selection**",
>   "1. Given a Claims Adjuster is on the Claim Details Entry step, When the user searches for a provider by name or NPI, Then the system performs a case-insensitive full-text search and returns only Individual providers sorted alphabetically.",
>   "2. Given a provider is selected, When the system displays the provider card, Then the card shows provider name, license number, address, and phone number with an option to remove the selection.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 2: Transaction Type Selection - Actual Service (Default)**",
>   "3. Given a Claims Adjuster selects 'Actual Service' as transaction type, When the claim details form is displayed, Then the system enables multi-select checkboxes for claim types, requires Claim Received Date (defaulting to system date), and allows multiple service records to be added.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 3: Transaction Type Selection - Precertification**",
>   "4. Given a Claims Adjuster selects 'Precertification' as transaction type, When the claim details form is displayed, Then the system changes claim type selection to single-select radio buttons, removes the Claim Received Date requirement, and restricts data entry to one service record only.",
>   "5. Given a user has saved one service record in Precertification mode, When the record is saved, Then the system disables the 'Add New' button to prevent additional records from being created.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 4: Transaction Type Switching**",
>   "6. Given a Claims Adjuster has entered claim details under one transaction type, When the user switches to a different transaction type, Then the system clears all previously entered claim type selections and details, requiring the user to re-enter all information.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 5: Required Field Validation**",
>   "7. Given a Claims Adjuster is entering claim details for Actual Service, When the user attempts to proceed without entering Treatment Facility Name, Treatment Facility Address, or Claim Received Date, Then the system displays inline error messages and blocks progression.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 6: Date Validation - Future Dates**",
>   "8. Given a Claims Adjuster is entering any date field (service date, injury date, diagnosis date, purchase date), When the user enters a future date, Then the system rejects the entry and displays a validation error message.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 7: Date Validation - Dates After Claim Received Date**",

>   "",
>   "**Scenario 8: Preventive Care Claim Entry**",
>   "10. Given a Claims Adjuster selects Preventive Care as a claim type, When the user enters wellness type, date of service, telemedicine indicator, and charges in the Add/Edit drawer, Then the system saves the entry as a separate record in the data table with an auto-generated line number.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 9: Injury Claim Entry with Surgery Validation**",
>   "11. Given a Claims Adjuster is entering an Injury claim, When the user selects surgeries along with other service types in the Type of Care Received field, Then the system prevents the combination through validation and requires the user to either create separate records or modify the selection.",
>   "12. Given an injury was caused by another pet or person, When the user indicates this condition, Then the system displays a Responsible Party Information section for capturing details about the responsible party.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 10: Illness Claim Entry with Surgery Validation**",
>   "13. Given a Claims Adjuster is entering an Illness claim, When the user selects surgeries along with other service types in the Type of Care Received field, Then the system prevents the combination through validation and requires the user to either create separate records or modify the selection.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 11: Medical Supplies - Multiple Supply Types**",
>   "14. Given a Claims Adjuster selects multiple supply types in Medical Supplies (e.g., Prescription Medication and Durable Medical Equipment), When the user saves the entry, Then the system creates separate records for each supply type to enable independent adjudication.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 12: Medical Supplies - Prescription Medication Entry**",
>   "15. Given a Claims Adjuster selects Prescription Medication as a supply type, When the user enters medication name/strength, dates filled/purchased, pharmacy details, and charges, Then the system saves the entry with all required fields validated and displays it in the data table.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 13: Medical Supplies - Over the Counter Medication Entry**",
>   "16. Given a Claims Adjuster selects Over the Counter Medication as a supply type, When the user enters medication name/strength, date purchased, store details, and charges, Then the system saves the entry with all required fields validated and displays it in the data table.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 14: Medical Supplies - Durable Medical Equipment Entry**",
>   "17. Given a Claims Adjuster selects Durable Medical Equipment as a supply type, When the user enters equipment description, date purchased, store details, and charges, Then the system saves the entry with all required fields validated and displays it in the data table.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 15: Medical Supplies - Other Supply Entry**",
>   "18. Given a Claims Adjuster selects Other as a supply type, When the user enters description, date purchased, store details, and charges, Then the system saves the entry with all required fields validated and displays it in the data table.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 16: 'Other' Selection in Dropdown Fields**",
>   "19. Given a Claims Adjuster selects 'Other' in any dropdown field (e.g., wellness type, injury type, condition type, supply type), When the selection is made, Then the system displays an additional required description field.",
>   "20. Given a user has entered a description for an 'Other' selection and saved the record, When the record is displayed in the data table, Then the entry appears in the format 'Other-&lt;Description&gt;'.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 17: Total Charges Calculation**",
>   "21. Given a Claims Adjuster has saved multiple service records with charges, When the records are saved, Then the system calculates and displays the accumulated total charges from all saved records in a read-only Total Charges field.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 18: Record Management - Edit and Delete**",
>   "22. Given a Claims Adjuster has saved service records, When the user views the data table, Then the system displays each record with auto-generated sequential line numbers (01, 02, etc.) and provides edit and delete functionality for each record.",
>   "23. Given a Claims Adjuster clicks edit on a saved record, When the Add/Edit drawer opens, Then the system pre-populates all previously entered data for modification.",
>   "24. Given a Claims Adjuster deletes a record, When the deletion is confirmed, Then the system removes the record from the data table and recalculates the total charges.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 19: Multiple Claim Types in Single Intake**",
>   "25. Given a Claims Adjuster is in Actual Service mode, When the user selects multiple claim types (e.g., Injury and Medical Supplies), Then the system displays expandable sections for each selected claim type and allows the user to add multiple records for each type independently."

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to review all collected claim information before final submission and have the ability to navigate back to previous steps for corrections, so that claim accuracy is verified before processing begins.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: review all collected claim information before final submission and have the ability to navigate back to previous steps for corrections
- **Value**: claim accuracy is verified before processing begins

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** review all collected claim information before final submission and have the ability to navigate back to previous steps for corrections,
> **so that** claim accuracy is verified before processing begins.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User accesses the final review step (Step 5 of 5) of the Pet Claim Intake workflow after completing all previous data entry steps.
> 2. System displays a comprehensive read-only summary of all claim information organized into structured sections:
>    2.1 Policy and Pet Information section showing policy details (policy ID, policyholder name, plan name, customer ID, contact information) and pet details (name, species, sex, age, weight, acquisition date, coverage start date).
>    2.2 Provider section displaying provider license number, address, and phone number.
>    2.3 Claim Details section showing all selected claim types (Preventive Care, Injury, Illness, Medical Supplies), transaction type, claim received date, treatment facility information, and other insurance coverage status.
>    2.4 Additional Information sections for each claim type in expandable/collapsible format containing type-specific details: Preventive Care (wellness type, service date, telemedicine status, charges), Injury (injury type, dates, care received, location, descriptions, related services including hospital stay, medication, physiotherapy), Illness (condition type, diagnosis date, care type, service date, related services), and Medical Supplies (prescription medication, OTC medication, durable medical equipment with dates, sources, charges).
>    2.5 Payment Method section displaying either check payment details (mailing address) or EFT details (masked account number, account type, account holder, masked routing number, bank name, effective dates).
>    2.6 Total Charges section displaying the automatically calculated cumulative total from all claim line items.
> 3. User reviews all displayed information for accuracy and completeness across all sections.
> 4. If user identifies incorrect information or needs to modify data:
>    4.1 User navigates back to previous steps using the 'Previous' button to access and correct specific data entry screens.
>    4.2 After making corrections, user navigates forward through the workflow steps to return to the Review page.
> 5. If user needs to pause the claim submission process:
>    5.1 User clicks 'Save and Exit' to preserve the current claim state in draft status for later retrieval and completion.
> 6. If user decides to abandon the claim creation:
>    6.1 User clicks 'Withdraw' button to cancel the entire claim intake process.
> 7. User submits the claim by clicking 'Submit Claim' button to complete the intake process and move the claim to processing stage.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the user has completed Steps 1-4 of Pet Claim Intake with all required data entered,
>    **When** the user navigates to Step 5,
>    **Then** the system displays the claim number (format C########) and a read-only summary of all previously entered information organized into Policy and Pet, Provider, Claim Details, Additional Information, Payment Method, and Total Charges sections.
>
> 2. **Given** the user is on the Review Claim page,
>    **When** the user views the page,
>    **Then** no fields are editable, 'Select a Pet' dropdown is hidden, delete icons for pet and provider are hidden, and '+ Add New' links for additional information sections are hidden.
>
> 3. **Given** multiple claim types were selected in previous steps (e.g., Preventive Care, Injury, Illness, Medical Supplies),
>    **When** the user views the Additional Information section,
>    **Then** each claim type is displayed with its complete type-specific details in expandable/collapsible format.
>
> 4. **Given** the user entered multiple claim line items with charges in previous steps,
>    **When** the system displays the Total Charges section,
>    **Then** the total is automatically calculated as the sum of all line item charges from all claim types.
>
> 5. **Given** the user selected EFT as the payment method in Step 4,
>    **When** the system displays Payment Method details,
>    **Then** the account number and routing number are displayed in masked format for security, along with account type, account holder, bank name, and effective dates.
>
> 6. **Given** the user selected Check as the payment method in Step 4,
>    **When** the system displays Payment Method details,
>    **Then** the complete mailing address for check delivery is displayed.
>
> 7. **Given** the user identifies incorrect information during review,
>    **When** the user clicks the 'Previous' button,
>    **Then** the system navigates back to the previous step (Step 4: Payment Details) allowing the user to make corrections.
>
> 8. **Given** the user has made corrections in an earlier step,
>    **When** the user navigates forward through the steps back to Step 5,
>    **Then** the Review page displays the updated information reflecting all corrections.
>
> 9. **Given** the user is on the Review Claim page and not ready to submit,
>    **When** the user clicks 'Save and Exit',
>    **Then** the system saves the claim in draft status and exits the workflow, allowing the claim to be retrieved within 30 days for completion.
>
> 10. **Given** the user is on the Review Claim page and decides not to proceed,
>     **When** the user clicks 'Withdraw',
>     **Then** the system cancels the claim intake process and abandons the current claim being created.
>
> 11. **Given** the user has reviewed all claim information and confirmed accuracy,
>     **When** the user clicks 'Submit Claim',
>     **Then** the system submits the claim for processing, moves the claim to the next stage in the claim lifecycle, and confirms successful submission.
>
> 12. **Given** the user is on the Review Claim page,
>     **When** the user views the 5-step progress indicator,
>     **Then** Step 5 is highlighted as the current active step, and all previous steps (1-4) show as completed.
>
> 13. **Given** the claim includes Injury details with related services,
>     **When** the user reviews the Injury section,
>     **Then** all related services (hospital stay, medication, physiotherapy) are displayed with their respective dates, descriptions, and charges.
>
> 14. **Given** the claim includes provider information entered in Step 2,
>     **When** the user reviews the Provider section,
>     **Then** the provider license number, complete address, and phone number are displayed exactly as entered.

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want the system to automatically initialize and validate claims based on policy integration and applicability rules during intake, so that eligible claims are created efficiently without manual intervention.
- **Role**: Claims Operations Manager
- **Action**: automatically initialize and validate dental claims through a structured four-step intake workflow with policy integration and applicability rules
- **Value**: eligible dental claims are created efficiently with complete data validation, proper draft management, and automated claim submission without manual intervention

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Operations Manager,
> **I want to** automatically initialize and validate dental claims through a structured four-step intake workflow with policy integration and applicability rules,
> **so that** eligible dental claims are created efficiently with complete data validation, proper draft management, and automated claim submission without manual intervention.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates dental claim creation through a structured four-step wizard (Policy and Patient Selection  Claim Info Entry  Upload Documents  Review and Submit).
> 2. During Step 1 (Policy and Patient Selection):
>    2.1 System prevents premature claim creation by disabling action buttons until required policy and patient information is provided.
>    2.2 User searches and selects the applicable policy and patient.
>    2.3 System enables claim creation and initiates the loss event through the initLoss command.
>    2.4 System transitions the interface to support ongoing claim development by enabling draft-saving and replacing cancellation with withdrawal options.
> 3. During Step 2 (Claim Info Entry):
>    3.1 User enters detailed claim information with validation applied through UIClaimInfoValidation rules.
>    3.2 System saves draft state through updateLossDraft command when navigating forward or backward.
>    3.3 User can navigate to previous or next steps, with system maintaining visited step history.
> 4. During Step 3 (Upload Documents):
>    4.1 User uploads supporting documentation for the claim.
>    4.2 System saves draft state when navigating between steps.
> 5. During Step 4 (Review and Submit):
>    5.1 User reviews complete claim information before submission.
>    5.2 System applies comprehensive validation through ClaimUpdateValidation rules.
>    5.3 System executes ClaimSubmitAction to locate the correct policy version and create the claim.
>    5.4 System navigates to submission confirmation upon successful claim creation.
> 6. Throughout the intake process after claim initiation:
>    6.1 User can save work-in-progress and exit at any point, with system persisting data even if validation has not yet been satisfied.
>    6.2 User can withdraw the claim with confirmation, resulting in claim closure with 'Abandoned' reason.
>    6.3 User can close the claim with confirmation, resulting in claim closure with 'Canceled' reason.
>    6.4 User can navigate backward to previous steps with draft data automatically saved.
> 7. System enforces workflow progression by marking steps as visited and maintaining state across navigation events.
> 8. System integrates with policy management to automatically identify applicable policy versions and validate coverage during claim submission.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the user opens the New Claim creation workspace for a dental claim,
>    **When** the system initializes,
>    **Then** the 'Create Claim and Continue' and 'Save & Exit' buttons are disabled until policy and patient are selected.
>
> 2. **Given** the user has selected a valid policy and patient in Step 1,
>    **When** the user clicks 'Create Claim and Continue',
>    **Then** the system calls initLoss command, marks Step 1 as visited, replaces 'Create Claim and Continue' with 'Next', replaces 'Cancel' with 'Withdraw', enables 'Save & Exit', and navigates to Step 2 Claim Info page.
>
> 3. **Given** the user is on Step 2 Claim Info page,
>    **When** the user clicks 'Next' without completing required claim information,
>    **Then** the system applies UIClaimInfoValidation rules and prevents navigation if validation fails, displaying appropriate error messages.
>
> 4. **Given** the user is on Step 2 Claim Info page with valid data entered,
>    **When** the user clicks 'Next',
>    **Then** the system calls updateLossDraft command, marks Step 2 as visited, and navigates to Step 3 Upload Documents page.
>
> 5. **Given** the user is on Step 3 Upload Documents page,
>    **When** the user clicks 'Next',
>    **Then** the system calls updateLossDraft command and navigates to Step 4 Review Claim page.
>
> 6. **Given** the user is on Step 4 Review Claim page,
>    **When** the user clicks 'Submit Claim',
>    **Then** the system validates data using ClaimUpdateValidation, executes ClaimSubmitAction, locates the correct policy version using Locate_Policy_Version business rule, creates the claim, and navigates to the submission result page.
>
> 7. **Given** the user has initiated a claim (after Step 1 completion) and is on any subsequent step,
>    **When** the user clicks 'Save & Exit' and confirms,
>    **Then** the system persists all entered data as a draft (even if validation has not passed) and exits the intake UI.
>
> 8. **Given** the user has initiated a claim and is on any step after Step 1,
>    **When** the user clicks 'Withdraw' and confirms the prompt 'Your changes will be lost. Are you sure you want to withdraw the claim and exit the form?',
>    **Then** the system closes the claim with reason 'Abandoned' and exits the intake UI.
>
> 9. **Given** the user has initiated a claim and is on any step after Step 1,
>    **When** the user clicks 'Close' and confirms the prompt 'Are you sure you want to close the claim and exit the form?',
>    **Then** the system closes the claim with reason 'Canceled' and exits the intake UI.
>
> 10. **Given** the user is on Step 2, Step 3, or Step 4,
>     **When** the user clicks 'Previous',
>     **Then** the system calls updateLossDraft command to save current state and navigates to the previous step, allowing the user to resume from that point.
>
> 11. **Given** the user navigates backward from Step 2 to Step 1,
>     **When** the system displays Step 1,
>     **Then** the 'Create Claim and Continue' button is displayed again (not 'Next'), and the user can modify policy/patient selection if needed.
>
> 12. **Given** the user completes all four steps and submits the claim,
>     **When** the system processes the submission,
>     **Then** the claim is created within the system, linked to the correct policy version, and the user is presented with a submission confirmation page.
>
> 13. **Negative Scenario - Given** the user is on Step 4 Review Claim page with incomplete or invalid data,
>     **When** the user clicks 'Submit Claim',
>     **Then** ClaimUpdateValidation fails, the system prevents submission, and displays specific validation error messages indicating the data issues.
>
> 14. **Negative Scenario - Given** the user has not yet clicked 'Create Claim and Continue' in Step 1,
>     **When** the user attempts to navigate or save,
>     **Then** the system prevents these actions as the claim has not been initialized.
>
> 15. **Given** the user saves a draft at any point after claim initiation,
>     **When** the user re-opens the draft claim,
>     **Then** all previously entered data is restored, visited steps are marked, and the user can continue from the last saved state.

### Epic: Operational Workflow & Task Management

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to access the Claim Intake queue, so that I can view and manage incoming claims that require processing.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: access the Claim Intake queue with proper authorization controls
- **Value**: I can view and manage incoming claims that require processing while maintaining secure, role-based access control

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** access the Claim Intake queue with proper authorization controls,
> **so that** I can view and manage incoming claims that require processing while maintaining secure, role-based access control.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Authenticated user attempts to access the Claim Intake queue within the CAP subsystem for Benefits/Dental line of business.
> 2. System validates user's assigned privileges against the 'Claim - Access Claim Intake Queue' privilege requirement.
>    2.1 **Main Flow (Authorized Access)**: When user possesses the required privilege (standard for Claim Adjuster and Claim Supervisor roles), system grants access to the Claim Intake queue and allows user to view and interact with pending claims for processing.
>    2.2 **Alternate Flow (Unauthorized Access)**: When user lacks the required privilege (e.g., Customer Service Representative role), system denies access to the Claim Intake queue and prevents viewing or interaction with claim intake operations.
> 3. Authorized users proceed to perform claim intake processing activities including viewing, assigning, and managing incoming claims within the queue.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a user with Claim Adjuster role is authenticated in CAP subsystem, **When** the user attempts to access the Claim Intake queue, **Then** the system grants access and displays the queue with all pending claims for the Benefits/Dental line of business.
> 2. **Given** a user with Claim Supervisor role is authenticated in CAP subsystem, **When** the user attempts to access the Claim Intake queue, **Then** the system grants access and allows full interaction with queue management functions.
> 3. **Given** a user with Customer Service Representative role is authenticated in CAP subsystem, **When** the user attempts to access the Claim Intake queue, **Then** the system denies access and does not display the Claim Intake queue interface.
> 4. **Given** an authenticated user without 'Claim - Access Claim Intake Queue' privilege, **When** the user attempts any direct navigation to Claim Intake queue, **Then** the system blocks access and prevents viewing of any claim intake data.
> 5. **Given** a user's role is modified to remove the 'Claim - Access Claim Intake Queue' privilege, **When** the user's next session begins, **Then** the system enforces the updated permissions and denies Claim Intake queue access.
> 6. **Given** a Claims Adjuster has accessed the Claim Intake queue, **When** viewing the queue, **Then** the user can perform standard claim intake operations (view, assign, process) according to their role permissions.
> 7. **Given** privilege assignment is based on user role configuration, **When** system evaluates access control, **Then** the decision is made in real-time based on current privilege assignments without requiring system restart.

#### Feature: As a Claims Supervisor, I want to access the Claim Intake queue, so that I can oversee and monitor intake operations.

- **Action**: access the Claim Intake queue within the Claims Adjudication Platform (CAP) subsystem
- **Value**: I can oversee and monitor intake operations for Dental/Benefits claims processing

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Supervisor,
> **I want to** access the Claim Intake queue within the Claims Adjudication Platform (CAP) subsystem,
> **so that** I can oversee and monitor intake operations for Dental/Benefits claims processing.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User authenticates and logs into the Claims Adjudication Platform (CAP) subsystem.
> 2. System validates user's assigned role and associated privileges.
> 3. For users with appropriate privilege:
>    3.1 System grants access to the Claim Intake queue specific to Dental/Benefits line of business.
>    3.2 User can view and interact with claims pending in the Claim Intake queue.
>    3.3 Claims Supervisor can oversee and monitor intake operations and claim processing activities.
> 4. For users without appropriate privilege:
>    4.1 System denies access to the Claim Intake queue.
>    4.2 Claim Intake queue remains hidden or inaccessible within the CAP interface.
>    4.3 User is restricted from viewing or interacting with intake queue contents.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a user with Claims Supervisor role who has 'Claim - Access Claim Intake Queue' privilege,
>    **When** the user accesses the Claims Adjudication Platform (CAP) subsystem,
>    **Then** the Claim Intake queue is visible and accessible for Dental/Benefits line of business.
>
> 2. **Given** a user with Claim Adjuster role who has 'Claim - Access Claim Intake Queue' privilege,
>    **When** the user logs into the CAP subsystem,
>    **Then** the user can successfully access and interact with the Claim Intake queue.
>
> 3. **Given** a user with Customer Service Representative role who does not have 'Claim - Access Claim Intake Queue' privilege,
>    **When** the user attempts to access the Claim Intake queue,
>    **Then** the queue is not visible or accessible within the CAP subsystem.
>
> 4. **Given** an authenticated user in the CAP subsystem,
>    **When** the system evaluates queue access permissions,
>    **Then** access is granted or denied based exclusively on the presence of 'Claim - Access Claim Intake Queue' privilege.
>
> 5. **Given** a user without 'Claim - Access Claim Intake Queue' privilege,
>    **When** the user navigates within the CAP subsystem,
>    **Then** the Claim Intake queue remains hidden and no access is provided regardless of other privileges.
>
> 6. **Given** the Claim Intake queue is active in the CAP subsystem,
>    **When** a Claims Supervisor with appropriate privilege accesses the queue,
>    **Then** the supervisor can view all pending claims and perform oversight activities for intake operations.
>
> 7. **Given** multiple users with different roles,
>    **When** access control is enforced,
>    **Then** only Claim Adjuster and Claim Supervisor roles are granted access by default, while Customer Service Representative role is explicitly excluded.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to assign, update, and complete tasks in the Claim Intake queue, so that I can manage the workflow and move claims through the intake process.

> [
>   "User authenticates to the CAP (Dental/Benefits) system and accesses the Claim Intake queue.",
>   "User with 'Control Claim Intake Queue' privilege performs queue management operations:",
>   "  2.1 Assigns tasks from the Claim Intake queue to appropriate personnel based on workload and expertise.",
>   "  2.2 Updates task information and status as work progresses through the intake process.",
>   "  2.3 Completes tasks once claim intake processing is finished.",
>   "System maintains an audit trail of all queue management actions performed by privileged users.",
>   "**Alternate Flow - Insufficient Privileges:**",
>   "  4.1 If user does NOT have 'Control Claim Intake Queue' privilege, system blocks all queue management operations.",
>   "  4.2 User cannot assign, update, or complete any tasks in the Claim Intake queue.",
>   "  4.3 System restricts complete access to the Claim Intake queue for unprivileged users."

>   "  - Then the task is removed from the active queue and completion is logged in the audit trail",

>   "  - Given a Customer Service Representative without 'Control Claim Intake Queue' privilege",
>   "  - When they attempt to access the Claim Intake queue",
>   "  - Then the system denies access and prevents all assign, update, and complete operations",
