>   "  - Given the system enforces role-based access control",
>   "  - When user roles are configured (Claims Adjuster, Claim Supervisor with privilege; CSR without privilege)",
>   "  - Then only users with explicitly granted privileges can perform queue management operations",
>   "**Scenario 7: Audit Trail Maintenance**",
>   "  - Given any queue management operation is performed by a privileged user",

>   "  - Then the system records the action, user identity, timestamp, and relevant details in the audit log"

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to initiate a new claim intake through a unified smart form interface, so that I can collect all required claim information consistently regardless of channel.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: initiate and complete a new claim intake through a unified smart form interface, collecting all required claim information consistently across channels (Portal, Call Center, CSSR)
- **Value**: all required claim information is collected consistently regardless of channel, reducing duplicate data entry, minimizing errors, and ensuring legal compliance from the first point of contact

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** initiate and complete a new claim intake through a unified smart form interface, collecting all required claim information consistently across channels (Portal, Call Center, CSSR),
> **so that** all required claim information is collected consistently regardless of channel, reducing duplicate data entry, minimizing errors, and ensuring legal compliance from the first point of contact.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates intake via CSSR Customer Portfolio  'Create New Claim' sub-button OR CAP Home page  'Portal Intake' button, with system calling Persona Core common module.
> 2. User selects or adds a member and inputs subject of claim information, with system validating the data.
>    2.1 If validation fails, user must edit and resubmit subject of claim information before proceeding.
> 3. Upon successful validation of subject of claim, system automatically creates an Event Case.
> 4. User inputs and updates case details, with system performing validation.
>    4.1 If validation fails, user must edit and resubmit case details before proceeding.
> 5. User inputs and updates additional information, with system performing validation.
>    5.1 If validation fails, user must edit and resubmit additional information before proceeding.
> 6. User uploads or updates supporting documents as needed.
> 7. User reviews all entered data across all sections and submits the intake, with system performing final comprehensive validation.
>    7.1 If final validation fails, user returns to edit any section (subject of claim, case details, additional information, or documents) and resubmits.
> 8. Upon successful submission, system evaluates applicability of the case to determine which claims should be created.
>    8.1 If no applicable claims are found, process ends or requires manual intervention with no claims created.
>    8.2 If at least one applicable claim exists, system proceeds to create claims.
> 9. System creates all applicable claim(s) based on the applicability evaluation results.
> 10. System evaluates eligibility and calculates benefits for created claims.
> 11. System checks if automatic payment is possible based on eligibility and benefit calculation results.
>    11.1 If automatic payment is possible, system creates payment template and proceeds to validation.
>    11.2 If automatic payment is not possible, manual payment process is required.
> 12. System validates the case for open status, with user potentially needing to edit case information if validation fails.
> 13. System supports continuation of incomplete intake sessions when individuals who started portal intake contact Call Center for assistance, allowing Call Center staff to continue from where the user left off.
> 14. All intake processes use the unified Smart Form UI technology regardless of entry channel to ensure consistency and reduce maintenance overhead.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a user initiates intake via CSSR Customer Portfolio or CAP Home page, **when** the system is accessed, **then** the Persona Core common module is called and the unified smart form interface loads within 3 seconds.
> 2. **Given** a user is entering subject of claim information, **when** the data is submitted, **then** the system validates the data and displays specific error messages for any validation failures within 2 seconds.
> 3. **Given** subject of claim validation passes, **when** the validation completes, **then** the system automatically creates an Event Case and assigns a unique case identifier.
> 4. **Given** a user is inputting case details, **when** validation fails, **then** the system displays inline error messages and prevents progression to the next step until corrections are made.
> 5. **Given** a user is inputting additional information, **when** validation fails, **then** the system displays inline error messages and prevents progression to document upload until corrections are made.
> 6. **Given** a user uploads documents, **when** documents are submitted, **then** the system accepts common file formats (PDF, JPG, PNG, DOCX) up to specified size limits and associates them with the Event Case.
> 7. **Given** a user reviews and submits all intake data, **when** final validation is performed, **then** the system validates all sections comprehensively and either accepts submission or returns user to specific failed sections with clear error indicators.
> 8. **Given** final validation fails, **when** the user is returned to edit, **then** the user can modify any section (subject of claim, case details, additional information, or documents) and all previously entered valid data is preserved.
> 9. **Given** the intake submission is successful, **when** applicability evaluation runs, **then** the system completes evaluation within 5 seconds and identifies all applicable claims based on policy and coverage rules.
> 10. **Given** no applicable claims are found during evaluation, **when** the evaluation completes, **then** the system ends the process without creating claims and notifies the user of the outcome.
> 11. **Given** at least one applicable claim exists, **when** evaluation completes, **then** the system automatically creates all identified applicable claims with unique claim identifiers.
> 12. **Given** claims are created, **when** eligibility and benefit calculation runs, **then** the system completes calculations within 10 seconds and stores results against each claim.
> 13. **Given** eligibility and benefits are calculated, **when** automatic payment check runs, **then** the system determines payment eligibility and either creates a payment template (if automatic payment possible) or flags for manual payment processing.
> 14. **Given** automatic payment is possible, **when** the payment template is created, **then** the system validates the case for open status and either opens the case or presents validation errors.
> 15. **Given** validation for open status fails, **when** the error is presented, **then** the user can edit necessary case information to resolve validation issues.
> 16. **Given** a Call Center staff member is assisting intake, **when** they use the unified interface, **then** the same validation rules, workflows, and data collection processes apply as for self-service portal intake.
> 17. **Given** an individual started intake via portal but encountered problems, **when** they contact Call Center, **then** Call Center staff can access and continue the incomplete intake session from where the individual left off.
> 18. **Given** customer data requires confirmation during intake, **when** the data is presented, **then** the user can update address, payment method, and work details within the intake flow.
> 19. **Given** an intake must be processed for a non-customer claimant, **when** the intake is initiated, **then** the system allows intake creation and processes it according to legal obligations without requiring existing customer status.
> 20. **Given** an intake is split into multiple claims, **when** claims are created, **then** the system maintains linkage between all claims and the originating Event Case for tracking and reporting purposes.


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=737159598"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to save incomplete claim intake as a draft case, so that I can resume intake processing later without losing entered information.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: initiate and complete a comprehensive claim intake process through a multi-step workflow, including the ability to save incomplete intake as a draft case and resume processing later
- **Value**: I can capture complete and accurate claim information at first point of contact, avoid data loss when interruptions occur, and efficiently manage intake workflow across multiple sessions while meeting legal obligations for claim registration

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** initiate and complete a comprehensive claim intake process through a multi-step workflow, including the ability to save incomplete intake as a draft case and resume processing later,
> **so that** I can capture complete and accurate claim information at first point of contact, avoid data loss when interruptions occur, and efficiently manage intake workflow across multiple sessions while meeting legal obligations for claim registration.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates new Event Case through role-specific entry points:
>    1.1 Portal users access via CSSR Customer Portfolio  'Create New Claim' or CAP Home page  'Portal Intake' button
>    1.2 Call Center representatives access via Persona Core common module
> 2. User inputs Subject of Claim details by selecting or adding member information and completing all required fields, with system performing real-time validation
> 3. Upon successful validation of Subject of Claim, system creates the Event Case in the system
> 4. User enters Case Details including loss date, location, description, and other required case information with system validation
> 5. User provides Additional Information as supplementary data to support claim evaluation, with system validation
> 6. User uploads supporting documentation to attach evidence and related materials to the intake
> 7. User saves incomplete intake as draft at any point during the process:
>    7.1 User clicks 'Save & Exit' to preserve all entered data and leave the intake workflow
>    7.2 System saves case with 'Incomplete' status, allowing retrieval and resumption within retention period
>    7.3 User can return later to continue from the saved state without re-entering information
> 8. User reviews all entered information for completeness and accuracy before final submission
> 9. User submits completed intake data, triggering comprehensive system validation
>    9.1 If validation fails, system returns user to edit workflow with specific error indicators, requiring correction of Subject of Claim, Case Details, Additional Information, or document uploads before resubmission
>    9.2 Validation cycle repeats until all data passes validation rules
> 10. System evaluates applicability to determine if intake qualifies for claim creation based on policy coverage and business rules
> 11. System checks for at least one applicable claim based on intake data and policy evaluation:
>     11.1 If no applicable claims exist, process ends or routes to manual review without automatic claim creation
>     11.2 If applicable claims exist, system proceeds to claim generation
> 12. System automatically creates one or more claims based on validated intake data and applicability results
> 13. System evaluates claimant eligibility against policy terms and calculates benefit amounts for each created claim
> 14. System determines payment method availability:
>     14.1 If automatic payment is possible, system creates payment template for processing
>     14.2 If automatic payment is not possible, system flags for manual payment processing
> 15. System navigates user to Case Overview screen displaying created Event Case and associated claims
> 16. System supports cross-channel continuity:
>     16.1 When individual starts intake via Portal but encounters issues, Call Center representative can continue the same intake process on behalf of the reporting party
>     16.2 Intake data can be modified later using intake UI components or specialized adjuster interfaces during review cycle until final submission


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Portal user or Call Center representative is logged in, **when** they access the intake entry point for their role, **then** the system displays the appropriate intake initiation interface within 2 seconds.
> 2. **Given** the user is entering Subject of Claim details, **when** they select or add a valid member, **then** the system performs real-time validation and enables progression to Event Case creation.
> 3. **Given** Subject of Claim validation passes, **when** the user proceeds, **then** the system creates an Event Case with unique identifier and timestamp within 3 seconds.
> 4. **Given** the user is at any step in the intake workflow (Subject of Claim, Case Details, Additional Information, or Document Upload), **when** they click 'Save & Exit', **then** the system:
>    4.1 Saves all entered data including partial field values
>    4.2 Sets case status to 'Incomplete'
>    4.3 Displays confirmation message
>    4.4 Returns user to their home page or dashboard
> 5. **Given** a case has been saved with 'Incomplete' status, **when** the same user accesses their draft cases within 30 days, **then** the system displays the saved case and allows resumption from the exact point where it was saved.
> 6. **Given** the user has completed all required fields across all intake steps, **when** they submit the intake for final processing, **then** the system validates all data within 5 seconds.
> 7. **Given** validation fails during submission, **when** the system identifies specific errors, **then**:
>    7.1 The system returns the user to the edit workflow
>    7.2 Inline error messages appear next to each invalid field
>    7.3 The user must correct errors and resubmit
>    7.4 The cycle repeats until validation passes
> 8. **Given** required fields (loss date, reporting party name, or contact information) are missing, **when** the user attempts to submit, **then** the system blocks submission and displays specific field-level error messages.
> 9. **Given** intake data passes all validation checks, **when** the system evaluates applicability, **then** the applicability evaluation completes within 10 seconds and determines eligibility for claim creation.
> 10. **Given** applicability evaluation determines no applicable claims exist, **when** the evaluation completes, **then** the system:
>     10.1 Does not create any claims automatically
>     10.2 Routes the case to manual review queue or ends the process per business rules
> 11. **Given** applicability evaluation identifies at least one applicable claim, **when** the evaluation completes, **then** the system automatically creates all applicable claims with proper linkage to the Event Case.
> 12. **Given** claims are created successfully, **when** the system evaluates eligibility and benefits, **then** each claim displays calculated benefit amounts based on policy terms and claimant eligibility.
> 13. **Given** automatic payment is determined possible, **when** the benefit calculation completes, **then** the system creates a payment template ready for processing without manual intervention.
> 14. **Given** automatic payment is not possible, **when** the system completes eligibility evaluation, **then** the claim is flagged for manual payment processing with appropriate workflow assignment.
> 15. **Given** the intake submission and claim creation process completes, **when** all backend processing finishes, **then** the system navigates the user to Case Overview screen displaying the Event Case, all created claims, and their statuses.
> 16. **Given** the claimant is not a customer of the insurance company, **when** the user attempts to process the intake, **then** the system allows intake creation and processing without restriction due to legal obligation requirements.
> 17. **Given** an individual started intake via Portal and encounters issues, **when** they contact the Call Center, **then** the Call Center representative can retrieve the incomplete Portal intake and continue processing using the Call Center UI on behalf of the reporting party.
> 18. **Given** a case status is 'Open' (not 'Incomplete'), **when** validation requirements are checked, **then** the system applies stricter validation rules appropriate for open status.
> 19. **Given** an intake has been submitted but not finalized, **when** users access the case during the review cycle, **then** they can update case details using intake UI components or specialized adjuster interfaces until final submission.
> 20. **Given** the user accesses the intake workflow, **when** they interact with the Smart Form UI, **then** the interface presents structured data collection for Subject of Claim, Case Details, Additional Information, and document uploads with consistent experience across Portal and Call Center channels.

> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to submit completed intake information to create a case and claim record, so that the claim moves into the next processing stage.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: submit completed intake information to create a case and claim record
- **Value**: the claim moves into the next processing stage with proper validation, eligibility evaluation, and automated payment processing where applicable

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** submit completed intake information to create a case and claim record,
> **so that** the claim moves into the next processing stage with proper validation, eligibility evaluation, and automated payment processing where applicable.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates the claim intake process through designated entry points (Portal via CSSR Customer Portfolio 'Create New Claim' or CAP Home page 'Portal Intake' button).
> 2. User selects an existing member or adds a new member with all required member information.
> 3. User enters Subject of Claim details, which the system validates before allowing progression.
>    3.1 If validation fails, user can edit Subject of Claim information and resubmit for validation.
> 4. Upon successful Subject of Claim validation, the system creates an Event Case.
> 5. User provides comprehensive case details, which are validated by the system.
>    5.1 If validation fails, user can edit Case Details and resubmit for validation.
> 6. User enters additional information to supplement the case record.
>    6.1 If validation fails, user can edit Additional Information and resubmit for validation.
> 7. User uploads supporting documents as needed throughout the intake process.
> 8. User reviews all entered information, and the system performs comprehensive validation of all submitted data.
>    8.1 If validation fails at final review, user can edit any section (Subject of Claim, Case Details, Additional Information, or Documents) and the process continues from the edited section forward through validation.
> 9. Upon successful validation, the system evaluates applicability to determine if claims can be created from the intake data.
> 10. System checks whether at least one applicable claim exists based on the intake information.
>    10.1 If no applicable claims exist, the process ends or requires manual review, and no claims are created.
>    10.2 If at least one applicable claim exists, the system creates the applicable claim(s).
> 11. System performs eligibility assessment and calculates benefit amounts for created claims.
> 12. System determines whether automatic payment processing is possible based on claim attributes and business rules.
>    12.1 If automatic payment is possible, the system generates a payment template for approved benefits.
>    12.2 If automatic payment is not possible, manual payment processing is required and no template is automatically created.
> 13. For interrupted portal intakes, Call Center representatives can access and continue the intake using Call Center UI.
> 14. Intake data can be modified post-submission using existing intake UI components or specialized adjuster interfaces.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a user initiates claim intake from a valid entry point, **when** the core persona module loads, **then** the member selection/addition interface is displayed within 2 seconds.
> 2. **Given** a user enters Subject of Claim details, **when** validation is performed, **then** the system either allows progression to Event Case creation or displays specific inline error messages indicating required corrections.
> 3. **Given** Subject of Claim validation is successful, **when** the user proceeds, **then** the system creates an Event Case with a unique identifier and enables Case Details entry.
> 4. **Given** a user is entering Case Details, Additional Information, or uploading documents, **when** validation fails at any checkpoint, **then** the user can edit the specific section and resubmit, with the process continuing from the edited section forward.
> 5. **Given** a user completes the Review and Submit step with all valid data, **when** comprehensive validation passes, **then** the system initiates applicability evaluation within 5 seconds.
> 6. **Given** applicability evaluation is complete, **when** at least one applicable claim exists, **then** the system creates all applicable claim records with proper linkage to the Event Case.
>    6.1 **Given** no applicable claims exist, **when** evaluation completes, **then** the intake is marked for review and no claim records are created.
> 7. **Given** claim(s) are created, **when** eligibility assessment completes, **then** the system calculates benefit amounts according to policy terms and stores results in the claim record.
> 8. **Given** eligibility and benefits are calculated, **when** automatic payment criteria are met, **then** the system generates a payment template with calculated amounts and payee information.
>    8.1 **Given** automatic payment criteria are not met, **when** evaluation completes, **then** the claim is flagged for manual payment processing without template creation.
> 9. **Given** a non-customer attempts to file a claim, **when** intake is initiated, **then** the system accepts the intake and requires customer data validation (address, payment method, work details) to fulfill legal obligations.
> 10. **Given** a user interrupts a portal intake, **when** a Call Center representative accesses the case, **then** the representative can view all previously entered data and continue the intake process.
> 11. **Given** intake submission is successful, **when** a single intake generates multiple related claims, **then** all created claims are properly linked to the originating Event Case and to each other.
> 12. **Given** a user uploads documents during intake, **when** the documents are submitted, **then** the system associates all documents with the Event Case and makes them accessible in subsequent claim processing stages.
> 13. **Given** an intake is completed and claims are created, **when** post-submission modifications are needed, **then** authorized users can access existing intake UI components or specialized adjuster interfaces to modify intake data.
> 14. **Given** validation fails at final review, **when** the user edits multiple sections (Subject of Claim, Case Details, Additional Information, Documents), **then** the system re-validates all edited sections and their dependencies before allowing final submission.
> 15. **Given** all intake steps are completed successfully, **when** the process concludes, **then** the system navigates to the Case Overview screen displaying the created Event Case and associated claim(s).

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to input and validate claim subject details, case details, and additional information through guided intake steps, so that all required information is captured accurately.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: input and validate claim subject details, case details, member information, additional information, and supporting documents through a guided intake workflow
- **Value**: all required information is captured accurately, validated systematically, and processed for claim creation and benefit calculation

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** input and validate claim subject details, case details, member information, additional information, and supporting documents through a guided intake workflow,
> **so that** all required information is captured accurately, validated systematically, and processed for claim creation and benefit calculation.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates the claim intake process via Portal (CSSR Customer Portfolio  'Create New Claim') or CAP Home page ('Portal Intake' button), which invokes Persona Core common module.
> 2. User inputs and updates Subject of Claim details, and system validates the information.
>   2.1. If validation fails, system displays validation errors, user corrects the details and resubmits for re-validation.
>   2.2. Upon successful validation, system proceeds to create Event Case.
> 3. System creates an Event Case after Subject of Claim validation passes.
> 4. User inputs and updates detailed Case Details, and system validates the information.
>   4.1. If validation fails, system displays validation errors, user corrects the details and resubmits for re-validation.
> 5. User selects an existing member or adds a new member with all required information.
>   5.1. For non-customer claims (legal obligation), system allows creation of non-customer records with appropriate flags.
> 6. User inputs and updates Additional Information, and system validates the data.
>   6.1. If validation fails, system displays validation errors, user corrects the information and resubmits for re-validation.
> 7. User uploads documents related to the claim and can update documents as needed.
> 8. User reviews all entered information across all sections and submits the intake data.
> 9. System performs comprehensive validation check on all submitted data against business rules for Open status.
>   9.1. If validation fails, system returns user to edit case information, allowing navigation to any relevant section (Subject of Claim, Case Details, Member, Additional Information, Documents) to correct data.
>   9.2. After corrections, user reviews and submits again, returning to validation check.
> 10. System evaluates applicability for claim creation, determining applicable coverage and policy rules.
>   10.1. During evaluation, if intake qualifies for splitting, system determines that multiple claims should be created from the single intake based on business rules.
>   10.2. If intake must be declined, system or user marks the intake as declined with documented reason, and process does not proceed to claim creation.
> 11. System checks if at least one applicable claim exists based on evaluation results.
>   11.1. If no applicable claims exist, process ends or requires manual review without proceeding to claim creation.
> 12. System creates one or more applicable claims based on applicability evaluation (including split claims if determined).
> 13. System assesses claimant eligibility against policy terms and calculates benefit amounts based on coverage rules.
> 14. System determines if payment can be processed automatically.
>   14.1. If automatic payment is not possible, manual payment processing is required.
> 15. System generates payment template for automatic or manual payment processing.
> 16. At any point before final submission, users can return to edit any section of the intake and continue through the workflow normally.
> 17. If Portal user encounters issues during intake, Call Center representative can access the incomplete intake via Call Center UI and continue the process on behalf of the customer from the point where customer left off.
> 18. In exceptional cases requiring adjuster involvement, adjuster uses Call Center UI to collect intake data with additional access rights, following the same process steps; intake data modifications can later be performed using intake UI components or specialized adjuster interfaces.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a user initiates claim intake from Portal or CAP Home page, **when** the process starts, **then** the Persona Core common module is invoked and the Subject of Claim input interface is displayed.
> 2. **Given** a user inputs Subject of Claim details, **when** validation is triggered, **then** the system validates the data and either proceeds to Event Case creation or displays inline validation errors.
> 3. **Given** Subject of Claim validation passes, **when** the system processes the data, **then** an Event Case is created successfully.
> 4. **Given** a user inputs Case Details, **when** validation is triggered, **then** the system validates the data and either proceeds to the next step or displays inline validation errors.
> 5. **Given** a user needs to add member information, **when** the member is a non-customer (legal obligation scenario), **then** the system allows creation of non-customer records with appropriate flags.
> 6. **Given** a user inputs Additional Information, **when** validation is triggered, **then** the system validates the data and either proceeds to document upload or displays inline validation errors.
> 7. **Given** a user uploads documents, **when** documents are submitted, **then** the system accepts and stores the documents, allowing updates as needed.
> 8. **Given** a user completes all intake sections and reviews information, **when** the user submits the intake data, **then** the system performs comprehensive validation against all business rules for Open status.
> 9. **Given** comprehensive validation fails after submission, **when** the system returns errors, **then** the user can navigate to any relevant section (Subject of Claim, Case Details, Member, Additional Information, Documents) to correct data and resubmit.
> 10. **Given** all validation passes, **when** the system evaluates applicability, **then** the system determines applicable coverage, policy rules, and whether intake should be split into multiple claims.
> 11. **Given** applicability evaluation determines multiple claims should be created, **when** the system processes the intake, **then** multiple claims are created from the single intake based on business rules, and each follows standard downstream processing.
> 12. **Given** applicability evaluation completes, **when** at least one applicable claim exists, **then** the system creates the applicable claim(s) and proceeds to eligibility and benefit calculation.
> 13. **Given** applicability evaluation determines no applicable claims exist, **when** the system processes the result, **then** the process ends or requires manual review without proceeding to claim creation.
> 14. **Given** applicability evaluation or validation determines intake must be declined, **when** the system or user declines the intake, **then** the intake is marked as declined with documented reason and does not proceed to claim creation.
> 15. **Given** claim(s) are created, **when** the system evaluates eligibility, **then** claimant eligibility is assessed against policy terms and benefit amounts are calculated based on coverage rules.
> 16. **Given** eligibility and benefits are calculated, **when** the system determines if automatic payment is possible, **then** the system either processes automatic payment or flags for manual payment processing.
> 17. **Given** payment processing determination is made, **when** the system generates payment template, **then** the payment template is created for automatic or manual payment processing as appropriate.
> 18. **Given** a user is in any step before final submission, **when** the user chooses to edit previously entered information, **then** the system allows navigation back to any section and continues the workflow normally after edits.
> 19. **Given** a Portal user encounters issues during intake, **when** a Call Center representative accesses the incomplete intake via Call Center UI, **then** the representative can continue the process on behalf of the customer from the point where the customer left off.
> 20. **Given** an exceptional case requiring adjuster involvement, **when** the adjuster uses Call Center UI to collect intake data, **then** the adjuster follows the same process steps with additional access rights, and intake data modifications can later be performed using intake UI components or specialized adjuster interfaces.
> 21. **Given** any validation checkpoint throughout the process, **when** customer information (address, payment method, work details) is encountered, **then** the system prompts for confirmation and allows updates as needed.

### Epic: User Experience & Workspace Management

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to search and filter cases and claims across all domains using a unified search interface, so that I can quickly locate relevant claims regardless of product line or LOB
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: search and filter cases and claims across all domains (Benefits, P&C, Dental) using a unified search interface with single-line quick search and advanced multi-criteria search capabilities
- **Value**: I can quickly locate relevant claims regardless of product line or LOB, reducing search time and improving operational efficiency

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** search and filter cases and claims across all domains (Benefits, P&C, Dental) using a unified search interface with single-line quick search and advanced multi-criteria search capabilities,
> **so that** I can quickly locate relevant claims regardless of product line or LOB, reducing search time and improving operational efficiency.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User activates unified search interface to locate cases and claims across all domains (Benefits, P&C, Dental).
> 2. User performs Single-Line Quick Search by clicking the search icon, entering free-text into the search bar, and receiving auto-suggestions.
>    2.1 System queries multiple fields simultaneously based on free-text input and displays top 5 matching results as auto-suggestions.
>    2.2 Auto-suggestions display entity identifiers and subject/name based on claim type: Benefits claims show Case Number and Claim Number with Subject of Claim; P&C claims show Claim Number with Subject of Claim; Dental claims show Claim Number with Patient name.
>    2.3 User selects a result from auto-suggestions to navigate directly to the appropriate destination based on entity type and status.
>    2.4 User clicks 'View All' link to see full search results table in the Case/Claim Search Result and Case/Claim List view.
>    2.5 User clears search input by clicking the clear (X) button, which removes text and auto-suggestions.
> 3. User performs Advanced Search by clicking the Advanced Search Filter Icon to open the advanced search panel.
>    3.1 User enters search criteria across multiple specific fields including Case #, Claim #, Date of Loss/Date of Service, party names (First Name, Last Name), Customer #, address fields (State, ZIP Code, City), Policy Number, Claim Type/LOB, Tax ID, and Business Name.
>    3.2 User selects one or multiple claim types from the Claim Type/LOB multi-select dropdown (CI, HI, Life, Accident, STD, LTD, SMP, Leave, Dental, Permanent Life, Auto, Home).
>    3.3 For P&C Home claims, system uses covered property address for State, ZIP Code, and City fields instead of party address.
>    3.4 User clicks Search button to submit the search request.
>    3.5 System closes the advanced search panel and displays results in the Case/Claim Search Result and Case/Claim List view.
>    3.6 User clears all advanced search criteria by clicking the Clear button.
> 4. User switches between entity types (Customers, Quotes/Policies, Compensations, Case/Claims) using the Entity Selector Button to change search context.
> 5. System redirects user to appropriate destination based on entity type and status:
>    5.1 For Benefits Claims with both case and claim existing, system redirects to Claim Overview page.
>    5.2 For Benefits Claims with case only and incomplete intake, system redirects to Member Form.
>    5.3 For Benefits Claims with case only and complete intake, system redirects to Event Case Overview.
>    5.4 For Dental Claims with Incomplete status, system redirects to Dental Claim Intake.
>    5.5 For Dental Claims with Pending/Open/Suspended/Closed status, system redirects to Dental Claim Overview.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the user clicks the search icon, **When** the action is executed, **Then** the search bar is activated with cursor positioned in the input field.
> 2. **Given** the user enters free-text into the single-line search bar, **When** text is entered, **Then** the system displays top 5 matching results as auto-suggestions by querying multiple fields simultaneously.
> 3. **Given** the user searches for Benefits Claims with both case and claim existing, **When** auto-suggestions are displayed, **Then** the system shows Case Number and Claim Number on the left and Subject of Claim on the right.
> 4. **Given** the user searches for Benefits Claims with case only (intake incomplete), **When** auto-suggestions are displayed, **Then** the system shows Case # only without Claim Number.
> 5. **Given** the user searches for P&C Claims, **When** auto-suggestions are displayed, **Then** the system shows Claim Number on the left and Subject of Claim on the right, with no case number displayed.
> 6. **Given** the user searches for Dental Claims, **When** auto-suggestions are displayed, **Then** the system shows Claim Number on the left and Patient name on the right, with case number auto-generated but not shown in UI.
> 7. **Given** the user selects a result from auto-suggestions for Benefits Claims (both case and claim exist), **When** the selection is made, **Then** the system redirects to Claim Overview page.
> 8. **Given** the user selects a result from auto-suggestions for Benefits Claims (case only, intake incomplete), **When** the selection is made, **Then** the system redirects to Member Form.
> 9. **Given** the user selects a result from auto-suggestions for Benefits Claims (case only, intake complete), **When** the selection is made, **Then** the system redirects to Event Case Overview.
> 10. **Given** the user selects a result from auto-suggestions for Dental Claims with Incomplete status, **When** the selection is made, **Then** the system redirects to Dental Claim Intake.
> 11. **Given** the user selects a result from auto-suggestions for Dental Claims with Pending/Open/Suspended/Closed status, **When** the selection is made, **Then** the system redirects to Dental Claim Overview.
> 12. **Given** the user clicks 'View All' link, **When** the action is executed, **Then** the system displays full search results in the Case/Claim Search Result and Case/Claim List view.
> 13. **Given** the user clicks the clear (X) button in the search bar, **When** the action is executed, **Then** the system removes entered text and clears all auto-suggestions.
> 14. **Given** the user clicks the Advanced Search Filter Icon, **When** the action is executed, **Then** the advanced search panel opens with all available search fields displayed.
> 15. **Given** the user enters criteria in advanced search fields and clicks Search button, **When** the action is executed, **Then** the system submits the search request, closes the advanced panel, and displays results in the Case/Claim Search Result and Case/Claim List view.
> 16. **Given** the user performs advanced search for P&C Home claims, **When** State, ZIP Code, or City fields are used, **Then** the system uses covered property address instead of party address.
> 17. **Given** the user clicks Clear button in advanced search panel, **When** the action is executed, **Then** the system clears all input fields in the advanced search panel.
> 18. **Given** the user interacts with Entity Selector Button, **When** a different entity type is selected (Customers, Quotes/Policies, Compensations, Case/Claims), **Then** the system updates the search context to the selected entity type.
> 19. **Given** the user selects multiple claim types from the Claim Type/LOB dropdown, **When** search is performed, **Then** the system returns results matching any of the selected claim types (CI, HI, Life, Accident, STD, LTD, SMP, Leave, Dental, Permanent Life, Auto, Home).
> 20. **Given** all search fields map to REST API Search Claim endpoints, **When** any search is performed, **Then** the system successfully queries the API and returns results within acceptable response time.
> 21. **Given** the user enters search criteria that returns no results, **When** search is executed, **Then** the system displays an appropriate "no results found" message without errors.
> 22. **Given** the Case # field in advanced search, **When** user attempts to search for Dental claims, **Then** the Case # field is not applicable and either disabled or excluded from the search criteria for Dental domain.
> 23. **Given** the Business Name field in advanced search, **When** user attempts to search for P&C claims, **Then** the Business Name field is not applicable and either disabled or excluded from the search criteria for P&C domain.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view and navigate case and claim lists with consistent sorting and filtering across Benefits, P&C, Dental, and Pet products, so that I can manage my workload efficiently across all claim types
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view and navigate case and claim lists with consistent sorting and filtering across Benefits, P&C, Dental, and Pet products
- **Value**: I can manage my workload efficiently across all claim types

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view and navigate case and claim lists with consistent sorting and filtering across Benefits, P&C, Dental, and Pet products,
> **so that** I can manage my workload efficiently across all claim types.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User navigates to the Claims tab on the customer portfolio page to access the unified claim list.
> 2. System retrieves and displays all claims associated with the current customer across all product lines (Benefits, P&C, Dental, Pet).
> 3. System presents claims with product-specific formatting and field values:
>    3.1 For Benefits claims: displays case records (with or without claims) and claim records where current customer is Subject Of Claim/Patient, showing claim case numbers.
>    3.2 For P&C claims: displays associated risk items in Subject Of Claim/Patient field, with tooltip support for multiple items; Claim Case field shows '-'.
>    3.3 For Dental claims: displays patient name in Subject Of Claim/Patient field and earliest Date of Service; Claim Case field shows '-'.
>    3.4 For Pet claims: displays pet name in Subject Of Claim/Patient field, with Date of Service (for Preventive Care/Injury/Illness) or Date Purchased (for Medical Supplies); Claim Case field shows '-'.
> 4. System applies intelligent sorting based on view context:
>    4.1 In Claim View (multi-product): sorts by Date of Loss/Date of Service in descending order.
>    4.2 In Case View (Benefits only): primary sort by Case number descending, secondary sort by Claim number descending, with records without claim numbers appearing last.
> 5. System enables user to identify and access specific claims for detailed review and processing.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. Given the user has PRIV>CAP>Case: Load Event Case and PRIV>CAP>Claim: Load Claim privileges, when the user clicks the 'Claims' tab on the customer portfolio page, then the system retrieves and displays the claim list within 3 seconds.
> 2. Given the user is viewing the claim list, when Benefits claims are displayed, then case records and claim records where the current customer is the Subject Of Claim/Patient are shown with claim case numbers visible.
> 3. Given the user is viewing P&C claims, when a claim has multiple associated risk items, then the Subject Of Claim/Patient field displays '...' and shows all risk items in a tooltip on mouse hover.
> 4. Given the user is viewing P&C, Dental, or Pet claims, when the claim list is displayed, then the Claim Case field shows '-' for all these claim types.
> 5. Given the user is viewing Dental claims, when the claim list is displayed, then the Subject Of Claim/Patient field shows the patient name and the DOL/DOS field shows the earliest Date of Service.
> 6. Given the user is viewing Pet claims, when the claim type is Preventive Care/Injury/Illness, then the DOL/DOS field displays the earliest Date of Service.
> 7. Given the user is viewing Pet claims, when the claim type is Medical Supplies, then the DOL/DOS field displays the Date Purchased.
> 8. Given the user is in Claim View (containing Benefits, P&C, Dental, and Pet claims), when the list is displayed, then claims are sorted by DOL/DOS in descending order.
> 9. Given the user is in Case View (containing only Benefits claims), when the list is displayed, then claims are sorted first by Case number in descending order, then by Claim number in descending order, with records without claim numbers appearing last.
> 10. Given the user does not have required privileges, when attempting to access the Claims tab, then the system prevents access and displays an appropriate authorization message.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to access a unified case overview page that displays case information, related claims, parties, and case management actions, so that I can manage all aspects of a case from a single location
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: access a unified case overview page that displays case information, related claims, parties, and case management actions through the 'I want to' menu
- **Value**: I can manage all aspects of a case from a single location with quick access to common case actions

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** access a unified case overview page that displays case information, related claims, parties, and case management actions through the 'I want to' menu,
> **so that** I can manage all aspects of a case from a single location with quick access to common case actions.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User accesses the case overview page which displays comprehensive case information, related claims, parties, and management options.",
>   "2. User interacts with the 'I want to' dropdown menu through a three-level hierarchy to perform case management actions.",
>   "3. User creates new claims based on case context and claim event type:",
>   "   3.1. For general claims, user selects 'Create New Claim' > 'Other Claim' to open the Add New Claim page.",
>   "   3.2. For Absence-related claims (when 'Absence' claim event is selected), user can create SMP, STD, or LTD claims through dedicated drawers.",
>   "4. User updates existing case information by selecting 'Update Information', which opens the Edit Case Information drawer.",
>   "5. User manages case lifecycle status:",
>   "   5.1. When case status is incomplete, user can select 'Open Case' to resubmit the case.",
>   "   5.2. When case is active (not in 'Close' status), user can select 'Close Case' to initiate case closure through the Close Case drawer.",
>   "   5.3. When case is closed, user can select 'Reopen Case' to reactivate the case through the Reopen Case drawer.",
>   "6. User modifies case substatus by selecting 'Change Case Substatus' to open the Change Case Substatus drawer.",
>   "7. User duplicates an existing case by selecting 'Copy Case':",
>   "   7.1. System generates a new case with a unique case number in 'Open' status.",
>   "   7.2. System copies Member Detail, Employment Details, and Additional Parties from the original case.",
>   "   7.3. System redirects user to Event Case Intake Step 2 with pre-filled data for review and editing before finalization."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** a claims adjuster accesses the case overview page, **When** the page loads, **Then** the system displays case information, related claims, parties, and the 'I want to' menu button within 2 seconds.",
>   "2. **Given** the 'I want to' menu button is clicked, **When** the user interacts with it, **Then** the system displays a three-level menu hierarchy with primary actions and sub-options positioned appropriately (Second Level Menu left of First Level Menu due to far-right button placement).",
>   "3. **Given** the user selects 'Create New Claim' > 'Other Claim', **When** the selection is confirmed, **Then** the system opens the Add New Claim page.",
>   "4. **Given** the 'Absence' claim event is selected, **When** the user accesses 'Create New Claim', **Then** the system displays SMP, STD, and LTD claim options in the menu.",
>   "5. **Given** the 'Absence' claim event is NOT selected, **When** the user accesses 'Create New Claim', **Then** the system does NOT display SMP, STD, or LTD claim options.",
>   "6. **Given** the user selects 'Create New Claim' > 'SMP Claim' (with Absence event selected), **When** the selection is confirmed, **Then** the system opens the Create SMP Claim drawer.",
>   "7. **Given** the user selects 'Create New Claim' > 'STD Claim' (with Absence event selected), **When** the selection is confirmed, **Then** the system opens the Create STD Claim drawer.",
>   "8. **Given** the user selects 'Create New Claim' > 'LTD Claim' (with Absence event selected), **When** the selection is confirmed, **Then** the system opens the Create LTD Claim drawer.",
>   "9. **Given** the user selects 'Update Information', **When** the selection is confirmed, **Then** the system opens the Edit Case Information drawer with current case details.",
>   "10. **Given** the case status equals 'incomplete', **When** the user accesses the 'I want to' menu, **Then** the 'Open Case' option is enabled.",
>   "11. **Given** the case status does NOT equal 'incomplete', **When** the user accesses the 'I want to' menu, **Then** the 'Open Case' option is disabled or hidden.",
>   "12. **Given** the user selects 'Open Case' (when enabled), **When** the selection is confirmed, **Then** the system resubmits the incomplete case.",
>   "13. **Given** the case is NOT in 'Close' status, **When** the user accesses the 'I want to' menu, **Then** the 'Close Case' option is enabled.",
>   "14. **Given** the case is in 'Close' status, **When** the user accesses the 'I want to' menu, **Then** the 'Close Case' option is disabled or hidden.",
>   "15. **Given** the user selects 'Close Case' (when enabled), **When** the selection is confirmed, **Then** the system opens the Close Case drawer.",
>   "16. **Given** the case is in 'Close' status, **When** the user accesses the 'I want to' menu, **Then** the 'Reopen Case' option is enabled.",
>   "17. **Given** the case is NOT in 'Close' status, **When** the user accesses the 'I want to' menu, **Then** the 'Reopen Case' option is disabled or hidden.",
>   "18. **Given** the user selects 'Reopen Case' (when enabled), **When** the selection is confirmed, **Then** the system opens the Reopen Case drawer.",
>   "19. **Given** the user selects 'Change Case Substatus', **When** the selection is confirmed, **Then** the system opens the Change Case Substatus drawer.",
>   "20. **Given** the user selects 'Copy Case', **When** the copy action is executed, **Then** the system:",
>   "    20.1. Generates a new case with a unique case number in 'Open' status.",
>   "    20.2. Copies Member Detail and Employment Details from the original case.",
>   "    20.3. Makes Member Detail fields non-editable in the copied case.",
>   "    20.4. Makes Employment Details editable except for addresses.",
>   "    20.5. Sets Report Date to current system date.",
>   "    20.6. Automatically copies Additional Parties from the original case.",
>   "    20.7. Redirects the user to Event Case Intake Step 2 with all pre-filled data.",
>   "21. **Given** the user is at Event Case Intake Step 2 after copying a case, **When** the user reviews the data, **Then** the user can update editable values before finalizing the copied case.",
>   "22. **Given** any UI component is rendered, **When** displayed, **Then** the component adheres to EIS Design System Library (DSM) standards."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view and manage party information (roles, relationships, contact details) associated with a case from a dedicated party management interface, so that I can maintain accurate stakeholder records
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view and manage party information (roles, relationships, contact details) associated with a case from a dedicated party management interface
- **Value**: I can maintain accurate stakeholder records throughout the claims lifecycle

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view and manage party information (roles, relationships, contact details) associated with a case from a dedicated party management interface,
> **so that** I can maintain accurate stakeholder records throughout the claims lifecycle.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User views a consolidated Party Information Table within the Case Overview screen displaying all parties associated with the case or claims.",
>   "2. For each party, user can view key attributes including Party Name (with sortable columns A-Z/Z-A), assigned Role(s) with multiple roles displayed as comma-separated values, association scope (Case-level or specific Claim/Loss Type), and Relationship to Participant classification.",
>   "3. User adds new parties to the case by initiating the Add Party workflow:",
>   "   3.1. User selects party type (Individual or Organization).",
>   "   3.2. User searches for existing parties using name search criteria and reviews search results.",
>   "   3.3. User either selects an existing party from results or creates a new party record.",
>   "   3.4. User specifies the association scope (Case or specific Claim), assigns one or multiple roles, and defines the relationship to participant.",
>   "   3.5. User saves the party association or cancels to abort the operation.",
>   "   3.6. User can repeat this workflow to add multiple parties sequentially.",
>   "4. User edits existing party information for eligible parties:",
>   "   4.1. Only parties with Personal relationship type are editable; parties with other relationship types (e.g., Sponsor) cannot be modified or removed.",
>   "   4.2. User modifies association scope, roles, or relationship classification as needed.",
>   "   4.3. User updates contact information including phone number, email address, and contact preference.",
>   "   4.4. User updates address details including address lines, country, city, state, and zip code.",
>   "   4.5. User saves changes to persist updates or cancels to discard modifications.",
>   "5. System maintains table sorting with Party Name as primary sort key, followed by Associated with field (Case-level associations appear before Claim-level associations)."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Scenario 1: View Party Information**",
>   "- Given a Claims Adjuster is viewing the Case Overview screen",
>   "- When the Party Information Table loads",
>   "- Then all parties associated with the case or claims are displayed with Party Name, Role(s), Associated with, and Relationship to Participant columns",
>   "- And the table is sorted by Party Name first, then by Associated with (Case before Claims)",
>   "- And Party Name column supports A-Z and Z-A sorting",
>   "- And parties with multiple roles show all roles separated by commas",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 2: Add New Party Successfully**",
>   "- Given a Claims Adjuster clicks the 'Add Party' button",
>   "- When the Add Party slide-out form opens",
>   "- And the user selects party Type (Individual/Organization)",
>   "- And the user enters search criteria and selects or creates a party",
>   "- And the user specifies Associated With, selects Roles, and defines Relationship to Participant",
>   "- And the user clicks Save",
>   "- Then the new party is added to the Party Information Table",
>   "- And the party appears in the correct sort order",
>   "- And the slide-out form closes",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 3: Cancel Add Party Operation**",
>   "- Given a Claims Adjuster is in the Add Party workflow",
>   "- When the user clicks Cancel at any point before saving",
>   "- Then no party association is created",
>   "- And the slide-out form closes without persisting any data",
>   "- And the Party Information Table remains unchanged",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 4: Edit Party with Personal Relationship Type**",
>   "- Given a party in the table has RelationshipType = Personal",
>   "- When the Claims Adjuster clicks the Edit icon for that party",
>   "- Then the Edit Party slide-out form opens",
>   "- And all editable fields are accessible (Associated With, Roles, Relationship to Participant, Contact Information, Address)",
>   "- When the user modifies any fields and clicks Save",
>   "- Then the changes are persisted",
>   "- And the updated information is reflected in the Party Information Table",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 5: Attempt to Edit Party with Non-Personal Relationship Type**",
>   "- Given a party in the table has RelationshipType other than Personal (e.g., Sponsor)",
>   "- When the Claims Adjuster views that party row",
>   "- Then the Edit icon is either not available or disabled",
>   "- And the user cannot modify or delete the party record",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 6: Add Multiple Parties Sequentially**",
>   "- Given a Claims Adjuster has successfully added a party",
>   "- When the user clicks 'Add Party' button again",
>   "- Then the Add Party workflow can be executed again",
>   "- And multiple parties can be added through repeated execution of the workflow",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 7: Update Contact and Address Information**",
>   "- Given a Claims Adjuster is editing an eligible party",
>   "- When the user modifies Phone, Email, Contact Preference, Address Lines, Country, City, State, or Zip Code fields",
>   "- And clicks Save",
>   "- Then all modified contact and address fields are updated",
>   "- And the changes are visible in subsequent party views",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 8: Cancel Edit Party Operation**",
>   "- Given a Claims Adjuster has opened the Edit Party form and made changes",
>   "- When the user clicks Cancel",
>   "- Then no changes are persisted",
>   "- And the slide-out form closes",
>   "- And the Party Information Table displays the original party information"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view policy summary information including coverages, exclusions, insureds, and plans on the claim overview page, so that I can verify policy details without navigating to separate policy screens
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view comprehensive policy summary information including policy details, coverages, exclusions, insureds, and plan limitations on the claim overview page
- **Value**: I can verify and reference policy information as it existed at claim creation without navigating to separate policy screens or external systems

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view comprehensive policy summary information including policy details, coverages, exclusions, insureds, and plan limitations on the claim overview page,
> **so that** I can verify and reference policy information as it existed at claim creation without navigating to separate policy screens or external systems.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User navigates to the Claim Overview screen for claims in Pending, Open, or Closed status across supported products (STD, SMP, LTD, CI, HI, ACC, Life, Leave).",
>   "2. User selects the Policy Summary Tab located next to the History Tab to access policy information.",
>   "3. System retrieves and displays static policy information captured at claim creation time in four organized sections:",
>   "   3.1 Policy Information section displays core policy details including Policy Number, Product, Status, Effective Date, Expiration Date, and State.",
>   "   3.2 Exclusions section presents all applicable exclusions as visual chips or text outputs (e.g., Cosmetic Surgery, Intoxication, War or Act of War).",
>   "   3.3 Insureds section shows party names and corresponding Dates of Birth for all covered individuals.",
>   "   3.4 Plans section displays comprehensive coverage details including limitations with restriction periods and application scope (Mental Illness, Substance Abuse, Self-Reported Conditions, Special Conditions, Combined Lifetime Limitation), plus Pre-existing Conditions details (Limitation/Exclusion type, duration, Look Back Period, Treatment Free Period, Continuously Insured Period).",
>   "4. System presents all data in business-friendly format using lookup values instead of internal codes for readability.",
>   "5. If Individual Policy data is unavailable at the policy level:",
>   "   5.1 System automatically retrieves policy data from Master Policy through policy relations.",
>   "6. If specific policy data field is not available in the policy data model:",
>   "   6.1 System excludes that particular information field from the Policy Summary display without displaying errors.",
>   "7. User reviews policy summary information to verify coverage and make informed claim decisions without leaving the Claim Overview screen."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Scenario 1: Successfully display complete policy summary for Individual Policy**",
>   "- Given a claim exists in Pending, Open, or Closed status for a supported product (STD, SMP, LTD, CI, HI, ACC, Life, or Leave),",
>   "- And the claim has associated Individual Policy data captured at creation time,",
>   "- When the Claims Adjuster selects the Policy Summary Tab on the Claim Overview screen,",
>   "- Then the system displays all four sections (Policy Information, Exclusions, Insureds, Plans) with complete data in business-friendly format,",
>   "- And all lookup values are displayed instead of internal codes,",
>   "- And the Policy Information section includes Policy Number, Product, Status, Effective Date, Expiration Date, and State,",
>   "- And the Plans section includes limitation periods (weeks for STD, months for LTD as applicable) and all pre-existing condition parameters.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 2: Retrieve policy data from Master Policy when Individual Policy is unavailable**",
>   "- Given a claim exists with policy data unavailable at the Individual Policy level,",
>   "- And Master Policy data is accessible through policy relations,",
>   "- When the Claims Adjuster selects the Policy Summary Tab,",
>   "- Then the system retrieves and displays policy information from the Master Policy,",
>   "- And all applicable sections are populated with Master Policy data in the same format as Individual Policy display.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 3: Handle missing policy data fields gracefully**",
>   "- Given a claim exists with some policy data fields not available in the policy data model,",
>   "- When the Claims Adjuster selects the Policy Summary Tab,",
>   "- Then the system displays only the available policy information fields,",
>   "- And missing fields are excluded from the display without error messages or placeholder text,",
>   "- And the remaining sections remain fully functional and readable.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 4: Display static policy snapshot regardless of policy changes**",
>   "- Given a claim was created with specific policy information captured at creation time,",
>   "- And the underlying policy has been subsequently modified or updated,",
>   "- When the Claims Adjuster views the Policy Summary Tab,",
>   "- Then the system displays only the static policy information as it existed at claim creation time,",
>   "- And the display does NOT reflect any changes made to the policy after claim creation,",
>   "- And Policy Refresh actions do not update the displayed Policy Summary information.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 5: Display exclusions in visual format**",
>   "- Given a policy has multiple exclusions defined (e.g., Cosmetic Surgery, Intoxication, War or Act of War),",
>   "- When the Claims Adjuster views the Policy Summary Tab,",
>   "- Then the Exclusions section displays all exclusions as visual chips or text outputs,",
>   "- And each exclusion is clearly readable and distinguishable from other exclusions.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 6: Display multiple insureds with demographic information**",
>   "- Given a policy covers multiple insured parties,",
>   "- When the Claims Adjuster views the Policy Summary Tab,",
>   "- Then the Insureds section displays all party names,",
>   "- And each insured's Date of Birth is displayed alongside their name.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 7: Restrict access to appropriate claim statuses**",
>   "- Given a claim exists in a status other than Pending, Open, or Closed,",
>   "- When the Claims Adjuster attempts to access the Claim Overview screen,",
>   "- Then the Policy Summary Tab is not available or does not display policy information.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 8: Multi-product support validation**",
>   "- Given claims exist for different product lines (Disability LOB: STD/SMP/LTD, Supplementary Benefits: CI/HI/ACC, Life, Leave),",
>   "- When the Claims Adjuster views the Policy Summary Tab for each claim type,",
>   "- Then the system displays product-appropriate policy information in the standardized four-section format,",
>   "- And product-specific fields (e.g., STD weeks vs LTD months for limitation periods) are displayed correctly per product type."
> ]

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=724146875"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to navigate through multi-step claim intake workflows with clear progress indicators and step-by-step guidance, so that I can efficiently collect all required information before claim submission
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: navigate through a multi-step claim intake workflow with clear progress indicators and step-by-step guidance to collect all required information
- **Value**: I can efficiently and accurately capture complete claim information before submission, reducing errors and ensuring compliance with data requirements

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** navigate through a multi-step claim intake workflow with clear progress indicators and step-by-step guidance to collect all required information,
> **so that** I can efficiently and accurately capture complete claim information before submission, reducing errors and ensuring compliance with data requirements.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User receives initial guidance and warning that the claim submission process must be completed in one continuous session without interruption.
> 2. User provides employee and employment information including name, class, employer, work state, occupation, hire date, and selects payment method with mailing address confirmation.
> 3. User classifies the claim by selecting event type, providing event description, entering accident details (cause, dates, location), and indicating applicable loss types.
>   3.1 System enforces selection of at least one loss type from: death, terminal illness, serious illness, hospital services, or work absence before allowing progression.
> 4. User uploads supporting documentation through file interface, with system accepting multiple formats (.zip, .doc, .docx, .pdf, .png, .jpg) and providing guidance on required documentation elements (provider details, billing information, service dates).
> 5. User reviews comprehensive summary of all entered information across all steps for verification and accuracy before final submission.
> 6. User accepts terms and conditions, acknowledges fraud warning, and submits the claim to trigger backend processing.
>   6.1 System maps portal data to Event Case and Claim Event entities.
>   6.2 System sets reporting method as 'SelfServicePortal' and reported date as current date.
>   6.3 System uploads documents to case e-folder and updates Event Case via API.
>   6.4 System retrieves and assigns claim numbers automatically.
> 7. User receives confirmation page with success indicator and option to navigate to Case Overview page.
> 8. Throughout the workflow, user can navigate to previously completed steps by clicking on step indicators to modify earlier entries.
>   8.1 If user cancels at any point, system displays confirmation dialog and returns user to appropriate context (CSSR Cases/Claims tab or Portal Home).
> 9. Visual step indicator displays current position, completed steps (with checkmarks), and inactive future steps throughout the process.
> 10. User can save progress and exit at any step, or use Previous/Next buttons to navigate sequentially through the workflow.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the user is on Step 1, **when** they view the instruction page, **then** the system displays a warning that the process must be completed in one session without interruption.
> 2. **Given** the user is on any step, **when** they view the step indicator, **then** the system displays:
>   2.1 Active step in blue with current step number.
>   2.2 Completed steps with checkmark indicator.
>   2.3 Inactive future steps in gray.
> 3. **Given** the user is on Step 2, **when** they enter employee information, **then** the system captures name, class, employer, work state, occupation, hire date, payment method, and mailing address.
> 4. **Given** the user is on Step 3, **when** they attempt to proceed without selecting a loss type, **then** the system blocks progression and displays a prompt requiring at least one loss type selection.
> 5. **Given** the user is on Step 3, **when** they select at least one loss type from (death, terminal illness, serious illness, hospital services, work absence), **then** the system enables the Next button.
> 6. **Given** the user is on Step 4, **when** they upload documents, **then** the system accepts files in formats: .zip, .doc, .docx, .pdf, .png, .jpg and provides guidance on required documentation elements.
> 7. **Given** the user is on Step 5, **when** they review the claim information, **then** the system displays a comprehensive read-only summary of all data entered across all previous steps.
> 8. **Given** the user is on Step 6, **when** they accept terms and submit the claim, **then** the system:
>   8.1 Creates Event Case and Claim Event entities.
>   8.2 Sets reporting method as 'SelfServicePortal' and reported date as current date.
>   8.3 Uploads all documents to case e-folder.
>   8.4 Retrieves and assigns claim numbers.
>   8.5 Displays success confirmation page within 5 seconds.
> 9. **Given** the user has completed one or more steps, **when** they click on a previously visited step icon, **then** the system navigates backward to that step allowing modification of earlier entries.
> 10. **Given** the user clicks Cancel at any step, **when** they confirm the cancellation, **then** the system returns them to CSSR Cases/Claims tab (if accessed from there) or Portal Home (if accessed directly).
> 11. **Given** the user is on the success page, **when** they click 'View Claims', **then** the system navigates to the Case Overview page displaying the newly created claim.
> 12. **Given** the user is on any step except Step 1, **when** they click Previous, **then** the system navigates to the immediately preceding step retaining all entered data.
> 13. **Given** the user is on any step except Step 6, **when** they click Next with valid data, **then** the system progresses to the immediately following step.
> 14. **Given** the workflow is active, **when** the user views any step, **then** the system displays common header with employee name and 'Submit Claim' title using DSM library design patterns.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to create and manage claims of different types (STD, LTD, SMP, TL, CI, Dental, P&C) from a unified case overview interface, so that I can handle multi-LOB cases without switching between different systems
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: create and manage claims of different types (STD, LTD, SMP, TL, CI, Dental, P&C) from a unified case overview interface
- **Value**: I can handle multi-LOB cases without switching between different systems

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** create and manage claims of different types (STD, LTD, SMP, TL, CI, Dental, P&C) from a unified case overview interface,
> **so that** I can handle multi-LOB cases without switching between different systems.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Claims Adjuster accesses the unified Event Case Overview interface to view all claims associated with an event across different lines of business (STD, LTD, SMP, TL, CI, Dental, P&C).
> 2. When the policy is already known in the system, the adjuster initiates creation of a new STD claim directly from the Event Case interface.
>    2.1 System provides specialized STD claim creation workflow with appropriate fields and validation specific to short-term disability products.
> 3. Adjuster completes required information for the STD claim and submits for creation.
>    3.1 System creates the STD claim and associates it with the parent Event Case.
> 4. Once STD claim is created, adjuster can edit and update the claim information through the same Event Case Overview interface.
> 5. Adjuster navigates between different claim types (STD, LTD, SMP, TL, CI, Dental, P&C) within the unified interface without leaving the Event Case context.
> 6. System maintains consistent user experience and navigation patterns across all claim types while supporting product-specific business rules and data requirements.
> 7. All claims related to the Event Case remain accessible and manageable from the single Event Case Overview workspace.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is viewing an Event Case Overview, **when** the interface loads, **then** all associated claims across different LOBs (STD, LTD, SMP, TL, CI, Dental, P&C) are displayed in a unified view.
> 2. **Given** a policy is already known in the system, **when** the adjuster initiates STD claim creation from Event Case interface, **then** the STD-specific claim creation workflow is presented with appropriate fields and validations.
> 3. **Given** the adjuster is creating a new STD claim, **when** required information is completed and submitted, **then** the system creates the STD claim and links it to the parent Event Case within 5 seconds.
> 4. **Given** an STD claim has been created, **when** the adjuster accesses the Event Case Overview, **then** the STD claim is visible and editable through the same interface.
> 5. **Given** multiple claim types exist within an Event Case, **when** the adjuster navigates between different claim types, **then** the system maintains context and does not require re-authentication or system switching.
> 6. **Given** the adjuster attempts to create an STD claim, **when** the policy is not known in the system, **then** the system blocks claim creation and displays an error message indicating policy must be established first.
> 7. **Given** the adjuster is editing an existing STD claim, **when** changes are saved, **then** the updated information is persisted and reflected in the Event Case Overview immediately.
> 8. **Given** the Event Case contains claims from multiple LOBs, **when** the adjuster views the case, **then** each claim type displays with its product-specific attributes while maintaining consistent navigation and layout patterns.
> 9. **Given** the adjuster is working within the unified Event Case interface, **when** switching between claim management tasks across different LOBs, **then** all actions (create, edit, view) are accessible without leaving the Event Case workspace.
