#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to upload and manage supporting documents during claim intake with drag-and-drop functionality and file validation, so that I can efficiently collect evidence without manual file handling
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: upload and manage supporting documents during dental claim intake with drag-and-drop functionality and file validation
- **Value**: I can efficiently collect and organize claim evidence without manual file handling errors or delays

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** upload and manage supporting documents during dental claim intake with drag-and-drop functionality and file validation,
> **so that** I can efficiently collect and organize claim evidence without manual file handling errors or delays.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User navigates to the document upload step (step 3 of 4) within the Dental Claim Intake wizard.",
>   "2. System presents an upload interface with drag-and-drop area, 'Select Files' button, eFolder sidebar displaying claim-related folder structure, and Tasks sidebar showing related tasks.",
>   "3. User uploads one or multiple documents using either drag-and-drop or file browser selection.",
>   "4. System validates each file in real-time against supported file types and size constraints:",
>   "   4.1. If file has unsupported extension, system blocks upload action without adding file to list or displaying error message.",
>   "   4.2. If file size is zero bytes, system rejects the file without adding to upload list.",
>   "   4.3. If file exceeds 20MB or type-specific maximum size limit, system displays dismissible error message and prevents file from being added.",
>   "5. System adds successfully validated files to the Uploaded Files List displaying file name with extension and delete (X) icon.",
>   "6. User can remove any uploaded file from the list by clicking the X icon before final submission.",
>   "7. User proceeds to final step (step 4) where clicking 'Submit Claim' triggers document upload to eFolder.",
>   "8. System stores all uploaded documents in the 'Intake' folder under 'Dental Claims' with 'Supporting Documents (Dental)' purpose designation and default file names.",
>   "9. Alternate Flow: User may skip document upload entirely and proceed to claim submission, as document upload is optional."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Positive Scenarios:**",
>   "1. **Given** the user is on step 3 of the Dental Claim Intake wizard, **When** the page loads, **Then** the system displays the drag-and-drop upload area, 'Select Files' button, eFolder sidebar with proper folder hierarchy (Dental Claims with subfolders: 1-Intake, 2-Financials, 3-Appeals, General; Inbound and Outbound with subfolders: Member, Provider, Other), and Tasks sidebar.",
>   "2. **Given** the user has selected or dragged a valid file with supported extension and size between 1 byte and 20MB, **When** the upload action is triggered, **Then** the system adds the file to the Uploaded Files List displaying the file name with extension and X delete icon.",
>   "3. **Given** multiple valid files are selected simultaneously, **When** the user initiates upload, **Then** the system validates and adds all valid files to the Uploaded Files List in a single operation.",
>   "4. **Given** the user has uploaded files in the Uploaded Files List, **When** the user clicks the X icon on any file, **Then** the system immediately removes that file from the list without affecting other uploaded files.",
>   "5. **Given** the user has uploaded documents in step 3 and proceeded to step 4, **When** the user clicks 'Submit Claim', **Then** the system uploads all documents from the Uploaded Files List to the eFolder under the 'Intake' folder with 'Supporting Documents (Dental)' purpose and default file names.",
>   "6. **Given** the user is on step 3 with no documents uploaded, **When** the user proceeds to step 4 and submits the claim, **Then** the system completes claim submission successfully without blocking due to missing documents.",
>   "**Negative Scenarios:**",
>   "7. **Given** the user attempts to upload a file with an unsupported file extension (not defined in LU>FileType), **When** the upload action is triggered, **Then** the system blocks the action, prevents the file from being added to the upload area or list, and does not display an error message.",
>   "8. **Given** the user attempts to upload a file with exactly 0 bytes size, **When** the upload action is triggered, **Then** the system rejects the file and does not add it to the Uploaded Files List.",
>   "9. **Given** the user attempts to upload a file exceeding 20MB or the type-specific maximum defined in LU>FileType.maxSizeInBytes, **When** the upload action is triggered, **Then** the system displays an error message 'File size is greater than allowable maximum of 20MB' with a dismissible X icon and does not add the file to the Uploaded Files List.",
>   "10. **Given** the user has uploaded files at step 3 but removes all files using the X icon, **When** the user proceeds to step 4 and clicks 'Submit Claim', **Then** the system completes claim submission without uploading any documents to the eFolder.",
>   "**Technical Requirements:**",
>   "11. The upload interface must be implemented using the DSM library with proper drag-and-drop functionality.",
>   "12. File type validation must reference the LU>FileType lookup table for supported extensions and type-specific size limits.",
>   "13. eFolder folder structure must display numeric prefixes (1-, 2-, 3-) to enforce proper display ordering.",
>   "14. Documents must NOT be saved to eFolder until the 'Submit Claim' action is completed in step 4."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to access a home page with loss search functionality and quick-access buttons for different claim intake types, so that I can quickly initiate new claims or find existing ones
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: access a centralized home page with loss search functionality and quick-access buttons for different claim intake types across multiple insurance product lines (Life, CI, HI, Absence, Dental, Pet)
- **Value**: I can quickly initiate new claims for various products or efficiently locate and resume work on existing loss records

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** access a centralized home page with loss search functionality and quick-access buttons for different claim intake types across multiple insurance product lines (Life, CI, HI, Absence, Dental, Pet),

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view and manage claim cards displaying key claim information (date of loss, policy, coverage, status, parties) on the case overview page, so that I can quickly assess all claims associated with a case
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view and manage claim cards displaying key claim information (date of loss, policy, coverage, status, parties) on the case overview page
- **Value**: I can quickly assess all claims associated with a case and navigate to detailed information as needed

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view and manage claim cards displaying key claim information (date of loss, policy, coverage, status, parties) on the case overview page,
> **so that** I can quickly assess all claims associated with a case and navigate to detailed information as needed.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System displays an 'Other Claims' section on the Case Overview page that consolidates all associated claims within the case.
> 2. Each claim is presented as a distinct claim card (e.g., Motor Claim card) containing summarized key information for quick assessment.
> 3. The 'Other Claims' section header provides expandable and collapsible functionality via a chevron icon to optimize screen space usage.
> 4. Each claim card displays essential claim information including:
>    4.1 Claim identification (Claim Type and Claim Number in format '&lt;Claim Type&gt; Claim # &lt;Claim Number&gt;')
>    4.2 Date of Loss in MM/DD/YYYY format
>    4.3 Policy Number with navigation capability
>    4.4 Coverage types associated with the claim
>    4.5 Assigned Claim File Owners
>    4.6 Damaged items list
>    4.7 Current claim status with visual color-coded indicator
>    4.8 Associated parties information
> 5. Users can navigate to related detailed pages through hyperlinked elements:
>    5.1 Clicking Claim Type and Number navigates to the specific Claim Overview page
>    5.2 Clicking Policy Number navigates to the Policy Detail Screen
> 6. Claim status is visually distinguished using color coding for rapid status identification:
>    6.1 Gray indicates Incomplete status
>    6.2 Yellow/Orange indicates Pending status
>    6.3 Green indicates Open status
>    6.4 Blue indicates Closed status


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a case exists with one or more associated claims and claim data is available in the system,
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster views the Case Overview page,
>    **Then** the 'Other Claims' section is displayed with all associated claim cards.
>
> 2. **Given** the 'Other Claims' section is displayed,
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster clicks the chevron icon in the section header,
>    **Then** the section expands or collapses accordingly to show or hide claim cards.
>
> 3. **Given** a claim card is displayed,
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster views the card,
>    **Then** all key information is visible including: Claim Type and Number, Date of Loss (MM/DD/YYYY format), Policy Number, Coverage types, Claim File Owners, Damages, Status with color-coded indicator, and Parties information.
>
> 4. **Given** a claim card displays a Claim Type and Number,
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster clicks the hyperlinked Claim Type and Number,
>    **Then** the system navigates to the corresponding Claim Overview page.
>
> 5. **Given** a claim card displays a Policy Number,
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster clicks the hyperlinked Policy Number,
>    **Then** the system navigates to the Policy Detail Screen.
>
> 6. **Given** a claim has a specific status (Incomplete, Pending, Open, or Closed),
>    **When** the claim card is displayed,
>    **Then** the status indicator displays the correct color: Gray for Incomplete, Yellow/Orange for Pending, Green for Open, or Blue for Closed.
>
> 7. **Given** multiple claims exist within a case,
>    **When** the 'Other Claims' section is displayed,
>    **Then** each claim is represented by a separate card with its own complete set of information.
>
> 8. **Given** claim data is mapped from system entities (CapPncClaimLossDetailEntity, CapPncClaimDamageDetailEntity, CapPncLossPolicyInfoEntity),
>    **When** the claim cards are rendered,
>    **Then** all displayed information accurately reflects the source data with proper mapping.
>
> 9. **Given** a case has no associated claims,
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster views the Case Overview page,
>    **Then** the 'Other Claims' section either does not display or shows an appropriate empty state message.
>
> 10. **Given** the UI implementation follows EIS Design System (DSM) library standards,
>     **When** the 'Other Claims' section and claim cards are rendered,
>     **Then** all visual elements conform to the design specifications defined in the Figma prototypes.

### Epic: Multi-Market & Localization Support

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to enter and view dates in DD/MM/YYYY format when processing UK market claims, so that I can work with locally-appropriate date conventions and reduce data entry errors.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: enter and view dates in DD/MM/YYYY format, currency in , and UK-specific terminology and data elements when processing claims under the en_GB locale
- **Value**: I can work with locally-appropriate conventions for the UK market, reduce data entry errors, and ensure compliance with UK business practices

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** enter and view dates in DD/MM/YYYY format, currency in , and UK-specific terminology and data elements when processing claims under the en_GB locale,
> **so that** I can work with locally-appropriate conventions for the UK market, reduce data entry errors, and ensure compliance with UK business practices.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System automatically detects and applies en_GB locale configuration across all Claims Case and Claims system screens and processes.
> 2. Date Management:
>   2.1 All date fields (Date of Birth, Date of Hire, Last Date Worked, Absence periods, Return to work dates, payment dates) display and accept DD/MM/YYYY format.
>   2.2 Date pickers, date outputs, and date placeholders show DD/MM/YYYY format across Event Case Intake, Absence Management, Party Management, Claim Overview, Financial Management, and all supporting screens.
>   2.3 Pre-filled dates from CEM/Absence data (Date of Birth, Date of Hire, Last Date Worked) display in DD/MM/YYYY format.
> 3. Currency and Financial Display:
>   3.1 All monetary fields (earnings, payments, offsets, deductions, balances, recoveries) display  symbol instead of $.
>   3.2 Currency placeholders and formatting apply across Claim Overview, Financial Management (Payments & Recoveries, Offsets, Deductions, Balance Overview), and payment allocation screens.
> 4. Address and Geographic Data:
>   4.1 Country field defaults to 'United Kingdom'.
>   4.2 'State/Province' label changes to 'County' with UK-specific lookup values.
>   4.3 UK postal code validation rules are applied to all address entry screens.
>   4.4 Work State field is hidden (not applicable in UK market).
> 5. Contact Information:
>   5.1 Phone number fields apply UK-specific formatting per E.164 standard (typically 11 digits with area codes of 3-5 digits, maximum 15 digits total).
>   5.2 UK phone number masking and validation enforced across Party Management and all contact entry points.
> 6. Product and Claim Type Display:
>   6.1 Claim type displays as 'GIP' (Group Income Protection) instead of 'LTD' across all screens.
>   6.2 Claim numbers use 'GIP' prefix (e.g., GIP2222) in headers, lookups, BAMs, tasks, notes, and history.
> 7. UK-Specific Terminology Updates:
>   7.1 'Check' relabeled to 'Cheque' across all payment methods and related UI.
>   7.2 'Elimination Period' relabeled to 'Deferred Period'.
> 8. US-Specific Field Suppression:
>   8.1 ERISA field hidden (US-specific regulation not applicable).
>   8.2 All tax-related fields hidden including Taxable %, Tax deductions in payment allocations, GBA/AGBA labels, and Federal/FICA/State tax fields.
> 9. UK-Specific Lookup Value Restrictions:
>   9.1 Offset Types restricted to Holiday Pay, Salary Continuance, and Income Protection Benefit.
>   9.2 Deduction Types restricted to Other Miscellaneous, Medical, Critical Illness, and Other Income Protection Policy.
>   9.3 Ancillary Activities lookup updated to include Activities of Daily Living (ADLs) and Vocational Rehabilitation Programme.
>   9.4 Credit card type options restricted to Visa Credit, Visa Debit, MasterCard, and American Express.
> 10. Adjuster can process claims across all functional areas (Event Case Intake including Member details, Work Detail, General Case Detail, Additional Information; Absence Management; Party Management; Claim Overview; Financial Management; Ancillary Activities) with consistent UK localization.
> 11. Alternate Flow - Non-UK Locale:
>   11.1 If locale is NOT set to en_GB, system applies current default implementation without UK-specific modifications.
>   11.2 All attributes function with US/default formatting (MM/DD/YYYY dates, $ currency, State/Province labeling, US tax fields visible, LTD claim type, Check terminology, Elimination Period terminology, US-specific lookup values).


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the system locale is set to en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster views any date field across Event Case Intake, Absence Management, Claim Overview, or Financial Management screens, **then** all dates display in DD/MM/YYYY format.
> 2. **Given** the system locale is set to en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster enters a date value, **then** the system accepts DD/MM/YYYY format and date picker displays DD/MM/YYYY format with appropriate placeholder text.
> 3. **Given** the system locale is set to en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster views any monetary field (earnings, payments, offsets, deductions, balances, recoveries), **then** all currency values display with the '' symbol.
> 4. **Given** the system locale is set to en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster adds or edits an address, **then** the Country field defaults to 'United Kingdom', the 'State/Province' label displays as 'County' with UK-specific lookup values, and UK postal code validation is applied.
> 5. **Given** the system locale is set to en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster enters a phone number, **then** UK phone number formatting is enforced per E.164 standard (maximum 15 digits, typical format with area codes of 3-5 digits).
> 6. **Given** the system locale is set to en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster views a claim, **then** the claim type displays as 'GIP' and claim numbers use 'GIP' prefix (e.g., GIP2222) across all screens including headers, lookups, BAMs, tasks, notes, and history.
> 7. **Given** the system locale is set to en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster accesses payment method screens, **then** the terminology 'Cheque' is used instead of 'Check' throughout the interface.
> 8. **Given** the system locale is set to en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster views benefit period configuration, **then** the label 'Deferred Period' is displayed instead of 'Elimination Period'.
> 9. **Given** the system locale is set to en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster accesses any claims screen, **then** US-specific fields (Work State, ERISA, Taxable %, Tax deductions, GBA/AGBA labels, Federal/FICA/State tax fields) are hidden and not available for data entry.
> 10. **Given** the system locale is set to en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster selects Offset Types, **then** only Holiday Pay, Salary Continuance, and Income Protection Benefit are available as options.
> 11. **Given** the system locale is set to en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster selects Deduction Types, **then** only Other Miscellaneous, Medical, Critical Illness, and Other Income Protection Policy are available as options.
> 12. **Given** the system locale is set to en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster manages Ancillary Activities, **then** the lookup includes Activities of Daily Living (ADLs) and Vocational Rehabilitation Programme options.
> 13. **Given** the system locale is set to en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster enters credit card payment information, **then** only Visa Credit, Visa Debit, MasterCard, and American Express are available as card type options.
> 14. **Given** pre-filled data exists from CEM/Absence systems (Date of Birth, Date of Hire, Last Date Worked) and locale is en_GB, **when** the Event Case Intake screen loads, **then** all pre-filled dates display in DD/MM/YYYY format.
> 15. **Given** mandatory field validation is triggered and locale is en_GB, **when** validation messages include date format examples, **then** the examples reflect DD/MM/YYYY format.
> 16. **Given** the system locale is NOT set to en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster processes claims, **then** the system applies current default implementation with MM/DD/YYYY dates, $ currency, State/Province labeling, visible US tax fields, LTD claim type, Check terminology, Elimination Period terminology, and US-specific lookup values.
> 17. **Given** the system locale is set to en_GB, **when** data is saved to the system, **then** all attribute mappings remain unchanged with only display format, visibility, and default values affected (no changes to underlying data structure or storage).
> 18. **Given** the system locale is set to en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster navigates between different functional areas (Event Case Intake, Absence Management, Party Management, Claim Overview, Financial Management, Ancillary Activities, BAMs, Tasks, Notes, History), **then** UK localization applies consistently across all screens and processes.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to enter UK phone numbers with proper formatting and validation, so that contact information is captured accurately according to UK telecommunications standards.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: enter UK phone numbers with proper formatting and validation during claims intake, case management, and party administration
- **Value**: contact information is captured accurately according to UK telecommunications standards and displayed consistently across all claims touchpoints

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** enter UK phone numbers with proper formatting and validation during claims intake, case management, and party administration,
> **so that** contact information is captured accurately according to UK telecommunications standards and displayed consistently across all claims touchpoints.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System applies UK-specific phone number formatting and validation when locale is set to 'en_GB' across all claims modules.
> 2. During member intake and case creation, user enters phone numbers that accept 11-digit UK numbers with validation.
> 3. System automatically formats domestic UK phone numbers according to area code length:
>    3.1. 3-digit area codes display as (020) XXXX XXXX.
>    3.2. 4-digit area codes display as 01XX YYYY YYY.
>    3.3. 5-digit area codes display as 01XXX YYY YYY.
> 4. System supports international format with +44 country code variations for UK numbers.
> 5. Phone number fields accept digits only during data entry per UK validation rules (GENESIS-255063).
> 6. User enters phone numbers for members during event case intake on 'Add New Member' screen with UK-specific formatting applied.
> 7. User enters phone numbers for parties (individuals and organizations) during party management with UK-specific formatting and validation enforced.
> 8. System displays formatted phone numbers consistently in claim overview headers and throughout claims lifecycle.
> 9. Phone number formatting applies across all claim-related screens including case intake, party management, case overview, payment methods, and claim overview.
> 10. System maintains phone number format consistency when viewing historical records, BAMs, tasks, and notes associated with claims.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the system locale is set to 'en_GB', **when** a user enters an 11-digit UK phone number starting with 020, **then** the system formats and displays it as (020) XXXX XXXX.
> 2. **Given** the system locale is set to 'en_GB', **when** a user enters an 11-digit UK phone number starting with a 4-digit area code (01XX), **then** the system formats and displays it as 01XX YYYY YYY.
> 3. **Given** the system locale is set to 'en_GB', **when** a user enters an 11-digit UK phone number starting with a 5-digit area code (01XXX), **then** the system formats and displays it as 01XXX YYY YYY.
> 4. **Given** the system locale is set to 'en_GB', **when** a user enters a UK phone number with +44 international prefix, **then** the system accepts and displays the number in +44 format.
> 5. **Given** the system locale is set to 'en_GB', **when** a user enters a phone number in the member intake screen, **then** the field accepts digits only per UK validation rules (GENESIS-255063).
> 6. **Given** the system locale is set to 'en_GB', **when** a user enters a phone number that does not conform to UK 11-digit format, **then** the system displays inline validation error and prevents submission.
> 7. **Given** the system locale is set to 'en_GB', **when** a user enters phone numbers for party management (individuals or organizations), **then** UK-specific formatting is applied and validated consistently.
> 8. **Given** the system locale is set to 'en_GB', **when** a user views claim overview header, case overview, or history records, **then** all phone numbers display with consistent UK formatting.
> 9. **Given** the system locale is set to 'en_GB', **when** a user enters phone numbers during payment method setup (for cheque address), **then** UK-specific phone validation and formatting apply.
> 10. **Given** the system locale is not set to 'en_GB', **when** a user enters phone numbers, **then** the system applies standard formatting rules without UK-specific validation.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to enter and validate UK postal codes using UK-specific validation rules, so that address data is compliant with UK postal code standards.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: enter and validate UK postal codes using UK-specific validation rules across all address entry points in the claims management system when the system locale is set to en_GB
- **Value**: address data is compliant with UK postal code standards and ensures data integrity for UK-based Income Protection (GIP) claims processing

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** enter and validate UK postal codes using UK-specific validation rules across all address entry points in the claims management system when the system locale is set to en_GB,
> **so that** address data is compliant with UK postal code standards and ensures data integrity for UK-based Income Protection (GIP) claims processing.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System detects locale setting as 'en_GB' and activates UK-specific validation rules for all postal code fields throughout the claims management application.
> 2. During event case intake when adding a new member, user enters address information with UK postal code validation applied to the Zip Code/Postal Code field (mandatory field, disabled after initial entry).
> 3. When editing existing member work details during event case intake, user enters postal code in the Zip Code field which applies UK postcode validation (mandatory but disabled field).
> 4. When managing party information (adding, editing, or searching parties - both individual and organization), user enters address details where the Zip Code field applies UK-specific postcode validation rules.
> 5. When configuring payment methods with cheque delivery addresses, user enters address information where postal code field applies UK postcode validation and formatting.
> 6. When managing deductions, user enters address information for deduction-related parties where postal code applies UK validation rules.
> 7. System enforces UK postcode validation format which includes:
>    7.1 Proper UK postcode structure and pattern validation
>    7.2 Mandatory field requirement for all UK address entries
>    7.3 Integration with UK county (relabeled from State/Province) lookup values
> 8. All postal code fields display with label 'Zip Code/Postal Code' to accommodate multi-market terminology while applying locale-specific validation.
> 9. System maintains country default as 'United Kingdom' (mandatory, disabled in most contexts) to ensure postal code validation context is consistent.
> 10. UK postal code validation is consistently applied across all functional areas including: Event Case Intake, Party Management, Payment Methods, Recoveries, Deductions, and Case Overview displays.
> 11. System maintains audit trail and history records that preserve UK postal code formatting and validation context.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the system locale is set to 'en_GB',
>    **When** a Claims Adjuster enters a postal code in any address field,
>    **Then** the system applies UK-specific postal code validation rules and rejects invalid UK postcode formats.
>
> 2. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is adding a new member during event case intake,
>    **When** the Zip Code/Postal Code field (section 4.7) is populated,
>    **Then** the field is mandatory, applies UK postcode validation, and becomes disabled after successful validation.
>
> 3. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is editing member work details,
>    **When** entering the Zip Code field,
>    **Then** UK postcode validation is enforced, the field is mandatory but disabled, and County field uses UK county lookup values.
>
> 4. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is adding or editing individual party information,
>    **When** entering address details,
>    **Then** Country defaults to 'United Kingdom', County is relabeled and uses UK lookup values, and Zip Code applies UK postcode validation.
>
> 5. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is adding or editing organization party information,
>    **When** entering address details,
>    **Then** the same UK postcode validation rules apply as for individual parties.
>
> 6. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is configuring a payment method with cheque delivery,
>    **When** entering the Cheque Address,
>    **Then** postal code field applies UK postcode validation with UK formatting for county and country defaulting to 'United Kingdom'.
>
> 7. **Given** locale is set to 'en_GB',
>    **When** a postal code field is displayed anywhere in the system,
>    **Then** the label reads 'Zip Code/Postal Code' to accommodate multi-market terminology.
>
> 8. **Given** a Claims Adjuster enters an invalid UK postal code format,
>    **When** attempting to save or proceed,
>    **Then** the system blocks submission and displays an inline validation error message next to the postal code field.
>
> 9. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is managing deductions,
>    **When** entering address information,
>    **Then** County field is relabeled and uses UK lookup values, and postal code applies UK-specific validation.
>
> 10. **Given** postal code data has been successfully entered and validated,
>     **When** viewing Case Overview header or any display screen,
>     **Then** the postal code displays in UK-specific formatting consistent with UK standards.
>
> 11. **Given** the system locale is NOT set to 'en_GB',
>     **When** a user enters postal code information,
>     **Then** UK-specific postal code validation is NOT applied and standard zip code validation is used instead.
>
> 12. **Given** a Claims Adjuster has entered a valid UK postal code,
>     **When** the record is saved and retrieved,
>     **Then** the postal code is preserved with correct UK formatting and validation context in all history and audit trails.
>
> 13. **Given** the Country field is set to 'United Kingdom',
>     **When** postal code validation is triggered,
>     **Then** the system enforces UK postcode validation rules consistently across all claims management functional areas including Event Case Intake, Party Management, Payment Methods, Recoveries, and Deductions.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want the Work State field to be hidden when processing UK market claims, so that the form reflects the absence of state-level regulations in the UK market.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: process UK market Income Protection (GIP) claims with locale-specific UI adaptations, data formats, terminology, and business rules that automatically apply when the system locale is set to 'en_GB'
- **Value**: the claims processing experience aligns with UK market requirements, regulatory context, and user expectations, eliminating irrelevant fields like Work State and ERISA while ensuring proper UK-specific data formats and terminology

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** process UK market Income Protection (GIP) claims with locale-specific UI adaptations, data formats, terminology, and business rules that automatically apply when the system locale is set to 'en_GB',
> **so that** the claims processing experience aligns with UK market requirements, regulatory context, and user expectations, eliminating irrelevant fields like Work State and ERISA while ensuring proper UK-specific data formats and terminology.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System detects locale setting and automatically applies all UK-specific adaptations when locale is set to 'en_GB'; all existing functionality for other locales remains unchanged.
> 2. User processes Event Case Intake with UK-specific member data entry, including:
>    2.1. Country field defaults to 'United Kingdom'.
>    2.2. 'State/Province' field is replaced with 'County' field populated from UK-specific county lookup values.
>    2.3. Postal Code field applies UK validation rules and displays as 'Zip Code/Postal'.
>    2.4. Phone number input applies UK-specific formatting and masking (11 digits per E.164 standard, displayed as (020) XXXX XXXX or +44 20 XXXX XXXX).
>    2.5. Work State field is completely hidden and non-functional for UK locale.
>    2.6. ERISA field is hidden as UK does not have ERISA regulations.
> 3. User manages Absence Period with localized date formats:
>    3.1. All date fields and date pickers use DD/MM/YYYY format instead of MM/DD/YYYY.
>    3.2. Date and Time displays use DD/MM/YYYY HH:MM format.
>    3.3. 'Elimination Period' terminology is replaced with 'Deferred Period' and 'Elimination Period Through Date' becomes 'Deferred Period Through Date'.
> 4. User creates Income Protection (GIP) claims with UK-specific attributes:
>    4.1. Claim type displays as 'GIP' instead of 'LTD'.
>    4.2. Claim numbers use 'GIP' prefix (e.g., GIP2222) consistently across all system records, references, entity references, and history.
>    4.3. All currency symbols display as '' instead of '$' for Base Salary Amount, Annual Salary Amount, Covered Annual Commission/Bonus, Weekly/Monthly amounts.
> 5. User manages Coverage with UK-specific display:
>    5.1. Deferred periods display with UK terminology.
>    5.2. All monetary amounts display in  currency.
> 6. User enters Offsets and Deductions using UK-specific lookup values:
>    6.1. Offset types include: Holiday Pay, Salary Continuance, Income Protection Benefit.
>    6.2. Deduction types include: Other Miscellaneous, Medical, Critical Illness, Other Income Protection Policy.
>    6.3. All offset and deduction amounts display in  currency.
> 7. User manages Ancillary Activities using UK-specific lookup values: Ancilliary Activities, Activities of Daily Living (ADLs), Vocational Rehabilitation Programme.
> 8. User processes Financial Management with UK localization:
>    8.1. All payment amounts display in  currency.
>    8.2. 'Check' terminology is replaced with 'Cheque' throughout the interface.
>    8.3. When 'Cheque' is selected as payment method, address field label changes from 'Check Address' to 'Cheque Address'.
>    8.4. When credit card payment is selected for UK locale, only UK-accepted card types are available: Visa Credit, Visa Debit, MasterCard, American Express.
>    8.5. Entire Taxes Management tab is hidden for UK locale; Taxable % fields and all tax-related sections are inaccessible.
> 9. User reviews Balance Management with localized transaction records displaying  currency, DD/MM/YYYY date formats, and GIP claim references.
> 10. User accesses History and Audit tracking with DD/MM/YYYY HH:MM timestamps, GIP references, and UK terminology throughout.
> 11. User works with Notes, Tasks, and BAMs that reflect UK terminology and date formats.
> 12. GBA and AGBA labels are hidden for UK locale as these US carrier-specific labels do not apply to UK Income Protection products.
> 13. All claim data for UK locale is stored with  currency and DD/MM/YYYY date formats; reports and exports display localized formats and terminology.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the system locale is set to 'en_GB', **when** a Claims Adjuster accesses any claims processing screen, **then** all UK-specific adaptations (date formats, currency, terminology, field visibility) are automatically applied.
> 2. **Given** the system locale is NOT 'en_GB', **when** a user accesses claims processing screens, **then** all existing functionality for other locales remains unchanged and no UK-specific adaptations are applied.
> 3. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is processing a UK claim, **when** viewing the Event Case Intake screen, **then** the Work State field is completely hidden and non-functional.
> 4. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is processing a UK claim, **when** viewing the Event Case Intake screen, **then** the ERISA field is hidden and non-functional.
> 5. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is processing a UK claim, **when** viewing the Financial Management screen, **then** the entire Taxes Management tab is hidden and all Taxable % fields are inaccessible.
> 6. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is entering member address information for UK locale, **when** the Country field is accessed, **then** it defaults to 'United Kingdom'.
> 7. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is entering member address information for UK locale, **when** entering location details, **then** 'State/Province' field is replaced with 'County' field populated from UK-specific county lookup values (integration: GENESIS-285227).
> 8. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is entering a postal code for UK locale, **when** the Postal Code field is accessed, **then** it displays as 'Zip Code/Postal' and applies UK validation rules (integration: GENESIS-255062).
> 9. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is entering a phone number for UK locale, **when** entering the phone number, **then** UK-specific formatting and masking is applied expecting 11 digits per E.164 standard and displaying as (020) XXXX XXXX or +44 20 XXXX XXXX format (integration: GENESIS-255063).
> 10. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is viewing any date field for UK locale, **when** dates are displayed or entered, **then** all date fields and date pickers use DD/MM/YYYY format instead of MM/DD/YYYY.
> 11. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is viewing date and time information for UK locale, **when** timestamps are displayed, **then** they use DD/MM/YYYY HH:MM format.
> 12. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is creating an Income Protection claim for UK locale, **when** the claim is created, **then** the claim number uses 'GIP' prefix (e.g., GIP2222) consistently across all system records, references, and history.
> 13. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is viewing any monetary field for UK locale, **when** currency amounts are displayed, **then** all currency symbols display as '' instead of '$' for all amount fields (Base Salary, Annual Salary, Commissions, Bonuses, Offsets, Deductions, Payments, Recoveries, Balances, Transactions).
> 14. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is viewing Coverage Management for UK locale, **when** viewing elimination period fields, **then** terminology displays as 'Deferred Period' and 'Deferred Period Through Date' instead of 'Elimination Period' and 'Elimination Period Through Date'.
> 15. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is selecting payment method for UK locale, **when** 'Cheque' is selected, **then** all related labels and references use 'Cheque' terminology and the address field label changes from 'Check Address' to 'Cheque Address'.
> 16. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is selecting credit card payment for UK locale, **when** choosing card type, **then** only UK-accepted card types are available: Visa Credit, Visa Debit, MasterCard, American Express.
> 17. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is entering Offsets for UK locale, **when** selecting offset type, **then** UK-specific lookup values are available: Holiday Pay, Salary Continuance, Income Protection Benefit.
> 18. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is entering Deductions for UK locale, **when** selecting deduction type, **then** UK-specific lookup values are available: Other Miscellaneous, Medical, Critical Illness, Other Income Protection Policy.
> 19. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is managing Ancillary Activities for UK locale, **when** selecting activity type, **then** UK-specific lookup values are available: Ancilliary Activities, Activities of Daily Living (ADLs), Vocational Rehabilitation Programme.
> 20. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is viewing History and Audit records for UK locale, **when** reviewing historical records, **then** all timestamps display in DD/MM/YYYY HH:MM format with GIP references and UK terminology.
> 21. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is processing a UK claim, **when** viewing any screen, **then** GBA and AGBA labels are hidden as they do not apply to UK Income Protection products.
> 22. **Given** a Claims Adjuster has completed a UK claim, **when** the claim data is stored, **then** all data is saved with  currency and DD/MM/YYYY date formats in appropriate database fields.
> 23. **Given** a Claims Adjuster generates reports or exports for UK claims, **when** viewing the output, **then** all data displays with localized formats and terminology consistent with UK requirements.
> 24. **Given** UK-specific lookup tables are not configured, **when** a Claims Adjuster attempts to access County, Offset, Deduction, or Ancillary Activity fields, **then** an appropriate error message is displayed indicating missing configuration.
> 25. **Given** integration endpoints (GENESIS-255062, GENESIS-255063, GENESIS-285227) are not operational, **when** UK-specific validations or lookups are triggered, **then** appropriate error handling prevents data corruption and notifies the user.

>    8.1 System applies DD/MM/YYYY format to Post Date and all Period dates.
>    8.2 System displays all payment amounts in  currency.
>    8.3 System relabels 'Check' to 'Cheque' for Recovery Method and throughout all payment references.
>    8.4 System hides all tax-related payment fields and amounts.

> 9. During Balance Management, system tracks all claim balances in  currency with DD/MM/YYYY format for transaction dates, and hides tax-related balance components.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the system locale is set to en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster accesses any claims interface, **then** all date fields throughout the application display and accept dates in DD/MM/YYYY format.
> 2. **Given** the system locale is set to en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster views or enters monetary values, **then** all currency fields display  symbol instead of $ symbol.
> 3. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is capturing Member Information during Event Case Intake, **when** entering Date of Hire and Date of Birth, **then** the system accepts and displays these dates in DD/MM/YYYY format.
> 4. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is entering a UK phone number, **when** the phone number is saved, **then** the system applies UK-specific formatting and masking supporting up to 15 digits (typically 11) with area codes of 3, 4, or 5 digits.
> 5. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is entering member address information, **when** the address form loads, **then** the Country field defaults to 'United Kingdom', the field labeled 'State/Province' is relabeled to 'County' with UK-specific lookup values, and Work State field is hidden.
> 6. **Given** a Claims Adjuster enters a UK postal code, **when** the postal code is validated, **then** the system applies UK-specific postal code validation rules (ref: GENESIS-255062).
> 7. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is creating a new claim during Case Details step, **when** the claim is generated, **then** the Claim Number includes 'GIP' prefix and Claim Type displays as 'GIP' (Group Income Protection).
> 8. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is configuring Coverage and Benefits, **when** viewing the interface, **then** all salary fields (Base Salary Amount, Annual Salary Amount, Covered Annual Commission, Covered Annual Bonus, Total Annual Covered Earnings, Covered Monthly Earnings, Monthly Minimum/Maximum, Gross Monthly Amount) display in  currency.
> 9. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is configuring Coverage and Benefits, **when** viewing the interface, **then** 'Elimination Period Through Date' is relabeled to 'Deferred Period Through Date', and Taxable%, tax-related fields, and ERISA field are hidden.
> 10. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is processing Offsets, **when** selecting Offset Type, **then** the lookup values are limited to: Holiday Pay, Salary Continuance, Income Protection Benefit only.
> 11. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is processing Deductions, **when** selecting Deduction Type, **then** the lookup values are limited to: Other Miscellaneous, Medical, Critical Illness, Other Income Protection Policy only.
> 12. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is processing payments, **when** viewing payment method options, **then** 'Check' is relabeled to 'Cheque' throughout all payment references and cheque address fields.
> 13. **Given** a Claims Adjuster selects credit card payment method, **when** choosing Credit Card Type, **then** the system limits options to: Visa Credit, Visa Debit, MasterCard, American Express.
> 14. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is viewing Payments and Recoveries, **when** the payment details display, **then** all payment amounts are shown in  currency, dates in DD/MM/YYYY format, and all tax-related fields are hidden.
> 15. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is viewing Balance Management, **when** the balance details display, **then** all balance amounts are shown in  currency, transaction dates in DD/MM/YYYY format, and tax-related balance components are hidden.
> 16. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is viewing Case Overview or History, **when** the display loads, **then** Event Date, Reporting Date, DOB, and all history dates show DD/MM/YYYY format, claim type shows 'GIP' with 'GIP' prefix, component name shows 'GIP Claim' instead of 'LTD Claim', address shows UK County format, and Work State is hidden.
> 17. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is managing ancillary activities, **when** selecting activity types, **then** the lookup values include UK terminology: Ancillary Activities, Activities of Daily Living (ADLs), Vocational Rehabilitation Programme.
> 18. **Given** the system locale is set to anything other than en_GB, **when** a Claims Adjuster accesses claims interfaces, **then** UK-specific adaptations are not applied and the system functions with existing US/default formatting.
> 19. **Given** a Claims Adjuster enters an invalid UK postal code, **when** validation occurs, **then** the system displays an appropriate error message and prevents submission.
> 20. **Given** a Claims Adjuster enters a UK phone number with more than 15 digits, **when** validation occurs, **then** the system displays an error message indicating maximum length exceeded.

>   "14. Alternate Flow - Non-UK Locale: When locale is NOT set to en_GB, all attributes function as currently implemented in US/default configuration (MM/DD/YYYY date format, $ currency, US phone/address standards, LTD claim type with LTD prefix, US-specific fields visible, 'Check' terminology, US offset/deduction types, US-specific lookups)."

**Acceptance Criteria:**

>   "2.2 Given locale is en_GB, When a user enters a date in MM/DD/YYYY format, Then the system either converts it appropriately or displays a validation error prompting DD/MM/YYYY format.",
>   "2.3 Given locale is en_GB, When date ranges are displayed (e.g., absence periods, approval periods), Then the format is 'DD/MM/YYYY - DD/MM/YYYY'.",

>   "3.2 Given locale is en_GB, When a user enters a monetary value, Then the system accepts and stores the value with  currency designation.",
>   "4. Address Localization:",

>   "4.3 Given locale is NOT en_GB, When an address form is displayed, Then State/Province field uses US state lookup and US zip code validation applies.",
>   "5. Phone Number Formatting:",

>   "7.2 Given locale is en_GB, When payment-related screens are displayed, Then all instances of 'Check' are replaced with 'Cheque' (including Check Address  Cheque Address).",
>   "7.3 Given locale is en_GB, When claim details are displayed, Then 'Elimination Period' is relabeled to 'Deferred Period'.",

>   "8.2 Given locale is en_GB, When deduction type dropdown is displayed, Then only UK-specific deduction types are available (Other Miscellaneous, Medical, Critical Illness, Other Income Protection Policy).",
>   "8.3 Given locale is en_GB, When credit card type dropdown is displayed in Payment Methods, Then only UK-specific card types are available (Visa Credit, Visa Debit, MasterCard, American Express).",

>   "9.2 Given locale is en_GB, When Balance Management screen is accessed, Then all balance amounts display in , payment dates display in DD/MM/YYYY, and tax line items (GBA, AGBA, Tax fields) are not visible in any breakdown view.",

>   "10.2 Given locale is en_GB, When GIP claim data is displayed in History, Tasks, Notes, or BAMs, Then entity types display 'GIP' instead of 'LTD' and all timestamps use DD/MM/YYYY format.",

>   "11.2 Given a claim was created with locale en_GB, When the same claim is accessed with a different locale setting, Then the claim data displays appropriately for the current locale without data corruption (dates, currency, addresses transform per current locale).",

### Epic: Document & Correspondence Management

#### Feature: As a System Administrator, I want to create and manage dental note templates with configurable attributes (templateCd, title, text, effectiveDate, expirationDate, textMarkupType, ownerName, ownerType), so that claims adjusters can use standardized templates when documenting dental claim notes.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: utilize standardized dental note templates with predefined categories to document claim processing activities
- **Value**: I can consistently document dental claims with structured, compliant notes across all processing stages (Intake, Eligibility, Benefits, Payment, Appeals), improving documentation quality and reducing processing time

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **utilize standardized dental note templates with predefined categories to document claim processing activities**,
> So that **I can consistently document dental claims with structured, compliant notes across all processing stages, improving documentation quality and reducing processing time**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System administrator provisions seven predefined dental note templates (General, Intake, Eligibility, Benefits, Payment, Appeals, Other) with unique identifiers and lifecycle dates
> 2. Upon template creation, system validates uniqueness of template codes and assigns UUID if code not provided
> 3. Claim adjuster selects appropriate template category when documenting dental claim activities at any processing stage
> 4. System applies template configuration including ownership model (DentalLoss/CapLoss), text format (HTML/plainText), and effective date ranges
> 5. Adjuster customizes template content within 2048-character limit while maintaining standardized structure
> 6. System enforces template expiration dates to prevent use of outdated documentation standards


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** administrator creates seven dental templates, **When** all required attributes are provided, **Then** system persists templates with unique codes and makes them available for claim documentation
> 2. **Given** template code is omitted, **When** template is created, **Then** system auto-generates UUID as identifier
> 3. **Given** adjuster documents dental claim, **When** selecting template, **Then** system presents only active templates within effective date range
> 4. **Given** template has expiration date, **When** date passes, **Then** system prevents template selection for new notes
> 5. **Given** template ownership is configured, **When** applied to claim, **Then** system validates against DentalLoss model type
> 6. **Given** incomplete mandatory attributes, **When** template creation attempted, **Then** system prevents submission until title and owner details provided

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to attach and manage dental claim notes using predefined templates during claim intake and adjudication, so that I can maintain consistent and standardized documentation across all dental claims.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: configure and utilize standardized note templates for dental claim documentation throughout intake and adjudication processes
- **Value**: I can ensure consistent, compliant documentation across all dental claims while reducing manual effort and improving claim processing quality

**Description:**

> As a Claim Adjuster,
> I want to configure and utilize standardized note templates for dental claim documentation throughout intake and adjudication processes,
> So that I can ensure consistent, compliant documentation across all dental claims while reducing manual effort and improving claim processing quality.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Configure seven distinct note templates with predefined categories via system API with unique identifiers and business metadata
> 2. Define template attributes including content format, effective dates, ownership model, and expiration parameters for lifecycle management
> 3. Apply appropriate templates during claim intake based on claim stage and documentation requirements
> 4. Attach standardized notes to dental claims during eligibility verification and benefits determination processes
> 5. Document payment decisions and appeals handling using category-specific templates
> 6. Reference templates through unique codes when creating claim notes to maintain documentation consistency


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** template configuration is initiated, **When** all seven category templates are created with valid attributes, **Then** system persists templates with unique identifiers for future reference
> 2. **Given** required attributes are missing, **When** template creation is attempted, **Then** system prevents creation until mandatory fields are provided
> 3. **Given** templates are configured, **When** adjuster creates claim notes, **Then** system enables template selection based on claim stage and category
> 4. **Given** character limits are exceeded, **When** template data is submitted, **Then** system rejects submission with validation guidance
> 5. **Given** effective dates are defined, **When** current date is outside template validity period, **Then** system restricts template availability
> 6. **Given** templates are applied, **When** claim documentation is retrieved, **Then** system displays consistent formatting and standardized content structure

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to submit dental claims (Actual Services, Predetermination, or Ortho) with member, patient, provider, and service line details, so that the system can adjudicate the claim and determine appropriate benefits.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: submit dental claims with member, patient, provider, and service line details for automated adjudication
- **Value**: the system can process claims efficiently, determine appropriate benefits, and route claims to the correct outcome status based on adjudication results

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **submit dental claims with member, patient, provider, and service line details for automated adjudication**,
> So that **the system can process claims efficiently, determine appropriate benefits, and route claims to the correct outcome status based on adjudication results**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates dental claim intake by identifying member, patient, and provider parties
> 2. User selects claim type (Actual Services, Predetermination, or Ortho) and provides claim service line details
> 3. Upon submission, system validates required data completeness and executes dental adjudication rules
> 4. System applies adjudication logic and assigns outcome flags (Allowed, Denied, Review Required) to each service line
> 5. System determines claim status based on adjudication results and claim type
>     5.1 If approved lines exist with no review flags, system sets claim to Open status
>     5.2 If all lines denied, system closes claim in Denied status
> 6. For Actual Services claims, system creates and issues payments immediately; for Ortho claims, system establishes payment schedule


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** valid member, patient, provider, and service line data, **When** user submits claim, **Then** system successfully validates data and executes adjudication rules
> 2. **Given** Actual Services claim with approved lines and no review flags, **When** adjudication completes, **Then** system creates immediate payments and closes claim in Paid status
> 3. **Given** claim with all lines denied, **When** adjudication completes, **Then** system closes claim in Denied status
> 4. **Given** claim with at least one line flagged for review, **When** adjudication completes, **Then** system sets claim status to Pending
> 5. **Given** Predetermination claim, **When** adjudication completes, **Then** system closes claim in Predetermined status without creating payments
> 6. **Given** Ortho claim with approved lines, **When** adjudication completes, **Then** system creates payment schedule and issues payments per schedule

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=509878353"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to distinguish between Predetermination claims (simple Predet or Predet-Preauth) and Actual Services claims during manual intake, so that claims are processed according to their specific business rules and requirements.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: distinguish and submit Predetermination claims (Simple Predet or Predet-Preauth) versus Actual Services claims during manual intake
- **Value**: claims are routed through appropriate adjudication workflows and preauthorization dependencies are enforced, preventing processing errors and ensuring compliance with business rules

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **distinguish and submit Predetermination claims (Simple Predet or Predet-Preauth) versus Actual Services claims during manual intake**,
> So that **claims are routed through appropriate adjudication workflows and preauthorization dependencies are enforced, preventing processing errors and ensuring compliance with business rules**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User is able to designate claim type during manual intake as either Predetermination (Simple Predet or Predet-Preauth) or Actual Services
> 2. Upon claim type selection, system enforces separation rules preventing mixed submissions
> 3. System validates Actual Services lines requiring preauthorization against previously approved Predet-Preauth claims
>     3.1 When matching preauth exists, system links authorization number to claim line
>     3.2 When preauth missing for required lines, system denies those lines
> 4. System routes Predetermination claims through estimate adjudication workflow, resulting in Predetermined-Approved, Predetermined-Denied, or Pending status
> 5. System routes Actual Services claims through payment adjudication workflow, resulting in Closed-Paid, Closed-Denied, or Pending status


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** adjuster submits Predetermination claim, **When** adjudication completes successfully with at least one approved line, **Then** claim status is Predetermined-Approved
> 2. **Given** adjuster submits Actual Services claim, **When** service lines require preauthorization and matching approved Predet-Preauth exists, **Then** system links preauth number and processes lines
> 3. **Given** adjuster submits Actual Services claim, **When** required preauthorization is missing, **Then** system denies those lines while processing remaining eligible lines
> 4. **Given** adjuster attempts mixed claim submission, **When** system detects both Predet and Actual Services lines, **Then** system prevents submission
> 5. **Given** adjudication fails for any claim type, **When** processing errors occur, **Then** system assigns Pending status for manual review

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want the system to automatically validate preauthorization requirements for Actual Services claims and deny lines that lack required preauthorization, so that only properly authorized services are paid.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: automatically validate preauthorization requirements for Actual Services claims and ensure only properly authorized lines are approved for payment
- **Value**: claims are adjudicated accurately, unauthorized services are systematically denied, and payment integrity is maintained without manual verification effort

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **automatically validate preauthorization requirements for Actual Services claims and ensure only properly authorized lines are approved for payment**,
> So that **claims are adjudicated accurately, unauthorized services are systematically denied, and payment integrity is maintained without manual verification effort**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System adjudicates submitted Actual Services claims and identifies lines requiring preauthorization
> 2. System validates existence of related approved Predetermination-Preauthorization claims for required services
>     2.1 When related preauth exists: system authorizes lines and attaches preauthorization reference number
>     2.2 When preauth is missing: system automatically denies lines requiring authorization
> 3. System processes remaining authorized lines through standard adjudication rules
> 4. System determines final claim disposition based on approved line availability
> 5. System assigns appropriate claim status: Closed-Paid when authorized lines approved, Closed-Denied when all lines denied, or Pending when adjudication cannot complete


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an Actual Services claim with lines requiring preauthorization, **When** related approved preauth claims exist, **Then** system authorizes those lines and proceeds with adjudication
> 2. **Given** lines requiring preauthorization without approved preauth, **When** claim is adjudicated, **Then** system automatically denies unauthorized lines
> 3. **Given** a claim with mixed authorized and unauthorized lines, **When** processing completes, **Then** only properly authorized lines are eligible for payment
> 4. **Given** all claim lines lack required preauthorization, **When** adjudication completes, **Then** claim status is set to Closed-Denied
> 5. **Given** at least one authorized line is approved, **When** final determination occurs, **Then** claim status is set to Closed-Paid

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want the system to automatically set claim status (Open, Pending, Closed-Denied, Closed-Paid, or Closed-Predetermined) based on adjudication results and claim type, so that claims flow through the correct lifecycle without manual intervention.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: enable automated claim status transitions based on adjudication outcomes and claim type business rules
- **Value**: claims progress through their lifecycle without manual status updates, reducing processing time and ensuring consistent status assignment across all claim types

**Description:**

> As a Claim Adjuster,
> I want to enable automated claim status transitions based on adjudication outcomes and claim type business rules,
> So that claims progress through their lifecycle without manual status updates, reducing processing time and ensuring consistent status assignment across all claim types


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System adjudicates submitted claims and applies decision flags to each service line
> 2. Upon adjudication completion, system evaluates line-level outcomes against claim type rules
>     2.1 When all lines denied, system assigns Closed-Denied status
>     2.2 When review required on any line, system assigns Pending status
> 3. For Actual Services and Ortho claims with allowed lines and no reviews, system assigns Open status
> 4. For Predetermination claims, system assigns Closed-Predetermined status regardless of line outcomes
> 5. System initiates payment processing or schedules based on status and claim type
> 6. Upon payment completion, system transitions claim to Closed-Paid status automatically


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** Actual Services claim adjudication completes with all lines denied, **When** status assignment executes, **Then** system sets status to Closed-Denied without manual intervention
> 2. **Given** any claim type has lines requiring review, **When** adjudication completes, **Then** system assigns Pending status and halts payment processing
> 3. **Given** Predetermination claim completes adjudication, **When** status determination occurs, **Then** system assigns Closed-Predetermined regardless of line outcomes
> 4. **Given** Ortho claim with allowed lines and no reviews, **When** status transitions, **Then** system assigns Open and creates payment schedule
> 5. **Given** Actual Services claim payments issued, **When** payment confirmation received, **Then** system automatically transitions to Closed-Paid
> 6. **Given** incomplete adjudication data, **When** status assignment attempted, **Then** system prevents status transition until adjudication completes

> [

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want the system to automatically create and issue payments for approved Actual Services claims and payment schedules for approved Ortho claims, so that eligible benefits are paid without manual payment creation.

> I want to **enable automated payment creation and issuance for approved dental claims based on claim type**,
> So that **eligible benefits are disbursed efficiently without manual payment intervention, reducing processing time and operational overhead**.

> 2. System determines claim status based on adjudication outcomes (Allowed, Denied, Review Required) and claim type
> 3. When Actual Services claim has approved lines, system automatically creates and issues individual payments

> 4. When Ortho claim has approved lines, system establishes payment schedule and executes periodic payments

> 3. **Given** a claim with all denied lines, **When** adjudication completes, **Then** system closes claim as Closed-Denied without payment creation
> 4. **Given** a claim requiring review, **When** adjudication completes, **Then** system sets status to Pending and prevents automatic payment processing
> 5. **Given** a Predetermination claim, **When** adjudication completes, **Then** system closes claim without payment generation

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want the system to execute payment generation and issuance jobs that validate payment amounts, generate dispatch requests, and track payment status, so that payments are reliably processed and issued to providers.
- **Role**: Claim Manager
- **Action**: execute scheduled payment generation and issuance jobs that validate payment eligibility, create dispatch requests, and monitor payment status throughout the processing lifecycle
- **Value**: payments are accurately validated, reliably dispatched to providers through integrated payment systems, and exceptions are promptly identified for resolution, ensuring timely provider reimbursement and operational efficiency

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Manager**,
> I want to **execute scheduled payment generation and issuance jobs that validate payment eligibility, create dispatch requests, and monitor payment status throughout the processing lifecycle**,
> So that **payments are accurately validated, reliably dispatched to providers through integrated payment systems, and exceptions are promptly identified for resolution, ensuring timely provider reimbursement and operational efficiency**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System executes scheduled payment generation job to identify approved settlements eligible for payment processing
> 2. System validates payment amounts against business rules and eligibility criteria before creating payment requests
> 3. System generates dispatch requests and transmits payment instructions to integrated payment hub for processing
>     3.1 Upon successful dispatch confirmation, system updates payment status and completes payment schedule
>     3.2 When dispatch fails, system executes failure handling workflow and creates intervention tasks
> 4. System tracks payment status transitions from generation through successful issuance or failure resolution
> 5. User is able to review and resolve failed payment exceptions through designated intervention workflows
> 6. System closes settlements and associated claims upon successful payment completion


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an approved settlement with validated payment amount, **When** payment generation job executes, **Then** system creates payment request and advances to issuance workflow
> 2. **Given** payment request generated, **When** payment issue job executes, **Then** system transmits dispatch request to payment hub and awaits confirmation
> 3. **Given** payment hub confirms successful dispatch, **When** system receives confirmation, **Then** payment status updates to completed and settlement closes automatically
> 4. **Given** payment dispatch fails validation or transmission, **When** failure detected, **Then** system triggers failure lifecycle command and creates intervention task
> 5. **Given** payment amounts fail business rule validation, **When** generation job executes, **Then** system prevents payment request creation and records validation exception
> 6. **Given** payment schedule completed successfully, **When** all payments processed, **Then** system closes associated settlement and updates claim status accordingly


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=529961891"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want the system to automatically re-adjudicate settlements when claims are adjusted or reopened, so that benefit calculations remain accurate and compliant with current policy rules.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: trigger automated re-adjudication of settlements when claims are adjusted or reopened
- **Value**: benefit calculations remain accurate, compliant with current policy rules, and settlements reflect the most recent claim information without manual recalculation

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **trigger automated re-adjudication of settlements when claims are adjusted or reopened**,
> So that **benefit calculations remain accurate, compliant with current policy rules, and settlements reflect the most recent claim information without manual recalculation**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User adjusts claim details or reopens previously closed claim requiring settlement recalculation.
>     1.1 Upon reopening closed claim, system validates current claim status and restores loss to active state.
>     1.2 User updates loss information, modifies settlement parameters, or corrects claim data.
> 2. System automatically triggers re-adjudication workflow upon detecting claim modifications or reopening events.
> 3. Adjudication engine recalculates benefit amounts applying current policy rules, coverage limits, and accumulator balances.
> 4. System updates settlement status to pending, reflecting recalculated benefit amounts and payment schedules.
> 5. User reviews re-adjudicated settlement results and approves or disapproves based on calculated outcomes.
> 6. Upon approval, system rebuilds payment schedules and processes payments according to updated settlement values.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim is adjusted with updated loss information, **When** modifications are submitted, **Then** system automatically initiates re-adjudication without manual intervention.
> 2. **Given** a previously closed claim is reopened, **When** loss is reactivated, **Then** system restores claim to pending status and triggers settlement recalculation.
> 3. **Given** re-adjudication is triggered, **When** adjudication engine processes claim, **Then** benefit amounts reflect current policy rules and updated claim data.
> 4. **Given** settlement is re-adjudicated, **When** recalculation completes, **Then** payment schedules are automatically rebuilt based on new settlement values.
> 5. **Given** re-adjudication fails validation, **When** errors are detected, **Then** system prevents settlement approval and notifies user of compliance issues.
> 6. **Given** predetermination claims are adjusted, **When** re-adjudication occurs, **Then** system applies special logic ensuring no actual payments or accumulator impacts.

## Initiative: Adjudication & Coverage Evaluation

### Epic: Core Adjudication Engine & Decision Logic

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to calculate and apply COLA adjustments to disability benefits annually, so that claimants' income keeps pace with inflation.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: calculate and apply annual COLA adjustments to long-term disability benefit payments based on policy parameters and inflation indices
- **Value**: claimants receive benefit payments that maintain purchasing power relative to inflation, ensuring financial adequacy throughout the disability period

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **calculate and apply annual COLA adjustments to long-term disability benefit payments based on policy parameters and inflation indices**,
> So that **claimants receive benefit payments that maintain purchasing power relative to inflation, ensuring financial adequacy throughout the disability period**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System configures COLA parameters at policy level including adjustment type (Fixed or CPI-indexed), calculation method (Compound or Simple), elimination period, maximum cap percentage, adjustment limits, and CPI index type
> 2. System determines COLA anniversary date based on elimination period completion and establishes annual recalculation schedule
> 3. System calculates accumulated COLA percentage using configured methodology with mathematical rounding to four decimal places
>     3.1 When using CPI-indexed compound method, system applies multiplicative formula across all prior years
>     3.2 When using fixed simple method, system applies linear multiplication
>     3.3 System applies maximum adjustment cap to each period's percentage
>     3.4 When CPI value is negative, system treats as zero percent
> 4. System applies calculated adjustment to benefit amount at each anniversary date subject to policy limits
> 5. Upon reaching configured adjustment limit, system maintains most recent benefit amount without further increases
> 6. When required CPI data is unavailable, system prevents settlement approval until data is available


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** policy with CPI-indexed compound COLA configured with 12-month elimination period, **when** elimination period completes and anniversary date arrives with valid CPI data, **then** system calculates accumulated percentage using multiplicative formula and applies adjustment to benefit amount
> 2. **Given** policy with fixed simple COLA configured, **when** annual anniversary occurs, **then** system calculates percentage as fixed rate multiplied by year number and adjusts benefit accordingly
> 3. **Given** CPI percentage exceeds policy maximum adjustment cap, **when** system calculates COLA, **then** system applies capped value instead of actual CPI percentage
> 4. **Given** required CPI index data is missing from configuration, **when** adjuster attempts settlement approval, **then** system blocks approval until data becomes available
> 5. **Given** policy with adjustment limit of N years, **when** Nth anniversary calculation completes, **then** system maintains benefit amount without further COLA increases
> 6. **Given** negative CPI percentage for any year, **when** system calculates indexed adjustment, **then** system treats negative value as zero percent

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to validate claim eligibility against policy effective dates and member waiting periods, so that only eligible claims are approved for payment.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: validate claim eligibility against policy effective dates, member waiting periods, and benefit limits through automated adjudication rules
- **Value**: only eligible claims with sufficient coverage and satisfied waiting periods are approved for payment, preventing erroneous payments and ensuring policy compliance

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **validate claim eligibility against policy effective dates, member waiting periods, and benefit limits through automated adjudication rules**,
> So that **only eligible claims with sufficient coverage and satisfied waiting periods are approved for payment, preventing erroneous payments and ensuring policy compliance**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System validates claim data integrity and completeness against policy terms upon claim submission or update
> 2. System evaluates member eligibility by verifying coverage effective dates, waiting period satisfaction, and active enrollment status
>     2.1 When critical validation errors exist, claim is marked ineligible and processing halts immediately
>     2.2 Upon eligibility confirmation, system proceeds to benefit calculation stage
> 3. System calculates benefit amounts including elimination periods, covered earnings, and gross benefit amounts based on product-specific rules
> 4. System creates or updates benefit accumulators to track utilized limits and reserves amounts for approved periods
>     4.1 If approval period exceeds remaining accumulator balance, system generates critical error and prevents approval
> 5. System re-executes adjudication logic automatically when claim data is modified to ensure continued eligibility
> 6. Upon successful adjudication, claim advances to payment allocation stage with calculated benefit amounts


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim with valid policy effective dates and satisfied waiting periods, **When** adjudication executes, **Then** system marks claim as eligible and calculates benefit amounts
> 2. **Given** critical validation errors exist, **When** adjudication begins, **Then** system halts processing immediately without proceeding to eligibility or benefit calculation
> 3. **Given** member coverage is inactive on date of loss, **When** eligibility evaluation runs, **Then** system marks claim as ineligible for payment
> 4. **Given** approval period exceeds remaining accumulator balance, **When** accumulator validation occurs, **Then** system prevents approval and generates critical error
> 5. **Given** claim data is modified, **When** update is saved, **Then** system automatically re-adjudicates and recalculates all eligibility and benefit determinations
> 6. **Given** all adjudication stages pass successfully, **When** process completes, **Then** system advances claim to payment allocation with approved benefit amounts
