#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to calculate gross benefit amounts based on policy formulas and accumulator limits, so that accurate payment amounts are determined for each coverage.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: calculate gross benefit amounts based on policy formulas and accumulator limits
- **Value**: accurate payment amounts are determined for each coverage

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **calculate gross benefit amounts based on policy formulas and accumulator limits**,
> So that **accurate payment amounts are determined for each coverage**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User is able to determine calculation method by checking manual override status and retrieving policy benefit parameters.
> 2. User is able to calculate accumulator remaining amounts using year-boundary logic, converting units between single and group accumulators when necessary.
>     2.1 Upon date range crossing year boundaries, system splits calculation into separate periods at year-end.
>     2.2 When accumulator units differ, system converts units to monetary values, performs calculations, then converts back.
> 3. User is able to execute configured formulas comparing units against remaining amounts to determine final gross benefit.
> 4. User is able to handle coverage recalculations after policy changes, generating overpayment balances and withholding adjustments.
> 5. User is able to apply coverage-specific override rules based on limit unit type and accumulator period constraints.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** manual override is disabled, **When** adjudicator initiates calculation, **Then** system retrieves policy data and executes formula-based calculation through all four sequential steps.
> 2. **Given** date range spans calendar/benefit year boundary, **When** accumulator calculation occurs, **Then** system splits into two periods and calculates remaining amounts separately per year.
> 3. **Given** single and group accumulators use different units, **When** calculation executes, **Then** system converts units to money, performs calculations, and converts results back with proper rounding.
> 4. **Given** coverage is cancelled or modified post-payment, **When** recalculation triggers, **Then** system generates overpayment balance and performs withholding from pending allocations.
> 5. **Given** accumulator is calendar/benefit year based with day units, **When** adjudicator attempts override, **Then** system prevents override per configuration constraints.
> 6. **Given** calculation completes successfully, **When** settlement is approved, **Then** system updates accumulator reserves and used amounts per configured timing rules.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to override eligibility results when appropriate, so that non-eligible claims can be manually approved based on business judgment.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: override system-determined eligibility results when business judgment requires manual approval of non-eligible claims
- **Value**: claims requiring exceptional handling can be approved despite initial ineligibility, ensuring business flexibility and customer satisfaction while maintaining control through privilege-based authorization

**Description:**

> As a Claim Adjuster,
> I want to override system-determined eligibility results when business judgment requires manual approval of non-eligible claims,
> So that claims requiring exceptional handling can be approved despite initial ineligibility, ensuring business flexibility and customer satisfaction while maintaining control through privilege-based authorization.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User reviews system-generated eligibility determination and identifies need for manual override based on business judgment
> 2. User initiates override process by entering settlement edit mode with appropriate system privileges
>     2.1 Upon lacking override privilege, system prevents access to override functionality
> 3. User applies override by selecting alternate eligibility status through manual selection mechanism
> 4. System preserves override decision and prevents automatic re-validation during subsequent updates
> 5. User removes override when business conditions change, triggering fresh automated eligibility assessment
> 6. System maintains override indicator for audit transparency and tracking purposes


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** user possesses override privileges, **When** eligibility override is applied, **Then** system accepts manual eligibility determination and displays override indicator
> 2. **Given** override is active, **When** claim data is updated, **Then** system maintains overridden status without automatic re-validation
> 3. **Given** user lacks override privileges, **When** attempting override access, **Then** system prevents override functionality entirely
> 4. **Given** override is removed, **When** user confirms removal, **Then** system executes fresh automated eligibility validation
> 5. **Given** override exists, **When** user reviews eligibility status, **Then** system clearly identifies result as manually overridden
> 6. **Given** eligibility assessment fails, **When** user reviews determination, **Then** system provides detailed reasoning for ineligibility decision

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to calculate COLA anniversary dates based on consecutive or non-consecutive payment patterns, so that COLA adjustments are applied at the correct time.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: calculate COLA anniversary dates based on consecutive or non-consecutive payment patterns
- **Value**: COLA adjustments are applied at the correct time

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **calculate COLA anniversary dates based on consecutive or non-consecutive payment patterns**,
> So that **COLA adjustments are applied at the correct time**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System checks for manual anniversary date override and applies it if present, otherwise proceeds with automated calculation
> 2. System determines elimination period start date using policy-defined waiting period type (consecutive requires full-month payments only; non-consecutive allows gaps and prorated payments)
> 3. System applies inclusion rules to filter eligible payments based on payee, payment type, disability status, and policy parameters
> 4. System calculates elimination period end date by accumulating payment durations until waiting period threshold is met, accounting for full-month versus partial-month allocations
> 5. System establishes COLA payment anniversary date as day following elimination period end and applies annual adjustments
> 6. System enforces adjustment limits per policy terms and continues applying COLA to all subsequent payments between anniversaries


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a manual override exists, **When** system processes anniversary calculation, **Then** system applies overridden date and skips automated calculation
> 2. **Given** consecutive waiting period type, **When** system identifies payment allocations, **Then** system only counts continuous full-month payments and resets calculation if non-compliant payment interrupts sequence
> 3. **Given** non-consecutive waiting period type, **When** system accumulates payment durations, **Then** system includes prorated payments and gaps until reaching required months
> 4. **Given** partial disability payments exist, **When** policy parameter permits partial disability inclusion, **Then** system counts partial disability periods as full days toward elimination period
> 5. **Given** elimination period is satisfied, **When** anniversary date is reached, **Then** system automatically calculates and applies COLA increase to all subsequent payments
> 6. **Given** policy defines adjustment limit, **When** limit is reached, **Then** system stops calculating new increases and continues applying last calculated COLA indefinitely

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=733053969"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to index pre-disability earnings annually to account for inflation, so that disability income thresholds remain accurate over time.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: index pre-disability earnings annually to account for inflation
- **Value**: disability income thresholds remain accurate over time and reflect current economic conditions

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **index pre-disability earnings annually to account for inflation**,
> So that **disability income thresholds remain accurate over time and reflect current economic conditions**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System determines annual adjustment percentage from policy configuration or retrieves Consumer Price Index values from system tables
> 2. System applies maximum adjustment percentage cap and selects lower value as indexing rate for the year
>     2.1 When CPI-based indexing is used, system aligns calendar year CPI data and treats negative values as zero
>     2.2 System validates CPI availability and blocks approval if required index is missing
> 3. System calculates accumulated indexing percentage using simple approach across multiple benefit years
> 4. System applies accumulated percentage to Average Gross Benefit Amount for benefit recalculation
> 5. System rounds accumulated percentage to four decimal places and updates disability income threshold
> 6. Upon indexing completion, system enables claim approval with updated benefit amounts


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** fixed percentage indexing is configured, **When** calculation occurs in second benefit year, **Then** system accumulates percentage using multiplication method and rounds to four decimals
> 2. **Given** CPI-based indexing is configured, **When** system retrieves annual CPI values, **Then** system sums yearly percentages and applies maximum cap if exceeded
> 3. **Given** CPI index is unavailable, **When** calculation is attempted, **Then** system prevents claim approval and displays error notification
> 4. **Given** negative CPI percentage occurs, **When** calculation processes, **Then** system treats value as zero and continues accumulation
> 5. **Given** accumulated percentage is calculated, **When** applied to Average Gross Benefit Amount, **Then** disability income threshold updates reflect inflation-adjusted earnings
> 6. **Given** indexing completes successfully, **When** adjuster reviews claim, **Then** updated benefit amounts are available for approval decision

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view remaining accumulator limits for each coverage, so that I can verify benefit limits are not exceeded.

- **Action**: monitor and verify remaining accumulator limits across applicable coverages to ensure benefit thresholds are not exceeded during claim adjudication
- **Value**: I can make informed payment decisions that comply with policy benefit limits, prevent overpayments, and maintain accurate financial controls throughout the claim lifecycle

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **monitor and verify remaining accumulator limits across applicable coverages to ensure benefit thresholds are not exceeded during claim adjudication**,
> So that **I can make informed payment decisions that comply with policy benefit limits, prevent overpayments, and maintain accurate financial controls throughout the claim lifecycle**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User is able to retrieve comprehensive limit status for selected coverage during claim review.
> 2. System calculates remaining benefit capacity by aggregating maximum payable amounts, successfully disbursed payments, and reserved settlements.
> 3. When coverage involves bundled benefits (e.g., death and accelerated death), system presents consolidated limit view reflecting interdependencies.
> 4. User is able to assess unit-based limits (time, trip, day metrics) alongside monetary thresholds for multi-dimensional benefit tracking.
> 5. Upon planned settlement approval, system updates reserved amounts and recalculates available capacity in real-time.
> 6. If planned amounts exceed policy thresholds, system flags limit exhaustion while preserving override records for audit transparency.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a coverage with active accumulator tracking, **When** adjuster requests limit information, **Then** system displays current limit level, total used amounts, planned reserves, and calculated remaining capacity.
> 2. **Given** bundled death coverages under Group Term Life, **When** limit view is accessed, **Then** system presents consolidated limit section aggregating death and accelerated death utilization.
> 3. **Given** policy has unit-based benefit structure, **When** limit details are retrieved, **Then** system displays applicable unit type and value mappings or indicates non-applicability.
> 4. **Given** planned settlement is approved, **When** reserves are updated, **Then** system recalculates remaining limit reflecting new reserved amounts within adjudication workflow.
> 5. **Given** reserved or used amounts exceed policy maximum, **When** limit status is displayed, **Then** system indicates zero remaining capacity while retaining actual values for regulatory tracking.
> 6. **Given** specialized benefit calculations apply, **When** limit information is presented, **Then** system applies product-specific rules for accurate capacity determination.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to automatically adjudicate settlements and calculate benefit amounts upon claim submission, so that eligible claims are quickly approved for payment.

- **Action**: automatically adjudicate PET claim settlements and calculate benefit amounts upon submission

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,

> So that **eligible claims are rapidly processed, approved, and routed for payment without manual intervention, reducing processing time and improving customer experience**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Upon claim submission, system automatically creates settlement with service lines and determines applicable policy version based on transaction type (Date of Service for actual claims; Claim Received Date for precertification)
>     1.1 System validates pet eligibility rules against policy terms
>     1.2 System differentiates claim types (Preventive Care, Injury, Illness, Medical Supplies) for versioning
> 2. System calculates benefit amounts using predefined business rules and applies adjudication decision logic
> 3. System proposes settlement action (PAY/DENY for actual services; PRECET-APPROVE/PRECET-DENY for precertification) and auto-approves or disapproves accordingly
> 4. When settlement is approved for actual services, system reserves amounts in Pet Annual Maximum and uses deductible in Pet Annual Deductible accumulators
> 5. Upon precertification processing, system closes settlement and claim without impacting financial accumulators or issuing payment
> 6. System updates claim status based on final settlement proposal and triggers payment automation for approved actual claims


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 2. **Given** eligibility passes, **When** benefit calculation completes, **Then** system returns accurate benefit amount per business rules and proposes PAY or DENY decision
> 3. **Given** settlement proposal is PAY, **When** approval occurs, **Then** Pet Annual Maximum reserves benefit amount and Pet Annual Deductible moves to Used status
> 4. **Given** transaction type is precertification, **When** adjudication completes, **Then** system closes settlement and claim without updating accumulators or issuing payment
> 5. **Given** settlement is approved for actual services, **When** claim status updates, **Then** system automatically triggers payment issuance process
> 6. **Given** incomplete or ineligible claim data, **When** validation fails, **Then** system prevents settlement approval and sets benefit amount to zero

#### Feature: As a Claims Examiner, I want to validate that premiums are paid to date before approving claims, so that claims are only paid when the policy is in good standing.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: validate that premiums are paid to date against the loss occurrence before approving claims
- **Value**: claims are only paid when the policy is in good standing and coverage is active

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **validate that premiums are paid to date against the loss occurrence before approving claims**,
> So that **claims are only paid when the policy is in good standing and coverage is active**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Upon claim creation, system retrieves premium paid to date information from billing records for the associated member
> 2. System evaluates premium payment status against the date of loss occurrence
> 3. When premium paid to date precedes the date of loss, system displays warning indicator to prevent claim payment
>     3.1 System maintains warning visibility throughout adjudication lifecycle
> 4. When premium coverage is current, system allows claim to proceed through standard adjudication workflow
> 5. System displays premium payment status information on claim record for adjuster review
> 6. System applies validation across all claim types including disability, term life, and supplementary benefits


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 2. **Given** premium paid to date is earlier than date of loss, **When** adjuster reviews the claim, **Then** system displays warning indicator preventing payment authorization
> 3. **Given** premium paid to date equals or exceeds date of loss, **When** adjuster evaluates eligibility, **Then** claim proceeds without payment restrictions
> 4. **Given** billing system is unavailable, **When** claim creation is attempted, **Then** system prevents claim submission until premium status is confirmed
> 5. **Given** multiple claim types exist, **When** premium validation executes, **Then** appropriate date of loss definition applies per claim type
> 6. **Given** premium status warning is active, **When** adjuster attempts payment approval, **Then** system blocks transaction until coverage issue is resolved

### Epic: Product-Specific Domain Logic & Configuration

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to configure and track multiple accumulator types (Per Lifetime, Per Event, Per Benefit Year, Per Calendar Year) for each coverage, so that benefit limits are accurately enforced across claims.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: configure and enforce multiple accumulator types across various time periods, coverage scopes, and measurement units to ensure accurate benefit limit tracking
- **Value**: benefit payments remain within contractual policy limits, preventing overpayments and ensuring regulatory compliance across diverse product lines

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **configure and enforce multiple accumulator types across various time periods, coverage scopes, and measurement units to ensure accurate benefit limit tracking**,
> So that **benefit payments remain within contractual policy limits, preventing overpayments and ensuring regulatory compliance across diverse product lines**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Configure accumulator types by defining scope (individual/group-level), time dimension (lifetime/benefit year/calendar year/per event/per confinement), measurement unit (money/days/visits), and applicable product lines
> 2. Upon coverage activation, system initiates accumulator tracking by establishing baseline criteria and matching parameters
> 3. Calculate current accumulation by summing indemnity payments with specified status (Issued/Cleared) filtered by policy ID, insured, coverage/group, date range, and event identifiers
> 4. Compare accumulated totals against configured limits; system prevents additional payments when thresholds are reached
> 5. When dual accumulator types apply, enforce both limits simultaneously
> 6. Reset accumulators automatically based on time dimension rules


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a coverage with lifetime group-level limits, **when** indemnity payments reach the configured maximum, **then** system blocks further payments across all coverages in that group
> 2. **Given** benefit year-based accumulators, **when** policy anniversary occurs, **then** system resets accumulation counters and permits new benefit usage
> 3. **Given** dual accumulator constraints, **when** either limit is exceeded, **then** system prevents payment authorization
> 4. **Given** payment status changes to Cleared, **when** accumulator recalculation occurs, **then** system updates totals reflecting only eligible payment statuses
> 5. **Given** per-event accumulators, **when** a new claim event is created, **then** system establishes independent accumulator tracking
> 6. **Given** incomplete matching criteria, **when** payment submission is attempted, **then** system prevents processing until all required identifiers are provided

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want the system to automatically calculate and reserve accumulator amounts when a settlement is approved, so that remaining benefit limits are accurately updated for future claims.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: automatically calculate and reserve accumulator amounts when a settlement is approved
- **Value**: remaining benefit limits are accurately updated for future claims without manual intervention

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **automatically calculate and reserve accumulator amounts when a settlement is approved**,
> So that **remaining benefit limits are accurately updated for future claims without manual intervention**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System calculates remaining amounts using minimum of single accumulator, prorated days multiplied by benefit amount, and group accumulator limits
> 2. Upon year-end crossing (Calendar or Benefit Year), system divides date ranges into separate periods and applies accumulator rules independently
>     2.1 Calendar Year boundaries apply January 1 through December 31
>     2.2 Benefit Year boundaries apply from policy effective date through twelve months forward
> 3. When accumulator units differ, system converts unit amounts to monetary values using benefit amount multipliers and additional percentages
> 4. System calculates settlement remaining amount by evaluating all coverages sharing the same settlement number
> 5. Upon settlement approval, system reserves calculated amounts against applicable single and group accumulators
> 6. If coverage modifications occur, system recalculates using settlement used amounts and adjusts reserves, generating overpayment records when necessary


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a settlement approval with date range within single year, **When** system calculates reserves, **Then** remaining amount equals minimum of single accumulator, days times benefit amount, and group accumulator
> 2. **Given** a settlement spanning Calendar or Benefit Year boundary, **When** system processes approval, **Then** date range splits into two periods with separate accumulator calculations applied
> 3. **Given** accumulator units differ between single and group, **When** calculation executes, **Then** system converts unit amounts to money using benefit amount multipliers before comparison
> 4. **Given** multiple coverages under one settlement, **When** remaining amount calculates, **Then** system considers total used amounts across all associated coverages
> 5. **Given** coverage amount modification post-approval, **When** recalculation triggers, **Then** system adjusts reserves and generates overpayment if new amount is less than issued
> 6. **Given** dynamic group limit applies, **When** coverage cancellation occurs, **Then** system recalculates group limit and withholds amounts from remaining coverages to offset discrepancies

#### Feature: As a Claims Examiner, I want to validate claim eligibility based on policy status, member effectiveness, and waiting periods, so that only eligible claims proceed to adjudication.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: validate claim eligibility against policy status, coverage rules, and business constraints to determine adjudication readiness
- **Value**: only eligible claims are routed to adjudication, preventing processing delays, reducing manual review costs, and ensuring compliance with policy terms and coverage requirements

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **validate claim eligibility against policy status, coverage rules, and business constraints to determine adjudication readiness**,
> So that **only eligible claims are routed to adjudication, preventing processing delays, reducing manual review costs, and ensuring compliance with policy terms and coverage requirements**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System evaluates submitted claim against sequential eligibility rules, stopping at first matched condition.
>     1.1 Upon override flag presence, system applies override value and bypasses standard rules.
>     1.2 When critical data is missing (policy status, transaction date, loss date), claim is rejected with severity messaging.
> 2. System assesses policy temporal validity by comparing loss date against effective and expiration dates.
> 3. When policy status is cancelled, expired, or inactive, claim is marked ineligible with contextual messaging.
> 4. For STD claims, system verifies member existence in insured parties list.
> 5. System calculates duplicate detection score; if threshold exceeded, claim is flagged as potential duplicate.
> 6. Upon passing all rules or no match, default rule marks claim eligible for adjudication routing.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** override flag is set, **When** eligibility evaluation begins, **Then** system applies override value and skips all other rules.
> 2. **Given** policy status, transaction date, or loss date is missing, **When** evaluation occurs, **Then** system rejects claim with critical severity message identifying missing element.
> 3. **Given** loss date precedes policy effective date and prior claims are allowed, **When** rule evaluation proceeds, **Then** system marks claim eligible with informational message.
> 4. **Given** policy is cancelled/expired/inactive relative to loss date, **When** evaluation runs, **Then** system marks claim ineligible with policy status message.
> 5. **Given** duplicate score meets/exceeds threshold, **When** detection completes, **Then** system flags claim as potential duplicate and marks ineligible.
> 6. **Given** no rules match, **When** evaluation completes, **Then** default rule marks claim eligible for adjudication.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to adjudicate dental claims with dynamic deductible and maximum accumulator calculations based on procedure category and network type, so that benefit amounts are correctly determined.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: adjudicate dental claims with automated deductible and maximum benefit accumulator calculations based on procedure categories and network participation
- **Value**: accurate benefit determinations are achieved through real-time tracking of deductible usage and maximum limits across individual and family policy levels

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **adjudicate dental claims with automated deductible and maximum benefit accumulator calculations based on procedure categories and network participation**,
> So that **accurate benefit determinations are achieved through real-time tracking of deductible usage and maximum limits across individual and family policy levels**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Initialize policy-based accumulators with configured limits for deductibles and maximums with tracking attributes (Limit, Used, Reserve, Remaining)
> 2. Evaluate procedure category, network type, and coverage rules to calculate payable deductible and benefit amounts
> 3. Reserve calculated amounts upon settlement approval, updating remaining balances across applicable individual, family, and coverage-specific accumulators
>     3.1 When multiple accumulators apply, determine final remaining amount as minimum across all relevant accumulators
> 4. Convert reserved amounts to used amounts upon payment issuance, adjusting for installment payments when applicable
> 5. Process overpayment recoveries by reverting used amounts to remaining and allocating excess to suspense
> 6. Handle underpayment corrections and recovery cancellations by adjusting reserved and used amounts with support for negative remaining balances


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** policy has configured deductible and maximum limits, **When** adjudication initiates, **Then** system establishes accumulators with correct initial values based on procedure category and policy hierarchy
> 2. **Given** claim includes procedures across multiple categories, **When** settlement is approved, **Then** system reserves appropriate amounts in correct accumulator combinations per procedure type rules
> 3. **Given** multiple accumulators apply to a procedure, **When** benefit calculation occurs, **Then** system uses minimum remaining amount across all applicable accumulators
> 4. **Given** payment is issued, **When** transaction completes, **Then** reserved amounts transfer to used and remaining balances update accurately
> 5. **Given** overpayment is recovered, **When** recovery exceeds adjustment needed, **Then** unused recovery amount moves to suspense allocation
> 6. **Given** recovery is canceled with insufficient remaining balance, **When** cancellation processes, **Then** system permits negative remaining amounts indicating overpayment condition

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=784765738"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to calculate gross benefit amounts for disability claims using covered earnings, benefit percentages, and minimum/maximum limits, so that weekly or monthly benefit payments are accurate.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: calculate gross benefit amounts for disability claims using covered earnings, benefit percentages, and policy-defined minimum/maximum limits
- **Value**: weekly or monthly benefit payments are accurate and compliant with policy terms

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **calculate gross benefit amounts for disability claims using covered earnings, benefit percentages, and policy-defined minimum/maximum limits**,
> So that **weekly or monthly benefit payments are accurate and compliant with policy terms**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System identifies applicable coverage (Core or BuyUp) based on policy version effective for the claim event date.
> 2. System calculates minimum gross benefit amount using policy-defined percentages or fixed amounts per configuration rules.
> 3. System calculates maximum gross benefit amount applying overrides or policy percentages against covered earnings.
> 4. System computes weekly gross benefit amount based on benefit type (percentage of salary or specified amount).
>     4.1 Upon override presence, system applies override value directly.
>     4.2 When no override exists, system calculates using benefit percentage or specified amount.
> 5. System enforces minimum and maximum constraints sequentially to derived benefit amount.
> 6. System applies rounding rules per policy configuration to finalize benefit amount.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a disability claim with effective BuyUp coverage, **When** calculating gross benefit, **Then** system uses BuyUp policy terms instead of Core coverage.
> 2. **Given** policy defines both minimum percentage and amount with 'Greater Of' type, **When** calculating minimum benefit, **Then** system selects higher value and rounds to two decimals.
> 3. **Given** calculated benefit exceeds maximum threshold, **When** applying constraints, **Then** system adjusts benefit down to maximum allowable amount.
> 4. **Given** calculated benefit falls below minimum threshold, **When** applying constraints, **Then** system adjusts benefit up to minimum guaranteed amount.
> 5. **Given** manual override is set for benefit percentage, **When** calculating benefit, **Then** system uses override value instead of default policy percentage.
> 6. **Given** all calculations complete, **When** finalizing benefit, **Then** system applies policy-specific rounding rules and produces final payment amount.

>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=425168355"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manage coverage-based configurations for each product (Term Life, CI, HI, Accident) including limit levels, units, and accumulation groups, so that adjudication rules are consistently applied.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: manage coverage-based configurations for each product line including limit levels, calculation units, and override rules
- **Value**: adjudication rules are consistently applied across all product types and coverage determinations are accurate

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **manage coverage-based configurations for each product line including limit levels, calculation units, and override rules**,
> So that **adjudication rules are consistently applied across all product types and coverage determinations are accurate**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System segregates configuration management by product category (Group vs Individual)
> 2. System enforces core constraint that Gross Amount and Number of Units cannot be overridden simultaneously
> 3. Upon Coverage Limit Unit being monetary AND Gross Amount set to auto-calculation, system enables Gross Amount Override capability
> 4. Upon Coverage Limit Unit being non-monetary AND Number of Units set to auto-calculation, system enables Number of Units Override capability
> 5. When coverage editability is enabled or special coverage types are detected, system disables all override capabilities
> 6. System maintains configuration attributes including calculation units, editability rules, and accumulation groups per coverage type


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Group Product coverage, **When** adjuster accesses configuration, **Then** system applies Group-specific configuration rules
> 2. **Given** Gross Amount Override is enabled, **When** adjuster attempts Number of Units override, **Then** system prevents simultaneous override
> 3. **Given** Coverage Limit Unit is monetary with auto-calculation, **When** configuration is evaluated, **Then** system enables only Gross Amount Override
> 4. **Given** Coverage Limit Unit is non-monetary with auto-calculation, **When** configuration is evaluated, **Then** system enables only Number of Units Override
> 5. **Given** special coverage types (Ambulance, Waiver of Premium, Wellness, Coma), **When** configuration is evaluated, **Then** system disables all override capabilities
> 6. **Given** editability is set for applicable field, **When** configuration is applied, **Then** system disables both override capabilities

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to track and display accumulator transaction history (Create, Reserve, Use, Recover, Clear, Adjust actions) for each coverage, so that I can audit accumulator movements and verify benefit limit calculations.

- **Action**: track and audit accumulator transaction history across coverage lifecycle to verify benefit limit calculations and ensure accurate claim adjudication

> 2. System presents segregated transaction histories for individual and group accumulators with chronological tracking
> 3. User reviews transaction details including dates, associated cases/claims, transaction types, and monetary or unit-based amounts

> 3. **Given** transactions contain dates, **When** displayed, **Then** system sorts by transaction date with most recent first and allows sorting by case or claim number
> 4. **Given** accumulator uses monetary or unit-based measurements, **When** amounts are shown, **Then** system formats currency with two decimals and displays negative values distinctly
> 5. **Given** benefit periods span multiple years, **When** calendar or benefit year accumulators exist, **Then** system separates transaction history by year
> 6. **Given** technical system transactions exist, **When** history is requested, **Then** system excludes internal transactions and displays only business-relevant accumulator actions

#### Feature: As a Claims Examiner, I want to validate dental claim procedures against eligibility rules (coverage in policy, duplicate checks, frequency limits, preauthorization) and generate adjudication decisions (Allowed, Denied, Review Required), so that only appropriate procedures are paid.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: validate dental procedures against policy coverage, eligibility rules, and clinical criteria to generate automated adjudication decisions
- **Value**: claims are processed consistently with accurate payment determinations, reducing manual review time and ensuring compliance with policy terms

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **validate dental procedures against policy coverage, eligibility rules, and clinical criteria to generate automated adjudication decisions**,
> So that **claims are processed consistently with accurate payment determinations, reducing manual review time and ensuring compliance with policy terms**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System validates master policy coverage for procedure subtype and denies if coverage does not exist
> 2. System executes configured adjudication rules in priority sequence to evaluate duplicate procedures, frequency limits, age restrictions, missing tooth conditions, and preauthorization requirements
> 3. System determines procedure-level decision by selecting first non-null rule status (Denied/Allowed/Review Required) or defaults to Allowed
>     3.1 Upon frequency limit violation, system denies with configured frequency period calculation
>     3.2 When clinical criteria require judgment, system flags for professional review with specific reason codes
> 4. System aggregates procedure decisions to determine claim-level settlement proposal (Pay/Deny/Pend/Predetermination)
> 5. System automatically routes claims requiring professional review to designated queue with appropriate task assignment
> 6. User is able to override Review Required status or deny flagged procedures through manual adjudication actions


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** valid policy coverage exists, **when** all procedures pass eligibility rules, **then** system approves claim with settlement proposal and initiates payment workflow
> 2. **Given** procedure fails duplicate or frequency validation, **when** adjudication executes, **then** system denies procedure with appropriate reason code without manual intervention
> 3. **Given** clinical criteria require review (age/tooth mismatches), **when** adjudication completes, **then** system sets claim to Pending status and creates professional review task
> 4. **Given** all procedures denied, **when** claim type is Predetermination, **then** system closes claim as Predetermined without payment creation
> 5. **Given** missing or invalid preauthorization data for required procedures, **when** actual claim submitted, **then** system denies with preauthorization validation failure reason
> 6. **Given** multiple rules executed, **when** determining final decision, **then** system prioritizes first non-null status by rule sequence ascending order

>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=784763659"

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want the system to validate ICD codes for uniqueness, primary designation, and future date restrictions, so that claim diagnosis data maintains integrity and compliance.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: ensure diagnosis information is automatically populated from source records and validated against integrity rules during claim initiation and submission
- **Value**: claim diagnosis data maintains integrity, uniqueness, compliance with clinical coding standards, and prevents downstream adjudication errors

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **ensure diagnosis information is automatically populated from source records and validated against integrity rules during claim initiation and submission**,
> So that **claim diagnosis data maintains integrity, uniqueness, compliance with clinical coding standards, and prevents downstream adjudication errors**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Upon claim initiation for STD/SMD/LTD, system automatically populates diagnosis codes and accident-versus-sickness designation from applicable source record (Event Case or predecessor STD Claim based on timing and existence rules)
>     1.1 When LTD claim is created simultaneously with or before STD claim, system defaults diagnosis from Event Case
>     1.2 When LTD claim is created after STD claim exists, system defaults diagnosis from STD claim instead
> 2. System enforces one-time data copy principle, preventing bidirectional synchronization between source and target records post-initiation
> 3. User is able to modify pre-populated diagnosis information during manual claim intake via designated menu
> 4. Upon claim submission, system validates diagnosis code uniqueness across all entries for the claim
> 5. System validates exactly one diagnosis code is designated as primary before allowing submission
> 6. System prevents submission when diagnosis date is recorded as future date


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** STD or SMD claim is initiated automatically from event case, **When** claim record is created, **Then** diagnosis codes and accident/sickness indicator are pre-populated from event case without user intervention
> 2. **Given** LTD claim is initiated and no STD claim exists, **When** claim creation occurs, **Then** diagnosis information defaults from event case ICD codes
> 3. **Given** LTD claim is created after existing STD claim, **When** system determines defaulting source, **Then** diagnosis information is populated from STD claim instead of event case
> 4. **Given** user attempts submission with duplicate ICD codes, **When** validation executes, **Then** system prevents submission and indicates duplication error
> 5. **Given** user designates zero or multiple primary diagnosis codes, **When** validation executes, **Then** system prevents submission until exactly one primary designation exists
> 6. **Given** diagnosis date is entered as future date, **When** validation executes, **Then** system prevents submission and requires correction to current or past date


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=715137579"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want ICD codes to be automatically defaulted from the Event Case or prior claim when creating a new disability claim, so that I don't have to manually re-enter diagnosis information.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: automatically inherit diagnosis codes from Event Case or prior related claims when initiating a new disability claim
- **Value**: I can reduce manual data entry, minimize diagnostic errors, and accelerate claim adjudication by reusing validated medical information

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **automatically inherit diagnosis codes from Event Case or prior related claims when initiating a new disability claim**,
> So that **I can reduce manual data entry, minimize diagnostic errors, and accelerate claim adjudication by reusing validated medical information**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Upon STD or SMD claim creation, system defaults ICD codes and accident/sickness classification from parent Event Case
> 2. Upon LTD claim creation, system evaluates timing: defaults from Event Case if no prior STD exists or simultaneous creation; defaults from STD claim during delayed transition scenarios
> 3. System performs one-time directional data copy at claim submission; subsequent source updates do not propagate to existing claims
> 4. User is able to modify defaulted codes during intake before final submission
> 5. System enforces diagnostic data integrity: unique codes, single primary designation, non-future diagnosis dates
> 6. When manual claim creation occurs via workflow menu, system applies same defaulting logic to intake form


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** STD claim creation **when** Event Case contains validated ICD codes **then** system pre-populates all codes with primary designation and accident/sickness value
> 2. **Given** LTD claim initiated after STD approval **when** STD-to-LTD transition delay exists **then** system sources codes from STD claim instead of Event Case
> 3. **Given** claim submitted with defaulted codes **when** source Event Case codes are subsequently updated **then** existing claim data remains unchanged
> 4. **Given** adjuster modifies defaulted codes **when** validation rules fail **then** system prevents submission until uniqueness, primary designation, and date constraints are satisfied
> 5. **Given** simultaneous STD and LTD creation **when** both claims initiate **then** both default from Event Case identically
> 6. **Given** manual claim workflow **when** intake form loads **then** system displays editable defaulted codes before final submission

> 3. System applies auto-adjudication rules evaluating loss date, coverage type, cause of loss, and claim amount threshold
> 4. System evaluates claim eligibility against business criteria
> 5. Upon successful validation and adjudication, system automatically approves and issues payment to designated payee
> 6. Upon business rule violations, system routes claim for manual review and approval


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** valid policy with comprehensive coverage and claim amount $150, **When** glass claim is submitted, **Then** system auto-adjudicates and issues payment without manual intervention
> 2. **Given** policy does not exist or is invalid, **When** validation executes, **Then** system prevents claim creation and provides corrective guidance
> 3. **Given** claim amount exceeds threshold or coverage is missing, **When** auto-adjudication rules execute, **Then** system routes to manual review workflow
> 4. **Given** loss date falls outside policy period, **When** validation occurs, **Then** system rejects auto-adjudication eligibility
> 5. **Given** all validation criteria met, **When** claim processing completes, **Then** case status updates to Closed with payment issued


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=573320033"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manually approve glass claims with repair bills exceeding the standard allowance, so that I can handle exceptions while maintaining control over claim payments.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: manually evaluate and approve glass repair claims that exceed standard bill thresholds when auto-adjudication rules fail
- **Value**: exceptions are properly reviewed and legitimate claims exceeding standard allowances are paid while maintaining financial controls and preventing fraud

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **manually evaluate and approve glass repair claims that exceed standard bill thresholds when auto-adjudication rules fail**,
> So that **exceptions are properly reviewed and legitimate claims exceeding standard allowances are paid while maintaining financial controls and preventing fraud**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Upon auto-adjudication failure due to repair bill exceeding threshold, system routes claim to adjuster for manual review
> 2. Adjuster evaluates claim details including policy coverage, loss circumstances, and supporting documentation against business rules
> 3. Adjuster contacts insured to gather additional information or clarification when claim details are insufficient
> 4. Adjuster exercises judgment to approve or deny payment based on coverage terms and claim validity
> 5. System processes approved payment to designated payee and closes claim
>     5.1 If denied, system records decision rationale and notifies insured


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a glass claim with repair bill exceeding standard threshold, **When** auto-adjudication rules fail validation, **Then** system assigns claim to adjuster queue for manual review
> 2. **Given** adjuster reviews claim with complete documentation, **When** coverage and loss details are validated, **Then** adjuster can approve payment exceeding standard allowance
> 3. **Given** claim information is insufficient, **When** adjuster requires additional details, **Then** system facilitates communication with insured and suspends claim pending response
> 4. **Given** adjuster denies exception claim, **When** decision is recorded, **Then** system prevents payment and documents denial rationale
> 5. **Given** manual approval is granted, **When** payment processing initiates, **Then** system issues payment and updates claim status to closed

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to add and manage ancillary activities (rehabilitation, financial assistance) on a claim with validation of applicability and overlapping periods, so that I can ensure accurate tracking of claim-related services.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: add and manage ancillary activities (rehabilitation, financial assistance) on claims with validation of eligibility and temporal conflicts
- **Value**: accurate tracking and oversight of claim-related services is maintained, preventing duplicate services and ensuring compliant service delivery

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **add and manage ancillary activities (rehabilitation, financial assistance) on claims with validation of eligibility and temporal conflicts**,
> So that **accurate tracking and oversight of claim-related services is maintained, preventing duplicate services and ensuring compliant service delivery**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Adjuster initiates addition of ancillary activity (rehabilitation, financial assistance) to an active claim
> 2. System validates activity applicability against claim coverage terms and policy entitlements
> 3. System detects temporal overlaps with existing ancillary activities on the claim
>     3.1 When overlap exists, system alerts adjuster and prevents duplicate service registration
> 4. Upon successful validation, system records activity with service period, type, and tracking metadata
> 5. Adjuster is able to modify or terminate existing ancillary activities with audit trail preservation
> 6. System maintains comprehensive activity history for reporting and compliance verification


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim eligible for ancillary services, **when** adjuster submits a new activity, **then** system validates applicability against policy coverage before acceptance
> 2. **Given** overlapping service periods exist, **when** adjuster attempts to add conflicting activity, **then** system prevents submission and provides conflict notification
> 3. **Given** valid activity parameters, **when** submission is successful, **then** system records activity with complete metadata and timestamps
> 4. **Given** an existing activity, **when** adjuster modifies service period, **then** system re-validates temporal conflicts across all activities
> 5. **Given** activity termination, **when** adjuster completes action, **then** system preserves full audit history
> 6. **Given** incomplete or invalid data, **when** submission occurs, **then** system prevents processing until requirements are satisfied

### Epic: Pre-Authorization, Predetermination & Case Management

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to refresh the policy to the latest version, so that claim eligibility and coverages are updated based on current policy terms
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: refresh the policy to the latest version to ensure claim eligibility and coverage determinations reflect current policy terms
- **Value**: claim decisions are based on accurate, up-to-date policy provisions, reducing adjudication errors and ensuring compliance with the insured's active coverage terms

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **refresh the policy to the latest version to ensure claim eligibility and coverage determinations reflect current policy terms**,
> So that **claim decisions are based on accurate, up-to-date policy provisions, reducing adjudication errors and ensuring compliance with the insured's active coverage terms**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates policy version verification based on the claim's Date of Loss.
> 2. System identifies whether a newer policy version exists for the coverage period.
>     2.1 If no new version exists, user is notified and no changes are applied.
>     2.2 If a new version exists, system presents version details and policy change summary.
> 3. User reviews policy version differences and impact on coverage terms.
> 4. User confirms application of the new policy version to the claim.
> 5. System applies updated policy terms, recalculates eligibility, coverage limits, benefit amounts, and elimination periods.
> 6. System updates payment calculations and generates financial balance adjustments as necessary.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim with an established Date of Loss, **when** the adjuster initiates a policy refresh, **then** the system identifies the applicable policy version based on that date.
> 2. **Given** no newer policy version exists, **when** the refresh is triggered, **then** the system notifies the user and no changes are applied.
> 3. **Given** a newer policy version is found, **when** the user requests details, **then** the system displays version comparison and coverage change summary.
> 4. **Given** the user confirms the policy refresh, **when** the update is applied, **then** eligibility, coverage limits, and benefit calculations are recalculated based on the new policy terms.
> 5. **Given** the policy refresh affects approved payments, **when** the refresh completes, **then** the system generates financial balance updates and payment adjustments.
> 6. **Given** the user lacks required privileges, **when** attempting to refresh policy, **then** the system prevents the action.


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=674186671"
> ]

- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: submit a pending claim to open status to initiate active adjudication workflows
- **Value**: the claim enters the operational processing pipeline and enables timely adjudication and payment resolution

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **submit a pending claim to open status to initiate active adjudication workflows**,
> So that **the claim enters the operational processing pipeline and enables timely adjudication and payment resolution**

> 3. User initiates submission action to advance claim to active processing
> 4. System transitions claim status from pending to open upon successful submission
> 5. System updates claim status indicators to reflect active processing state

> 3. **Given** successful submission, **When** status changes to open, **Then** system visually indicates active processing state
> 4. **Given** claim status update, **When** transition completes, **Then** system reflects changes across all claim components
> 5. **Given** submission action initiated, **When** processing completes, **Then** system enables downstream adjudication workflows

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to add and manage preauthorization data for predetermination claims, so that actual service claims can be validated against approved preauthorization
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: establish and manage preauthorization records on predetermined claims to enable validation of subsequent actual service claims against approved authorizations
- **Value**: actual service claims are accurately validated against preapproved authorizations, reducing improper payments and ensuring compliance with predetermination decisions

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **establish and manage preauthorization records on predetermined claims to enable validation of subsequent actual service claims against approved authorizations**,
> So that **actual service claims are accurately validated against preapproved authorizations, reducing improper payments and ensuring compliance with predetermination decisions**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Access closed precertification claims with predetermined status to review adjudicated procedure lines
> 2. Establish preauthorization records for approved procedure lines by capturing authorization authority, effective dates, and validity periods
> 3. Modify existing preauthorization details when no actual service claim exists
>     3.1 System validates authorization date ranges and required data completeness
> 4. Update preauthorization parameters when actual service claims are linked
>     4.1 System prevents authorization revocation if actual service claims exist
>     4.2 System validates service dates fall within authorization validity periods
> 5. System associates preauthorization data with procedure lines for downstream claim validation
> 6. System enforces business rules preventing unauthorized modifications that conflict with processed service claims


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a closed precertification claim with allowed procedure lines, **When** the adjuster establishes preauthorization, **Then** the system captures authorization details and links them to the procedure line
> 2. **Given** preauthorization without linked actual service claims, **When** the adjuster modifies authorization parameters, **Then** the system validates data completeness and saves updates
> 3. **Given** preauthorization with linked actual service claims, **When** the adjuster attempts to revoke authorization, **Then** the system prevents the change and notifies of existing dependencies
> 4. **Given** preauthorization date modifications, **When** actual service claims exist, **Then** the system validates service dates fall within updated authorization periods
> 5. **Given** incomplete authorization data, **When** the adjuster attempts to save, **Then** the system prevents submission until required information is provided
> 6. **Given** successful preauthorization establishment, **When** viewing the procedure line, **Then** authorization status is visible for reference during actual claim processing

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view and edit claim events including loss types, ICD codes, and injury/sickness classification, so that case information is accurately captured and maintained
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: modify claim event details including loss types, medical codes, and injury classifications
- **Value**: case information remains accurate and complete throughout the claim lifecycle, supporting proper adjudication and coverage evaluation

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **modify claim event details including loss types, medical codes, and injury classifications**,
> So that **case information remains accurate and complete throughout the claim lifecycle, supporting proper adjudication and coverage evaluation**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User is able to access existing claim events and modify loss type selections, ensuring previously recorded losses remain documented while adding newly identified loss types when applicable
> 2. Upon selecting or accessing loss types, user provides or updates loss-specific details such as absence periods, accident circumstances, death information, or wellness visit dates
> 3. User manages medical diagnosis codes including adding, editing, removing, and designating primary codes to support medical necessity and coverage determination
> 4. When all required information is complete, user submits modifications triggering system validation, duplicate case detection, and automated claim generation workflows
> 5. If associated claims are closed, system restricts editing capabilities to preserve claim integrity while maintaining visibility of historical data


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 2. **Given** multiple loss types under a single event, **When** the adjuster adds new loss types, **Then** the system displays appropriate information collection sections with required fields and default values where applicable
> 3. **Given** incomplete or invalid loss information, **When** the adjuster attempts to save, **Then** the system prevents submission until all required data meets business validation rules
> 4. **Given** modified event data, **When** changes are saved, **Then** the system invokes duplicate case validation and updates associated claims accordingly
> 5. **Given** an associated claim is closed, **When** the adjuster views the event, **Then** the system restricts editing of that loss type's attributes while maintaining view access
> 6. **Given** medical diagnosis codes are added or modified, **When** changes are committed, **Then** the system maintains code hierarchy and primary designation rules for downstream adjudication processes

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to validate coverage duplication and prevent duplicate coverages from being processed, so that claim settlements are accurate and compliant
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: validate coverage duplication and prevent duplicate coverages from being processed during adjudication
- **Value**: claim settlements are accurate, compliant, and free from redundant coverage payments

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **validate coverage duplication and prevent duplicate coverages from being processed during adjudication**,
> So that **claim settlements are accurate, compliant, and free from redundant coverage payments**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System initiates duplication validation upon adjudication or re-adjudication of an open claim
> 2. System applies coverage-specific duplication rules based on policy number, case number, coverage name, incident date, and applicable parameters (e.g., date range, child name, surgery link)
>     2.1 Upon detection of matching criteria, system flags coverage as duplicate
>     2.2 System excludes incomplete or non-eligible coverages from validation scope
> 3. When no duplication exists, system marks coverage as eligible for settlement
> 4. When duplication is detected, system designates coverage as non-eligible and prevents further processing until resolution
> 5. System displays eligibility status and error notifications to inform adjudication decisions


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an open claim under adjudication, **When** the system evaluates coverage with complete parameters, **Then** duplication validation executes based on coverage-type-specific criteria
> 2. **Given** duplicate coverage is identified, **When** validation completes, **Then** system marks coverage as non-eligible and displays duplication error message
> 3. **Given** no duplication exists, **When** validation completes, **Then** system marks coverage as eligible for settlement
> 4. **Given** coverage lacks required parameters, **When** validation runs, **Then** system excludes coverage from duplication check until parameters are captured
> 5. **Given** duplicate coverage is flagged, **When** adjuster attempts updates, **Then** system prevents modifications until duplication is resolved via re-adjudication


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=652219080"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to override non-eligible claim determinations when appropriate, so that valid claims can proceed to settlement despite eligibility validation failures
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: override non-eligible claim determinations when business rules and privileges permit
- **Value**: valid claims can proceed to settlement despite initial eligibility validation failures, ensuring appropriate claims are not wrongfully denied

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **override non-eligible claim determinations when business rules and privileges permit**,
> So that **valid claims can proceed to settlement despite initial eligibility validation failures, ensuring appropriate claims are not wrongfully denied**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Upon eligibility validation failure, system displays non-eligible status with detailed scoring information for adjuster review
> 2. User is able to access comprehensive eligibility determination rationale and supporting validation details
> 3. When adjuster possesses required privileges and business rules permit override, system enables eligibility decision reversal
>     3.1 If override is disallowed by business rules, system prevents override action
>     3.2 If adjuster lacks privileges, system conceals override capability
> 4. User submits override decision with confirmation to update claim eligibility status
> 5. System updates claim status from non-eligible to eligible and removes validation error messaging
> 6. Upon successful override, system reflects updated eligibility status across all claim views and case summaries


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** eligibility validation has failed, **When** adjuster reviews claim details, **Then** system displays non-eligible determination with rationale and scoring breakdown
> 2. **Given** adjuster has override privileges and business rules allow override, **When** adjuster initiates override action, **Then** system enables override confirmation and processing
> 3. **Given** business rules prohibit override for specific validation failure, **When** adjuster attempts override, **Then** system prevents override action regardless of privilege level
> 4. **Given** adjuster lacks override privileges, **When** viewing non-eligible claim, **Then** system conceals override functionality entirely
> 5. **Given** override is successfully confirmed, **When** system processes override, **Then** claim status updates to eligible and validation errors are removed
> 6. **Given** claim eligibility has been overridden, **When** viewing claim across all interfaces, **Then** system consistently displays eligible status with override indicator


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=571487565"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to select and manage plan options for multi-plan master policy claims, so that coverage data is correctly retrieved and claim is re-adjudicated with appropriate plan terms
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: select and apply the appropriate plan option for master policy claims with multiple coverage plans to ensure accurate adjudication
- **Value**: claims are processed with correct coverage terms, preventing payment errors and reducing manual rework

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **select and apply the appropriate plan option for master policy claims with multiple coverage plans to ensure accurate adjudication**,
> So that **claims are processed with correct coverage terms, preventing payment errors and reducing manual rework**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. When processing a master policy claim with multiple matching plans, user is able to access plan selection workflow
> 2. System filters and presents only plans matching both claim coverage type and member's employer class
> 3. User is able to review available plan options and select the appropriate plan for the claim
> 4. Upon plan confirmation, system retrieves coverage data specific to the selected plan
> 5. System automatically re-adjudicates the claim using the selected plan's terms and benefit structure
> 6. User is able to modify plan selection when business conditions require re-evaluation, triggering re-adjudication


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a master policy claim with multiple matching plans, **When** the adjuster accesses the claim, **Then** system presents available plans filtered by coverage and member class
> 2. **Given** available plan options are displayed, **When** adjuster selects a plan and confirms, **Then** system stores the selection and retrieves associated coverage data
> 3. **Given** a plan is confirmed, **When** selection is saved, **Then** system automatically re-adjudicates the claim using the selected plan's terms
> 4. **Given** a certificate policy claim is processed, **When** adjuster reviews claim, **Then** plan selection workflow is not available
> 5. **Given** only one plan matches claim criteria, **When** claim is created, **Then** system auto-applies the single matching plan without requiring manual selection
> 6. **Given** a plan is already selected, **When** adjuster modifies the plan choice, **Then** system re-adjudicates with updated plan terms

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to add and manage approval periods for disability claims, so that benefit payments are properly tracked and approved for specific time periods
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: establish and manage approval periods for disability claims to control benefit payment authorization windows
- **Value**: benefit payments are accurately tracked, authorized for specific timeframes, and aligned with medical evidence and policy terms

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **establish and manage approval periods for disability claims to control benefit payment authorization windows**,
> So that **benefit payments are accurately tracked, authorized for specific timeframes, and aligned with medical evidence and policy terms**

> 1. User initiates creation of approval period for disability claim
> 2. User defines approval period parameters including coverage timeframe and benefit authorization details
> 3. System validates approval period against business rules and policy constraints
>     3.1 When validation fails, system prevents submission and identifies data deficiencies

> 4. **Given** user is defining approval period, **When** user cancels operation, **Then** system discards unsaved data without impacting claim
> 5. **Given** approval period is established, **When** payment processing occurs, **Then** system restricts benefits to authorized timeframe

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view claim accumulators and benefit duration tracking for absence cases, so that remaining benefits and usage are accurately calculated and displayed
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: monitor accumulated benefit duration and remaining entitlements across multiple absence claim types within a unified case view
- **Value**: I can accurately assess benefit eligibility, prevent overpayments, and make informed adjudication decisions based on comprehensive benefit usage tracking

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **monitor accumulated benefit duration and remaining entitlements across multiple absence claim types within a unified case view**,
> So that **I can accurately assess benefit eligibility, prevent overpayments, and make informed adjudication decisions based on comprehensive benefit usage tracking**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Upon accessing absence case overview, system presents consolidated benefit accumulator displaying total duration, consumed time, and remaining entitlements for each claim type
> 2. System calculates used duration by aggregating all approved claim periods and incorporating externally recorded time usage
> 3. System derives remaining benefit duration using formula: (Total Duration - Used Duration - External Time Used)
> 4. When claim assignment exists, system displays responsible examiner or queue information; otherwise indicates unassigned status
> 5. System formats duration metrics according to claim type conventions (weeks/days for disability, months for LTD, years/months/days for Life Premium Waiver)
> 6. Upon user request, system reveals supplementary claim milestone dates including last work date, actively-at-work date, and loss date


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an absence case with multiple approved claim periods, **When** adjuster views case overview, **Then** system displays accurate accumulated used duration reflecting all approved periods
> 2. **Given** external time usage has been recorded, **When** remaining duration is calculated, **Then** system deducts both approved and external time from total benefit duration
> 3. **Given** claims of different types (STD, LTD, Life Premium Waiver), **When** displaying duration metrics, **Then** system applies type-specific formatting conventions automatically
> 4. **Given** claim has assigned examiner, **When** examiner data is unavailable, **Then** system displays user identifier as fallback
> 5. **Given** user requires additional temporal context, **When** accessing supplementary dates, **Then** system presents last worked, actively-at-work, and loss dates in consistent format
> 6. **Given** incomplete benefit data, **When** calculating remaining duration, **Then** system prevents display of erroneous accumulator values


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=556513389"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view and manage patient history and missing teeth records for dental claims, so that treatment history is tracked and available for predetermination and actual service claims
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: access comprehensive patient treatment history and missing teeth records across all dental claims to support accurate adjudication and predetermination decisions
- **Value**: treatment history is continuously tracked and available for validating eligibility, preventing duplicate payments, and ensuring accurate benefit determinations for both predetermination requests and actual service claims

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **access comprehensive patient treatment history and missing teeth records across all dental claims to support accurate adjudication and predetermination decisions**,
> So that **treatment history is continuously tracked and available for validating eligibility, preventing duplicate payments, and ensuring accurate benefit determinations for both predetermination requests and actual service claims**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User is able to retrieve complete procedure history across all dental claims, displaying only finalized transactions (closed/paid/denied/pending actual services) sorted chronologically by service date
> 2. User is able to identify missing teeth for primary and permanent dentition derived from historical paid claims to validate treatment eligibility
> 3. User is able to filter patient history by clinical attributes (procedure codes, tooth identifiers, service categories), financial outcomes (decision status, payment dates), and provider characteristics
> 4. User is able to manually record additional patient history when external treatment data must be incorporated for comprehensive adjudication
>     4.1 Upon manual entry, system validates clinical data integrity (service dates, procedure codes, tooth identifiers) and prevents duplicate diagnoses
> 5. When claims are adjusted or new procedures processed, system automatically refreshes history to reflect current treatment status
> 6. User is able to expand procedure records to review detailed clinical attributes, financial calculations, provider information, and diagnostic justifications


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a patient with multiple dental claims, **when** the adjuster accesses patient history, **then** system displays only closed, paid, denied, or pending actual service procedures sorted by service date descending, excluding predetermination records
> 2. **Given** paid dental claims contain missing teeth data, **when** history is retrieved, **then** system displays distinct primary and permanent missing teeth without duplicates, hiding sections where no data exists
> 3. **Given** an adjuster applies multiple filters, **when** filtering by clinical or financial criteria, **then** system returns only matching procedures while maintaining expandable detail access and sort capabilities
> 4. **Given** an adjuster manually adds patient history, **when** required fields are incomplete or service date is future-dated, **then** system prevents record creation until validation errors are resolved
> 5. **Given** a claim is adjusted after initial processing, **when** procedures are added or modified, **then** patient history automatically updates in real-time to reflect current claim status
> 6. **Given** expanded procedure details, **when** reviewing treatment information, **then** system displays complete clinical attributes, financial breakdowns, provider details, and associated diagnosis codes
