## Initiative: Financial Scheduling & Payment Management

### Epic: Payment Engine & Calculation Core

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view and manage payment balances per payee, so that I can identify and resolve overpayments and underpayments efficiently.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: monitor, calculate, and resolve payment imbalances across payees within event cases
- **Value**: payment accuracy is maintained, overpayments are recovered efficiently, and underpayments are corrected promptly while ensuring regulatory compliance and audit integrity

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **monitor, calculate, and resolve payment imbalances across payees within event cases**,
> So that **payment accuracy is maintained, overpayments are recovered efficiently, and underpayments are corrected promptly while ensuring regulatory compliance and audit integrity**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System automatically detects data changes impacting payment calculations and triggers balance recalculation process across all affected payees
> 2. System calculates payment variance by comparing actual payments, scheduled payments, and balance adjustments per payee and aggregates at event case level
> 3. User reviews calculated balances filtered by payee to identify overpayment, underpayment, or balanced status
> 4. Upon overpayment detection, user initiates recovery action, applies withholding to future payments, or waives recovery based on business rules
> 5. Upon underpayment detection, user authorizes corrective payment issuance to affected payee
> 6. System recalculates balances incorporating all adjustments and maintains complete audit trail of all balance management activities


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** payment-impacting data changes occur, **When** system detects changes, **Then** balance recalculation initiates automatically for affected event cases and payees
> 2. **Given** balance calculation completes, **When** user accesses balance view, **Then** system displays actual versus scheduled payment variance per payee with aggregated case-level balance
> 3. **Given** overpayment exists for a payee, **When** user selects resolution action, **Then** system processes recovery, withholding, or waiver and recalculates balance accordingly
> 4. **Given** underpayment exists for a payee, **When** user authorizes corrective payment, **Then** system generates payment and updates balance to zero
> 5. **Given** external payments exist outside system scope, **When** user records external balance adjustment, **Then** system incorporates adjustment into overall case balance
> 6. **Given** any balance management action occurs, **When** transaction completes, **Then** system creates immutable audit log entry with timestamp and user attribution

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want the system to automatically recalculate payment balances when claim data changes, so that balance information remains accurate and current.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: have the system automatically recalculate payment balances when claim financial data is modified
- **Value**: balance information remains accurate and current without manual intervention, reducing errors and processing time

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **have the system automatically recalculate payment balances when claim financial data is modified**,
> So that **balance information remains accurate and current without manual intervention, reducing errors and processing time**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User modifies claim financial information and commits the changes
> 2. System triggers automated settlement re-adjudication process
> 3. System recalculates payment schedules based on updated claim data
>     3.1 Upon orthodontic claims, system applies specialized payment allocation rules
>     3.2 When interest applies, system recalculates interest distribution accordingly
> 4. System executes balance computation using current payment schedule
> 5. System generates balance change transaction logs for audit purposes
> 6. System presents updated balance activities and recalculated payment details reflecting current financial state


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim with existing issued payments, **When** the adjuster modifies financial charges and saves, **Then** the system automatically triggers balance recalculation without manual initiation
> 2. **Given** payment schedule recalculation completes, **When** balance computation executes, **Then** system reflects accurate balance amounts across all affected payees
> 3. **Given** balance changes occur, **When** recalculation finishes, **Then** system creates auditable transaction logs capturing all balance modifications
> 4. **Given** recalculated balances exist, **When** amounts equal zero, **Then** system excludes those activities from display
> 5. **Given** incomplete claim data, **When** balance calculation attempts, **Then** system prevents processing until required financial information is provided
> 6. **Given** interest-bearing payments, **When** recalculation occurs, **Then** system accurately distributes interest allocation in balance computations

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to generate and track balance change logs, so that I can maintain an audit trail of all balance recalculations and adjustments.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: generate and track balance change logs for all payment-related transactions and schedule adjustments
- **Value**: I maintain a comprehensive audit trail ensuring financial transparency, regulatory compliance, and accountability for all balance recalculations

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **generate and track balance change logs for all payment-related transactions and schedule adjustments**,
> So that **I maintain a comprehensive audit trail ensuring financial transparency, regulatory compliance, and accountability for all balance recalculations**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System evaluates transaction type to determine balance impact and logging requirements
> 2. Upon payment schedule initialization, system captures transaction type and total balance amount in change log
> 3. When processing payment adjustments (underpayment, recovery, overpayment waiver actions), system records transaction number, type, and updated balance
>     3.1 System excludes standard payment issuance from logging as it does not affect total balance
> 4. System associates each balance change with unique payee identifier for dental claims
> 5. System returns empty log for non-balance-impacting transactions
> 6. User is able to retrieve complete chronological history of balance modifications for audit purposes


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a payment schedule initialization transaction, **When** system processes the balance calculation, **Then** change log captures transaction type and total balance without transaction number
> 2. **Given** payment adjustment transactions (underpayment/recovery/waiver), **When** balance recalculation occurs, **Then** system records transaction number, type, and updated balance amount
> 3. **Given** a standard payment issuance, **When** transaction is processed, **Then** system does not create change log entry
> 4. **Given** an unrecognized transaction type, **When** balance processing completes, **Then** system returns empty log list
> 5. **Given** multiple sequential balance modifications, **When** user retrieves audit trail, **Then** all balance-impacting transactions appear chronologically with complete details

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to create and manage payment allocations with gross amounts, additions (interest), and deductions, so that payments are calculated accurately according to policy terms.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: create and manage payment allocations by calculating and distributing gross amounts, additions (interest/rehab), and deductions across payable items according to policy terms
- **Value**: payments are calculated accurately with proper financial adjustments, ensuring compliance with policy requirements and correct balance reconciliation

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **create and manage payment allocations by calculating and distributing gross amounts, additions (interest/rehab), and deductions across payable items according to policy terms**,
> So that **payments are calculated accurately with proper financial adjustments, ensuring compliance with policy requirements and correct balance reconciliation**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User is able to initiate payment allocation by identifying existing allocations or creating new ones based on payable item attributes and deduction details
> 2. System calculates precise allocation amounts by comparing transaction remaining balance against scheduled versus actual balanced amounts
> 3. User is able to apply allocated amounts as gross payments, additions (interest/rehab), or reductions (deductions/offsets/taxes) with proper sign conventions
>     3.1 When handling additions, system generates unique addition numbers and creates split results with positive amounts
>     3.2 When processing deductions or taxes, system creates reductions with negative amounts
> 4. System generates allocation accumulator details for audit and reconciliation tracking
> 5. Upon allocation completion, system updates transaction remaining amount and adjusts item actual balanced amounts based on payment direction
> 6. User is able to reuse existing allocations when subsequent transactions match identical payable attributes


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a payment transaction with remaining balance, **When** adjuster initiates allocation, **Then** system identifies matching allocation or creates new one based on payable item and deduction attributes
> 2. **Given** transaction and balance amounts, **When** system calculates allocation, **Then** allocated amount equals minimum of remaining balance and unscheduled balance difference, rounded to two decimals
> 3. **Given** allocation amount is non-zero, **When** applying to gross items, **Then** system sets gross amount; **When** applying to interest/rehab, **Then** creates additions with positive amounts
> 4. **Given** deduction or tax allocation, **When** system processes reduction, **Then** creates split results with negative amounts and proper type classification
> 5. **Given** successful allocation, **When** transaction completes, **Then** system reduces transaction remaining amount and updates item balanced amount according to payment direction
> 6. **Given** allocation amount equals zero, **When** validation occurs, **Then** system skips financial adjustment generation and proceeds to balance updates


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=594614718"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to apply tax withholdings (Federal, State, FICA) to payments, so that tax obligations are properly deducted from benefit payments.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: apply regulatory tax withholdings to authorized benefit payments based on jurisdiction and allocation eligibility
- **Value**: tax obligations are accurately calculated and deducted in compliance with federal, state, and FICA requirements

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **apply regulatory tax withholdings to authorized benefit payments based on jurisdiction and allocation eligibility**,
> So that **tax obligations are accurately calculated and deducted in compliance with federal, state, and FICA requirements**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System evaluates tax applicability rules against payment allocations based on claim inclusion, allocation type exclusions, and temporal period alignment
> 2. System calculates withholding amounts using percentage-based methodology for standard tax rates and extra withholding provisions
> 3. System calculates flat-rate withholdings prorated by benefit duration and allocation period overlap
>     3.1 When allocation period partially overlaps tax period, system applies proration rate to flat tax amount
> 4. System aggregates taxable wages across all eligible allocations to establish total withholding base
> 5. System rounds all calculated tax amounts to two decimal places prior to deduction
> 6. Upon calculation completion, system applies withheld amounts to reduce net payment and updates tax reporting records


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a payment allocation is flagged as interest-only, ex gratia, or expense type, **When** tax calculation executes, **Then** system excludes allocation from withholding base
> 2. **Given** percentage-based tax applies, **When** payment date falls within tax period, **Then** system calculates withholding as taxable amount multiplied by tax percentage
> 3. **Given** flat-rate tax applies, **When** allocation period overlaps tax term, **Then** system prorates flat amount by benefit duration and allocation rate
> 4. **Given** multiple allocations qualify for withholding, **When** aggregation occurs, **Then** system sums all taxable amounts to establish total taxable wages
> 5. **Given** calculated tax amounts contain fractional cents, **When** rounding applies, **Then** system rounds to two decimal places
> 6. **Given** incomplete or missing tax configuration, **When** calculation attempts, **Then** system prevents withholding application and flags for resolution


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=713700428"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to calculate and apply interest on delayed payments, so that claimants receive appropriate compensation for payment delays.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: Calculate and apply statutory interest on delayed claim payments based on state-specific regulations
- **Value**: Claimants receive appropriate compensation for payment delays, ensuring regulatory compliance and fair treatment

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **calculate and apply statutory interest on delayed claim payments based on state-specific regulations**,
> So that **claimants receive appropriate compensation for payment delays, ensuring regulatory compliance and fair treatment**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Configure state-specific interest parameters including rates, grace periods, thresholds, and calendar calculation methods upon system setup.
> 2. Determine interest applicability by validating policy situs state against regulatory requirements at payment approval.
> 3. Calculate delayed payment duration from claim received date to payment approval date, accounting for claim source-specific grace periods and additional threshold days.
>     3.1 Adjust calculation basis when claim is modified via adjustment workflow before or after payment issuance.
> 4. Compute interest amount using state formula (principal  rate  delay days), applying minimum threshold rules and service-type variations (first-series-only for orthodontic claims).
> 5. Generate interest payment addition and allocate to approved payment template when interest exceeds regulatory minimum.
> 6. Issue combined principal and interest payment or record zero interest when delay falls within grace period or below threshold.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** policy situs state requires interest **and** claim payment exceeds grace period, **When** payment is approved, **Then** system calculates interest using state rate, formula base, and delayed days with two-decimal precision.
> 2. **Given** calculated interest falls below state minimum threshold, **When** interest determination completes, **Then** system sets interest to zero and issues principal payment only.
> 3. **Given** claim received date is adjusted before payment issuance, **When** claim is re-adjudicated, **Then** system recalculates interest using updated received date and new payment post date.
> 4. **Given** claim received date is adjusted after payment issuance, **When** claim is re-adjudicated, **Then** system generates balance adjustment without reissuing original payment and recalculates interest using original payment date.
> 5. **Given** orthodontic claim with multiple payment series, **When** interest calculation executes, **Then** system applies interest only to first series payment amount.
> 6. **Given** policy situs state does not mandate interest, **When** payment approval occurs, **Then** system bypasses interest calculation and issues principal payment without interest addition.


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=797646527"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want the system to automatically generate and issue payments on scheduled dates, so that benefit payments are processed efficiently without manual intervention.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: enable automated generation and posting of scheduled payments through system-driven processes
- **Value**: benefit payments are processed efficiently without manual intervention, reducing processing time and human error while ensuring timely disbursement to payees

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **enable automated generation and posting of scheduled payments through system-driven processes**,
> So that **benefit payments are processed efficiently without manual intervention, reducing processing time and human error while ensuring timely disbursement to payees**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System automatically generates payments from active schedules when payment dates arrive, creating approved payment records without user action
>     1.1 Upon reaching scheduled payment date, system applies generation rules to select eligible allocations
>     1.2 System regenerates previously failed payments when schedules are updated or automatically rescheduled
> 2. System automatically posts approved payments by dispatching to Payment Hub subsystem through scheduled jobs
> 3. System validates payment data and retrieves current payee information before transaction creation
> 4. When validation succeeds, system creates outbound payment transactions and updates payment status to 'Issued'
> 5. System updates financial accumulators by relocating reserved amounts to used category upon payment issuance
> 6. Upon critical validation failures, system creates exception tasks for adjuster review and triggers automated rescheduling after resolution


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** active payment schedule with due date reached, **When** generation job runs, **Then** system creates payment records with 'Approved' status without user intervention
> 2. **Given** approved payments exist, **When** posting job executes, **Then** system dispatches to Payment Hub and assigns 'Issue Requested' status
> 3. **Given** payment validation succeeds, **When** outbound transaction created, **Then** system updates status to 'Issued' and relocates accumulator reserves to used amounts
> 4. **Given** payment validation fails with critical issues, **When** error detected, **Then** system creates exception task and prevents payment issuance
> 5. **Given** last payment issued from schedule, **When** completion rules execute, **Then** system evaluates schedule completion trigger
> 6. **Given** payment amount is zero or negative, **When** processing recovery payment, **Then** system assigns 'Issued' status without Payment Hub dispatch


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=761792184"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want to track accumulator usage (limit, reserved, used, remaining amounts) throughout the claim lifecycle, so that benefit limits are not exceeded.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: track and manage accumulator usage (limit, reserved, used, and remaining amounts) throughout the claim lifecycle
- **Value**: benefit limits are enforced, payment amounts remain within policy boundaries, and accurate real-time visibility into available coverage is maintained

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **track and manage accumulator usage (limit, reserved, used, and remaining amounts) throughout the claim lifecycle**,
> So that **benefit limits are enforced, payment amounts remain within policy boundaries, and accurate real-time visibility into available coverage is maintained**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Upon coverage addition to claim, system initializes accumulators with policy limit amounts and tracks remaining balances by accumulator type
> 2. During adjudication, system calculates gross payment amount constrained by remaining accumulator balance and displays limit usage for reference
> 3. When payment is posted, system reserves allocated amount reducing remaining balance
> 4. Upon payment issuance, system transfers reserved amount to used amount
> 5. If payment is cancelled, declined, voided or stopped, system returns amounts to appropriate accumulator buckets (reserved or remaining)
> 6. User is able to manually adjust accumulator limits when business circumstances require limit modifications


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** coverage is added, **When** accumulators are initialized, **Then** system establishes limit amounts and tracks them by configured accumulator types
> 2. **Given** adjudication occurs, **When** gross amount is calculated, **Then** system constrains payment by remaining accumulator balance
> 3. **Given** payment is posted, **When** amount is allocated, **Then** system reserves amount and reduces remaining balance accordingly
> 4. **Given** payment is issued, **When** transaction completes, **Then** system moves reserved amount to used category
> 5. **Given** payment is cancelled or reversed, **When** transaction is processed, **Then** system restores amounts to correct accumulator buckets maintaining balance integrity
> 6. **Given** accumulator requires adjustment, **When** manual modification is applied, **Then** system updates limit and remaining amounts reflecting the change


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=586716951"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manage overpayments through recovery, waiver, or withholding options, so that overpaid amounts are properly handled according to policy.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: manage overpayments through recovery, waiver, or withholding mechanisms
- **Value**: overpaid amounts are appropriately resolved in compliance with policy rules and financial controls

**Description:**

> As a Claim Adjuster,
> I want to manage overpayments through recovery, waiver, or withholding mechanisms,
> So that overpaid amounts are appropriately resolved in compliance with policy rules and financial controls


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System detects overpayment by comparing actual payments against scheduled amounts per payee
> 2. User selects resolution strategy: recovery, waiver, or withholding based on policy guidelines
>     2.1 Recovery: Record incoming payment from payee representing recovered amount
>     2.2 Waiver: Reduce overpayment by amount organization agrees not to recover
>     2.3 Withholding: Specify amount or percentage to deduct from future payments
> 3. System recalculates balance incorporating selected adjustment action
> 4. Upon data changes affecting calculations, system automatically triggers balance recalculation
> 5. System maintains audit trail of all resolution activities and balance changes
> 6. User is able to view balance adjustments filtered by payee with detailed activity history


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** overpayment exists for a payee, **When** user initiates recovery action, **Then** system records incoming payment and recalculates balance reducing overpayment
> 2. **Given** overpayment is identified, **When** user applies waiver, **Then** system reduces overpayment by waived amount without expectation of recovery
> 3. **Given** overpayment requires gradual resolution, **When** user configures withholding parameters, **Then** system deducts specified amount/percentage from subsequent payments
> 4. **Given** any adjustment action is executed, **When** system processes the action, **Then** automatic balance recalculation triggers and persists updated calculations
> 5. **Given** multiple resolution actions exist, **When** user reviews balance status, **Then** system displays complete audit trail of all adjustments per payee
> 6. **Given** invalid resolution parameters, **When** user attempts submission, **Then** system prevents processing until data meets policy requirements

### Epic: Payment Scheduling & Plan Management

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to create a payment template by providing payee and allocation details, so that I can establish the foundation for payment scheduling.

- **Action**: create and configure a payment template with payee and allocation parameters
- **Value**: I can establish a reusable foundation for scheduling recurrent claim payments efficiently

> 3. **Given** template requires modification, **When** user updates parameters, **Then** system validates and applies changes while keeping template open
> 4. **Given** payment schedule creation succeeds, **When** closure is triggered, **Then** system transitions template to closed terminal state
> 5. **Given** template is closed, **When** modification is attempted, **Then** system prevents further updates
> 6. **Given** mandatory allocation data is incomplete, **When** submission occurs, **Then** system prevents template progression

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to build and activate a payment schedule from approved settlement data, so that the system can generate actual payments on scheduled dates.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: build and activate a payment schedule from approved settlement data
- **Value**: the system can generate actual payments on scheduled dates automatically

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **build and activate a payment schedule from approved settlement data**,
> So that **the system can generate actual payments on scheduled dates automatically**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Initialize payment schedule in Open status upon creation
> 2. Build schedule by collecting template data, validating approved settlements, and confirming origin source consistency
>     2.1 System prevents scheduling if settlements lack Approved status or PAY proposal code
>     2.2 System creates payment template and executes scheduling rules
> 3. Activate schedule to transition to Active status and trigger automated payment generation
>     3.1 System validates no duplicate active/suspended schedules exist for same origin source
> 4. Suspend or unsuspend active schedules to temporarily halt or resume payment generation
> 5. Cancel schedule permanently from Open, Active, or Suspe nded status
> 6. Complete schedule automatically when all payments generated


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** approved settlements with PAY proposal code, **When** building payment schedule, **Then** system creates schedule in Open status with validated template data
> 2. **Given** schedule in Open status, **When** activating without duplicate schedules for origin source, **Then** system transitions to Active and initiates payment generation job
> 3. **Given** settlement not in Approved status, **When** attempting to build schedule, **Then** system prevents schedule creation with settlement validation error
> 4. **Given** active schedule exists for origin source, **When** attempting to activate another, **Then** system prevents activation with duplicate schedule error
> 5. **Given** Active schedule, **When** suspending, **Then** system stops payment generation and allows unsuspend to resume
> 6. **Given** all scheduled payments generated, **When** finalizing, **Then** system transitions schedule to Completed status

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to activate an approved payment schedule so that payments can be generated and issued according to the schedule.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: activate an approved payment schedule to initiate automated payment generation
- **Value**: scheduled payments are issued systematically according to predefined intervals without manual intervention

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **activate an approved payment schedule to initiate automated payment generation**,
> So that **scheduled payments are issued systematically according to predefined intervals without manual intervention**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User is able to initiate activation of a payment schedule in Open status
> 2. System validates no conflicting active or suspended schedules exist for the same origin source
>     2.1 Upon conflict detection, system prevents activation and notifies user
> 3. System verifies user authority levels meet payment approval thresholds per business rules
>     3.1 If insufficient authority, system routes for manual approval
> 4. System transitions schedule status from Open to Active
> 5. System triggers automated payment generation job
> 6. Payments are systematically generated according to scheduling rules while schedule remains Active


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a payment schedule in Open status with validated settlements, **When** activation is requested, **Then** system confirms no active/suspended schedules exist for the origin source
> 2. **Given** valid authority levels, **When** activation completes, **Then** schedule status transitions to Active and payment generation initiates
> 3. **Given** conflicting schedules exist, **When** activation is attempted, **Then** system prevents activation and displays conflict notification
> 4. **Given** insufficient authority, **When** activation is requested, **Then** system routes to manual approval workflow
> 5. **Given** active schedule, **When** payment generation job executes, **Then** payments are created per schedule intervals
> 6. **Given** invalid settlements, **When** activation is attempted, **Then** system prevents activation until settlements meet approval criteria

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to suspend an active payment schedule temporarily, so that I can pause payment generation without canceling the schedule.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: suspend an active payment schedule temporarily and manage payment schedule lifecycle states
- **Value**: I can pause payment generation without permanently canceling the schedule, maintaining control over scheduled payments while addressing temporary business needs

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** suspend an active payment schedule temporarily and manage payment schedule lifecycle states,
> **so that** I can pause payment generation without permanently canceling the schedule, maintaining control over scheduled payments while addressing temporary business needs.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. Initialize new payment schedules in 'Open' status through the Build Payment Schedule process, which collects payment template data, validates settlements, and creates payment templates based on defined mappings.",
>   "2. Activate payment schedules by transitioning from 'Open' to 'Active' status after successful validation checks and business rule evaluation.",
>   "  2.1. System validates that no Active or Suspended schedule exists for the same origin source; if found, displays error message and prevents activation.",
>   "  2.2. System evaluates payment authority rules via [BR>Claim Payment Schedule Activation (Claim)] to verify sufficient authority levels and privileges.",
>   "  2.3. Upon successful activation, system triggers Payment Generation Job to begin creating individual payments.",
>   "3. Suspend active payment schedules to temporarily halt payment generation.",
>   "  3.1. User changes schedule status from 'Active' to 'Suspended'.",
>   "  3.2. System stops Payment Generation Job from processing the suspended schedule without deleting schedule configuration.",
>   "  3.3. Batch operation 'Suspend Loss Payment Schedules' allows suspension of multiple Active schedules matching the origin source.",
>   "4. Unsuspend payment schedules to resume payment generation.",
>   "  4.1. User changes schedule status from 'Suspended' back to 'Active'.",
>   "  4.2. System resumes Payment Generation Job processing for the reactivated schedule.",
>   "  4.3. Batch operation 'Unsuspend Loss Payment Schedules' allows reactivation of multiple Suspended schedules matching the origin source.",
>   "5. Cancel payment schedules permanently when termination is required.",
>   "  5.1. User initiates cancellation from any current status (Open, Active, Suspended).",
>   "  5.2. System changes status to 'Canceled', permanently terminating the schedule and all future payment generation.",
>   "  5.3. Batch operation 'Cancel Loss Payment Schedules' allows cancellation of multiple Active or Suspended schedules matching the origin source.",
>   "6. Complete payment schedules when all payments have been generated, transitioning to 'Completed' status.",
>   "7. Payment Generation Job continuously processes Active schedules to create individual payments according to schedule configuration."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Scenario 1: Successfully Suspend Active Payment Schedule**",
>   "1. GIVEN an Active payment schedule exists for a claim",
>   "  WHEN the Claims Adjuster suspends the payment schedule",
>   "  THEN the schedule status changes from 'Active' to 'Suspended'",
>   "  AND payment generation is halted for this schedule",
>   "  AND the schedule configuration and existing payments remain intact.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 2: Successfully Unsuspend Payment Schedule**",
>   "2. GIVEN a Suspended payment schedule exists",
>   "  WHEN the Claims Adjuster unsuspends the payment schedule",
>   "  THEN the schedule status changes from 'Suspended' to 'Active'",
>   "  AND the Payment Generation Job resumes processing the schedule",
>   "  AND future payments are generated according to the original schedule configuration.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 3: Prevent Duplicate Active Schedules**",
>   "3. GIVEN an Active or Suspended payment schedule already exists for an origin source",
>   "  WHEN attempting to activate a new payment schedule for the same origin source",
>   "  THEN the system displays error message: 'Active or suspended payment schedule already exists for the origin source: &lt;origin source&gt;'",
>   "  AND activation is prevented",
>   "  AND the user must cancel or complete existing schedules before proceeding.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 4: Payment Authority Validation During Activation**",
>   "4. GIVEN a payment schedule in 'Open' status",
>   "  WHEN attempting to activate the schedule",
>   "  THEN the system evaluates [BR>Claim Payment Schedule Activation (Claim)]",
>   "  AND IF authority levels and privileges are insufficient",
>   "  THEN activation is blocked",
>   "  AND a user with appropriate authority must manually activate and approve the schedule.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 5: Cancel Payment Schedule from Any Status**",
>   "5. GIVEN a payment schedule in any status (Open, Active, or Suspended)",
>   "  WHEN the Claims Adjuster cancels the payment schedule",
>   "  THEN the schedule status changes to 'Canceled'",
>   "  AND all future payment generation is permanently terminated",
>   "  AND the schedule cannot be reactivated.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 6: Batch Suspend Multiple Schedules**",
>   "6. GIVEN multiple Active payment schedules exist with the same origin source",
>   "  WHEN the 'Suspend Loss Payment Schedules' batch operation is executed",
>   "  THEN all matching Active schedules are changed to 'Suspended' status",
>   "  AND payment generation is halted for all affected schedules.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 7: Settlement Validation During Build Payment Schedule**",
>   "7. GIVEN a settlement that is not in 'Approved' status OR does not have 'Pay' proposal code OR is from a different origin source",
>   "  WHEN 'Build Payment Schedule' is called",
>   "  THEN the system returns an appropriate error message",
>   "  AND payment schedule creation is aborted.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 8: Complete Payment Schedule**",
>   "8. GIVEN all scheduled payments have been generated for an Active schedule",
>   "  WHEN the Payment Generation Job completes processing",
>   "  THEN the schedule status changes to 'Completed'",
>   "  AND no further payments are generated."
> ]

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=531214195"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to unsuspend a suspended payment schedule, so that payment generation resumes from where it was paused.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: unsuspend a suspended payment schedule
- **Value**: payment generation resumes from where it was paused

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** unsuspend a suspended payment schedule,
> **so that** payment generation resumes from where it was paused.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User identifies a payment schedule in 'Suspended' status that needs to be reactivated for payment generation.",
>   "2. User initiates the Unsuspend Payment Schedule action for the selected schedule.",
>   "3. System validates the payment schedule eligibility for unsuspension:",
>   "3.1. Verifies the schedule is currently in 'Suspended' status.",
>   "3.2. Confirms no other Active payment schedule exists for the same origin source.",
>   "4. System transitions the payment schedule from 'Suspended' to 'Active' status.",
>   "5. Payment Generation Job automatically resumes generating payments according to the schedule configuration.",
>   "6. System confirms successful unsuspension and displays updated schedule status.",
>   "7. **Bulk Unsuspend Operation**: User can unsuspend multiple payment schedules associated with a loss by initiating 'Unsuspend Loss Payment Schedules' command:",
>   "7.1. System searches for all payment schedules with matching origin source in 'Suspended' status.",
>   "7.2. System unsuspends all identified schedules in a single operation.",
>   "8. **Alternate Path - Manual Activation Required**: If insufficient authority levels prevent automatic unsuspension, user can manually activate the schedule using 'Activate Loss Payment Schedules (Manual)' action to explicitly approve and reactivate the schedule."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** a payment schedule exists in 'Suspended' status **When** the Claims Adjuster initiates the Unsuspend Payment Schedule command **Then** the system transitions the schedule to 'Active' status and payment generation resumes automatically.",
>   "2. **Given** a payment schedule is in 'Suspended' status **When** unsuspension is successful **Then** the Payment Generation Job includes this schedule in the next payment generation cycle.",
>   "3. **Given** a payment schedule in 'Suspended' status **When** another Active payment schedule already exists for the same origin source **Then** the system blocks the unsuspend action and displays error message: 'Active or suspended payment schedule already exists for the origin source: &lt;origin source&gt;'.",
>   "4. **Given** a payment schedule is not in 'Suspended' status (e.g., Canceled, Completed, Open) **When** the Claims Adjuster attempts to unsuspend it **Then** the system prevents the action and displays an appropriate error message indicating the schedule cannot be unsuspended from its current state.",
>   "5. **Given** multiple payment schedules for a loss are in 'Suspended' status **When** the Claims Adjuster initiates 'Unsuspend Loss Payment Schedules' bulk command **Then** the system identifies all Suspended schedules matching the origin source and transitions all of them to 'Active' status in a single operation.",
>   "6. **Given** a payment schedule requires manual activation due to authority level constraints **When** the Claims Adjuster uses 'Activate Loss Payment Schedules (Manual)' **Then** the system allows explicit approval and activation of the schedule regardless of automated authority rules.",
>   "7. **Given** a payment schedule is unsuspended successfully **When** the status change is committed **Then** the system records the status transition with timestamp and user identification for audit purposes.",
>   "8. **Given** payment authority rules are defined in BR>Claim Payment Schedule Activation **When** unsuspension is attempted **Then** the system validates the action against applicable payment authority rules before allowing status transition."
> ]

>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=531214195"

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to cancel a payment schedule that should not be issued, so that no payments are generated from that schedule.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: cancel a payment schedule that should not be issued
- **Value**: no payments are generated from that schedule

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** cancel a payment schedule that should not be issued,
> **so that** no payments are generated from that schedule.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Claims Adjuster identifies a payment schedule that needs to be permanently terminated.
> 2. Claims Adjuster initiates the Cancel Payment Schedule command for the target schedule.
> 3. System validates the payment schedule is eligible for cancellation (status is 'Active' or 'Suspended').
> 4. System transitions the payment schedule status to 'Canceled'.
> 5. System permanently terminates the schedule, ensuring no future payments are generated.
> 6. For bulk operations at loss level:
>    6.1 Claims Adjuster can use Cancel Loss Payment Schedules command to cancel multiple schedules.
>    6.2 System searches for all Active or Suspended payment schedules matching the specified origin source.
>    6.3 System cancels all matching payment schedules in a single operation.
> 7. Canceled payment schedules remain in the system for audit and historical reference but cannot be reactivated.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a payment schedule exists with status 'Active',
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster executes Cancel Payment Schedule command,
>    **Then** the payment schedule status changes to 'Canceled' and no further payments are generated from this schedule.
>
> 2. **Given** a payment schedule exists with status 'Suspended',
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster executes Cancel Payment Schedule command,
>    **Then** the payment schedule status changes to 'Canceled' and the schedule is permanently terminated.
>
> 3. **Given** a payment schedule exists with status 'Open',
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster executes Cancel Payment Schedule command,
>    **Then** the system allows cancellation and transitions status to 'Canceled'.
>
> 4. **Given** a payment schedule exists with status 'Completed',
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster attempts to execute Cancel Payment Schedule command,
>    **Then** the system prevents cancellation as the schedule has already completed its lifecycle.
>
> 5. **Given** a payment schedule exists with status 'Canceled',
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster attempts to execute Cancel Payment Schedule command again,
>    **Then** the system prevents duplicate cancellation as the schedule is already in terminal canceled status.
>
> 6. **Given** multiple payment schedules exist at loss level with the same origin source in 'Active' or 'Suspended' status,
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster executes Cancel Loss Payment Schedules command with that origin source,
>    **Then** all matching payment schedules are canceled in a single operation.
>
> 7. **Given** a payment schedule has been canceled,
>    **When** the scheduled payment generation process runs,
>    **Then** no payments are created for the canceled schedule.
>
> 8. **Given** a payment schedule is canceled,
>    **When** viewing the payment schedule history,
>    **Then** the schedule remains visible for audit purposes with status 'Canceled' and cannot be reactivated or unsuspended.
>
> 9. **Given** a payment schedule was created from approved settlements with 'Pay' proposal code,
>    **When** the schedule is canceled,
>    **Then** the underlying settlement approvals remain unchanged and only the payment schedule is terminated.


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=531214195"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to adjust payment amounts by adding or reducing upcoming payments, so that I can correct payment calculations without rescheduling.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: adjust payment amounts by adding or reducing upcoming payments
- **Value**: I can correct payment calculations without rescheduling the entire payment plan

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** adjust payment amounts by adding or reducing upcoming payments,
> **so that** I can correct payment calculations without rescheduling the entire payment plan.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User initiates payment adjustment from the Dental Claim Overview - Financials screen by selecting 'Adjust Payment(s)' action from the 'Select Payments Action' dropdown.",
>   "2. User specifies the type of adjustment needed by selecting either Addition, Reduction, or both adjustment types.",
>   "3. For Addition adjustments:",
>   "   3.1. User provides Addition Type, Addition Amount, and optional Addition Comments.",
>   "   3.2. System applies the addition amount to the first upcoming payment that is not yet issued or stopped.",
>   "4. For Reduction adjustments:",
>   "   4.1. User provides Reduction Type, Reduction Amount, and optional Reduction Comments.",
>   "   4.2. System subtracts the reduction amount from the first upcoming payment that is not yet issued or stopped.",
>   "5. User can apply both addition and reduction simultaneously to the same payment schedule.",
>   "6. System validates the adjustment entries and enables submission only when required fields are completed.",
>   "7. User confirms the adjustment action through a confirmation prompt before the system processes the changes.",
>   "8. System processes the adjustment by:",
>   "   8.1. Targeting the first upcoming payment without a related actual payment (not in 'Issued' or 'Stop Requested' status).",
>   "   8.2. Applying the addition amount to increase the paymentNetAmount or the reduction amount to decrease it.",
>   "   8.3. Executing Payment Scheduling rules from the Rule Engine to ensure compliance.",
>   "   8.4. Updating the payment schedule and displaying the Addition/Reduction information in the payment list.",
>   "9. If user cancels the adjustment at the drawer level, the system closes the drawer and returns to the Financials screen without changes.",
>   "10. If user cancels the confirmation prompt, the system returns to the adjustment drawer for further editing.",
>   "11. If user toggles off Addition or Reduction checkbox, the system hides the corresponding section while preserving the other.",
>   "12. System prevents the 'Adjust Payment(s)' action from being visible when:",
>   "    12.1. All payments in the schedule are already issued.",
>   "    12.2. A previous addition or reduction was applied to a payment that has subsequently been issued."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** the user has CAP>Adjust Payment Schedule Amount(Dental) privilege and is on the Dental Claim Overview - Financials screen with scheduled payments where the latest payment is not yet completed, **When** the user accesses the 'Select Payments Action' dropdown, **Then** the 'Adjust Payment(s)' action is visible and selectable.",
>   "2. **Given** all scheduled payments are in 'Issued', 'Request Stopped', or 'Failed' status, **When** the user views the 'Select Payments Action' dropdown, **Then** the 'Adjust Payment(s)' action is hidden.",
>   "3. **Given** a previous addition or reduction was applied to a payment that is now in 'Issued' status, **When** the user views the payment actions, **Then** the 'Adjust Payment(s)' action is hidden.",
>   "4. **Given** the user has opened the 'Adjust Payment(s)' drawer, **When** the user ticks the 'Addition' checkbox, **Then** the system displays the Addition section with fields for Addition Type, Addition Amount, and Addition Comments.",
>   "5. **Given** the user has opened the 'Adjust Payment(s)' drawer, **When** the user ticks the 'Reduction' checkbox, **Then** the system displays the Reduction section with fields for Reduction Type, Reduction Amount, and Reduction Comments.",
>   "6. **Given** the user has enabled both Addition and Reduction sections, **When** the user enters valid amounts in both sections, **Then** the 'Adjust' button becomes enabled.",
>   "7. **Given** the user has not entered an Addition Amount or Reduction Amount, **When** the user attempts to proceed, **Then** the 'Adjust' button remains disabled.",
>   "8. **Given** the user has entered valid adjustment amounts and clicked 'Adjust', **When** the confirmation pop-up appears with 'Do you want to adjust the payment(s)?', **Then** the user can choose to Confirm or Cancel the operation.",
>   "9. **Given** the user clicks 'Confirm' on the confirmation pop-up, **When** the system processes the adjustment, **Then** the addition amount is added to the paymentNetAmount of the first upcoming payment without a related actual payment, Payment Scheduling rules are applied, and Addition information is displayed on the payment list.",
>   "10. **Given** the user clicks 'Confirm' on the confirmation pop-up with a reduction, **When** the system processes the adjustment, **Then** the reduction amount is subtracted from the paymentNetAmount of the first upcoming payment without a related actual payment, Payment Scheduling rules are applied, and Reduction information is displayed on the payment list.",
>   "11. **Given** the user has entered adjustment values, **When** the user clicks 'Cancel' on the 'Adjust Payment' drawer, **Then** the system closes the drawer and returns to the Dental Claim Overview - Financials screen without applying changes.",
>   "12. **Given** the user has clicked 'Adjust' and the confirmation pop-up is displayed, **When** the user clicks 'Cancel' on the confirmation pop-up, **Then** the system closes the confirmation window and remains in the 'Adjust Payment' drawer with entered data preserved.",
>   "13. **Given** the user has enabled the 'Addition' checkbox and entered addition details, **When** the user unticks the 'Addition' checkbox, **Then** the system hides the Addition section and clears the entered addition data.",
>   "14. **Given** the user has enabled the 'Reduction' checkbox and entered reduction details, **When** the user unticks the 'Reduction' checkbox, **Then** the system hides the Reduction section and clears the entered reduction data.",
>   "15. **Given** the adjustment is successfully processed, **When** the payment schedule is updated, **Then** the adjusted payment amounts reflect the addition/reduction, and the payment list displays the adjustment information with type and comments.",
>   "16. **Given** the claim is for Dental Actual or Ortho Service, **When** the user applies an adjustment, **Then** the system processes the adjustment according to the specified service type rules.",
>   "17. **Given** the claim is not for Dental Actual or Ortho Service, **When** the user views the payment actions, **Then** the 'Adjust Payment(s)' action is not available."
> ]


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=811438770"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster with sufficient authority, I want to approve a payment schedule that exceeds my authority limit, so that high-value payments can proceed after management review.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: approve payment schedules that exceed my authority limit through escalation and management review
- **Value**: high-value payments can be processed securely while maintaining proper financial controls and audit compliance

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **approve payment schedules that exceed my authority limit through escalation and management review**,
> So that **high-value payments can be processed securely while maintaining proper financial controls and audit compliance**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates payment schedule creation where gross amount exceeds their authority limit for the line of business.
> 2. System evaluates payment amount against user's authority threshold and transitions schedule to pending approval status.
> 3. System generates approval task and routes to appropriate management queue based on required authority level.
> 4. User with insufficient authority receives notification indicating authorization limit constraint and required escalation.
> 5. Authorized approver reviews and approves the payment schedule meeting authority requirements.
> 6. Upon approval, system automatically activates schedule, posts transactions, and issues payments.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a payment schedule exceeds user authority limit, **When** submitted, **Then** system transitions status to pending approval and generates escalation task.
> 2. **Given** user lacks sufficient authority, **When** attempting approval, **Then** system prevents action and displays authorization constraint message.
> 3. **Given** authorized approver reviews request, **When** approval is granted, **Then** system activates schedule and processes payments automatically.
> 4. **Given** payment is below authority threshold, **When** submitted, **Then** system bypasses approval workflow and proceeds directly.
> 5. **Given** approval is pending, **When** reviewing schedule, **Then** system displays authorization status and required approval level clearly.

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want the system to automatically deactivate existing payment schedules when a new one is created, so that only one active schedule exists per payment level.
- **Role**: Claims Operations Manager
- **Action**: automatically deactivate existing payment schedules when a new one is created and ensure only one active schedule exists per payment level
- **Value**: duplicate payments are prevented and payment processing remains consistent with a single source of truth for each payment level

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Operations Manager,
> **I want to** automatically deactivate existing payment schedules when a new one is created and ensure only one active schedule exists per payment level,
> **so that** duplicate payments are prevented and payment processing remains consistent with a single source of truth for each payment level.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System automatically deactivates existing payment schedules when a new payment schedule is initiated.
>    1.1 System searches for all payment schedules with states 'Active', 'Suspended', or 'Open' within the same payment level.
>    1.2 System deactivates all found schedules according to the Payment Schedule Life Cycle and Commands rules.
> 2. System prevents duplicate payments by canceling conflicting active payments.
>    2.1 System identifies existing payments in 'Approved' state within the same payment level.
>    2.2 System cancels all found approved payments with informational message indicating automatic cancellation during the Build Payment Schedule Flow process.
> 3. System executes payment scheduling calculation using the Rule Engine Payment Scheduling Rules service.
>    3.1 System converts collected financial data into a list of calculated payments.
>    3.2 Output includes both already issued payments and future payments to be issued.
>    3.3 **Alternate Flow**: If errors occur during payment scheduling calculation, system creates a task titled 'Payment Scheduling process failed' and terminates the process.
> 4. System initializes the new payment schedule according to Payment Schedule Life Cycle and Commands.
> 5. System activates the initialized payment schedule and evaluates next steps.
>    5.1 System attempts to activate the payment schedule.
>    5.2 **Alternate Flow**: If activation fails, system creates a 'Review Payment Schedule' task and terminates the process.
>    5.3 Upon successful activation, system checks for non-issued payments in the schedule.
>    5.4 If no non-issued payments exist, system executes Complete Payment Schedule command and ends the process.
>    5.5 If non-issued payments exist, the schedule remains in active state and the process completes successfully.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a payment level has existing payment schedules with states 'Active', 'Suspended', or 'Open',
>    **When** a new payment schedule is created for the same payment level,
>    **Then** all existing schedules are automatically deactivated according to the Payment Schedule Life Cycle commands.
>
> 2. **Given** a payment level has existing payments in 'Approved' state,
>    **When** a new payment schedule is created for the same payment level,
>    **Then** all approved payments are automatically canceled with message code 'BuildPaymentScheduleFlow-CancelActivePayments', severity 'info', and message text 'Payment is automatically canceled during the Build Payment Schedule Flow process.'
>
> 3. **Given** financial data is available for payment calculation,
>    **When** the Payment Scheduling Service executes,
>    **Then** the system generates a complete list of calculated payments including both issued and future payments.
>
> 4. **Given** errors occur during Payment Scheduling Service execution,
>    **When** the service fails,
>    **Then** the system creates a task titled 'Payment Scheduling process failed' and terminates the process without creating a payment schedule.
>
> 5. **Given** a payment schedule has been initialized,
>    **When** the activation command is executed,
>    **Then** the system successfully transitions the schedule to 'Active' state or creates a 'Review Payment Schedule' task if activation fails.
>
> 6. **Given** a payment schedule is successfully activated,
>    **When** the schedule has no non-issued payments,
>    **Then** the system executes the Complete Payment Schedule command and ends the process.
>
> 7. **Given** a payment schedule is successfully activated,
>    **When** the schedule contains non-issued payments,
>    **Then** the schedule remains in 'Active' state and is available for future payment generation.
>
> 8. **Given** multiple payment schedules exist for the same payment level,
>    **When** querying active schedules,
>    **Then** only one payment schedule can be in 'Active', 'Suspended', or 'Open' state at any given time.

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want the system to automatically cancel non-issued payments when a new schedule is created, so that duplicate payments are prevented.
- **Role**: Claims Operations Manager
- **Action**: automatically cancel non-issued payments when a new payment schedule is created
- **Value**: duplicate payments to insured parties are prevented and operational efficiency is maintained

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Operations Manager,
> **I want to** automatically cancel non-issued payments when a new payment schedule is created,
> **so that** duplicate payments to insured parties are prevented and operational efficiency is maintained.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System initiates payment schedule creation process when triggered from the Payments & Reserves list create payment action at the claim level.
> 2. System deactivates all existing payment schedules with status 'Active', 'Suspended', or 'Open' within the same payment level using lifecycle commands.
> 3. System searches for and automatically cancels all approved payments within the payment level to prevent duplicate disbursements to the insured.
>    3.1 Cancelled payments are logged with informational message code 'BuildPaymentScheduleFlow-CancelActivePayments' and descriptive reason.
> 4. System executes the Payment Scheduler service via Rule Engine to calculate payment lists, including both previously issued and future payments.
> 5. System validates the output from the payment scheduling service.
>    5.1 If validation errors are detected, system creates a 'Payment Scheduling process failed' task and terminates the process without proceeding to initialization.
> 6. System initializes the new payment schedule using the Init Payment Schedule lifecycle command.
> 7. System activates the payment schedule using the Activate Payment Schedule lifecycle command.
>    7.1 If activation fails, system creates a 'Review Payment Schedule' task and continues processing.
> 8. System checks whether the activated schedule contains any non-issued payments.
>    8.1 If non-issued payments exist, process ends and the schedule remains active for future payment issuance.
>    8.2 If no non-issued payments exist, system executes the Complete Payment Schedule lifecycle command and closes the schedule.
> 9. Process completes with the payment schedule in the appropriate final state.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a payment schedule creation is initiated from the claim payment action, **When** existing payment schedules with status 'Active', 'Suspended', or 'Open' are found at the same payment level, **Then** all matching schedules are deactivated before the new schedule is created.
> 2. **Given** a new payment schedule is being created, **When** approved payments exist within the same payment level, **Then** all approved payments are automatically cancelled with message code 'BuildPaymentScheduleFlow-CancelActivePayments' and severity 'info'.
> 3. **Given** approved payments are cancelled during schedule creation, **When** the cancellation is recorded, **Then** the cancellation message includes 'Payment is automatically canceled during the Build Payment Schedule Flow process.'
> 4. **Given** the Payment Scheduler service is executed, **When** the service completes successfully, **Then** the output includes a calculated list of both already-issued payments and future payments to be issued.
> 5. **Given** the Payment Scheduler service completes, **When** validation errors are detected in the output, **Then** a task titled 'Payment Scheduling process failed' is created and the process terminates without initializing the payment schedule.
> 6. **Given** payment schedule validation succeeds, **When** the schedule is initialized and activation is attempted, **Then** the system executes the Init Payment Schedule and Activate Payment Schedule lifecycle commands in sequence.
> 7. **Given** the payment schedule activation command is executed, **When** activation fails, **Then** a 'Review Payment Schedule' task is created and the process continues to check payment status.
> 8. **Given** a payment schedule is successfully activated, **When** the schedule contains non-issued payments, **Then** the schedule remains in active state and the Complete Payment Schedule command is not executed.
> 9. **Given** a payment schedule is successfully activated, **When** the schedule contains no non-issued payments, **Then** the system executes the Complete Payment Schedule lifecycle command.
> 10. **Given** only one active payment schedule rule is enforced, **When** multiple payment schedule creation attempts occur for the same payment level, **Then** only the most recent schedule remains active and all prior schedules are deactivated.
> 11. **Given** the build payment schedule process completes, **When** the final state is reached, **Then** no duplicate approved payments exist for the same payable item at the same payment level.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to reschedule payments when claim data changes, so that payment amounts and dates are recalculated based on updated information.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: reschedule payments when claim data changes
- **Value**: payment amounts and dates are recalculated based on updated information

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** reschedule payments when claim data changes,
> **so that** payment amounts and dates are recalculated based on updated information.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. System automatically triggers the Reschedule Payments Service when balance-sensitive fields are modified across Event Case, Claim, Master Policy, or Certificate Policy levels.",
>   "2. Upon service initiation, the system evaluates whether the full 'Build Payment Schedule' process should be executed based on claim context and configuration.",
>   "3. If Build Payment Schedule is required:",
>   "3.1. System retrieves current financial data from Event Case and Claim Settlement sources.",
>   "3.2. System updates the existing Payment Template (must be in Open status).",
>   "3.3. System executes Case Payments Scheduling Automation business process to recalculate payment amounts and dates.",
>   "3.4. System evaluates the Previous Payment Schedule status to determine final action.",
>   "3.5. If Previous Payment Schedule status is 'Suspended', system suspends the new Payment Schedule and completes process.",
>   "3.6. If Previous Payment Schedule status is NOT 'Suspended', system completes process without suspension.",
>   "4. If Build Payment Schedule is not required, system bypasses the full scheduling flow and completes process immediately.",
>   "5. For Disability LOB, system monitors and triggers recalculation for 16 specific field changes including: Actively At Work Date, retroactive Ancillaries, retroactive Deductions, Tax Withholding, Reduce payment adjustments, Covered Earnings, retroactive Offsets, Gross Benefit Amount, Elimination/Benefit Period dates, Taxable percentage, Current Earnings for Partial Disability, FICA exemptions, Date of Loss, Payment Method, Check Address, and LTD Survivor Benefit data.",
>   "6. For Life LOB, system monitors and triggers recalculation for 9 specific field changes including: Annual Covered Earnings (for Multiples of Salary benefit type only), Face Value Override, Gross Amount Override, Reduce payment adjustments, plan updates (Master Policy and Claim), retroactive Deductions, Date of Loss, Payment Method, and Check Address.",
>   "7. For Accident LOB, system monitors and triggers recalculation for 18 specific field changes including: Child Organized Sport indicator, retroactive Ancillaries, retroactive Deductions, Reduce payment adjustments, plan updates (Master Policy only), Gross Amount or unit overrides, Accidental Death Benefit Amount Override, days/occurrences counts, Date Range modifications, Burn Degree, Dislocation Reduction Type and Partial Dislocation flag, Fracture Reduction Type and Chip Fracture flag, Burn Skin Graft coverage links, Date of Loss, Payment Method, and Check Address.",
>   "8. For Critical Illness LOB, system monitors and triggers recalculation for 11 specific field changes including: Face Value, Gross Amount or unit overrides, days/occurrences counts, Recurring flag, Incident Date or Date Range beginning date, plan updates (Master Policy only), Reduce payment adjustments, retroactive Deductions, Date of Loss, Payment Method, and Check Address.",
>   "9. For Hospital Indemnity LOB, system monitors and triggers recalculation for 11 specific field changes including: days/occurrences counts, Gross Amount or unit overrides, Recurring flag, Incident Date or Date Range beginning date, plan updates (Master Policy only), Surgery link on Anesthesia coverage, Reduce payment adjustments, retroactive Deductions, Date of Loss, Payment Method, and Check Address.",
>   "10. Unless otherwise specified, field change monitoring applies to both Master Policy and Certificate Policy levels, with noted exceptions for Accident, Critical Illness, and Hospital Indemnity LOBs where certain plan updates apply to Master Policy only."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** a Payment Template exists in Open status and a balance-sensitive field is modified, **When** the modification is saved, **Then** the Reschedule Payments Service is automatically triggered within 5 seconds.",
>   "2. **Given** the Reschedule Payments Service is triggered, **When** the system evaluates the claim context, **Then** the decision to use 'Build Payment Schedule' is determined and logged correctly.",
>   "3. **Given** 'Build Payment Schedule' is required, **When** the process executes, **Then** the system successfully retrieves financial data from both Event Case and Claim Settlement sources without errors.",
>   "4. **Given** financial data is retrieved, **When** the Payment Template is updated, **Then** all payment amounts and dates are recalculated based on the current claim data and saved to the template.",
>   "5. **Given** the Case Payments Scheduling Automation completes, **When** the Previous Payment Schedule status is 'Suspended', **Then** the new Payment Schedule is set to 'Suspended' status and the process completes.",
>   "6. **Given** the Case Payments Scheduling Automation completes, **When** the Previous Payment Schedule status is NOT 'Suspended', **Then** the new Payment Schedule retains its calculated status and the process completes without suspension.",
>   "7. **Given** 'Build Payment Schedule' is not required, **When** the service is initiated, **Then** the process completes immediately without executing payment schedule updates.",
>   "8. **Given** a Payment Template is in a status other than Open, **When** a balance-sensitive field is modified, **Then** the Reschedule Payments Service fails gracefully with a clear error message indicating the template status precondition is not met.",
>   "9. **Disability LOB - Given** any of the 16 monitored fields (e.g., Actively At Work Date, Covered Earnings, Gross Benefit Amount, Elimination Period end date) is modified, **When** the change is saved, **Then** the payment schedule recalculation is triggered and completed successfully.",
>   "10. **Disability LOB - Given** the Current Earnings value for Partial Disability payment is changed, **When** recalculation occurs, **Then** the partial disability payment amounts reflect the updated Current Earnings value.",
>   "11. **Life LOB - Given** Annual Covered Earnings is changed for a claim with Benefit Type = Multiples of Salary, **When** recalculation occurs, **Then** the payment schedule reflects the updated earnings calculation.",
>   "12. **Life LOB - Given** Face Value Override or Gross Amount Override is modified, **When** recalculation occurs, **Then** the payment amounts reflect the overridden values instead of default calculations.",
>   "13. **Accident LOB - Given** Burn Degree is changed for a coverage under Burn Category, **When** recalculation occurs, **Then** the benefit amount is recalculated according to the new Burn Degree value.",
>   "14. **Accident LOB - Given** Reduction Type (Open/Close) or Chip Fracture switch is changed for a coverage under Fracture Category, **When** recalculation occurs, **Then** the benefit amount reflects the updated fracture classification.",
>   "15. **Critical Illness LOB - Given** the Recurring flag or number of occurrences is modified, **When** recalculation occurs, **Then** the payment schedule reflects the correct frequency and total payment count.",
>   "16. **Hospital Indemnity LOB - Given** the Surgery link on Anesthesia coverage is changed, **When** recalculation occurs, **Then** the Anesthesia benefit amount is correctly linked to the associated Surgery coverage benefit.",
>   "17. **Given** a plan update is made at Master Policy level for Accident, Critical Illness, or Hospital Indemnity LOB, **When** recalculation occurs, **Then** only Master Policy-level payment schedules are updated, not Certificate Policy schedules.",
>   "18. **Given** a plan update is made for Disability or Life LOB, **When** recalculation occurs, **Then** both Master Policy and Certificate Policy payment schedules are updated as applicable.",
>   "19. **Given** retroactive Deductions or Deduction details are added or modified, **When** recalculation occurs, **Then** all affected payment dates are adjusted retroactively and future payment amounts reflect the deduction changes.",
>   "20. **Given** Payment Method or Check Address is changed at Event Case or Claim level, **When** recalculation occurs, **Then** all scheduled payments reflect the updated payment delivery method and address without changing payment amounts or dates.",
>   "21. **Negative - Given** a field that is not designated as balance-sensitive is modified, **When** the change is saved, **Then** the Reschedule Payments Service is NOT triggered.",
>   "22. **Negative - Given** the Reschedule Payments Service is in progress, **When** a user attempts to modify another balance-sensitive field, **Then** the system either queues the second trigger or prevents the modification with a clear message until the first process completes.",
>   "23. **Performance - Given** a balance-sensitive field is modified, **When** the Reschedule Payments Service completes, **Then** the entire recalculation process finishes within 30 seconds for standard claims and within 60 seconds for complex claims with multiple coverages."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to generate individual payments from an active payment schedule on their due dates, so that payments are issued according to the schedule.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: generate individual payments from an active payment schedule on their due dates
- **Value**: payments are issued according to the schedule

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** generate individual payments from an active payment schedule on their due dates,
> **so that** payments are issued according to the schedule.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User navigates to the Claim or Event Case Overview Page and accesses the 'Payments & Recoveries' section to view active payment schedules.",
>   "2. User initiates payment generation by selecting 'Generate Payment' action from the available payment actions menu.",
>   "3. System loads the payment schedule information, identifies payments with current due dates, and generates the corresponding individual payments.",
>   "4. System automatically sets the generated payments to 'Approved' status, making them ready for disbursement.",
>   "5. Alternate Scenario: If all allocations have been manually deleted from the payment schedule:",
>   "   5.1. System creates a new payment schedule and marks the original schedule status as 'Completed'.",
>   "   5.2. 'Generate Payment' button becomes unavailable for the completed schedule.",
>   "6. Alternate Scenario: If the payment schedule status is 'Suspend':",
>   "   6.1. User attempts to click 'Generate Payment' button.",
>   "   6.2. System blocks payment issuance and does not generate any individual payments under the suspended schedule.",
>   "7. Alternate Scenario: If the payee's preferred payment method is invalid (not Check or EFT) or does not exist:",
>   "   7.1. User initiates payment generation.",
>   "   7.2. System updates the generated payment status to 'Cancelled' instead of 'Approved'."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** an Event Case with Payment Level set to Case or Claim and status 'Open', and an active payment schedule exists with valid allocations, and the payee has a preferred payment method of Check or EFT, and the user has PRIV>CAP>Issue Payment privilege, **When** the user clicks 'Select Payments Action'  'Generate Payment' button, **Then** the system generates individual payments for all due dates and sets their status to 'Approved'.",
>   "2. **Given** a payment schedule where all allocations have been manually deleted by the user, **When** the user views the payment schedule in the Payments & Recoveries section, **Then** the 'Generate Payment' button is unavailable and the system has created a new payment schedule with the original schedule status set to 'Completed'.",
>   "3. **Given** a payment schedule with status 'Suspend', **When** the user attempts to click 'Generate Payment' button, **Then** the system does not issue any individual payments and no new payments are created.",
>   "4. **Given** a payment schedule where the payee's preferred payment method is neither Check nor EFT or does not exist, **When** the user clicks 'Generate Payment' button, **Then** the system generates the payment but sets its status to 'Cancelled' instead of 'Approved'.",
>   "5. **Given** the user does not have the privilege PRIV>CAP>Issue Payment, **When** the user views the Claim or Event Case Overview Page, **Then** the 'Generate Payment' action is not available or accessible.",
>   "6. **Given** an Event Case with status other than 'Open', **When** the user attempts to access payment generation functionality, **Then** the system prevents payment generation from the payment schedule.",
>   "7. **Given** successful payment generation from an active schedule, **When** the system completes the generation process, **Then** all generated payments display with status 'Approved' in the Payments & Recoveries section and are ready for disbursement according to their due dates."
> ]
