#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to validate payment template data before scheduling, so that errors are caught early and payment scheduling rules can proceed.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: validate payment template data before scheduling and generate complete payment schedules with allocations, adjustments, and orthodontic payment plans
- **Value**: errors are caught early, payment scheduling rules proceed correctly, and all payment types (actual services and orthodontic) are processed accurately with proper adjustments applied

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** validate payment template data before scheduling and generate complete payment schedules with allocations, adjustments, and orthodontic payment plans,
> **so that** errors are caught early, payment scheduling rules proceed correctly, and all payment types (actual services and orthodontic) are processed accurately with proper adjustments applied.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Validate Payment Template details at initiation and verify all required data elements are present and conform to business rules.
>   1.1 If validation fails, return empty collection with error messages including severity, code, and message details with validationStatus set to Invalid and terminate processing.
> 2. Generate payment allocations based on claim type after successful validation.
>   2.1 For Actual Services claims: Set grossAmount from paymentAmount of Allowed settlement and set paymentDate as Payment Schedule's Creation Date.
>   2.2 For Orthodontic Services with Monthly frequency: Calculate Payment Amount as PaymentAmount divided by orthoMonthQuantity, generate payment series starting from current date and incrementing by calendar month until orthoMonthQuantity is reached, with last payment adjusted to reconcile total.
>   2.3 For Orthodontic Services with Quarterly frequency: Calculate Payment Amount as (PaymentAmount / orthoMonthQuantity) * 3, generate payment series incrementing by 3 calendar months until orthoMonthQuantity is reached.
>   2.4 For Orthodontic Services with One-Time frequency: Set full PaymentAmount as single payment with current date.
>   2.5 Handle month-end date mapping when next month lacks corresponding day by mapping to last day of target month.
> 3. Assign payment keys by grouping allocations by paymentDate plus payee combination and assign unique paymentId to each PaymentPayableItem.
> 4. Generate consolidated payment schedule by grouping allocations with matching paymentDate and payee into single payment records.
>   4.1 Map payment structure including Root Entity with direction set to 'outgoing', Payment Details with paymentDate, paymentAllocations, paymentNetAmount and payeeDetails.
>   4.2 Include Payment Allocation details with allocationSource, allocationGrossAmount, allocationNetAmount, allocationLossInfo, allocationPayableItem, and allocationDentalDetails.
>   4.3 Calculate paymentNetAmount as sum of all allocationNetAmount values, or set to 0 if paymentAllocations is null.
> 5. Apply financial adjustments to first upcoming payment without related actual payment (earliest future post date excluding Issued or Stop Requested statuses).
>   5.1 Add Claim Intake Fees to paymentNetAmount of first upcoming payment.
>   5.2 Add Addition amounts from 'Adjust Payment(s)' drawer to first upcoming payment.
>   5.3 Apply Reduction amounts from 'Adjust Payment(s)' drawer starting with first upcoming payment, cascading to subsequent payments if reduction exceeds first payment amount.
>   5.4 When payment with applied adjustments fails (Decline or Void), hide 'Adjust Payment(s)' action and prevent recalculation of applied amounts in new schedules.
>   5.5 When payment reaches Issued or Stop Requested status, hide 'Adjust Payment(s)' action to prevent further modifications.
> 6. Process orthodontic payment rescheduling when claim adjustments occur.
>   6.1 Unreserve and unuse the existing limit allocation.
>   6.2 Recalculate New Payable Amount using benefit amount calculation business rules.
>   6.3 Cancel all Pending Post or Approved payments while keeping issued payments unchanged.
>   6.4 Regenerate new payment series with New Payments Amount calculated as New payable amount divided by new Months of Treatment, with first payment date set to current date.
>   6.5 Prevent Payment Frequency updates during claim adjustment process.
> 7. Return complete payment schedule with all processed payments, allocations, adjustments, and validation status for downstream processing.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a payment template is submitted for validation, **when** all required fields are present and conform to business rules, **then** the system returns validationStatus 'Valid' with no error messages and proceeds to payment generation.
> 2. **Given** a payment template with missing or invalid data, **when** validation is performed, **then** the system returns validationStatus 'Invalid' with error messages containing severity, code, and message details, and terminates processing without generating payments.
> 3. **Given** an Actual Services claim with approved settlement, **when** payment allocations are generated, **then** grossAmount is set from paymentAmount of Allowed settlement and paymentDate is set to Payment Schedule's Creation Date.
> 4. **Given** an Orthodontic Services claim with Monthly frequency and orthoMonthQuantity of 12, **when** payment allocations are generated, **then** the system creates 12 monthly payments with amounts calculated as PaymentAmount/12 rounded to 2 decimal places, with last payment adjusted to reconcile total.
> 5. **Given** an Orthodontic Services claim with Quarterly frequency, **when** payment allocations are generated, **then** the system calculates payment amount as (PaymentAmount/orthoMonthQuantity)*3 and generates payments every 3 calendar months until orthoMonthQuantity is reached.
> 6. **Given** an Orthodontic Services claim with One-Time frequency, **when** payment allocations are generated, **then** the system creates a single payment with full PaymentAmount and current date.
> 7. **Given** a payment date falls on a day not present in the target month, **when** calculating next payment date, **then** the system maps to the last day of the target month.
> 8. **Given** multiple payment allocations exist, **when** generating payment schedule, **then** the system groups allocations by paymentDate plus payee and assigns unique paymentId to each PaymentPayableItem.
> 9. **Given** payment allocations are grouped, **when** calculating paymentNetAmount, **then** the system sums all allocationNetAmount values, or sets to 0 if paymentAllocations is null.
> 10. **Given** Claim Intake Fees are added to a claim, **when** applying adjustments, **then** the system adds fees to paymentNetAmount of first upcoming payment (earliest future post date excluding Issued/Stop Requested).
> 11. **Given** a Reduction Amount exceeds first payment amount, **when** applying reduction, **then** the system applies maximum reduction to first payment and cascades remaining reduction to subsequent payments until full amount is applied.
> 12. **Given** a payment with applied adjustments fails with Decline or Void status, **when** user accesses payment actions, **then** the system hides 'Adjust Payment(s)' action and prevents recalculation of applied adjustments in new schedules.
> 13. **Given** a payment reaches Issued or Stop Requested status, **when** user accesses payment actions, **then** the system hides 'Adjust Payment(s)' action to prevent further modifications.
> 14. **Given** an orthodontic claim requires rescheduling, **when** reschedule process is initiated, **then** the system unreserves limits, recalculates New Payable Amount, cancels Pending Post/Approved payments, keeps issued payments unchanged, and regenerates new payment series starting from current date.
> 15. **Given** an orthodontic claim is being adjusted, **when** user attempts to change Payment Frequency, **then** the system prevents the frequency update and maintains original frequency setting.
> 16. **Given** newly added Fees are applied to a payment that subsequently fails (Decline or Void), **when** user attempts to edit or delete fees, **then** the system prevents modification and excludes failed fees from recalculation in new payment schedules.
> 17. **Given** all payment allocations and adjustments are processed, **when** returning payment schedule, **then** the system outputs complete structure including Root Entity with direction 'outgoing', Payment Details, Payment Allocations, Loss Info, Payable Items, and Dental Details with all amounts rounded to 2 decimal places.

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want the system to automatically complete a payment schedule when all payments have been generated, so that the schedule lifecycle is properly closed.
- **Role**: Claims Operations Manager
- **Action**: manage the complete lifecycle of dental payment schedules from creation through activation, execution, suspension/cancellation, and completion
- **Value**: payment schedules are properly controlled, monitored, and automatically closed when all payments have been generated, ensuring financial accuracy and operational efficiency

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Operations Manager,
> **I want to** manage the complete lifecycle of dental payment schedules from creation through activation, execution, suspension/cancellation, and completion,
> **so that** payment schedules are properly controlled, monitored, and automatically closed when all payments have been generated, ensuring financial accuracy and operational efficiency.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. **Payment Schedule Creation**: System builds new payment schedules from approved settlement data by collecting payment template information, validating settlement conditions, creating payment templates in 'Open' status, and initiating rule-based scheduling.
>    1.1 Settlement validation ensures status is 'Approved', calculated proposal code is 'Pay', and origin source matches input requirements before proceeding.
>    1.2 If validation fails, system returns specific error messages indicating the validation failure reason and terminates the process.
> 2. **Payment Schedule Activation**: System activates payment schedules to enable payment generation by transitioning status from 'Open' to 'Active'.
>    2.1 System validates that no other schedules with status 'Active' or 'Suspended' exist for the same origin source before allowing activation.
>    2.2 System applies payment authority rules as defined in business rules for claim payment schedule activation.
>    2.3 If authority validation fails or duplicate active schedules exist, activation is blocked with appropriate error messaging.
>    2.4 Manual activation command is available to override automatic activation when system automation fails due to authority or privilege constraints.
> 3. **Payment Generation Execution**: While payment schedule remains in 'Active' status, the Payment Generation Job automatically generates scheduled payments according to the defined schedule.
> 4. **Payment Schedule Suspension and Resumption**: System provides capability to temporarily halt payment generation by suspending schedules.
>    4.1 Suspend operation transitions schedule from 'Active' to 'Suspended' status, preventing payment generation.
>    4.2 Unsuspend operation returns schedule from 'Suspended' to 'Active' status, resuming payment generation.
> 5. **Payment Schedule Cancellation**: System permanently terminates payment schedules by transitioning to 'Canceled' status from any operational state (Open, Active, Suspended).
> 6. **Automatic Payment Schedule Completion**: When all scheduled payments have been generated, system automatically executes completion command to transition schedule from 'Active' to 'Completed' status, properly closing the schedule lifecycle.
> 7. **Bulk Payment Schedule Management**: System enables mass operations on multiple payment schedules sharing the same origin source.
>    7.1 Bulk cancel operation searches for schedules in 'Active' or 'Suspended' status and executes cancel command for each match.
>    7.2 Bulk suspend operation searches for schedules in 'Active' status and executes suspend command for each match.
>    7.3 Bulk unsuspend operation searches for schedules in 'Suspended' status and executes unsuspend command for each match.
>    7.4 If no schedules match the search and filter criteria, bulk operation completes without executing commands.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** settlement data is submitted for payment schedule creation **When** settlement status is 'Approved', proposal code is 'Pay', and origin source matches input **Then** system successfully creates payment template in 'Open' status and initiates payment schedule creation.
> 2. **Given** settlement validation is performed **When** settlement status is not 'Approved' **Then** system returns error message 'Cannot resolve financial data for settlement &lt;settlement uri&gt;. Settlement state is not 'Approved'.' and terminates process without creating payment schedule.
> 3. **Given** settlement validation is performed **When** settlement calculated proposal code is not 'Pay' **Then** system returns error message 'Cannot resolve financial data for settlement &lt;settlement uri&gt;. Settlement proposal code is not 'PAY'.' and terminates process.
> 4. **Given** settlement validation is performed **When** settlement origin source differs from input origin source **Then** system returns error message 'Settlement is from a different origin source: &lt;settlement uri&gt;' and terminates process.
> 5. **Given** payment schedule in 'Open' status exists **When** activate command is executed and no other 'Active' or 'Suspended' schedules exist for same origin source **Then** system transitions schedule to 'Active' status and enables payment generation.
> 6. **Given** payment schedule activation is attempted **When** another schedule with same origin source already exists in 'Active' or 'Suspended' status **Then** system displays error 'Active or suspended payment schedule already exists for the origin source: &lt;origin source&gt;' and prevents activation.
> 7. **Given** payment schedule activation is attempted **When** payment authority rules validation fails **Then** system blocks activation and prevents status transition.
> 8. **Given** payment schedule is in 'Active' status **When** Payment Generation Job executes **Then** system automatically generates scheduled payments according to defined schedule.
> 9. **Given** payment schedule is in 'Active' status **When** suspend command is executed **Then** system transitions schedule to 'Suspended' status and halts payment generation.
> 10. **Given** payment schedule is in 'Suspended' status **When** unsuspend command is executed **Then** system transitions schedule back to 'Active' status and resumes payment generation.
> 11. **Given** payment schedule is in 'Open', 'Active', or 'Suspended' status **When** cancel command is executed **Then** system transitions schedule to 'Canceled' status and permanently terminates schedule.
> 12. **Given** payment schedule is in 'Active' status **When** all scheduled payments have been generated **Then** system automatically executes complete command and transitions schedule to 'Completed' status.
> 13. **Given** bulk cancel operation is initiated with origin source **When** system searches for matching schedules **Then** cancel command is automatically executed for all schedules in 'Active' or 'Suspended' status matching that origin source.
> 14. **Given** bulk suspend operation is initiated with origin source **When** system searches for matching schedules **Then** suspend command is automatically executed for all schedules in 'Active' status matching that origin source.
> 15. **Given** bulk unsuspend operation is initiated with origin source **When** system searches for matching schedules **Then** unsuspend command is automatically executed for all schedules in 'Suspended' status matching that origin source.
> 16. **Given** bulk operation is initiated **When** no schedules match the origin source and status filter criteria **Then** system completes operation without executing any commands and without errors.

### Epic: Payment Status Management & User Interface

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view a comprehensive payment list showing upcoming, posted, underpayment, and deduction payments, so that I can manage all payment types from a single interface.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view a comprehensive payment list showing upcoming, posted, underpayment, and deduction payments, and perform payment actions based on payment schedule status
- **Value**: I can manage all payment types from a single interface and efficiently process payments according to their current workflow stage

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view a comprehensive payment list showing upcoming, posted, underpayment, and deduction payments, and perform payment actions based on payment schedule status,
> **so that** I can manage all payment types from a single interface and efficiently process payments according to their current workflow stage.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User accesses the Payment List in the Payments & Recoveries section of Claims/Case management to view all payment records.
> 2. System retrieves and displays payment records in two primary categories:
>    2.1 **Upcoming Payments** - Retrieved via 'Get scheduled and actual payments' API where paymentDate > lastGeneratedPaymentDate, displaying only Payment Schedules with status 'Open', 'Active', or 'Suspended'.
>    2.2 **Posted Payments** - Retrieved via PaymentSearch functionality where paymentDate  lastGeneratedPaymentDate, displaying status from CapPayment.state (either 'Issued' or 'Cancelled') with TransactionID and payment details.
> 3. System displays three types of payment records: Payment (including Upcoming Payment and Posted Payment/Single Payment), Underpayment, and Deduction Payment.
> 4. User can sort the payment list by Post Date, Payment Made From/To, or Payment Amount.
> 5. User can expand payment details to view breakdowns including Interest, Deduction, Indemnity/Expense, GBA, Offset, Tax, and Rehab components.
> 6. User performs payment actions via 'Select Payments Action' dropdown, with available actions dynamically determined by payment schedule status:
>    6.1 **When status is 'Open' (Pending Approval)** - Authority Approval button appears; available actions include Create Payment, Update Payment, and Post Recovery. Cancel All Payments is hidden if issued payment exists; Generate Payment is not visible.
>    6.2 **When status is 'Active' (Pending Post)** - Available actions include Create Payment, Update Payment, Suspend All Payments, Generate Payment, and Post Recovery. Cancel All Payments is hidden if issued payment exists.
>    6.3 **When status is 'Suspended'** - Available actions include Create Payment, Update Payment, Unsuspend All Payments, and Post Recovery. Cancel All Payments is hidden if issued payment exists; Generate Payment is not visible.
>    6.4 **When no payment schedule exists** - Only 'Create Payment' and 'Post Recovery' actions are visible.
> 7. For Posted Payments with 'Issued' status, user can access a three-dot menu with options to 'Request Stop' or 'Decline/Void Payment'.
> 8. System displays Payment Method value after payment is issued.
> 9. Cancelled payments appear in the Posted Payments list with 'Cancelled' status without action menu availability.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a user with appropriate privileges accesses the Payment List, **when** payment records exist, **then** the system displays all payment records categorized as Upcoming Payments, Posted Payments, Underpayments, and Deduction Payments.
> 2. **Given** upcoming payments exist, **when** the system retrieves payment data, **then** only Payment Schedules with status 'Open', 'Active', or 'Suspended' where paymentDate > lastGeneratedPaymentDate are displayed in the Upcoming Payments section.
> 3. **Given** posted payments exist, **when** the system retrieves payment data, **then** all payments where paymentDate  lastGeneratedPaymentDate are displayed with their CapPayment.state status ('Issued' or 'Cancelled') and TransactionID.
> 4. **Given** a payment schedule has status 'Open', **when** the user views available actions, **then** the system displays Authority Approval button, Create Payment, Update Payment, and Post Recovery options, while hiding Cancel All Payments if issued payment exists and hiding Generate Payment.
> 5. **Given** a payment schedule has status 'Active', **when** the user views available actions, **then** the system displays Create Payment, Update Payment, Suspend All Payments, Generate Payment, and Post Recovery options, while hiding Cancel All Payments if issued payment exists.
> 6. **Given** a payment schedule has status 'Suspended', **when** the user views available actions, **then** the system displays Create Payment, Update Payment, Unsuspend All Payments, and Post Recovery options, while hiding Cancel All Payments if issued payment exists and hiding Generate Payment.
> 7. **Given** no payment schedule exists, **when** the user opens the Select Payments Action dropdown, **then** only 'Create Payment' and 'Post Recovery' actions are visible.
> 8. **Given** a posted payment has 'Issued' status, **when** the user accesses the payment record, **then** a three-dot menu appears with 'Request Stop' and 'Decline/Void Payment' options.
> 9. **Given** a posted payment has 'Cancelled' status, **when** the user views the payment record, **then** the payment displays with 'Cancelled' status and no action menu is available.
> 10. **Given** the user views the payment list, **when** sorting is applied, **then** the list can be sorted by Post Date, Payment Made From/To, or Payment Amount.
> 11. **Given** a payment record is displayed, **when** the user expands payment details, **then** the system shows breakdown components including Interest, Deduction, Indemnity/Expense, GBA, Offset, Tax, and Rehab.
> 12. **Given** a payment has been issued, **when** the payment record is displayed, **then** the Payment Method value is visible.
> 13. **Given** the user lacks appropriate privileges (Approve Underpayment, Activate Payment Schedule), **when** attempting to perform restricted actions, **then** the system prevents unauthorized actions and displays appropriate access control messaging.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to see payment status indicators (Pending Approval, Pending Post, Suspended, Issued, Cancelled) based on payment schedule and payment state, so that I can quickly understand the current state of each payment.

> **so that** I can quickly understand the current state of each payment and take appropriate actions based on payment lifecycle stage.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. System displays comprehensive Payment List in Payments & Recoveries section showing three payment record types: Payment (Upcoming and Posted), Underpayment, and Deduction Payment.",
>   "2. System retrieves and displays payment records through differentiated mechanisms:",
>   "   2.1. Upcoming Payments: Retrieved via 'Get scheduled and actual payments' API where paymentDate > lastGeneratedPaymentDate, displaying Payment Schedules with status 'Open', 'Active', or 'Suspended'.",
>   "   2.2. Posted Payments (Single Payment): Retrieved via PaymentSearch API where paymentDate  lastGeneratedPaymentDate, displaying CapPayment.state statuses 'Issued' or 'Cancelled'.",
>   "   2.3. Underpayment and Deduction Payment records displayed using additional methods per referenced documentation.",
>   "3. System presents payment status through mapped indicators:",
>   "   3.1. 'Pending Approval' for Payment Schedule status 'Open'.",
>   "   3.2. 'Pending Post' for Payment Schedule status 'Active'.",
>   "   3.3. 'Suspended' for Payment Schedule status 'Suspended'.",
>   "   3.4. 'Issued' for posted payments that have been disbursed.",
>   "   3.5. 'Cancelled' for payments that have been terminated.",
>   "4. User can sort payment list by Post Date, Payment Made From/To, or Payment Amount in ascending or descending order.",
>   "5. User can expand payment records to view detailed breakdown by payment type (Interest, Deduction, Indemnity, GBA, Offset, Tax, etc.).",
>   "6. System displays contextual actions based on payment schedule status:",
>   "   6.1. When status is 'Pending Approval' (Open): Authority Approval button is visible, enabling user to initiate approval workflow to transition schedule to Active status.",
>   "   6.2. When status is 'Pending Post' (Active): Select Payments Action dropdown includes Update Payment, Suspend All Payments, Generate Payment (if payment schedule exists), and Cancel All Payments (unless issued payment exists).",
>   "   6.3. When status is 'Suspended': Unsuspend All Payments action is available in Select Payments Action dropdown to reactivate the schedule.",
>   "   6.4. When payment is 'Issued': Three-dot menu provides 'Request Stop' and 'Decline/Void Payment' options, and Payment Method information displays the method used by Payment Hub.",
>   "7. System always displays Create Payment and Post Recovery actions in Select Payments Action dropdown regardless of payment schedule status.",
>   "8. System hides Cancel All Payments action when issued payment exists in payment schedule to prevent cancellation of schedules with already-issued payments.",
>   "9. For Absence type payments, user can access EOB Remarks via hyperlink to view explanation of benefits remarks specific to absence payments.",
>   "10. User actions are enabled based on appropriate privileges (Approve Underpayment, Activate Payment Schedule) and existence of payment records."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Positive Scenarios:**",
>   "1. **Given** payment records exist in the system, **When** Claims Adjuster navigates to Payments & Recoveries section, **Then** system displays comprehensive Payment List showing all three record types (Payment, Underpayment, Deduction Payment).",
>   "2. **Given** payment schedule has status 'Open', **When** Payment List is displayed, **Then** system shows status indicator as 'Pending Approval' and displays Authority Approval button.",
>   "3. **Given** payment schedule has status 'Active', **When** Payment List is displayed, **Then** system shows status indicator as 'Pending Post' and Select Payments Action dropdown includes Update Payment, Suspend All Payments, Generate Payment, and Cancel All Payments options.",
>   "4. **Given** payment schedule has status 'Suspended', **When** Payment List is displayed, **Then** system shows status indicator as 'Suspended' and Unsuspend All Payments action is available in dropdown.",
>   "5. **Given** payment has CapPayment.state status 'Issued', **When** payment record is displayed, **Then** system shows 'Issued' status, displays Payment Method information, and three-dot menu includes 'Request Stop' and 'Decline/Void Payment' options.",
>   "6. **Given** payment has CapPayment.state status 'Cancelled', **When** payment record is displayed, **Then** system shows 'Cancelled' status indicator.",
>   "7. **Given** upcoming payments exist where paymentDate > lastGeneratedPaymentDate, **When** system retrieves payment list via 'Get scheduled and actual payments' API, **Then** only Payment Schedules with status 'Open', 'Active', or 'Suspended' are displayed.",
>   "8. **Given** posted payments exist where paymentDate  lastGeneratedPaymentDate, **When** system retrieves payment list via PaymentSearch API, **Then** only payments with CapPayment.state 'Issued' or 'Cancelled' are displayed.",
>   "9. **Given** user clicks on payment record, **When** payment details expand, **Then** system displays breakdown by payment type including Interest, Deduction, Indemnity, GBA, Offset, and Tax.",
>   "10. **Given** user applies sorting, **When** sort criteria is selected (Post Date, Payment Made From/To, or Payment Amount), **Then** system reorders list in ascending or descending order based on selection.",
>   "11. **Given** payment is for Absence type, **When** payment record is displayed, **Then** EOB Remarks hyperlink is accessible and displays explanation of benefits remarks upon click.",
>   "12. **Given** any payment schedule status, **When** Select Payments Action dropdown is displayed, **Then** Create Payment and Post Recovery actions are always visible.",
>   "13. **Given** user has appropriate privileges and payment schedule is in 'Open' status, **When** Authority Approval button is clicked, **Then** system initiates approval workflow to transition schedule to Active status.",
>   "**Negative Scenarios:**",
>   "14. **Given** issued payment exists in payment schedule, **When** Select Payments Action dropdown is displayed, **Then** Cancel All Payments action is hidden and not available for selection.",
>   "15. **Given** user lacks required privileges (Approve Underpayment or Activate Payment Schedule), **When** attempting to access privileged actions, **Then** system prevents action execution and displays appropriate authorization message.",
>   "16. **Given** no payment records exist in the system, **When** Claims Adjuster navigates to Payments & Recoveries section, **Then** Payment List displays empty state with appropriate messaging.",
>   "17. **Given** payment schedule status is not 'Open', **When** Payment List is displayed, **Then** Authority Approval button is not visible.",
>   "18. **Given** payment is not for Absence type, **When** payment record is displayed, **Then** EOB Remarks hyperlink is not available."

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to cancel all unissued scheduled payments with a single action, so that I can efficiently remove pending payment schedules without processing individual cancellations.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: cancel all unissued scheduled payments with a single action
- **Value**: I can efficiently remove pending payment schedules without processing individual cancellations

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** cancel all unissued scheduled payments with a single action,
> **so that** I can efficiently remove pending payment schedules without processing individual cancellations.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User initiates bulk cancellation by selecting the 'Cancel All Payments' action from the 'Select Payments Action' menu in the 'Payments & Recoveries' section.",
>   "2. System executes the Cancel Payment Schedule logic to remove all pending payments from the active payment schedule.",
>   "3. System removes all cancelled payment allocations from the user interface, resulting in an empty payment list.",
>   "4. User confirms that all pending payments have been successfully cancelled and are no longer displayed.",
>   "5. **Alternate Flow - Selective Payment Cancellation:** If the user needs to cancel only specific payments rather than the entire schedule:",
>   "   5.1. User selects 'Update Payment' instead of 'Cancel All Payments'.",
>   "   5.2. System navigates to the Payment wizard Detail step.",
>   "   5.3. User removes only the specific allocation(s) that should not be paid.",
>   "   5.4. User completes the remaining update steps and submits the changes.",
>   "   5.5. System processes the update according to the Update Payment workflow.",
>   "6. **Alternate Flow - Issued Payments Present:** If any payment in the schedule has already been issued:",
>   "   6.1. The 'Cancel All Payments' button is hidden and unavailable to prevent bulk cancellation.",
>   "   6.2. User must use alternative processes to handle issued payments individually.",
>   "7. **Post-Cancellation Flow:** After successfully cancelling all payments, if the user needs to create a new payment schedule:",
>   "   7.1. User initiates the Create Payment process.",
>   "   7.2. System presents a blank 'Allocations' section with no pre-populated data from the cancelled schedule."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Scenario 1: Successful Bulk Cancellation**",
>   "1. Given the user is on the Claim or Event Case Overview page with an open Event Case",
>   "   And the Payment Level is set to Case or Claim",
>   "   And all payments in the payment list have 'Pending' status (unissued)",
>   "   And the user has privilege PRIV>CAP>Cancel Payment Schedule",
>   "   When the user clicks 'Select Payments Action' and selects 'Cancel All Payments'",
>   "   Then the system cancels all payments in the payment schedule",
>   "   And the payment list displays as empty with no payment allocations visible.",
>   "**Scenario 2: Button Availability Validation - Issued Payments Block**",
>   "2. Given the user is viewing a payment schedule that contains at least one payment with 'Issued' status",
>   "   When the user clicks 'Select Payments Action'",
>   "   Then the 'Cancel All Payments' button is not displayed or is disabled",
>   "   And the user cannot perform bulk cancellation.",
>   "**Scenario 3: Privilege Enforcement**",
>   "3. Given the user does not have privilege PRIV>CAP>Cancel Payment Schedule",
>   "   When the user accesses the 'Select Payments Action' menu",
>   "   Then the 'Cancel All Payments' option is not available",
>   "   And the system prevents unauthorized bulk cancellation.",
>   "**Scenario 4: Precondition Validation - Event Case Status**",
>   "4. Given the Event Case status is not 'Open' (e.g., Closed or Pending)",
>   "   When the user attempts to access payment actions",
>   "   Then the 'Cancel All Payments' button is not available",
>   "   And the system prevents cancellation of payments on non-open cases.",
>   "**Scenario 5: Selective Payment Removal**",
>   "5. Given the user wants to cancel only specific payments, not all payments",
>   "   When the user selects 'Update Payment' instead of 'Cancel All Payments'",
>   "   Then the system navigates to the Payment wizard Detail step",
>   "   And the user can remove specific allocations while retaining others",
>   "   And the system processes the update according to the Update Payment workflow.",
>   "**Scenario 6: Post-Cancellation Payment Creation**",
>   "6. Given the user has successfully cancelled all payments in a schedule",
>   "   When the user initiates the Create Payment process",
>   "   Then the 'Allocations' section in Step 1 Detail is blank with no pre-populated data",
>   "   And the user can define a completely new payment schedule from scratch.",
>   "**Scenario 7: Payment Level Validation**",
>   "7. Given the Event Case Payment Level is not set to 'Case' or 'Claim'",
>   "   When the user views the payment actions",
>   "   Then the 'Cancel All Payments' functionality is not available",
>   "   And the system enforces payment level restrictions."
> ]

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=648787867"

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to suspend all pending payments with a confirmation dialog, so that I can temporarily halt payment processing while maintaining the ability to resume later.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: suspend or unsuspend all pending payments on a claim or event case with confirmation dialogs
- **Value**: I can temporarily halt or resume payment processing while maintaining full control over payment schedules and ensuring proper workflow management

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** suspend or unsuspend all pending payments on a claim or event case with confirmation dialogs,
> **so that** I can temporarily halt or resume payment processing while maintaining full control over payment schedules and ensuring proper workflow management.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User accesses payment schedule management actions through the Payments & Recoveries section on the Claim or Event Case Overview Page.",
>   "2. User initiates suspension of all pending payments:",
>   "2.1 User selects 'Suspend All Payments' action from the Select Payments Action menu.",
>   "2.2 System displays a confirmation dialog requesting user confirmation to suspend all payments.",
>   "2.3 Upon confirmation, system executes suspension logic and updates payment schedule status to Suspended.",
>   "2.4 If user declines confirmation, system cancels the operation and returns to previous state without changes.",
>   "3. User initiates unsuspension to resume payment processing:",
>   "3.1 User selects 'Unsuspend All Payments' action from the Select Payments Action menu.",
>   "3.2 System displays a confirmation dialog requesting user confirmation to unsuspend all payments.",
>   "3.3 Upon confirmation, system calls the unsuspendPaymentSchedule API and executes backend logic.",
>   "3.4 System updates payment schedule status to Active and enables payment generation processing.",
>   "3.5 System displays updated Pending status in the Payments List.",
>   "3.6 If user declines confirmation, system closes the dialog and discards the process without changes.",
>   "4. System enforces privilege-based access control, ensuring only authorized users can suspend or unsuspend payment schedules.",
>   "5. Payment schedule status changes are reflected across all related payment management interfaces and workflows."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** the Event Case Payment Level is Case or Claim, Event Case status is Open, and user has Suspend Payment Schedule privilege, **when** user clicks 'Suspend All Payments', **then** system displays a confirmation dialog within 2 seconds.",
>   "2. **Given** user is viewing the suspension confirmation dialog, **when** user clicks 'Yes', **then** system updates payment schedule status to Suspended and all pending payments are halted from processing.",
>   "3. **Given** user is viewing the suspension confirmation dialog, **when** user clicks 'No', **then** system closes the dialog without making any changes to the payment schedule status.",
>   "4. **Given** the Event Case Payment Level is Case or Claim, Event Case status is Open, Payment Schedule status is Suspended, and user has Unsuspend Payment Schedule privilege, **when** user clicks 'Unsuspend All Payments', **then** system displays a confirmation dialog within 2 seconds.",
>   "5. **Given** user is viewing the unsuspension confirmation dialog, **when** user clicks 'Yes', **then** system calls unsuspendPaymentSchedule API, updates payment schedule status to Active, and displays Pending status in the Payments List.",
>   "6. **Given** payment schedule status is changed to Active, **when** payment generation process runs, **then** payments are processed according to the Payment Creation and Management Capability logic.",
>   "7. **Given** user is viewing the unsuspension confirmation dialog, **when** user clicks 'No', **then** system closes the dialog and discards the process without changes to payment schedule status.",
>   "8. **Given** user does not have required privileges (Suspend or Unsuspend Payment Schedule), **when** user accesses the Payments & Recoveries section, **then** the respective action buttons are not available or disabled.",
>   "9. **Given** Event Case status is not Open, **when** user attempts to suspend or unsuspend payments, **then** system prevents the action and displays appropriate error message.",
>   "10. **Given** Payment Schedule status is already Active, **when** user attempts to unsuspend payments, **then** system prevents duplicate processing or displays appropriate status message.",
>   "11. **Given** Payment Schedule status is not Suspended, **when** user views the Select Payments Action menu, **then** 'Unsuspend All Payments' option is not available or disabled."
> ]


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=650322996"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to unsuspend all suspended payments and resume payment generation, so that I can reactivate payment processing after a temporary hold.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: unsuspend all suspended payments and resume payment generation
- **Value**: I can reactivate payment processing after a temporary hold

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** unsuspend all suspended payments and resume payment generation,
> **so that** I can reactivate payment processing after a temporary hold.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. Claims Adjuster navigates to the Claim or Event Case Overview Page and locates the 'Payments & Recoveries' section.",
>   "2. Claims Adjuster initiates the unsuspend action by selecting 'Unsuspend All Payments' from the 'Select Payments Action' menu.",
>   "3. System presents a confirmation dialog to verify the user's intent to unsuspend all payments on the claim or event case.",
>   "4. Claims Adjuster confirms the action to proceed with unsuspending all payments.",
>   "4.1. **Alternate Flow**: If Claims Adjuster cancels the confirmation, the system closes the dialog and discards the unsuspend request without making any changes to the payment schedule status.",
>   "5. System executes the unsuspend payment schedule logic via the backend API and updates the payment schedule status from Suspended to Active.",
>   "6. System displays 'Pending' status in the Payments List while processing the unsuspend operation.",
>   "7. Payment generation resumes automatically according to the rules defined in the associated Payment Definition.",
>   "8. Payment schedule status is permanently changed to Active, enabling future payments to be processed normally."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** the Event Case status is Open, the Payment Schedule status is Suspended, the Event Case Payment Level is set to Case or Claim, and the user has 'Unsuspend Payment Schedule' privilege, **When** the Claims Adjuster navigates to the Claim or Event Case Overview Page, **Then** the 'Unsuspend All Payments' action is visible and enabled in the 'Select Payments Action' menu within the 'Payments & Recoveries' section.",
>   "2. **Given** the Claims Adjuster clicks 'Unsuspend All Payments', **When** the system displays the confirmation popup, **Then** the popup clearly asks the user to confirm unsuspending all payments with 'Yes' and 'No' options.",
>   "3. **Given** the confirmation popup is displayed, **When** the Claims Adjuster clicks 'No', **Then** the system closes the popup, discards the unsuspend process, and leaves the payment schedule status unchanged as Suspended.",
>   "4. **Given** the confirmation popup is displayed, **When** the Claims Adjuster clicks 'Yes', **Then** the system calls the unsuspendPaymentSchedule API and initiates the backend unsuspend payment schedule logic.",
>   "5. **Given** the unsuspend process is initiated, **When** the backend processes the request, **Then** the system displays 'Pending' status in the Payments List to indicate processing is in progress.",
>   "6. **Given** the unsuspend process completes successfully, **When** the system updates the payment schedule, **Then** the payment schedule status changes from Suspended to Active.",
>   "7. **Given** the payment schedule status is Active, **When** the system evaluates payment generation triggers, **Then** payments are generated and processed according to the Payment Definition rules associated with the claim or event case.",
>   "8. **Given** the user does not have the 'Unsuspend Payment Schedule' privilege, **When** the user views the Claim or Event Case Overview Page, **Then** the 'Unsuspend All Payments' action is not visible or is disabled.",
>   "9. **Given** the Event Case status is not Open or the Payment Schedule status is not Suspended, **When** the Claims Adjuster attempts to access the 'Unsuspend All Payments' action, **Then** the action is disabled or not available.",
>   "10. **Given** the Event Case Payment Level is not set to Case or Claim, **When** the Claims Adjuster views the Payments & Recoveries section, **Then** the 'Unsuspend All Payments' action is not applicable and is not displayed."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view balance information per payee including total balance, balance activities, and recalculated payments, so that I can understand the financial position for each payee.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view balance information per payee including total balance, balance activities, and recalculated payments
- **Value**: I can understand the financial position for each payee

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view balance information per payee including total balance, balance activities, and recalculated payments,
> **so that** I can understand the financial position for each payee.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User accesses the claim or event case overview page where the Payments & Recoveries Component is displayed.",
>   "2. User creates a payment for the claim or event, which establishes the basis for future balance tracking (initially, balance data remains empty).",
>   "3. User triggers balance recalculation by performing actions that affect financial calculations:",
>   "   3.1. Modifying the Class and Plan of the associated policy.",
>   "   3.2. Updating gross amount calculation-related attributes on the claim.",
>   "   3.3. Changing policy information.",
>   "   3.4. Updating eligibility rule validation-related attributes.",
>   "4. System processes the recalculation trigger through the Common Balance Backend Services and displays updated financial information including:",
>   "   4.1. Total Balance per Payee (shown as the default view).",
>   "   4.2. Related Balance Activities associated with the selected payee.",
>   "   4.3. Recalculated Payments records, filtered according to the system's Recalculated Payments Filter logic.",
>   "5. User selects a different payee from the drop-down menu to view financial data specific to that payee.",
>   "6. System refreshes the display to show the corresponding financial data for the newly selected payee, maintaining the same structure of balance, activities, and recalculated payments."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** the user is on the claim or event case overview page and has the privileges 'PRIV>CAP>Initiate Balance Change Log' and 'PRIV>CAP>Initiate Balance',\n   **When** the user creates a payment,\n   **Then** the balance data and tables are displayed as empty (initial state).",
>   "2. **Given** a payment has been created for a claim or event,\n   **When** the user performs a balance-sensitive action (e.g., changes policy Class and Plan, updates gross amount attributes, modifies policy information, or updates eligibility rule validation attributes),\n   **Then** the system triggers the Common Balance Backend Services (RAF>CAP>Common Balance Backend Services) to recalculate balance information.",
>   "3. **Given** the system has triggered balance recalculation,\n   **When** the recalculation process completes,\n   **Then** the Payments & Recoveries Component displays:\n      - Total Balance per Payee as the default view,\n      - Related Balance Activities for the selected payee,\n      - Recalculated Payments records filtered according to the Recalculated Payments Filter logic.",
>   "4. **Given** multiple payees exist for a claim or event,\n   **When** the user selects a different payee from the drop-down menu,\n   **Then** the system refreshes the display to show the corresponding Total Balance, Balance Activities, and Recalculated Payments for the selected payee.",
>   "5. **Given** the user has no privileges 'PRIV>CAP>Initiate Balance Change Log' or 'PRIV>CAP>Initiate Balance',\n   **When** the user accesses the case overview page,\n   **Then** the balance information and related controls are not accessible or visible.",
>   "6. **Given** no recalculation triggers have been executed,\n   **When** the user reviews the case overview page after payment creation,\n   **Then** the balance data and tables remain empty until a balance-sensitive field is modified.",
>   "7. **Given** the user is viewing balance information for a specific payee,\n   **When** the system displays Recalculated Payments records,\n   **Then** only records that meet the Recalculated Payments Filter logic criteria are shown."
> ]


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=570103572"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view a chronological list of balance activities showing transaction type, amount, and running total balance, so that I can audit all actions affecting the case balance.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view a chronological list of balance activities showing transaction type, amount, and running total balance
- **Value**: I can audit all actions affecting the case balance

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view a chronological list of balance activities showing transaction type, amount, and running total balance,
> **so that** I can audit all actions affecting the case balance.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User navigates to the Payments & Recoveries section on the Claim Overview page to access the Balance Activities table.
> 2. User initiates balance-related actions such as Add External Overpayment, Pay Underpayment, Waive Overpayment, or other balance activities.
>    2.1 When user performs Add External Overpayment action, system records the transaction upon successful save.
>    2.2 When user performs Waive Overpayment action, system records the transaction upon successful save.
>    2.3 When user performs Pay Underpayment action, system records the transaction upon successful save.
> 3. System automatically records each completed balance action by inserting a new record in the Balance Activities table.
> 4. System displays all balance activity records in chronological order, showing Date, Transaction ID, Transaction Type, Transaction Amount, and Total Balance for each entry.
> 5. User reviews the comprehensive audit trail to track all financial activities and verify balance accuracy throughout the claim lifecycle.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a user is on the Claim Overview page, **when** they navigate to the Payments & Recoveries section, **then** the Balance Activities table is displayed with all recorded transactions.
> 2. **Given** a balance-related action (Add External Overpayment, Waive Overpayment, Pay Underpayment) is performed, **when** the user saves the action successfully, **then** the system automatically inserts a new record in the Balance Activities table.
> 3. **Given** a new balance activity record is created, **when** displayed in the table, **then** it must include all five required data elements: Date, Transaction ID, Transaction Type, Transaction Amount, and Total Balance.
> 4. **Given** multiple balance activities have been performed, **when** viewing the Balance Activities table, **then** all records are displayed in chronological order by date.
> 5. **Given** a balance activity is recorded, **when** displayed, **then** the Transaction ID is unique and distinguishable from other transactions.
> 6. **Given** a balance transaction is completed, **when** the record is displayed, **then** the Total Balance reflects the updated balance after the transaction is applied.
> 7. **Given** no balance activities have been performed on a claim, **when** viewing the Payments & Recoveries section, **then** the Balance Activities table is empty or displays an appropriate message.
> 8. **Given** a user attempts to perform a balance action, **when** the save operation fails, **then** no record is inserted into the Balance Activities table.

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=598912996"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to waive partial or full overpayment amounts and see the impact reflected in balance activities, so that I can manage overpayment resolution efficiently.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: waive partial or full overpayment amounts and see the impact reflected in balance activities
- **Value**: I can manage overpayment resolution efficiently

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** waive partial or full overpayment amounts and see the impact reflected in balance activities,
> **so that** I can manage overpayment resolution efficiently.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User accesses the Balance Management Claim overview page to view overpayment balances on a Case or Claim.",
>   "2. User initiates waive overpayment action to write off overpayment balances:",
>   "   2.1. User can waive the full overpayment amount to completely eliminate the balance.",
>   "   2.2. User can waive a partial overpayment amount, reducing the balance by the specified value.",
>   "3. System processes the waive action and reflects the adjustment in the balance activities, updating the overpayment balance accordingly.",
>   "4. User can reverse a previously executed waive action:",
>   "   4.1. User identifies a waived overpayment that needs to be reinstated.",
>   "   4.2. User initiates Cancel Waive Overpayment action from the Balance Management Claim overview page.",
>   "   4.3. System reverses the waive action and restores the overpayment balance to its original state prior to waiving.",
>   "5. System maintains complete audit history of all waive and cancel waive actions for compliance and tracking purposes."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** a Claim has an overpayment balance, **when** the user accesses the Balance Management Claim overview page, **then** the current overpayment amount is displayed with the option to waive overpayment.",
>   "2. **Given** the user selects Waive Overpayment action, **when** the user enters a partial amount less than the total overpayment, **then** the system successfully processes the waive and reduces the overpayment balance by the specified amount.",
>   "3. **Given** the user selects Waive Overpayment action, **when** the user waives the full overpayment amount, **then** the system eliminates the entire overpayment balance and reflects a zero balance.",
>   "4. **Given** an overpayment has been waived, **when** the waive action is completed, **then** the balance activities section is updated immediately to reflect the waive transaction with timestamp and user identification.",
>   "5. **Given** an overpayment has been previously waived, **when** the user selects Cancel Waive Overpayment action, **then** the system reverses the waive and restores the original overpayment balance amount.",
>   "6. **Given** multiple partial waives have been applied to an overpayment, **when** the user cancels a specific waive action, **then** only that specific waive transaction is reversed without affecting other waive actions.",
>   "7. **Given** the user attempts to waive an amount, **when** the specified amount exceeds the current overpayment balance, **then** the system prevents the action and displays an appropriate error message.",
>   "8. **Given** the user attempts to cancel a waive overpayment, **when** no waive action exists for the selected balance, **then** the system prevents the action and displays an appropriate message.",
>   "9. **Given** any waive or cancel waive action is performed, **when** the transaction is completed, **then** the system creates an audit log entry capturing the action type, amount, user, timestamp, and case/claim identifier.",
>   "10. **Given** the overpayment balance is displayed, **when** the balance has been partially or fully waived, **then** the system clearly indicates the waived amount and remaining balance separately in the balance activities."
> ]


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=823331557"

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to reduce future payments by withholding overpayment amounts, so that I can offset overpayments against upcoming payments.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: reduce future payments by withholding overpayment amounts
- **Value**: I can offset overpayments against upcoming payments

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** reduce future payments by withholding overpayment amounts,
> **so that** I can offset overpayments against upcoming payments.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. Claims Adjuster accesses the Reduce Payment function through the Balance Action workflow on the Claim Balance Management overview page for a specific case or claim.",
>   "2. Claims Adjuster reviews the current overpayment balance available for withholding.",
>   "3. Claims Adjuster specifies the withholding amount to be applied:",
>   "   3.1. Full withholding - the entire overpayment balance is withheld.",
>   "   3.2. Partial withholding - a specified portion of the overpayment balance is withheld.",
>   "4. System processes the withholding request and updates the overpayment balance to reflect the reduced amount available.",
>   "5. System records the withholding transaction and ensures the withheld amount is excluded from all future payment calculations for the case or claim.",
>   "6. Claims Adjuster can view and audit all payment withholdings through the Payment Withholdings List on the Payments & Recoveries page.",
>   "7. System maintains a complete audit trail of all withholding actions including amounts, dates, and user information."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** a claim has an overpayment balance of $5,000, **when** the Claims Adjuster initiates the Reduce Payment function, **then** the system displays the current overpayment balance and allows specification of withholding amount.",
>   "2. **Given** the Claims Adjuster specifies a partial withholding amount of $2,000, **when** the withholding is processed, **then** the overpayment balance is reduced to $3,000 and the withheld $2,000 is recorded.",
>   "3. **Given** the Claims Adjuster specifies a full withholding amount, **when** the withholding is processed, **then** the entire overpayment balance is withheld and the balance is reduced to $0.",
>   "4. **Given** a withholding has been successfully applied, **when** future payments are calculated for the claim, **then** the withheld amount is excluded from payment calculations.",
>   "5. **Given** one or more withholdings have been applied to a claim, **when** the Claims Adjuster navigates to the Payments & Recoveries page, **then** all withholdings are visible in the Payment Withholdings List with complete details.",
>   "6. **Given** a claim has no overpayment balance, **when** the Claims Adjuster attempts to access the Reduce Payment function, **then** the system prevents the action or displays an appropriate message indicating no balance is available.",
>   "7. **Given** the Claims Adjuster specifies a withholding amount greater than the available overpayment balance, **when** attempting to process the withholding, **then** the system prevents the transaction and displays a validation error.",
>   "8. **Given** a withholding transaction is completed, **when** reviewing the claim financial records, **then** the withholding is recorded with timestamp, user identifier, original balance, withheld amount, and remaining balance."

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view and manage EOB remarks on payment allocations, so that I can provide clear explanations to claimants about their payment details and claim decisions.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view and manage EOB (Explanation of Benefits) remarks on payment allocations
- **Value**: I can provide clear explanations to claimants about their payment details and claim decisions

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view and manage EOB (Explanation of Benefits) remarks on payment allocations,
> **so that** I can provide clear explanations to claimants about their payment details and claim decisions.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. The system automatically generates EOB remarks on each allocation when payment is created during claim processing.",
>   "2. Automated EOB remarks are generated by OpenL rules that evaluate claim processing scenarios including:",
>   "  2.1 Age reduction applications with dynamic percentage calculations",
>   "  2.2 Face value overrides on claims",
>   "  2.3 Wellness coverage auto-generated payments via payment automation",
>   "  2.4 Other line-of-business-specific scenarios (Life, DI, etc.)",
>   "3. Claims adjusters can manually add pre-defined EOB remarks during the payment process when automated remarks are insufficient or specific clarification is needed.",
>   "4. Manual EOB remarks are pre-configured in the system and available for selection based on specific scenarios, including:",
>   "  4.1 Payments made to guardians (on behalf of beneficiaries)",
>   "  4.2 Gross allowable benefit adjustments per contract terms",
>   "  4.3 Claim amount adjustments relative to policy information (Gross/Weekly/Monthly overrides)",
>   "5. When none of the pre-defined remarks apply to the situation, claims adjusters can select the 'OTHER' remark code (EOB003) and enter custom text manually.",
>   "6. The system provides reference information (LOB and Type fields) for EOB remarks without storing these fields in the backend.",
>   "7. All EOB remarks (automated and manual) are attached to allocations to provide complete transparency about fees paid, denial reasons, and payment detail generation."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Scenario 1: Automated EOB Remark Generation**",
>   "1. Given a claim is being processed with an age reduction applied,",
>   "   When the payment is created,",
>   "   Then the system automatically generates an EOB remark (AutoEOB003) with the dynamic percentage value explaining the age reduction.",
>   "2. Given a claim has a face value override,",
>   "   When the payment allocation is created,",
>   "   Then the system automatically attaches an EOB remark (AutoEOB004) indicating the face value has been overridden.",
>   "3. Given a wellness coverage payment is auto-created via payment automation,",
>   "   When the allocation is generated,",
>   "   Then the system automatically adds an EOB remark (AutoEOB005) explaining the auto-generated payment determination.",
>   "**Scenario 2: Manual EOB Remark Addition**",
>   "4. Given a claims adjuster is processing a payment during the payment creation process,",
>   "   When the adjuster selects a manual EOB remark from the pre-defined list (e.g., EOB001 for guardian payments),",
>   "   Then the selected remark is attached to the allocation with the corresponding message.",
>   "5. Given the payee is a guardian and 'On behalf of' is selected,",
>   "   When the adjuster adds manual remark EOB001,",
>   "   Then the allocation displays 'Payment is made to the guardian' as the EOB explanation.",
>   "6. Given a claim salary amount has been adjusted (DI claim),",
>   "   When the adjuster adds manual remark EOB002,",
>   "   Then the allocation shows 'Your gross allowable benefit has been adjusted per your contract.'",
>   "**Scenario 3: Custom EOB Remark Entry**",
>   "7. Given none of the pre-defined EOB remarks adequately explain the payment decision,",
>   "   When the adjuster selects the 'OTHER' remark code (EOB003),",
>   "   Then the system allows the adjuster to enter custom text manually to provide situation-specific explanations.",
>   "8. Given custom text is entered for the 'OTHER' remark code,",
>   "   When the payment allocation is saved,",
>   "   Then the custom EOB text is attached to the allocation and visible to the claimant.",
>   "**Scenario 4: EOB Remark Viewing**",
>   "9. Given an allocation has EOB remarks (automated or manual),",
>   "   When the claims adjuster views the payment allocation details,",
>   "   Then all associated EOB remarks are displayed with their corresponding messages.",
>   "10. Given multiple EOB remarks exist on a single allocation,",
>   "    When the adjuster or claimant reviews the payment,",
>   "    Then all applicable remarks are visible to provide complete transparency.",
>   "**Scenario 5: Reference Data Handling**",
>   "11. Given LOB and Type fields are displayed for EOB remarks,",
>   "    When the system stores the EOB remark,",
>   "    Then these reference fields are not persisted in the backend (reference only).",
>   "**Negative Scenario: Invalid Custom Text**",
>   "12. Given the 'OTHER' remark code is selected,",
>   "    When the adjuster attempts to save without entering custom text,",
>   "    Then the system displays a validation error requiring text entry before proceeding."
> ]


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=755902666"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to automatically generate EOB remarks based on claim adjudication rules, so that payment explanations are consistently applied without manual intervention.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: automatically generate EOB remarks based on claim adjudication rules and manually select pre-defined remarks when needed during payment processing
- **Value**: payment explanations are consistently applied without manual intervention, while maintaining flexibility for specific scenarios requiring custom explanations

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** automatically generate EOB remarks based on claim adjudication rules and manually select pre-defined remarks when needed during payment processing,
> **so that** payment explanations are consistently applied without manual intervention, while maintaining flexibility for specific scenarios requiring custom explanations.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. System automatically generates EOB remarks on each allocation when a payment is created through OpenL rules during claim processing workflow.",
>   "2. For automated EOB remark generation scenarios:",
>   "   2.1. When Age Reduction is applied during Life LOB claim adjudication, system generates remark with dynamic percentage value explaining the reduction.",
>   "   2.2. When Face Value is overridden during Life LOB claim processing, system generates remark indicating the override has occurred.",
>   "   2.3. When payment is auto-created for Wellness coverage via payment automation in Life LOB, system generates remark explaining the wellness payment determination.",
>   "3. For manual EOB remark selection scenarios:",
>   "   3.1. Claims Adjuster can select 'Guardian Payment' remark when payee is a guardian and 'On behalf of' option is selected in Life LOB claims.",
>   "   3.2. Claims Adjuster can select 'Contract Adjustment' remark when claim salary amount is adjusted in DI LOB claims.",
>   "   3.3. Claims Adjuster can select 'Policy Information Adjustment' remark when Gross/Weekly/Monthly amount is overridden for any coverage across all LOBs.",
>   "   3.4. Claims Adjuster can select 'Custom Remark' option to manually input specific explanations not covered by pre-defined remarks.",
>   "4. Each EOB remark contains standardized components including LOB classification, unique code identifier, explanatory message text, and trigger rule or usage context.",
>   "5. System supports dynamic parameter insertion in automated EOB messages to provide specific details such as percentage values or amounts.",
>   "6. Generated EOB remarks are displayed to explain system-generated adjustments and provide transparency on claim processing decisions."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Automated EOB Remark Generation:**",
>   "1. Given a Life LOB claim with Age Reduction applied, When payment is created through claim processing, Then EOB remark 'AutoEOB003' is automatically generated with the exact percentage reduction value populated dynamically in the message.",
>   "2. Given a Life LOB claim where Face Value has been overridden, When payment allocation is created, Then EOB remark 'AutoEOB004' is automatically generated indicating the override.",
>   "3. Given a Life LOB claim with Wellness coverage payment automation triggered, When automated payment is created, Then EOB remark 'AutoEOB005' is automatically generated explaining the wellness payment determination.",
>   "4. Given any payment creation scenario not meeting automated remark conditions, When payment is processed, Then no automated EOB remark is generated for that specific condition.",
>   "**Manual EOB Remark Selection:**",
>   "5. Given a Life LOB claim payment with guardian as payee, When Claims Adjuster selects 'On behalf of' option, Then 'EOB001' remark option is available for selection with message 'Payment is made to the guardian'.",
>   "6. Given a DI LOB claim with salary amount adjustment, When Claims Adjuster processes payment, Then 'EOB002' remark option is available for selection with message about contract adjustment.",
>   "7. Given any LOB claim with Gross/Weekly/Monthly amount override, When Claims Adjuster processes payment, Then 'EOB003' remark option is available for selection with policy information adjustment message.",
>   "8. Given any claim payment scenario requiring custom explanation, When Claims Adjuster selects 'OTHER' code option, Then system allows manual input of custom remark text.",
>   "**Data Integrity and Business Rules:**",
>   "9. Given any payment allocation created during claim processing, When EOB remark is generated or selected, Then remark must be associated with that specific allocation.",
>   "10. Given automated EOB remark generation, When dynamic parameters are required (e.g., percentage), Then system populates actual values from claim data into the message template.",
>   "11. Given EOB remark metadata (LOB and Type), When remark is stored, Then LOB and Type are used for reference purposes only and are not persisted in the backend system.",
>   "12. Given multiple payments with different allocations on single claim, When payments are processed, Then each allocation can have its own distinct EOB remark based on applicable rules.",
>   "**Negative Scenarios:**",
>   "13. Given a claim payment without any applicable automated rule conditions, When payment is created, Then no automated EOB remarks are generated inappropriately.",
>   "14. Given a manual remark selection without required context (e.g., guardian payment without 'On behalf of'), When Claims Adjuster attempts to apply remark, Then system prevents inappropriate remark application or provides warning."
> ]


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=755902666"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to add pre-defined manual EOB remarks during the payment process, so that I can document specific claim circumstances and adjustments.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: add pre-defined manual EOB remarks during the payment process
- **Value**: I can document specific claim circumstances and adjustments that require additional context beyond automated system-generated explanations

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** add pre-defined manual EOB remarks during the payment process,
> **so that** I can document specific claim circumstances and adjustments that require additional context beyond automated system-generated explanations.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. During the payment creation process, the system automatically generates EOB remarks on each allocation based on OpenL rules that evaluate claim processing details.",
>   "2. When automated remarks do not cover specific claim circumstances, the Claims Adjuster can select from pre-defined manual EOB remark options to provide additional context.",
>   "3. The system provides four types of manual EOB remarks for selection:",
>   "   3.1. **EOB001**: Documents payment to guardian when 'On behalf of' payment arrangement is selected (applicable across lines of business).",
>   "   3.2. **EOB002**: Explains contract-based benefit adjustment for Disability Insurance claims when salary amount has been manually adjusted.",
>   "   3.3. **EOB003**: Documents policy-based claim amount adjustment when Gross/Weekly/Monthly benefit amounts are overridden for specific coverage.",
>   "   3.4. **OTHER**: Allows entry of custom user-defined text to document unique situations not covered by standard remark categories.",
>   "4. The system supports both manual and automated EOB remark types within the same payment allocation, with automated remarks triggered by specific business scenarios:",
>   "   4.1. Age reduction application (Life LOB) generates AutoEOB003 with dynamic percentage calculation.",
>   "   4.2. Face Value override (Life LOB) generates AutoEOB004.",
>   "   4.3. Wellness coverage auto-payment creation (Life LOB) generates AutoEOB005.",
>   "5. Selected manual remarks are associated with the specific payment allocation and persist as part of the claim's payment documentation."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Scenario 1: Manual EOB Remark Selection Access**",
>   "1. Given a Claims Adjuster is creating a payment with allocations",
>   "   When the payment creation screen is displayed",
>   "   Then the system shall provide an option to add manual EOB remarks to each allocation",
>   "   And the system shall display all applicable pre-defined remark options (EOB001, EOB002, EOB003, OTHER) based on the line of business.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 2: Guardian Payment Documentation (EOB001)**",
>   "2. Given a Claims Adjuster has selected 'On behalf of' payment arrangement for an allocation",
>   "   When the adjuster selects EOB001 manual remark",
>   "   Then the system shall associate the guardian payment explanation with that allocation",
>   "   And the remark shall be visible in the payment details and explanation of benefits output.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 3: Disability Insurance Salary Adjustment Documentation (EOB002)**",
>   "3. Given a Claims Adjuster is processing a Disability Insurance claim",
>   "   And the salary amount has been manually adjusted from the original contract value",
>   "   When the adjuster selects EOB002 manual remark during payment creation",
>   "   Then the system shall document the contract-based benefit adjustment on the allocation",
>   "   And the remark shall explain the deviation from standard contract terms.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 4: Coverage Amount Override Documentation (EOB003)**",
>   "4. Given a Claims Adjuster has overridden Gross, Weekly, or Monthly benefit amounts for a coverage",
>   "   When the adjuster selects EOB003 manual remark during payment creation",
>   "   Then the system shall document the policy-based claim amount adjustment",
>   "   And the remark shall be associated with the specific coverage allocation.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 5: Custom Remark Entry (OTHER)**",
>   "5. Given a Claims Adjuster encounters a unique claim circumstance not covered by standard remark categories",
>   "   When the adjuster selects 'OTHER' remark type and enters custom text",
>   "   Then the system shall accept and store the user-defined remark text (minimum 10 characters, maximum 500 characters)",
>   "   And the custom remark shall be displayed in the EOB output with clear attribution.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 6: Coexistence with Automated Remarks**",
>   "6. Given a payment allocation has automated EOB remarks generated by OpenL rules (AutoEOB003, AutoEOB004, or AutoEOB005)",
>   "   When a Claims Adjuster adds a manual EOB remark to the same allocation",
>   "   Then the system shall preserve both automated and manual remarks",
>   "   And both remark types shall be displayed in the EOB output without overwriting each other.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 7: Line of Business Validation**",
>   "7. Given a Claims Adjuster is processing a Life line of business claim",
>   "   When selecting manual EOB remarks during payment creation",
>   "   Then the system shall display EOB001, EOB003, and OTHER options",
>   "   And EOB002 (DI-specific) shall not be available for selection.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 8: Missing Context Documentation Prevention**",
>   "8. Given a Claims Adjuster has selected 'OTHER' remark type",
>   "   When the adjuster attempts to save without entering custom text",
>   "   Then the system shall prevent saving and display an inline error message",
>   "   And require text entry before allowing payment creation to proceed.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 9: Remark Persistence and Audit Trail**",
>   "9. Given a Claims Adjuster has added manual EOB remarks during payment creation",

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to post and cancel recoveries on a Pet claim with automatic balance recalculation, so that recovery transactions are accurately tracked and claim balances remain current.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: post and cancel recoveries on a Pet claim with automatic balance recalculation
- **Value**: recovery transactions are accurately tracked and claim balances remain current

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** post and cancel recoveries on a Pet claim with automatic balance recalculation,
> **so that** recovery transactions are accurately tracked and claim balances remain current.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. Adjuster accesses an open Pet insurance claim and navigates to the Financials tab to view the Recoveries sub-tab.",
>   "2. **Post Recovery Flow:**",
>   "   2.1. Adjuster initiates posting a new recovery transaction by entering required recovery details (amount, reason, etc.).",
>   "   2.2. System generates a recovery item with status 'Issued' and closes the data entry interface.",
>   "   2.3. System automatically triggers Pet Loss Balance calculation engine.",
>   "   2.4. System generates and logs balance change transactions for audit trail.",
>   "   2.5. System displays updated recovery activities in the Balance Activities list.",
>   "   2.6. System automatically adjusts the plan accumulator by reversing the Used Amount back to the Remaining Amount.",
>   "3. **Cancel Recovery Flow:**",
>   "   3.1. Adjuster selects an existing recovery transaction and initiates cancellation.",
>   "   3.2. System prompts for cancellation confirmation.",
>   "   3.3. Upon confirmation, system changes the recovery item status to 'Canceled'.",
>   "   3.4. System automatically triggers Pet Loss Balance recalculation (same engine as posting).",
>   "   3.5. System adjusts the accumulator by transferring the canceled recovery amount (allocationType = ADJUSTMENT) from Remaining Amount back to Used Amount.",
>   "   3.6. System displays updated balance activities reflecting the cancellation.",
>   "4. **Alternate Flow - Cancel During Data Entry:**",
>   "   4.1. If adjuster cancels while entering recovery data, system prompts for confirmation.",
>   "   4.2. Upon confirmation, system discards all entered data and closes the interface without saving or triggering any calculations."
