#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view and manage the complete list of payments and allocations for a claim, so that I can track payment status and perform payment-related actions.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view and manage the complete list of payments and allocations for a claim
- **Value**: I can track payment status and perform payment-related actions

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view and manage the complete list of payments and allocations for a claim,
> **so that** I can track payment status and perform payment-related actions.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System displays all payment allocations in the Case Overview - Payment List, grouped by post date, transaction type, claims, payee, and payment amount.
> 2. User can sort payment records by post date, payee name, or payment amount with cross-page sorting support (5 records per page).
> 3. System presents comprehensive allocation breakdowns based on product line:
>    3.1. For Absence products: GBA, AGBA, offsets, deductions, taxes, rehab, and COLA allocations.
>    3.2. For Life/CI/HI products: indemnity, deductions, interest, indebtedness, and restored death benefit allocations.
> 4. Each payment record displays status (Pending Approval, Issued, Suspended, Failed, etc.), payment method (EFT with masked account numbers showing last 4 digits, or Check), date ranges (benefit periods, deduction periods, tax periods), and currency in locale-specific format.
> 5. User can activate payment schedules by performing Authority Approval action when schedule status is 'Open', transitioning schedule to Active status after authorization validation.
> 6. User can generate actual payments from scheduled payments when post dates are reached, transitioning them into the payment lifecycle.
> 7. User can modify existing payment schedules using Update Payment action before full processing or issuance.
> 8. User can suspend all payments in an Active schedule, transitioning it to Suspended state, or unsuspend to return to Active state.
> 9. User can cancel entire payment schedules when no issued payments exist using Cancel All Payments action.
> 10. User can request issuance for approved regular payments (excluding ATP claims) via Request Issue action, initiating payment processing through Payment Hub integration.
> 11. User can stop issued payments using Request Stop action to prevent payment delivery or cashing.
> 12. User can fail or void issued payments using Decline/Void Payment action with mandatory reason tracking.
> 13. User can approve or disapprove pending underpayment records:
>     13.1. Approve Payment action transitions underpayments through the underpayment lifecycle.
>     13.2. Disapprove Payment action cancels underpayments with mandatory reason tracking and displays cancellation message.
> 14. System consolidates split allocations across calendar/benefit years into single payment records for simplified viewing.
> 15. User can access detailed payment information and initiate new payment creation by navigating to the payment creation wizard via links to Step 1 Detail page.
> 16. System provides real-time notifications upon completion of all payment-related actions.
> 17. System displays EOB remarks as hyperlinks that open floating windows with alphabetically sorted detailed remark information.
> 18. System displays negative payment values (overpayments, recoveries) in red with parentheses format to distinguish debits from credits.
> 19. System tags ASO claim payments with detailed ASO type indicators for specialized processing requirements.
> 20. System displays failure reasons via information icon tooltips for failed payments to support investigation and corrective action.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim with multiple payment records across different product lines, **when** the Claims Adjuster views the Payment Allocations List, **then** all payments are displayed grouped by post date, transaction type, claims, payee, and payment amount with pagination of 5 records per page.
> 2. **Given** payment records are displayed, **when** the user sorts by post date, payee name, or payment amount, **then** sorting is applied across all pages, not just the current page.
> 3. **Given** an Absence product payment, **when** displayed in the list, **then** allocation breakdown includes GBA, AGBA, offsets, deductions, taxes, rehab, and COLA components.
> 4. **Given** a Life/CI/HI product payment, **when** displayed in the list, **then** allocation breakdown includes indemnity, deductions, interest, indebtedness, and restored death benefit components.
> 5. **Given** a payment schedule with status 'Open', **when** the user performs Authority Approval action and passes authorization validation, **then** the schedule transitions to 'Active' status and enables subsequent payment generation.
> 6. **Given** an Active payment schedule with post date reached, **when** the user performs Generate Payment action, **then** scheduled payments are posted to actual payment records and enter the payment lifecycle.
> 7. **Given** an approved payment (non-ATP claim), **when** the user performs Request Issue action, **then** the payment transitions to 'Issue Requested' status and initiates Payment Hub integration for issuance.
> 8. **Given** a payment for an ATP claim, **when** viewing available actions, **then** the Request Issue action is disabled.
> 9. **Given** a payment schedule with issued payments, **when** viewing available actions, **then** the Cancel All Payments action is hidden.
> 10. **Given** an Active payment schedule, **when** the user performs Suspend All Payments action, **then** the schedule transitions to 'Suspended' status and prevents payment generation.
> 11. **Given** a Suspended payment schedule, **when** the user performs Unsuspend All Payments action, **then** the schedule returns to 'Active' status.
> 12. **Given** an issued payment, **when** the user performs Decline/Void Payment action with mandatory reason, **then** the payment transitions to 'Failed' status and the reason is stored and displayed via information icon tooltip.
> 13. **Given** a pending underpayment record, **when** the user performs Approve Payment action, **then** the underpayment transitions through the underpayment lifecycle to approved state.
> 14. **Given** a pending underpayment record, **when** the user performs Disapprove Payment action with mandatory reason, **then** the underpayment is cancelled and a cancellation message is displayed.
> 15. **Given** a payment split across multiple calendar/benefit years, **when** displayed in the list, **then** only one consolidated payment record appears aggregating all split allocations.
> 16. **Given** a payment with EFT method, **when** displayed, **then** the account number is masked showing only the last 4 digits.
> 17. **Given** a payment record, **when** displayed, **then** date ranges (benefit periods, deduction periods, tax periods) use locale-specific format (MM/DD/YYYY for US, DD/MM/YYYY for UK).
> 18. **Given** a payment record, **when** displayed, **then** currency uses locale-specific formatting ($ for US,  for UK).
> 19. **Given** a payment with EOB remarks, **when** the user clicks the EOB Remarks hyperlink, **then** a floating window opens displaying detailed remarks sorted alphabetically.
> 20. **Given** a payment with negative value (overpayment/recovery), **when** displayed, **then** the value appears in red with parentheses format (e.g., ($123.45)).
> 21. **Given** a failed payment, **when** displayed, **then** the status shows 'Failed' with an information icon that displays the failure reason in a tooltip upon hover or click.
> 22. **Given** an ASO claim payment, **when** displayed, **then** the record includes a detailed ASO type indicator tag.
> 23. **Given** any payment action is performed, **when** the action completes, **then** the system displays a real-time notification confirming action completion.
> 24. **Given** the user is viewing the Payment Allocations List from Case context, **when** checking feature availability, **then** the feature is hidden and disabled (Claim-specific functionality only).
> 25. **Given** a payment record in the list, **when** the user clicks the navigation link, **then** the system opens the payment creation wizard at Step 1 Detail page with full payment details.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to navigate between payment creation steps (Detail and Allocations) with validation checkpoints, so that I can systematically build and review payment schedules before confirmation.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: navigate between payment creation steps (Detail and Allocations) with validation checkpoints
- **Value**: I can systematically build and review payment schedules before confirmation

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** navigate between payment creation steps (Detail and Allocations) with validation checkpoints,
> **so that** I can systematically build and review payment schedules before confirmation.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User initiates payment workflow in one of two modes: Create mode (new payment) or Update mode (modify existing payment from Payments List).",
>   "2. User proceeds through a two-step sequential process with visual progress indicators:",
>   "2.1. Step 1 (Detail): User enters or modifies core payment information including payment method and other required details.",
>   "2.2. Step 2 (Allocations): User configures payment allocations across payees and reviews calculated payment schedules.",
>   "3. User navigates between steps using step navigation icons with conditional access:",
>   "3.1. Forward navigation requires completing current step through prescribed action buttons (Calculate for Step 1).",
>   "3.2. Backward navigation is permitted only to previously visited steps when no unsaved changes exist.",
>   "3.3. Navigation attempts with unsaved changes are blocked until user saves or cancels modifications.",
>   "4. User validates and calculates payment schedules in Step 2:",
>   "4.1. User clicks Calculate button to validate payment method, generate payment schedule preview via API, save all allocations, and navigate to Step 2.",
>   "4.2. If all payee allocations are deleted, Calculate button becomes unavailable until at least one allocation is added.",
>   "4.3. If payment method validation fails, system displays error and user must correct before proceeding.",
>   "5. In Create mode, user completes payment creation:",
>   "5.1. After calculation, user reviews allocations and clicks Create button to finalize payment.",
>   "5.2. If user modifies input fields after calculation, Create button becomes disabled and user must click Recalculate before proceeding.",
>   "5.3. Upon successful creation, system creates payment schedule and navigates to Case Overview page.",
>   "6. In Update mode, user completes payment modification:",
>   "6.1. User modifies payment details or allocations as needed.",
>   "6.2. User clicks Calculate/Recalculate to preview changes with validation.",
>   "6.3. User clicks Update button (always visible) to finalize modifications, triggering payment method validation and update service.",
>   "7. User can exit the workflow at any step:",
>   "7.1. User clicks Cancel button or Close Icon (X) to initiate exit process.",
>   "7.2. System displays confirmation modal asking 'Are you sure you want to close this form?' with Yes/No options.",
>   "7.3. If Yes is selected, form closes without saving changes; if No is selected, user returns to current step.",
>   "8. If API calls fail during calculation, creation, or update operations, system displays error message and user remains on current step to retry or cancel."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster opens the payment wizard in Create mode, **When** the wizard initializes, **Then** the drawer displays title 'Create a Payment' with Step 1 (Detail) active and Step 2 (Allocations) in unvisited state.",
>   "2. **Given** a Claims Adjuster opens the payment wizard from Payments List, **When** the wizard initializes, **Then** the drawer displays title 'Update Payment' with existing payment data pre-populated.",
>   "3. **Given** a user is on Step 1 (Detail) with all required fields completed, **When** the user clicks the Calculate button with valid payment method, **Then** the system calls POST /cap-adjuster/v1/financial/payment-schedule/preview API, saves all payment allocations including 'On behalf of' scenarios, and navigates to Step 2 (Allocations) within 3 seconds.",
>   "4. **Given** a user is on Step 1 (Detail), **When** the user clicks the Calculate button with invalid or missing payment method, **Then** the system displays inline validation error message and blocks navigation to Step 2.",
>   "5. **Given** a user has visited Step 2 and returned to Step 1 without unsaved changes, **When** the user clicks the Step 2 navigation icon, **Then** the system immediately navigates to Step 2 without requiring recalculation.",
>   "6. **Given** a user has modified fields on any step, **When** the user attempts to navigate to another step via step navigation icons, **Then** the system blocks navigation and requires user to save or cancel before proceeding.",
>   "7. **Given** a user is on Step 2 in Create mode after successful calculation, **When** the user modifies any input fields, **Then** the Create button becomes disabled and the Recalculate button becomes active.",
>   "8. **Given** a user is on Step 2 in Create mode with no field modifications since last calculation, **When** the user clicks the Create button, **Then** the system calls startBuildPaymentScheduleFlow REST service, creates the payment, and navigates to Case Overview page within 5 seconds.",
>   "9. **Given** a user is on Step 2 in Update mode, **When** the user clicks the Update button regardless of allocation presence, **Then** the system validates payment method and calls updatePaymentSchedule REST service to persist changes.",
>   "10. **Given** a user has deleted all payee allocations in Step 2, **When** viewing the allocations section, **Then** the Calculate button is hidden and becomes visible only after at least one allocation is added.",
>   "11. **Given** a user is at any step in the wizard, **When** the user clicks Cancel button or Close Icon (X), **Then** the system displays confirmation modal with message 'Are you sure you want to close this form?' with Yes/No options.",
>   "12. **Given** the confirmation modal is displayed, **When** the user selects Yes, **Then** the form closes immediately without saving any changes.",
>   "13. **Given** the confirmation modal is displayed, **When** the user selects No, **Then** the modal closes and user returns to the current step to continue editing.",
>   "14. **Given** a user clicks Calculate, Create, or Update button, **When** the corresponding API call fails, **Then** the system displays an error message, user remains on the current step, and user can retry the operation or cancel.",
>   "15. **Given** payment allocations include 'On behalf of' scenarios, **When** the system saves payment data, **Then** all allocations are persisted in the backend regardless of UI filtering applied for display purposes.",
>   "16. **Given** the wizard interface is rendered, **When** evaluating UI components, **Then** all visual elements conform to EIS Design System (DSM) library standards including drawer interface, progress indicators, and action buttons."

### Epic: Payment Distribution, Allocation & Settlement

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to create and manage recovery payments for claims, so that I can process funds returned to the carrier from overpayments or third parties.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: create and post recovery payments for claims by specifying payee, recovery amount, payment method, and allocation details
- **Value**: funds returned to the carrier from overpayments or third parties are accurately recorded and allocated to the appropriate claims and coverages

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** create and post recovery payments for claims by specifying payee, recovery amount, payment method, and allocation details,
> **so that** funds returned to the carrier from overpayments or third parties are accurately recorded and allocated to the appropriate claims and coverages.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates recovery payment creation from the Claim Overview page by accessing the Post Recovery section.
> 2. User specifies the mandatory payee by selecting from available claim parties and beneficiaries presented in alphabetical order.
> 3. User enters the mandatory total recovery amount to be posted.
> 4. User provides optional recovery details including recovery date, payment method (Check/EFT or Cheque for UK), and reference number (check/cheque number or bank account number).
> 5. User distributes the recovery amount across relevant claims and coverages through the allocations section, with ability to add or remove allocation entries as needed.
> 6. User submits the recovery payment for posting.
>    6.1 If user attempts to abandon the form before completion, system prompts for confirmation before discarding unsaved data.
> 7. System validates mandatory fields, creates the recovery payment record, automatically sets the recovery status to 'Issued', and returns user to the Claim Overview page.
> 8. For Event Cases, recovery payment creation functionality is not available.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is viewing a valid Claim Overview page, **When** they click the 'Post Recovery' button, **Then** the Post Recovery Drawer form opens with all required input fields displayed.
> 2. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is viewing an Event Case Overview page, **When** they navigate to the Post Recovery section, **Then** the 'Post Recovery' button is hidden and disabled.
> 3. **Given** the Post Recovery Drawer is open, **When** the Claims Adjuster attempts to submit the form without selecting a Payee, **Then** the system displays an inline error message indicating that Party (Payee) is mandatory and blocks submission.
> 4. **Given** the Post Recovery Drawer is open, **When** the Claims Adjuster attempts to submit the form without entering a Total Recovery Amount, **Then** the system displays an inline error message indicating that Total Recovery Amount is mandatory and blocks submission.
> 5. **Given** the Post Recovery Drawer is open, **When** the Claims Adjuster opens the Party dropdown, **Then** the system displays all claim parties and beneficiaries sorted alphabetically.
> 6. **Given** the Claims Adjuster is using the UK locale, **When** they view the Post Recovery Drawer, **Then** the system displays '' as the currency symbol, 'DD/MM/YYYY' as the date format, and 'Cheque'/'Cheque Number' instead of 'Check'/'Check Number'.
> 7. **Given** the Claims Adjuster is using the default (US) locale, **When** they view the Post Recovery Drawer, **Then** the system displays '$' as the currency symbol, 'MM/DD/YYYY' as the date format, and 'Check/EFT'/'Check Number' labels.
> 8. **Given** the Claims Adjuster has completed all mandatory fields in the Post Recovery Drawer, **When** they click the 'Post' button, **Then** the system triggers the 'generateRecovery' service to create a new recovery payment within 5 seconds.
> 9. **Given** a recovery payment is successfully created, **When** the system processes the transaction, **Then** the recovery status is automatically set to 'Issued' via the DXP CAP Adjuster API and the user is returned to the Claim Overview page.
> 10. **Given** the Claims Adjuster has partially filled out the Post Recovery Drawer, **When** they click 'Cancel' or the 'Close (X)' button, **Then** the system displays a confirmation modal with the message 'Are you sure you want to close this form?'.
>     10.1 **Given** the confirmation modal is displayed, **When** the Claims Adjuster confirms closure, **Then** the system closes the drawer without saving data and returns to the Claim Overview page.
>     10.2 **Given** the confirmation modal is displayed, **When** the Claims Adjuster cancels the action, **Then** the drawer remains open with all entered data intact.
> 11. **Given** the Claims Adjuster has entered a Total Recovery Amount, **When** they use the Allocations Section, **Then** they can add and delete allocation entries to distribute the recovery amount across multiple claims and coverages.
> 12. **Given** a recovery payment is posted, **When** the transaction is recorded, **Then** the Party selection is mapped to CapPayeeDetailsEntity.payee and the Total Recovery Amount is mapped to CapPaymentEntity.recoveryAmount in the backend system.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to waive overpayments with authority-level validation, so that I can resolve overpayment balances while ensuring compliance with approval limits.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: waive overpayments with authority-level validation
- **Value**: I can resolve overpayment balances while ensuring compliance with approval limits

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** waive overpayments with authority-level validation,
> **so that** I can resolve overpayment balances while ensuring compliance with approval limits.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User accesses the overpayment waiver function from the claim's financial management interface when an overpayment balance exists.",
>   "2. User specifies the waiver amount to be written off:",
>   "  2.1 System validates that the amount is greater than zero and does not exceed the total outstanding overpayment balance for the claim.",
>   "  2.2 System adjusts currency display based on user locale settings.",
>   "3. User documents the business justification for the waiver in a required comments field.",
>   "4. User initiates the waiver submission:",
>   "  4.1 **Main Flow - Authorized Waiver**: System evaluates user's authority level against the requested waiver amount through approval rules. If user has sufficient authority, system prompts for authorization confirmation. Upon confirmation, system processes the waiver, creates a balance activity record, updates the claim financial balance, and navigates to the claim overview.",
>   "  4.2 **Alternate Flow - Insufficient Authority**: If user lacks sufficient authority level for the requested amount, system displays an error message indicating the user's current authority level and the maximum waiver amount they are authorized to approve. Waiver is not processed and user remains in the interface to adjust the request or cancel.",
>   "  4.3 **Alternate Flow - Validation Failure**: If waiver amount violates validation rules (zero/negative or exceeds balance), system prevents submission and displays appropriate validation messages.",
>   "5. User can cancel the waiver process at any time:",
>   "  5.1 System presents a confirmation prompt before discarding unsaved data.",
>   "  5.2 If confirmed, system closes the interface without saving; if cancelled, user returns to continue editing.",

> [
>   "**Positive Scenarios:**",

>   "2. Given the user enters a valid waiver amount (greater than $0, less than or equal to total balance) and provides required comments, When the user submits the waiver and has sufficient authority level, Then the system displays an authorization confirmation prompt.",
>   "3. Given the user confirms the authorization prompt, When the system processes the waiver, Then:",
>   "  3.1 A record is created in the Balance Activities section with the waiver details.",
>   "  3.2 The claim's financial balance is updated to reflect the waived amount.",
>   "  3.3 The user is navigated to the Claim Overview page.",
>   "  3.4 The overpayment balance displayed on the Financials tab reflects the reduction.",
>   "4. Given the user's locale is set to en_GB, When the Amount field is displayed, Then the currency symbol shows '' instead of '$'.",
>   "5. Given the user clicks Cancel or Close, When the confirmation modal displays and user selects 'Yes', Then the drawer closes without saving any data and no waiver record is created.",
>   "**Negative Scenarios:**",
>   "6. Given the user enters a waiver amount of $0 or a negative value, When the user attempts to submit, Then the system prevents submission and displays a validation error requiring an amount greater than $0.",
>   "7. Given the user enters a waiver amount exceeding the Total Balance per Claim, When the user attempts to submit, Then the system prevents submission and displays a validation error indicating the maximum allowable amount.",
>   "8. Given the user leaves the Comments field blank, When the user attempts to submit, Then the system prevents submission and displays a validation error indicating the field is required.",
>   "9. Given the user has an authority level that permits waivers up to $500 and enters a waiver amount of $750, When the user clicks Save, Then:",
>   "  9.1 The system displays an error message showing the user's current authority level and the maximum amount they can waive.",
>   "  9.2 The waiver is not processed.",
>   "  9.3 The user remains in the drawer to modify the amount or cancel the operation.",
>   "10. Given the user clicks Cancel after entering data, When the confirmation modal displays and user selects 'No', Then the user returns to the form with all entered data preserved."

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to cancel overpayment waivers, so that I can reverse incorrect waive decisions and restore overpayment balances.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: cancel overpayment waivers
- **Value**: I can reverse incorrect waive decisions and restore overpayment balances

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** cancel overpayment waivers,
> **so that** I can reverse incorrect waive decisions and restore overpayment balances.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Claims Adjuster accesses the Balance Management section from the claim or event case overview page.
> 2. Adjuster initiates the 'Cancel Waive Overpayment' action from the available balance actions.
> 3. System presents a Cancel Waive Overpayment form within a drawer interface for the adjuster to complete.
> 4. Adjuster provides required cancellation details and submits the cancellation request.
> 5. System processes the cancellation and reverts the waived amount back to the claim or event case balance.
> 6. **Alternate Flow - User Abandons Cancellation**:
>    6.1. If the adjuster attempts to cancel or close the drawer before submitting, system displays a confirmation prompt to prevent accidental data loss.
>    6.2. If adjuster confirms abandonment, system closes the drawer without saving any information and returns to the Balance Management view.
>    6.3. If adjuster does not confirm abandonment, system closes the confirmation prompt and returns to the cancellation form to allow completion.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim or event case with an overpayment waive in 'Issued' status exists, **When** a Claims Adjuster with 'Cancel Overpayment Waive' privilege navigates to the Balance tab, **Then** the 'Cancel Waive Overpayment' action is available in the Select Action drop-down.
> 2. **Given** the Claims Adjuster selects 'Cancel Waive Overpayment' action, **When** the system opens the cancellation drawer, **Then** the form displays all required fields for completing the cancellation.
> 3. **Given** the Claims Adjuster completes the cancellation form and clicks Submit, **When** the system processes the request, **Then** the waived amount is reverted and added back to the claim or event case balance.
> 4. **Given** the Claims Adjuster is completing the cancellation form, **When** they click Cancel or Close button, **Then** the system displays a confirmation prompt warning that changes will not be saved.
> 5. **Given** the confirmation prompt is displayed, **When** the adjuster confirms cancellation, **Then** the system closes both the drawer and confirmation pop-up without saving any information and returns to the Balance Management view.
> 6. **Given** the confirmation prompt is displayed, **When** the adjuster does not confirm cancellation, **Then** the system closes only the confirmation pop-up and returns to the cancellation form with all entered data preserved.
> 7. **Given** a user without 'Cancel Overpayment Waive' privilege attempts to access the function, **When** they view the Balance tab, **Then** the 'Cancel Waive Overpayment' action is not available or is disabled.
> 8. **Given** an overpayment waive exists in a status other than 'Issued', **When** the adjuster views available balance actions, **Then** the 'Cancel Waive Overpayment' action is not available for that specific waive transaction.
> 9. **Given** the cancellation is successfully submitted, **When** the system completes processing, **Then** the balance is updated immediately and reflects the restored overpayment amount.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to pay underpayments with optional withholding compensation, so that I can issue additional payments to claimants and manage payment withholdings.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: pay underpayments with optional withholding compensation
- **Value**: I can issue additional payments to claimants and manage payment withholdings

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** pay underpayments with optional withholding compensation,
> **so that** I can issue additional payments to claimants and manage payment withholdings.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Adjuster initiates the Pay Underpayment balance action to generate underpayment payments for a specific payee.
> 2. System presents the underpayment interface displaying the current payee (non-editable) and pre-populates the payment amount with the Total Balance per Payee.
>    2.1 Adjuster can modify the payment amount as needed within validation constraints.
>    2.2 Adjuster optionally selects 'Compensate Withholdings' option to address previously withheld amounts from overpayments.
>       2.1.1 When withholding compensation is selected, the interface switches to extended mode where the amount becomes auto-calculated and non-editable.
>       2.1.2 System displays a multi-select dropdown of issued payments that have overpayment withholdings on the case or claim, excluding any payments already adjusted by previous compensate withholding actions.
>       2.1.3 As adjuster selects payments from the dropdown, the system automatically recalculates the payment amount based on the cumulative withholding amounts of selected payments.
> 3. Adjuster submits the underpayment action, triggering the appropriate payment generation API based on whether withholding compensation was selected.
> 4. System validates payment details including payment method (CHECK/EFT), addresses, expiration dates, and amount constraints per business rules for collecting financial data.
> 5. Upon successful validation and submission, the system generates a new payment record in the Payment List, updates the payee's balance accordingly, and navigates the adjuster to the Case or Claim Overview page.
>    5.1 If adjuster cancels or closes the underpayment drawer, system displays a confirmation modal requiring explicit confirmation before discarding changes.
>    5.2 If validation fails (empty amount, negative values, or amount exceeding Total Balance per Payee when underpayment balance exists), system prevents submission and displays appropriate error messages requiring correction.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an adjuster initiates Pay Underpayment action for a payee with underpayment balance, **When** the underpayment drawer opens, **Then** the system displays the payee name (non-editable) and pre-populates the Amount field with the Total Balance per Payee amount.
> 2. **Given** the adjuster is on the standard underpayment interface, **When** the adjuster modifies the Amount field to a valid value within the Total Balance per Payee limit, **Then** the system accepts the modified amount for submission.
> 3. **Given** the adjuster checks the 'Compensate Withholdings' checkbox, **When** the interface switches to extended mode, **Then** the Amount field becomes non-editable and auto-calculated, and the Payment Applied Withholdings multi-select dropdown appears showing only issued payments with overpayment withholdings (excluding payments already adjusted).
> 4. **Given** the adjuster is in withholding compensation mode, **When** the adjuster selects one or more payments from the Payment Applied Withholdings dropdown, **Then** the Amount field automatically updates to reflect the cumulative withholding amounts from selected payments.
> 5. **Given** the adjuster submits a standard underpayment (Compensate Withholdings unchecked), **When** all validations pass, **Then** the system calls POST /cap-adjuster/v1/financial/payment/generate-under-payment API, generates a new payment, updates the payee balance, and navigates to Case/Claim Overview page.
> 6. **Given** the adjuster submits a withholding compensation underpayment (Compensate Withholdings checked), **When** all validations pass, **Then** the system calls the Generate Withholding Underpayment API, generates a new payment, updates the payee balance, and navigates to Case/Claim Overview page.
> 7. **Given** the adjuster attempts to submit with an empty Amount field, **When** validation occurs, **Then** the system prevents submission and displays a mandatory field error message.
> 8. **Given** the adjuster enters a negative value in the Amount field, **When** validation occurs, **Then** the system prevents submission and displays an error indicating negative values are not allowed.
> 9. **Given** an underpayment balance exists and the adjuster enters an amount exceeding the Total Balance per Payee, **When** validation occurs, **Then** the system prevents submission and displays an error indicating the amount cannot exceed the total balance.
> 10. **Given** the adjuster is in withholding compensation mode and has not selected any payments from the dropdown, **When** attempting to submit, **Then** the system prevents submission and displays a mandatory field error for the Payment Applied Withholdings dropdown.
> 11. **Given** the adjuster clicks Close or Cancel buttons during underpayment entry, **When** the action is triggered, **Then** the system displays a confirmation modal requiring explicit confirmation before closing the drawer and discarding changes.
> 12. **Given** payment generation is initiated, **When** the system validates payment details, **Then** the system verifies payment method is valid (CHECK/EFT), addresses are complete and valid, and expiration dates are within acceptable ranges per business rules for collecting financial data.
> 13. **Given** a payment has already been adjusted by a previous compensate withholding action, **When** the Payment Applied Withholdings dropdown is populated, **Then** that payment is excluded from the available selection list.
> 14. **Given** the system processes currency amounts, **When** displaying the Amount field, **Then** the format is locale-sensitive ($ for en_US,  for en_GB) according to user preferences.

>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=580269794"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to reduce payments through withholdings by amount or percentage, so that I can manage payment reductions and track withholding details.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: reduce payments through withholdings by amount or percentage
- **Value**: I can manage payment reductions and track withholding details to recover overpayments systematically

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** reduce payments through withholdings by amount or percentage,
> **so that** I can manage payment reductions and track withholding details to recover overpayments systematically.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User initiates payment reduction by accessing the Reduce Payment interface from the case balance context.",
>   "2. User configures withholding strategy by selecting the balance reduction type:",
>   "   2.1. Amount-based withholding (available only for disability claims): User specifies fixed weekly or monthly withholding amount, and system automatically calculates and displays estimated number of weeks/months to full recovery (rounded to 1 decimal place).",
>   "   2.2. Percentage-based withholding (available for all claim types including disability and life): User specifies percentage of payment to withhold.",
>   "3. User selects target claim(s) for withholding application:",
>   "   3.1. For amount-based withholding: Single claim selection from eligible disability claims (STD, SMD, LTD, Statutory, PFL, Corporate).",
>   "   3.2. For percentage-based withholding: Multiple claim selection from eligible claims including disability and life claims (CI, HI, Accident, TL).",
>   "   3.3. System filters out claims that already have active payment withholding configurations.",
>   "   3.4. System supports selecting a claim different from the overpaid claim to enable cross-claim recovery.",
>   "4. User saves or updates the withholding configuration, triggering system actions:",
>   "   4.1. System persists configuration data to the event case domain.",
>   "   4.2. System reduces the overpayment amount from the case balance through payment initialization.",
>   "   4.3. System navigates user to Case Overview page upon successful completion.",
>   "5. Alternate Flow - Unsaved Changes Protection: If user attempts to close the interface with unsaved changes, system displays confirmation modal allowing user to discard changes or return to complete the action.",
>   "6. Alternate Flow - Update Existing Configuration: When modifying an existing withholding setup, system changes action button to 'Save' and updates existing configuration rather than creating new withholding record."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** a user opens the Reduce Payment interface, **When** the interface loads, **Then** the system displays Remaining Balance Type selection (Amount/Percentage) and Claims dropdown as mandatory fields.",
>   "2. **Given** a user selects 'Amount' as Remaining Balance Type, **When** viewing available claims, **Then** the system restricts claim selection to single-select and displays only eligible disability claims (STD, SMD, LTD, Statutory, PFL, Corporate).",
>   "3. **Given** a user selects 'Percentage' as Remaining Balance Type, **When** viewing available claims, **Then** the system enables multi-select and displays all eligible claim types including disability and life claims (CI, HI, Accident, TL).",
>   "4. **Given** a user selects 'Amount' type for a STD or SMD claim, **When** entering a withholding amount, **Then** the system maps the value to withholdingWeeklyAmount and auto-calculates Number of Estimated Weeks as (Overpayment Amount / Withholding Amount) rounded to 1 decimal place in real-time.",
>   "5. **Given** a user selects 'Amount' type for a LTD claim, **When** entering a withholding amount, **Then** the system maps the value to withholdingMonthlyAmount and auto-calculates Number of Estimated Months as (Overpayment Amount / Withholding Amount) rounded to 1 decimal place in real-time.",
>   "6. **Given** a user selects 'Percentage' type, **When** entering a percentage value, **Then** the system does not display the Number of Estimated Weeks/Months field and maps the value to withholdingPct.",
>   "7. **Given** multiple claims exist under a payee, **When** user views the Claims dropdown, **Then** the system filters out and does not display any claims that already have active payment withholding configurations.",
>   "8. **Given** a user completes all mandatory fields and clicks 'Add', **When** the system processes the request, **Then** the configuration is saved to CapFinancialAdjustmentWithholdingEntity, the overpayment amount is reduced from Case Balance via InitPayment service, and user is navigated to Case Overview page.",
>   "9. **Given** a user is updating an existing withholding configuration, **When** the Reduce Payment interface opens, **Then** the system displays 'Save' button instead of 'Add' button and pre-populates existing values.",
>   "10. **Given** a user has unsaved changes in the Reduce Payment form, **When** user clicks Cancel or Close button, **Then** the system displays a confirmation modal (Template C-002) requiring user to confirm discard or return to form.",
>   "11. **Given** a user attempts to save the configuration with missing mandatory fields (Remaining Balance Type, Withholding Amount/Percentage, or Claims), **When** user clicks Add/Save, **Then** the system blocks submission and displays validation error messages for incomplete fields.",
>   "12. **Given** a withholding configuration exists for Claim A to recover overpayment from Claim B, **When** the system processes payments for Claim A, **Then** the configured withholding amount or percentage is deducted and applied to reduce the overpayment balance in Claim B."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view and manage payment withholdings list, so that I can track all active withholdings and edit or remove them as needed.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view and manage payment withholdings list
- **Value**: I can track all active withholdings and edit or remove them as needed

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view and manage payment withholdings list,
> **so that** I can track all active withholdings and edit or remove them as needed.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System displays a Payment Withholdings section with an expandable accordion header that controls visibility of the withholding list table.
> 2. When a payee is selected, the system retrieves and displays all associated withholdings in a table format with the following information:
>    2.1 Remaining Balance Type (displayed as 'Amount' or 'Percentage')
>    2.2 Withholding Amount (displayed as dollar amount such as $100.00 or percentage such as 10)
>    2.3 Associated Claims (multiple claims displayed as comma-separated text)
> 3. For each withholding record, user can perform management actions:
>    3.1 Edit withholding by clicking the pencil icon, which navigates to Balance Action - Reduce Payment (Claim) UI with prefilled data for modification
>    3.2 Remove withholding by clicking the trash icon, which triggers a confirmation workflow
> 4. When removing a withholding, system displays a confirmation modal prompting 'Are you sure you want to remove this withholding?'
>    4.1 If user confirms removal (clicks Yes), the withholding row is deleted from the list
>    4.2 If user cancels removal (clicks No), the modal closes without changes
> 5. System handles special display conditions:
>    5.1 When no withholding items exist for the selected payee, the accordion title displays 'No Data' and an empty table structure remains visible
>    5.2 When the selected payee is removed, the entire Payment Withholdings section is hidden from view


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a payee is selected with associated withholdings, **When** the Payment Withholdings section loads, **Then** the system displays an expandable accordion with all withholding records in a table format showing Remaining Balance Type, Withholding Amount, and Claims columns.
> 2. **Given** a withholding record displays a Remaining Balance Type, **When** viewing the withholding, **Then** the type is shown as either 'Amount' or 'Percentage' in text format.
> 3. **Given** a withholding record displays a Withholding Amount, **When** the balance type is 'Amount', **Then** the amount is formatted as a dollar value (e.g., $100.00), **And When** the balance type is 'Percentage', **Then** the amount is displayed as a percentage (e.g., 10).
> 4. **Given** a withholding is associated with multiple claims, **When** viewing the Claims column, **Then** all claim identifiers are displayed as comma-separated text.
> 5. **Given** a withholding record is displayed, **When** the user clicks the Edit button (pencil icon), **Then** the system navigates to the Balance Action - Reduce Payment (Claim) UI with the selected withholding's data prefilled for editing.
> 6. **Given** a withholding record is displayed, **When** the user clicks the Remove button (trash icon), **Then** the system displays a confirmation modal with the message 'Are you sure you want to remove this withholding?' and Yes/No buttons.
>    6.1 **Given** the removal confirmation modal is open, **When** the user clicks Yes, **Then** the withholding row is removed from the list and the modal closes.
>    6.2 **Given** the removal confirmation modal is open, **When** the user clicks No, **Then** the modal closes without removing the withholding row.
> 7. **Given** a payee is selected, **When** no withholding items exist for that payee, **Then** the Payment Withholdings accordion title displays 'No Data' and an empty table structure remains visible.
> 8. **Given** the Payment Withholdings section is displayed, **When** the selected payee is removed, **Then** the entire Payment Withholdings section (accordion and table) is hidden from view.
> 9. **Given** withholding data is retrieved, **When** displaying the information, **Then** all data is sourced from the Balance Action - Reduce Payment (Claim) UI interface.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to create and manage deduction payments to third parties, so that I can process court-ordered or sponsor-based deductions from claim payments.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: create and manage deduction payments to third parties
- **Value**: court-ordered or sponsor-based deductions from claim payments can be properly processed and distributed

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** create and manage deduction payments to third parties,
> **so that** court-ordered or sponsor-based deductions from claim payments can be properly processed and distributed.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User creates a new deduction record by specifying the deduction type and category (Sponsor-based or Non-Sponsor-based).",
>   "2. User configures deduction parameters including amount or percentage, tax treatment designation (pre-tax or post-tax), and associated party information (sponsor or third party).",
>   "3. For Sponsor-based deductions (Health & Welfare category):",
>   "  3.1. User selects from available sponsor deduction types: Insurance Premium (payroll deductions for other insurance plan premiums), Saving Accounts (FSA for flexible spending or HSA for health savings), Union Dues (contributions for wages, benefits, and representation), Other job-related deductions (merchandise, uniforms, tools, tuition, certification fees), or Other non-job-related deductions (retirement, charitable donations).",
>   "  3.2. For HSA deductions, user confirms the insured has an eligible High Deductible Health Plan (HDHP), as this is a prerequisite for HSA eligibility.",
>   "  3.3. System aggregates these deductions across all claims for the same Sponsor (Employer) for external batch payment and reporting.",
>   "4. For Non-Sponsor-based deductions (Wage Garnishment category):",
>   "  4.1. User selects garnishment type (Child Support for court custody order obligations, or Wage Garnishment for creditor garnishments, tax levies, or student loans).",
>   "  4.2. User attaches court order or official notice documentation and identifies the third-party payee.",
>   "  4.3. System automatically generates a secondary Deduction Payment payable to the designated third party.",
>   "5. User applies the deduction to claim payment calculations:",
>   "  5.1. For single disability claims, system applies the deduction as a fixed weekly or monthly amount.",
>   "  5.2. For multiple claims or non-disability claims, system calculates the deduction as a percentage of the payment amount.",
>   "  5.3. System applies pre-tax or post-tax logic based on the deduction configuration.",
>   "6. System reduces the net payment amount to the insured by the deduction amount and routes the deducted funds according to the deduction category (aggregated to sponsor or direct payment to third party).",
>   "7. User reviews and manages active deductions throughout the claim lifecycle, with visibility into deduction history and payment distribution records."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** a claims adjuster is creating a Sponsor-based Insurance Premium deduction, **When** all required parameters (amount, tax treatment, sponsor) are entered, **Then** the deduction is saved and will be aggregated with other deductions for the same sponsor for external payment processing.",
>   "2. **Given** a claims adjuster is creating an HSA Saving Account deduction, **When** the insured does not have an eligible HDHP, **Then** the system prevents creation of the HSA deduction and displays a validation error indicating HDHP eligibility is required.",
>   "3. **Given** a claims adjuster is creating a Non-Sponsor-based Child Support deduction, **When** the court order and third-party payee information are provided, **Then** the system creates the deduction and automatically generates a secondary Deduction Payment record payable to the designated third party.",
>   "4. **Given** a deduction is configured as pre-tax, **When** the deduction is applied to a claim payment calculation, **Then** the deduction amount is subtracted from the gross payment amount before tax calculations are performed.",
>   "5. **Given** a deduction is configured as post-tax, **When** the deduction is applied to a claim payment calculation, **Then** the deduction amount is subtracted from the net payment amount after tax calculations are completed.",
>   "6. **Given** a deduction is applied to a single disability claim, **When** the payment is calculated, **Then** the system applies the deduction as the configured fixed weekly or monthly amount.",
>   "7. **Given** a deduction is applied to multiple claims or a non-disability claim, **When** the payment is calculated, **Then** the system applies the deduction as the configured percentage of the payment amount.",
>   "8. **Given** multiple Sponsor-based deductions exist for different claims under the same Employer, **When** payment processing occurs, **Then** the system aggregates all deductions for that Sponsor for batch payment and generates an external report detailing the aggregated amounts.",
>   "9. **Given** a Non-Sponsor-based Wage Garnishment deduction is applied to a payment, **When** the claim payment is issued, **Then** the system generates a separate payment to the third-party creditor for the garnishment amount and reduces the insured's net payment accordingly.",
>   "10. **Given** a claims adjuster is reviewing FSA vs HSA options for a deduction, **When** comparing the two account types, **Then** the system enforces distinct rules: HSA requires HDHP eligibility, has higher contribution limits, allows year-to-year rollover and portability, can earn interest, and excludes self-employed individuals; FSA does not require HDHP, has lower limits, typically follows 'use it or lose it' rules, and is employer-only.",
>   "11. **Given** required deduction parameters are missing (type, amount/percentage, party information), **When** the user attempts to save the deduction, **Then** the system prevents saving and displays inline validation errors for all missing required fields.",
>   "12. **Given** a deduction is successfully created and applied to a payment, **When** the user views the payment details, **Then** the deduction line item, category (Sponsor vs Non-Sponsor), calculation method, and resulting net payment amount are all clearly displayed in the payment breakdown."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view payment allocations with detailed financial adjustments, so that I can verify payment calculations including gross amounts, deductions, taxes, and offsets.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view payment allocations with detailed financial adjustments
- **Value**: I can verify payment calculations including gross amounts, deductions, taxes, and offsets

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view payment allocations with detailed financial adjustments,
> **so that** I can verify payment calculations including gross amounts, deductions, taxes, and offsets.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System displays a paginated table of payment allocation transactions for a claim, showing 5 records per page with jump-to functionality.
> 2. Each payment allocation record presents comprehensive financial information including:
>    - Post Date, Transaction ID (payment number), and Type (from reserve type)
>    - Benefit period date range (From-Through Date)
>    - Financial breakdown: Offsets (sum of offset reductions), ADJ Gross (gross allocation amount), Deductions (sum of deductions), Taxes (sum of all taxes), Partial/CE (current earnings prorated amount), and Total (net allocation amount)
>    - Payment Status indicator displayed under the amount field
> 3. System calculates and displays summary totals:
>    - Total Payment as sum of all allocation net amounts
>    - Differentiation between positive amounts (payments) and negative amounts (recoveries)
> 4. Users can sort payment allocations by Post Date, Transaction ID, Type, From-Through Date, ADJ Gross, and Total columns, with sorting applied across all pages (not just current page).
> 5. Default display order is Post Date in descending order.
> 6. System provides Payment Additional Information section with detailed breakdown including Loss Type, Offset list, Deduction list, Taxes list, and Rehab (rehabilitation additions) list.
> 7. System applies conditional logic for Transaction ID and Payment Status display:
>    - 7.1 When payment date is after last generated payment date, Transaction ID displays the payment number value and Payment Status shows 'Pending'
>    - 7.2 When payment date is on or before last generated payment date, Transaction ID remains empty and Payment Status displays the actual payment state
>    - 7.3 When payment date is before last generated payment date, Payment Status displays the actual payment state
> 8. System provides refresh functionality with safeguards:
>    - 8.1 Refresh button is disabled during active refresh operations to prevent concurrent processing
>    - 8.2 Refresh button is hidden and unavailable after claim closure


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim with multiple payment allocations, **When** the Claims Adjuster navigates to the Payment Allocations List, **Then** the system displays all allocation transactions in a paginated table with 5 records per page, sorted by Post Date in descending order by default.
> 2. **Given** a payment allocation record, **When** displayed in the list, **Then** the system shows Post Date, Transaction ID, Type, benefit period (From-Through Date), and calculated financial breakdown (Offsets, ADJ Gross, Deductions, Taxes, Partial/CE, Total).
> 3. **Given** multiple payment allocation transactions, **When** the system calculates financial components, **Then**:
>    - Offsets equals sum of all reduction amounts where reductionType='OFFSET'
>    - Deductions equals sum of all reduction amounts where reductionType='DEDUCTION'
>    - Taxes equals sum of all tax amounts
>    - Total Payment equals sum of all allocation net amounts
> 4. **Given** a payment allocation, **When** the Total amount is calculated, **Then** positive values display as payments and negative values display as recoveries.
> 5. **Given** a payment with paymentDate > lastGeneratedPaymentDate, **When** displayed in the list, **Then** Transaction ID shows the payment number value and Payment Status displays 'Pending' under the amount field.
> 6. **Given** a payment with paymentDate &lt;= lastGeneratedPaymentDate, **When** displayed in the list, **Then** Transaction ID field remains empty and Payment Status displays the actual payment state.
> 7. **Given** the user clicks on a sortable column header (Post Date, Transaction ID, Type, From-Through Date, ADJ Gross, or Total), **When** sorting is applied, **Then** the system sorts all records across all pages, not just the current page.
> 8. **Given** the Payment Additional Information section, **When** accessed, **Then** the system displays detailed breakdown including Loss Type, complete Offset list, Deduction list, Taxes list, and Rehab list.
> 9. **Given** a refresh operation is in progress, **When** the user views the page, **Then** the Refresh button is disabled to prevent concurrent refresh operations.
> 10. **Given** a claim has been closed, **When** the user views the Payment Allocations List, **Then** the Refresh button is hidden and unavailable.
> 11. **Given** pagination controls, **When** the user navigates between pages, **Then** the system maintains the current sort order and displays the correct 5 records per page.
> 12. **Given** the Post Date field, **When** displayed, **Then** the date format is MM/DD/YYYY and maps to CapPaymentDetailsEntity.paymentDate.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manage offsets on disability claims with type, date range, amount, and prorating rate, so that I can apply statutory and manual offsets to reduce benefit payments.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: manage offsets on disability claims with type, date range, amount, and prorating rate
- **Value**: I can apply statutory and manual offsets to reduce benefit payments accurately and in compliance with policy terms

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** manage offsets on disability claims with type, date range, amount, and prorating rate,
> **so that** I can apply statutory and manual offsets to reduce benefit payments accurately and in compliance with policy terms.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. Claims Adjuster accesses the Claim Overview Page to view and manage all offsets associated with the disability claim.",
>   "2. To create a new offset, the Claims Adjuster initiates the Add Offset process and provides required offset information:",
>   "   2.1. Selects the Type of Offset from predefined offset categories.",
>   "   2.2. Specifies the Beginning Date when the offset becomes effective.",
>   "   2.3. Specifies the Through Date when the offset ends (must be after Beginning Date).",
>   "   2.4. Enters the Offset Amount as a positive monetary value representing the reduction amount.",
>   "   2.5. Selects the Prorating Rate (1/5, 1/7, or 1/30) to determine how the offset is distributed across payment periods.",
>   "3. Upon saving the new offset, the system updates the Leave claim through backend integration and displays the offset entry in the Offsets section of the Claim Overview Page.",
>   "4. For existing manual offsets, the Claims Adjuster can modify offset details:",
>   "   4.1. Opens the Edit Offset form which pre-populates all current offset values.",
>   "   4.2. Updates any modifiable fields following the same validation rules as new offset creation.",
>   "   4.3. Saves changes to update the claim and refresh the Offsets display.",
>   "5. For existing manual offsets that are no longer applicable, the Claims Adjuster can remove the offset:",
>   "   5.1. Initiates the removal action for the selected offset entry.",
>   "   5.2. Confirms the removal decision through system prompt.",
>   "   5.3. System removes the offset and updates the claim financial calculations accordingly.",
>   "6. System distinguishes between manual and automatic offsets, restricting edit and remove operations to manual offsets only to preserve system-generated offset integrity.",
>   "7. At any point during offset form entry or editing, the Claims Adjuster can cancel the operation with confirmation to prevent accidental data loss."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Scenario 1: Successfully Add New Manual Offset**",
>   "1. Given the Claims Adjuster is on the Claim Overview Page with an active disability claim",
>   "   When the user clicks 'Add Offset' button",
>   "   Then the Add Offset slide-out form opens with all required fields empty and ready for input.",
>   "2. Given the Add Offset form is open",
>   "   When the user fills all required fields (Type of Offset, Beginning Date, Through Date, Offset Amount >0, Prorating Rate) with valid values and Through Date is after Beginning Date",
>   "   And clicks 'Save' button",
>   "   Then the system updates the Leave claim via REST>Update Loss, closes the form, and displays the new offset in the Offsets section on Claim Overview Page.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 2: Validation Prevents Invalid Offset Creation**",
>   "3. Given the Add Offset form is open",
>   "   When the user enters a Through Date that is earlier than or equal to Beginning Date",
>   "   Then the system displays a validation error and prevents form submission.",
>   "4. Given the Add Offset form is open",
>   "   When the user enters an Offset Amount of zero or negative value",
>   "   Then the system displays a validation error and prevents form submission.",
>   "5. Given the Add Offset form is open",
>   "   When the user attempts to save without filling any required field (Type of Offset, Beginning Date, Through Date, Offset Amount, or Prorating Rate)",
>   "   Then the system displays validation errors for all missing required fields and prevents form submission.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 3: Successfully Edit Existing Manual Offset**",
>   "6. Given a manual offset entry exists in the Offsets section",
>   "   When the Claims Adjuster clicks the 'Edit Icon' next to the manual offset entry",
>   "   Then the Edit Offset slide-out form opens with all current offset values pre-filled (Type of Offset, Beginning Date, Through Date, Offset Amount, Prorating Rate).",
>   "7. Given the Edit Offset form is open with pre-filled values",
>   "   When the user modifies one or more fields with valid values and clicks 'Save'",
>   "   Then the system updates the Leave claim via REST>Update Loss, closes the form, and displays the updated offset values in the Offsets section.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 4: System Protects Automatic Offsets from Manual Modification**",
>   "8. Given an automatic offset entry exists in the Offsets section",
>   "   When the Claims Adjuster views the offset entry",
>   "   Then the 'Edit Icon' and 'Remove Icon' are hidden and the offset cannot be manually modified or removed.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 5: Successfully Remove Manual Offset**",
>   "9. Given a manual offset entry exists in the Offsets section",
>   "   When the Claims Adjuster clicks the 'Remove Icon' next to the manual offset entry",
>   "   Then a confirmation modal displays with message 'Are you sure you want to remove this entry?' and Yes/No buttons.",
>   "10. Given the removal confirmation modal is displayed",
>   "    When the user clicks 'Yes'",
>   "    Then the system removes the offset entry, updates the claim, and refreshes the Claim Overview Page without the removed offset.",
>   "11. Given the removal confirmation modal is displayed",
>   "    When the user clicks 'No'",
>   "    Then the modal closes and the offset entry remains unchanged in the Offsets section.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 6: Cancel Offset Form Operations**",
>   "12. Given the Add Offset or Edit Offset form is open with data entered or modified",
>   "    When the user clicks 'Cancel' button or 'Close Icon'",
>   "    Then a confirmation modal displays with message 'Are you sure you want to close this form?' and Yes/No buttons.",
>   "13. Given the cancellation confirmation modal is displayed",
>   "    When the user clicks 'Yes'",
>   "    Then the form closes without saving changes and the user returns to the Claim Overview Page.",
>   "14. Given the cancellation confirmation modal is displayed",
>   "    When the user clicks 'No'",
>   "    Then the modal closes and the user remains in the form to continue editing.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 7: Prorating Rate Selection**",
>   "15. Given the Add Offset or Edit Offset form is open",
>   "    When the user accesses the Prorating Rate dropdown",
>   "    Then only the values 1/5, 1/7, and 1/30 are available for selection from LU>ProratingRate.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 8: Data Mapping and Backend Integration**",
>   "16. Given the user successfully saves a new or edited offset",
>   "    When the system processes the save action",
>   "    Then all field values are correctly mapped to CapLeaveFinancialAdjustmentOffsetEntity: Type of Offset  offsetType (LU>OffsetType), Beginning Date  offsetTerm.effectiveDate, Through Date  offsetTerm.expirationDate, Offset Amount  offsetWeeklyAmount, Prorating Rate  offsetProratingRate (LU>ProratingRate), and the Leave claim is updated via REST>Update Loss API."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want the system to automatically generate and issue scheduled payments, so that claim payments are processed efficiently without manual intervention.
- **Role**: Claims Operations Manager
- **Action**: configure the system to automatically generate and issue scheduled claim payments through batch processing and external payment hub integration
- **Value**: claim payments are processed efficiently without manual intervention, reducing operational overhead and ensuring timely disbursements to claimants

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Operations Manager,
> **I want to** configure the system to automatically generate and issue scheduled claim payments through batch processing and external payment hub integration,
> **so that** claim payments are processed efficiently without manual intervention, reducing operational overhead and ensuring timely disbursements to claimants.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. Scheduled Payment Generation Job automatically retrieves all active payment schedules and generates individual payment records by applying Payment Generation Rules.",
>   "2. System initializes each generated payment record through Init Payment lifecycle command, preparing it for approval and subsequent issuance.",
>   "3. Scheduled Payment Issue Job retrieves all approved payments where ASO Type equals ATP and initiates issuance processing.",
>   "4. System evaluates payment net amount to determine processing path:",
>   "   4.1. For payments with net amount  0: Execute direct issuance without external dispatch (internal adjustment processing).",
>   "   4.2. For payments with net amount > 0: Proceed to external dispatch preparation.",
>   "5. For positive net amount payments, system generates dispatch payment request with complete payment details and retrieves current customer data for the payee to ensure accuracy.",
>   "6. System validates the dispatch request before transmission to Payment Hub.",
>   "7. Upon successful validation, system dispatches outbound payment to external Payment Hub for processing and distribution.",
>   "8. **Alternate Flow - Dispatch Failure Recovery**: When dispatch to Payment Hub fails:",
>   "   8.1. System executes Request Issue Payment Failed lifecycle command to record the failure.",
>   "   8.2. System checks if the associated payment schedule remains Active.",
>   "   8.3. For Active schedules: System re-runs payment generation process and monitors task completion status.",
>   "   8.4. If regeneration task does not complete successfully: System creates 'Canceled Payments' user task for manual Claims Operations review and intervention.",
>   "9. **Alternate Flow - Invalid Dispatch Request**: When dispatch request validation fails:",
>   "   9.1. System executes Cancel Payment lifecycle command for the invalid payment.",
>   "   9.2. System executes Deactivate Schedule lifecycle command to prevent further payment generation from the problematic schedule.",
>   "   9.3. System generates reschedule payments input data and automatically invokes Payments Rescheduling business process to reallocate affected payments.",
>   "10. System maintains audit trail of all payment generation, issuance, failures, and rescheduling activities for compliance and operational reporting."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Scenario 1: Successful Payment Generation and Issuance (Positive Net Amount)**",
>   "- Given an active payment schedule with approved payment amount > 0 and ASO Type = ATP",
>   "- When the Payment Generation Job executes",
>   "- Then the system generates a payment record, initializes it via Init Payment command, and makes it available for issuance processing",
>   "- And when Payment Issue Job executes, the system retrieves current payee customer data, validates the dispatch request, and successfully transmits the payment to Payment Hub",
>   "- And the payment status reflects successful issuance",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 2: Zero or Negative Net Amount Payment Processing**",
>   "- Given an approved payment with net amount  0",
>   "- When the Payment Issue Job processes the payment",
>   "- Then the system executes Issue Payment command directly without dispatching to Payment Hub",
>   "- And the payment is marked as issued without external dispatch record",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 3: Dispatch Failure with Active Schedule Recovery**",
>   "- Given a payment with net amount > 0 that fails to dispatch to Payment Hub",
>   "- And the associated payment schedule status is Active",
>   "- When the system detects dispatch failure",
>   "- Then the system executes Request Issue Payment Failed command and automatically re-runs payment generation process",
>   "- And if regeneration completes successfully, the new payment is queued for issuance",
>   "- And if regeneration fails, the system creates a 'Canceled Payments' user task for manual Claims Operations intervention",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 4: Invalid Dispatch Request Handling**",
>   "- Given a generated payment that fails dispatch request validation",
>   "- When the validation check determines the request is Not Valid",
>   "- Then the system executes Cancel Payment command for the invalid payment",
>   "- And executes Deactivate Schedule command to prevent further generation from the problematic schedule",
>   "- And automatically invokes Payments Rescheduling business process with generated reschedule input data",
>   "- And no payment is transmitted to Payment Hub until rescheduling is resolved",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 5: Payment Generation Filter Compliance**",
>   "- Given multiple payments in approved status with varying ASO Type values",
>   "- When Payment Issue Job executes",
>   "- Then only payments with ASO Type = ATP are retrieved and processed for issuance",
>   "- And payments with other ASO Type values are excluded from the issuance batch",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 6: Payee Data Currency Validation**",
>   "- Given a payment ready for dispatch",
>   "- When the system prepares the dispatch request",
>   "- Then the system retrieves the latest customer data for the payment payee before generating the dispatch request",
>   "- And the dispatch request reflects the most current payee information available in the system",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 7: Inactive Schedule Handling on Dispatch Failure**",
>   "- Given a payment dispatch failure where the associated schedule is no longer Active",
>   "- When the system checks schedule status during failure recovery",
>   "- Then the system does not attempt payment regeneration",
>   "- And the failure is logged with schedule inactive status for operational review"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to set and manage preferred payment methods for claimants, so that payments are issued using the correct payment method (EFT, Check, Credit Card).
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: set and manage preferred payment methods for claimants
- **Value**: payments are issued using the correct payment method (EFT, Check, Credit Card)

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** set and manage preferred payment methods for claimants,
> **so that** payments are issued using the correct payment method (EFT, Check, Credit Card).


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. Claims Adjuster accesses the member's preferred payment method configuration from the Case Overview - Member page.",
>   "2. System displays the current preferred payment method inherited from CEM (if available) through the Edit Preferred Payment Method modal.",
>   "3. Claims Adjuster selects from existing saved payment methods (EFT/ACH or Credit Card) or one-time methods (Cash, Check) organized by category.",
>   "4. Claims Adjuster saves the selected payment method, which populates the value to CEM and returns to Case Overview - Member page.",
>   "5. **Alternate Flow: Adding New Payment Method**",
>   "  5.1. Claims Adjuster initiates the add new payment method process from the Edit Preferred Payment Method modal.",
>   "  5.2. System presents payment type selection options: ACH/EFT, Credit Card, Cash (out of scope), or Check (out of scope).",
>   "  5.3. For P&C lines, 'Belongs to Insured' toggle is available but currently hidden with no backend integration.",
>   "  5.4. **For EFT/ACH Payment Type**:",
>   "    5.4.1. Claims Adjuster enters account holder name, bank name, bank transit/routing number, and account number.",
>   "    5.4.2. System displays account number in masked format for security.",
>   "    5.4.3. Claims Adjuster submits the EFT details, which are saved as preferred payment method and populated to CEM (out of scope).",
>   "  5.5. **For Credit Card Payment Type**:",
>   "    5.5.1. Claims Adjuster enters card number, card holder name, CVV, billing address, and effective date range (from/to).",
>   "    5.5.2. System optionally auto-fills billing address using 'Use Payor Details' toggle.",
>   "    5.5.3. System displays card number in masked format for security.",
>   "    5.5.4. Claims Adjuster submits the credit card details, which are saved as preferred payment method and populated to CEM (out of scope).",
>   "  5.6. **For Check Payment Type (Out of Scope)**:",
>   "    5.6.1. Claims Adjuster enters check number and check date.",
>   "6. **Alternate Flow: Canceling Edit Operation**",
>   "  6.1. Claims Adjuster cancels from Edit Preferred Payment Method modal, discarding any changes and returning to Case Overview - Member page.",
>   "7. **Alternate Flow: Canceling Add Payment Method**",
>   "  7.1. Claims Adjuster cancels while adding a new payment method from any payment type form.",
>   "  7.2. System discards entered data and returns to Edit Preferred Payment Method modal.",
>   "8. System retrieves available payment options via RAF>PaymentMethod service and categorizes them as 'SAVED' or 'ONE TIME' methods."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** a member record exists with inherited CEM payment method, **When** Claims Adjuster opens Edit Preferred Payment Method modal, **Then** the Payment Method dropdown pre-fills with the inherited CEM value.",
>   "2. **Given** Claims Adjuster selects an existing payment method from the dropdown, **When** they click 'Save', **Then** the system populates the selected value to CEM and returns to Case Overview - Member page.",
>   "3. **Given** Claims Adjuster clicks 'Add new payment method', **When** the Add Payment Method slide-out opens, **Then** the system displays payment type options: ACH/EFT, Credit Card, Cash (OOS), and Check (OOS).",
>   "4. **Given** Claims Adjuster selects EFT/ACH payment type, **When** they enter Account Holder Name, Bank Name, Bank Transit/Routing Number, and Account Number, **Then** the Account Number displays in masked format.",
>   "5. **Given** all required EFT details are entered, **When** Claims Adjuster clicks 'Add', **Then** the system saves the payment method as preferred, populates to CEM (OOS), and returns to Case Overview - Member page.",
>   "6. **Given** Claims Adjuster selects Credit Card payment type, **When** they enter Card Number, Card Holder Name, CVV, Billing Address, and Effective dates, **Then** the Card Number displays in masked format.",
>   "7. **Given** Claims Adjuster toggles 'Use Payor Details' on Credit Card form, **When** the toggle is activated, **Then** the system auto-fills the Billing Address with payor details.",
>   "8. **Given** all required Credit Card details are entered, **When** Claims Adjuster clicks 'Add', **Then** the system saves the payment method as preferred, populates to CEM (OOS), and returns to Case Overview - Member page.",
>   "9. **Given** Claims Adjuster is viewing payment methods for a P&C line case, **When** they access the Add Payment Method panel, **Then** the 'Belongs to Insured' toggle is available but hidden with no backend value sent.",
>   "10. **Given** Claims Adjuster is viewing payment methods for a Benefits line case, **When** they access the Add Payment Method panel, **Then** the 'Belongs to Insured' toggle is not available.",
>   "11. **Given** Claims Adjuster clicks 'Cancel' in Edit Preferred Payment Method modal, **When** the action is confirmed, **Then** the system discards any changes and returns to Case Overview - Member page.",
>   "12. **Given** Claims Adjuster clicks 'Cancel' while adding a new payment method, **When** the action is confirmed, **Then** the system discards entered data and returns to Edit Preferred Payment Method modal.",
>   "13. **Given** Claims Adjuster attempts to save an EFT payment method with missing required fields, **When** they click 'Add', **Then** the system displays validation errors and prevents submission.",
>   "14. **Given** Claims Adjuster attempts to save a Credit Card payment method with missing required fields, **When** they click 'Add', **Then** the system displays validation errors and prevents submission.",
>   "15. **Given** the system retrieves payment options via RAF>PaymentMethod service, **When** options are loaded, **Then** payment methods are categorized as 'SAVED' (EFT/ACH, Credit Card) and 'ONE TIME' (Cash, Check).",
>   "16. **Given** UI implementation is in progress, **When** UI components are rendered, **Then** they follow DSM library standards (https://eisgroup.invisionapp.com/dsm/eis-group/eis-design-system)."
> ]
