#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to cancel recovery payments, so that I can reverse incorrect recovery transactions and restore payment balances.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: cancel recovery payments
- **Value**: I can reverse incorrect recovery transactions and restore payment balances

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** cancel recovery payments,
> **so that** I can reverse incorrect recovery transactions and restore payment balances.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System displays comprehensive Recovery List within Event Case or Claim Overview Payment List, showing all recovery transactions with key attributes including Transaction ID, associated Claims, Payee information, Payment Amount, Recovery Status, and Transaction Type.
> 2. Users can expand individual recovery entries to view detailed allocation breakdown by product line, including coverage assignments, gross amounts, and interest components.
> 3. For recoveries with 'Issued' status viewed from Claim context, users can initiate cancellation by selecting 'Cancel Recovery' action from the Action button menu.
> 4. System prompts user with confirmation modal requiring explicit Yes/No response before processing cancellation.
> 5. Upon confirmation, system cancels the recovery transaction, updates status to 'Canceled', and displays success notification to confirm the reversal.
> 6. Canceled recoveries remain visible in the list with updated status, maintaining complete transaction history.
>    6.1 If recovery is already canceled, action options are hidden and the entry displays read-only with 'Canceled' status.
>    6.2 If user is viewing from Event Case level (not specific Claim), cancellation actions are disabled and hidden to enforce claim-level operational control.
>    6.3 For SUSPENSE-type allocations, system displays only Net Amount without coverage name breakdown.
>    6.4 For interest-only allocations, Claims field displays 'N/A' instead of specific claim type.
>    6.5 System automatically hides Gross Amount or Interest amount fields when values equal zero to simplify display.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is viewing the Recovery List from Claim Overview, **when** the list loads, **then** all recoveries display with Transaction ID, Post Date as 'n/a', Claims type or 'N/A', Payee name, Payment Amount in red, Recovery Status, and Transaction Type within 3 seconds.
> 2. **Given** a recovery has 'Issued' status and is viewed from Claim context, **when** user clicks the Action button, **then** 'Cancel Recovery' option is available and enabled.
> 3. **Given** a recovery has 'Canceled' status, **when** user views the recovery in the list, **then** no action options are displayed and the status shows 'Canceled'.
> 4. **Given** user is viewing Recovery List from Event Case level, **when** user attempts to access actions, **then** Action button with 'Cancel Recovery' option is hidden and disabled for all recoveries.
> 5. **Given** user selects 'Cancel Recovery' for an issued recovery, **when** the confirmation modal appears, **then** modal displays message 'Are you sure you want to cancel the recovery?' with Yes and No options.
> 6. **Given** user clicks 'Yes' in the cancellation confirmation modal, **when** the system processes the request, **then** recovery status updates to 'Canceled' and success notification 'The recovery has been Canceled.' displays within 2 seconds.
> 7. **Given** user clicks 'No' in the cancellation confirmation modal, **when** the modal closes, **then** no changes are made to the recovery status and user returns to Recovery List.
> 8. **Given** user expands a recovery entry for Life/CI/HI/ACC products, **when** allocation details display, **then** Coverage Name, Gross Amount (if > 0), and Interest amount (if > 0) are shown.
>    8.1 **Given** allocation is SUSPENSE type, **then** Coverage Name displays as '-' and only Net Amount is shown.
> 9. **Given** user expands a recovery entry for Absence product, **when** allocation details display, **then** only Gross Amount is shown (if > 0).
> 10. **Given** allocation has interest-only assignment, **when** recovery displays in list, **then** Claims field shows 'N/A' instead of claim type.
> 11. **Given** Gross Amount or Interest amount equals 0 in allocation details, **when** expanded view displays, **then** the respective field with zero value is hidden from view.
> 12. **Given** user locale is set to en_GB, **when** Post Date is displayed, **then** format follows DD/MM/YYYY pattern (though recovery Post Date always shows 'n/a').
> 13. **Given** a recovery is successfully canceled, **when** user refreshes or navigates back to Recovery List, **then** the canceled recovery remains visible with 'Canceled' status maintaining complete audit trail.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view recovery allocations with gross amounts, interest, and suspense details, so that I can verify recovery transaction accuracy.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view recovery allocations with gross amounts, interest, and suspense details, and cancel recoveries when necessary
- **Value**: I can verify recovery transaction accuracy and manage recovery records effectively throughout the claims lifecycle

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view recovery allocations with gross amounts, interest, and suspense details, and cancel recoveries when necessary,
> **so that** I can verify recovery transaction accuracy and manage recovery records effectively throughout the claims lifecycle.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User creates a recovery record following the established recovery creation process, which transitions the recovery to 'Issued Recovery' status and displays it in the Payment & Recoveries list.
>
> 2. User reviews recovery allocation information displayed on the Event Case or Claim Overview page:
>    2.1. For ADJUSTMENT allocation types, system displays detailed allocation fields including 'Indemnity', 'Interest', and other relevant financial breakdown components.
>    2.2. For SUSPENSE allocation types, system displays 'Net Amount' instead of the detailed allocation field breakdown.
>
> 3. User expands the recovery record to view comprehensive allocation details, including the Applicable Recovery Amount.
>
> 4. User accesses available actions via the options menu:
>    4.1. For recoveries in 'Issued Recovery' state on Claim Overview, system presents 'Cancel Recovery' action option.
>    4.2. For recoveries in 'Canceled Recovery' state, system displays no action options.
>    4.3. On Event Case Overview, no cancellation action is available regardless of recovery state.
>
> 5. User initiates recovery cancellation by selecting 'Cancel Recovery' action, which triggers the backend cancellation service and updates the recovery state from 'Issued Recovery' to 'Canceled Recovery'.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a recovery has been created and transitioned to 'Issued Recovery' status, **When** the user navigates to the Event Case or Claim Overview page, **Then** the recovery record is displayed in the Payment & Recoveries list.
>
> 2. **Given** a recovery record has allocation type ADJUSTMENT, **When** the user views the allocation details, **Then** the system displays detailed allocation fields including 'Indemnity', 'Interest', and other relevant financial components.
>
> 3. **Given** a recovery record has allocation type SUSPENSE, **When** the user views the allocation details, **Then** the system displays only 'Net Amount' instead of detailed allocation fields.
>
> 4. **Given** the user is viewing a recovery record, **When** the user clicks the expand button, **Then** the system displays the Applicable Recovery Amount and full allocation details.
>
> 5. **Given** a recovery is in 'Issued Recovery' state and the user is on Claim Overview page, **When** the user clicks the options menu (3 dots button), **Then** the system displays 'Cancel Recovery' as an available action.
>
> 6. **Given** a recovery is in 'Issued Recovery' state and the user is on Event Case Overview page, **When** the user clicks the options menu (3 dots button), **Then** the 'Cancel Recovery' option is not available.
>
> 7. **Given** a recovery is in 'Canceled Recovery' state, **When** the user clicks the options menu (3 dots button), **Then** no action options are displayed.
>
> 8. **Given** the user has selected 'Cancel Recovery' action on a valid recovery, **When** the cancellation is confirmed, **Then** the system calls the cancelRecovery backend service and updates the recovery state to 'Canceled Recovery'.
>
> 9. **Given** a recovery has been canceled, **When** the user refreshes or returns to the Payment & Recoveries list, **Then** the recovery displays with 'Canceled Recovery' status and no available actions.

#### Feature: As a System Administrator, I want to configure authority levels for overpayment waivers and underpayments, so that approval workflows enforce compliance with financial limits.
- **Role**: System Administrator
- **Action**: configure authority levels for overpayment waivers and underpayments
- **Value**: approval workflows enforce compliance with financial limits

**Description:**

> **As a** System Administrator,
> **I want to** configure authority levels for overpayment waivers and underpayments,
> **so that** approval workflows enforce compliance with financial limits.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. System Administrator configures authority levels with specific financial thresholds for overpayment waiver approvals.",
>   "2. Authority levels are defined using standardized classification parameters (AuthorityLevelType='cap', AuthorityLevelSubType='OverpaymentWaive').",
>   "3. Administrator assigns users to appropriate authority levels based on their roles and financial approval limits.",
>   "4. Administrator configures financial limit thresholds in the Dental Authority Level Limits Config (Claim) business rule that define approval boundaries for each authority level.",
>   "5. System evaluates approval requests by matching the user's highest applicable authority level against the overpayment amount.",
>   "6. Approval workflow automatically routes requests based on authority evaluation results:",
>   "   6.1. If overpayment amount is within user's authority limit: approval is granted automatically.",
>   "   6.2. If overpayment amount exceeds user's authority limit: request is escalated to higher authority level or denied based on configured rules.",
>   "   6.3. If no matching authority level exists for the user: request defaults to requiring higher-level approval or rejection per business rules.",
>   "7. System returns approval status indicating whether the current user can approve or if escalation is required."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** a System Administrator configures an authority level with AuthorityLevelType='cap' and AuthorityLevelSubType='OverpaymentWaive',\n   **When** the configuration is saved,\n   **Then** the authority level is available for assignment to users.",
>   "2. **Given** a user has been assigned an authority level for overpayment waivers,\n   **When** the user attempts to approve an overpayment waiver,\n   **Then** the system retrieves the user's highest applicable authority level matching the configured criteria.",
>   "3. **Given** an overpayment waiver request with a specific monetary amount,\n   **When** the approval process is triggered,\n   **Then** the system evaluates the amount against the Dental Authority Level Limits Config (Claim) business rule for the user's authority level.",
>   "4. **Given** the overpayment amount is within the user's configured authority limit,\n   **When** the approval status is determined,\n   **Then** the system sets approval status to 'granted' and allows the user to approve the waiver.",
>   "5. **Given** the overpayment amount exceeds the user's configured authority limit,\n   **When** the approval status is determined,\n   **Then** the system sets approval status to 'escalation required' and routes the request to a higher authority level or denies it per business rules.",
>   "6. **Given** a user has no matching authority level configured (no AuthorityLevelType='cap' and AuthorityLevelSubType='OverpaymentWaive'),\n   **When** they attempt to approve an overpayment waiver,\n   **Then** the system prevents approval and requires higher-level authorization or rejects the request.",
>   "7. **Given** multiple authority levels exist for a user,\n   **When** determining approval authority,\n   **Then** the system selects the highest authority level that matches the overpayment waiver criteria.",
>   "8. **Given** the Dental Authority Level Limits Config (Claim) business rule is not configured,\n   **When** an approval evaluation is attempted,\n   **Then** the system returns an error or defaults to denial to prevent unauthorized approvals.",
>   "9. **Given** an approval process completes successfully,\n   **When** the approval status is returned,\n   **Then** the status clearly indicates whether approval is granted, escalation is required, or the request is denied.",
>   "10. **Given** an overpayment waiver object is submitted without required input data,\n    **When** the approval process is initiated,\n    **Then** the system prevents processing and returns an appropriate validation error."
> ]


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=811442925"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want the system to automatically reschedule payments when claim details are adjusted, so that payment schedules remain accurate and reflect current claim status.
- **Role**: Claims Operations Manager
- **Action**: ensure the system automatically reschedules payments when claim details are adjusted
- **Value**: payment schedules remain accurate and reflect current claim status without manual intervention

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Operations Manager,
> **I want to** ensure the system automatically reschedules payments when claim details are adjusted,
> **so that** payment schedules remain accurate and reflect current claim status without manual intervention.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. When a user with the appropriate privilege adjusts a claim in Pending status and submits the Pet Adjust Claim workflow, the system automatically initiates payment rescheduling.",
>   "2. The system generates a new payment template version incorporating the latest updated claim information.",
>   "3. The system performs backend cleanup operations:",
>   "   3.1. Automatically cancels payment schedules in Open, Active, or Suspended statuses.",
>   "   3.2. Automatically cancels payments in Approved or Issue Requested statuses.",
>   "4. The system creates new payments based on the newly generated active payment schedule, accounting for all payment statuses including previously issued payments.",
>   "5. The system calculates balance amounts to identify overpayment or underpayment scenarios (currently out of scope for full implementation).",
>   "6. The Payment List UI dynamically updates to reflect changes based on payment status:",
>   "   6.1. For payments NOT in Issued status: system updates payment amounts based on the revised Gross Benefit Amount (GBA) and removes canceled payment schedules from view.",
>   "   6.2. For payments in Issued status where the service still exists and user edits the previous service:",
>   "      6.2.1. If the Benefit Amount remains unchanged, the issued payment amount is preserved.",
>   "      6.2.2. If the Benefit Amount changes, the system generates an overpayment/underpayment balance (currently out of scope).",
>   "   6.3. For payments in Issued status where the service is deleted: system generates a balance based on the previous service (currently out of scope).",
>   "   6.4. For payments in Issued status where a new service is added: system generates a new corresponding payment.",
>   "7. The entire rescheduling process executes automatically as part of the Automatic Re-Adjudicate Settlement workflow, requiring no manual intervention after submission."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** a claim in Pending status with existing payment schedules in Open, Active, or Suspended statuses, **When** a user with PRIV>CAP>Update Loss privilege completes the Pet Adjust Claim workflow and clicks Submit, **Then** the system automatically cancels all such payment schedules and they are no longer visible in the Payment List UI.",
>   "2. **Given** a claim in Pending status with payments in Approved or Issue Requested statuses, **When** the claim adjustment is submitted, **Then** the system automatically cancels these payments and generates new payments based on the updated payment template.",
>   "3. **Given** a claim adjustment that updates the Gross Benefit Amount for a service with non-issued payments, **When** the adjustment is processed, **Then** the Payment List UI displays updated payment amounts reflecting the new GBA.",
>   "4. **Given** a claim adjustment that modifies a service with a payment in Issued status and the Benefit Amount remains the same, **When** the adjustment is processed, **Then** the issued payment amount remains unchanged.",
>   "5. **Given** a claim adjustment that adds a new service, **When** the adjustment is processed, **Then** the system generates a new payment for that service regardless of existing issued payments.",
>   "6. **Given** a claim adjustment workflow is initiated by a user without PRIV>CAP>Update Loss privilege, **When** the user attempts to submit the adjustment, **Then** the system prevents submission and displays an authorization error.",
>   "7. **Given** a claim in a status other than Pending, **When** a user attempts to adjust the claim, **Then** the automatic payment rescheduling process does not trigger.",
>   "8. **Given** a successful claim adjustment submission, **When** the Automatic Re-Adjudicate Settlement use case completes, **Then** a new payment template version is created and the actual service payment is successfully re-generated.",
>   "9. **Given** a claim adjustment that deletes a service with a payment in Issued status, **When** the adjustment is processed, **Then** the system identifies the balance scenario (out of scope for current implementation but must be logged for future reconciliation).",
>   "10. **Given** a claim adjustment that changes the Benefit Amount for a service with a payment in Issued status, **When** the adjustment is processed, **Then** the system identifies the overpayment/underpayment balance (out of scope for current implementation but must be logged for future reconciliation)."
> ]

>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=819957134"

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view and manage payment status transitions through the payment lifecycle, so that I can track payment progress from creation through issuance or cancellation.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: initiate and track recovery payments through their complete lifecycle from creation to issuance
- **Value**: I can ensure accurate recovery processing, maintain financial integrity, and monitor payment progress through all status transitions

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** initiate and track recovery payments through their complete lifecycle from creation to issuance,
> **so that** I can ensure accurate recovery processing, maintain financial integrity, and monitor payment progress through all status transitions.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates a recovery payment request for a claim with appropriate authorization and privileges.
> 2. System validates the recovery payment request against common validation rules and business requirements.
>    2.1 If validation fails, system returns error message with validation code and terminates the process.
> 3. System automatically establishes recovery payment metadata including:
>    - Creation timestamp set to current system time
>    - Approval timestamp set to current system time
>    - Issue timestamp set to current system time
> 4. System links the recovery payment to its originating event case by resolving the event case link from the source claim.
> 5. System generates a unique payment number according to the product model configuration pattern for financial transactions.
> 6. System executes initialization adjustment payment validation rules to ensure compliance with business policies.
> 7. System persists the recovery payment record to the database with all validated information.
> 8. System initiates accumulator updates by posting payment details to the Accumulator Service for reserve and exposure tracking.
> 9. System triggers business activity monitoring for recovery payment initiation.
> 10. System executes loss balance persistence processing for the originating claim to reflect the recovery impact.
> 11. System evaluates and triggers case payment rescheduling automation when withholding conditions are present on the case.
> 12. User receives the complete recovery payment image for confirmation and reference.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is logged in with basic authorization and holds the 'Initiate Recovery' privilege,
>    **When** they submit a valid recovery payment request for a claim,
>    **Then** the system creates a recovery payment record with creation, approval, and issue dates all set to the current system timestamp.
>
> 2. **Given** a recovery payment initiation request is submitted,
>    **When** the common request validation is executed,
>    **Then** the system validates all required fields and business rules before proceeding.
>    2.1 **Given** the validation identifies missing or invalid data,
>    **When** validation fails,
>    **Then** the system returns an error message with specific validation code and terminates the process without creating a payment record.
>
> 3. **Given** a recovery payment passes validation,
>    **When** the system processes the payment,
>    **Then** the system generates a unique payment number using the product model configured pattern.
>
> 4. **Given** a recovery payment is being created,
>    **When** the system resolves linkages,
>    **Then** the system establishes an event case link by applying the 'Resolve Event Case Link by Origin Source' business rule for the source claim.
>
> 5. **Given** a recovery payment is initiated,
>    **When** the system completes the creation process,
>    **Then** the system executes all 'Init Adjustment Payment Validation' entrypoint rules successfully.
>
> 6. **Given** a recovery payment is successfully validated,
>    **When** the system persists the record,
>    **Then** the recovery payment is saved to the database and a complete payment image is returned to the user.
>
> 7. **Given** a recovery payment is saved to the database,
>    **When** the system processes downstream impacts,
>    **Then** the system posts accumulator details to the Accumulator Service and updates all relevant accumulators.
>
> 8. **Given** a recovery payment is successfully created,
>    **When** the system completes the transaction,
>    **Then** the system triggers the 'Init Recovery' business activity monitoring event.
>
> 9. **Given** a recovery payment is finalized,
>    **When** the system processes financial impacts,
>    **Then** the system triggers 'Loss Balance Persistence' business process for the same origin source claim.
>
> 10. **Given** a recovery payment is created for a case with applied withholding,
>     **When** the system evaluates payment schedules,
>     **Then** the system triggers 'Case Payments Rescheduling Automation' business process for the originating claim.
>
> 11. **Given** a user attempts to initiate a recovery payment without the 'Initiate Recovery' privilege,
>     **When** the authorization is checked,
>     **Then** the system denies the request and returns an authorization error.
>
> 12. **Given** a user is not logged in with basic authorization,
>     **When** they attempt to initiate a recovery payment,
>     **Then** the system rejects the request and prompts for valid authentication.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to resolve payment method validation errors during payment dispatch, so that I can identify and correct payment method issues before issuance.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: resolve payment method validation errors during payment dispatch by identifying and correcting issues with payment methods (CHECK or EFT), customer/provider data, addresses, and effective dates
- **Value**: payments can be successfully issued without errors and delays caused by invalid payment methods, expired addresses, or inactive providers

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** resolve payment method validation errors during payment dispatch by identifying and correcting issues with payment methods (CHECK or EFT), customer/provider data, addresses, and effective dates,
> **so that** payments can be successfully issued without errors and delays caused by invalid payment methods, expired addresses, or inactive providers.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System loads current customer data from CEM when payment payee type is Policy Holder (IndividualCustomer) to ensure payment information is up-to-date.
> 2. System validates provider status is 'Active' when payment payee type is provider.
> 3. System resolves appropriate payment method by:
>    3.1 Using specific payment method ID if set and validating it is within effective/expiration date range (inclusive, both dates optional).
>    3.2 Filtering all customer payment methods by current date within effective/expiration dates when no specific method ID is set.
>    3.3 Filtering to include only CHECK and EFT payment method types.
>    3.4 Selecting preferred method (preferred=true) if available, otherwise selecting method with latest effective date.
> 4. System resolves payment method details based on payment type:
>    4.1 For EFT/ACH: Maps payment method token ID from payment method profile and sets entity type.
>    4.2 For CHECK: Resolves check mailing address by checking for specific address ID first, then filtering customer addresses by communication preference 'MailingAddressForCheck', and selecting preferred or most recent temporary address.
> 5. System generates payment hub dispatch request with mapped payment data including amount, currency, transaction date, recipient name, payment method type, and payment method details.
> 6. System generates validation messages with specific error codes and severity levels for encountered issues:
>    6.1 Customer/provider data loading failures.
>    6.2 Expired payment methods or addresses.
>    6.3 Missing payment methods or addresses.
>    6.4 Invalid payment method types (not CHECK or EFT).
>    6.5 Inactive provider state.
> 7. System sets validation status to 'Invalid' if any critical severity messages exist, otherwise sets status to 'Valid'.
> 8. Claims Adjuster reviews validation error messages to identify specific payment method issues preventing dispatch.
> 9. Claims Adjuster corrects identified issues by:
>    9.1 Updating expired payment methods with valid effective dates in CEM.
>    9.2 Adding or updating mailing addresses for check payments.
>    9.3 Changing payment method type from unsupported types (CASH, CREDIT_CARD) to supported types (CHECK, EFT).
>    9.4 Updating provider status to 'Active' or selecting alternate active provider.
>    9.5 Ensuring customer/payee data is properly loaded and accessible.
> 10. Claims Adjuster retriggers payment generation after corrections to validate successful dispatch request creation.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a payment payee is an Individual Customer Policy Holder, **when** payment generation is initiated, **then** the system loads the latest customer data from CEM within 2 seconds.
> 2. **Given** a payment method ID is specified on the payment, **when** the system resolves payment method, **then** it validates the method is within effective/expiration date range (both dates inclusive and optional) and generates 'GenerateDispatchRequest-CAPPaymentMethodExpired' critical error if expired.
> 3. **Given** a payment method ID is specified but cannot be found, **when** the system resolves payment method, **then** it generates 'GenerateDispatchRequest-CAPPaymentMethodNotFound' critical error and sets validation status to 'Invalid'.
> 4. **Given** no payment method ID is specified, **when** the system resolves payment method, **then** it filters all customer payment methods by current date within effective dates and includes only CHECK and EFT types.
> 5. **Given** multiple valid payment methods exist, **when** the system selects payment method, **then** it selects the preferred method (preferred=true) if available, otherwise selects the method with latest effective date.
> 6. **Given** a payment method type is CASH or CREDIT_CARD, **when** validation occurs, **then** the system generates 'GetPreferredPaymentMethod-InvalidPaymentMethodType' critical error with message 'Invalid payment method type. Must be one of the values: [CHECK, EFT]'.
> 7. **Given** a CHECK payment method is selected, **when** the system resolves check address, **then** it first attempts to use the specified checkAddressId if set, otherwise filters addresses with communicationPreference='MailingAddressForCheck'.
> 8. **Given** a check address is found by ID but is expired, **when** validation occurs, **then** the system generates 'GenerateDispatchRequest-CAPCheckAddressExpired' critical error.
> 9. **Given** a check address cannot be found by specified ID, **when** validation occurs, **then** the system generates 'GenerateDispatchRequest-CAPCheckAddressNotFound' critical error.
> 10. **Given** no check addresses exist with communicationPreference='MailingAddressForCheck', **when** the system resolves check address, **then** it uses all filtered customer addresses excluding expired temporary addresses.
> 11. **Given** multiple applicable addresses exist for check payment, **when** the system selects address, **then** it selects preferred address if exists, otherwise temporary address with latest effective date, otherwise first applicable address.
> 12. **Given** a payment payee is a provider, **when** the system validates provider, **then** it verifies provider state is 'Active' and generates 'GenerateDispatchRequest-InvalidProviderState' critical error if not active.
> 13. **Given** a provider payee cannot be loaded, **when** validation occurs, **then** the system generates 'GenerateDispatchRequest-InvalidProvider' critical error with the provider URI.
> 14. **Given** customer data cannot be loaded for a payee, **when** validation occurs, **then** the system generates 'GetPreferredPaymentMethod-InvalidPayee' critical error with the payee URI.
> 15. **Given** any critical severity validation message exists, **when** validation status is determined, **then** the system sets validation status to 'Invalid' and blocks payment dispatch.
> 16. **Given** no critical severity validation messages exist, **when** validation status is determined, **then** the system sets validation status to 'Valid' and allows payment dispatch to proceed.
> 17. **Given** an Individual Customer recipient, **when** the system maps recipient name, **then** it concatenates customer first name and last name separated by space.
> 18. **Given** validation errors exist, **when** Claims Adjuster views payment validation results, **then** all validation messages display with error code, severity, and descriptive message within 1 second.
> 19. **Given** Claims Adjuster corrects payment method or address issues in CEM, **when** payment generation is retriggered, **then** the system re-validates using updated data and clears previous errors if resolved.
> 20. **Given** a valid payment method and address exist, **when** payment hub request is generated, **then** it includes all required fields: amount, currency code, domain correlation ID (Payment URI), domain name ('CLAIM'), transaction date (current system time), recipient name, payment method type, and payment method details.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to apply automatic offsets to disability claims based on configuration, so that statutory and manual offsets are correctly calculated and applied to benefit payments.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: apply automatic offsets to disability claims based on configuration
- **Value**: statutory and manual offsets are correctly calculated and applied to benefit payments

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** apply automatic offsets to disability claims based on configuration,
> **so that** statutory and manual offsets are correctly calculated and applied to benefit payments.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System retrieves applicable auto offset configuration for the disability claim based on priority order, claim type, and coverage code.
> 2. System identifies template allocations that qualify for offset application by filtering against the configuration's applicable claim types (e.g., STD, LTD) and loss type criteria.
>   2.1. If no applicable template allocations are found based on configuration filters, the system exits offset generation without creating any offsets.
> 3. System calculates auto offset weekly amounts for each claim payable period using the formula: (Payable Period Approved Gross Benefit Amount) / (Proration Rate) / (Calculated Payable Duration in weeks), with results rounded to two decimal places.
> 4. System generates auto-offset draft records for each overlapping period between payable periods and applicable allocations, capturing offset type, offset period, proration rate, weekly amount, priority, and associated offset claim.
> 5. System merges consecutive auto-offset drafts that share identical offset weekly amounts and offset claim references into consolidated drafts to optimize offset efficiency.
> 6. System processes drafts in priority order and generates final offset reductions by checking for existing offsets with the same type and overlapping periods.
>   6.1. When an existing offset fully overlaps with a draft period (full overlap scenario), the system does not generate any new offset for that draft.
>   6.2. When an existing offset partially overlaps with a draft period (partial overlap scenario), the system generates offsets only for the non-overlapping sub-periods within the draft period.
>   6.3. When no existing offset overlaps with a draft period (no overlap scenario), the system generates one offset with the offset period equal to the entire draft period.
> 7. System applies priority-based configuration rules spanning nine priority levels, including coverage-specific state offsets (NJTDBSTNJ, NYDBLSTNY, state paid medical/family leave programs), and claim-type offsets (STDSHTM for LTD claims).
> 8. System adds all generated offset reductions to the payment template, making them available for payment calculation and distribution processes.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a disability claim with coverage code NYDBL and claim type STD, **when** the auto offset rule executes, **then** the system retrieves configuration with priority 2 (STNY offset type) and applicable claim types STD and LTD.
> 2. **Given** a payment template with allocations for STD, NYDBL, and LTD claims, and the configuration specifies applicable claim types as 'STD, LTD', **when** filtering allocations, **then** the system identifies only the STD and LTD allocations as applicable, excluding NYDBL.
> 3. **Given** a configuration with applicable claim types specified, but no template allocations match those types, **when** the rule processes step 2, **then** the system exits immediately without executing steps 3-5 and generates zero offsets.
> 4. **Given** a payable period with AGBA of $300, proration rate of 1/5, and calculated payable duration of 15 weeks, **when** calculating auto offset weekly amount, **then** the system returns $100.00 (rounded to two decimals).
> 5. **Given** three consecutive auto-offset drafts with offset weekly amount $100 and offset claim LTD-12345, **when** the system performs draft merging in step 4, **then** the three drafts are consolidated into one draft covering the combined period.
> 6. **Given** an auto-offset draft for period 1-14 Jan and an existing manual offset of type STNY for period 5-10 Jan, **when** the system generates final offsets in step 5, **then** two auto offsets are created covering 1-4 Jan and 11-14 Jan (partial overlap scenario).
> 7. **Given** an auto-offset draft for period 1-14 Jan and an existing offset of type STNY covering the entire period 1-14 Jan, **when** the system checks for overlaps, **then** no new offset is generated (full overlap scenario).
> 8. **Given** an auto-offset draft for period 15-28 Jan and no existing offsets with the same type and overlapping period, **when** the system processes the draft, **then** one offset is created with offset period 15-28 Jan (no overlap scenario).
> 9. **Given** multiple auto-offset drafts with different priority values (priority 2 and priority 8), **when** the system sorts and processes drafts in step 5, **then** lower priority number drafts (priority 2) are processed before higher priority number drafts (priority 8).
> 10. **Given** a disability claim with coverage code NYTDB and claim type Any, **when** the auto offset rule executes, **then** the system applies priority 1 configuration with auto offset type STNJ for STD and LTD applicable claim types.
> 11. **Given** an LTD claim with coverage code Any and no specific state coverage, **when** the auto offset rule executes, **then** the system retrieves priority 9 configuration indicating 'No offset' and generates zero offsets.
> 12. **Given** an STD claim with coverage code Any, **when** processing template allocations, **then** the system applies priority 8 configuration with auto offset type SHTM to LTD applicable claim types only.
> 13. **Given** a claim with two payable periods (1-21 Jan with AGBA $300, 22-28 Jan with AGBA $100), both with proration rate 1/5, **when** calculating offset weekly amounts, **then** both periods yield $100 weekly offset amounts despite different AGBAs due to different payable durations.
> 14. **Given** all generated auto-offset reductions, **when** the rule completes execution, **then** all offsets are added to the payment template as reduction line items with accurate offset type, period, proration rate, and weekly amount attributes.
> 15. **Given** a payment template without any payable periods defined, **when** the auto offset rule executes, **then** the system generates zero offset drafts and exits gracefully without errors.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to calculate AGBA (Adjusted Gross Benefit Amount) based on partial disability type and offsets, so that disability benefit amounts are correctly determined.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: calculate AGBA (Adjusted Gross Benefit Amount) based on partial disability type and offsets
- **Value**: disability benefit amounts are correctly determined

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** calculate AGBA (Adjusted Gross Benefit Amount) based on partial disability type and offsets,
> **so that** disability benefit amounts are correctly determined.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System evaluates claim parameters for each payable period to determine the appropriate AGBA calculation code using a hierarchical, first-match-wins decision logic.
> 2. System applies sequential condition checks in strict order:
>    2.1 Assigns Default Code when partial disability flag is false, partial disability type is 'NONE', or when disability earnings fall below the minimum partial earnings threshold (Prorated Disability Earnings Amount &lt; Prorated Pre-Disability Salary Amount  Minimum Partial Earnings Percentage).
&gt;    2.2 Assigns Zero Code when disability earnings exceed the maximum partial earnings threshold, with support for multi-year indexing scenarios (cumulative indexing percentages applied to pre-disability salary).
>    2.3 Assigns WIB Code when Work Incentive Benefit is marked as 'Included'.
>    2.4 Assigns Direct Offset Code when Partial Disability Type equals 'Direct Offset'.
>    2.5 Assigns Proportionate Loss Code when Partial Disability Type equals 'Proportionate Loss'.
>    2.6 Assigns Loss Of Earnings Code when Partial Disability Type equals 'Loss Of Earnings'.
>    2.7 Defaults to fallback code if no conditions are satisfied.
> 3. System executes the calculation formula corresponding to the selected code:
>    3.1 **Default formula**: AGBA = Prorated Gross Benefit Amount - Offsets.
>    3.2 **Zero formula**: AGBA = 0.
>    3.3 **WIB formula**: If (Prorated Gross Benefit Amount + Offsets + Prorated Disability Earnings Amount)  Prorated Pre-Disability Salary Amount, then AGBA = Prorated Gross Benefit Amount; otherwise AGBA = Prorated Pre-Disability Salary Amount - Offsets - Prorated Disability Earnings Amount.
>    3.4 **Direct Offset formula**: Calculate Disability Offset = Prorated Disability Earnings Amount  Disability Earnings Reduced Percentage, round to two decimal places, then AGBA = Prorated Gross Benefit Amount - Offsets - Disability Offset.
>    3.5 **Proportionate Loss formula**: Calculate Loss Proportion = (Prorated Pre-Disability Salary Amount - Prorated Disability Earnings Amount) / Prorated Pre-Disability Salary Amount, then AGBA = (Prorated Gross Benefit Amount - Offsets)  Loss Proportion.
>    3.6 **Loss Of Earnings formula**: Calculate AGBA using both Direct Offset and Proportionate Loss methods, then select the greater of the two values.
> 4. System applies floor rule to ensure AGBA cannot be negative, setting AGBA = 0 if calculated value is less than zero.
> 5. System handles multi-year indexing scenarios:
>    5.1 For Year 1 or no indexing: applies Maximum Partial Earnings Percentage directly to Prorated Pre-Disability Salary Amount.
>    5.2 For Year 2 with indexing: applies compound calculation using Year 1 indexing percentage.
>    5.3 For Year n with indexing: applies cumulative sum of indexing percentages from Years 1 to n-1.
> 6. System applies product-specific override for GIP Product (UK-specific LTD with locale = en_GB), disabling AGBA calculations entirely.
> 7. System processes all AGBA calculations using prorated amounts, offsets, and earnings data captured during the claim assessment and ongoing review process.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim with Is Partial Disability = FALSE, **when** AGBA calculation is triggered, **then** the system assigns Default Code and calculates AGBA = Prorated Gross Benefit Amount - Offsets.
> 2. **Given** a claim with Prorated Disability Earnings Amount &lt; (Prorated Pre-Disability Salary Amount  Minimum Partial Earnings Percentage), **when** the minimum threshold is configured, **then** the system assigns Default Code and provides full non-partial benefit.
&gt; 3. **Given** a claim with Prorated Disability Earnings Amount > (Prorated Pre-Disability Salary Amount  Maximum Partial Earnings Percentage) in Year 1, **when** no indexing is applied, **then** the system assigns Zero Code and sets AGBA = 0.
> 4. **Given** a claim in Year 2 with Indexing of Monthly Earnings = Yes, **when** Prorated Disability Earnings Amount exceeds indexed threshold (Prorated Pre-Disability Salary Amount  (1 + Indexing % Year 1)  Maximum Partial Earnings Percentage), **then** the system assigns Zero Code and sets AGBA = 0.
> 5. **Given** a claim with Work Incentive Benefit = 'Included', **when** (Prorated Gross Benefit Amount + Offsets + Prorated Disability Earnings Amount)  Prorated Pre-Disability Salary Amount, **then** AGBA equals Prorated Gross Benefit Amount (full benefit preserved).
> 6. **Given** a claim with Work Incentive Benefit = 'Included', **when** (Prorated Gross Benefit Amount + Offsets + Prorated Disability Earnings Amount) > Prorated Pre-Disability Salary Amount, **then** AGBA = Prorated Pre-Disability Salary Amount - Offsets - Prorated Disability Earnings Amount.
> 7. **Given** a claim with Partial Disability Type = 'Direct Offset', **when** AGBA is calculated, **then** the system computes Disability Offset = Prorated Disability Earnings Amount  Disability Earnings Reduced Percentage, rounds to two decimal places, and calculates AGBA = Prorated Gross Benefit Amount - Offsets - Disability Offset.
> 8. **Given** a claim with Partial Disability Type = 'Proportionate Loss', **when** AGBA is calculated, **then** the system computes Loss Proportion = (Prorated Pre-Disability Salary Amount - Prorated Disability Earnings Amount) / Prorated Pre-Disability Salary Amount, and AGBA = (Prorated Gross Benefit Amount - Offsets)  Loss Proportion.
> 9. **Given** a claim with Partial Disability Type = 'Loss Of Earnings', **when** AGBA is calculated, **then** the system calculates AGBA using both Direct Offset and Proportionate Loss formulas and selects the greater value.
> 10. **Given** any calculation code, **when** the calculated AGBA value is negative, **then** the system applies the floor rule and sets AGBA = 0.
> 11. **Given** a GIP Product claim with locale = en_GB, **when** AGBA calculation is triggered, **then** the system bypasses all AGBA calculations entirely (product-specific override).
> 12. **Given** a claim in Year n with indexing enabled, **when** evaluating Maximum Partial Earnings threshold, **then** the system applies cumulative indexing percentages: Prorated Pre-Disability Salary Amount  (1 + Sum of Indexing % Years 1 to n-1).
> 13. **Given** multiple conditions that could match, **when** AGBA calculation code is determined, **then** the system selects the first matching condition in hierarchical order (Default > Zero > WIB > Direct Offset > Proportionate Loss > Loss Of Earnings).
> 14. **Given** a claim missing required data elements (e.g., Prorated Gross Benefit Amount, Prorated Disability Earnings Amount, or Prorated Pre-Disability Salary Amount), **when** AGBA calculation is triggered, **then** the system produces an error or validation failure preventing calculation.
> 15. **Given** a claim with WIB included but WIB duration is missing, **when** AGBA calculation is triggered, **then** the system behavior is undefined (OPEN QUESTION - requires clarification on error handling, default duration, or unlimited duration treatment).

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to handle ASO (Administrative Services Only) claims with ATP and ATP with Check payment types, so that I can process self-funded group claims correctly.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: handle ASO (Administrative Services Only) claims with ATP and ATP with Check payment types
- **Value**: I can process self-funded group claims correctly according to the service arrangement and funding method

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** handle ASO (Administrative Services Only) claims with ATP and ATP with Check payment types,
> **so that** I can process self-funded group claims correctly according to the service arrangement and funding method.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System identifies claims with ASO indicator and displays special handling type (ATP or ATP with Check) on Claim Overview header to alert the adjuster of the service arrangement.
> 2. User creates payment records for ASO claims, with the system automatically tagging payment items with the appropriate ASO type indicator throughout the UI.
> 3. User updates payment information as needed during claim adjudication process.
> 4. System processes payments according to ASO type:
>    4.1. **ATP (Advice to Pay) Flow**: When ASO Type is ATP, the carrier calculates payment amount but does NOT issue payment to claimant.
>       4.1.1. User can create and update payment normally through standard workflow.
>       4.1.2. When payment status reaches 'Approved', system automatically hides 'Request Issue' action from UI to prevent payment issuance.
>       4.1.3. System calculates payment amount but does NOT send payment request to payment hub.
>       4.1.4. Employer receives payment determination information and manages actual payment to claimant directly.
>    4.2. **ATP with Check Flow**: When ASO Type is ATP with Check, carrier provides full claim management including payment issuance.
>       4.2.1. User can create, update, and issue payment through complete payment lifecycle.
>       4.2.2. System sends payment request to payment hub with ASO type indicator 'ATP with Check'.
>       4.2.3. **For Direct Billing funding method**: Payment hub issues payment from carrier funds; system integrates with Employer Management Portal to send notification task to employer; carrier receives reimbursement from employer after payment.
>       4.2.4. **For Alternative Account funding method**: Payment is drawn directly from employer-funded bank account; system sends ASO type indicator to payment hub for proper account handling.
> 5. System manages special handling restrictions:
>    5.1. ASO special handling indicator cannot be manually removed from UI once set on a claim.
>    5.2. For unsupported products (Life, Critical Illness, Hospital Indemnity, Health Insurance, Accident), special handling values can be set manually in UI, but ASO claim payment processing functionality is NOT supported due to unpredictable claims and higher severity making ASO arrangements uncommon.
> 6. System displays ASO Type tags on payment records in Payment List UI and throughout payment workflow to distinguish ATP from ATP with Check payments for operational clarity.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim is designated as ASO, **when** the Claims Adjuster views the Claim Overview screen, **then** the system displays the special handling indicator (ATP or ATP with Check) in the claim header.
> 2. **Given** an ASO claim exists, **when** the adjuster creates a payment record, **then** the system automatically tags the payment item with the corresponding ASO type (ATP or ATP with Check) visible throughout the payment UI.
> 3. **Given** a payment for an ASO claim with ATP type, **when** the payment status reaches 'Approved', **then** the system hides the 'Request Issue' action from the UI and does NOT send the payment to the payment hub.
> 4. **Given** a payment for an ASO claim with ATP type is approved, **when** the system processes the payment, **then** the payment amount is calculated and recorded, but no actual payment issuance occurs, and the employer is provided with payment determination information.
> 5. **Given** a payment for an ASO claim with ATP with Check type, **when** the adjuster requests payment issuance, **then** the system sends the payment request to the payment hub with the ASO type indicator 'ATP with Check'.
> 6. **Given** an ATP with Check payment with Direct Billing funding method, **when** the payment is issued, **then**:
>    6.1. The payment hub issues payment from carrier funds.
>    6.2. The system sends a notification task to the employer via the Employer Management Portal.
>    6.3. The system tracks the reimbursement due from employer to carrier.
> 7. **Given** an ATP with Check payment with Alternative Account funding method, **when** the payment is issued, **then** the payment is drawn directly from the employer-funded bank account with ASO type indicator sent to payment hub.
> 8. **Given** an ASO special handling is set on a claim, **when** the adjuster attempts to remove it via UI, **then** the system prevents removal of the special handling indicator.
> 9. **Given** a claim for an unsupported product (Life, Critical Illness, Hospital Indemnity, Health Insurance, or Accident), **when** the adjuster manually sets ATP or ATP with Check special handling values, **then** the values are stored but ASO payment processing functionality does NOT execute.
> 10. **Given** multiple ASO payments exist, **when** the adjuster views the Payment List UI, **then** the system displays ASO type tags on each payment record to clearly distinguish between ATP and ATP with Check payment types.
> 11. **Given** supported products (Disability, Leave, Dental, Vision), **when** ASO claims are processed, **then** full ASO payment functionality is available and executes correctly according to the ASO type.
> 12. **Given** an ATP payment is in any pre-approved status, **when** the adjuster updates payment information, **then** the system allows normal payment updates without restriction.
> 13. **Given** integration with payment hub, **when** an ATP with Check payment is sent, **then** the payment hub receives the ASO type indicator and processes payment according to the specified funding method within expected service level agreements.

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want the system to automatically handle underpayment approval and issuance workflows, so that underpayments are processed efficiently with proper authority validation.
- **Role**: Claims Operations Manager
- **Action**: automatically handle underpayment approval and issuance workflows with proper authority validation and external payment system integration
- **Value**: underpayments are processed efficiently with minimal manual intervention, proper compliance controls, and seamless payment dispatch

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Operations Manager,
> **I want to** automatically handle underpayment approval and issuance workflows with proper authority validation and external payment system integration,
> **so that** underpayments are processed efficiently with minimal manual intervention, proper compliance controls, and seamless payment dispatch.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. System automatically initiates underpayment workflow when standard underpayments or withholding underpayments are generated from claim settlement activities.",
>   "2. **Phase 1: Approval Process**",
>   "   2.1. System evaluates underpayment against predefined business rules to determine if automatic approval is permitted based on amount thresholds, claim characteristics, and authority matrices.",
>   "   2.2. When auto-approval criteria are met, system automatically approves underpayment and transitions status without human intervention.",
>   "   2.3. When auto-approval criteria are not met, system creates user task for manual approval and suspends process pending adjudicator review.",
>   "3. **Phase 2: Issuance Process**",
>   "   3.1. Scheduled Payment Issue Job retrieves all underpayments in approved status.",
>   "   3.2. System initiates issuance workflow by executing payment request lifecycle command.",
>   "   3.3. System generates dispatch request payload for Payment Hub using standardized format rules and validates completeness and accuracy.",
>   "   3.4. Upon successful validation, system dispatches payment request to external Payment Hub for fund transfer execution.",
>   "   3.5. System evaluates dispatch outcome to confirm successful transmission.",
>   "4. **Alternate Path: Request Validation Failure**",
>   "   4.1. When generated request fails validation checks, system cancels the underpayment and creates notification task to alert users of cancellation with reason details.",
>   "5. **Alternate Path: Dispatch Failure**",
>   "   5.1. When Payment Hub dispatch fails or times out, system marks issuance as failed and records failure status for investigation and retry.",
>   "6. System maintains complete audit trail of all approval decisions, validation results, dispatch attempts, and status transitions throughout the workflow."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** an underpayment is generated from claim settlement, **when** the approval rules evaluate the underpayment, **then** the system determines approval path within 5 seconds and either auto-approves or creates manual approval task.",
>   "2. **Given** an underpayment meets auto-approval criteria, **when** approval rules execute, **then** the system transitions underpayment status to 'Approved' and makes it available for the Payment Issue Job without manual intervention.",
>   "3. **Given** an underpayment requires manual approval, **when** the system evaluates approval status, **then** a user task 'Underpayment Approval Required' is created and assigned to appropriate authority level, and the process suspends until manual action is completed.",
>   "4. **Given** the Payment Issue Job runs on schedule, **when** approved underpayments exist, **then** the system retrieves all underpayments with 'Approved' status and initiates issuance workflow for each.",
>   "5. **Given** an approved underpayment enters issuance phase, **when** dispatch request is generated, **then** the system validates all required fields (payee information, amount, payment method, claim reference) are present and correctly formatted.",
>   "6. **Given** a dispatch request passes validation, **when** the system sends the request to Payment Hub, **then** the request is successfully transmitted and the system records dispatch timestamp and confirmation.",
>   "7. **Given** a dispatch request fails validation, **when** the system detects missing or invalid data, **then** the underpayment is canceled, status is updated to 'Canceled', and a user task 'Underpayment Canceled' is created with specific validation failure details.",
>   "8. **Given** Payment Hub dispatch fails, **when** the system evaluates dispatch outcome, **then** the underpayment status is updated to 'Failed', the failure is logged with error details, and the underpayment remains available for retry or manual intervention.",
>   "9. **Given** a dispatch is successfully transmitted to Payment Hub, **when** confirmation is received, **then** the underpayment status transitions to 'Issued' and the process completes successfully.",
>   "10. **Given** any status transition occurs during the workflow, **when** the change is executed, **then** the system records timestamp, user/system actor, previous status, new status, and reason in the audit trail.",
>   "11. **Given** multiple underpayments of different types (standard and withholding), **when** they enter the approval workflow, **then** the system applies appropriate business rules based on underpayment type and processes each independently.",
>   "12. **Given** the Payment Issue Job runs, **when** no approved underpayments exist, **then** the job completes without errors and logs that no underpayments were available for processing."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to generate self-balance transactions for overpaid and underpaid items, so that claim balances are automatically reconciled.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: generate self-balance transactions for overpaid and underpaid items
- **Value**: claim balances are automatically reconciled

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** generate self-balance transactions for overpaid and underpaid items,
> **so that** claim balances are automatically reconciled.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. System generates balance amount allocation items for each balance using transaction direction set as not defined to capture all balance discrepancies.",
>   "2. System identifies and categorizes payment discrepancies:",
>   "  2.1. Overpaid items where scheduled amount is less than actual balanced amount.",
>   "  2.2. Underpaid items where scheduled amount exceeds actual balanced amount.",
>   "3. System calculates self-balance amounts by:",
>   "  3.1. Computing total overpaid amount as the sum of differences between actual and scheduled amounts for overpaid items.",
>   "  3.2. Computing total underpaid amount as the sum of differences between scheduled and actual amounts for underpaid items.",
>   "  3.3. Calculating suspense balance from outgoing and incoming suspense items.",
>   "  3.4. Adjusting overpaid/underpaid amounts based on suspense balances (positive suspense increases overpaid, negative suspense increases underpaid).",
>   "  3.5. Determining final self-balance amount as the minimum of adjusted overpaid and underpaid amounts.",
>   "4. System creates a payment transaction with incoming direction, current timestamp, payee registry ID, and payee role.",
>   "5. System processes overpaid items by:",
>   "  5.1. Setting transaction net amount to the calculated self-balance amount.",
>   "  5.2. Generating allocations and financial adjustments for each overpaid item based on allocation type (Gross, Interest, Rehab, Deductions, Offsets, Taxes).",
>   "  5.3. Creating suspense allocations for any unallocated payment amounts remaining after processing.",
>   "6. System processes underpaid items by:",
>   "  6.1. Setting transaction net amount to negative of the calculated self-balance amount.",
>   "  6.2. Generating allocations and financial adjustments for each underpaid item.",
>   "  6.3. Creating suspense allocations with negative amounts for any unallocated payment amounts.",
>   "7. System finalizes the transaction by setting net amount to zero USD to ensure balanced state.",
>   "8. For each allocation item, system:",
>   "  8.1. Locates or creates allocations matching payable item, deduction details, and interest-only flags.",
>   "  8.2. Calculates amount to allocate respecting transaction remaining amount limits and item discrepancy amounts.",
>   "  8.3. Applies amounts based on type: direct application for gross amounts, creation of addition/reduction/tax objects with split results for other types.",
>   "  8.4. Generates accumulator details for allocations.",
>   "  8.5. Updates transaction remaining amount and balance item actual amounts accordingly.",
>   "9. System filters balance amount allocation items by:",
>   "  9.1. Excluding REHAB, OFFSET, and WITHHOLDING types to prevent duplication and exclude future-only items.",
>   "  9.2. Applying transaction direction filters (incoming for underpaid, outgoing for overpaid).",
>   "  9.3. Sorting by payment date in ascending order.",
>   "10. System matches actual and adjustment payment allocations to balance items for accurate reconciliation tracking."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** a balance with overpaid items (actualBalancedAmount > scheduledAmount) and underpaid items (scheduledAmount > actualBalancedAmount),\n   **When** the self-balance transaction generation process executes,\n   **Then** the system creates a single payment transaction with direction='incoming' and initial net amount equal to the minimum of total overpaid and underpaid amounts.",
>   "2. **Given** balance amount allocation items are generated,\n   **When** filtering by type,\n   **Then** items with type REHAB, OFFSET, or WITHHOLDING are excluded from the results.",
>   "3. **Given** suspense balances exist (outgoing minus incoming suspense amounts  0),\n   **When** calculating self-balance amount,\n   **Then** positive suspense balance is added to overpaid amount and negative suspense balance absolute value is added to underpaid amount.",
>   "4. **Given** overpaid items are being processed,\n   **When** generating allocations,\n   **Then** the system:\n     - Sets allocation gross amount directly for Gross type items\n     - Creates addition objects with split results for INTEREST and REHAB types\n     - Creates reduction objects with negative split results for DEDUCTION and OFFSET types\n     - Creates tax objects with negative split results for FEDERAL, STATE, and FICA types.",
>   "5. **Given** not all payment amount was allocated after processing overpaid items,\n   **When** completing overpaid item processing,\n   **Then** the system generates one additional allocation with allocationType='SUSPENSE' and allocationNetAmount equal to the unallocated amount.",
>   "6. **Given** not all payment amount was allocated after processing underpaid items,\n   **When** completing underpaid item processing,\n   **Then** the system generates one additional allocation with allocationType='SUSPENSE' and allocationNetAmount equal to negative one times the unallocated amount.",
>   "7. **Given** allocations are being created for a balance amount allocation item,\n   **When** an allocation with identical payable item, deduction details, and interest-only flag already exists,\n   **Then** the system reuses the existing allocation instead of creating a duplicate.",
>   "8. **Given** allocations are being created for a balance amount allocation item,\n   **When** no matching allocation exists,\n   **Then** the system creates a new allocation with allocationType='ADJUSTMENT' and sets payable item, deduction details, interest-only flag, and payment number.",
>   "9. **Given** amount to allocate is being calculated,\n   **When** rounding to two decimal places,\n   **Then** the amount equals the minimum of absolute transaction remaining amount and absolute difference between actual balanced and scheduled amounts, with sign based on transaction remaining amount direction.",
>   "10. **Given** calculated amount to allocate equals zero,\n    **When** processing the allocation item,\n    **Then** the system skips generation of allocation and financial adjustments and proceeds to the next item.",
>   "11. **Given** allocation amounts have been applied,\n    **When** updating balance item actual amounts,\n    **Then** for outgoing transactions the actual balanced amount increases by the allocated amount, and for incoming transactions it decreases by the allocated amount.",
>   "12. **Given** all overpaid and underpaid items have been processed,\n    **When** finalizing the self-balance transaction,\n    **Then** the transaction net amount is set to 0 USD indicating a fully balanced state.",
>   "13. **Given** balance amount allocation items are generated,\n    **When** ordering the results,\n    **Then** items are sorted by payment date in ascending order to ensure earliest payments are balanced first.",
>   "14. **Given** DEDUCTION type items are being processed,\n    **When** creating reduction objects,\n    **Then** the deductionType is set to the item's sub type value.",
>   "15. **Given** FICA type tax items are being processed,\n    **When** creating tax objects,\n    **Then** the ficaType is set to the item's sub type value.",
>   "16. **Given** transaction remaining amount is positive,\n    **When** calculating amount to allocate,\n    **Then** the amount to allocate is positive.",
>   "17. **Given** transaction remaining amount is negative,\n    **When** calculating amount to allocate,\n    **Then** the amount to allocate is negative (negative one times the absolute amount).",
>   "18. **Given** the self-balance transaction process completes,\n    **When** reviewing generated allocations,\n    **Then** accumulator details are generated for each allocation per the 'Case Balance Allocation Amount Accumulator Details Generation (Claim)' rule.",
>   "19. **Given** actual payments and adjusting payments exist for balance items,\n    **When** filtering allocations,\n    **Then** the system matches actual payment allocations and adjustment payment allocations to balance items using the 'BR>Claim Matching Allocations (Claim)' rule.",
>   "20. **Given** adjustment payment allocations are being filtered,\n    **When** identifying relevant adjustments,\n    **Then** overpayment withholdings within actual payments are also included in the adjustment allocations."
> ]

>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=594614718"

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manage tax withholdings with type, amount, date range, and claim selection, so that I can ensure correct tax deductions from disability claim payments.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: manage tax withholdings with type, amount, date range, and claim selection
- **Value**: I can ensure correct tax deductions from disability claim payments

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** manage tax withholdings with type, amount, date range, and claim selection,
> **so that** I can ensure correct tax deductions from disability claim payments.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User accesses the Withholdings management interface for an existing event case containing at least one disability claim (STD/SMD or LTD).
> 2. **Add New Withholding**: User creates a new tax withholding entry by:
>    2.1. Selecting the applicable tax type from available options.
>    2.2. Specifying the withholding amount using either a flat dollar amount or a percentage-based calculation.
>       2.2.1. When using percentage-based withholding, user may optionally specify an extra withholding amount.
>    2.3. Defining the effective date range by entering 'From' and 'Through' dates.
>    2.4. Selecting the specific disability claim to which the withholding applies from available claims.
>       2.4.1. If operating at payment level, the claim is automatically preselected and cannot be modified.
>    2.5. Submitting the withholding entry for validation and storage.
> 3. **Edit Existing Withholding**: User modifies previously configured withholding entries by:
>    3.1. Selecting the withholding entry to edit.
>    3.2. Updating any of the previously entered fields (tax type, amount, dates, claim association).
>    3.3. Saving the changes, which are subject to the same validation rules as new entries.
> 4. **Remove Withholding**: User deletes withholding entries that are no longer applicable by:
>    4.1. Initiating the removal action for a selected withholding entry.
>    4.2. Confirming the removal through a system prompt.
>       4.2.1. If removal is not confirmed, the action is cancelled without changes.
>    4.3. The system removes the entry and updates the withholdings list.
> 5. **Validation and Persistence**: Upon submission of add or edit actions, the system validates all business rules and saves the withholding configuration, making it immediately effective for payment processing.
> 6. All withholding entries are displayed in the Withholdings interface, providing a complete view of tax deductions configured for the case.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster with 'CAP>Case: Update Taxes Details (Withholdings and YTD Earnings)' privilege accesses an event case with at least one disability claim,
>    **When** they initiate the Add Withholding action,
>    **Then** the system displays the Add Withholding form with all required fields (Tax Type, Tax Amount, Withholding From date, Withholding Through date, Claim selection).
>
> 2. **Given** the Add Withholding form is open,
>    **When** the user enters a flat dollar Tax Amount,
>    **Then** the system allows selection of only one disability claim from the dropdown containing STD/SMD/LTD claims.
>
> 3. **Given** the Add Withholding form is open,
>    **When** the user selects percentage-based Tax Amount entry,
>    **Then** the system displays an optional 'Extra Withholding' field for additional flat amount entry.
>
> 4. **Given** the user enters percentage-based Tax Amount with an Extra Withholding value greater than 0,
>    **When** they attempt to select multiple claims,
>    **Then** the system restricts selection to only one claim.
>
> 5. **Given** the user is operating at payment level (claim-specific context),
>    **When** the Add Withholding form is displayed,
>    **Then** the claim field is preselected with the current claim and is non-editable.
>
> 6. **Given** the user completes all required fields correctly,
>    **When** they submit the withholding entry,
>    **Then** the system validates the data, saves the withholding record, and displays it in the Withholdings UI within 2 seconds.
>
> 7. **Given** the user submits a withholding entry with missing mandatory fields (Type, Period, Amount, or Claim),
>    **When** validation occurs,
>    **Then** the system returns inline error messages identifying the missing fields and prevents submission.
>
> 8. **Given** the user enters both flat dollar Amount AND percentage Amount simultaneously,
>    **When** validation occurs,
>    **Then** the system returns an error message indicating these fields are mutually exclusive and prevents submission.
>
> 9. **Given** an existing withholding entry is displayed,
>    **When** the user clicks the edit icon,
>    **Then** the system opens the edit form with all previously entered values pre-populated.
>
> 10. **Given** the user modifies fields in the edit form and saves changes,
>     **When** validation passes,
>     **Then** the system updates the withholding record and reflects the changes immediately in the Withholdings UI.
>
> 11. **Given** an existing withholding entry is displayed,
>     **When** the user clicks the Remove icon and confirms the removal,
>     **Then** the system deletes the withholding record and updates the list to exclude the removed entry.
>
> 12. **Given** the user initiates withholding removal,
>     **When** the confirmation prompt is displayed and the user cancels the action,
>     **Then** the system closes the prompt without making any changes and the withholding remains in the list.
>
> 13. **Given** the user enters date values using the calendar widget or manual entry,
>     **When** both 'From' and 'Through' dates are provided,
>     **Then** the system accepts the date range if 'Through' date is equal to or after 'From' date.
>
> 14. **Given** multiple withholding entries exist for a case,
>     **When** the user views the Withholdings UI,
>     **Then** the system displays all configured withholdings with complete details (type, amount, date range, associated claim).
>
> 15. **Given** the user attempts to save a withholding with validation errors,
>     **When** the error messages are displayed,
>     **Then** the user can correct the errors and resubmit without losing other entered data.

## Initiative: Claims Adjustment & Recalculation

### Epic: Financial Adjustments & Settlement Management

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to add and edit prior earnings for state-mandated disability claims, so that I can accurately calculate covered weekly earnings and trigger claim recalculation.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: add, edit, and remove prior earnings records for state-mandated disability claims (NYDBL, NJTDB, MAPML)
- **Value**: covered weekly earnings and gross benefit amounts are accurately calculated and the claim is properly re-adjudicated to ensure correct settlement values

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** add, edit, and remove prior earnings records for state-mandated disability claims (NYDBL, NJTDB, MAPML),
> **so that** covered weekly earnings and gross benefit amounts are accurately calculated and the claim is properly re-adjudicated to ensure correct settlement values.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Adjuster accesses the Prior Earnings UI on the SMP claim overview page to manage earnings records.
> 2. For adding new prior earnings:
>   2.1 Adjuster initiates the Add Earnings form and provides earnings details including week/quarter number, ending date, days/weeks worked, and gross amount paid.
>   2.2 System validates the entered data and creates the new prior earnings record.
>   2.3 System automatically triggers claim re-adjudication and recalculates Covered Weekly Earnings and GBA values.
>   2.4 System refreshes the display to show the new record and updated calculated values in the Earnings and Coverages sections.
> 3. For editing existing prior earnings:
>   3.1 Adjuster selects an existing prior earnings record for modification.
>   3.2 System displays the record in edit mode with pre-populated field values.
>   3.3 Adjuster updates the necessary fields and saves the changes.
>   3.4 System validates the updates, triggers claim re-adjudication, and recalculates settlement values.
>   3.5 System refreshes the display to reflect the updated record and recalculated earnings values.
> 4. For removing prior earnings:
>   4.1 Adjuster initiates removal of an existing prior earnings record.
>   4.2 System prompts for confirmation to prevent accidental deletion.
>   4.3 Upon confirmation, system removes the record, triggers claim re-adjudication, and recalculates settlement values.
>   4.4 System updates the display to show the revised earnings list and recalculated values.
> 5. System displays prior earnings in the format appropriate to the coverage type: by weeks for NYDBL and NJTDB claims, or by quarters for MAPML claims.
> 6. All earnings modifications immediately impact downstream financial calculations and are reflected in both the Earnings section (Covered Weekly Earnings) and Coverages section (GBA).


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster with PRIV>CAP>Update Loss privilege accessing an SMP claim, **When** the adjuster adds a new prior earnings record with valid week/quarter number, ending date, days/weeks worked, and gross amount paid, **Then** the system creates the record, triggers claim re-adjudication, recalculates Covered Weekly Earnings and GBA, and displays the updated values within the Earnings and Coverages sections.
> 2. **Given** an SMP claim with NYDBL or NJTDB coverage, **When** the adjuster views the Prior Earnings UI, **Then** the system displays prior earnings records organized by weeks.
> 3. **Given** an SMP claim with MAPML coverage, **When** the adjuster views the Prior Earnings UI, **Then** the system displays prior earnings records organized by quarters.
> 4. **Given** an existing prior earnings record on an SMP claim, **When** the adjuster clicks the edit icon and modifies any field values, **Then** the system validates the changes, updates the record, triggers claim re-adjudication, recalculates Covered Weekly Earnings and GBA, and displays the updated values.
> 5. **Given** an existing prior earnings record on an SMP claim, **When** the adjuster initiates removal and confirms the deletion, **Then** the system removes the record, triggers claim re-adjudication, recalculates Covered Weekly Earnings and GBA based on remaining records, and refreshes the display.
> 6. **Given** an adjuster attempting to remove a prior earnings record, **When** the removal is initiated, **Then** the system displays a confirmation dialog requiring explicit approval before proceeding with the deletion.
> 7. **Given** an adjuster without PRIV>CAP>Update Loss privilege, **When** the adjuster attempts to add, edit, or remove prior earnings, **Then** the system prevents the operation and displays appropriate authorization error.
> 8. **Given** multiple prior earnings records exist on a claim, **When** any record is added, edited, or removed, **Then** the system recalculates the total Covered Weekly Earnings and GBA values based on all remaining records and applicable business rules.
> 9. **Given** an adjuster is editing a prior earnings record, **When** the adjuster cancels the operation before saving, **Then** the system discards the changes and returns the record to its original state without triggering recalculation.
> 10. **Given** invalid or incomplete data is entered in the prior earnings form, **When** the adjuster attempts to save, **Then** the system displays validation errors and prevents the record from being saved until corrections are made.
