#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manage offsets (add, edit, remove) on disability claims, so that I can ensure accurate benefit calculations by accounting for income from other sources.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: manage offsets (add, edit, remove) on disability claims
- **Value**: I can ensure accurate benefit calculations by accounting for income from other sources

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** manage offsets (add, edit, remove) on disability claims,
> **so that** I can ensure accurate benefit calculations by accounting for income from other sources.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates the offset management process from the Offsets UI on the Claim Overview page.
> 2. User adds a new offset by providing required information:
>    2.1 User selects the type of offset being applied.
>    2.2 User specifies the offset beginning date and through date.
>    2.3 User enters the offset amount.
>    2.4 User selects the prorating rate for calculation purposes.
> 3. System validates all entered offset data to ensure accuracy and completeness.
> 4. System updates the claim with the new offset information and displays it on the Offsets UI.
> 5. User modifies existing offsets when circumstances change:
>    5.1 User selects an existing offset record for editing.
>    5.2 System presents the Edit Offset form with pre-filled data from the original offset entry.
>    5.3 User updates the necessary fields (type, dates, amount, or prorating rate).
>    5.4 User submits the updated offset information.
>    5.5 System validates changes, updates the claim, and reflects the modifications on the Offsets UI.
> 6. All offset changes are applied to the claim's benefit calculations to ensure accurate payment amounts.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster with PRIV>CAP>Update Loss privilege is logged in and viewing a disability claim,
>    **When** the user accesses the Offsets UI on Claim Overview,
>    **Then** the system displays the Add Offset option and any existing offsets with edit capabilities.
>
> 2. **Given** the user initiates the Add Offset process,
>    **When** the Add Offset form is opened,
>    **Then** the system presents all required fields: Offset Type (selection), Beginning Date (calendar/manual entry), Through Date (calendar/manual entry), Offset Amount (manual entry), and Prorating Rate (selection).
>
> 3. **Given** the user completes all required fields in the Add Offset form with valid data,
>    **When** the user submits the form,
>    **Then** the system validates the data, updates the claim, and displays the newly added offset on the Offsets UI.
>
> 4. **Given** the user submits an Add Offset form with invalid or incomplete data,
>    **When** validation occurs,
>    **Then** the system prevents claim update and displays appropriate error messages indicating which fields require correction.
>
> 5. **Given** an offset already exists on the claim,
>    **When** the user clicks the Edit Icon on the Offsets UI,
>    **Then** the system opens the Edit Offset form with all fields pre-filled with the current offset data.
>
> 6. **Given** the user modifies one or more fields in the Edit Offset form,
>    **When** the user submits the changes,
>    **Then** the system validates the updated data, updates the claim record, and displays the modified offset information on the Offsets UI.
>
> 7. **Given** a user without PRIV>CAP>Update Loss privilege attempts to access offset management functions,
>    **When** the user views the Claim Overview,
>    **Then** the system does not display Add or Edit offset options.
>
> 8. **Given** multiple offsets exist on a single claim,
>    **When** the Offsets UI is displayed,
>    **Then** all offsets are shown with their respective details (type, dates, amount, prorating rate) and individual edit capabilities.
>
> 9. **Given** an offset has been successfully added or edited,
>    **When** the claim's benefit calculation is performed,
>    **Then** the system applies the offset amount according to the specified prorating rate and date range to ensure accurate payment amounts.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to add and edit deductions (child support, wage garnishment, etc.) at the case or claim level, so that I can withhold benefits to be paid to third parties.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: add, edit, and remove deductions (child support, wage garnishment, etc.) at the case or claim level
- **Value**: benefits can be withheld and paid to third parties according to legal or contractual obligations

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** add, edit, and remove deductions (child support, wage garnishment, etc.) at the case or claim level,
> **so that** benefits can be withheld and paid to third parties according to legal or contractual obligations.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User initiates deduction addition from the Deductions interface on either the case overview or claim overview page (based on payment level configuration).",
>   "2. User selects the deduction type and completes type-specific requirements:",
>   "   2.1. For Child Support: System displays mandatory State field for selection.",
>   "   2.2. For Child Support or Wage Garnishment: System displays mandatory 'Deduction Paid To' field for third-party selection.",
>   "   2.3. For other deduction types: State and Deduction Paid To fields are hidden.",
>   "3. User specifies the deduction paid to party (related to the case), deduction period (via calendar selection or manual entry), and pre-tax application preference.",
>   "4. User selects the deduction amount type and enters the corresponding value:",
>   "   4.1. Weekly, Monthly, or Fixed: User enters positive monetary amount.",
>   "   4.2. Percentage: User enters percentage value within 0-100 range.",
>   "5. User selects which claim(s) the deduction applies to, subject to validation rules:",
>   "   5.1. For Flat amount deductions: Only single claim selection allowed.",
>   "   5.2. For multiple claims: Weekly, Monthly, or Fixed amount type required.",
>   "   5.3. For Life, CI, or HI claims: Only Flat dollar amount and Child Support or Wage Garnishment types allowed.",
>   "6. User submits the deduction; system validates for duplicate deductions (same type and overlapping dates), calculates deduction payment per business rules, and updates absence loss records.",
>   "7. System displays the newly added deduction in the Deductions list with all configured details visible.",
>   "8. User can edit existing case-level deductions by opening the edit screen, modifying fields, and saving changes (claim-level deductions cannot be edited).",
>   "9. User can remove deductions by selecting the remove action, confirming the removal, and system updates the deductions list accordingly."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** a user with 'PRIV>CAP>Case: Update Deduction' privilege accesses an Event Case, **When** they initiate Add Deduction, **Then** the Add Deduction form opens with all required fields available for input.",
>   "2. **Given** a user selects 'Child Support' as the deduction type, **When** the form is displayed, **Then** the mandatory 'State' field appears and must be populated before submission.",
>   "3. **Given** a user selects 'Child Support' or 'Wage Garnishment', **When** the form is displayed, **Then** the mandatory 'Deduction Paid To' field appears and must be populated before submission.",
>   "4. **Given** a user enters a negative amount for Weekly, Monthly, or Fixed deduction amount type, **When** they attempt to save, **Then** the system displays an error message and prevents submission.",
>   "5. **Given** a user selects Percentage as the deduction amount type, **When** they enter a value outside the 0-100 range, **Then** the system displays an error message and prevents submission.",
>   "6. **Given** a user selects a Flat deduction amount, **When** they attempt to select more than one claim, **Then** the system displays error BR>CapFinancialAdjustmentDeduction>Mandatority of deductionAmount and deductionPct and prevents submission.",
>   "7. **Given** a user selects multiple claims, **When** they choose a deduction amount type other than Weekly, Monthly, or Fixed, **Then** the system displays error BR>CapFinancialAdjustmentDeduction>Mandatority of deductionAmount and deductionPct and prevents submission.",
>   "8. **Given** a user selects a Life, CI, or HI claim, **When** they choose a deduction type other than Child Support or Wage Garnishment, **Then** the system displays error BR>CapFinancialAdjustmentDeduction>Mandatority of deductionAmount and deductionPct and prevents submission.",
>   "9. **Given** a user selects a Life, CI, or HI claim, **When** they choose a deduction amount type other than Flat dollar amount, **Then** the system displays error BR>CapFinancialAdjustmentDeduction>Mandatority of deductionAmount and deductionPct and prevents submission.",
>   "10. **Given** a user submits a deduction with the same type and overlapping dates as an existing deduction, **When** validation runs, **Then** the system displays error BR>CapFinancialAdjustmentDeduction>deductionType and deductionTerm validation and prevents submission.",
>   "11. **Given** a user successfully submits a valid deduction, **When** the system processes the submission, **Then** the deduction is saved, absence loss is updated, deduction payment is calculated per BR>Claim Payment Calculation (Claim), and the deduction appears in the Deductions list within 3 seconds.",
>   "12. **Given** a case-level deduction exists, **When** the user clicks the edit icon, **Then** the edit screen opens with all fields pre-populated from the original deduction data.",
>   "13. **Given** a claim-level deduction exists, **When** the user attempts to edit, **Then** the system prevents editing.",
>   "14. **Given** a user edits a case-level deduction and saves changes, **When** validation passes, **Then** the system updates the deduction, recalculates absence loss, and displays the updated deduction in the Deductions list.",
>   "15. **Given** a user clicks the Remove icon on a deduction, **When** the confirmation dialog appears and the user confirms removal, **Then** the system removes the deduction and updates the Deductions list immediately.",
>   "16. **Given** a user clicks the Remove icon on a deduction, **When** the confirmation dialog appears and the user cancels, **Then** the system closes the dialog without removing the deduction.",

>   "18. **Given** the payment level is not set to Event Case, **When** the user views the claim overview page, **Then** the Deductions component is displayed on the claim overview page (while deduction data is saved at case level in the backend).",

#### Feature: As a Claims Examiner, I want to refresh policy data on a claim to reflect policy changes, so that claim eligibility, benefits, and payment calculations are updated automatically.
- **Role**: Claims Examiner
- **Action**: refresh policy data on a claim to reflect policy changes
- **Value**: claim eligibility, benefits, and payment calculations are updated automatically

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Examiner,
> **I want to** refresh policy data on a claim to reflect policy changes,
> **so that** claim eligibility, benefits, and payment calculations are updated automatically.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Claims Examiner initiates policy refresh action from the Claim Overview page for claims with 'Pending' or 'Open' status.
> 2. System validates the Date of Loss (DOL) and checks for the existence of a new policy version applicable to the claim.
>    2.1. If no new policy version is found, system displays informational message and ends the process without updates.
> 3. When a new policy version is identified, system presents a confirmation modal displaying the new policy version number and provides a link to view detailed policy changes via Policy History comparison.
> 4. Claims Examiner reviews policy changes and decides whether to proceed.
>    4.1. If examiner cancels the action, policy refresh workflow is not triggered and process ends without updates.
> 5. Upon confirmation, system triggers policy refresh workflow and re-integrates current policy data with the claim.
> 6. System performs comprehensive recalculation cascade including: re-running eligibility rules based on updated waiting periods and incurral periods, updating accumulators based on new benefit maximums and time periods, recalculating Gross Benefit Amount (GBA) using updated benefit schedules and face values.
>    6.1. If coverage no longer exists under the new policy terms, system sets coverage status to non-eligible instead of recalculating benefits.
> 7. System reschedules payment obligations based on updated benefit amounts and generates balance adjustments where applicable.
> 8. System preserves any manually overridden values on the claim, ensuring examiner adjustments are not automatically replaced by policy data.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim with status 'Pending' or 'Open' and user has PRIV>CAP>Claim UI: Policy Refresh privilege, **when** the Claims Examiner navigates to Claim Overview page, **then** the Policy Refresh button is displayed and enabled.
> 2. **Given** the Claims Examiner clicks Policy Refresh button, **when** system checks for new policy version based on Date of Loss, **then** the check completes within 3 seconds.
> 3. **Given** a new policy version exists for the Date of Loss, **when** system displays confirmation modal, **then** the modal shows the new policy version number, a link to compare policy transactions (latest vs. previous version), and 'Yes' and 'Cancel' action buttons.
> 4. **Given** no new policy version exists for the Date of Loss, **when** system completes the check, **then** a modal displays the message 'No new policy version is found' with a Cancel button, and no claim updates are performed.
> 5. **Given** the confirmation modal is displayed, **when** the Claims Examiner clicks 'Cancel', **then** the policy refresh workflow is not triggered, the modal closes, and the claim data remains unchanged.
> 6. **Given** the Claims Examiner clicks 'Yes' in the confirmation modal, **when** system triggers policy refresh workflow, **then** system re-integrates with the new policy version and initiates claim recalculation.
> 7. **Given** policy data has been refreshed, **when** eligibility rules are re-evaluated, **then** system updates eligibility results based on new waiting periods, incurral periods, and time period configurations.
> 8. **Given** eligibility rules have been re-evaluated, **when** coverage still exists under the new policy, **then** system updates accumulators, recalculates GBA using new benefit schedules, benefit amounts, and reduction schedules, and generates updated Face Value.
> 9. **Given** eligibility rules have been re-evaluated, **when** coverage no longer exists under the new policy, **then** system sets the coverage status to non-eligible and does not recalculate GBA.
> 10. **Given** GBA has been recalculated, **when** payment rescheduling is triggered, **then** system adjusts payment schedules and generates balance entries if payment amounts have changed.
> 11. **Given** the claim contains manually overridden values (e.g., benefit amounts, eligibility dates), **when** policy refresh is executed, **then** all overridden values remain unchanged and are not replaced by policy data.
> 12. **Given** policy changes include modifications to Benefit Schedule (adding or removing benefits), **when** recalculation occurs, **then** system validates existing settlement against new benefits and updates GBA accordingly.
> 13. **Given** policy changes include modifications to Beneficiary information, **when** recalculation occurs, **then** system recalculates payment amount distribution based on updated beneficiary rules.
> 14. **Given** policy changes affect multiple policy-sensitive fields (e.g., Benefit Maximum, Time Period, Benefit Amount) for Accident, Critical Illness, or Hospital Indemnity lines of business, **when** recalculation occurs, **then** system updates accumulators and GBA reflecting all applicable changes.
> 15. **Given** policy changes include First Day Hospitalization modifications for Disability Income line of business, **when** recalculation occurs, **then** system recalculates Through Date based on updated hospitalization rules.
> 16. **Given** the user does not have PRIV>CAP>Claim UI: Policy Refresh privilege, **when** the user navigates to Claim Overview page, **then** the Policy Refresh button is not displayed.
> 17. **Given** the claim status is neither 'Pending' nor 'Open', **when** the user navigates to Claim Overview page, **then** the Policy Refresh button is disabled or not available.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to adjust payment amounts (add or reduce) for pending or approved payments, so that I can correct payment schedules without recreating them.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: adjust payment amounts (add or reduce) for pending or approved payments
- **Value**: I can correct payment schedules without recreating them

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** adjust payment amounts (add or reduce) for pending or approved payments,
> **so that** I can correct payment schedules without recreating them.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Access the payment adjustment function from the Pet Claim Overview Financials - Payments screen for claims with at least one payment in 'Pending Post' or 'Pending Approval' status.
> 2. Initiate the adjustment workflow by selecting 'Adjust Payment' action from the 'Select Payments Action' dropdown.
> 3. Choose adjustment type(s) to apply:
>    3.1. Enable 'Addition' to increase payment amounts by specifying Addition Type, Addition Amount, and Addition Comments.
>    3.2. Enable 'Reduction' to decrease payment amounts by specifying Reduction Type, Reduction Amount, and Reduction Comments.
>    3.3. Apply both addition and reduction simultaneously if business scenario requires offsetting adjustments.
>    3.4. Toggle off either Addition or Reduction checkbox to hide that section and proceed with single adjustment type only.
> 4. Enter required adjustment values to enable the 'Adjust' button (button remains disabled if amounts are not entered).
> 5. Confirm the adjustment action through a confirmation prompt to prevent accidental modifications.
>    5.1. If user cancels at confirmation, return to the adjustment drawer to modify entries or abandon the action.
>    5.2. If user cancels from the adjustment drawer, close the drawer and return to the Payments screen without applying changes.
> 6. System processes and applies adjustments according to Payment Scheduling rules:
>    6.1. For additions: adds the specified amount to the paymentNetAmount of upcoming payments that do not have related actual payments ('Issued' or 'Stop Requested').
>    6.2. For reductions: reduces the specified amount from the paymentNetAmount of upcoming payments that do not have related actual payments ('Issued' or 'Stop Requested').
> 7. Display updated payment information in the payment list, including addition and reduction details for audit and tracking purposes.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster with privilege 'PRIV>CAP>Adjust Payment Schedule Amount' is viewing a claim with payments in 'Pending Post' or 'Pending Approval' status,
>    **When** they access the 'Select Payments Action' dropdown,
>    **Then** the 'Adjust Payment' action is available and clickable.
>
> 2. **Given** the 'Adjust Payment(s)' drawer is displayed,
>    **When** no Addition Amount or Reduction Amount is entered,
>    **Then** the 'Adjust' button remains disabled and cannot be clicked.
>
> 3. **Given** the user has ticked the 'Addition' checkbox,
>    **When** the Addition section is displayed,
>    **Then** the section contains fields for Addition Type, Addition Amount, and Addition Comments.
>
> 4. **Given** the user has ticked the 'Reduction' checkbox,
>    **When** the Reduction section is displayed,
>    **Then** the section contains fields for Reduction Type, Reduction Amount, and Reduction Comments.
>
> 5. **Given** the user has entered a valid Addition Amount or Reduction Amount,
>    **When** the system validates the entry,
>    **Then** the 'Adjust' button becomes enabled.
>
> 6. **Given** the user clicks the 'Adjust' button,
>    **When** the confirmation popup appears with message 'Do you want to adjust the payment?',
>    **Then** the popup displays 'Confirm' and 'Cancel' buttons.
>
> 7. **Given** the user clicks 'Cancel' in the confirmation popup,
>    **When** the system processes the action,
>    **Then** the confirmation window closes and the user remains in the 'Adjust Payment' drawer with previously entered data intact.
>
> 8. **Given** the user clicks 'Confirm' on the adjustment confirmation,
>    **When** the system applies the addition,
>    **Then** the Addition Amount is added to the paymentNetAmount of upcoming payments without related actual payments, and 'Addition' information is displayed in the payment list.
>
> 9. **Given** the user clicks 'Confirm' on the adjustment confirmation,
>    **When** the system applies the reduction,
>    **Then** the Reduction Amount is subtracted from the paymentNetAmount of upcoming payments without related actual payments, and 'Reduction' information is displayed in the payment list.
>
> 10. **Given** a payment has status 'Issued' or 'Stop Requested',
>     **When** the adjustment processing occurs,
>     **Then** that payment is excluded from the adjustment calculation and retains its original paymentNetAmount.
>
> 11. **Given** the user ticks the 'Addition' checkbox to Off after displaying the Addition section,
>     **When** the system updates the UI,
>     **Then** the Addition section is hidden and no addition values are submitted.
>
> 12. **Given** the user ticks the 'Reduction' checkbox to Off after displaying the Reduction section,
>     **When** the system updates the UI,
>     **Then** the Reduction section is hidden and no reduction values are submitted.
>
> 13. **Given** the user clicks 'Cancel' in the 'Adjust Payment(s)' drawer,
>     **When** the system processes the cancellation,
>     **Then** the drawer closes, no adjustments are applied, and the user returns to the Pet Claim Overview UI - Financials - Payments (Claim) screen.
>
> 14. **Given** adjustments have been successfully applied,
>     **When** the user views the payment list,
>     **Then** the updated payment information displays the adjusted amounts and associated addition/reduction details for audit tracking.
>
> 15. **Given** a user without privilege 'PRIV>CAP>Adjust Payment Schedule Amount' attempts to access the adjustment function,
>     **When** they view the 'Select Payments Action' dropdown,
>     **Then** the 'Adjust Payment' action is not displayed or is disabled.
>
> 16. **Given** both Addition and Reduction are selected with valid amounts,
>     **When** the user confirms the adjustment,
>     **Then** the system applies both the addition and reduction according to BR>Rule Engine Payment Scheduling rules (Pet) and reflects net impact in the payment schedule.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to update approval periods (start date, end date, status) for premium waiver settlements, so that I can manage benefit period approvals and track their status.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: update approval periods (start date, end date, status) for premium waiver settlements
- **Value**: I can manage benefit period approvals and track their status

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** update approval periods (start date, end date, status) for premium waiver settlements,
> **so that** I can manage benefit period approvals and track their status.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User opens the approval period modification interface for a selected premium waiver settlement from the List of Settlements.",
>   "2. User updates approval period details by entering:",
>   "   2.1 Approval Period Start Date (must fall within elimination/benefit periods based on approval status)",
>   "   2.2 Approval Period End Date (must be greater than or equal to start date and within benefit period)",
>   "   2.3 Approval Status (select from: To Be Determined, Cancelled, Approved, or Completed)",
>   "3. User submits the updated approval period information.",
>   "4. System validates the approval period data against business rules:",
>   "   4.1 Verifies dates do not overlap with existing approval periods for the same member",
>   "   4.2 Confirms dates fall within elimination and benefit period boundaries based on approval status",
>   "   4.3 Validates approval status transitions follow permitted rules (e.g., Completed only allowed if currently Approved)",
>   "   4.4 Ensures only one approved period exists at a time",
>   "   4.5 Validates against premium waiver accumulator limits",
>   "5. If validation passes, system updates approval period records in the claim management system.",
>   "6. When approval status is set to 'Approved' and specific integration conditions are met, system sends premium waiver data to Billing system for premium suspension processing.",
>   "7. User is returned to the List of Settlements with the updated approval period reflected.",
>   "**Alternate Flow - User Cancels Update:**",
>   "   7.1 If user clicks Cancel button or Close icon, system prompts for confirmation to discard changes.",
>   "   7.2 Upon confirmation, window closes and user returns to List of Settlements without saving changes.",
>   "   7.3 If user declines confirmation, update window remains open.",
>   "**Alternate Flow - Validation Failure:**",
>   "   7.4 If validation fails (date overlaps, invalid date ranges, unauthorized status transitions, or multiple approved periods detected), system displays specific error messages for each failing field.",
>   "   7.5 User must correct validation errors before successfully saving or choose to cancel the operation.",
>   "**Alternate Flow - Billing Integration Not Triggered:**",
>   "   7.6 If approval status is set to 'Approved' but conditions for Billing system integration are not met, system completes the update without triggering external integration while still validating and saving the approval period data."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster accesses a premium waiver settlement, **When** they open the Update Approval Period interface, **Then** the system displays three required fields: Approval Period Start Date (date picker), Approval Period End Date (date picker), and Approval Status (dropdown with options: To Be Determined, Cancelled, Approved, Completed).",
>   "2. **Given** all required fields are populated with valid data, **When** the user clicks Save, **Then** the system updates the approval period records and closes the window within 3 seconds, returning the user to the List of Settlements with updated data displayed.",
>   "3. **Given** the user enters an Approval Period Start Date outside the elimination/benefit period boundaries, **When** they attempt to save, **Then** the system displays an inline validation error message next to the Start Date field and prevents save.",
>   "4. **Given** the user enters an Approval Period End Date that is earlier than the Start Date, **When** they attempt to save, **Then** the system displays a validation error message stating 'End date must be greater than or equal to start date' and prevents save.",
>   "5. **Given** an approval period already exists for the same member with overlapping dates, **When** the user attempts to save the new approval period, **Then** the system displays a validation error message 'Approval periods cannot overlap for the same member' and prevents save.",
>   "6. **Given** the current approval status is 'To Be Determined', **When** the user attempts to change the status to 'Completed', **Then** the system displays a validation error indicating invalid status transition and prevents save.",
>   "7. **Given** the current approval status is 'Approved', **When** the user changes the status to 'Completed' with valid dates, **Then** the system allows the status transition and successfully saves the record.",
>   "8. **Given** multiple approved periods exist for the same member, **When** the user attempts to save a new period with 'Approved' status, **Then** the system displays a validation error message 'Only one approved period allowed at a time' and prevents save.",
>   "9. **Given** the user sets the Approval Status to 'Approved' and all Billing integration conditions are met, **When** the save operation completes, **Then** the system sends premium waiver data to the Billing system for premium suspension processing.",
>   "10. **Given** the user sets the Approval Status to 'Approved' but Billing integration conditions are not met, **When** the save operation completes, **Then** the system updates the approval period without triggering Billing system integration.",
>   "11. **Given** the user has made changes and clicks the Cancel button or Close icon (X), **When** the confirmation popup appears with message 'Are you sure to cancel/close?', **Then**:",
>   "    11.1 If user confirms, the window closes without saving changes and returns to List of Settlements.",
>   "    11.2 If user cancels the popup, the window remains open with entered data intact.",
>   "12. **Given** the approval period data violates PW accumulator limits, **When** the user attempts to save, **Then** the system displays a validation error related to accumulator limits and prevents save.",
>   "13. **Given** any required field (Start Date, End Date, or Approval Status) is left empty, **When** the user attempts to save, **Then** the system displays a validation error indicating required fields are missing and prevents save."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to cancel coverage and undo cancellation with proper accumulator management, so that I can reverse coverage decisions and regenerate payments or overpayment balances as needed.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: cancel coverage and undo cancellation with proper accumulator management
- **Value**: I can reverse coverage decisions and regenerate payments or overpayment balances as needed

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** cancel coverage and undo cancellation with proper accumulator management,
> **so that** I can reverse coverage decisions and regenerate payments or overpayment balances as needed.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. Cancel Coverage operation enables the adjuster to mark coverage as cancelled with mandatory cancellation reason documentation.",
>   "2. Upon cancellation, the system manages accumulators based on payment status:",
>   "   2.1. If settlement is approved but payment is NOT made: Individual and Group Accumulator Reserved Amounts are released (set to $0, Remaining limit increases back).",
>   "   2.2. If payment has been issued: Overpayment Balance is generated equal to the payment amount; Individual and Group Accumulator Used Amounts remain unchanged.",
>   "3. The system executes accumulator clearing to unreserve Reserved Amount back to remaining limit based on settlement and payment allocation status.",
>   "4. For coverage with approved payment records, the system triggers payment rescheduling and hides payment records from UI while retaining them in backend Payment Schedule.",
>   "5. Cancelled coverage is locked and excluded from policy, case, or claim update propagation, re-adjudication/refresh processes, and payment reschedule processes until explicitly restored.",
>   "6. Undo Cancellation operation allows the adjuster to restore cancelled coverage by resetting cancellation indicators and clearing cancellation reason.",
>   "7. Upon undo cancellation, the system restores accumulators based on payment status:",
>   "   7.1. If payment was NOT made: Individual and Group Accumulator Reserved Amounts are restored (Remaining limit decreases).",
>   "   7.2. If payment was approved but NOT issued: Payment must be manually recreated if needed; Individual and Group Accumulator Reserved Amounts are restored.",
>   "   7.3. If payment was issued: Payment remains unchanged; previously generated Overpayment Balance is cleared (Balance=$0); Individual and Group Accumulator Used Amounts remain unchanged.",
>   "8. The system re-adjudicates the settlement to re-run eligibility rules, gross amount calculation, and accumulator limit calculations.",
>   "   8.1. If Override checkbox is checked: System displays overridden eligibility status and overridden Gross Amount instead of re-calculated values.",
>   "9. The system reserves the Gross Amount in the accumulator for restored settlements based on payment allocation status.",
>   "10. The system triggers payment rescheduling and balance adjustment:",
>   "    10.1. For coverage with approved payment records: Calls payment rescheduling and shows previously hidden payment records on UI.",
>   "    10.2. For coverage with issued/failed payment records: Calls recalculation process and removes previously generated overpayment balance amount."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** a settlement is approved but payment is NOT made, **when** the adjuster cancels the coverage with a mandatory cancellation reason, **then** the system sets isCancelled=True, releases Individual and Group Accumulator Reserved Amounts to $0, increases Remaining limits, and locks the coverage from re-adjudication.",
>   "2. **Given** a payment has been issued for the coverage, **when** the adjuster cancels the coverage, **then** the system generates an Overpayment Balance equal to the payment amount and maintains unchanged Individual and Group Accumulator Used Amounts.",
>   "3. **Given** coverage has approved payment records, **when** cancellation is executed, **then** the system calls payment rescheduling process, finds payment allocations where payment status=Approved AND associated settlement's isCancelled=True, and hides these payment records from UI while retaining them in backend Payment Schedule.",
>   "4. **Given** coverage is cancelled, **when** policy, case, or claim updates occur, **then** the cancelled coverage is excluded from update propagation, re-adjudication/refresh processes, and payment reschedule processes.",
>   "5. **Given** a cancelled coverage exists, **when** the adjuster performs Undo Cancellation, **then** the system sets isCancelled=False, clears the cancelReason, and makes cancelReason NOT mandatory.",
>   "6. **Given** payment was NOT made on cancelled coverage, **when** undo cancellation is executed, **then** the system restores Individual and Group Accumulator Reserved Amounts and decreases Remaining limits accordingly.",
>   "7. **Given** payment was issued on cancelled coverage, **when** undo cancellation is executed, **then** the system clears the Overpayment Balance to $0, leaves the issued payment unchanged, and maintains unchanged Individual and Group Accumulator Used Amounts.",
>   "8. **Given** undo cancellation is performed without Override checkbox checked, **when** the system re-adjudicates the settlement, **then** eligibility rules, gross amount calculation, and accumulator limit calculations are re-run and updated values are displayed.",
>   "9. **Given** undo cancellation is performed with Override checkbox checked, **when** the system re-adjudicates the settlement, **then** the system displays the overridden eligibility status and overridden Gross Amount instead of re-calculated values.",
>   "10. **Given** coverage with approved payment records is restored, **when** undo cancellation completes, **then** the system calls payment rescheduling process and shows previously hidden payment records on the UI.",
>   "11. **Given** coverage with issued or failed payment records is restored, **when** undo cancellation completes, **then** the system calls recalculation process and removes the previously generated overpayment balance amount.",
>   "12. **Given** no applicable payment allocations are found during cancellation or undo cancellation, **when** payment processing steps are triggered, **then** the system skips payment rescheduling and balance adjustment steps.",
>   "13. **Given** payment was approved but NOT issued on cancelled coverage, **when** undo cancellation is executed, **then** the payment is not automatically recreated and must be manually recreated if needed, while Individual and Group Accumulator Reserved Amounts are restored."
> ]


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=699244693"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to edit claim coverage data (earnings, GBA, taxable percentage) with override capability, so that I can adjust settlement calculations and trigger re-adjudication.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: edit claim coverage data (earnings, GBA, taxable percentage) with override capability
- **Value**: I can adjust settlement calculations and trigger re-adjudication to ensure accurate benefit payments

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** edit claim coverage data (earnings, GBA, taxable percentage) with override capability,
> **so that** I can adjust settlement calculations and trigger re-adjudication to ensure accurate benefit payments reflect policy terms and claimant circumstances.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Adjuster initiates editing mode for STD Claim coverage data from the Coverage UI section across common elements, taxable percentage, or coverage data subsections.
> 2. System presents coverage fields in context-aware states:
>    2.1 For first-time edits: all fields display in read-only mode pre-populated with settlement result values, with Override checkboxes available for overridable fields.
>    2.2 For subsequent edits: previously overridden fields appear activated with Override checkboxes marked, non-overridden fields remain read-only, and available-for-override fields display unmarked Override checkboxes.
> 3. Adjuster selects specific fields to override by marking corresponding Override checkboxes, which activates those fields for data entry.
> 4. Adjuster enters or modifies values in activated fields according to business requirements.
> 5. Adjuster can revert previously overridden values at any time:
>    5.1 Unmarking the Override checkbox disables editing for that field.
>    5.2 System clears the override value and restores the original settlement result value.
> 6. Upon saving, system validates overridden data against business rules:
>    6.1 If validation succeeds: system initiates automatic re-adjudication via REST>Readjudicate Settlement API.
>    6.2 If validation fails: system displays error messages and allows adjuster to correct data or revert overrides.
> 7. System completes re-adjudication and displays updated and recalculated coverage data in preview mode without requiring manual page refresh.
> 8. All override actions and re-adjudication results are persisted to the claim settlement record.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an adjuster with PRIV>CAP>Adjudicate Settlement privilege and an STD Claim in Pending, Approved, or Disapproved state,
>    **When** the adjuster clicks the Edit icon in any Coverage section,
>    **Then** the system activates editing mode with all fields in read-only state and Override checkboxes displayed for overridable fields.
>
> 2. **Given** editing mode is active for the first time,
>    **When** the adjuster marks an Override checkbox,
>    **Then** the corresponding field becomes editable and accepts user input.
>
> 3. **Given** the adjuster has previously overridden one or more fields,
>    **When** the adjuster re-enters editing mode,
>    **Then** previously overridden fields display as editable with Override checkboxes marked, and non-overridden fields remain read-only.
>
> 4. **Given** an Override checkbox is marked and a field contains an override value,
>    **When** the adjuster unmarks the Override checkbox,
>    **Then** the field becomes read-only, the override value is cleared, and the original settlement result value is restored.
>
> 5. **Given** the adjuster has entered valid override values,
>    **When** the adjuster saves the data,
>    **Then** the system validates the data, initiates re-adjudication via REST>Readjudicate Settlement, and displays recalculated coverage data without manual refresh within 5 seconds.
>
> 6. **Given** the adjuster has entered override values that violate business rules,
>    **When** the adjuster attempts to save,
>    **Then** the system displays specific error messages and prevents re-adjudication until the data is corrected or overrides are reverted.
>
> 7. **Given** re-adjudication has completed successfully,
>    **When** the Coverage UI section refreshes,
>    **Then** all updated and recalculated values are displayed in preview mode with override indicators visible for manually adjusted fields.
>
> 8. **Given** the adjuster does not have PRIV>CAP>Adjudicate Settlement privilege,
>    **When** the adjuster attempts to access the Edit function,
>    **Then** the system denies access and displays an authorization error message.
>
> 9. **Given** an STD Claim settlement does not exist or is in an invalid state,
>    **When** the adjuster attempts to edit coverage data,
>    **Then** the system prevents editing and displays an appropriate state validation message.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manage year-to-date (YTD) earnings by adding, editing, and removing entries, so that I can maintain accurate earnings history for tax withholding calculations.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: add, edit, and remove year-to-date (YTD) earnings entries within an event case or claim
- **Value**: accurate earnings history is maintained for tax withholding calculations and financial settlement processing

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** add, edit, and remove year-to-date (YTD) earnings entries within an event case or claim,
> **so that** accurate earnings history is maintained for tax withholding calculations and financial settlement processing.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates YTD Earnings management operations from the YTD Earnings interface within an event case or claim.
> 2. **Add New YTD Earnings**: User creates a new YTD earnings record by providing the year and earnings amount, which is validated and saved to the case.
> 3. **Edit Existing YTD Earnings**: User selects an existing YTD earnings entry for modification.
>    3.1. System displays pre-populated data from the original entry.
>    3.2. User updates the year and/or earnings amount.
>    3.3. System validates the changes and updates the record upon successful validation.
> 4. **Remove YTD Earnings**: User initiates removal of an existing YTD earnings entry.
>    4.1. System prompts for confirmation before deletion.
>    4.2. Upon confirmation, system removes the entry and updates the display.
>    4.3. If user cancels confirmation, no changes are made and the workflow exits.
> 5. **Data Validation**: System enforces business rules during add and edit operations.
>    5.1. If validation fails (duplicate year or invalid amount), system displays error messages and prevents saving.
>    5.2. User must correct the data before successfully completing the operation.
> 6. After successful completion of any operation (add, edit, or remove), the updated YTD earnings list is displayed in the interface.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster is viewing an event case or claim with YTD Earnings UI, **When** the user initiates adding a new YTD Earnings entry with valid Year and Amount (greater than 0), **Then** the system saves the entry, updates the Event Case, and displays the new entry in the YTD Earnings UI.
> 2. **Given** the user is adding or editing a YTD Earnings entry, **When** the user enters a Year that already exists for this case or claim, **Then** the system displays an error message indicating year overlap and prevents saving.
> 3. **Given** the user is adding or editing a YTD Earnings entry, **When** the user enters a YTD Earnings Amount of 0 or less, **Then** the system displays an error message and prevents saving.
> 4. **Given** an existing YTD Earnings record is displayed, **When** the user clicks the edit icon, **Then** the system opens an in-line editing form with pre-populated data and disables the 'Add new' button and all other 'Edit' and 'Remove' icons.
> 5. **Given** the user is editing an existing YTD Earnings entry, **When** the user updates the fields with valid data and saves, **Then** the system validates the data, updates the record, and displays the modified entry in the YTD Earnings UI.
> 6. **Given** an existing YTD Earnings record is displayed, **When** the user clicks the Remove icon and confirms deletion, **Then** the system removes the entry and displays the updated YTD Earnings list.
> 7. **Given** the user initiates YTD Earnings removal, **When** the user does not confirm the deletion in the confirmation popup, **Then** the system closes the popup and no changes are made to the YTD Earnings records.
> 8. **Given** the user is in the process of adding a new YTD Earnings entry, **When** the form is open, **Then** the 'Add new' button is disabled to prevent concurrent additions.
> 9. **Given** any YTD Earnings operation (add, edit, remove) completes successfully, **When** the system processes the change, **Then** the Event Case is updated and the YTD Earnings UI reflects the current state of all earnings records.
> 10. **Given** the user has appropriate permissions, **When** accessing an event case or claim, **Then** the user can view and manage YTD Earnings entries for that case.

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want the system to automatically recalculate and reschedule payments when claim data is adjusted, so that payment schedules remain accurate without manual intervention.
- **Role**: Claims Operations Manager
- **Action**: have the system automatically recalculate and reschedule payments when claim data is adjusted
- **Value**: payment schedules remain accurate without manual intervention, reducing errors and operational overhead

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Operations Manager,
> **I want to** have the system automatically recalculate and reschedule payments when claim data is adjusted,
> **so that** payment schedules remain accurate without manual intervention, reducing errors and operational overhead.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. When a user with update privileges adjusts a claim (status: Pending, Open, or Suspended) and submits the Adjust Claim workflow, the system automatically triggers payment rescheduling.",
>   "2. The system generates a new payment template version incorporating all updated claim information from the adjustment.",
>   "3. The system performs backend payment processing:",
>   "   3.1. Cancels existing payment schedules in Open, Active, or Suspended status.",
>   "   3.2. Cancels pending payments in Approved or Issue Requested status.",
>   "   3.3. Creates new payments based on the newly activated payment schedule for all non-issued payment statuses.",
>   "4. The system applies differential logic for payments already in Issued status:",
>   "   4.1. For Actual Service Claims where the procedure still exists but was edited: if benefit amount is unchanged, issued payment remains unchanged; if benefit amount changed, the system marks an overpayment or underpayment balance (out of scope for this release).",
>   "   4.2. For Actual Service Claims where a procedure was deleted: the system generates a balance based on the previous procedure (out of scope).",
>   "   4.3. For Actual Service Claims where a new procedure is added: the system generates a new payment for the newly added procedure.",
>   "   4.4. For Ortho Service Claims: issued payment amount remains unchanged, and the system generates an overpayment or underpayment balance (out of scope).",
>   "5. The system refreshes the payment list UI to display only current active payments, hiding all automatically canceled payments and schedules.",
>   "6. For payments not yet issued, the system updates payment amounts based on the recalculated Gross Benefit Amount (GBA)."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Scenario 1: Successful Automatic Rescheduling for Non-Issued Payments**",
>   "   - Given a claim in Open status with existing payment schedules in Active status and payments in Approved status",
>   "   - When a user with PRIV>CAP>Update Loss privilege adjusts the claim and submits the Adjust Claim workflow",
>   "   - Then the system automatically generates a new payment template version",
>   "   - And the system cancels all existing payment schedules in Open, Active, or Suspended status",
>   "   - And the system cancels all pending payments in Approved or Issue Requested status",
>   "   - And the system creates new payments based on the updated claim data",
>   "   - And the payment list UI displays only the newly created payments without showing canceled items",
>   "**Scenario 2: Issued Payment Handling for Actual Service Claims with Edited Procedure (Unchanged Benefit Amount)**",
>   "   - Given an Actual Service claim with an issued payment for a procedure",
>   "   - When a user adjusts the claim by editing the procedure details but the benefit amount remains unchanged",
>   "   - Then the issued payment amount remains unchanged",
>   "   - And no overpayment or underpayment balance is generated",
>   "**Scenario 3: Issued Payment Handling for Actual Service Claims with Edited Procedure (Changed Benefit Amount)**",
>   "   - Given an Actual Service claim with an issued payment for a procedure",
>   "   - When a user adjusts the claim by editing the procedure with a changed benefit amount",
>   "   - Then the issued payment amount remains as originally issued",
>   "   - And the system marks an overpayment or underpayment balance (calculation out of scope)",
>   "**Scenario 4: New Procedure Added to Actual Service Claim with Issued Payments**",
>   "   - Given an Actual Service claim with existing issued payments",
>   "   - When a user adjusts the claim by adding a new procedure",
>   "   - Then the system generates a new payment for the newly added procedure",
>   "   - And existing issued payments remain unchanged",
>   "**Scenario 5: Ortho Service Claim with Issued Payments**",
>   "   - Given an Ortho Service claim with issued payments",
>   "   - When a user adjusts the claim data",
>   "   - Then the issued payment amount remains unchanged",
>   "   - And the system generates an overpayment or underpayment balance (calculation out of scope)",
>   "**Scenario 6: Payment Status Filtering During Cancellation**",
>   "   - Given a claim with payment schedules in various statuses (Open, Active, Suspended, Closed)",
>   "   - When the system performs automatic rescheduling",
>   "   - Then only payment schedules in Open, Active, or Suspended status are canceled",
>   "   - And payment schedules in Closed or other statuses remain unaffected",
>   "**Scenario 7: Insufficient User Privileges**",
>   "   - Given a user without PRIV>CAP>Update Loss privilege",
>   "   - When the user attempts to adjust a claim",
>   "   - Then the system prevents the adjustment workflow from executing",
>   "   - And no automatic payment rescheduling occurs",
>   "**Scenario 8: Claim Status Validation**",
>   "   - Given a claim with status Closed or Denied",
>   "   - When a user attempts to adjust the claim",
>   "   - Then the system prevents automatic payment rescheduling",
>   "   - And displays an appropriate status-related error message",
>   "**Scenario 9: UI Payment List Refresh**",
>   "   - Given a claim adjustment has triggered automatic rescheduling",
>   "   - When the payment list UI is refreshed",
>   "   - Then only active payments created from the new payment template are displayed",
>   "   - And canceled payments and schedules are not visible to the user",
>   "**Scenario 10: Non-Issued Payment Amount Update**",
>   "   - Given a claim with non-issued payments",
>   "   - When a user adjusts the claim resulting in a changed Gross Benefit Amount (GBA)",
>   "   - Then the system updates payment amounts based on the new GBA",
>   "   - And the updated amounts are reflected in the newly created payments"
> ]

### Epic: Tax & Compliance Management

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view a comprehensive Summary of Taxes by year, so that I can review all tax withholdings and earnings data for a claim in one place.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view a comprehensive summary of taxes organized by year for a claim
- **Value**: I can review all tax withholdings and earnings data for a claim in one centralized location to ensure accurate tax compliance and financial oversight

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view a comprehensive summary of taxes organized by year for a claim,
> **so that** I can review all tax withholdings and earnings data for a claim in one centralized location to ensure accurate tax compliance and financial oversight.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Claims adjuster navigates to the Event Case or Claim Overview page for the relevant claim.
> 2. Claims adjuster accesses the Taxes tab to view tax-related information.
> 3. System retrieves and displays a comprehensive summary of all tax values organized by year.
> 4. Tax summary includes withholding amounts and year-to-date earnings data associated with all payments scheduled for the Event Case or Claim.
> 5. System enforces privilege-based access control, restricting tax summary visibility to users with payment initiation and tax details update privileges.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster with 'PRIV>CAP>Initiate Payment' and 'PRIV>CAP>Case: Update Taxes Details (Withholdings and YTD Earnings)' privileges is logged into the system and an Event Case or Claim exists with scheduled payments and applied taxes, **When** the user navigates to the Event Case or Claim Overview page and clicks on the Taxes tab, **Then** the system displays a summary of all tax values organized by year within 3 seconds.
> 2. **Given** the Taxes tab is selected, **When** the tax summary is displayed, **Then** all tax withholding amounts and year-to-date earnings data are organized and grouped by calendar year in chronological order.
> 3. **Given** multiple payments with taxes have been processed across different years for a single claim, **When** the tax summary is displayed, **Then** each year shows aggregated tax withholding and earnings data for all payments within that year.
> 4. **Given** a user without 'PRIV>CAP>Initiate Payment' privilege attempts to access the Taxes tab, **When** the user clicks on the Taxes tab, **Then** the system denies access and displays an authorization error message.
> 5. **Given** a user without 'PRIV>CAP>Case: Update Taxes Details (Withholdings and YTD Earnings)' privilege attempts to access the Taxes tab, **When** the user clicks on the Taxes tab, **Then** the system denies access and displays an authorization error message.
> 6. **Given** an Event Case or Claim exists but no payments have been scheduled or no taxes have been applied, **When** the user accesses the Taxes tab, **Then** the system displays an empty state message indicating no tax data is available.
> 7. **Given** the tax summary is displayed, **When** the data is rendered, **Then** the display format follows the specification defined in the Tax Management - Summary of Taxes UI design.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manage FICA exemption indicators (FICA SS Exempt and FICA Medicare Exempt) through a dedicated dialog, so that I can accurately reflect tax exemption status for claims.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: manage FICA exemption indicators (FICA SS Exempt and FICA Medicare Exempt) through a dedicated dialog
- **Value**: I can accurately reflect tax exemption status for claims and ensure proper tax compliance across all claim payments

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** manage FICA exemption indicators (FICA SS Exempt and FICA Medicare Exempt) through a dedicated dialog,
> **so that** I can accurately reflect tax exemption status for claims and ensure proper tax compliance across all claim payments.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. Claims Adjuster accesses the FICA exemption management functionality from the Summary of Taxes section within the Taxes tab of the Event Case Overview.",
>   "2. System presents exemption management interface with two independent controls for FICA Social Security exemption and FICA Medicare exemption.",
>   "3. System intelligently loads and displays default exemption values based on business rules:",
>   "   3.1. Retrieves existing exemption status from the individual customer's tax exemption profile in the Customer Entity Management system.",
>   "   3.2. When no existing exemption data is found, defaults both exemptions to non-exempt status.",
>   "   3.3. For GIP product cases, automatically applies full FICA exemption (both Social Security and Medicare) as the default.",
>   "4. Claims Adjuster reviews the pre-populated exemption indicators and modifies either or both toggles based on the claimant's actual exemption eligibility.",
>   "5. Claims Adjuster saves the updated exemption status.",
>   "6. System persists the exemption indicators to the claim's financial adjustment entity and triggers comprehensive payment recalculation:",
>   "   6.1. Recalculates all payments in the actual Payment Schedule, including both past and future payments.",
>   "   6.2. Applies the updated FICA exemption rules to ensure accurate tax withholding across the entire payment history.",
>   "7. System confirms the update and returns the Claims Adjuster to the Event Case Overview with refreshed tax information.",
>   "8. **Alternate Flow - Cancellation with Unsaved Changes:**",
>   "   8.1. If Claims Adjuster attempts to cancel at any point after making changes, system prompts for confirmation before discarding edits.",
>   "   8.2. If confirmed, system discards all changes and returns to Event Case Overview without modifying exemption status.",
>   "   8.3. If cancellation is declined, system preserves all changes and allows continued editing."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Scenario 1: Default Values Load Correctly from Customer Profile**",
>   "- Given a Claims Adjuster opens the Edit FICA Exempt dialog for an Event Case with an existing customer tax profile",
>   "- When the dialog loads",
>   "- Then the system displays FICA SS Exempt and FICA Medicare Exempt toggle values matching the customer's taxExempt attribute from the CEM IndividualCustomer entity",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 2: Default Values for New Customer Without Tax Profile**",
>   "- Given a Claims Adjuster opens the Edit FICA Exempt dialog for an Event Case where the customer's taxExempt attribute is empty",
>   "- When the dialog loads",
>   "- Then both FICA SS Exempt and FICA Medicare Exempt toggles default to No (False/off state)",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 3: GIP Product Automatic Exemption Default**",
>   "- Given a Claims Adjuster opens the Edit FICA Exempt dialog for an Event Case associated with the GIP product",
>   "- When the dialog loads",
>   "- Then both FICA SS Exempt and FICA Medicare Exempt toggles are automatically set to Yes (True/on state) regardless of the customer's CEM profile",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 4: Independent Toggle Control**",
>   "- Given a Claims Adjuster is in the Edit FICA Exempt dialog",
>   "- When the adjuster modifies only the FICA SS Exempt toggle from No to Yes",
>   "- Then the FICA Medicare Exempt toggle remains in its original state and both values can be set independently",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 5: Successful Save and Payment Recalculation**",
>   "- Given a Claims Adjuster modifies one or both FICA exemption toggles in the Edit FICA Exempt dialog",
>   "- When the adjuster clicks the Save button",
>   "- Then the system updates CapFinancialAdjustmentEntity.isOasdiExempt and CapFinancialAdjustmentEntity.isMedicareExempt with the new values",
>   "- And the system recalculates all payments in the actual Payment Schedule (both past and future)",
>   "- And the dialog closes returning the adjuster to the Event Case Overview with updated tax information displayed",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 6: Cancel with Confirmation - Discard Changes**",

>   "- When the adjuster clicks the Cancel button",
>   "- Then the system displays a confirmation modal with the message 'Are you sure you want to close this form?'",
>   "- When the adjuster selects Yes",
>   "- Then the system discards all changes and closes the dialog without updating the Event Case",
>   "- And the adjuster is returned to the Event Case Overview with original tax exemption values intact",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 7: Cancel with Confirmation - Continue Editing**",
>   "- Given a Claims Adjuster has modified exemption toggles and clicked Cancel",
>   "- And the confirmation modal is displayed",
>   "- When the adjuster selects No",
>   "- Then the system closes the confirmation modal and returns to the Edit FICA Exempt dialog with all changes preserved",

>   "",
>   "**Scenario 8: Override Default Values**",

>   "- When the adjuster changes either toggle to a different value",
>   "- And clicks Save",
>   "- Then the system accepts the adjuster's override and persists the manually entered values rather than the defaults"

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to add, edit, and remove tax withholdings (Federal and State) with flexible amount or percentage options, so that I can adjust tax calculations based on claim-specific requirements.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: add, edit, and remove tax withholdings (Federal and State) with flexible amount or percentage options
- **Value**: I can adjust tax calculations based on claim-specific requirements

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** add, edit, and remove tax withholdings (Federal and State) with flexible amount or percentage options,
> **so that** I can adjust tax calculations based on claim-specific requirements.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User accesses the Manage Withholdings interface from the Event Case Taxes tab to view existing withholding entries with options to Add, Edit, or Remove.
> 2. To add a new tax withholding, user initiates the process and provides required tax configuration:
>    2.1 User selects Tax Type (Federal Tax or State Tax).
>    2.2 User defines tax amount using mutually exclusive options: either Dollar Amount (flat rate per benefit period) or Percentage (0-100% with up to two decimal places), with value greater than 0.
>    2.3 User specifies the effective period by entering From Date and Through Date, where Through Date must be later than From Date.
>    2.4 User selects applicable Claims from available STD, SMD, and LTD claims linked to Event Case (single claim required for dollar amount; multiple claims allowed for percentage based on Extra Withholding presence).
>    2.5 If State Tax is selected, user specifies the State with State Income Tax.
>    2.6 User optionally selects Filing Status for Federal or State taxes.
>    2.7 If percentage-based calculation is used, user may optionally enter Extra Withholding amount (must be greater than 0 if entered).
> 3. User saves the withholding configuration, which updates the case and displays the new entry in the Taxes tab.
> 4. To modify existing withholdings, user edits an entry which opens a pre-filled form with the same configuration options and validation rules.
> 5. To remove withholdings, user deletes an entry after confirming the removal action.
> 6. System applies tax calculation method based on entry type: flat rate per benefit period for dollar amounts, or percentage of benefit amounts for percentage-based entries.
> 7. User can cancel form entry at any time with confirmation, discarding unsaved changes and returning to the Taxes tab.
> 8. System enforces business rules including:
>    8.1 Restricting claims selection to income-related claim types (STD, SMD, LTD) that are not closed.
>    8.2 Adjusting Extra Withholding field visibility and Claims selection cardinality based on Tax Amount entry type.
>    8.3 Applying flat rates according to benefit period type (weekly for STD/SMP, monthly for LTD).
>    8.4 Allowing overlapping date periods for different withholding records.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster accesses the Event Case Taxes tab, **When** the Manage Withholdings interface loads, **Then** all existing withholding entries are displayed with Add, Edit, and Remove action options.
> 2. **Given** user clicks 'Add Withholding' button, **When** the slide-out form opens, **Then** all required fields (Tax Type, Tax Amount, From Date, Through Date, Claims) are presented with appropriate validation.
> 3. **Given** user selects Federal Tax as Tax Type, **When** completing the form, **Then** State selection field is not required.
> 4. **Given** user selects State Tax as Tax Type, **When** completing the form, **Then** State selection field is required and populated with states from LU>TaxState that have state income tax.
> 5. **Given** user enters a Dollar Amount in Tax Amount field, **When** the field is populated, **Then** system sets tax type to FLAT, hides Extra Withholding field, and restricts Claims dropdown to single selection only.
> 6. **Given** user enters a Percentage in Tax Amount field, **When** the field is populated, **Then** system sets tax type to PERCENTAGE, displays Extra Withholding field as optional, and allows multiple Claims selection (subject to Extra Withholding restrictions).
> 7. **Given** user attempts to enter both Dollar Amount and Percentage, **When** one field is populated, **Then** system prevents entry in the other field as they are mutually exclusive.
> 8. **Given** user enters Tax Amount value of 0 or negative, **When** attempting to save, **Then** system displays validation error and prevents save, requiring value greater than 0.
> 9. **Given** user enters Extra Withholding value of 0 or negative, **When** the field is visible and attempting to save, **Then** system displays validation error and prevents save, requiring value greater than 0 if Extra Withholding is entered.
> 10. **Given** user enters Through Date earlier than or equal to From Date, **When** attempting to save, **Then** system displays validation error and prevents save, requiring Through Date to be later than From Date.
> 11. **Given** user attempts to save without completing required fields, **When** save is initiated, **Then** system displays validation errors for missing Tax Type, Tax Amount, From/Through Dates, Claims, or State (when Tax Type is State) and prevents save.
> 12. **Given** Claims dropdown is populated, **When** loading claim options, **Then** system retrieves only STD, SMD, and LTD claims linked to Event Case, excluding closed claims and non-income claims, displayed as Coverage Type + Loss Number.
> 13. **Given** user enters valid withholding configuration, **When** clicking Save button, **Then** form closes, case is updated with tax type stored in Attr>CapFinancialAdjustmentTax>taxType and calculation method in federalTaxType/stateTaxType attributes, and user returns to Event Case Taxes tab with new entry visible.
> 14. **Given** user clicks Edit icon on existing withholding entry, **When** Edit Withholding form opens, **Then** all fields are pre-filled with current values and follow same validation rules as Add operation.
> 15. **Given** user clicks Remove icon on existing withholding entry, **When** confirmation modal is displayed with Yes/No options, **Then** selecting Yes deletes the entry and refreshes interface, while selecting No closes modal without changes.
> 16. **Given** user clicks Cancel button or Close Icon (X) on Add/Edit Withholding form, **When** confirmation modal is displayed asking 'Are you sure you want to close the form?', **Then** selecting Yes closes form without saving and returns to Event Case Taxes tab, while selecting No keeps user in the form.
> 17. **Given** multiple withholding records exist with overlapping date periods, **When** viewing withholding entries, **Then** system allows and displays overlapping periods as permitted by business rules.
> 18. **Given** flat-rate dollar amount withholding is configured for STD/SMP claims, **When** tax calculation is applied, **Then** flat rate is applied per week per benefit period.
> 19. **Given** flat-rate dollar amount withholding is configured for LTD claims, **When** tax calculation is applied, **Then** flat rate is applied per month per benefit period.
> 20. **Given** percentage-based withholding is configured, **When** tax calculation is applied, **Then** percentage is applied to benefit amounts for selected claims.
> 21. **Given** Filing Status field is available, **When** user selects from dropdown, **Then** options are populated from LU>TaxMaritalStatus (Single, Married, etc.) and selection is optional for both Federal and State taxes.
> 22. **Given** the UI is implemented, **When** user interacts with the interface, **Then** design follows EIS DS Library design system with UXD mockups specifications from Figma.

>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=556512886"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to specify tax withholding details including tax type, amount/percentage, extra withholding, date ranges, state, filing status, and applicable claims, so that tax calculations are precise and compliant with regulations.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: specify and manage tax withholding details including tax type, amount/percentage, extra withholding, date ranges, state, filing status, and applicable claims
- **Value**: tax calculations are precise, compliant with regulations, and accurately applied across relevant claims

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** specify and manage tax withholding details including tax type, amount/percentage, extra withholding, date ranges, state, filing status, and applicable claims,
> **so that** tax calculations are precise, compliant with regulations, and accurately applied across relevant claims.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User accesses the Manage Withholdings screen within an Event Case Taxes tab, viewing all existing withholdings with available actions (Add, Edit, Delete).
> 2. User initiates creation of a new withholding entry, which opens a structured input form for capturing all required tax withholding parameters.
> 3. User specifies the tax type from available manual withholding categories (excluding FICA), which determines subsequent field visibility and requirements.
>    3.1. If State tax type is selected, user must also specify the applicable state from jurisdictions with income tax requirements and may optionally provide filing status.
>    3.2. If Federal tax type is selected, user may optionally provide filing status information.
> 4. User defines the withholding amount using either a flat dollar amount or a percentage (mutually exclusive methods).
>    4.1. When dollar amount is specified, system applies flat withholding to a single selected claim and stores amounts appropriately based on claim type (weekly for STD/SMD, monthly for LTD).
>    4.2. When percentage is specified, user may select multiple applicable claims and optionally enter extra withholding amounts, with system enforcing single-claim selection when extra withholding is provided.
> 5. User establishes effective date range for the withholding (from/through dates), with system allowing overlapping periods within event cases.
> 6. User selects applicable claims from available STD/SMD/LTD claims linked to the event case, with system excluding closed claims and formatting display as coverage type plus loss number.
> 7. User saves the withholding configuration, which updates the event case tax records and returns to the taxes management view.
> 8. User modifies existing withholdings by selecting an entry for editing, updating desired fields while maintaining all field dependencies and business rules, and saving changes.
> 9. User removes obsolete withholdings by deleting entries with confirmation, updating the event case tax records accordingly.
> 10. User can abandon withholding creation or editing at any time with confirmation, preserving the current state of tax records.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** the user is on the Event Case Taxes tab, **When** they view the Manage Withholdings screen, **Then** the system displays all existing withholdings with Add, Edit, and Delete action buttons available.
> 2. **Given** the user clicks 'Add Withholding Button', **When** the form opens, **Then** the system displays a slide-out form titled 'Add Withholding' with Tax Type, Tax Amount, From/Through Dates, and Claims as required fields.
> 3. **Given** the user is adding a withholding, **When** they select Tax Type from the dropdown, **Then** the system populates only manual withholding types from LU>TaxType, excluding FICA.
> 4. **Given** the user selects Tax Type = State, **When** the field is populated, **Then** the system makes 'States with State Income Tax' field visible, required, and populated from LU>TaxState, and makes 'Filing Status' visible as optional.
> 5. **Given** the user selects Tax Type = Federal, **When** the field is populated, **Then** the system makes 'Filing Status' field visible as optional (sourced from LU>TaxMaritalStatus) and keeps 'States with State Income Tax' hidden.
> 6. **Given** the user is specifying Tax Amount, **When** they enter a Dollar Amount, **Then** the system disables the Percentage field, sets taxType as FLAT, hides 'Extra Withholding' field, restricts Claims dropdown to single selection, and stores value to Federal/State TaxWeeklyAmount (STD/SMP) or TaxMonthlyAmount (LTD).
> 7. **Given** the user is specifying Tax Amount, **When** they enter a Percentage (0-100%, up to 2 decimal places), **Then** the system disables the Dollar Amount field, sets taxType as PERCENTAGE, displays 'Extra Withholding' as optional, allows multi-selection in Claims dropdown, and stores value to Federal/State TaxPercentage.
>    7.1. **Given** the user enters a Percentage with Extra Withholding value >0, **When** the Extra Withholding field is populated, **Then** the system restricts Claims dropdown to single selection only.
> 8. **Given** the user is entering From/Through Dates, **When** they use MM/DD/YYYY format, **Then** the system accepts overlapping date periods within Event Cases and stores values to Attr>CapFinancialAdjustmentTax>term (effectiveDate/expirationDate).
> 9. **Given** the user is selecting Claims, **When** the Claims dropdown is displayed, **Then** the system shows STD/SMD/LTD claims linked via eventCaseLink in format '&lt;Coverage Type&gt; &lt;lossNumber&gt;', excludes closed claims, and stores selections to Federal/State lossSources.
> 10. **Given** all required fields are completed, **When** the user clicks 'Save Button', **Then** the system stores all withholding data (Tax Type to Attr>CapFinancialAdjustmentTax>taxType, State to CapFinancialAdjustmentTaxDetailsStateEntity.stateTaxState, Filing Status to State/Federal TaxMaritalStatus), closes the form, and returns to Event Case Taxes tab displaying the updated withholdings list.
> 11. **Given** the user selects 'Edit Icon' on an existing withholding, **When** the edit form opens, **Then** the system displays the slide-out form titled 'Edit Withholding' with all fields pre-populated with existing data, applies all field rules and dependencies, and updates the record upon Save.
> 12. **Given** the user selects 'Delete Icon' on an existing withholding, **When** the delete action is triggered, **Then** the system displays confirmation modal with message 'Are you sure you want to remove this entry?', removes the entry upon confirmation, and updates the Taxes tab.
> 13. **Given** the user clicks 'Cancel Button' or 'Close Icon' during Add/Edit, **When** the action is triggered, **Then** the system displays confirmation modal with message 'Are you sure you want to close the form?', closes without saving upon confirmation, or keeps form open with data intact if user cancels.
> 14. **Given** the user lacks privilege PRIV>CAP>Case: Update Taxes Details (Withholdings and YTD Earnings), **When** they access the Event Case Taxes tab, **Then** the system prevents Add, Edit, and Delete actions on withholdings.
> 15. **Given** required fields are missing (Tax Type, Tax Amount, From/Through Dates, Claims, or State when Tax Type = State), **When** the user attempts to save, **Then** the system blocks submission and displays inline error messages next to incomplete fields.
