#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manage Year-To-Date (YTD) earnings by adding, editing, and removing annual earnings records, so that tax withholding calculations are based on accurate YTD income data.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: manage Year-To-Date (YTD) earnings by adding, editing, and removing annual earnings records
- **Value**: tax withholding calculations are based on accurate YTD income data

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** manage Year-To-Date (YTD) earnings by adding, editing, and removing annual earnings records,
> **so that** tax withholding calculations are based on accurate YTD income data.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. Adjuster views existing YTD Earnings records in a tabular format displaying Year and YTD Earnings Amount for each entry.",
>   "2. Adjuster adds a new YTD Earnings record by specifying a unique year (1900-2500 range) and a positive earnings amount in system currency.",
>   "  2.1. If the year already exists, system prevents save and notifies adjuster of duplicate year.",
>   "  2.2. If the year is outside the valid range, system prevents save and notifies adjuster of invalid year value.",
>   "  2.3. If the earnings amount is zero or negative, system prevents save and displays field-level validation error.",
>   "  2.4. If adjuster cancels the add operation, system discards unsaved changes and returns to table view.",
>   "3. Adjuster edits an existing YTD Earnings record by modifying year or earnings amount with the same validation rules as adding new records.",
>   "  3.1. System pre-fills the form with existing data and applies all uniqueness and value range validations.",
>   "  3.2. If adjuster cancels the edit operation, system discards changes and returns to table view.",
>   "4. Adjuster saves changes to YTD Earnings records, which updates the underlying financial adjustment entities used for tax calculations.",
>   "5. Adjuster removes a YTD Earnings record by confirming deletion through a modal dialog.",
>   "  5.1. If adjuster confirms deletion, system permanently removes the record.",
>   "  5.2. If adjuster cancels deletion, system retains the record and returns to table view.",
>   "6. System prevents concurrent modifications by disabling all add/edit/delete actions when an add or edit operation is in progress."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Given** the adjuster is viewing the Taxes tab in the Payments and Recoveries section,\n**When** the tab loads,\n**Then** the system displays all existing YTD Earnings records in a table with Year and YTD Earnings Amount columns, and Edit and Delete action icons for each row.",
>   "**Given** the adjuster clicks the 'Add New' button,\n**When** the inline form appears,\n**Then** the system displays required fields for Year (year picker with manual entry) and YTD Earnings Amount (currency field with $ symbol), and disables the Add New button and all action icons.",
>   "**Given** the adjuster enters a year value and earnings amount in the add form,\n**When** the year is unique, within range 1900-2500, and the amount is greater than 0,\n**Then** the system saves the new record, updates the table display, and re-enables all action buttons.",
>   "**Given** the adjuster enters a year value that already exists in another record,\n**When** attempting to save,\n**Then** the system displays the validation error 'Year is already assigned' and prevents the save operation.",
>   "**Given** the adjuster enters a year value outside the range 1900-2500,\n**When** attempting to save,\n**Then** the system displays the validation error 'The Year value is not valid' and prevents the save operation.",
>   "**Given** the adjuster enters a YTD Earnings Amount less than or equal to 0,\n**When** attempting to save,\n**Then** the system displays a field-level validation error and prevents the save operation.",
>   "**Given** the adjuster clicks the Edit icon for an existing record,\n**When** the inline edit form appears,\n**Then** the system pre-fills the Year and YTD Earnings Amount fields with existing data, displays Save and Close buttons, and disables all other action icons.",
>   "**Given** the adjuster modifies an existing record,\n**When** the adjuster clicks Save and all validations pass,\n**Then** the system updates the record in the database (CapFinancialAdjustmentYTDEarningsEntity), refreshes the table display, and re-enables all action buttons.",
>   "**Given** the adjuster is in add or edit mode,\n**When** the adjuster clicks the Close button,\n**Then** the system discards all unsaved changes, returns to the main table view, and re-enables the Add New button and all action icons.",
>   "**Given** the adjuster clicks the Remove icon for a record,\n**When** the confirmation modal appears with message 'Are you sure you want to remove this entry?',\n**Then** the system displays Yes and No buttons for user confirmation.",
>   "**Given** the adjuster clicks Yes in the Remove confirmation modal,\n**When** the action is confirmed,\n**Then** the system permanently deletes the record from the database and refreshes the table display.",
>   "**Given** the adjuster clicks No in the Remove confirmation modal,\n**When** the cancellation is confirmed,\n**Then** the system closes the modal, retains the record, and returns to the main table view without any changes.",
>   "**Given** multiple YTD Earnings records exist for different years,\n**When** the adjuster views the table,\n**Then** each record displays the year and earnings amount in system currency, with independent Edit and Delete action icons.",
>   "**Given** the adjuster saves or updates a YTD Earnings record,\n**When** the save operation completes,\n**Then** the system maps Year to CapFinancialAdjustmentYTDEarningsEntity.year and YTD Earnings Amount to CapFinancialAdjustmentYTDEarningsEntity.ytdEarningsAmount for downstream tax withholding calculations."
> ]


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=556512974"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to enter and validate YTD earnings amounts for specific years with required field validation and positive value checks, so that tax calculations are based on verified income data.

- **Value**: tax calculations are based on verified and accurate income data

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** enter, edit, and validate Year-To-Date (YTD) earnings amounts for specific years with required field validation and positive value checks,
> **so that** tax calculations are based on verified and accurate income data.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User navigates to the Taxes tab within the Payments and Recoveries section from the Event Case or Claim overview screen to access the YTD Earnings management interface.",
>   "2. User views existing YTD Earnings records displayed in a table showing Year and YTD Earnings Amount (in system currency) with action icons for editing and removing each entry.",
>   "3. User adds a new YTD Earnings record by initiating the add operation, entering the required Year (using year picker or manual entry) and YTD Earnings Amount (currency input), then saving the record.",
>   "3.1. If user attempts to add a new record while another add or edit operation is active, the add function is disabled until the active operation is completed or cancelled.",
>   "3.2. If user provides a Year value that already exists in the table, system prevents duplicate entry and displays validation error.",
>   "3.3. If user provides a Year value outside the range 1900-2500, system rejects the entry and displays validation error.",
>   "3.4. If user provides a YTD Earnings Amount of zero or negative value, system prevents entry and displays validation error.",
>   "3.5. If user omits required fields (Year or YTD Earnings Amount), system prevents save and displays validation error indicating required fields.",
>   "4. User edits an existing YTD Earnings record by activating inline editing, modifying pre-filled Year or YTD Earnings Amount values, then saving the changes.",
>   "4.1. If user attempts to edit a record while another add or edit operation is active, the edit function is disabled until the active operation is completed or cancelled.",
>   "4.2. Same validation rules apply as for adding new records (Year uniqueness, range 1900-2500, positive Amount, required fields).",
>   "5. User removes an existing YTD Earnings record by initiating the delete action, confirming the removal in the confirmation modal, and completing the deletion.",
>   "5.1. If user confirms deletion, the record is permanently removed from the table.",
>   "5.2. If user cancels deletion, the modal closes and the record remains unchanged.",
>   "6. User can cancel any active add or edit operation at any time, discarding unsaved changes and returning the interface to view-only mode."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. **Given** the user is on the Taxes tab, **when** they view the YTD Earnings table, **then** all existing records display with Year and YTD Earnings Amount columns and action icons for edit and delete per row.",
>   "2. **Given** the user clicks the Add New button, **when** the inline form appears, **then** Year and YTD Earnings Amount fields are displayed as empty required fields with appropriate input controls (year picker and currency input).",
>   "3. **Given** the user is adding or editing a YTD Earnings record, **when** they enter a Year value already present in the table, **then** the system displays the validation error 'Year is already assigned' and prevents saving.",
>   "4. **Given** the user is adding or editing a YTD Earnings record, **when** they enter a Year value less than 1900 or greater than 2500, **then** the system displays the validation error 'The Year value is not valid' and prevents saving.",
>   "5. **Given** the user is adding or editing a YTD Earnings record, **when** they enter a YTD Earnings Amount of 0 or negative value, **then** the system displays a validation error indicating the amount must be greater than 0 and prevents saving.",
>   "6. **Given** the user is adding or editing a YTD Earnings record, **when** they leave the Year or YTD Earnings Amount field empty and attempt to save, **then** the system displays a validation error indicating required fields must be completed and prevents saving.",
>   "7. **Given** the user has entered valid Year (unique, between 1900-2500) and YTD Earnings Amount (positive value) in the add form, **when** they click Save, **then** the new record is added to the YTD Earnings table and the form closes.",
>   "8. **Given** the user is actively adding or editing a YTD Earnings record, **when** they attempt to initiate another add or edit operation, **then** the Add New button and all edit/delete icons are disabled until the active operation is saved or cancelled.",
>   "9. **Given** the user clicks the edit icon on an existing YTD Earnings record, **when** the inline edit form appears, **then** the Year and YTD Earnings Amount fields are pre-filled with the existing record values.",
>   "10. **Given** the user has modified values in an edit form with valid data, **when** they click Save, **then** the record is updated in the table with the new values and the form closes.",
>   "11. **Given** the user clicks the delete icon on a YTD Earnings record, **when** the confirmation modal appears with the message 'Are you sure you want to remove this entry?', **then** the user can select Yes to permanently remove the record or No to cancel and retain the record.",
>   "12. **Given** the user is in an active add or edit operation, **when** they click the Close button, **then** all unsaved changes are discarded and the interface returns to view-only mode without updating the table.",
>   "13. **Given** the user has successfully saved a new or edited YTD Earnings record, **when** the record appears in the table, **then** the YTD Earnings Amount is displayed in the system currency format with the currency symbol."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view detailed tax withholding information including FICA SS Taxable Wages, FICA Medicare Taxable Wages, Federal Taxable Wages, and corresponding tax amounts withheld by year, so that I can verify tax compliance and accuracy.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view detailed tax withholding information including FICA SS Taxable Wages, FICA Medicare Taxable Wages, Federal Taxable Wages, and corresponding tax amounts withheld by year, and manage FICA exemption indicators to ensure tax compliance and accuracy
- **Value**: I can verify tax compliance and accuracy, and ensure correct tax calculations for all claim payments

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view detailed tax withholding information including FICA SS Taxable Wages, FICA Medicare Taxable Wages, Federal Taxable Wages, and corresponding tax amounts withheld by year, and manage FICA exemption indicators to ensure tax compliance and accuracy,
> **so that** I can verify tax compliance and accuracy, and ensure correct tax calculations for all claim payments.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User views tax withholding summary information organized by year within the Event Case Overview, displaying FICA Social Security Taxable Wages, FICA Medicare Taxable Wages, Federal Taxable Wages, State Taxable Wages, corresponding tax amounts withheld, and excludable wages.",
>   "2. User accesses the FICA exemption management functionality from the Summary of Taxes component to modify exemption indicators for the event case.",
>   "3. User views current FICA exemption status for both Social Security and Medicare, which are inherited from the Individual Customer's tax exempt attribute or defaulted based on product type.",
>   "4. User modifies FICA exemption indicators by toggling Social Security exemption and/or Medicare exemption status independently.",
>   "5. User saves exemption changes, triggering system to update the financial adjustment entity and automatically recalculate all payments (both past and future) in the actual Payment Schedule based on the new exemption values.",
>   "6. User reviews updated tax withholding data in the Summary of Taxes table reflecting the recalculated amounts based on modified exemption settings.",
>   "7. Alternate Flow: If user cancels the exemption modification process:",
>   "   7.1. System prompts for confirmation before discarding changes.",
>   "   7.2. If confirmed, system closes the dialog without saving changes and does not trigger payment recalculation.",
>   "   7.3. If declined, user remains in the editing interface to continue modifications."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "1. Given an Event Case with a Subject (Individual Customer) exists, when the Claims Adjuster accesses the Summary of Taxes component, then the system displays tax withholding data organized by year including FICA SS Taxable Wages, FICA Medicare Taxable Wages, Federal Taxable Wages, State Taxable Wages, corresponding withheld tax amounts, and excludable wages.",
>   "2. Given the Claims Adjuster opens the Edit FICA Exempt Dialog, when the dialog loads, then the system displays current exemption status for both FICA SS and FICA Medicare with visual indicators (On=blue/Yes/True or Off=gray/No/False).",
>   "3. Given the Individual Customer has a taxExempt attribute value, when the FICA exemption dialog loads for the first time, then the system inherits and displays the exemption status from the Individual Customer's taxExempt attribute for both FICA SS and Medicare exemptions.",
>   "4. Given the Individual Customer's taxExempt attribute is empty, when the FICA exemption dialog loads, then the system defaults both FICA SS Exempt and FICA Medicare Exempt to No (False).",
>   "5. Given the Event Case is associated with a GIP product, when the FICA exemption dialog loads for the first time, then the system defaults both FICA SS Exempt and FICA Medicare Exempt to On (True).",
>   "6. Given the Claims Adjuster modifies one or both exemption toggles and clicks 'Save', when the save action completes, then the system updates CapFinancialAdjustmentEntity.isOasdiExempt and CapFinancialAdjustmentEntity.isMedicareExempt with the new values.",
>   "7. Given FICA exemption indicators have been saved, when the system processes the update, then all payments (both past and future) in the actual Payment Schedule are recalculated based on the updated exemption values.",
>   "8. Given payment recalculation has completed, when the Claims Adjuster views the Summary of Taxes table, then the table displays updated tax withholding amounts reflecting the modified FICA exemption settings.",
>   "9. Given the Claims Adjuster is editing FICA exemptions and clicks 'Cancel', when the confirmation modal appears with message 'Are you sure you want to close this form?', then:",
>   "   9.1. If user selects 'Yes', the dialog closes without saving changes and no payment recalculation occurs.",
>   "   9.2. If user selects 'No', the user remains in the Edit FICA Exempt Dialog with all unsaved changes preserved.",
>   "10. Given invalid or missing Subject (Individual Customer) data, when the Claims Adjuster attempts to access the Edit FICA Exempt Dialog, then the system prevents access or displays an appropriate error message.",
>   "11. Given multiple years of payment data exist, when the Claims Adjuster views the Summary of Taxes, then tax withholding information is accurately segregated and displayed by tax year."
> ]

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=624209234"

>   "3. **Given** an Event Case or Claim with scheduled payments and applied taxes exists, **When** the authorized user opens the Taxes tab, **Then** the system displays tax values grouped and listed by year according to the Tax Management - Summary of Taxes UI specification.",

>   "7. **Given** the user is logged into the system with valid credentials and appropriate permissions, **When** they access tax information, **Then** the system logs the access for audit and compliance purposes."

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to confirm deletion of tax withholding or YTD earnings entries through a confirmation modal before removal, so that accidental deletions are prevented.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: confirm deletion of tax withholding or YTD earnings entries through a confirmation modal before removal
- **Value**: accidental deletions are prevented

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** confirm deletion of tax withholding or YTD earnings entries through a confirmation modal before removal,
> **so that** accidental deletions are prevented.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. Users access the Manage Withholdings interface to view existing tax withholding records in a table format with options to add, edit, or delete entries.",
>   "2. Users can manage tax withholding entries by selecting Tax Type (Federal or State), entering flat dollar or percentage-based amounts, specifying date ranges, and linking to claims within the Event Case.",
>   "3. When initiating deletion of a tax withholding entry:",
>   "   3.1. User clicks the Delete Icon on the withholding entry row in the Manage Withholdings table.",
>   "   3.2. System displays a confirmation modal requiring explicit user confirmation before proceeding with deletion.",
>   "   3.3. User must confirm the deletion action to permanently remove the withholding record from CapFinancialAdjustmentTax.",
>   "   3.4. If user cancels the confirmation modal, the deletion is aborted and the withholding record remains unchanged.",
>   "4. Upon confirmed deletion, the system removes the tax withholding entry and its associated details (Federal or State specific) from the Event Case.",
>   "5. The updated Manage Withholdings table reflects the removal of the deleted entry immediately after confirmation."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Scenario 1: Successful Deletion Confirmation**",
>   "1. Given a Claims Adjuster is viewing the Manage Withholdings table with existing tax withholding entries,",
>   "   When the user clicks the Delete Icon on any withholding entry row,",
>   "   Then a confirmation modal is displayed before any deletion occurs.",
>   "2. Given the deletion confirmation modal is displayed,",
>   "   When the user confirms the deletion action,",
>   "   Then the system permanently removes the withholding record from CapFinancialAdjustmentTax and its associated detail entities (CapFinancialAdjustmentTaxDetailsFederal or CapFinancialAdjustmentTaxDetailsStateEntity).",
>   "3. Given the deletion is confirmed and processed,",
>   "   When the modal closes,",
>   "   Then the Manage Withholdings table is refreshed and the deleted entry no longer appears in the list.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 2: Deletion Cancellation**",
>   "4. Given a deletion confirmation modal is displayed for a tax withholding entry,",
>   "   When the user cancels or closes the confirmation modal without confirming,",
>   "   Then the deletion is aborted and the withholding record remains unchanged in the system.",
>   "5. Given the deletion was cancelled,",
>   "   When the modal closes,",
>   "   Then the user returns to the Manage Withholdings table with the entry still visible and intact.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 3: Prevention of Accidental Deletion**",
>   "6. Given a user accidentally clicks the Delete Icon on a withholding entry,",
>   "   When the confirmation modal appears requiring explicit confirmation,",
>   "   Then the user has the opportunity to cancel the action before any data loss occurs.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 4: Deletion Applies to All Tax Types**",
>   "7. Given withholding entries exist for both Federal and State tax types with varying configurations (flat dollar, percentage-based, with or without extra withholding),",
>   "   When the Delete Icon is clicked on any entry regardless of tax type or configuration,",
>   "   Then the confirmation modal is displayed consistently before deletion proceeds.",
>   "",
>   "**Scenario 5: Data Integrity After Deletion**",
>   "8. Given a tax withholding entry is confirmed for deletion and removed,",
>   "   When the Claims Adjuster navigates to the Event Case overview Taxes tab or refreshes the Manage Withholdings interface,",
>   "   Then the deleted entry does not appear and no orphaned data remains in CapFinancialAdjustmentTax or related detail entities."
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to enforce mutual exclusivity between tax amount ($) and tax percentage (%) fields in withholding management, so that tax calculations remain unambiguous and accurate.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: enforce mutual exclusivity between tax amount ($) and tax percentage (%) fields in withholding management
- **Value**: tax calculations remain unambiguous and accurate

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** enforce mutual exclusivity between tax amount ($) and tax percentage (%) fields in withholding management,
> **so that** tax calculations remain unambiguous and accurate.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User navigates to the Manage Withholdings page to view existing withholding entries with available actions.",
>   "2. User initiates creation of a new withholding entry, which opens a dedicated form interface.",
>   "3. User selects the appropriate tax type from available manual withholding options (FICA excluded from manual entry).",
>   "4. User enters tax calculation basis using mutually exclusive input method:",
>   "   4.1 If entering flat dollar amount: system displays benefit period context (Week/Month) based on claim type and enforces positive value validation.",
>   "   4.2 If entering percentage amount: system accepts values with up to two decimal places within 0-100 range and enables optional extra withholding field.",
>   "5. User defines the withholding effective period by specifying start and end dates with chronological validation.",
>   "6. User selects applicable claims from filtered list of open STD, SMD, and LTD claims:",
>   "   6.1 Single claim selection is enforced when using flat dollar amounts.",
>   "   6.2 Multiple claim selection is permitted for percentage amounts (with restrictions when extra withholding is specified).",
>   "7. For state tax withholdings:",
>   "   7.1 User must select the applicable state from states with income tax requirements.",
>   "   7.2 User may optionally specify filing status for state or federal tax types.",
>   "8. User saves the withholding configuration, which maps data to appropriate federal or state tax detail entities and stores calculation type indicator.",
>   "9. User modifies existing withholding entries by accessing edit function, updating fields under same validation rules, and saving changes.",
>   "10. User removes obsolete withholding entries through deletion workflow with confirmation safeguard.",
>   "11. System validates all business rules before allowing save and displays specific error messages for any violations."
> ]


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> [
>   "**Positive Scenarios:**",
>   "1. Given the user is on the Add Withholding form, when the user enters a dollar amount in the Tax Amount field, then the Tax Amount percentage field becomes disabled or unavailable for entry.",
>   "2. Given the user is on the Add Withholding form, when the user enters a percentage value in the Tax Amount percentage field, then the Tax Amount dollar field becomes disabled or unavailable for entry.",
>   "3. Given the user has entered a valid flat dollar amount greater than 0 with valid dates and selected one open STD/SMD/LTD claim, when the user clicks Save, then the system creates the withholding entry and displays it in the Manage Withholdings list.",
>   "4. Given the user has entered a percentage value between 0-100 with up to two decimal places, valid dates, and selected one or more open STD/SMD/LTD claims, when the user clicks Save, then the system creates the withholding entry with calculation type stored as PERCENTAGE.",
>   "5. Given the user has selected State as Tax Type, when the user selects a state from the States with State Income Tax dropdown and saves, then the withholding is mapped to CapFinancialAdjustmentTaxDetailsStateEntity attributes.",
>   "6. Given the user has selected Federal as Tax Type and optionally selected a Filing Status, when the user saves, then the withholding is mapped to CapFinancialAdjustmentTaxDetailsFederal attributes.",
>   "7. Given the user has entered a percentage amount, when the user enters an optional Extra Withholding dollar amount and saves, then both the percentage and extra withholding values are stored correctly.",
>   "8. Given an existing withholding entry exists, when the user clicks the Edit icon, then the Edit Withholding form opens pre-filled with current data and allows modification following the same validation rules.",
>   "9. Given the user clicks the Remove icon next to a withholding entry and confirms deletion in the modal, when the confirmation is completed, then the withholding entry is removed from the system.",
>   "10. Given the user has made changes in the Add or Edit form, when the user clicks Cancel or Close, then the form closes without saving and the user returns to the Manage Withholdings page.",
>   "**Negative Scenarios:**",
>   "11. Given the user is on the Add Withholding form, when the user attempts to enter both a dollar amount AND a percentage value simultaneously, then the system prevents dual entry through field mutual exclusivity enforcement.",
>   "12. Given the user enters a dollar amount of 0 or negative value, when the user attempts to save, then the system displays an error message requiring a value greater than 0 and prevents save.",
>   "13. Given the user enters a percentage value less than 0 or greater than 100, when the user attempts to save, then the system displays an error message requiring a value between 0-100 and prevents save.",
>   "14. Given the user enters a percentage with more than two decimal places, when the user attempts to save, then the system displays an error message about decimal place limitation and prevents save.",
>   "15. Given the user selects a Through Date that is equal to or earlier than the From Date, when the user attempts to save, then the system displays an error message requiring Through Date to be later than From Date and prevents save.",
>   "16. Given the user has selected State as Tax Type, when the user attempts to save without selecting a state from the dropdown, then the system displays an error message requiring state selection and prevents save.",
>   "17. Given the user has entered a flat dollar amount, when the user attempts to select multiple claims, then the system restricts selection to single claim only.",
>   "18. Given the user has entered a percentage amount with Extra Withholding specified, when the user attempts to select multiple claims, then the system applies restrictions to claims selection and prevents save if violated.",
>   "19. Given the user attempts to select claims that are not of type STD, SMD, or LTD, or are not in open status, then those claims do not appear in the selectable claims list.",
>   "20. Given the user has not entered either a dollar amount OR a percentage value, when the user attempts to save, then the system displays an error message requiring one tax calculation method and prevents save."
> ]

### Epic: Core Adjudication & Recalculation Engine

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to update claim details and automatically trigger settlement refresh, so that all related settlements reflect the most current claim information.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: update claim details and automatically trigger settlement refresh
- **Value**: all related settlements reflect the most current claim information

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** update claim details and automatically trigger settlement refresh,
> **so that** all related settlements reflect the most current claim information.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Claims Adjuster accesses an active Critical Illness claim that is in an eligible lifecycle state for modification (e.g., under review, pending adjudication, or open status).
> 2. Adjuster reviews and updates claim details that impact settlement calculations, including:
>    2.1. Critical illness diagnosis information and medical documentation
>    2.2. Policy coverage amounts and benefit eligibility
>    2.3. Claimant information and beneficiary details
>    2.4. Loss date or reporting information corrections
> 3. Upon saving claim detail updates, the system automatically validates changes against business rules for Critical Illness product requirements and policy terms.
> 4. System triggers automatic settlement recalculation process:
>    4.1. Identifies all settlements associated with the updated claim
>    4.2. Recalculates settlement amounts based on updated claim information
>    4.3. Applies product-specific adjudication rules and coverage limits
>    4.4. Updates settlement status and amounts in real-time
> 5. Adjuster reviews recalculated settlement information to verify accuracy and alignment with updated claim details.
> 6. System maintains audit trail of claim modifications and corresponding settlement adjustments for compliance and historical tracking.
> 7. Claim progresses through appropriate lifecycle transitions based on adjudication outcomes and settlement status.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster accesses an active Critical Illness claim in an editable state, **when** they update claim details affecting settlement calculations, **then** the system automatically triggers settlement recalculation within 5 seconds of saving changes.
> 2. **Given** claim details have been updated, **when** settlement recalculation is triggered, **then** all settlements linked to the claim are identified and recalculated based on current claim information and product rules.
> 3. **Given** settlement recalculation is in progress, **when** the process completes, **then** updated settlement amounts and statuses are displayed to the Claims Adjuster without requiring manual refresh.
> 4. **Given** a claim update violates Critical Illness product business rules or policy eligibility criteria, **when** the Adjuster attempts to save changes, **then** the system blocks the update and displays specific validation error messages indicating which rules were violated.
> 5. **Given** multiple settlements exist for a single claim, **when** claim details are updated, **then** all related settlements reflect the changes consistently and simultaneously.
> 6. **Given** a Claims Adjuster updates claim information, **when** settlement recalculation occurs, **then** the system creates a complete audit trail capturing the original values, updated values, timestamp, and user identity.
> 7. **Given** a Critical Illness policy is not active or in force, **when** an Adjuster attempts to update claim details, **then** the system prevents modifications and displays a message indicating policy status requirements.
> 8. **Given** settlement recalculation has completed, **when** the Adjuster reviews the claim, **then** the system clearly indicates which settlements were recalculated and highlights any changes in settlement amounts or payment status.
> 9. **Given** a claim is in a closed or finalized state, **when** an Adjuster attempts to update claim details, **then** the system prevents modifications unless the claim is reopened through proper lifecycle transition.
> 10. **Given** settlement recalculation fails due to system error or data integrity issues, **when** the failure occurs, **then** the system retains original claim updates, logs the error, and notifies the Adjuster with actionable error information without data loss.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to recalculate payment amounts whenever claim data changes, so that overpayments and underpayments are accurately identified.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: recalculate payment amounts whenever claim data changes, automatically identify overpayments and underpayments through balance calculation, and apply appropriate balance management actions
- **Value**: overpayments and underpayments are accurately identified and resolved, ensuring correct payment allocations, accurate accumulators, and proper financial reconciliation between carrier and insured

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** recalculate payment amounts whenever claim data changes, automatically identify overpayments and underpayments through balance calculation, and apply appropriate balance management actions,
> **so that** overpayments and underpayments are accurately identified and resolved, ensuring correct payment allocations, accurate accumulators, and proper financial reconciliation between carrier and insured.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System performs initial case and claim setup during intake, executing applicability rules to automatically determine and create appropriate claim types (STD, LTD, Life, etc.) based on available information.
> 2. System continuously monitors and tracks all user changes to event case, claim, and benefit details, displaying complete change history in UI history component.
> 3. System automatically triggers readjudication and payment recalculation whenever claim data is updated.
>    3.1. When updates occur before payment issuance, system recalculates payment schedule to reflect new amounts.
>    3.2. When updates occur after payments are scheduled or issued, system recalculates and updates payment schedule only (never modifying actual issued payments), enabling balance calculation against already-issued amounts.
>    3.3. When case data is updated with information that meets applicability criteria (e.g., adding death event), system automatically evaluates and creates additional claims as appropriate.
> 4. System executes balance calculation service to compare scheduled payment allocations against issued payment allocations and balance transaction allocations, incorporating expenses (money not related to payments/claims such as unpaid premium or excess refunds).
> 5. System interprets balance calculation results:
>    5.1. Balance = 0 indicates no money owed by either party.
>    5.2. Balance > 0 indicates carrier owes insured (underpayment situation).
>    5.3. Balance &lt; 0 indicates insured owes carrier (overpayment situation).
&gt; 6. Claims Adjuster applies balance management actions when balance becomes non-zero:
>    6.1. For overpayment (Balance &lt; 0), Adjuster selects from available options:
&gt;       6.1.1. Post Recovery: Used when no future payments exist; creates formal activity stating amount to be returned without additional payment transactions; impacts accumulators when recovery reaches 'issued' status.
>       6.1.2. Waive Overpayment: Reduces overpayment by amount decided to waive and not recover; impacts accumulators when waive reaches 'issued' status.
>       6.1.3. Reduce Payment (Overpayment Withholding): Used when future payments are planned; Adjuster selects withholding amount and system automatically withholds from subsequent payments until resolved; impacts accumulators when payment with withholding is issued.
>       6.1.4. Add External Overpayment: Posts overpayment from outside the specific claims case/claim; impacts total balance for payee and may require additional activities; does NOT impact accumulators.
>    6.2. For underpayment (Balance > 0), system uses specific underpayment payment type as balancing option; impacts accumulators during underpayment issuing and generation process.
> 7. Adjuster manually modifies payment allocations or adds new ones through payment management UI when necessary, triggering automatic recalculation.
> 8. System executes self-balancing process to automatically identify and offset balance items by generating self-balance transactions, ensuring correct ledger and accumulator numbers.
> 9. When balancing payment status changes (e.g., to cancelled) after initial processing, system re-impacts accumulators to reflect the status change.
> 10. System maintains balance management scope restriction: all balancing activities are performed per claim and payee, or per event case and payee only (cross-event case management not supported).


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster updates event case, claim, or benefit details before payment issuance, **When** the update is saved, **Then** the system automatically triggers readjudication and recalculates the payment schedule to reflect the new amounts within the current processing cycle.
> 2. **Given** a Claims Adjuster updates claim data after payments have been scheduled or issued, **When** the update is saved, **Then** the system recalculates and updates the payment schedule only without modifying any issued payment records, and all user changes are visible in the UI history component.
> 3. **Given** case data is updated with information that triggers applicability rules (e.g., adding death event), **When** the update is processed, **Then** the system automatically evaluates and creates additional claims if sufficient information exists to meet claim type criteria.
> 4. **Given** payment schedule updates have occurred, **When** the balance calculation service runs, **Then** the system compares scheduled payment allocations against issued payment allocations and balance transaction allocations, incorporating expenses, and produces a balance result.
> 5. **Given** balance calculation completes, **When** Balance = 0, **Then** the system indicates no money is owed by either party and no balance management action is required.
> 6. **Given** balance calculation completes, **When** Balance > 0 (carrier owes insured), **Then** the system identifies an underpayment situation and enables the Claims Adjuster to apply underpayment payment type, which impacts accumulators during underpayment issuing and generation.
> 7. **Given** balance calculation completes, **When** Balance &lt; 0 (insured owes carrier), **Then** the system identifies an overpayment situation and enables the Claims Adjuster to select from four balance management options: Post Recovery, Waive Overpayment, Reduce Payment (Overpayment Withholding), or Add External Overpayment.
&gt; 8. **Given** an overpayment exists with no future payments planned, **When** the Claims Adjuster selects Post Recovery, **Then** the system creates a formal recovery activity without additional payment transactions and impacts accumulators when the recovery reaches 'issued' status.
> 9. **Given** an overpayment exists, **When** the Claims Adjuster selects Waive Overpayment with a specified amount, **Then** the system reduces the overpayment by the waived amount and impacts accumulators when the waive reaches 'issued' status.
> 10. **Given** an overpayment exists with future payments planned, **When** the Claims Adjuster selects Reduce Payment (Overpayment Withholding) and specifies withholding amount, **Then** the system automatically withholds the specified amount from subsequent payments until the overpayment is resolved, and impacts accumulators when each payment with withholding is issued.
> 11. **Given** an overpayment from outside the specific claims case/claim needs to be recorded, **When** the Claims Adjuster selects Add External Overpayment, **Then** the system posts the overpayment, impacts total balance for the payee, does NOT impact accumulators, and may require additional activities.
> 12. **Given** the Claims Adjuster manually modifies payment allocations or adds new ones through payment management UI, **When** the changes are saved, **Then** the system automatically triggers payment recalculation.
> 13. **Given** a balancing payment (Recovery, Waive, Withholding, or Underpayment) has been processed, **When** its status changes to cancelled, **Then** the system re-impacts accumulators to reflect the status change and maintain accurate benefit limit tracking.
> 14. **Given** the self-balancing process is executed, **When** balance items are identified, **Then** the system automatically generates self-balance transactions to offset balance items and ensure correct ledger and accumulator numbers.
> 15. **Given** a Claims Adjuster attempts to manage balance across multiple event cases, **When** the action is initiated, **Then** the system prevents the action and enforces balance management scope restriction to per claim and payee, or per event case and payee only.
> 16. **Given** any balance management action is applied (except Add External Overpayment), **When** the action reaches its defined timing point (Recovery and Waive at 'issued' status; Withholding when payment issued; Underpayment during issuing/generation), **Then** the system impacts accumulators by increasing or decreasing used amounts accordingly.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manage balance transactions (recovery, underpayment, overpayment waive, payment reduction), so that I can resolve overpayments and underpayments efficiently.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: manage balance transactions (recovery, underpayment, overpayment waive, payment reduction) for payees
- **Value**: overpayments and underpayments are resolved efficiently while maintaining accurate balance records and accumulator impacts

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** manage balance transactions (recovery, underpayment, overpayment waive, payment reduction) for payees,
> **so that** overpayments and underpayments are resolved efficiently while maintaining accurate balance records and accumulator impacts.


**Key Capabilities:**

> [
>   "1. User selects a payee to initiate balance management workflow.",
>   "2. System generates and displays comprehensive balance information for the selected payee, including balance list overview and balance activities list.",
>   "3. User reviews balance details through Balance UI component to determine if corrective action is needed.",
>   "4. When balance amount is not zero, user accesses Action menu within Balance UI component to perform appropriate balance transaction based on scenario:",
>   "4.1. **Reduce Payment (Overpayment Withholding)**: When overpayment exists and future payments are planned, user initiates payment reduction. Withholding is applied during payment scheduling. Total balance updates when payment is issued, and accumulator is impacted.",
>   "4.2. **Post Recovery**: User records a recovery payment. System immediately generates recovery payment with 'issued' status. Transaction appears in transaction section and Payment and Recovery list. Total balance increases immediately upon saving, and accumulator is impacted.",
>   "4.3. **Waive Overpayment**: When business decision is made to forgive overpayment, user initiates waiver action. Total balance increases upon saving transaction data, and accumulator is impacted.",
>   "4.4. **Add External Overpayment**: User records overpayment that occurred outside the system. Total balance increases upon saving transaction data. This action does NOT impact accumulator (unique characteristic).",
>   "4.5. **Pay Underpayment**: User initiates underpayment correction. System generates underpayment payment with 'pending' status. Transaction appears in transaction section and Payment and Recovery list. Payment requires approval and issuance workflow before affecting total balance. Total balance decreases when payment is issued. User can optionally compensate withholding during this process.",
>   "5. System saves all balance transactions and updates total balance and/or accumulator according to the specific action type and payment status.",
>   "6. User can access supplementary capabilities including policy refresh (for AH Disability and LA Life claims), change history review, and related case/claim data updates as needed."

> [

>   "2.1. Recovery payment is generated with 'issued' status immediately.",
>   "2.2. Transaction appears in both transaction section and Payment and Recovery list.",
>   "2.3. Total balance amount increases by the recovery amount.",
>   "2.4. Accumulator is updated to reflect the recovery.",

>   "4. Given user selects 'Waive Overpayment' action and completes the transaction, When transaction is saved, Then total balance increases and accumulator is impacted.",
>   "5. Given user selects 'Add External Overpayment' action and enters valid data, When transaction is saved, Then total balance increases but accumulator remains unchanged.",
>   "6. Given user selects 'Pay Underpayment' action, When transaction is saved, Then:",

>   "6.2. Transaction appears in transaction section and Payment and Recovery list.",

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to adjust absence case data (tax withholdings, deductions, absence reasons, work details) and trigger automatic re-adjudication, so that claims are created and payments are recalculated based on updated information.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: adjust absence case data (tax withholdings, deductions, absence reasons, work details) and trigger automatic re-adjudication
- **Value**: claims are created and payments are recalculated based on updated information

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** adjust absence case data (tax withholdings, deductions, absence reasons, work details) and trigger automatic re-adjudication,
> **so that** claims are created and payments are recalculated based on updated information.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Case Adjuster verifies that the Absence Case has status 'Incomplete' or 'Open' before initiating any adjustment activities.
> 2. Case Adjuster performs data adjustment activities in any order and as many times as needed, including:
>    2.1 Managing Federal Income Tax (FIT) withholdings for underlying claims by entering flat dollar amounts with date ranges (system prorates across overlapping payment allocations) or percentages with date ranges (system applies to taxable amounts when payment post date falls within range).
>    2.2 Managing deductions applicable to one or many underlying claims by entering flat dollar amounts per week or percentages, designating pre-tax or post-tax application, and specifying from and through dates.
>    2.3 Managing absence reasons, which triggers automated re-adjudication flow.
>    2.4 Managing absence type, participant work days/hours, YTD earnings, absence events, absence periods, party information, occupation class, preferred payment method, payment frequency, and absence dates.
> 3. System updates the Absence Case data based on user edits and saves changes.
> 4. System automatically initiates processing workflows based on the type of data changes:
>    4.1 When tax withholdings, deductions, or other payment-impacting data is updated, system automatically recalculates payment amounts.
>    4.2 When absence reason or data affecting case applicability is updated, system automatically submits the Absence Case (if status is 'Incomplete'), evaluates case applicability to identify applicable claim types, re-evaluates eligibility and calculates Gross Benefit Amount (GBA), creates new claim types if applicable and not already created, and recalculates payments.
>    4.3 If Absence Case status was 'Incomplete' during re-adjudication, system may update status to 'Open' after processing.
> 5. System retains existing claims even when Absence Case is no longer applicable for those claims after re-adjudication (claims are not deleted).
> 6. Upon completion, the adjuster can continue to the Manage Payments and Financials process, repeat the adjustment process, or initiate claim or case closure.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an Absence Case with status 'Complete' or 'Closed', **when** the Case Adjuster attempts to adjust data, **then** the system prevents data modification and displays an appropriate status message.
> 2. **Given** an Absence Case with status 'Incomplete' or 'Open', **when** the Case Adjuster accesses the case, **then** the system allows all adjustment activities to be performed.
> 3. **Given** a Federal Income Tax withholding entered as a flat dollar amount with from and through dates, **when** the system processes payment allocations, **then** the withholding is applied only to allocations with dates overlapping the specified range and prorated when necessary.
> 4. **Given** a Federal Income Tax withholding entered as a percentage with beginning and through dates, **when** the payment post date falls within the specified range, **then** the FIT withholding percentage is applied to the taxable amount of that allocation.
> 5. **Given** a deduction entered as a flat dollar amount per week or percentage with pre-tax or post-tax designation, **when** the system calculates payments, **then** the deduction is applied correctly according to the specified parameters and date range to all applicable underlying claims.
> 6. **Given** the Case Adjuster updates tax withholdings or deductions, **when** the changes are saved, **then** the system automatically recalculates payment amounts reflecting the updated values.
> 7. **Given** the Case Adjuster updates the absence reason or other applicability-affecting data, **when** the changes are saved, **then** the system automatically initiates the re-adjudication flow including submission, applicability evaluation, eligibility evaluation, GBA calculation, and claim creation.
> 8. **Given** an Absence Case with status 'Incomplete' when absence reason is updated, **when** re-adjudication is triggered, **then** the system submits the Absence Case, executes automated adjudication processes, and may update the status to 'Open'.
> 9. **Given** re-adjudication results in the Absence Case no longer being applicable to existing claims, **when** the process completes, **then** the system retains all existing claims without deletion.
> 10. **Given** re-adjudication identifies new applicable claim types, **when** the evaluation process completes, **then** the system automatically creates the new claim types if they were not previously created.
> 11. **Given** multiple data adjustment activities are performed, **when** the Case Adjuster saves changes after each activity, **then** the system allows activities to be performed multiple times in any order without restriction.
> 12. **Given** all adjustment activities are completed, **when** the Case Adjuster finalizes updates, **then** the system enables continuation to Manage Payments and Financials process or allows the adjuster to repeat the adjustment process or initiate claim/case closure.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to update case information (reporting method, dates, employer, work state, occupation, class) and trigger payment recalculation, so that all downstream claim and payment calculations reflect the latest case data.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: update case information (reporting method, dates, employer, work state, occupation, class) and trigger payment recalculation
- **Value**: all downstream claim and payment calculations reflect the latest case data

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** update case information (reporting method, dates, employer, work state, occupation, class) and trigger payment recalculation,
> **so that** all downstream claim and payment calculations reflect the latest case data.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Claims Adjuster navigates to the Edit Additional Information function from the Case Overview screen.
> 2. System displays current case information with two primary data categories:
>    2.1 Reporting Details (Reporting Method, Date Reported)
>    2.2 Work-Related Information (Date Last Worked, Employer, Work State, Occupation, Date of Hire, Class)
> 3. Adjuster updates any combination of reporting details fields as needed to reflect accurate intake information.
> 4. Adjuster updates any combination of work-related information fields to capture current employment circumstances.
> 5. Adjuster submits the updated case information.
> 6. System validates and saves all modified case data.
> 7. System triggers recalculation processes for all dependent claims and payments associated with the case.
> 8. System returns the adjuster to the Case Overview screen displaying the updated information and confirmation of successful save.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a case has completed intake with pre-filled reporting and work information, **when** the Claims Adjuster accesses Edit Additional Information, **then** all current values are displayed and editable.
> 2. **Given** the adjuster updates one or more fields in the Reporting Details section, **when** the form is submitted, **then** the system saves the updated Reporting Method and Date Reported and displays them on Case Overview.
> 3. **Given** the adjuster updates one or more fields in the Work-Related Information section (Employer, Work State, Occupation, Date of Hire, Class, Date Last Worked), **when** the form is submitted, **then** all updated values are saved and reflected on the Case Overview screen.
> 4. **Given** case information is successfully updated, **when** the save operation completes, **then** the system automatically triggers recalculation of all downstream claim payments based on the new case data.
> 5. **Given** the adjuster is on the Edit Additional Information screen, **when** they submit the form with valid data, **then** the system navigates back to the Case Overview UI within 3 seconds and displays a confirmation message.
> 6. **Given** dependent claims exist with calculated payments, **when** work-related information (Class, Occupation, or Work State) is modified, **then** all affected payment amounts are recalculated to reflect the updated case attributes.
> 7. **Given** the adjuster attempts to save without making any changes, **when** the form is submitted, **then** the system returns to Case Overview without triggering unnecessary recalculation processes.
> 8. **Given** required fields are left blank or invalid data is entered, **when** the adjuster attempts to submit, **then** the system blocks submission and displays inline error messages indicating which fields require correction.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to trigger payment recalculation when specific claim attributes change (coverage amounts, dates, deductions, offsets, taxable percentages), so that payment schedules are updated to reflect the correct benefit amounts.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: trigger payment recalculation when specific claim attributes change (coverage amounts, dates, deductions, offsets, taxable percentages)
- **Value**: payment schedules are updated to reflect the correct benefit amounts and overpay/underpay balances are automatically generated

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** trigger payment recalculation when specific claim attributes change (coverage amounts, dates, deductions, offsets, taxable percentages),
> **so that** payment schedules are updated to reflect the correct benefit amounts and overpay/underpay balances are automatically generated.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User modifies case-level attributes that trigger payment recalculation across all affected claims:
>    1.1 Change Actively At Work (AAW) Date which cascades to claim level and triggers recalculation for all affected allocations and claims.
>    1.2 Add retroactive ancillary activities such as rehabilitation services.
>    1.3 Add or change retroactive deductions.
>    1.4 Add retroactive tax withholding.
>    1.5 Execute reduce payment action.
>    1.6 Change FICA Social Security exempt or FICA Medicare exempt attributes.
> 2. User modifies claim-level attributes that trigger payment recalculation for specific claims:
>    2.1 Update Face Value which recalculates gross amount of settlement and allocation amounts.
>    2.2 Update Annual Covered Earnings (when editable) which recalculates face value and subsequent settlement amounts.
>    2.3 Change Covered Earnings on a disability claim.
>    2.4 Add or change retroactive offsets including automatic offsets.
>    2.5 Change Gross Benefit Amount of a coverage.
>    2.6 Change Elimination Period end date or Benefit Period start/end dates.
>    2.7 Change Taxable percentage of a disability claim.
>    2.8 Change Current Earnings value of a Partial Disability payment.
> 3. Upon any attribute modification, user saves the changes which initiates automated recalculation process.
> 4. System recalculates Gross Amount of Settlement based on the modified attribute values.
> 5. System recalculates Allocation amounts for all affected payments.
> 6. System automatically generates new balance records when existing issued payment records exist:
>    6.1 System calculates underpay balance when new calculated amount exceeds previously issued payment.
>    6.2 System calculates overpay balance when new calculated amount is less than previously issued payment.
> 7. System completes recalculation and makes updated payment schedules and balance records available for review and action.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim with an existing issued payment of $5,000 with face value of $5,000,
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster updates the face value to $6,000 and clicks Save,
>    **Then** the system recalculates the gross amount of death coverage to $6,000 and generates an underpay balance record of $1,000.
> 2. **Given** a disability claim with existing payment records,
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster changes the Taxable percentage and saves,
>    **Then** the system recalculates the Gross Amount of Settlement, Allocation amounts, and generates a new balance record reflecting the difference.
> 3. **Given** multiple claims associated with a single event case,
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster changes the Actively At Work (AAW) Date at the case level,
>    **Then** the system cascades the change to all affected claims and triggers payment recalculation for all related allocations.
> 4. **Given** a claim with issued payments,
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster adds a retroactive deduction and saves,
>    **Then** the system recalculates the Gross Amount of Settlement, Allocation amounts, and generates an overpay balance record if applicable.
> 5. **Given** a disability claim,
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster updates Annual Covered Earnings (when editable) and saves,
>    **Then** the system recalculates the face value based on the new earnings, recalculates settlement and allocation amounts, and generates balance records if existing payments exist.
> 6. **Given** a claim with existing payment records,
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster changes the Elimination Period end date or Benefit Period dates,
>    **Then** the system recalculates all affected payment allocations and generates appropriate balance records.
> 7. **Given** a claim with previously issued payments,
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster adds or changes a retroactive offset and saves,
>    **Then** the system recalculates settlement amounts and generates balance records reflecting overpay or underpay amounts.
> 8. **Given** a claim requiring payment reduction,
>    **When** the Claims Adjuster triggers the reduce payment action with corresponding data and saves,
>    **Then** the system recalculates the Gross Amount of Settlement, Allocation amounts, and generates appropriate balance records.
> 9. **Given** any attribute change that triggers recalculation,
>    **When** no existing issued payment records exist,
>    **Then** the system recalculates settlement and allocation amounts without generating balance records.
> 10. **Given** a case with retroactive ancillary activities,
>     **When** the Claims Adjuster adds rehabilitation services and saves,
>     **Then** the system triggers recalculation for all affected payment schedules and generates balance records as needed.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view and manage balance transactions (issued payments, scheduled payments, balance adjustments) per payee, so that I can accurately determine overpayment or underpayment amounts.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: view and manage balance transactions (issued payments, scheduled payments, balance adjustments) per payee
- **Value**: I can accurately determine overpayment or underpayment amounts and take appropriate corrective actions

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** view and manage balance transactions (issued payments, scheduled payments, balance adjustments) per payee,
> **so that** I can accurately determine overpayment or underpayment amounts and take appropriate corrective actions.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User selects a specific payee as a mandatory precondition for balance review and management.
> 2. System generates and displays balance data for the selected payee, including balance list and balance activities list through the Balance UI component.
> 3. User previews current balance status and reviews transaction history via the Balance Overview interface.
> 4. When payee balance is non-zero, user accesses balance management actions from the Action menu.
> 5. User executes balance correction actions based on specific scenarios:
>    5.1 **Reduce Payment (Overpayment Withholding)** - When overpayment exists and future payments are planned:
>       - User selects 'Reduce payment' action and configures withholding amount.
>       - System applies overpayment withholding during payment scheduling process.
>       - Amount impacts total balance only when payment containing withholding is issued (increases total balance).
>       - Issued recovery impacts the accumulator.
>    5.2 **Post Recovery** - When recovery needs to be recorded:
>       - User adds recovery through Balance UI Action section.
>       - System immediately generates recovery payment with 'issued' status.
>       - Transaction appears in Balance UI and Payment and Recovery List UI.
>       - Amount impacts total balance upon saving recovery data (increases total balance).
>       - Issued recovery impacts the accumulator.
>    5.3 **Waive Overpayment** - When overpayment exists and waiver is appropriate:
>       - User adds overpayment waive (action only available if overpayment exists in balance).
>       - Amount impacts total balance on saving transaction data (increases total balance).
>       - Issued overpayment waive impacts the accumulator.
>    5.4 **Add External Overpayment** - When external overpayment needs to be recorded (always available):
>       - User adds external overpayment through Balance UI Action section.
>       - Amount impacts total balance on saving transaction data (increases total balance).
>       - Exception: External overpayment does NOT impact the accumulator.
>    5.5 **Pay Underpayment** - When underpayment needs to be compensated:
>       - User adds underpayment through Balance UI Action section.
>       - System generates underpayment payment with 'pending' status.
>       - Payment appears in Payment and Recovery List UI and proceeds through approval and issuance workflow.
>       - Amount impacts total balance only upon payment issuance (decreases total balance).
>       - User optionally selects to compensate withholding.
> 6. User views generated payments and recoveries in Payment and Recovery List UI for review and tracking.
> 7. User accesses change history through Common UI Component - History and Case Overview - History interfaces for audit purposes.
> 8. User updates case data through Case Overview interface, with case updates remaining independent and not cascading to disability claims.
> 9. User updates claim data through Claim Overview interface with policy refresh capabilities available for both AH Disability and LA Life products.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a Claims Adjuster accesses the Balance UI **without** selecting a payee, **When** attempting to view balance data, **Then** the system prompts for mandatory payee selection and does not display balance information.
> 2. **Given** a payee is selected, **When** the Claims Adjuster views the Balance Overview, **Then** the system displays the balance list, balance activities list, and current total balance within 2 seconds.
> 3. **Given** the selected payee has a zero balance, **When** the Claims Adjuster views the Action menu, **Then** only the 'Add External Overpayment' action is available (always available regardless of balance).
> 4. **Given** the selected payee has a non-zero balance, **When** the Claims Adjuster views the Action menu, **Then** all applicable balance management actions are displayed (Recovery, Overpayment Waive, Payment Reduction, Underpayment, External Overpayment).
> 5. **Given** there is no overpayment in the balance, **When** the Claims Adjuster attempts to select 'Waive Overpayment', **Then** the action is disabled or not displayed in the Action menu.
> 6. **Given** an overpayment exists and future payments are planned, **When** the Claims Adjuster configures and saves a 'Reduce Payment' withholding, **Then** the system applies the withholding during payment scheduling and the total balance increases only when the payment is issued.
> 7. **Given** a Claims Adjuster posts a recovery, **When** the recovery is saved, **Then** the system immediately generates a recovery payment with 'issued' status, displays the transaction in Balance UI, updates the total balance immediately (increase), and impacts the accumulator.
> 8. **Given** a Claims Adjuster adds an external overpayment, **When** the transaction is saved, **Then** the system updates the total balance immediately (increase) but does NOT impact the accumulator.
> 9. **Given** a Claims Adjuster adds an underpayment payment, **When** the underpayment is saved, **Then** the system generates a payment with 'pending' status, displays it in Payment and Recovery List UI, and updates the total balance only upon payment issuance (decrease).
> 10. **Given** a balance transaction has been created, **When** the Claims Adjuster attempts to cancel or modify the transaction via UI, **Then** the system prevents the action (current UI limitation, backend operations allow cancellation).
> 11. **Given** any balance management action is performed, **When** the Claims Adjuster views the change history, **Then** the system displays the transaction details, timestamp, and user information through the History interface.
> 12. **Given** a Claims Adjuster updates case data through Case Overview, **When** the case is associated with a disability claim, **Then** the system saves the case updates without cascading changes to the disability claim.
> 13. **Given** a Claims Adjuster updates claim data through Claim Overview, **When** the claim is for AH Disability or LA Life products, **Then** the system provides policy refresh capabilities and saves the claim updates successfully.
> 14. **Given** multiple balance transactions exist for a payee, **When** the Claims Adjuster reviews the Balance Activities List, **Then** all transactions are displayed with their status, amount, transaction type, and impact on total balance in chronological order.
> 15. **Given** an underpayment payment with the 'compensate withholding' option, **When** the payment is issued, **Then** the system correctly applies the withholding compensation and reflects the adjustment in the total balance.

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to apply COLA adjustments to disability payments based on policy parameters and anniversary dates, so that benefit amounts are correctly increased according to cost-of-living adjustments.
- **Role**: Claims Adjuster
- **Action**: apply COLA adjustments to disability payments based on policy parameters and anniversary dates
- **Value**: benefit amounts are correctly increased according to cost-of-living adjustments

**Description:**

> **As a** Claims Adjuster,
> **I want to** apply COLA adjustments to disability payments based on policy parameters and anniversary dates,
> **so that** benefit amounts are correctly increased according to cost-of-living adjustments.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System verifies all preconditions are met before applying COLA, including configuration of COLA parameters, calculation of Anniversary date, and calculation of accumulated adjustment percentage.
>   1.1 If any precondition is not satisfied, COLA calculation is blocked and payment proceeds without adjustment until preconditions are met.
> 2. System evaluates payment eligibility against three distinct criteria sets to determine COLA applicability.
>   2.1 Coverage Type: COLA applies only to Main LTD coverage payments; expense payments, ex-gratia payments, and interest payments are excluded.
>   2.2 Payee Requirement: COLA applies only when the member is the payee; payments to different payees are excluded regardless of other criteria.
>   2.3 Disability Status: Full disability payments always receive COLA; partial disability payments receive COLA only if the parameter 'COLA Applies to the Partial Disability' is set to Yes.
>   2.4 If payment is before the first Anniversary Date, COLA does not apply.
> 3. System determines the calculation basis according to policy configuration for eligible payments.
>   3.1 For Net Benefit policies: COLA applies to AGBA (Adjusted Gross Benefit Amount), calculated as GBA minus Offsets, where GBA includes only main benefit (Core or BuyUp) excluding Rehab and other additions.
>   3.2 For Gross Benefit policies: COLA applies to GBA (Gross Benefit Amount) before offsets, where GBA includes only main benefit excluding additional benefits.
>   3.3 For partial disability when allowed: Net Benefit policies apply same adjustments as AGBA calculation but exclude offsets; Gross Benefit policies apply same adjustments as AGBA but do not apply offsets.
> 4. System calculates COLA adjustment amount using the formula: COLA $ = (AGBA or GBA per policy rules)  accumulated COLA percentage.
>   4.1 COLA is calculated on a monthly basis with automatic proration by 30 days for partial month payment periods.
>   4.2 For mid-month COLA effective dates, the system applies the percentage calculated for the first day of the payment period.
>   4.3 For payments covering periods less than a full month, both the calculation basis (GBA or AGBA) and the resulting COLA amount are prorated with explicit reflection of payment percentage, from dates, and through dates.
> 5. System stores COLA amount separately as a distinct component to clearly identify the portion of benefit representing cost-of-living increase.
> 6. System applies financial treatment rules to COLA adjustments.
>   6.1 COLA is taxed identically to main coverage benefits including FICA, Federal, and State taxes.
>   6.2 COLA is subject to the same deductions as AGBA.
>   6.3 COLA increase is excluded from maximum benefit amount calculations defined or calculated by policy data.
> 7. System excludes specific benefit components from COLA calculation basis, including Rehab Incentive Benefit, Survivor Benefits, and other additions beyond main LTD coverage.
> 8. System triggers COLA recalculation in response to standard conditions (GBA changes, approval periods changes, payment allocations changes) and COLA-specific conditions.
>   8.1 Payment-level triggers: Payee changes, approval period changes to/from Partial Disability status, approval period removals or status changes, Date of Loss changes, Offsets changes, payment schedule updates, and payment status changes.
>   8.2 Policy-level triggers: Policy data updates during adjudication, adjuster-initiated policy refresh, COLA value changes or any changes impacting GBA or payment data.
>   8.3 When policy percentage type changes from CPI to Fixed during active claim, system recalculates COLA using Compound approach regardless of standard Fixed calculation method.
> 9. System reflects all COLA-related changes in the Balance once at least one payment is issued, including payment rescheduling after issuance, Recovery posting, Underpayment payment, and Auto balancing scenarios.
> 10. Payment is issued with COLA adjustment incorporated and properly documented.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** COLA parameters are not configured OR Anniversary date is not calculated OR accumulated percentage is not calculated, **When** a payment is processed, **Then** the system blocks COLA calculation and processes the payment without COLA adjustment.
> 2. **Given** all preconditions are met and payment is for Main LTD coverage with member as payee for full disability, **When** the payment date is on or after the first Anniversary Date, **Then** the system applies COLA adjustment to the eligible payment.
> 3. **Given** a payment is for expense, ex-gratia, or interest (flagged as 'Is Interest'), **When** COLA eligibility is evaluated, **Then** the system excludes this payment from COLA calculations regardless of other criteria.
> 4. **Given** the payee is different from the member, **When** COLA eligibility is evaluated, **Then** the system excludes this payment from COLA calculations regardless of coverage type or disability status.
> 5. **Given** a partial disability payment and parameter 'COLA Applies to the Partial Disability' is set to No, **When** COLA eligibility is evaluated, **Then** the system does not apply COLA to the payment.
> 6. **Given** a partial disability payment and parameter 'COLA Applies to the Partial Disability' is set to Yes, **When** COLA eligibility is evaluated, **Then** the system applies COLA according to the disability calculation method.
> 7. **Given** a Net Benefit policy with full disability payment, **When** COLA is calculated, **Then** the system applies COLA to AGBA (GBA minus Offsets) where GBA includes only main benefit.
> 8. **Given** a Gross Benefit policy with full disability payment, **When** COLA is calculated, **Then** the system applies COLA to GBA before offsets where GBA includes only main benefit.
> 9. **Given** a payment allocation period is less than a full month, **When** COLA is calculated, **Then** the system prorates both the calculation basis and COLA amount by 30 days with explicit payment percentage, from dates, and through dates.
> 10. **Given** COLA becomes effective mid-month, **When** COLA percentage is applied, **Then** the system uses the percentage calculated for the first day of the payment period.
> 11. **Given** COLA has been calculated for a payment, **When** the payment is processed, **Then** the system stores the COLA amount separately and distinctly from other benefit components.
> 12. **Given** COLA is applied to a payment, **When** taxation is calculated, **Then** the system applies FICA, Federal, and State taxes to COLA identically to main coverage benefits.
> 13. **Given** COLA is applied to a payment, **When** deductions are calculated, **Then** the system applies the same deductions to COLA as applied to AGBA.
> 14. **Given** COLA has been applied to a payment, **When** maximum benefit amount is calculated, **Then** the system excludes the COLA increase from the maximum benefit threshold calculation.
> 15. **Given** a payment includes Rehab Incentive Benefit, Survivor Benefits, or other additions, **When** COLA calculation basis is determined, **Then** the system excludes these components and calculates COLA only on main benefit (Core or BuyUp).
> 16. **Given** at least one payment has been issued with COLA, **When** GBA changes OR approval periods change OR payment allocations change, **Then** the system triggers COLA recalculation for affected payments.
> 17. **Given** at least one payment has been issued with COLA, **When** payee changes OR approval period changes to/from Partial Disability OR Date of Loss changes OR Offsets change OR payment schedule updates OR payment status changes, **Then** the system triggers payment-level COLA recalculation.
> 18. **Given** at least one payment has been issued with COLA, **When** policy data is updated OR policy is refreshed by adjuster OR COLA values change, **Then** the system triggers policy-level COLA recalculation for all affected payments.
> 19. **Given** policy percentage type changes from CPI to Fixed during an active claim, **When** COLA recalculation is triggered, **Then** the system recalculates COLA using the Compound approach regardless of standard Fixed calculation method.
> 20. **Given** at least one payment has been issued with COLA, **When** any COLA-related change occurs in the payment schedule (rescheduling, Recovery posting, Underpayment payment, Auto balancing), **Then** the system reflects the changes in the Balance.
> 21. **Given** a payment date is before the first Anniversary Date, **When** COLA eligibility is evaluated, **Then** the system does not apply COLA to the payment.

>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=735715176"
> ]
