#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to update claim plan selection and automatically recalculate settlements, payments, and balances, so that coverage eligibility and payment amounts reflect the new plan.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: update claim plan selection and trigger automated recalculation of settlements, payments, and financial balances to reflect the new plan's coverage eligibility and benefit amounts
- **Value**: coverage eligibility and payment amounts accurately reflect the current plan selection, ensuring correct benefit adjudication and preventing overpayments or underpayments

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **update claim plan selection and trigger automated recalculation of settlements, payments, and financial balances to reflect the new plan's coverage eligibility and benefit amounts**,
> So that **coverage eligibility and payment amounts accurately reflect the current plan selection, ensuring correct benefit adjudication and preventing overpayments or underpayments**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Adjuster initiates plan selection change on claim associated with master policy containing multiple plans
> 2. System triggers recalculation engine when existing coverages are present under the claim
> 3. System readjudicates valid settlements by recalculating gross amounts, validating eligibility, and updating existing coverage records
>     3.1 Upon coverage becoming invalid under new plan, system marks settlement as non-eligible and removes coverage from payment schedules
> 4. System reschedules future payments with updated amounts or payment dates when payment schedules exist
> 5. System generates overpay/underpay balances for payments already issued, cleared, or stop-requested; no action taken for voided or declined payments
> 6. Adjuster manually adds new coverages applicable under the newly selected plan


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** claim has no existing coverages, **When** adjuster changes plan selection, **Then** system saves new plan without triggering recalculation
> 2. **Given** existing settlement remains valid under new plan, **When** recalculation executes, **Then** system updates gross amounts and eligibility without creating duplicate coverage records
> 3. **Given** existing coverage becomes invalid under new plan, **When** recalculation executes, **Then** system marks settlement as non-eligible and removes associated payment allocations
> 4. **Given** payments already issued exist for affected coverages, **When** recalculation completes, **Then** system automatically generates appropriate overpay or underpay balances
> 5. **Given** payment schedule exists for valid settlement, **When** recalculation occurs, **Then** system reschedules future payments with updated amounts or dates
> 6. **Given** recalculation completes, **When** adjuster reviews claim, **Then** accumulator balances reflect adjustments for both valid and invalid settlements

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to add and manage deductions (flat amount or percentage, pre/post-tax) with effective date ranges, so that deductions are correctly applied to claim payments.

- **Action**: establish and maintain payment deductions with flexible calculation rules and effective date controls

> I want to **establish and maintain payment deductions with flexible calculation rules and effective date controls**,
> So that **deductions are accurately applied to benefit payments according to regulatory requirements and claimant circumstances**

> 1. User accesses deduction management interface at case or claim level based on configured payment hierarchy
> 2. User initiates deduction establishment by specifying deduction category, priority, payee party, and applicable time period
> 3. User defines calculation methodology selecting amount basis (weekly, monthly, fixed, percentage) with claim-type-specific restrictions
>     3.1 Upon weekly/monthly selection, system restricts to disability claims with single claim assignment
>     3.2 Upon percentage selection, system enables multi-claim application
> 4. User designates tax treatment and payment source allocation ensuring distinct payee and payor parties

> 2. **Given** deduction requires payee specification, **When** adjuster submits without distinct parties, **Then** system prevents submission with party conflict notification
> 3. **Given** overlapping deduction exists, **When** adjuster attempts duplicate establishment, **Then** system blocks creation unless multiple parties configured
> 4. **Given** percentage-based deduction, **When** adjuster selects amount value, **Then** system enforces 0-100 range validation
> 5. **Given** fixed amount selected for non-qualifying claim type, **When** adjuster attempts submission, **Then** system prevents processing with claim type restriction message
> 6. **Given** no eligible claims exist, **When** adjuster accesses interface, **Then** system disables all deduction management actions

### Epic: Product-Specific Domain Logic

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to trigger automatic recalculations when key claim information is updated, so that all claim records and calculated figures are adjusted based on the latest data.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: trigger automatic recalculation of claim records and financial figures when critical claim or case information is updated
- **Value**: all dependent calculations, payment schedules, and balances remain accurate and consistent with the latest claim data without manual intervention

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **trigger automatic recalculation of claim records and financial figures when critical claim or case information is updated**,
> So that **all dependent calculations, payment schedules, and balances remain accurate and consistent with the latest claim data without manual intervention**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System detects updates to critical case-level parameters (actively-at-work dates, retroactive ancillaries, deductions, tax withholdings, payment reductions)
> 2. System identifies changes to claim-level financial elements (covered earnings, offsets, gross benefit amounts, taxable percentages, current earnings for partial disability)
> 3. System automatically recalculates all dependent claim records, benefit amounts, and payment schedules based on updated information
> 4. System adjusts payment timelines and reschedules future disbursements to reflect recalculated amounts
> 5. System updates claim balances, overpayments, and outstanding amounts across all affected coverages
> 6. System maintains audit trail of recalculation triggers and resulting adjustments


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** case-level information is updated, **When** recalculation is triggered, **Then** system adjusts all dependent claim records reflecting the change
> 2. **Given** claim-level financial data is modified, **When** recalculation executes, **Then** benefit amounts and payment schedules are updated accordingly
> 3. **Given** retroactive adjustments are applied, **When** recalculation completes, **Then** past payment records and future schedules reflect corrected amounts
> 4. **Given** multiple simultaneous changes occur, **When** recalculation processes, **Then** system applies updates in correct dependency order
> 5. **Given** recalculation identifies overpayments, **When** processing completes, **Then** balances reflect recovery amounts and future payment adjustments
> 6. **Given** recalculation fails validation, **When** error occurs, **Then** system prevents submission and preserves data integrity


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=585311833"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to adjust claim information across multiple steps (Policy, Claim Details, Payment Details, Review), so that I can comprehensively modify claim data before submission.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: adjust and recalculate claim information through a multi-step workflow to correct or update claim data and trigger automatic re-adjudication
- **Value**: ensure accurate claim outcomes, maintain data integrity, and improve settlement accuracy through comprehensive claim modification capabilities

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **adjust and recalculate claim information through a multi-step workflow to correct or update claim data and trigger automatic re-adjudication**,
> So that **I can ensure accurate claim outcomes, maintain data integrity, and improve settlement accuracy through comprehensive claim modification capabilities**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates adjustment workflow when claim is in eligible status (Pending, Open, Suspended, or Closed with specific reasons)
> 2. User provides updated policy holder and coverage information in initial intake stage
> 3. User modifies claim details including provider information, service records, and supplementary data while system enforces business constraints
> 4. User reviews consolidated changes across all modification stages before final submission
> 5. Upon submission confirmation, system validates business rules, executes automatic re-adjudication, updates claim status, and records audit trail
>     5.1 If validation fails, user returns to previous stage to correct issues
>     5.2 If submission fails, system presents error details for resolution


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** claim is in adjustable status, **When** adjuster has update privileges, **Then** system enables adjustment workflow access
> 2. **Given** adjustment is initiated, **When** user navigates multi-step process, **Then** system enforces data constraints and preserves unadjustable attributes
> 3. **Given** changes are completed, **When** user submits for validation, **Then** system executes business rule checks before allowing final submission
> 4. **Given** validation succeeds and submission is confirmed, **When** system processes adjustment, **Then** automatic re-adjudication executes, status updates, and audit records are created
> 5. **Given** validation or submission fails, **When** errors are detected, **Then** system prevents completion and provides actionable feedback
> 6. **Given** user cancels mid-workflow, **When** cancellation is confirmed, **Then** system discards unsaved changes and restores original claim state

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to automatically re-adjudicate settlements when claim information is adjusted, so that benefit amounts, deductibles, and coverage decisions are recalculated based on updated data.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: automatically re-adjudicate settlements when claim information is adjusted
- **Value**: benefit amounts, deductibles, and coverage decisions are recalculated accurately based on updated claim data, ensuring payment accuracy and compliance

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **automatically re-adjudicate settlements when claim information is adjusted**,
> So that **benefit amounts, deductibles, and coverage decisions are recalculated accurately based on updated claim data, ensuring payment accuracy and compliance**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System resets settlement and loss status to pending upon claim adjustment submission
> 2. System clears existing reserves and reverts deductible usage from used to remaining
> 3. System executes automatic adjudication to recalculate settlement proposals
> 4. System reallocates deductibles sequentially across allowed procedures
>     4.1 First procedure exhausts available deductible
>     4.2 Remaining deductible reduces subsequent procedures sequentially
> 5. When payment schedule exists, system automatically reschedules payments
> 6. System creates and issues updated payments based on recalculated settlement


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim is adjusted, **When** submission occurs, **Then** system resets settlement status and clears reserves
> 2. **Given** deductible was previously used, **When** re-adjudication triggers, **Then** system reverts deductible to remaining
> 3. **Given** settlement recalculation completes, **When** multiple procedures exist, **Then** deductible allocates sequentially starting with first procedure
> 4. **Given** payment schedule exists, **When** settlement is re-adjudicated, **Then** system reschedules payments automatically
> 5. **Given** re-adjudication succeeds, **When** process completes, **Then** system issues updated payment
> 6. **Given** claim is suspended during process, **When** suspension triggers, **Then** re-adjudication halts and executes suspension workflow

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to automatically reschedule payments when claim adjustments are made, so that payment amounts and schedules reflect the latest benefit calculations.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: automatically reschedule payments when claim adjustments are made
- **Value**: payment amounts and schedules reflect the latest benefit calculations without manual intervention

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **automatically reschedule payments when claim adjustments are made**,
> So that **payment amounts and schedules reflect the latest benefit calculations without manual intervention**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. When adjuster submits a claim adjustment for eligible claims, system triggers automatic re-adjudication
> 2. System generates updated payment template version incorporating latest benefit calculations
> 3. System cancels existing payment schedules and unapproved payments tied to previous adjudication
> 4. System creates new payment records aligned with updated benefit amounts
>     4.1 For non-issued payments, system updates amounts per revised calculations
>     4.2 For issued payments, system evaluates procedure changes and benefit variances
> 5. Upon completion, system renders updated payment information excluding canceled records
> 6. System tracks payment status transitions throughout rescheduling process


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim in adjustable status, **When** adjuster completes adjustment submission, **Then** system automatically initiates payment rescheduling
> 2. **Given** existing payment schedules exist, **When** rescheduling executes, **Then** system cancels all open/active/suspended schedules
> 3. **Given** unapproved payments exist, **When** rescheduling processes, **Then** system cancels approved or issue-requested payments
> 4. **Given** benefit amounts change, **When** creating new payments, **Then** system calculates amounts using updated benefit data
> 5. **Given** issued payments exist, **When** procedures remain unchanged, **Then** system preserves issued payment amounts
> 6. **Given** rescheduling completes, **When** displaying payment information, **Then** system excludes automatically canceled records from view

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to add, edit, or delete fees during claim adjustment, so that additional charges or concessions are properly captured and applied to payments.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: manage fees during claim adjustment to ensure additional charges or concessions are properly captured and reflected in settlement calculations
- **Value**: accurate claim payments reflect all applicable fees, supporting proper financial reconciliation and claim closure

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **manage fees during claim adjustment to ensure additional charges or concessions are properly captured and reflected in settlement calculations**,
> So that **accurate claim payments reflect all applicable fees, supporting proper financial reconciliation and claim closure**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates claim adjustment process and accesses fee management capabilities
> 2. User modifies fee information by adding new charges, editing amounts, or removing obsolete fees based on payment status
>     2.1 Upon closed claim adjustment, system restricts modifications to fees already applied to issued payments
>     2.2 System permits changes to fees associated with pending payments
> 3. User submits adjustments triggering automated settlement recalculation
> 4. System re-adjudicates settlement allocating fees to appropriate payments based on claim type and payment schedule
> 5. System reschedules affected payments reflecting updated fee totals
> 6. System processes payment issuance and automatically closes claim when all obligations are fulfilled

> 3. **Given** an orthodontic services claim, **When** fees are added, **Then** system allocates fees to the first pending payment without issued status
> 4. **Given** a closed claim with issued payments, **When** user attempts adjustment, **Then** system prevents modification of fees already applied to issued payments
> 5. **Given** fees are added without new procedures, **When** user submits, **Then** system updates existing payment amounts without generating new payments
> 6. **Given** all payments are issued, **When** settlement is complete, **Then** system automatically closes the claim

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manually override adjudication review-required rules, so that I can approve procedures that require manual review and continue the adjudication process.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: manually override system-flagged review-required adjudication rules on specific procedures
- **Value**: I can expedite claim settlements by approving flagged procedures that require manual judgment, ensuring continuous adjudication workflow without unnecessary delays

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **manually override system-flagged review-required adjudication rules on specific procedures**,
> So that **I can expedite claim settlements by approving flagged procedures that require manual judgment, ensuring continuous adjudication workflow without unnecessary delays**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System identifies procedures flagged with review-required status during claim adjudication and presents override capability to authorized users
> 2. User reviews the specific rule triggering the review requirement, including clinical rationale and applicable procedure codes
> 3. User exercises manual override authority to approve the flagged procedure
>     3.1 Upon cancellation, system retains original review status without adjudication changes
> 4. System nullifies the review-required flag and resumes automated adjudication for remaining rules based on defined sequence
> 5. System recalculates settlement proposal according to updated adjudication flags and business rules


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim with procedure status of review-required and user holds override privileges, **When** user accesses the procedure, **Then** system presents override action with rule-specific justification details
> 2. **Given** user approves the override, **When** system processes the approval, **Then** review-required flag is nullified and adjudication continues through remaining rule sequences
> 3. **Given** user cancels the override action, **When** cancellation is confirmed, **Then** system retains original review-required status without adjudication modifications
> 4. **Given** multiple review rules exist on single procedure, **When** override is approved, **Then** system processes only highest-priority rule per business hierarchy
> 5. **Given** successful override completion, **When** adjudication recalculates, **Then** settlement proposal reflects updated adjudication results and payment amounts

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to adjust disability claims by modifying key information such as covered earnings, offsets, benefit amounts, and elimination periods, so that all dependent calculations are automatically recalculated.

- **Action**: adjust disability claim parameters and trigger automatic recalculation of dependent values, payment schedules, and balances

> So that **claim financial accuracy is maintained across all interdependent elements without manual recalculation, reducing errors and processing time**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User is able to modify critical claim parameters including covered earnings, benefit amounts, elimination periods, and offset information
> 2. Upon modification of case-level triggers (work status dates, ancillary services, deductions, tax withholding), system initiates recalculation process
> 3. Upon modification of claim-level triggers (earnings, offsets, benefit periods, taxable percentages), system recalculates dependent values
> 4. System automatically adjusts previously generated claim records and payment schedules based on parameter changes
> 5. System updates financial balances to reflect recalculated amounts across case and claim levels
> 6. User is able to review recalculated outputs including updated payment obligations and benefit entitlements


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 2. **Given** elimination or benefit periods are adjusted, **When** changes are submitted, **Then** payment schedules reflect updated timelines without manual intervention
> 3. **Given** retroactive offsets or deductions are added, **When** recalculation completes, **Then** historical payment balances are adjusted accordingly
> 4. **Given** case-level parameters change, **When** triggers activate, **Then** all associated claims reflect cascading recalculations
> 5. **Given** incomplete or invalid parameter modifications, **When** submission attempted, **Then** system prevents recalculation until data integrity is restored
> 6. **Given** recalculation completes, **When** adjuster reviews results, **Then** audit trail captures original and recalculated values with timestamp

>     2.1 Upon pre-payment adjustment, user modifies provider information, claim attributes, service details, and financial data with full editing privileges
>     2.2 Upon post-payment adjustment, user updates information with restricted privilegesonly charge amounts modifiable for previously paid services

> 4. Upon successful submission, system executes automatic re-adjudication, recalculates settlement amounts, updates claim status, and records all modifications in audit trail

> 3. **Given** post-payment claim adjustment, **When** adjuster attempts modifications, **Then** system restricts editing to charge amounts only for previously paid services while allowing new service additions
> 4. **Given** completed adjustment data, **When** adjuster submits changes, **Then** system validates business rules and prevents submission if data integrity constraints are violated
> 5. **Given** validated adjustment submission, **When** system processes changes, **Then** automatic re-adjudication executes, settlement recalculates, and claim status updates according to new proposal
> 6. **Given** adjustment completion, **When** system finalizes transaction, **Then** all modifications are recorded in audit trail and adjuster navigates to refreshed claim overview

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to complete Premium Waiver Approval Period Creation Request tasks, so that new approval periods are properly initiated when manually specified.

- **Value**: premium waiver benefits remain continuously managed with proper approval cycles, ensuring timely benefit administration and preventing coverage gaps

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **complete premium waiver approval period creation request tasks to initiate new manually-specified approval periods**,
> So that **premium waiver benefits remain continuously managed with proper approval cycles, ensuring timely benefit administration and preventing coverage gaps**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System automatically generates approval period creation request tasks when manual approval frequency is configured and timing conditions are met
> 2. Upon task generation, system validates benefit period status, remaining accumulator balance, and absence of upcoming approved periods
> 3. User is able to review task details and confirm completion to initiate the approval period creation workflow
> 4. System prevents duplicate task generation for the same approval period timeline
> 5. When completed, task triggers downstream approval period establishment processes


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** manual approval frequency is configured and current date is within the specified threshold of period end date, **When** all eligibility conditions are satisfied, **Then** system generates a single approval period creation request task
> 2. **Given** a creation request task exists, **When** user completes the task, **Then** system marks task as completed and enables subsequent approval period workflows
> 3. **Given** premium waiver accumulator is depleted or business process has ended, **When** system evaluates task generation, **Then** no new tasks are created
> 4. **Given** an upcoming approved or disapproved period already exists, **When** system checks preconditions, **Then** task generation is prevented

> 4. **Given** incomplete preconditions, **When** system evaluates triggers, **Then** withholds task creation until all conditions met
> 5. **Given** task completion initiated, **When** user finalizes action, **Then** system records authorization and updates waiver approval period

>     1.1 When timing condition is met (approval end date minus configured days), system initiates task creation
>     1.2 System prevents duplicate task generation for the same claim
> 2. User accesses assigned followup task from task queue
> 3. User reviews claim documentation status and outstanding requirements
> 4. User verifies all necessary documentation is prepared for approval decision
> 5. User completes task to confirm readiness for approval period conclusion

**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 2. **Given** a followup task already exists for a claim, **When** timing conditions are met again, **Then** system prevents duplicate task creation
> 3. **Given** user accesses the generated task, **When** user reviews documentation requirements, **Then** system displays relevant claim and approval period information
> 4. **Given** user completes documentation review, **When** user finalizes the task, **Then** system marks task as completed and records completion timestamp
> 5. **Given** task is incomplete, **When** approval period approaches expiration, **Then** system maintains task visibility in adjuster's queue
> 6. **Given** task completion fails, **When** system encounters errors, **Then** system prevents task closure and notifies user of incomplete action

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want claim balance change logs to be automatically generated for payment and schedule transactions, so that financial reconciliation and balance tracking are maintained accurately.

- **Action**: automatically generate balance change logs when payment and schedule transactions occur
- **Value**: financial reconciliation and balance tracking integrity are maintained without manual intervention

> I want to **automatically generate balance change logs when payment and schedule transactions occur**,
> So that **financial reconciliation and balance tracking integrity are maintained without manual intervention**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System monitors transactions that trigger balance recalculation and evaluates transaction type against logging criteria
> 2. Upon schedule initialization, system creates log entry capturing transaction type and total balance amount
> 3. When payment-related transactions occur (underpayments, recoveries, waivers), system generates log with payment number, transaction type, and balance impact
>     3.1 Standard payment issuance transactions are excluded as they do not affect total balance
> 4. For non-qualifying transaction types, system bypasses log creation
> 5. System validates data completeness (payee balance, transaction identifiers) before log generation
> 6. Change log records are staged for database persistence with complete audit attributes

> 2. **Given** payment-related transaction (underpayment/recovery/waiver), **When** processing completes, **Then** system generates log including payment number and balance impact
> 3. **Given** standard payment issuance, **When** transaction processes, **Then** system does not create balance change log
> 4. **Given** transaction with incomplete payee balance data, **When** log generation is attempted, **Then** system prevents log creation
> 5. **Given** non-qualifying transaction type, **When** evaluation occurs, **Then** system returns empty log list
> 6. **Given** multiple qualifying transactions, **When** processed sequentially, **Then** each generates distinct log entry with accurate temporal sequence

### Epic: Claim Lifecycle & State Management

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to close a claim by transitioning it to Closed status, so that I can mark the claim as complete and prevent further modifications
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: close a claim by transitioning it to Closed status and completing associated work items
- **Value**: I can finalize the claim lifecycle, prevent unauthorized modifications, and ensure proper case and task completion

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **close a claim by transitioning it to Closed status and completing associated work items**,
> So that **I can finalize the claim lifecycle, prevent unauthorized modifications, and ensure proper case and task completion**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System validates the closure request and verifies performer authorization privileges
> 2. System evaluates whether claim status transition to Closed is permissible per product lifecycle configuration
>     2.1 If transition is invalid, system prevents closure and notifies performer of incompatible status
> 3. System updates claim status to Closed and triggers closure event for downstream processing
> 4. System completes associated case and task records in work management
> 5. System returns finalized claim image reflecting closed state to performer


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a valid claim in eligible status, **When** adjuster initiates closure with proper privileges, **Then** system transitions claim to Closed and completes work items
> 2. **Given** claim in incompatible status, **When** closure is attempted, **Then** system rejects transition and returns status incompatibility notification
> 3. **Given** successful closure, **When** process completes, **Then** system prevents further modifications to closed claim
> 4. **Given** closure completion, **When** finalized, **Then** associated case and tasks reflect completed status
> 5. **Given** closure event triggered, **When** processed, **Then** downstream systems receive closure notification

> 3. **Given** successful claim reopening, **When** status is restored, **Then** business activity monitoring event is triggered and audit trail is updated
> 4. **Given** user lacks required privileges, **When** reopening is attempted, **Then** system denies request without modifying claim state

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to close an Event Case and all associated claims together, so that I can efficiently complete multiple related claims at once
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: close an Event Case and all associated claims together through a unified lifecycle process
- **Value**: I can efficiently complete multiple related claims at once, reducing administrative overhead and ensuring consistent case resolution

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **close an Event Case and all associated claims together through a unified lifecycle process**,
> So that **I can efficiently complete multiple related claims at once, reducing administrative overhead and ensuring consistent case resolution**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System validates request authorization and lifecycle state eligibility before allowing closure initiation
> 2. System verifies mandatory closure information including reason code compliance with business rules
> 3. Upon successful validation, system transitions Event Case status to Closed and triggers loss closure business logic
> 4. System completes associated case and task records through work management integration
> 5. When lifecycle constraints are violated, system prevents closure and returns descriptive error messaging
>     5.1 If status transition is invalid, closure command is rejected
>     5.2 If business rules fail, detailed violation messages are provided

> 3. **Given** incomplete or invalid reason code, **When** closure is submitted, **Then** system returns business rule violation errors
> 4. **Given** successful closure execution, **When** process completes, **Then** system triggers loss closure analytics and returns updated case image
> 5. **Given** insufficient privileges, **When** closure is attempted, **Then** system prevents execution based on authorization validation
> 6. **Given** closure completion, **When** response is returned, **Then** all associated tasks and case records reflect completed status

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want the system to validate that a claim status transition is allowed before executing it, so that I cannot perform invalid state transitions
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: validate and enforce permissible claim status transitions based on product lifecycle configuration
- **Value**: invalid state changes are prevented, ensuring claim integrity and regulatory compliance throughout the claim lifecycle

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **validate and enforce permissible claim status transitions based on product lifecycle configuration**,
> So that **invalid state changes are prevented, ensuring claim integrity and regulatory compliance throughout the claim lifecycle**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System validates performer privilege and claim existence before processing any lifecycle command
> 2. System evaluates requested status transition against product-specific lifecycle configuration rules
> 3. Upon validation success, system executes status update and triggers downstream processes (BAM events, case/task completion)
>     3.1 If transition from current status is prohibited, system blocks execution and returns descriptive error
> 4. System persists updated claim state and returns confirmation with current claim image
> 5. System completes associated case and task records in work management upon successful closure


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim in Open status and lifecycle rules allow OpenClosed transition, **When** adjuster initiates close command with valid privileges, **Then** system updates status to Closed and completes associated tasks
> 2. **Given** lifecycle configuration prohibits transition from current status, **When** adjuster attempts invalid state change, **Then** system rejects request with error message and preserves existing status
> 3. **Given** performer lacks required closure privilege, **When** close command is requested, **Then** system denies operation before validation
> 4. **Given** successful status transition, **When** system processes command, **Then** BAM event triggers and claim image reflects updated state
> 5. **Given** claim does not exist, **When** lifecycle command is initiated, **Then** system returns validation failure without processing

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want the system to automatically close claims and cases when all payments are issued and conditions are met, so that manual closure workload is reduced
- **Role**: Claim Manager
- **Action**: enable the system to automatically evaluate and close eligible claims and event cases upon payment completion
- **Value**: operational efficiency is increased by reducing manual closure workload and ensuring timely case finalization

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Manager**,
> I want to **enable the system to automatically evaluate and close eligible claims and event cases upon payment completion**,
> So that **operational efficiency is increased by reducing manual closure workload and ensuring timely case finalization**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Upon payment schedule completion, system evaluates claims and event cases against auto-close eligibility criteria
> 2. System verifies all prerequisites are satisfied including payment issuance status, payee balance reconciliation, and task completion
> 3. System executes claim closure for all qualifying claims in open state with approved auto-adjudicated settlements
> 4. System assesses whether all claims within an event case are closed to determine case-level closure eligibility
> 5. System finalizes event case closure when all associated claims are successfully closed
>     5.1 If closure prerequisites fail, system generates escalation task for manual review
>     5.2 If eligibility criteria not met, process terminates without closure action


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** payment schedule is completed, **When** all claims meet auto-close eligibility and closure readiness criteria, **Then** system automatically closes claims and event case without manual intervention
> 2. **Given** claim lacks required approved settlements or payments, **When** auto-close process evaluates eligibility, **Then** system bypasses closure and terminates process
> 3. **Given** payee balances show over-payment or under-payment, **When** closure readiness verification occurs, **Then** system generates escalation task and halts closure
> 4. **Given** not all claims within event case are closed, **When** event case closure is evaluated, **Then** system leaves event case open and completes process
> 5. **Given** incomplete automated processes or tasks exist, **When** prerequisites are verified, **Then** system prevents closure and creates manual review task
> 6. **Given** all eligibility and readiness conditions satisfied, **When** closure executes, **Then** claims close before event case closure is attempted


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=657907234"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view and manage open items (unpaid coverages, incomplete payments, unposted payments) before closing a claim, so that I can ensure all outstanding issues are addressed
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: review and resolve outstanding obligations before finalizing claim closure
- **Value**: all financial and administrative requirements are satisfied, preventing premature closure and ensuring compliance

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **review and resolve outstanding obligations before finalizing claim closure**,
> So that **all financial and administrative requirements are satisfied, preventing premature closure and ensuring compliance**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates claim closure and system validates eligibility based on current claim status and user privileges
> 2. System presents consolidated view of outstanding obligations across five categories: active tasks, unpaid coverages, incomplete/unposted payments, unprocessed balances, and premium waiver approval periods
> 3. User evaluates hard-stop items requiring mandatory resolution versus soft-stop items that may be auto-closed
>     3.1 Upon identifying hard-stop items, system prevents closure until resolved
>     3.2 When unpaid obligations exist, system enforces 'Partially Paid' closure reason
> 4. User selects appropriate closure reason and system validates against payment history and outstanding obligations
> 5. System finalizes closure by terminating active workflow processes, updating claim status, and converting all management interfaces to read-only
> 6. Upon successful closure, system restricts all modification actions except reopen and follow-up task creation


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** claim has incomplete payments or unapproved premium waiver periods, **When** user attempts closure, **Then** system blocks submission with hard-stop alert until items resolved
> 2. **Given** unpaid coverages or unposted scheduled payments exist, **When** user selects closure reason other than 'Partially Paid', **Then** system prevents closure with validation error
> 3. **Given** issued payments exist on claim, **When** user selects 'Denied/Withdrawn/Terminated' reason, **Then** system rejects submission as incompatible with payment history
> 4. **Given** all hard-stop items resolved and appropriate reason selected, **When** user saves closure, **Then** system terminates active tasks, updates status to 'Closed', and disables all edit capabilities
> 5. **Given** claim successfully closed, **When** user returns to claim overview, **Then** system displays read-only interface with only 'Reopen Claim' and 'Follow Up Task' actions available
> 6. **Given** claim closed, **When** policy updates occur, **Then** system prevents cascading changes to preserve closed claim data snapshot


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=636890887",
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=536085613",
>   "/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=669747804"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to provide a reason and note when closing a claim, so that there is a documented record of why the claim was closed
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: document closure rationale and supporting notes when finalizing a claim
- **Value**: there is an auditable record justifying the closure decision and preserving institutional knowledge

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **document closure rationale and supporting notes when finalizing a claim**,
> So that **there is an auditable record justifying the closure decision and preserving institutional knowledge**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Adjuster initiates claim closure workflow when resolution criteria are met
> 2. System mandates selection of closure reason code aligned with claim outcome (e.g., Paid, Denied, Partially Paid)
> 3. Adjuster provides optional narrative notes detailing closure context
> 4. Upon validation of financial and operational prerequisites, system transitions claim to closed state
>     4.1 If incompatible reason exists (e.g., Denied with issued payments), system blocks closure
>     4.2 If outstanding payment or approval obligations remain, system enforces corrective action
> 5. System restricts post-closure modifications while preserving audit trail
> 6. Authorized users retain ability to reopen claim with documented justification


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** adjuster closes claim, **When** no closure reason is selected, **Then** system prevents submission until reason is provided
> 2. **Given** closure reason conflicts with financial state (e.g., Denied with payments issued), **When** adjuster attempts save, **Then** system displays validation error blocking closure
> 3. **Given** unposted payments or incomplete approval periods exist, **When** adjuster selects non-Partially Paid reason, **Then** system enforces Partially Paid selection or resolution of obligations
> 4. **Given** valid closure reason and notes submitted, **When** system completes closure, **Then** claim transitions to read-only state with documented reason visible
> 5. **Given** claim is closed, **When** user accesses claim record, **Then** only Reopen and Follow Up actions remain available
> 6. **Given** closure completed, **When** audit review occurs, **Then** closure reason and notes are permanently retrievable


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=536085613"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want the system to prevent editing of a closed claim's data and hide management actions, so that closed claims remain immutable and audit-compliant
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: enforce immutability of closed claims by restricting data modifications and concealing management actions
- **Value**: closed claims remain tamper-proof, ensuring regulatory compliance, data integrity, and reliable audit trails

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **enforce immutability of closed claims by restricting data modifications and concealing management actions**,
> So that **closed claims remain tamper-proof, ensuring regulatory compliance, data integrity, and reliable audit trails**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System transitions claim to 'Closed' status upon authorized closure action, updating all dependent entities (procedures, settlements, tasks)
>     1.1 Upon closure, system denies all procedures, sets settlement to 'Deny', and terminates associated workflows
> 2. System restricts edit privileges for all closed claim data fields, preventing adjuster modifications
> 3. System conceals management action options (e.g., 'Close Claim', 'Reopen') from user interfaces when claim status is 'Closed'
> 4. System generates immutable audit records capturing closure timestamp, reason, and user identity
> 5. System notifies user of successful closure and displays read-only claim overview


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim in 'Closed' status, **When** an adjuster accesses the claim overview, **Then** all data fields are read-only and editing controls are disabled
> 2. **Given** a closed claim, **When** the adjuster views action menus, **Then** management actions (e.g., 'Close Claim', 'Modify') are hidden or inactive
> 3. **Given** an authorized closure request, **When** the system executes closure, **Then** procedures are denied, settlement is set to 'Deny', and tasks are terminated
> 4. **Given** a closure event, **When** the system completes the transaction, **Then** an audit log entry is created with timestamp, reason, and user ID
> 5. **Given** an unauthorized edit attempt on a closed claim, **When** the system detects the request, **Then** the operation is blocked and the user is notified
> 6. **Given** a closed claim, **When** the adjuster refreshes the overview, **Then** claim status displays 'Closed' with the selected reason (e.g., 'Canceled')


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=813007903"
> ]

### Epic: Case & Claim Details Management

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view comprehensive case and claim details on a unified overview page, so that I can quickly assess the status and history of a claim without navigating multiple screens
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: access a unified overview displaying all case and claim information across multiple claim types with key status indicators and navigable references
- **Value**: I can rapidly assess claim status, history, and critical attributes without navigating multiple systems, enabling faster adjudication decisions

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,

> So that **I can rapidly assess claim status, history, and critical attributes without navigating multiple systems, enabling faster adjudication decisions**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User is able to view consolidated claim portfolio for a case, displaying all associated claim types (Critical Illness, Term Life, Hospital Indemnity, Accident, Whole Life, Variable Universal Life)
> 2. System presents color-coded status indicators (Incomplete, Pending, Open, Closed) with current substatus for rapid prioritization
> 3. User is able to access critical temporal and financial markers (diagnosis dates, loss dates, face values) specific to each claim type
> 4. System displays policy associations (master and certificate policies), ERISA designation, and assigned claim manager or queue

**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 2. **Given** claim assignments exist, **When** rendering manager information, **Then** system displays formatted user names or queue names appropriately
> 3. **Given** ERISA-governed policies, **When** displaying claim attributes, **Then** ERISA status appears correctly as Yes/No
> 4. **Given** claims with multiple loss benefits, **When** exceeding display threshold, **Then** system shows benefit summary with expandable tooltip for full details
> 5. **Given** navigable claim or policy references, **When** user selects hyperlink, **Then** system directs to corresponding detailed record
> 6. **Given** incomplete data elements, **When** rendering overview, **Then** system applies fallback logic without display errors

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to track all changes made to a case or claim through a searchable and filterable history log, so that I can audit modifications and understand the evolution of claim decisions
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: access and analyze a comprehensive, searchable change history across all case and claim modifications
- **Value**: I can audit the full lifecycle of decisions, ensure compliance, and understand the evolution of case handling for improved accuracy and accountability

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **access and analyze a comprehensive, searchable change history across all case and claim modifications**,
> So that **I can audit the full lifecycle of decisions, ensure compliance, and understand the evolution of case handling for improved accuracy and accountability**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. System retrieves and presents comprehensive change history for event cases, claims, settlements, payments, recoveries, and relationships in chronological order
> 2. User is able to filter history by component, reference, entity, adjuster, and date range to narrow audit scope
> 3. System displays business-friendly change details including original and new values, modification timestamp, and responsible user
> 4. User is able to sort history records by temporal, organizational, or entity-based criteria to analyze patterns
> 5. Upon case closure, system restricts further history refresh while maintaining complete historical record access
> 6. System excludes system-calculated changes to focus audit on human decision points


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 2. **Given** multiple filter criteria are applied, **When** user views history, **Then** system returns only matching records with active filters visually indicated
> 3. **Given** history contains complex data, **When** user views records, **Then** system presents values in business-friendly format with locale-appropriate date formatting
> 4. **Given** system-calculated changes exist, **When** history is displayed, **Then** system excludes automated calculations showing only manual modifications
> 5. **Given** a claim is closed, **When** user attempts to refresh history, **Then** system prevents refresh while maintaining read access to historical records
> 6. **Given** history data exists across multiple entities, **When** user reviews claim history, **Then** system includes both claim-specific and related case-level changes

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to add and manage related cases to link duplicate or connected claims, so that I can maintain data integrity and ensure comprehensive claim handling
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: establish and maintain relationships between duplicate or connected cases to ensure comprehensive claim tracking and data integrity
- **Value**: all related claim information is linked bidirectionally, preventing duplicate processing and enabling holistic case analysis across connected events

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **establish and maintain relationships between duplicate or connected cases to ensure comprehensive claim tracking and data integrity**,
> So that **all related claim information is linked bidirectionally, preventing duplicate processing and enabling holistic case analysis across connected events**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User is able to search for potentially related cases using advanced criteria including case number, policy details, claimant information, and event characteristics
> 2. User is able to establish typed relationships between cases by selecting relationship classification and providing contextual notes
>     2.1 Upon selecting relationship type as 'Other', system requires explanatory note
>     2.2 System prevents self-linking and duplicate relationship creation
> 3. User is able to view all linked cases with relationship types, event dates, and current status indicators in consolidated table
> 4. User is able to modify relationship classifications or remove incorrect linkages when case analysis reveals errors
> 5. System automatically creates bidirectional relationship records in both linked cases with complete history tracking
> 6. Upon any relationship change, system generates audit trail entries for both cases documenting modification details


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** adjuster searches for related case, **When** multiple matches exist, **Then** system displays top five results with option to view complete list using advanced filters
> 2. **Given** adjuster attempts to link case to itself, **When** save is initiated, **Then** system prevents submission and displays self-linking error
> 3. **Given** adjuster creates new relationship, **When** relationship is saved, **Then** system creates bidirectional records in both cases' relationship tables with identical details
> 4. **Given** relationship type 'Other' is selected, **When** adjuster attempts save without note, **Then** system prevents submission until explanatory note is provided
> 5. **Given** adjuster modifies existing relationship, **When** changes are saved, **Then** system updates both cases and generates history records documenting previous and new values
> 6. **Given** duplicate relationship exists (same cases and type), **When** adjuster attempts creation, **Then** system prevents submission and displays duplication error

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to perform claim lifecycle actions (submit, close, reopen, change substatus, follow-up tasks, policy refresh) from a single action menu, so that I can efficiently manage claim progression without navigating to separate screens
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: manage claim lifecycle progression through centralized workflow actions
- **Value**: I can efficiently transition claims through their lifecycle stages and maintain data synchronization without navigating multiple screens

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **manage claim lifecycle progression through centralized workflow actions**,
> So that **I can efficiently transition claims through their lifecycle stages and maintain data synchronization without navigating multiple screens**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User is able to submit claim for processing when eligibility criteria are met
> 2. User is able to close claim by providing required closure information through system dialog
> 3. User is able to reopen previously closed claim by initiating reopening workflow
> 4. User is able to update claim sub-status classification to reflect current processing stage
> 5. User is able to refresh claim with latest policy version based on Date of Loss, triggering recalculation of payments and balances
>     5.1 When no new policy version exists, system prevents refresh and notifies user
> 6. User is able to create follow-up tasks for closed claims when additional action is required


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** claim meets submission requirements, **When** user initiates submit action, **Then** system processes claim submission workflow
> 2. **Given** claim is in Open status, **When** user initiates close action, **Then** system presents closure workflow and updates status upon completion
> 3. **Given** claim is in Closed status, **When** user initiates reopen action, **Then** system processes reopening workflow and restores Open status
> 4. **Given** user has appropriate privilege, **When** user initiates policy refresh, **Then** system validates policy version availability and recalculates claim financials if newer version exists
> 5. **Given** no policy version update exists, **When** user attempts refresh, **Then** system prevents action and provides notification
> 6. **Given** claim is Closed and user has privilege, **When** user creates follow-up task, **Then** system enables task creation workflow


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=533638678"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view other related claims (Life, CI, HI, Accident) from a case overview in card or loss view format, so that I can understand the full scope of claims for a customer without switching contexts
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: access a consolidated view of all related claims across product lines within a case context
- **Value**: I can assess the complete exposure and interdependencies across Life, Critical Illness, Health Insurance, and Accident claims without navigating away from the case

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **access a consolidated view of all related claims across product lines within a case context**,
> So that **I can assess the complete exposure and interdependencies across Life, Critical Illness, Health Insurance, and Accident claims without navigating away from the case**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates case review and system presents aggregated claim inventory across all product lines (Term Life, Permanent Life, Critical Illness, Health Insurance, Accident)
> 2. System displays each claim as a summary entity with core identifiers and status indicators
> 3. User navigates to specific claim detail for in-depth adjudication when assessment requires granular review
> 4. User switches between claim-centric and loss-centric organizational views to analyze coverage impacts
> 5. System dynamically filters and presents only loss categories containing active data, suppressing empty classifications
> 6. User completes cross-claim analysis and proceeds with adjudication decisions informed by full case context


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a case with multiple active claims, **When** the adjuster accesses the case overview, **Then** the system displays all associated Life, CI, HI, and Accident claims in a unified interface
> 2. **Given** the adjuster reviews claim summaries, **When** a specific claim requires detailed investigation, **Then** the system navigates to that claim's full record without losing case context
> 3. **Given** the adjuster toggles to loss-centric view, **When** the system reorganizes data, **Then** only loss categories with existing coverage items are displayed
> 4. **Given** multiple product types exist, **When** no data is available for a loss category, **Then** the system suppresses that category from the interface
> 5. **Given** the adjuster completes cross-claim review, **When** returning to primary claim, **Then** all reviewed claim states remain accessible for reference


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=508658748"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view and manage third parties associated with a claim (for motor/P&C claims), so that I can track all involved parties and their details throughout the claim lifecycle
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: view and manage third parties associated with a claim throughout its lifecycle
- **Value**: I can maintain accurate records of all involved parties, ensure complete claim documentation, and facilitate comprehensive claim resolution by tracking relationships and interactions with external entities

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **view and manage third parties associated with a claim throughout its lifecycle**,
> So that **I can maintain accurate records of all involved parties, ensure complete claim documentation, and facilitate comprehensive claim resolution by tracking relationships and interactions with external entities**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User accesses existing claim to review associated third parties
> 2. User initiates addition of new third party to claim context
> 3. User provides essential third-party information to establish the party relationship
>     3.1 Upon incomplete information, system prevents submission until requirements are met
> 4. System validates and stores third-party details within claim record
> 5. User is able to view updated third-party roster within claim management interface
> 6. Upon cancellation, system discards pending changes and returns to previous state without persisting data


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim exists, **When** the adjuster accesses claim management, **Then** all associated third parties are displayed with their current details
> 2. **Given** adjuster initiates add party operation, **When** mandatory information is provided, **Then** system successfully persists the new third party and displays confirmation
> 3. **Given** adjuster provides incomplete information, **When** attempting submission, **Then** system prevents submission and indicates required information
> 4. **Given** adjuster cancels during party addition, **When** cancellation is confirmed, **Then** system discards all entered data without persistence
> 5. **Given** third party is successfully added, **When** returning to claim view, **Then** new party appears in the third-party roster
> 6. **Given** multiple third parties exist, **When** viewing claim, **Then** all parties are accessible throughout the claim lifecycle


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=576498427"

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view detailed case information in a read-only drawer when a case is closed, so that I can review case details without risk of accidental modification
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: access comprehensive case information in read-only format when a case reaches closed status
- **Value**: I can review historical case details without risk of accidental modification, ensuring data integrity and audit compliance

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **access comprehensive case information in read-only format when a case reaches closed status**,
> So that **I can review historical case details without risk of accidental modification, ensuring data integrity and audit compliance**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Upon case closure, system restricts modification capabilities and enables read-only access mode
> 2. User is able to retrieve closed case information including work details, employment data, and classification attributes
> 3. When attribute data is unavailable, system displays standardized indicators maintaining information consistency
> 4. User is able to review comprehensive case snapshot reflecting final state at closure
> 5. System returns user to case overview after review completion without data persistence requirements


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a case in closed status, **When** user accesses case details, **Then** system presents information in read-only format preventing all modifications
> 2. **Given** user reviews closed case, **When** data attributes are missing, **Then** system displays standardized unavailable indicators
> 3. **Given** user completes review, **When** exiting detail view, **Then** system returns to overview without data changes
> 4. **Given** case status is not closed, **When** user accesses case details, **Then** system provides editable interface instead
> 5. **Given** closed case accessed, **When** displaying work details, **Then** system presents employment, occupation, and classification information comprehensively

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to access a sidebar with tasks, notes, files, and activity timeline for a claim, so that I can manage all claim-related work items and documentation in one place
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: access a centralized workspace to manage tasks, documentation, notes, and activity history throughout the claim lifecycle
- **Value**: I can efficiently coordinate all claim-related work items and maintain complete visibility of claim progression without navigating multiple systems

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **access a centralized workspace to manage tasks, documentation, notes, and activity history throughout the claim lifecycle**,
> So that **I can efficiently coordinate all claim-related work items and maintain complete visibility of claim progression without navigating multiple systems**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User is able to manage assigned work items including task assignment, completion, creation, updates, and suspension throughout claim processing
> 2. User is able to create, update, and review claim-related notes to document decisions and communications
> 3. User is able to access and organize claim documentation through searchable repository with filtering capabilities
> 4. User is able to review chronological activity timeline showing business actions and claim progression history
> 5. Upon performing claim operations (adjudicate, close, reopen, settle), system updates workspace context to reflect current claim state


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim is open for processing, **When** adjuster accesses the workspace, **Then** system displays current tasks, notes, documents, and activity history relevant to that claim
> 2. **Given** adjuster performs task operations, **When** tasks are assigned, completed, or updated, **Then** system reflects changes in real-time within workspace
> 3. **Given** adjuster adds notes or documents, **When** information is submitted, **Then** system persists data and displays in chronological order
> 4. **Given** claim undergoes status changes, **When** operations like close or reopen occur, **Then** activity timeline captures business actions with timestamps
> 5. **Given** adjuster searches for documents, **When** filters are applied, **Then** system retrieves matching artifacts from repository
> 6. **Given** incomplete or invalid operations, **When** adjuster attempts submission, **Then** system prevents processing and indicates required corrections

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view service history and diagnosis history for pet claims with filtering and manual record management, so that I can track the pet's medical history and services across all claims
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: access, review, filter, and maintain comprehensive service and diagnosis history records for pet claims
- **Value**: I can make informed adjudication decisions based on complete medical history tracking across all claims for a pet

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **access, review, filter, and maintain comprehensive service and diagnosis history records for pet claims**,
> So that **I can make informed adjudication decisions based on complete medical history tracking across all claims for a pet**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User accesses pet claim and navigates to consolidated service and diagnosis history
> 2. User reviews historical medical records with expandable detail views and applies filtering criteria to isolate relevant service patterns
> 3. User supplements system-generated records by adding manual service or diagnosis entries when additional documentation is available
>     3.1 Upon reviewing diagnosis records, user toggles between viewing all entries or earliest diagnosis dates per condition
> 4. User edits or removes manually-added records to correct data entry errors or remove duplicate information
> 5. System persists all changes and refreshes historical views to reflect current medical tracking data
> 6. System restricts modification capabilities to manual records only, preserving system-generated data integrity


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a pet claim is opened, **When** user navigates to service history, **Then** system displays both service and diagnosis history tables with all available records
> 2. **Given** filtering criteria are applied, **When** user initiates search, **Then** system returns only records matching specified attributes
> 3. **Given** user adds manual service or diagnosis record, **When** saved, **Then** system persists record with 'Manual' source designation
> 4. **Given** multiple diagnosis records share identical diagnosis codes, **When** toggle is set to 'Show Earliest Date', **Then** system displays only the earliest dated record per code
> 5. **Given** a system-generated record exists, **When** user attempts modification, **Then** system prevents editing or deletion operations
> 6. **Given** user deletes manual record, **When** confirmed, **Then** system removes record and refreshes display permanently


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=821663942"
> ]

### Epic: Operational Workflow & Task Management

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to assign a case to another user or queue, so that I can distribute workload and ensure proper case management.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: reassign claims to other users or queues to optimize workload distribution and ensure appropriate case handling
- **Value**: workload is balanced across the team, claims are routed to appropriate expertise, and case management efficiency is maintained throughout the claim lifecycle

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **reassign claims to other users or queues to optimize workload distribution and ensure appropriate case handling**,
> So that **workload is balanced across the team, claims are routed to appropriate expertise, and case management efficiency is maintained throughout the claim lifecycle**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates claim reassignment from active claim management interface
> 2. System validates user privileges and claim eligibility for reassignment based on claim status
> 3. User selects assignment destination: specific individual adjuster or organizational queue
>     3.1 When assigning to individual: User searches and selects from eligible assignees
>     3.2 When assigning to queue: User selects from available organizational queues
> 4. User provides optional contextual notes explaining reassignment rationale
> 5. System processes reassignment, updates claim ownership records, and confirms transfer
> 6. Upon completion, system reflects new claim manager assignment across all claim interfaces


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an active claim, **When** the adjuster initiates reassignment, **Then** the system validates privileges and claim status before allowing reassignment
> 2. **Given** valid reassignment request, **When** assigning to individual, **Then** system provides searchable list of eligible assignees
> 3. **Given** valid reassignment request, **When** assigning to queue, **Then** system displays available organizational queues
> 4. **Given** completed assignment selection, **When** user confirms reassignment, **Then** system updates claim ownership and reflects changes immediately
> 5. **Given** closed claim status, **When** user attempts reassignment, **Then** system prevents reassignment unless claim is reopened
> 6. **Given** reassignment in progress, **When** user cancels, **Then** system discards changes and maintains current assignment


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=529957600"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view case manager contact information in a pop-up, so that I can quickly reach out to the assigned case manager.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: access case manager contact information and reassign cases when collaboration or workload distribution is required
- **Value**: I can efficiently coordinate with case managers and maintain optimal case ownership without workflow interruptions

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **access case manager contact information and reassign cases when collaboration or workload distribution is required**,
> So that **I can efficiently coordinate with case managers and maintain optimal case ownership without workflow interruptions**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User accesses assigned case manager identity and contact details within case context
> 2. User initiates case reassignment workflow when ownership transfer is required
> 3. User selects reassignment destination by searching available personnel or queuing systems
>     3.1 When assigning to personnel, user searches organizational directory and reviews contact information
>     3.2 When assigning to queue, user selects from categorized work queues
> 4. User provides assignment justification through contextual notes
> 5. System validates assignment eligibility and completes ownership transfer
> 6. System updates case overview with new assignment details


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** case has assigned manager, **When** user views case details, **Then** system displays manager identity and contact information on demand
> 2. **Given** reassignment is initiated, **When** user searches personnel directory, **Then** system returns eligible assignees with role and contact information after minimum search criteria met
> 3. **Given** user selects queue assignment, **When** viewing available queues, **Then** system displays only claim-relevant queues
> 4. **Given** no assignee selected, **When** user attempts submission, **Then** system prevents reassignment completion
> 5. **Given** valid assignment submitted, **When** system processes request, **Then** case ownership transfers and case overview reflects new assignment
> 6. **Given** user cancels reassignment, **When** unsaved changes exist, **Then** system prompts confirmation before discarding


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=552017996"

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to update case information including reporting method, event date, and work details, so that case records remain accurate and current.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: update case information including reporting details, event data, and work-related information
- **Value**: case records remain accurate, current, and reflect the most recent information for effective claim processing and regulatory compliance

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **update case information including reporting details, event data, and work-related information**,
> So that **case records remain accurate, current, and reflect the most recent information for effective claim processing and regulatory compliance**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User accesses existing case records with pre-populated information for review and modification
> 2. User updates reporting methodology and timeline information to reflect accurate loss notification details
> 3. User modifies event occurrence data and descriptive information based on investigation findings
> 4. User revises employment and occupational details including employer, work location, occupation classification, and hiring date
> 5. User submits consolidated updates for system validation and persistence
> 6. Upon successful submission, system confirms changes and returns user to case overview


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an authorized adjuster with update privileges accesses an open case, **When** modifications are submitted, **Then** system persists all changes and reflects updated information in case records
> 2. **Given** case information is being updated, **When** user attempts to modify a closed case, **Then** system prevents editing and notifies user of case status restriction
> 3. **Given** incomplete or invalid data is provided, **When** user attempts submission, **Then** system prevents persistence until data integrity requirements are satisfied
> 4. **Given** successful case updates, **When** changes are committed, **Then** system maintains audit trail of modifications with timestamp and user identification
> 5. **Given** multiple fields require updates, **When** user submits consolidated changes, **Then** system processes all modifications atomically to maintain data consistency

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=553160885"

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to add or update special handling flags on a claim, so that I can flag cases requiring special attention such as audits, appeals, or complaints.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: designate and update special handling flags on claims requiring exceptional processing attention
- **Value**: cases needing audit review, appeals, or complaint resolution are properly identified, tracked, and routed to specialized queues for appropriate handling

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **designate and update special handling flags on claims requiring exceptional processing attention**,
> So that **cases needing audit review, appeals, or complaint resolution are properly identified, tracked, and routed to specialized queues for appropriate handling**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Adjuster accesses claim overview and initiates special handling configuration
> 2. System presents available handling categories for selection (audit, appeal, complaint)
> 3. Adjuster activates or deactivates handling flags based on claim circumstances
> 4. Upon enabling audit flag, system automatically generates audit task and routes to specialized queue
> 5. System persists flag selections and updates claim status indicators
> 6. Adjuster reviews active handling designations through claim header summary


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** a claim requires audit oversight, **When** adjuster activates the audit flag, **Then** system creates audit task and assigns to audit queue automatically
> 2. **Given** multiple handling flags are selected, **When** changes are saved, **Then** all activated flags appear in claim header summary
> 3. **Given** adjuster modifies flag selections, **When** cancel is selected, **Then** no changes persist and original flags remain active
> 4. **Given** handling flags are active, **When** adjuster views claim header, **Then** current flag status is visible
> 5. **Given** incomplete flag configuration, **When** adjuster attempts to save, **Then** system prevents submission until valid selections are confirmed


**Reference URLs:**

> [
