#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to create a follow-up task with a specific task type and notes, so that I can track pending actions and ensure timely follow-up on claims.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: Create and assign follow-up tasks to track pending actions and ensure timely claim resolution
- **Value**: Critical claim activities are tracked systematically, preventing delays and ensuring compliance with operational timelines

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **create and assign follow-up tasks to track pending actions and ensure timely claim resolution**,
> So that **critical claim activities are tracked systematically, preventing delays and ensuring compliance with operational timelines**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates follow-up task creation within the claim context
> 2. User categorizes the task by business purpose (correspondence, reassessment, payment, appeal)
> 3. User documents the reason and context for the follow-up action
> 4. System validates completeness of task information before acceptance
> 5. System registers the task and associates it with the claim record
> 6. Upon cancellation, system confirms intent to prevent accidental data loss


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 3. **Given** task creation is in progress, **When** user cancels the operation, **Then** system confirms intent before discarding entered information
> 4. **Given** task is successfully created, **When** viewing the claim, **Then** the task appears with associated category and notes
> 5. **Given** task category is selected, **When** task is saved, **Then** category displays in task description for quick identification

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want cases to be automatically assigned to available users based on authority levels and workload, so that new cases are distributed efficiently without manual intervention.
- **Role**: Case Manager
- **Action**: enable automated case assignment to qualified users based on authority levels and active workload distribution
- **Value**: new cases are distributed efficiently without manual intervention, ensuring balanced workloads and appropriate expertise alignment

**Description:**

> As a **Case Manager**,
> I want to **enable automated case assignment to qualified users based on authority levels and active workload distribution**,
> So that **new cases are distributed efficiently without manual intervention, ensuring balanced workloads and appropriate expertise alignment**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Upon intake completion, system retrieves eligible users with required claim authority type and validates authority levels via configured rules
> 2. System filters user pool by excluding inactive users and those within unavailability periods
> 3. System applies load balancing by counting active cases per eligible user and assigns to user with lowest workload
>     3.1 When multiple users have equal workload, system assigns to first user in sequence
>     3.2 When no eligible users exist, system assigns case to designated queue for manual intervention
> 4. System updates case manager assignment, creates task assignment, and maintains queue visibility for oversight


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** intake is completed **When** eligible users exist with proper authority **Then** system assigns case to user with fewest active cases
> 2. **Given** multiple users have equal active case counts **When** load balancing executes **Then** system assigns to first user in filtered list
> 3. **Given** no eligible users meet authority and availability criteria **When** assignment rule executes **Then** system assigns case to claim management queue without user assignment
> 4. **Given** case assignment is complete **When** system updates records **Then** case manager field, task assignment, and queue association are synchronized
> 5. **Given** user is within unavailability period or inactive **When** filtering occurs **Then** system excludes user from assignment pool


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=704868799"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view the case header with key information including case number, status, member details, event date, and case manager, so that I have a consolidated view of the case at a glance.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: access a consolidated case header displaying critical case attributes, member identity, event context, and assigned resources
- **Value**: I can rapidly assess case status, identify stakeholders, and navigate to related functions without searching across multiple screens

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **access a consolidated case header displaying critical case attributes, member identity, event context, and assigned resources**,
> So that **I can rapidly assess case status, identify stakeholders, and navigate to related functions without searching across multiple screens**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User retrieves case by identifier and accesses consolidated overview displaying case attributes, lifecycle status, and event timeline.
> 2. User reviews member and subject identities with navigation to detailed profiles for verification.
> 3. User identifies assigned case manager and accesses reassignment workflow when case is active.
>     3.1 When case status is closed, manager assignment modifications are restricted unless case reopened.
> 4. User selects context-sensitive actions from available operations filtered by current case status.
> 5. User navigates to special handling processes via direct access link.
> 6. User updates operational attributes and system persists changes to case record.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 3. **Given** case status is closed, **When** user attempts manager reassignment, **Then** system prevents modification unless case has been reopened.
> 4. **Given** user selects action menu, **When** dropdown is activated, **Then** system presents only operations permissible for current case lifecycle state.
> 5. **Given** user modifies operational attributes, **When** changes are submitted, **Then** system persists updates and reflects changes across case record.
> 6. **Given** insufficient privileges, **When** user attempts restricted operations, **Then** system prevents unauthorized access to case management functions.

- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: search for and reassign a case to another resource or queue

> So that **the appropriate expertise is applied to the case and workload is optimally distributed**

>     3.1 System filters results by authorized users with relevant access

> 5. User is able to add context notes to document reassignment rationale

> 4. **Given** no assignee or queue is selected, **When** user attempts submission, **Then** system prevents completion until selection is made
> 5. **Given** assignment is completed, **When** submission succeeds, **Then** system updates case header with new assignment

- **Action**: access and manage tasks within the Claim Audit queue based on assigned privileges
- **Value**: I can ensure audit-related work items are properly controlled, assigned, and completed to maintain compliance and operational efficiency

### Epic: Document & Correspondence Management

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manually generate a letter from a predefined template, so that I can create claim-related correspondence on demand.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: manually generate claim-related correspondence from predefined templates on demand
- **Value**: I can create timely, accurate, and compliant communication with relevant parties throughout the claim lifecycle without manual document assembly

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **manually generate claim-related correspondence from predefined templates on demand**,
> So that **I can create timely, accurate, and compliant communication with relevant parties throughout the claim lifecycle without manual document assembly**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates letter creation and selects appropriate template for the business context
> 2. System auto-populates party information and displays template-specific input fields based on selected template requirements
> 3. User associates letter with relevant entities (event case and/or claim) and enriches template with additional context as needed
> 4. User previews generated correspondence with integrated data from claims, events, and customer management systems
> 5. Upon validation and confirmation, system generates document, creates metadata, and stores in predefined eFolder catalog
> 6. Generated letter becomes immediately accessible through eFolder for tracking and audit purposes


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** user has document management privileges, **When** letter generation is initiated, **Then** system presents available templates with auto-defaulted party selection based on business context
> 2. **Given** template is selected, **When** user associates entities and enriches data, **Then** system validates data completeness and integration with claim/event/customer sources
> 3. **Given** letter preview is generated, **When** user submits for generation, **Then** system produces document combining user input with mapped system data
> 4. **Given** validation detects incomplete data, **When** submission occurs, **Then** system prevents generation and prompts correction without data loss
> 5. **Given** user cancels during preview or confirmation, **When** cancellation is confirmed, **Then** system discards draft without creating document record
> 6. **Given** successful generation, **When** document is created, **Then** letter appears in eFolder with proper metadata for retrieval and audit trail

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to cancel letter generation at any point with confirmation, so that I can avoid accidental document creation.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: cancel correspondence generation at any stage with system confirmation to prevent unintended document creation
- **Value**: I maintain control over document workflow, avoid creating erroneous or premature correspondence, and ensure only validated communications are finalized

**Description:**

> I want to **cancel correspondence generation at any stage with system confirmation to prevent unintended document creation**,
> So that **I maintain control over document workflow, avoid creating erroneous or premature correspondence, and ensure only validated communications are finalized**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates correspondence creation workflow by selecting template and entity context
> 2. User populates correspondence details and previews generated content with integrated data
> 3. User triggers cancellation at any workflow stage before final submission
>     3.1 Upon cancellation request, system prompts explicit confirmation
>     3.2 If confirmed, system terminates workflow without generating artifacts
> 4. Upon submission, system requests generation confirmation before finalizing
>     4.1 If declined, system keeps form accessible for further editing
> 5. System validates completeness and correctness prior to document finalization
> 6. Upon successful generation, system archives correspondence in designated repository with metadata


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 3. **Given** user submits correspondence, **When** final confirmation is presented, **Then** system allows decline while preserving draft state
> 4. **Given** user declines final confirmation, **When** returning to form, **Then** all previously entered data remains intact for modification
> 5. **Given** validation errors exist, **When** generation is attempted, **Then** system prevents completion and displays actionable error guidance
> 6. **Given** generation is confirmed and validated, **When** processing completes, **Then** correspondence appears in designated repository

### Epic: Domain-Specific Logic & Frameworks

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to manage event case information including loss and party details, so that I can process claims efficiently from case opening to closure.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: manage event case information including loss events, party details, and lifecycle transitions from case opening through closure
- **Value**: I can process claims efficiently with accurate information cascading across case and claim layers while maintaining complete visibility of related claims and parties

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **manage event case information including loss events, party details, and lifecycle transitions from case opening through closure**,
> So that **I can process claims efficiently with accurate information cascading across case and claim layers while maintaining complete visibility of related claims and parties**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Access event case overview and view consolidated case information including member details, assigned case manager, claim events, related claims, and associated parties
> 2. Update case-level information triggering automatic validation and cascading changes to corresponding claim layers through refresh processes
> 3. Manage loss events by adding loss types, updating loss information forms, managing diagnosis codes, and categorizing injury versus sickness
> 4. Progress case through lifecycle transitions including close case with reason codes, reopen closed cases, or change case substatus based on business rules
> 5. Manage party information by adding or editing individuals or organizations with designated roles and relationships to the case or specific claims
> 6. Reassign case ownership to different handlers or queues with supplemental notes for continuity


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an open event case, **When** the adjuster updates loss information or party details, **Then** the system validates changes and automatically cascades updates to all associated claims and refreshes the case overview
> 2. **Given** case status requirements are met, **When** the adjuster initiates lifecycle transition (close, reopen, substatus change), **Then** the system validates business rules, updates case status, and prevents invalid transitions
> 3. **Given** multiple claims exist under the event case, **When** the adjuster views the case overview, **Then** the system displays all related claims with current statuses and enables navigation to individual claim details
> 4. **Given** the adjuster adds or modifies party information, **When** duplicate validation is triggered, **Then** the system prevents duplicate entries and displays appropriate error guidance
> 5. **Given** case reassignment is initiated, **When** the adjuster selects target person or queue, **Then** the system updates case manager designation and notifies the new handler
> 6. **Given** claim events are edited post-intake, **When** the refresh process executes, **Then** the system synchronizes loss enrichment transformations and updates claim wrappers with retrieved loss data


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=555081643"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to perform case lifecycle actions (create new claim, update information, close case, reopen case, change substatus), so that I can manage the complete claim lifecycle efficiently.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: manage the complete event case lifecycle through creation, updates, status transitions, and closure
- **Value**: I can efficiently process claims from intake through final resolution while maintaining data integrity across all related entities

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **manage the complete event case lifecycle through creation, updates, status transitions, and closure**,
> So that **I can efficiently process claims from intake through final resolution while maintaining data integrity across all related entities**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Access existing event case and review organized information across claim events, parties, and related claims
> 2. Create additional claims within the case by selecting appropriate claim type from available options
> 3. Update case-level information including reporting details, employment data, and coverage classifications with automated validation
> 4. Close active cases by providing closure reason codes and supplemental descriptions
>     4.1 Upon case status equals open, system enables closure workflow
> 5. Reopen closed cases by selecting reopening reason codes with supporting descriptions
>     5.1 Upon case status equals closed, system enables reopening workflow
> 6. Change case substatus for active cases based on status matrix rules and reassign cases to different handlers or queues


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an open event case, **when** the adjuster submits case information updates, **then** the system validates dependencies and cascades changes to related loss and claim entities automatically
> 2. **Given** an open case requiring closure, **when** the adjuster provides closure reason code, **then** the system transitions case status to closed and prevents further substatus changes
> 3. **Given** a closed case requiring additional processing, **when** the adjuster provides reopening reason code, **then** the system transitions case status to open and enables lifecycle actions
> 4. **Given** incomplete or invalid data during updates, **when** the adjuster attempts submission, **then** the system prevents processing and indicates required corrections
> 5. **Given** case reassignment requirements, **when** the adjuster selects target handler or queue, **then** the system transfers case ownership and notifies designated parties
> 6. **Given** multiple claim types within an event case, **when** the adjuster creates new claims, **then** the system maintains associations and applies appropriate loss type enrichment transformations

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view and edit member information including occupation class, preferred payment method, and work days, so that I can maintain accurate member data for claim processing.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: manage event case lifecycle stages and maintain member information to ensure accurate claim processing
- **Value**: I can progress cases through their lifecycle, update critical member data, and ensure all changes cascade appropriately across claims for accurate adjudication

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **manage event case lifecycle stages and maintain member information to ensure accurate claim processing**,
> So that **I can progress cases through their lifecycle, update critical member data, and ensure all changes cascade appropriately across claims for accurate adjudication**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Access event case and review comprehensive case summary including claim events, associated claims, and party information
> 2. Update case information including reporting details, employment dates, occupation, and class that impact policy retrieval and eligibility validation
> 3. Maintain member data via member profile including occupation class, preferred payment method, and work schedules for absence claims
>     3.1 Upon occupation class update, system recalculates plan and coverage eligibility
>     3.2 Upon payment method update, system applies preference to subsequent payment processing
> 4. Modify claim events including loss types, loss details, ICD codes, and injury classification that trigger system refresh to cascade changes across case and claim layers
> 5. Progress case through lifecycle transitions: close open cases with reason codes, reopen closed cases with justification, or change substatus based on status matrix rules
> 6. Manage case assignments by reassigning to individual adjusters or queues with optional notes for workload distribution


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** adjuster accesses event case, **When** updating member occupation class or employment dates, **Then** system recalculates eligibility and coverage across all associated claims
> 2. **Given** adjuster modifies claim event information, **When** changes are saved, **Then** system triggers refresh process cascading updates to loss and claim wrapper layers
> 3. **Given** case status is open, **When** adjuster closes case with valid reason code, **Then** system prevents further processing and records closure justification
> 4. **Given** case status is closed, **When** adjuster reopens with valid reason, **Then** system restores processing capabilities and logs reopening justification
> 5. **Given** member preferred payment method is updated, **When** subsequent payments are processed, **Then** system applies updated payment preference
> 6. **Given** adjuster reassigns case, **When** selecting person or queue, **Then** system designates new handler and prevents submission if assignment target is invalid

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want the system to automatically sync return-to-work data from event cases to newly created claims, so that claim data remains consistent and current.
- **Role**: Claim Manager
- **Action**: automatically synchronize return-to-work milestones from event cases to newly created disability and leave claims
- **Value**: claim data integrity is maintained without manual re-entry, reducing administrative burden and ensuring accurate workforce recovery tracking

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Manager**,
> I want to **automatically synchronize return-to-work milestones from event cases to newly created disability and leave claims**,
> So that **claim data integrity is maintained without manual re-entry, reducing administrative burden and ensuring accurate workforce recovery tracking**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Upon claim creation, system verifies existence of return-to-work data in the parent event case
> 2. When event case contains return-to-work milestones and claim record is empty, system extracts the most recent dates for each milestone type (estimated/actual, part-time/full-time)
> 3. System populates claim return-to-work fields with synchronized values and records synchronization event in claim history
> 4. If claim already contains return-to-work data, system preserves existing claim values and bypasses synchronization
> 5. User is able to view and manually update synchronized return-to-work milestones through claim overview interface
> 6. System applies synchronization logic only to newly created claims post-implementation


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an event case with return-to-work dates exists, **When** a new claim is created from that event, **Then** system populates claim with the latest return-to-work dates from event case
> 2. **Given** a claim already contains return-to-work data, **When** synchronization process executes, **Then** system retains existing claim values without overwriting
> 3. **Given** event case has no return-to-work data, **When** claim is created, **Then** system leaves claim return-to-work fields empty
> 4. **Given** synchronization completes successfully, **When** user accesses claim overview, **Then** return-to-work milestones are visible and editable
> 5. **Given** claim exists prior to feature implementation, **When** event case is updated, **Then** system does not retroactively synchronize data


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=783163247"
> ]

> 5. **Given** a closed case, **When** the closure action is complete, **Then** system cascades status updates to all related claims and sub-entities.
> 6. **Given** a closed case, **When** business requirements change, **Then** authorized users can reopen the case with justification following similar documentation requirements.

> 3. Upon save, system initiates automated Refresh Process cascading updates to dependent entities
>     3.1 Refresh Loss Process locates existing losses by event case and loss type, then applies case-level updates
>     3.2 Refresh ClaimWrapper Process identifies related claim wrappers by event case, claim type, and policy, then synchronizes loss associations and updates
> 4. System propagates critical data impacting downstream processes: Date Last Worked (policy retrieval), Date of Hire (eligibility), Class (plan coverage), Injury vs Sickness (benefit periods)
> 5. System recalculates claim eligibility, benefit periods, and payment schedules when relevant case attributes change
> 6. System maintains audit trail of cascaded updates across case, claim, and loss layers


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** event case loss information is updated, **When** user saves changes, **Then** system locates all related losses by event case and loss type and cascades updates without manual intervention
> 2. **Given** claim events are modified post-intake, **When** refresh process executes, **Then** system identifies existing claim wrappers by event case, claim type, and policy ID and synchronizes all related loss associations
> 3. **Given** Date of Hire or Class is updated, **When** changes are saved, **Then** system re-validates eligibility and recalculates plan coverage, alerting user if impacts require review
> 4. **Given** Injury vs Sickness classification changes for STD/LTD claims, **When** refresh completes, **Then** system recalculates Elimination Periods and Maximum Benefit Periods accordingly
> 5. **Given** multiple claims exist under one event case, **When** case-level data updates, **Then** all associated claim and loss records reflect current information consistently
> 6. **Given** refresh process fails validation, **When** error occurs, **Then** system prevents incomplete updates and alerts user with actionable error context

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=555081643"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to view a comprehensive case summary with organized sub-sections on the Event Case Overview, so that I can quickly understand the case status and details.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: view and manage comprehensive case information through organized sub-sections from intake to closure
- **Value**: I can efficiently understand case status, process updates across all related entities, and progress cases through lifecycle transitions with validated data integrity

**Description:**

> As a Claim Adjuster,
> I want to view and manage comprehensive case information through organized sub-sections from intake to closure,
> So that I can efficiently understand case status, process updates across all related entities, and progress cases through lifecycle transitions with validated data integrity


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User accesses Event Case Overview with pre-populated case summary including member information, case manager assignment, claim events, related claims, and party details
> 2. User modifies case attributes through action menu or component-specific functions
>     2.1 Upon updating member demographics or employment details, system validates eligibility and policy associations
>     2.2 When editing claim event information, system triggers refresh process cascading changes to losses and claim wrappers
> 3. User manages case lifecycle transitions including close, reopen, and substatus changes based on current case state
> 4. User creates new claims for supported products or associates existing claims to current event case
> 5. User assigns or reassigns case to claim handlers or queues with supplemental documentation
> 6. System validates all modifications and reflects updated information across sub-sections maintaining referential integrity


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** case is in open status, **When** adjuster accesses Event Case Overview, **Then** system displays complete case summary with all sub-sections and available lifecycle actions
> 2. **Given** adjuster updates claim event loss information, **When** changes are saved, **Then** system executes refresh process cascading updates to related losses and claim wrappers without data loss
> 3. **Given** case status is open, **When** adjuster selects close case action and provides reason code, **Then** system validates closure conditions and transitions case to closed status
> 4. **Given** case status is closed, **When** adjuster attempts lifecycle actions, **Then** system restricts actions to reopen case only and prevents other modifications
> 5. **Given** adjuster modifies member employment or classification data, **When** system validates changes, **Then** eligibility rules and policy associations are re-evaluated automatically
> 6. **Given** adjuster creates new claim from event case, **When** claim type is selected, **Then** system initiates appropriate claim workflow maintaining event case associations

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to navigate to related records (customer portfolio, claim overview, policy details) from the event case, so that I can access comprehensive member and policy information.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: navigate to related records from the event case to access comprehensive member, policy, and claim information
- **Value**: I can make informed claim decisions based on complete contextual information across customer portfolio, policy details, and claim history

> As a Claim Adjuster,
> I want to navigate to related records from the event case to access comprehensive member, policy, and claim information,
> So that I can make informed claim decisions based on complete contextual information across customer portfolio, policy details, and claim history


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User is able to navigate to Individual Customer Portfolio from event case header by selecting member name hyperlink
>     1.1 Upon selection, system displays member detail view with complete profile information
>     1.2 User is able to view occupation class, payment preferences, and work schedule data
> 2. User is able to navigate to Claim Overview from Other Claims section by selecting claim number hyperlink
> 3. User is able to navigate to policy details (master or certificate) by selecting policy number hyperlink from claim cards
> 4. User is able to view party relationships and contact information associated with case or claim context

> 3. **Given** user views claim card, **When** policy number hyperlink is selected, **Then** system redirects to appropriate policy interface based on policy type
> 4. **Given** user requires party details, **When** Party Information section is accessed, **Then** system displays all associated parties with roles, relationships, and contact information
> 5. **Given** absence claim event exists, **When** user accesses Leaves by Plan section, **Then** system displays integrated disability claim timelines with navigation to related claim overviews
> 6. **Given** user navigates to external record, **When** returning to event case, **Then** system preserves case context and user position

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to add and manage party information (individuals and organizations) with relationship and role details, so that I can maintain accurate stakeholder records.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: add and manage party information (individuals and organizations) with relationship and role designations throughout the claim lifecycle
- **Value**: accurate stakeholder records are maintained to support claim processing, communication, and compliance requirements

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **add and manage party information (individuals and organizations) with relationship and role designations throughout the claim lifecycle**,
> So that **accurate stakeholder records are maintained to support claim processing, communication, and compliance requirements**


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates party addition process by selecting party type (individual or organization) and searching existing party records
>     1.1 If party not found, user creates new party record before association
> 2. User associates selected party to either case level or specific claim level based on stakeholder involvement scope
> 3. User designates party roles from extended lookup values and defines relationship to participant for context clarity
> 4. User provides or updates contact information to enable communication workflows
> 5. User modifies existing party records by updating association scope, roles, relationships, or contact details as claim circumstances evolve
> 6. System persists party information and displays stakeholder data including name, roles, association level, and participant relationship across relevant interfaces


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** user searches for party, **When** party exists in system, **Then** system retrieves party record for association without requiring duplicate creation
> 2. **Given** user associates party, **When** selecting association level, **Then** system enables designation to case level or specific claim level based on stakeholder scope
> 3. **Given** user designates party role, **When** multiple roles applicable, **Then** system allows assignment of multiple roles from extended party lookup values
> 4. **Given** user defines relationship, **When** party associated to participant, **Then** system captures and displays relationship context for stakeholder identification
> 5. **Given** user updates party information, **When** changes saved, **Then** system reflects modifications across all interfaces displaying party data
> 6. **Given** party record incomplete, **When** user attempts save, **Then** system prevents submission until required party identification and association data provided

#### Feature: As a Claims Operations Manager, I want the system to validate absence period overlaps and prevent duplicate events, so that data integrity is maintained.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: manage expected absence periods with automated validation to prevent overlapping records and ensure temporal data integrity
- **Value**: absence tracking accuracy is maintained, duplicate events are prevented, and claim decisions are based on verified absence data

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **manage expected absence periods with automated validation to prevent overlapping records and ensure temporal data integrity**,
> So that **absence tracking accuracy is maintained, duplicate events are prevented, and claim decisions are based on verified absence data**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. User initiates absence period definition by selecting absence classification (continuous, intermittent, or reduced schedule)
> 2. System adapts data capture requirements based on absence type: continuous requires date range only; intermittent and reduced schedule require occurrence patterns
>     2.1 For general date patterns, user specifies occurrence frequency, timeframe, and duration per occurrence
>     2.2 For specific dates, user selects individual absence dates and partial-day durations
> 3. System validates temporal integrity by preventing overlapping expected absence periods before submission
> 4. User modifies or removes specific absence dates through inline editing with transaction-level controls
> 5. System commits validated absence data and refreshes tracking records upon successful submission


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** user defines continuous absence, **when** only start and end dates are provided, **then** system accepts submission without occurrence details
> 2. **Given** user selects intermittent or reduced schedule absence, **when** occurrence type is not specified, **then** system prevents submission until required parameters are complete
> 3. **Given** an expected absence period overlaps with existing expected periods, **when** user attempts to save, **then** system rejects submission and displays overlap conflict message
> 4. **Given** user specifies particular absence dates, **when** hours exceed 24 or minutes exceed 59, **then** system prevents invalid time entry
> 5. **Given** user modifies specific absence date entry, **when** inline edit is active, **then** system disables all other row actions and form controls until edit is committed or cancelled
> 6. **Given** user cancels form with unsaved changes, **when** confirmation is required, **then** system prompts for confirmation before discarding data


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=556513163"
> ]

#### Feature: As a Claims Adjuster, I want to configure absence periods with specific dates or general occurrence patterns (per week/month), so that I can accurately represent different absence schedules.
- **Role**: Claim Adjuster
- **Action**: configure and manage absence periods with flexible scheduling patterns
- **Value**: accurately track and document claimant availability across various absence scenarios, supporting informed claim decisions and compliance requirements

**Description:**

> As a **Claim Adjuster**,
> I want to **configure and manage absence periods with flexible scheduling patterns**,
> So that **I can accurately track and document claimant availability across various absence scenarios, supporting informed claim decisions and compliance requirements**.


**Key Capabilities:**

> 1. Adjuster initiates absence period creation or modification from the case overview, selecting absence category (continuous, intermittent, or reduced schedule).
> 2. System validates and captures the temporal boundaries for the absence period, preventing conflicting expected absence entries.
> 3. When applicable, adjuster defines occurrence patterns using either:
>     3.1 General recurrence rules (frequency per timeframe with optional duration)
>     3.2 Specific date selections with customizable time increments
> 4. For date-specific patterns, adjuster specifies partial or full-day absences with time precision.
> 5. System confirms data integrity before persisting the absence configuration and refreshing the case record.
> 6. Adjuster may revoke or abandon changes through explicit cancellation workflow.


**Acceptance Criteria:**

> 1. **Given** an adjuster initiates absence configuration, **When** temporal boundaries are defined, **Then** system prevents overlapping expected absence periods and enforces chronological validity.
> 2. **Given** intermittent or reduced schedule is selected, **When** occurrence pattern is specified, **Then** system captures either recurrence rules or specific dates based on adjuster selection.
> 3. **Given** specific dates are chosen, **When** time details are provided, **Then** system interprets blank time as full-day absence and validates time format constraints.
> 4. **Given** configuration is incomplete or invalid, **When** submission is attempted, **Then** system prevents persistence and provides actionable guidance.
> 5. **Given** configuration is valid, **When** adjuster submits, **Then** system persists the absence record and reflects updates in the case overview.
> 6. **Given** adjuster cancels during entry, **When** confirmation is provided, **Then** system discards unsaved changes without affecting existing records.


**Reference URLs:**

> [
>   "https://wiki.eisgroup.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=556513163"
> ]
